data.title: 1 Tyrwhitt Bistro Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Garden Vegetable Soup, Caprese Salad, Crispy Mild Wings, Meat Lovers Pizza, Black Truffle Egg Pizza, Black Pepper Ribeye Steak, Carbonara Bacon, Panna Cotta
data.ABOUT: With an industrial chic vibe, black and white decor, and clean lines greeting diners, 1 Tyrwhitt Bistro & Bar is savoury Italian dining done right. Don’t expect all the gimmicky frills other Italian restaurants bring because this place is about two things: the food and the drinks. So what you can expect, and should totally look forward to, is delicious hand-tossed, thin crust pizzas crisped to perfection (the Black Truffle Egg Pizza is a must-try), authentic, home-made pastas, and a wine list that’ll beckon you for days! (Aug 2015)

data.title: 1-Altitude
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Creamy Fish Laksa Pasta, Bak Kwa Carbonara Pasta, Satay Platter, Truffle Mushroom Pizza
data.ABOUT:
1-Altitude offers a dazzling view of the city’s skyline. With a wide menu of food and drinks, 1-Altitude provides diners with a mesmerising wine and dine experience right in the heart of Singapore.

The best place to be during sundown, visit 1-Altitude for post-work shenanigans. Kickstart your meal with a delicious plate of Creamy Fish Laksa Pasta. Rich and tasty, the pasta combines the well-loved classic carbonara sauce with the local spicy broth, packing a punch of flavour in every mouthful. Another interesting rendition of sweet and savoury flavours is the Bak Kwa Carbonara Pasta.

Sharing options at 1-Altitude are also aplenty with their array of food platters. The Satay Platter is a hot favourite, with marinated beef, pork and chicken skewers served with warm rice cakes.

As the night progresses, expect rounds of great classic cocktails and alcoholic spirits as well as delectable bar bites while the live band serenades you. (Jul 2020)

data.title: 1-V:U – Restaurant and Day Club
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jospered Octopus, Glazed oyster blade steak, Red snapper fillet
data.ABOUT:
The Restaurant
Located on Sentosa island, 1-V:U promises a dining experience like no other. A four-minute walk from the Wings of Time show and accessible via Imbiah station along the Sentosa Monorail, 1-V:U is the crown jewel of The Outpost Hotel. Open for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner, the 60-seater luxe-casual dining room offers front-row access to the live culinary theatrics through an open kitchen by the team of chefs, led by Ace Tan.
The Communal Menu is interestingly themed “Terra” (land), and “Aqua” (sea), to put the spotlight on their meats and seafood dishes respectively.

Standouts include the refreshing Grilled Tiger Prawns, served in a chilled lemongrass galangal prawn broth, along with avocado and glass noodles. If you prefer red meat, be sure to try the Beef Tartare with Confit Yolk, drizzled with smoked sesame dressing, and served with scallions and nashi pear. (Feb 2020)
The Day Club
1-V:U is an exquisite oasis for sun-seekers seeking an escape from the city bustle. With daily DJ sessions on deck bringing Deep House and Soulful beats all the way from day to night, 1-V:U is where it’s at for the endless summer vibes. Cool off with our signature cocktails in hand, dig into our dayclub bites and groove to poolside beats as you take in the unparalleled panorama of the island. (Feb 2020)

data.title: 10 SCOTTS
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 10 Scotts RoadLobby LevelGrand Hyatt SingaporeSingapore (228211)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gourmet Tartines, Crab Cakes, Cuban Breeze, Lady Marmalade, Homemade Ice Cream & Sorbets
data.ABOUT:
Located at the lobby level of Grand Hyatt Singapore, 10 SCOTTS is the ideal venue for an afternoon high tea or a leisurely evening cocktail with your closest confidantes. Embraced by a breathtaking view of beautiful cascading waterfalls, you'll feel at ease as you enjoy a feast of delectable fare.
The high tea spread includes a selection of fine teas, a plethora of coffee concoctions, decadent evening cocktails, an endless array of sensational savouries, and a stunning medley of toothsome desserts. Trust us. The dining experience at 10 SCOTTS is truly one for the books. (May 2015)

data.title: 13% Wine Bistro @ Telok Ayer
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Angus Burger, Coca Tomato, Baked Camembert, Gougères, Selection of Cheese and Cold Cuts
data.ABOUT:
13% Wine Bistro was founded on a shared love of fine wine, great food, and the unpretentious atmosphere of vineyards across Europe.

Snugly nestled on the second floor, simple furniture and walls loaded with frames fade into the background as the enormous chalkboard panel listing specials and recommendations draws your attention. Warm bulbs and aqua lights tracking along the 8-metre mosaic bar set a cosy scene whilst diners peruse the special Iberico and cheese counter, or take their seats and eagerly await the delicious parade of contemporary European cuisine and international wines to come.

Whether you're an expert or just starting out, 13% Gastro Wine’s drink list will take you on a pleasant wine-tasting journey as you dig into delicacies like Tatins, grilled Black Iberico "la Pluma" marinated with cured Iberico ham, or the Coca Iberico (featuring Coca bread topped with Comté cheese, Iberico Ham, Portobello, roasted tomato & garlic sauce and fresh herbs). Sharing boards are also available to stave off hunger pangs between tipples - an absolute necessity! It's all the pleasures of vineyard wine tasting without the high prices and stuffy snootiness. (Apr 2018)

data.title: 15 Stamford by Alvin Leung (The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 15 Stamford RoadThe Capitol Kempinski HotelSingapore (178906)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Whole Boston Lobster in Thai Dressing, Singapore Laksa, Hamachi with Calamansi Ponzu, ‘Bak Kut Teh’ Pork Chop, Beef Short Ribs Rendang
data.ABOUT: Chef Alvin Leung might have earned himself international fame with his famous ‘Sex on the Beach’ dish, but you don’t have to worry about konjac-based ‘condoms’ filled with ham jus on the menu here. Instead, Leung takes things down a notch and puts his focus on turning out charcoal-grilled items and interesting sauces. You’ll want to order the Singapore-style Laksa, Leung’s tribute to our little red dot. The slippery noodles are dipped in a rich gravy made from a generous amount of prawn shells and coconut milk, with tea-smoked quail eggs and tempura tiger prawns that elevate this humble dish. The Whole Boston Lobster in Thai Dressing is another dish that shows off a creative sauce — this time, made from fish sauce, lime and chilli, and diced mangosteens and tomatoes. For lighter, more refreshing fare, try the Sashimi of Hamachi. The fleshy slices are plumped up with a zesty calamansi gel, ponzu sauce, and a smattering of slightly bitter and crunchy garlic chips. Come for the creative cooking without gimmicks. (Jan 2019)

data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Crostini, Kurobuta Pork Yakitori, Scallop Brochette
data.ABOUT:
History breathes beneath the floorboards and inside the walls of this beautiful bar at the Sofitel smack in the middle of the Central Business District. As a nod to the rich maritime history of the area around the hotel, this luxe bar was named 1864 after the year the historic Tanjong Pagar Dock Company was founded, and it evokes equal parts modern luxury and old-world glamour.
In the day, it is a breakfast and tea lounge, serving up eggs, Viennoiseries, coffee, and high-tea platters. At lunchtime, treat yourself to tapas with a French-Asian profile, think spicy Scallop Brochette, ikura-studded Salmon Crostini, and smoky Kurobuta Pork Yakitori served up with cold soba noodles. By the night-time, all the good vibes come together to turn the space into a sexy wine and cocktail bar, serving hotel guests alongside the city’s swanky barflies, turning out barrel-aged cocktails and premium wines faster than you can say “martini”. The signatures here include a regal Cognac Old Fashioned, the Martinez, a forgotten classic made with gin and cherry liqueur, and a cheeky Coconut Negroni that puts a Singapore spin on the international favourite. Luxury, elegance, and a quiet spot to while away the day: they don’t often make hotels like this anymore, steeped in old-world charm and flawless hospitality. (Nov 2017)

data.Good For: City Views, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Barcelona Bikini, Beef Sliders, Iberico Ham, Confit Eggplant
data.ABOUT: 1927 Rooftop Pool & Bar is a luxe hotspot, delighting guests with fashionable and entertaining social experiences including their renowned monthly pool parties. There are summertime vibes all year round with an infinity-edged rooftop pool, sun lounges and DJ decks. The poolside playground's award-winning mixologists are elevating Singapore’s nightlife with their seductive signature cocktails paired with chef's selection of small and large bites. Nibble on summertime classics such as the SO Hot Chix Wings and Crispy Shoestring Parmesan Truffle Fries, or satisfy your cravings with the SO Tower, a stacked Wagyu Beef Burger topped with SO Sauce. (Mar 2020)

data.title: 21 on Rajah
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Halal Certified
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Singapore Laksa, Roasted U.S. Angus Beef Prime Rib-Eye, Nonya Kuehs, Sago Melaka, Durian Mousse
data.ABOUT:
Explore the different combination of flavours with 21 on Rajah unique spread of Mediterr-Asian Buffet. Indulge in familiar street delicacies while exploring Mediterranean’s exotic flavours.
Think a rijsttafel (rice table)-inspired sumptuous buffet spread filled with Mediterranean favourites such as Traditional Greek Salad with Marinated Feta Cheese and Black Olives, Grilled Lamb Chop with Garlic-Mint Sauce and Eggplant, Okra and Tomato Tagine. In additional to the ice crustacean bar and the carving station serving the restaurant's signatures NZ Prime Beef Rib-Eye with 21 On Rajah Signature Homemade Sauces and Slow-Cooked Salted Salmon in Tamarind Sauce, there is a new station featuring items such as Seafood and Chicken Paella, Tortilla de Patatas Espanola (Spanish Omelette with Potatoes) and assorted pizzas.
Weekend dinner brings along an up the notch delights of Arabic Mezza and Antipasti Station and an addition of Snow Crab in the Ice Crustacean bar. Not forgetting Chef’s recommended favourites such as Slipper Lobsters in Chili Crab sauce, Ikan Panggang, Braised Crabmeat Ee-fu Noodles and 21 on Rajah special Basmati Rice.  End your night with a sweet treat at the churros station and chocolate fondue where you may also find a selection of French and local pastries and 21 On Rajah's beverage highlights.
As one of the premier Halal-certified buffets in the city, its east meets west food and vibe makes it a truly unique concept. (Aug 2018)

data.title: 2D1N Soju Bang
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ginseng Chicken Soup, Beef Galbi Soup, Korean Steamed Spicy Chicken, Kimchi Pancake, Korean Ramen with Kimchi Soup
data.ABOUT:
2D1N Soju Bang is the sister restaurant to the popular Korean BBQ joint Ssikkek, located just upstairs. 

At 2D1N, the focus is on authentic, homely Korean cuisine. The Ginseng Chicken Soup, for instance, is a comforting dish featuring a plump, tender chicken simmered in a nourishing broth infused with slices of spiced ginger and spring onions. 

Meat lovers will also love the Korean steamed spicy chicken. A healthier alternative to the deep-fried version, the meat here is tossed with the same sweet spicy sauce, and steamed until tender. Potatoes, carrots, and onions are accompaniments that turn this dish into a hearty stew. 

Of course, the Kimchi Pancake is another not-to-be-missed classic. The crisp edges of the fried pancakes are perfect to nibble on, while the tangy slivers of kimchi nestled in the fluffy pancake help to cut through the richness of the dish. Wash it all down with a glass or two of sweet Makgeolli. (Oct 2019)

data.title: 49 Seats
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Seafood Pasta, Fish & Chips with Tom Yum Salted Egg Sauce, Creamy Smoked Duck Pasta, Cheese Fries
data.ABOUT:
A savoury twist to Singapore's food scene focused on affordable but quality experience, 49 Seats has been in the F&B industry since 2012 and has established a strong local presence. It is recognised for its fusion style meals with a slight twist of local flavour. 

49 Seats, the pioneer of Tom Yum Pasta as well as Fish and Chips with Tom Yum Sauce in Singapore, is our go-to for foods full of spicy and savoury flavours. Apart from their groundbreaking tom yum dish, 49 Seats is also famous for their Creamy Smoked Duck Pasta, which is one of the most popular smoked duck dishes on the market. 

Founded on the belief of creating a fun and friendly environment, 49 Seats offers a casual dining experience that continues to serve quality food to the guest's heart. With a price that is comfortably affordable to all, customers get to enjoy their fusion food at any time of the day. (Feb 2019)

data.title: 5 Senses Bistro (Funan Mall)
data.Cuisine: Modern European, French, Fusion, Seafood, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Seared Pink Norwegian Salmon, Australian Rib-Eye Steak, Carbonara, Baked Camembert, Octopus Salad
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Indulge your senses in the simple joys of comfort food prepared with passion and specially curated ingredients. At 5 Senses Bistro (Funan Mall), we fuse Asian and European flavours based on simplicity and freshness.

Every meal is a refreshing culinary adventure that will delight and leaves an impression on all your senses, bring your friends and family along! If there's one thing that's even better than a good meal, it's enjoying it with better company. (Jul 2019)

data.title: 5 Senses Bistro (The Star Vista)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 1 Vista Exchange Green#02-21The Star VistaSingapore (138617)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Carbonara, Semi-House Smoked Chicken Breast Linguine, 150 Days Grain-Fed Angus Braised Beef Cheek, Apple Crumble, Chocolate Lava Cake
data.ABOUT: Following the philosophy that good food can also be affordably priced, 5 Senses Bistro serves up comfort dishes, reminiscent of mama’s cooking. The kitchen team takes pride in the food they cook, as seen from the attention to detail — Carbonara, for instance, is a favourite pasta dish with slivers of juicy bacon and a precise 62°C Poached Egg. The restaurant’s signature dish, a Semi-House Smoked Chicken Breast Linguine, is also a delight to tuck into. The slippery, al dente pasta is made fresh daily, as is the tangy tomato sauce enveloping this dish. The chicken is lightly-smoked, juicy, and flavourful. For a heartier main course, try the 150 Days Grain-Fed Angus Braised Beef Cheek. The beef is cooked sous vide for hours, so that the meat is meltingly soft and fork-tender, suffused with a rich, heady flavour from the gravy. Be sure to save some space for dessert. Classics like the Apple Crumble and a delicious, warm Chocolate Lava Cake are sweet comforts to indulge in at the end of the meal. (Apr 2019)

data.title: 51 Soho
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Maple Chilli Mayo Chicken Sandwich, Alexander, Soju Sangria, Squid Sumiyaki
data.ABOUT:
From the folks behind the eclectic Birds of a Feather and trendy Halcyon & Crane comes this venture, a bistro-bar in Telok Ayer serving up one-of-a-kind cocktails and delightful dishes. The cool tones of the exterior contrasts with the warm lighting of the interior for a sleek, modern look that is hard to miss. Like the decor, the menu is contemporary and features a range of breakfast and dinner plates for hungry diners. Try the Maple Chilli Mayo Chicken Sandwich - a delicious combination of flavours that will leave you wanting more. There are also a range of charcoal skewers with lamb, potato, chicken, and various other items flavoured with house marinade. 

The cocktail menu is sure to delight barflies looking for a tipple. With unique drinks such as the Alexander - a dessert drink made with Remy Martin, black chocolate liqueur, and cream. The sweetness of the liqueur and the dense cream give this drink a richness that is best enjoyed as a post-dinner treat. Soju lovers will love the refreshing Soju Sangria. Made with lightly sweet grape soju, fresh fruits, and lemonade, this drink is a invigorating pick-me-up for hot days or just for when you need a tropical twist. (March 2019)

data.title: 566 Seafood & Beer Garden At Mandai Hill
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab, Curry Fish Head, Hakka Rice Wine Claypot Chicken, Pan-fried “Kurobuta” Pork Chop with Honey Sauce, Braised Homemade Beancurd with Bamboo Charcoal and Mushroom
data.ABOUT:
Rebranded itself to emphasise its focus on fresh seafood and good service, Cafe 56 is now known as 566 Seafood.

Come here for their impressive variety, with fish, prawns, lobsters, scallops and more cooked in almost every style you can dream of. You'll have a hard time deciding whether your live-caught Garoupa should be steamed in soy sauce or coated in sweet and sour sauce. The poultry and beancurd dishes are equally strong contenders, with firm favourites being the Pan-Fried Kurobuta Pork Chop with Honey Sauce and Braised Homemade Beancurd. Even humble dishes like porridge are jazzed up with the addition of a succulent lobster.

Another reason that makes this place a gem is its ambience. Tucked away in Mandai estate, its offbeat location and pared back interiors bring back memories of the good ol' kampong days. Patrons can choose among three themes to dine in — jungle, kampong and Chinese banquet — adding a quirky touch to an already amazing dining experience. (Nov 2019)

data.title: 665°F
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.PRESS RELEASE: Sitting at the top of Andaz Singapore at Level 38, 665°F is the hotel’s premium steakhouse, where you can take in the rich interior inspired by classic Savile-Row tailor shops and stunning views of the Singapore skyline. Named after the temperature of the Pira oven and grill in which sits in the heart of a show kitchen, 665°F is a cosy dining experience specialising in gourmet prime cuts and sustainable seafood. (Aug 2019)

data.title: 6ix 6ix 六六
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala Grilled Fish, Pork in Fragrant Chilli Oil, Kung Pao Chicken, Mala Noodle Soup
data.ABOUT:
Located along Singapore’s bustling nightlife lane along Cuppage Road, 6ix 6ix serves up delectable Chinese cuisine along with a host of alcoholic beverages. 

The ideal place for a quick get together among family and friends, 6ix 6ix’s wide variety of skewers are always great for chilling over beers or as a starter to a sumptuous feast. Well-known for the Mala Grilled Fish, the restaurant has an array of other fiery and tongue-numbing dishes that will have you going back for seconds. A milder version, the Chilli Oil Grilled Fish, is best suited for sharing among friends who have different spice tolerance levels. Drenched in spicy sauce, the fish is juicy and extremely flavourful. Order a couple of Sichuan delights such as the Pork in Fragrant Chilli Oil, Kung Pao Chicken, Mapo Tofu, and more to complete the fiery Sichuan experience. 

For those looking for tasty one dish meals that afford you more bang for your buck, the Mala Noodle Soup and Egg Fried Rice are classic favourites that are filling and satisfying. (Dec 2020)

data.title: 7 Wonders Seafood @ Jalan Besar
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, Fusion, Seafood, Local, Southeast Asian, Zi Char, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab, Double Cooked Pork, Buttermilk Crab, Mala Xiang Guo
data.ABOUT:
7 Wonders Seafood newly opened 2,800 square foot Chinese seafood restaurant features two floors of seating for 60 guests on the upper floor and 30 guests on the ground floor. Guests can choose to casually dine at the ground floor, enjoying delicious fresh seafood or, cozy up on the second floor for an intimate dining experience.

Focusing on seven signature dishes with their own unique stories, the restaurant serves up tasty zi char meals alongside Mala Xiang Guo options guaranteed to satisfy all your cravings. Sure to please, the restaurant also whips up iconic local delights such as Signature Chilli Crab, savoury Red Wine Pork Ribs, Curry & Assam Fish Head, and many more.

Drenched in a mouthwatering coat of thick, creamy sauce, the Chilli Crabs are fresh and meaty. Served alongside six crispy mantous, seafood lovers should not miss out on ordering this classic delight. Pair this dish with a simple yet well-executed side of Homemade Tofu will surely satisfy your food cravings. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, this dish makes for a good accompaniment with a bowl of warm, fluffy rice. (Jan 2021)

data.title: 7th Heaven KTV & Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lychee Smoked Duck Pizza, Mac & Cheese, Signature Truffle Fries, Honey Paprika Wings
data.ABOUT:
Forget your usual seedy KTV lounge, this spot is the new place to be. Serving a selection of delicious international bites alongside KTV entertainment, this spot is sure to give other lounges in Singapore a run for their money. With sharing plates and individual portions on offer, diners can sing late into the night without fearing that they will go hungry.

There is a snack menu with nibbles such as the Signature Truffle Fries, which are deep fried till golden brown and crisp, then drizzled with truffle oil and topped with parmesan cheese for an extra touch of richness. For something a little heartier, opt for the Spam Fries - deep fried luncheon meat topped with parmesan cheese and garlic mayo dip.

The Lychee Smoked Duck Pizza is another must-try. This unique dish incorporates the fruity sweetness of lychee into a meaty pizza dish. The combination may look odd on paper, but the sweet and smoky flavours combine to make a delicious dish. Not as adventurous? The Mac & Cheese is another option. Made with soft elbow pasta topped with bacon and baked with cheese, this dish is rich and sure to fuel you through a marathon singing session. (Dec 2018)

data.title: 8 Korean BBQ (Shaw Centre)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Kimchi Stew, Toriyama Wagyu, 8 Colours Set, Flower Pork Set
data.ABOUT:
Korean BBQ is all about the meat, but at some barbecue joints, you end up scarfing down generic slabs of meat with little to no character or flavour. Not at Eight Korean BBQ, a sleek, industrial-chic barbecue joint at swanky Shaw Centre that prides itself on its meat know-how. Here, the focus is on exquisite cuts from premium varieties of beef and pork. They’ve sourced super-rare Mangalitza pork that has a rich meatiness and beautiful, flavourful fat, as well as Toriyama Wagyu beef, the “rolls royce” of high-end Japanese beef known for its buttery texture and flavour.
In true Korean style, you can have your meats seared unadorned, coated in a punchy marinade, or served up in a nourishing stew. The restaurant’s name is drawn from its signature dish, the Eight Colours Set, which brings eight portions of pork belly, each a different colour, from pink and unseasoned to a spicy, fiery red that signals its heavy gochujang flavour. Premium choices abound, a kind of choose-your-own-adventure Korean BBQ experience. Stop by for funky Korean BBQ and experience some of the best meat the world has to offer! (Aug 2018)

data.title: 8 Korean BBQ (The Central)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 6 Eu Tong Sen Street#02-79/90The CentralSingapore (059817)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 8 Colours Set, Beef  Kimchi Stew, Seafood Bean Paste Stew, Army Stew
data.ABOUT:
My oh my do we love some Korean grilled meats. Our latest craze? None other than E!GHT Korean BBQ, located at The Central at Clarke Quay. The exclamation mark in lieu for the letter ‘i’ is warranted at E!GHT Korean BBQ, as any food lover would get understandably hyped up over its tantalising array of impeccable BBQ meats. 

Pork features front and centre here, and we encourage guests to go whole hog. Grab a few friends and partake in the signature 8 Colours Set, where thick strips of pork belly are marinated eight different ways, with wine, ginseng, garlic, miso, and red pepper paste. If you were wondering why the pork here is so rich and tender, it’s because the establishment only uses the famous Mangalitsa pork from Hungary, better known as the ‘Kobe beef of pork’. Searching for something comforting? Then why not order up one of E!GHT’s many stews? Top picks include Beef Kimchi Stew, Seafood Bean Paste Stew, and the Army Stew. Finally, complete your meal with some grog, whether it be Korean Hite Beer or Korean Raspberry Wine. 

Prepare to feast like kings in this industrial chic Korean grill, where you won’t even have to lift a finger as the attentive service staff do all the cooking right in front of your eyes. (Jun 2017)

data.title: 9th ave.
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
For appetisers, Vegan Croquette and Coconut Thai Seafood Broth

For mains, Deconstructed Beef Wellington, Chicken Burger, and the Spicy Seafood Sacchettini

For desserts, the Twin Peaks and Mangomitsu
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located onsite in SIT@Republic Polytechnic, this restaurant got its name from the school's address, Woodlands Avenue 9.

The mezzanine level restaurant boasts a 305-square feet of cosy dining space. Albeit serving as a training kitchen for students from the School of Hospitality, guests can expect quality food and service.

With dishes curated just for you and made from the freshest seasonal produce, you will get your money's worth dining here.

For breakfast, fill yourself with the 9th avenue morning classic, the Eggs Benedict.

With two slices of toasted walnut bread topped with portobello mushrooms, two poached eggs and a generous dose of our house-made hollandaise. Together with our signature smoothie, this hearty meal would definitely kickstart your day on the right track!

For lunch, make sure to recharge yourself with our mains, inspired by various cuisines with our own twists ranging from the famous Singaporean dish, “Chicken” rice to deconstructed beef wellington seared to perfection.

Feeling peckish during Tea-time?

Energize yourself with some freshly made desserts such as Mangomitsu and Mi-Cuit au Chocolate. You wouldn’t want to miss out on our specially brewed Boba tea series too! (Nov 2020)

data.title: ADDA
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pani Puri, Adda Nachos, Prata Quesadillas, Charred Laksa Salmon
data.ABOUT:
Get ready to embark on a sensational culinary experience at ADDA as the best dishes from India take on a fun, contemporary twist. Relax and soak up the ambience in the restaurant’s comprehensive concept of a restaurant, bar and lounge, all rolled into one. 

A fun take on the popular Indian street food, the Pani Puri is a plateful of sweet and savoury fried puff pastry balls filled with spiced mashed potato. Made for the discerning palate, this dish is a must try here at ADDA. Topped with caramelised cottage cheese and spiced salsa queso, the Adda Nachos features crunchy and thick homemade gram flour nachos loved by all. Served with a side of avocado salsa, the Prata Quesadillas comes stuffed with peppers and cheese for the vegetarians. A non-vegetarian option is also available on the menu. 

Pair your meal with a heady cocktail mix artfully crafted by the restaurant’s master mixologist, or opt for The Spice Adda experience with a melange of signature ADDA cocktails and a carefully curated wine list of over 50 options. (Feb 2021)

data.title: ANJU
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Bean Mascarpone, Domi Carpaccio, Hogam Jeon, Galbi Jjim, Legendary Beauty
data.ABOUT:
Experience authentic Korean cuisine with exquisite drinks when you drop by ANJU at Tras Street. Bringing you the finest liquor straight from Korea, dive into a unique dining experience with the restaurant's specially curated list of fine Korean fare. Chef favourites here include Galbi Jjim, Domi Carpaccio and Yuk Hoe.

Start your meal with a bowl of crispy Bori Prawns. Deep-fried to a golden brown, these crunchy prawns are served up with green baby garlic shoots for maximum flavour. For those who love a good mix of sweet and savoury, the Black Bean Mascarpone is a delicious dish not to be missed out on! Layered on a fluffy piece of oven-baked sourdough is a generous spread of mascarpone with sweet Siritae Beans and chive oil - the perfect way to whet your appetite.

Meat lovers can look forward to satisfying your carnivorous cravings with the Young Gae. Featuring an oven-roasted baby chicken with a boneless and butterfly cut, this fuss-free dish is marinated with Yuja sauce for an authentic taste of Korea. Wash down your meal with a refreshing glass of Legendary Beauty to enjoy the beautiful aroma of Omija and Cornus berries. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Aburi-EN (Causeway Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Premium Buta Don, Wagyu Stamina Don, Kyushu Tonkotsu Karamiso Ramen, Wagyu Niku Udon
data.ABOUT:
Offering a fine selection of Japanese and Australian wagyu, Aburi-EN specialises in “aburi”, partially grilled meat. The pride and joy of the restaurant, its A4/A5 Miyazaki wagyu has consecutively clinched Japan’s “National Wagyu Award” three times.

Harvested from carefully selected pigs which enjoy a natural diet of chestnuts and other nutritious food, the restaurant’s Buta Don bowls feature hearty servings of tender juicy meat with a sweet nuance. Pop by during lunch to enjoy a bowl of Premium Buta Don with a mini bowl of asari miso soup and pickles. Alternatively, choose to add on a healthy bowl of greens or an Okinawa Onsen Egg to compliment your meal!

Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with the Wagyu Stamina Don. Topped with a beautiful Okinawa egg, this don is a tasty mix of grilled miyazaki, Australian wagyu and mixed vegetables. Other mouthwatering rice bowls here include the Chicken Nanban Don, Unagi Jyu and Aburi Salmon don. For those who prefer a steaming warm bowl of noodles to satiate your cravings for authentic Japanese food, the Kyushu Tonkotsu Karamiso Ramen and Wagyu Niku Udon comes highly recommended. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Aburiya (Boat Quay)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Roast Beef Don, Kazoku Mori, Aburiya Salad, Tegutan Ramen
data.ABOUT:
Constantly on the hunt for the best wagyu in town, Aburiya is the true champion of Japanese wagyu beef. Visit the Japanese restaurant located at Boat Quay to embark on a real Japanese wagyu beef journey in more ways than one. 

Drop by in the afternoon to have a go at their delicious don sets that are affordably priced. Served with a cup of hot tea, salad, and a bowl of piping hot miso soup, the Wagyu Roast Beef Don set comes in two sizes to cater to different preferences. Topped with radish, spring onions and a generous amount of beautifully marbled wagyu meat, the fluffy grains of Japanese rice complements the tender beef and makes for a sumptuous lunch. 

For those looking to satisfy their carnivorous cravings, the wagyu set menu is perfect for sharing between two pax. Indulge in an intimate meal with a platter of Kazoku Mori. A mix of wagyu short rib, wagyu loin, pork belly, pork cheek and sausage, this generous platter is accompanied by egg soup, assorted kimchi, vegetables and more for a satisfying meal. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Acqua e Farina
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pizza Acqua e Farina, Piatto di Dolci, Spaghetti ai Gamberi, Bistecca al Pepe Verde, Risotto ai Funghi, Linguine ai Frutti di Mare
data.ABOUT:
If you’re on the prowl for truly authentic Italian food, look no further than Acqua e Farina. This charming, tastefully decorated restaurant will welcome diners with warm, positive vibes from the moment they step in (think lots of wood and brick in the interiors). Lovely décor wouldn’t mean very much without great grub, though, and we’re happy to say that Acqua e Farina’s mouthwatering list of Italian treats, made from produce mostly imported from Italy, is an absolute delight.
Luxuriate in Italian culinary heaven with dishes like the signature Pizza Acqua e Farina, with its delectable toppings of salami, tomato, mozzarella, ricotta cheese, and sautéed spinach. Each bite will unleash a delicious medley of flavours, and before you know it you’ll be chowing down with unexpected enthusiasm and speed! The pastas aren’t to be sneezed at either – the Spaghetti ai Gamberi is bound to impress with its helpings of oh-so-fresh prawns and a spiciness that gives it extra ‘kick’. Finally, few meals are complete without a dessert to round things off – and if you’re unsure of what to get, why not try the Piatto di Dolci? This platter contains mini portions of Crème Brûlée, Lava Cake, Panna Cotta, and Tiramisu, providing you with a very well-rounded coda to your meal. There are many other dishes on the restaurant’s hefty menu that aren’t mentioned here, so why not nip down and check it out sometime soon? You won’t regret it, we promise! (Feb 2017)

data.title: Afterglow
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Raw Vegan Nut 'Cheese' Platter with Crackers, Afterglow Kimchi Nori Rolls, Drag-Pom Salad, Raw Taco Bowl, Raw Lasagne, Deconstructed Sushi Bowl, Raw Chocolate Salted Caramel Fudge
data.ABOUT:
If there's one relatively underrated cuisine on the Singapore dining scene, it's raw vegan fare. Vegetarianism's stauncher cousin has gained itself a reputation for not being the tastiest stuff in the world, often relegated to the classification of rabbit food. Afterglow, the hip outpost in the Keong Saik area, aims to change that perception with intriguing, creative raw fare that defies expectations.
Afterglow has hippie chic intentions that go well beyond its inventive decor. The concept was born out of local ingredient sourcing and improving the lifestyles of city dwellers with wholesome, natural fare. Evolving the industrial look with a vintage, trinket-filled aura, the communal space is used to showcase on-theme books, accessories and even wines. This is your first indication that the approach here is not all pious, with additional edge given by artisanal cold brew, small-batch coffee, and craft beer to suit the lively neighborhood after dark.
Regardless of your familiarity with raw vegan dishes, the menu at Afterglow aims to please. To start, the Raw vegan nut 'cheese' platter with crackers uses cultured cashews, soaked and pureed to recreate the smooth texture of a cheesy dip, miraculously sans any actual dairy. The accompanying crackers made of whole seeds and grains deliver a satisfying crunch, and the dip is so tasty that you'd never know it has added probiotic benefits. The sushi-like Afterglow kimchi nori rolls uses faux rice made with almonds and homemade Kimchi that has been stewing in zingy marinades for 7 days. Venturing into Mexican territory, the Raw taco bowl substitutes the seasoned beef for chunky walnuts spiced with a blend of salsas and crunchy purple cabbage, for a refreshing take on usually belt-busting burritos. For a more Italian spin, the Raw lasagne smartly deceives the tongue with zucchini as the pasta sheets, and macerated tomatoes as the sauce.
The Drag-pom salad is ideal for raw-vegan newbies and naysayers alike, featuring an undeniably good combination of dragonfruit with pomegranate, avocado, and macadamia. Also sure to please any palate is the Raw chocolate salted caramel fudge, featuring raw avocado and cacao, layered with sesame-based tahini cream, and a vanilla-medjool sweetened crust for a delightfully guilt-free treat. And really, doesn't that make it all the sweeter? (Dec 2014)

data.title: Ah Hoi's Kitchen
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 1A Cuscaden RoadLevel 4Hotel Jen Tanglin SingaporeSingapore (249716)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ah Hoi’s Chilli Crab, Black Pepper Crab, Salted Egg Crab with Crispy Yam, Steamed Sea Perch with Bean Crumb, Fried Black Pepper Beef Kway Teow, Durian Chendol
data.PRESS RELEASE: Ah Hoi's Kitchen is all about authentic Singaporean cuisine, bringing diners the true flavours of Singapore with expertise built over more than 20 years of heritage. Serving only the freshest seafood prepared with traditional recipes, this dining institution has made a name for itself for its Sri Lankan Crabs perfected with the culinary team's unique Singapore Chilli Crab recipe, as well as iconic local dishes including Fried Black Pepper Kway Teow and Salted Egg Prawns. Other signature dishes featured on the menu include Steamed Sea Perch with Crispy Bean Crumb, Salted Egg Baby Lobsters, Seafood Claypot Mee Tai Bak, Soft Shell Crab with Salted Egg and Poached Spinach with Conpoy and Trio Egg, as well as Stir-fried Kenya Beans with Dried Shrimp and Garlic. The dining experience is complete with classic local desserts such as Yam Paste, Ice Kacang and Durian Chendol. Tucked away on top of Tanglin Mall, Ah Hoi's Kitchen offers an airy, sun-kissed al fresco setting with great poolside views. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Akira Back (JW Marriott Singapore South Beach)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 30 Beach RoadLevel B1MJW Marriott Hotel Singapore South BeachSingapore (189763)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tuna Pizza, Yukhoe, Toro Caviar, Hokkaido Scallops, 48 Hours Sanchoku Short Ribs
data.ABOUT:
A member of Marriott Bonvoy, dine in a menu of bold culinary offerings grounded in highly-lauded chef Akira Back’s signature philosophies.
Delight in an unexpected and exploratory culinary style of modern Japanese cuisine as chef reinvents the traditional Japanese playbook of dining with a menu where elegant melding of cultures inspires the evolution of culinary tradition.
Signatures include Tuna Pizza, thinly-sliced fresh Tuna by pairing it with an umami aioli with a sprinkle of truffle oil atop the delicate crust. The classic Korean dish of Yukhoe is elevated with Tajima wagyu striploin served with nashi pear and sesame soy, topped with a quail egg yolk and seaweed caviar.Discover Akira Back’s signature flavours, where the show is not just in the mouth. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Papparadelle Al Cinghiale, Filetto di Manzo alla Brace, Gamberoni, Tagliolini al Nero Seppia, Pizza Contadina,  Pizza Parma, Quattro Formaggi, and Bufala, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
In our minds, a culinary gem hidden in plain sight would be the best way to describe Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments. Synonymous with its Italian name, 'the Village', this unpretentious Italian Trattoria situated along Bukit Timah is known by its fans for its warm service and rustic Italian fare.
Despite its modest interior of dark wood floors and tiled bricks, the food at Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments is second to none. It should come as no surprise though, judging by Chef Mimmo's insistence on using only the freshest ingredients and making most of the dishes from scratch!
Diners are in for a real treat as Chef Mimmo brings his Italian roots to the plate with a range of classic Napoleon dishes such as Parma, Quattro Formaggi and Bufala Pizza - a thin crusted tomato based pizza baked to perfection and topped with arugula, slices of fresh bufala mozzarella and cherry tomatoes.
Fancy some light evening breeze while sipping on a glass of Bordeaux? Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments' al fresco dining area is a hit with its regulars, and it's easy to see why. Imagine enjoying some great Italian food with a glass of wine in hand, while the sun sets in the background. I guess that's what the Italians mean by 'La Dolce Vita'. (Sept 2017)

data.title: Al Forno (East Coast) Italian Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 400 East Coast RoadLe Peranakan HotelSingapore (428996)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Linguine All' Aragosta, Spaghetti Cartoccio, Pizza Al Forno, Pizza Rollo, Pizza Con Carne
data.ABOUT:
A sunny retreat that has been an East Coast staple for 20 years, Al Forno really knows what it's doing when it comes to fresh Italian favourites.
With all the Italian options in Singapore, it's no wonder the competition is stiff enough to see many a restaurant come and go, but Al Forno has stood the test of time and tastiness with a beautifully simple philosophy. Take the freshest Italian ingredients, make dishes that people know and love, and the diners will come. And while it's now a common claim to source ingredients like vine ripened whole tomatoes and peppery parmigiana directly from Italy, Al Forno was the first to do so, with exclusive imports since 1995. That means the dishes here have been tasted, tweaked and perfected so that you can't go wrong with anything on the diligently genuine, yet approachable menu.
The Linguine All' Aragosta, more commonly known as Lobster Linguine, is a house favourite, featuring salty capers and olives punctuating a naturally sweet red sauce made from cherry tomatoes. Succulent chunks of lobster tail and thick noodles of linguine soak up the sauce perfectly. For more of that divine signature sauce, go for the Spaghetti Cartoccio, which is studded with a mix of shelled seafood and baked up in a decadent foil package for two. From the pizzas, the Pizza Con Carne is a knockout, with all forms of meaty deliciousness arranged neatly atop the authentic foldable crust. The Pizza Rollo is a great starter or family pick, featuring a melt of ricotta, spinach and ham all rolled up. Looking quite charming atop their trademark checkered tablecloths, all the dishes taste as good as they look! (Mar 2015)

data.title: Al Forno Tapas & Wine Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Italian, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Pizza
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)

data.title: Alati Divine Greek Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Octopus (XTAPODI), Salt-Baked Seasonal Greek Fish, Calamari Souvlaki, Beef Souvlaki, Mousaka
data.ABOUT:
If you aren’t in the know, the dim and unassuming interiors or covered doorways of the eateries along Amoy might baffle and leave you wondering if there really are plenty of food options here – perhaps one of the reasons why the bright spaces of ALATI will inevitably catch your eye. From the invitingly open arched doors to the signature blues and whites of the Mediterranean coating the interiors, everything, including the food, will transport you to Greece.

For full authenticity, the produce is brought here, fresh from the Aegean Sea, and items on the menu are crafted by hand, which might explain the depth of flavour in dips like Taramosalata (fish-roe cream) and Melitzanosalata (smoked eggplants with walnuts). Of course, there’s more than pita and dips on the menu. Fill up on amazing Salt-Baked Fresh Fish, grilled gems like the Octopus and Squid – simply named but complex on the tongue – and mains like Kotopoulo Souvlaki (grilled chicken with fried potatoes and yoghurt) as well as Mousaka (minced beef, eggplant, potatoes and béchamel sauce). Even their drinks menu boasts Greek tipples like Mastiha and Ouzo, an uncommon sight in Singapore.

Bring on the influx of Japanese and American diners to our shores, we’re not complaining, but it’s nice to see more unusual cuisines, that prove deliciously authentic, opening up in the heart of the city! (Feb 2016)

data.title: Alaturka Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Meze Tabagi, Adana Kebab, Kuzu Pirzola, Moussaka, Kunefe
data.ABOUT:
Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant prides itself on being the purveyor of fine Mediterranean, Turkish, and Middle Eastern dining. With indoor dining as well as alfresco seating in historic Kampong Glam, be treated to impeccable Turkish hospitality while you feast on dishes that are meticulously prepared from only the best ingredients.

The menu is extensive, featuring hot and cold appetisers, pide, kebabs, mains, desserts, and more. The Meze Tabagi is a great introduction to the cuisine, with an assortment of popular mezes and a side of hot Turkish Lavas Bread.

For mains, specialities include the Adana Kebab, a grilled skewer of marinated minced chicken, the Kuzu Pirzola, grilled lamb chops with homemade gravy, and the classic Moussaka. Choose from the wide range of Turkish breads to go along with the protein-heavy dishes too, from classic sourdough to ones topped with melted cheese.

The desserts are equally tempting and will definitely satisfy anyone with a sweet tooth. If we had to choose a favourite, it would be the Kunefe, a thin vermicelli pastry baked in soft cheese and soaked in syrup. Wash all the goodness down with a comforting pot of traditional apple tea. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Alley Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Roll, Pita Pockets, Chacuterie, The Invisible Sling (Cocktail)
data.ABOUT:
A cocktail bar tucked between two heritage Peranakan shophouses along Emerald Hill, Alley Bar is an architectural gem that seamlessly weaves old world charm with contemporary design for a cosy and inviting atmosphere.

Serving up a mix of stellar cocktails and non-boozy drinks, Alley Bar’s photo-worthy cocktails will definitely have you reaching out for more. Perfect for after work socials or gatherings with friends, the bar has a wide variety of happy hour classics and cocktails for all. A unique twist on the Pina Colada, The Ghosted Colada is a heady mix of Plantation 3 stars rum and house-made pandan syrup, pineapple juice, fresh lime and coconut. Tinged with fruity notes, this tropical paradise drink is a great option to zest up your night. 

For those who rather stick to local favourites, The Invisible Sling is Alley Bar’s cheeky take on the usual Singapore Sling. This concoction features a combination of Widges Gin, Dom Benedictine, cherry brandy and triple sec with kaffir lime leaf-infused pineapple juice, angostura bitters, fresh lime juice, and house-made hibiscus syrup. 

Offering equally exciting non-alcoholic options on it’s extensive menu, those who prefer to steer clear of alcohol can also get in on the action with Alley Bar’s exciting cordials. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Alley on 25
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Burgers, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Icehaus
Scottish Smoked Salmon with Chive Crème Fraiche, Charcuterie, Italian Soft-Serve Ice Cream

Smoke & Pepper
Vietnamese Squid, Barbecued Specialties, Black Angus Beef Burger

The Green Oven
Braised Lamb Shank, Clay-Baked ChickenMore
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Conceived as the culinary hub of the hotel, Alley on 25 is Andaz Singapore's all-day dining venue that aims to recreate the fluid, spontaneous experience of Singapore street dining - in the sky.
Icehaus
Guests hankering after a light meal can head to Icehaus, an outlet inspired by kitchens of a bygone, pre-electricity era, when food was kept cool in wooden cabinets filled with ice slabs. Icehaus focuses on cold dishes such as Scottish Smoked Salmon with chive crème fraiche, charcuterie, seafood, salads, sandwiches and desserts, with specialist dessert machines dishing up Italian soft-serve ice cream and shaved ice.
Smoke & Pepper
Smoke & Pepper, the largest dining destination at Alley on 25, showcases Asian-inspired barbecued specialties prepared over an open-fire barbecue grill. Dig into succulent BBQ grub such as Grilled Diver Scallops, Grilled Squid with Green Chili and Shiso Pesto, and more.
The Green Oven
The Green Oven is where classic international favourites fare prepared from the heart of the kitchen - our giant green-colour Beech oven. Dig into to family-sharing styled comfort dishes like braised lamb shank, claypot baked chicken, black mussels and even dark chocolate brownies. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Alma By Juan Amador
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pigeon with Mango, Coco, Purple Curry;  Toothfish with Cauliﬂower, Turron, Lime;  Gambas with Al Ajillo
data.ABOUT:
If you believe that the essence of dining is all about indulging in the finest cuisine with your closest companions, you will love Alma by Juan Amador. Here, a casual atmosphere and astonishing creations reveal the culinary brilliance of the highly-acclaimed three-Michelin star chef, Juan Amador. Situated on the leafy grounds of Singapore’s Goodwood Park Hotel on Scotts Road, the menu at Alma by Juan Amador reads like a roster of contemporary European dishes heavy with Asian influence. Places tend to fill up quickly at this Michelin one-star restaurant in Orchard, so wait no more and reserve a table today!
For Asian-influenced modern European cuisine in the Orchard district of Singapore, look no further than Alma by Juan Amador – the brainchild of the eponymous Spanish-German chef with three Michelin stars to his name. Helmed by executive chef Haikal Johari, whose illustrious career saw him establish the renowned Water Library restaurants in Bangkok, Thailand, Alma (which means “soul” in Spanish) takes you to the heart of dining with extraordinary, masterful creations like the signature monkfish cheek with saffron, mussel and artichoke.
You’ll find this Michelin one-star restaurant on the tranquil premises of the Goodwood Park Hotel, a heritage building on Scotts Road in Singapore’s commercial heart of Orchard. Over 300 wine labels, including several from Robert Parker’s 100-Point list, will spoil wine lovers with a penchant for European-Asian fare at Alma by Juan Amador, so don’t hesitate to approach its amiable crew if you need a recommendation. Additionally, drinks and snacks are available at Bar@Alma and if you’re coming in a group, you might want to request the private room. (May 2017)

data.title: Almost Famous Craft Beer Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala G&T, Creamy Tiger Prawns Laksa Linguine, Har Cheong Gai Wings, Chili Crab Shrooms Linguine
data.ABOUT:
Almost Famous Craft Beer Bar is a minimalist beer bar tucked away in CHIJMES. Also known as the "Apple store" of craft beer bars, you can expect a warm ambience and Instagram-worthy food and decor.

With 16 rotational beers on tap, you’ll be spoiled by choice as you try beers from all over the world like Singapore’s Brewlander & Co., Australia’s Pirate Life Brewing, and Vietnam’s Pasteur Street Brewing Company. What’s a round of beer without some wings? Try Almost Famous Craft Beer Bar’s chicken wings, which come with a light spicy and tangy butter sriracha sauce, a yuzu soy garlic sauce, and more. Our favourite’s has to be the Har Cheong Gai version, where the wings are marinated for 48 hours in a shrimp paste blend.

Other highlights include its East-meets-West pasta dishes, like the Creamy Tiger Prawns Laksa Linguine, and the Chili Crab Shrooms Linguine. Besides beers, specialty Gin & Toni cocktails are also available along with non-alcoholic options such as Seedlips Spice and Tonic. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Alter Ego
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Location: City Hall, Marina Bay, Promenade, Esplanade, Marina Central
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pokecado Toast, Matcha Maniac, Thai Geisha, Southern Fried Chicken Skin, Yuzu Blossom, Har Cheong Kai
data.ABOUT:
Here’s a spot that will liven up your Instagram feed. From the folks behind A Poke Theory, Alter Ego is the evil twin of the beloved healthy eating joint on Boon Tat street. Serving Poke Bowls till evening, and indulgent grub with booze afterward, everything on the menu screams #foodporn.

The brunch menu is a sight to behold - featuring everything from decadent desserts to brunch staples with a twist. Artfully created thickshakes are available in a range of flavours - from peanut butter to matcha. The Matcha Maniac is particularly noteworthy for its lush green colour and generous serving of rich chantilly cream. If sugar isn’t your thing, the Pokecado Toast comes in the same lovely green shade, with velvety smashed avocado on sourdough topped with spiced roasted cashews and crispy tempura batter.

Prefer some bubbly? The bar bites are as indulgent as poke is healthy. From Southern Fried Chicken Skin to local favourite Har Cheong Kai starting from just $4, you could be forgiven for wanting to try them all in one sitting. Their Happy Hour deals are pretty darn great as well - an array of $6 bottled beers and cold pints going from $10 and up. In a place like this where both food and drinks appease those at either ends of the clean or indulgent eating spectrum, you'll find solace in knowing it'll hit all the right spots. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Amano
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Italian Meatballs, Burrata Pizza, Prawn & Bacon Pizza, Mushroom Risotto, US Duroc Pork Chop, Chocolate Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in the corner of Namly Place, Amano is a vibrant Italian restaurant serving up delicious pizzas and pastas, handmade with love. 

Start your meal on a high note with a wide selection of antipasto and salads. The Arugula Salad is a refreshing combination of nutty leafy greens, tomatoes, and slivers of prosciutto tossed in a zesty lemon dressing. The Italian Meatballs are good for sharing, with juicy beef meatballs in a tangy tomato sauce.

Ordering a pizza is a must here, as each pie is lovingly handmade with fresh ingredients. The Pepperoni is a classic favourite, while adventurous palates will favour creative pizzas such as the Burrata, with fresh cheese, sweet tomatoes and pesto, or the Prawn & Bacon with an interesting Surf & Turf spin topped with juicy tiger prawns and crispy bacon. 

There’s also a good selection of pastas and grilled meats to choose from. The Mushroom Risotto is a top hit amongst vegetarians, while meat-lovers will enjoy grilled US Duroc Pork Chop and Ribeye Steak with mushroom sauce. Save some space for dessert — the warm Chocolate Lava Cake boasts a molten center that is not to be missed. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Amazing Hokkaido
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Melty 7 Kinds of Tsukune, Muroran Yakitori,Tokujo Assorted Hokkaido Fresh Sashimi
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Welcome to the newest after-work hangout in town – Amazing Hokkaido – where the service is warm, and the atmosphere always cheerful. Amidst blaring Japanese tunes and incessant chatter, smiley wait staff scurry in traditional garb to serve up menu delights flown in daily from Hokkaido, a region well-known for its fresh seafood.

 

The 100-seater establishment, tucked in the dining enclave of Robertson Quay, works with a selection of gourmet partners to serve up a plethora of Japanese offerings. Signatures include the Muroran Yakitori, a classic Hokkaido dish with skewered onion and pork; Melty 7 Kinds of tsukune, chicken skewers served with a variety of savoury toppings; Tokujo Assorted Hokkaido Fresh Sashimi platter, which includes sashimi favourites like tuna akami, fatty tuna, and sea urchin. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Amber West
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hong Kong Char Siew Chicken, Basil Millet Bowl, Caramel Parfait, Pineapple Pork Chop, Thai Sour & Spicy Seabass, Chempedak Crème Brulée
data.ABOUT:
Amber West, a student operated restaurant, brings affordable gourmet selections prepared by student chefs and served by student servers, to those who visit the in-house fine dining training restaurant, located right in the heart of ITE College West’s vast campus at Choa Chu Kang. The restaurant serves to train students in an authentic learning environment at affordable prices and features a tantalising collection of dishes, both Western and Asian cuisine with a twist.

Specialising in Asian and Western cuisine, the restaurant serves up four course meals that will definitely get you bang for your buck. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Ambush-Pan European Dining (Junction 8)
data.Cuisine: Modern European, French, Italian, Spanish, Seafood, German, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oktoberfest Platter, Ambush’s Paella, Signature Fish and Truffles Chips, Bruschetta, Tiramisu, Risotto with Pancetta & Foie Gras
data.ABOUT:
For a name that conjures up images of covert military or law enforcement stake-outs, Ambush has a decidedly gentle ambience. Its ambitious menu, however, is nothing short of fierce.
Giant platters of sausage (the Oktoberfest Platter) sit comfortably next to fragrant Spanish Paella, and the Signature Fish and Truffle Chips are mentioned in the same breath as Risotto with Pancetta & Foie Gras. If you have ever wanted to eat everything that Europe has to offer in one sitting, this is the place to be.
In the words of its founder, Stanley Ng, Ambush offers a “whistle-stop tour of all the best that European food has to offer...Start in France, continue through Spain, then relax with a moreish dessert and coffee in Italy – and be home in time to plan your next gastronomic adventure!”
Short of teleporting from one European city to another, Ambush is really your best bet for an eating tour of Europe in a single meal. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Ameising Tapas & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shiitake Truffle Yaki, Surumeika Teppanyaki, Ameising Platter, Ribeye Soba
data.ABOUT:
Located at Hong Leong Building, Ameising Tapas & Bar is situated in the middle of the CBD. Offering a full menu of Japanese tapas, sashimi, rice and soba bowls, as well as bar snacks, it’s a great place for lunch, dinner, and post-work drinks with colleagues. 

While it’s a casual place, they’re serious about their food. The main highlights are their kushiyaki selections, with grilled skewers that include Shiitake Truffle Yaki and Ebi Mentaiko Yaki for those who want to up their ante. Mains include the Unagi Kebayaki and Garlic Fried Rice, the latter a staple of any good teppanyaki joint. And yes, their teppanyaki selection heats things up with Surumeika Teppanyaki, with squid and butter soyu. 

Even if you’re just here for drinks, you’ll be tempted by their selection of bar snacks on offer. Have the best of everything with the Ameising Platter, consisting of Amaebi, Tako, Popcorn Chicken, Kawa Karaage, and Curry Samosa. For something lighter, opt for the Sashimi Platter instead.

Lunch includes wallet-friendly options such as the set lunch of grilled selections or sashimi, which comes with salad, miso soup, rice, and pickles. If you prefer a fuss-free alternative, their rice, noodle, and grain bowls pack a punch — we recommend their Poke Bowl Soba, Quinoa Bowl, and Ribeye Soba. 

Their fully stocked sake collection even has a helpful sake meter value to help you narrow your choices from sweet to dry. Ameising Tapas & Bar’s Cocktail Diary Series features different cocktails on Wednesdays, so look out for it! (Apr 2021)

data.title: Amò
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mushrooms, Truffle, Mascarpone and Tuscan Pecorino Signature Pizza, Margherita DOP Classic Pizza, Spaghetti Chitarra with Boston Lobster and Tarragon, Butter Roasted Spring Chicken with Rosemary Jus and Roman Potatoes, Grilled Octopus, Friggitelli Peppers and Calabrian Chili Vinaigrette, Tiramisu
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The gastronomic stretch of Hong Kong Street, lined with the city's top restaurants and bars, has new company in the form of Amò, the smart-casual Italian eatery and bar by established restaurateur-chef Beppe De Vito of the ilLido Group. Located at 33 Hong Kong Street, Amò continues the group's mission to elevate the Italian dining scene in Singapore, by combining Italian traditions with contemporary innovation at a high perceived value.
Short for "amore", the restaurant is named after the colloquial term of endearment used across Italy regardless of dialects and regions. In the same spirit, Amò is a union of Italian cuisine and people, designed as a social destination where the best culinary influences from all parts of Italy come together, for groups of friends to gather over antipasti, big plates and pizzas to share. (Jun 2017)

data.title: Anglo Indian Cafe & Bar (Chijmes)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Anglo Specialty Tandoori Chicken, Lamb Seekh Kebab, Paneer Tikka, Anglo Indian Chicken Jalfrezi, Anglo Indian Country Captain Chicken
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Excellently located at Chijmes, Anglo Indian Café & Bar, offers the unique combination of Anglo-Indian Cuisine, where you can enjoy open air seating with sumptuous Asian and continental dishes.

It’s our commitment to fulfilling all your requirements that brings you back every time. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Anglo Indian Cafe & Bar (Marina One)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tomato Shorba, Butter Chicken, Ragra Mutton, Bombay Potatoes
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Anglo Indian Café & Bar offers some of the best Indian cuisines, serving a wide variety of delicious dishes which they carefully prepare with the finest and freshest ingredients to make sure that everything is perfectly catered to every palate and satisfying to your taste buds. 

Located along Straits View and just a few minutes away from Downtown MRT Station, Anglo Indian Café & Bar also provides an exquisite environment and a comfortable ambiance which makes it a great place to chill out and have a quality time together with family, friends or colleagues. (Aug 2019)
