data.title: Anouska's Restaurant and Bar
data.Good For: Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Escape to Kaifeng, Chen Pi Collins, Signature Roast BBQ Duck, Fried Enoki Mushroom Masala, Fried Sesame “Wuxi” Pork Rib
data.ABOUT:
Bringing you drinks from around the world spanning the disco era of the 70s and 80s, coupled with mouth-watering delights from the iconic Yellow Pot, Anouska’s Bar showcases top shelf spirits, premium wines, local craft beers, artisanal Chinese teas and cocktails expertly injected with nostalgic Eastern influence. You are in for an eccentric, elegant surprise as you enter the bar, which includes large golden fans and strong hues of black, gold and yellow, layered with Oriental screens and calligraphy wallpaper from Anouska’s personal collection. Bask in old-world charm while enjoying craft cocktails and an abundance of delightful Chinese fare with an innovative twist.

Infusing house-made chrysanthemum cordial with Tanqueray London dry gin for hints of flowery notes, the bar’s trademark cocktail, Escape to Kaifeng, is a must-try. Inspired by the flower of Kaifeng in China, this intoxicating mix is refreshingly delicious.

On Her Majesty’s Secret Service is a playful tribute to designer Anouska Hempel — a former Bond Girl from the 1969 namesake film — in the form of a dry gin martini tipped with yuzu and green tea bitters. Fans of the iconic martini can also try three unique variations of the Bond-approved classic with Martini Triad, a tasting flight of the bar’s signature martinis — including a dirty martini clouded with house-made pickled green chilli and brine.

The Hong Long Choc is a seductive swirl of whisky, chocolate liqueur, aromatic bitters and Lapsang Souchong — perfect for chocolate lovers to satisfy their cocoa cravings.

Bringing the creativity and style from the adjoining Singapore Chinese Icon, Yellow Pot, Chef Sebastian has created an ingenious offering of Chinese fare made for both intimate gatherings and larger groups. Favourites include Fried Prawns with Bonito Aioli or the highly addictive Sichuan-style Popcorn Chicken — all paired perfectly with Anouska’s favourite drinks from around the world. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Anti:dote
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, British, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Vegetarian, Dessert Only
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
Reinterpreting classic cocktail recipes with a contemporary flair, Anti:dote presents a unique wine and dining experience like no other. Offering a progressive selection of non-conventional concoctions cleverly disguised as ‘cure-alls’, come down to this modern cocktail bar to experience a fine selection of handcrafted cocktails today. Pair with the vast array of tapas options available and surround yourself with a good fine, great wine and laughter for a splendid night out. 

Begin with the bar’s casual set menu. Featuring signature favourites such as the Roasted Scallop, Wagyu Beef Short Rib and Marinated Heirloom Tomatoes, complete the course with glasses of four varying exquisite wines. An indulgent combination of wine and Kaviari Kristal Caviar, this fancy dining experience is sure to leave a lasting impression. 

Vegetarian delights here include menu options that are fresh from the garden. Opt for the Beer Battered Aubergine or Baked Baby Cauliflower to enjoy bites that are healthy, nutritious and green. For those looking for a decadent sweet treat, one can never go wrong with the British Strawberries and Devonshire clotted Cream Eton Mess. An innovative deconstructed dessert, this dish is an absolute stunner you can’t leave without trying. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Apollo Coffee Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Breakfast Burger, Wurst Rosti, Pork and Pear Tartine, Butterscotch Banana Waffle
data.ABOUT:
Brought to you by the team behind Atlas Coffeehouse, Columbus Coffee Co. and Lunar Coffee Roasters, Apollo Coffee Bar is every cafe hopper's dream. A long list of brunch items, mains, desserts, and artisanal coffees make up the menu, while whitewashed walls and natural sunlight make a perfect backdrop for some Insta-worthy shots.

Start your day right with the Breakfast Burger, with creamy cheddar scrambled eggs, spicy aioli, caramelised onions and bacon between brioche buns and a side of crispy tater tots. The Wurst Rosti, that comes with a cheesy sausage and sunny side up eggs, is also a favourite.

If you're looking for something heartier, the variety of Small and Large Plates will not disappoint. The Pork and Pear Tartine is a unique choice. This open-faced sandwich is topped with roasted pears, bacon, caramelised onions, and ricotta. For some trusty comfort food, go for the Wagyu Cheeseburger or Mushroom Bacon Carbonara.

No meal is complete without a sweet treat, and Apollo's selection of waffles and soft serves does just the trick. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Aqua Luna
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chorizo & Onion Flatbread, Truffle Polenta Fries, Alexandra Sunset Cocktail
data.PRESS RELEASE:
"Park Hotel Alexandra is proud to introduce a stunning new bar – Aqua Luna – which sits high above the hustle and bustle of the busy streets of Alexandra.
This gorgeous oasis is perched on the seventh floor of the hotel and sits beside the shimmery blue waters of the hotel’s 25-meter infinity pool. Featuring a spectacular ceiling-to-floor glass enclave, Aqua Luna easily seats 56 guests at its marble-white central bar and comfortable high-tables and chairs positioned around its rim – all affording revellers a 180-degree view of the beautiful surrounds.
By day, guests munching on a light lunch can take in the striking view of the treetop canopy of the Southern Ridges in all its fresh, green glory. By twilight, the space is transformed into an eye-catching watering hole where the stage is set daily for the viewing of the magnificent golden-hued sunset. As the sky darkens, the scene changes once again with the moon and sparkling lights of the Queenstown precinct morphing into the backdrop for a relaxing evening.
The entire experience at Aqua Luna is heightened by a stellar line-up of speciality cocktails that were meticulously conceptualised to reflect the laid-back and easy-going vibe by day and the sensual and chill-out atmosphere by night." (Dec 2015)

data.title: Arbora (formerly Spuds & Aprons)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 109 Mount Faber RoadFaber Peak SingaporeSingapore (099203)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab Potato Skins, Classic Caesar, Wild Mushroom, Braised Beef Cheek, Tomahawk Pork Rib, Fisherman’s Stew, Rack of Lamb, Smoked Duck Mushroom Ragout, Chempedak Bread & Butter
data.ABOUT:
Who says you have to travel for dinner with a view? This lush spot proves otherwise. Nestled in the greenery of Mount Faber, this restaurant exudes a sense of tranquility that’s hard to replicate elsewhere. Inspired by the Latin word for a leafy enclosure, this restaurant is a haven from the rush of the city and is the perfect place for a relaxed dinner for two.

The menu features a range of dishes made with wild ingredients, as well as continental comfort food. The Chilli Crab Potato Skins are a hot favourite. Featuring deep-fried potato skins stuffed with classic chilli crab gravy, this dish is crisp and delicious, and goes perfectly with a cold beer. Prefer something a little healthier? Opt for one of the delicious salads. The Wild Mushroom Salad is made with a mix of mushrooms topped with greens, tomatoes and balsamic vinegar. The flavour of the tender mushrooms is rich and goes perfectly with the crisp greens. 

For dessert with a twist, try the Chempedak Bread & Butter, a bread pudding that is made with butter and croissants, chempedak, and vanilla ice cream. Mildly sweet, velvety and perfect for sharing, this dish the perfect way to end a decadent meal. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Arkadas Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yaprak Sarma with Rice in Vine Leaves, Moussaka, Chicken Doner Kebabs, Apple Tea
data.ABOUT:
Authentically Turkish, Arkadas Cafe greets you with lush greenery and an impressive cascading waterfall. Enter this hidden oasis to enjoy quality traditional dishes such as Yaprak Sarma with Rice in Vine Leaves, Chicken Doner Kebabs, and more. 

An appetiser featuring flavoured rice rolled up with vine leaves, squeeze some lime over the Yaprak Sarma for maximum flavour. Similar to lasagna, the Moussaka is a generous portion of cheese and minced beef, layered with eggplants and baked to perfection. The Chicken Doner Kebab is a great lunch option for the health conscious. Thinly sliced and snugly bundled up, the slices of doner kebab are accompanied by a medley of vegetables in a crisp wrap. 

Order a pot of Turkish Tea while waiting for dessert. Light, aromatic and refreshing, this delicious hot beverage is served in a traditional glass cup. For something sweeter, the Apple Tea is a cold and fruity drink that helps to dispel the relentless heat of Singapore. Wrap up your meal with a traditional dessert like Baklava for an authentic Turkish experience. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Aromas of India
data.Cuisine: Indian, Fusion, Middle Eastern, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tomato Garlic Soup, Butter Chicken, Chicken Tikka, Mutton Biryani
data.ABOUT: Nestled in Little India, Aromas of India guarantees a wide array of delicious Indian delicacies with every visit. Boasting a special menu on selected days of the week, the restaurant offers nourishing soups and traditional favourites such as Chicken Tikka and Tomato Garlic Soup. Traditionally famous for its savoury tandoori dishes and exotic curries, Aromas of India features fresh dishes made from whole, natural ingredients that are served piping hot. Start your meal with a bowl of Creamy Mushroom Soup before tantalising your tastebuds with the restaurant’s signature Butter Chicken. Besides these two staples, the restaurant also offers lamb, vegetarian, seafood, rice and biryani dishes. Pick the Mango Lassi, Sweet Lassi or Salted Lassi to complement your meal from Aromas of India’s wide selection of juices and speciality drinks. Apart from being famed for its food, the restaurant also offers high tea, regarded as one of the best in Singapore. Dedicated to serving authentic and the best of Indian cuisine, Aromas of India is truly a foodie's paradise. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Art
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.PRESS RELEASE: A neo-Italian rooftop dining destination located in the historic National Gallery of Singapore, Art combines modernist sensibilities with classical inspirations.Group Executive Chef Daniele Sperindio presents 'An Italian Tale', a brand new menu that draws ideas and inspirations from his Italian roots, culinary experiences abroad and the season’s finest ingredients, set against the backdrop of Singapore's glamourous skyline.Please visit https://www.artrestaurant.sg/ for more information. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Ash & Elm
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Smoky Copper Pot, The Ring of Cheese, German Pork Knuckle Flatbread, Tomahawk, Smoked Aces, Flaming Strawberry
data.ABOUT:
Boldly symbolic of burning wood-fire and glowing embers, G Restaurant Awards of Excellence winner Ash & Elm is a vibrant restaurant featuring three culinary theatres – a charcuterie and cheese room; a wood-fired oven; and an open charcoal-grill kitchen. Set within a striking venue that embraces spontaneity and energy, Ash & Elm dishes hearty food presented with flair.
Ash & Elm prides itself on the use of fine produce sourced from around the world, and boasts a la carte options with a selection of sharing platters, house-cured and Michelin Guide-recommended premium meats, as well as sustainably-sourced seafood. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Ashino
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fatty Tuna, Charcoal Grilled Keiji, Fresh Abalone Shabu Shabu. Fresh Salmon Roe, Fresh Uni
data.ABOUT:
Hidden away from the rip-roaring CHIJMES lies Ashino, a cosy ten-seater restaurant that successfully recreates the experience of dining in a bespoke sushi restaurant in Tokyo. And no details have been spared here, from the decor that features a sushi counter fashioned from a 180-year-old block of hinoki cypress wood to the imported ingredients flown in from Japan. 

Heading this restaurant is none other than Taku Ashino, whose precision and meticulousness help elevate the delicate ingredients them spectacular. Having trained in various sushi restaurants in Tokyo for over a decade, Ashino pays careful attention to making the ingredients sing, grilling his fish over a binchotan grill instead of a gas torch, as well as cooking a blend of Hokkaido and Niigata rice in a traditional iron rice pot with Mount Fuji water to achieve the perfect texture of rice. 

Whether you choose a set or omakase menu for lunch, rest assured that you’ll be in good hands. Signature sushi classics make an appearance, from the delectable melt-in-your-mouth Fatty Tuna to the Fresh Salmon Roe that provide bursts of flavour when you bite down on it, leaving you with nothing but a smile on your face. 

Eschewing ostentatiousness and swankiness, Ashino is a culinary gem that delivers up delectable sushi not to be found anywhere else in this city. (Dec 2017)

data.title: Asia Grand Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 331 North Bridge Road#01-02 & #01-05/08 Odeon TowersSingapore (188720)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Stuffed Crab Shell, Steamed Fresh Abalone with Garlic, Braised Superior Shark’s Fin Soup with Crab Roe, Drunken Prawn Cooked with Flame
data.ABOUT:
A sumptuous meal of Cantonese cuisine awaits at Asia Grand Restaurant. Serving a variety of popular food items that are loved by locals and tourists alike, Asia Grand promises an authentic traditional Cantonese dining experience.

With a wide variety of mouthwatering Hong Kong-style Dim Sum and an exquisite selection of a la carte Cantonese dishes, there is something for everyone here for a hearty and satisfying meal. Putting together different options to ensure pocket-friendly rates, check out the restaurant’s set menu for the most delicious deals. Chef recommendations here include the Fried Stuffed Crab Shell, Stewed Kampong Chicken with Onion and Vegetables, as well as the Steamed Fresh Abalone with Garlic.

Feast like a king with Asia Grand’s extensive menu of seafood options. Try the Braised Superior Shark’s Fin Soup with Crab Roe for a simple twist on this classic favourite. Move on to the Seafood Salad for the best of the sea, all on one plate. The Drunken Prawn Cooked with Flame is also a must-try dish that tastes even better than it looks. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Asian Market Cafe
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Malaysian, Fusion, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roti Prata, Laksa, Durian Pudding
data.ABOUT: Asian Market Cafe brings back a glorious buffet line of local favourites and contemporary regional delicacies! Guests can expect to be treated to an array of well-loved Southeast Asian cuisine that pays tribute to the diversity of flavour and cultures within the region. (Jun 2021)

data.title: Astor Bar at The St. Regis Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 29 Tanglin RoadLevel 1The St. Regis SingaporeSingapore (247911)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Weisse Garten, Capitan’s Cure, Manhattan Club, Korean Square.
data.ABOUT:
Bringing the art of drinking from the House of Astor in New York to St. Regis, Astor Bar impresses with an inspired selection of over 40 cocktails and signature rituals. Featuring a New York cocktail mail, have a sip of the Big Apple in the heart of town as you indulge in a list of specially curated cocktails that pays homage to five of New York City’s well known neighbourhoods. 

Diners can expect to be greeted by hospitality, grandeur, and elegance the moment they enter the bar. Decorated with some of the world’s finest artworks, sip on heady concoctions presented in distinctive glassware exclusively designed for Astor Bar by world renowned glassware producer John Jenkins. 

From local infusions to spirit-free cocktails and your favourite glass of Bloody Mary, it’s never too early for a cocktail. If you’re looking to get a buzz from visiting Lower Manhattan, raise a toast to Little Germany’s Weisse Garten. A sophisticated blend of beer, spirits and hearty European fruits and grains, this sweet mix of Irish whiskey and lager is the perfect way to end your day. Other exciting beverages include the Capitan’s Cure, Manhattan Club and Korean Square. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Atico Lounge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Argentinian Beef Bagel Burger, Japanese Snow Crab Croquettes, Deep Fried Chicken Gyoza
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Sprawled across two levels at the peak of ION Orchard, the luxe multi-concept 1-ATICO is home to three distinct social experiences.

The leisure destination of choice and a radical playground for the elite and discerning crowd, Atico’s lounge invites patrons to live the high life from day to night perfectly. Open daily, meet us at the top. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Atlas Coffeehouse
data.Cuisine: Fusion, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wurst Rosti, The Gentleman’s Relish, Bacon Kedgeree, Superbowl 2.0, Buttermilk Waffles
data.ABOUT:
Fans of popular cafe Assembly Coffee can now flock to its sister business, Atlas Coffeehouse. Situated in one of the city's lushest, chillest spots, it's just a stone's throw from the Botanic Gardens and the quiet estates of Bukit Timah. It's the perfect spot to while away an afternoon. Think handsome industrial-chic decor overlooking greenery and a nice cup of coffee. It's especially popular with students from the nearby campuses, so the vibe is young, hip, and friendly!

What really hits the spot is cafe grub done well and with flair. There's lots of hearty fare here: massive all day breakfasts, beautiful caramelized bacon on waffles, and soul-warming bowls of pasta. Save some room for sweets! The Butterscotch Banana Pancakes - toffee-like bananas on a massive fluffy pancake - is to die for. It's not a cafe without a good, piping-hot cup of java. Brewed from a custom blend by local roasters 2Degrees North, the coffee here is robust and punchy in all the right places. (Sep 2016)

data.title: Atrium Bar 317
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Home-made Quiche, Mini Wagyu Beef Burger, Grilled Chicken Satay, Chilli Fried
Potato Wedges with Spicy Avocado Dip
data.ABOUT:
Start your day with a piping hot cup of Java as you read the news, or have it to-go if you're in a hurry. Atrium Bar 317 is the place for you to get your morning coffee and treat yourself to a buttery croissant or a delicious muffin!

In the evening, stay a little longer as we transform into a chic hotel bar and enjoy our signature Mojito.

Check out the bar snack menu for delicious offerings such as the wildly-loved Chicken Satay! (Mar 2020)

Atrium Restaurant is Halal-certified!
In line with the tightened Covid-19 measures announced on 14 May, Atrium Restaurant will be closed from 16 May to 13 June 2021.
We seek your understanding. 
Thank you and stay safe! (May 2021)

data.title: Auntie's Wok & Steam
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Dim Sum, Double Boiled Beef Short Rib Noodles, Homemade Jiao Zi Dumplings
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Conceived as the culinary hub of the hotel, Alley on 25 is Andaz Singapore's all-day dining venue that aims to recreate the fluid, spontaneous experience of Singapore street dining - in the sky. Alley on 25 encompasses seven shop-house inspired venues including 2 bars and 5 restaurants - each specialising in 1 food preparation method.
Meandering down the alleyway, guests can discover Auntie's Wok and Steam, an authentic Singaporean culinary outlet, where guests can choose from sustainably sourced live seafood in fish tanks, then watch as chefs prepare their catch at live wok and steamer stations. Auntie's Wok and Steam also specialises in dim sum, as well as classic rice, noodle and meat dishes such as Double Boiled Beef Short Rib noodles, and homemade Jiao Zi dumplings served in a spicy vinegar sauce. (Oct 2017)

data.title: Avenue 87
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Soup of The Day, “Duck Rice”, Fried Chicken, Not Your Usual Lemon Tart
data.ABOUT:
Nestled along Amoy Street, Avenue 87 is a contemporary joint serving up Asian and fusion delights perfect for quick lunches or after work socials. Designed to be a semi-casual cozy hangout spot, Avenue 87 is a great place for good food and conversation. 

A restaurant full of surprises, Avenue 87 was founded on chefs Alex Phan’s and Glen Tay’s love for creating fusion dishes between modern and traditional Singaporean cuisine. The menu features the chefs’ creative combination of different flavours as well as an innovative offering of a variety of beverage blends. 

Start your meal with the restaurant’s soup of the day. An innovative take on the traditional local duck rice, Duck Rice here at Avenue 87 features a shiny brown Confit Duck served with yam rice and an assortment of salted vegetables. Wandering off the beaten path, Avenue 87 delivers on its promise to surprise diners with their selections of sweet treats. Not Your Usual Lemon Tart is a dessert that’s reimagined, while sticking to components such as sable and a blend of herbs, making it a unique dish. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Awadh
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Galawat Kebabs, Paya, Shorba and Kulcha
data.ABOUT:
Awadh brings the best cuisine of Northern India right to your doorstep. Eat like Awadhi royalty as you indulge in dishes cooked in the “Dum Pukht” style, in which ingredients in dough-sealed containers are slowly-cooked over a low flame. This process allows each individual component to gradually release their flavours, creating dishes that are not only flavorful and potent, but also connected to cultural history and tradition.

Located in The Centrepoint, Awadh is the perfect destination for gastronomes from all walks of life, serving a wide array of meat, seafood and vegetarian dishes. Be sure to try the Paya. These trotters are seasoned with a diverse mix of spices and left to cook overnight over a slow fire, creating a flavourful and tender bite. Awadh also has vegan options such as the “Impossible” kebabs or curries. Committed to showcasing the culinary heights of Northern India, the menu at Awadh changes with each season, and is unique to the festivals that mark the month. Thus, Awadh promises each and every diner and new and wholly unique experience. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Awfully Chocolate (Greenwich V)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Location: Yio Chu Kang, Ang Mo Kio
data.DISHES WE LOVE: All Chocolate Cake, Super Stacked Chocolate Cake, Hei Ice-cream Single Scoop, Classic Dark Chocolate
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Awfully Chocolate started as a cake shop selling only one cake - a simple dark chocolate cake between layers of dark chocolate fudge. Chocolate with a distinct roast. Real cake one can bite into, rich in taste yet moist and light. Not just mouthfuls of mousse or cream. Not overly sweet but something you could eat over and over again and not get tired of.
Today, we have grown from one indie store into a group of shops, cafes and restaurants bearing our love for dark chocolate. At Awfully Chocolate cafes, we serve our desserts the way we believe they should be experienced. Many of the cakes are served warm with a scoop of our chocolate ice-cream, and recommend with a contrasting artisanal tea or gourmet coffee, or for the connoisseurs, mocha royale or classic dark chocolate. (Apr 2017)

data.title: Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Andalusia Mixed Meat Platter,  Beef Kofta Tagine, Moroccan Mint Tea, Falafel
data.ABOUT:
Savour the magic of Middle Eastern cuisine at this quaint little spot on Bussorah street. Tucked away amongst the plethora of haunts serving up kebabs and koftas, you might easily miss this gem despite its bright turquoise interior. Modelled after the souks of Arabia, there are some the best dishes Andalusia has to offer here. From rich kebabs to light sweet teas, you can be assured to get them all under one roof. Diners looking to get a taste of Moroccan cuisine are sure to love Deli Moroccan for its generous portions, warm service, and pocket-friendly prices. 

The Beef Kofta Tagine is one of their most popular dishes. Made with ground beef, spices, and some apricot for a sweet twist, this unique dish is best savoured with some fragrant basmati rice. Carnivores are sure to enjoy the Andalusia Mixed Meat Platter. The indulgent platter consists of a generous assortment of meats like lamb, chicken, and beef accompanied by hummus and french fries -- best for sharing. Be sure to wash down your meal with some Moroccan Mint Tea, a refreshing drink made with black tea, sugar syrup, and fresh mint leaves that will invigorate your senses. (March 2019)

data.title: Azmaya
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Australian Pork, Spanish Beef, Pork belly, Pork Loins Holler
data.PRESS RELEASE: Situated in Robertson Quay, Azmaya serves up hearty portions of authentic Japanese Sukiyaki and Shabu-Shabu that are great for communal sharing. Their delectable selection of soup bases and premium meats will leave you wanting more. This cosy and classic Japanese hotpot place is the one to beat. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Azmaya Honten (Cuppage Plaza)

data.title: BAM! Restaurant
data.Hours: Tue-Sat: 12-2pm (Last Seating: 1:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Seating: 9:30pm)Closed Monday and Sunday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
We weren't certain it could be done, but BAM! has updated the staid tapas trend back to its former glory, with loud Japanese flavours turning up the volume on dishes that have been there, and done that a few times over. With a hip culture tailor-made for Tras Street, BAM! hits all the high notes.
Merging two cuisines is hardly groundbreaking, however BAM!'s inspired blending of Spanish tapas with small plates that are meant to be shared, and a Japanese sake-flowing izakaya, is spot on. The category is a bit hazy - is it a tapakaya? sakapas? - but whatever you choose to call it, the dining experience here is nothing short of uproarious.
The digs are adequately cool kid-chic, with the requisite hipster trimmings of concrete and not much else. Nude bulbs and the underbelly of the dining room's wiring are starkly exposed. Despite the naked decor, BAM! is not blushing at all with a boldly confident gastronomic vision and spot-on flavours. The vibe draws on the hearty camaraderie of Spanish bars with the real world grit of izakayas, for a pitch-perfect air of laidback dining.
The menu reads like a daily market billboard, hailing the freshest and peak-season ingredients. There are some mainstays though that have earned their permanent placement. The Pasta a la Plancha with Prawn and Sake Butter is next-level umami, with just enough acidity from the wine. And sake doesn't just make a one-time appearance, with a glassed-in cooler of both popular and hard-to-find brands. The resident sake sensei will not only pair your dishes with ample pours, but will show you how to really make the most of it, encouraging you to drizzle the wine into the luscious Kampong Egg with crispy squid and punchy chorizo, another menu regular.
As its name suggests, BAM! is loud and proud of its excellent fusion angle. The hip setting, top-notch food, and unique sake spin, make it deserving of its exclamation point. (Aug 2014)

data.title: BLVD @ Changi
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address:
5 Changi Business Park Central 1
#01-72/73
Changi City Point
Singapore (486038)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Glazed Salmon, Sage Brine Iberico Pork, Hand Cut Double Friend Fries, Kampong Fried Chicken Wings, Black Correct Cake, Masala Spiced Fried Fish Cutlet, 3 Chef's Choice Meat, Mushroom Truffle Crema, Classic Hamburger
data.ABOUT:
BLVD in Changi is the Easternmost offering of the popular Boulevard brand of outlets, which in-the-know revellers recognise for the brand’s style of quirky luxury and personable service. This is the perfect joint for a chic lunch or late-afternoon tipple that accidentally spills into a long dinner. Kick off with small plates like Kampong Fried Chicken Wings, Salted Pepper Squid, Masala Spiced Fried Fish Cutlets, and Butter Chickpeas, which will give you a sense of the sure-handed East-meets-West cuisine on offer here. Mains evolve into comforting plates like DIY pasta plates where you match your favourite pasta to your favourite sauce. Dunk some Fettuccine in their delectable Meatball Pomodoro Sauce or a heady Puttanesca, or have some Pappardelle tossed up in that Roman classic: Cacio E Pepe, a humble but gut-punching mix of fresh cheese and insane amounts of black pepper. 

Their state of the art Beechwood Stone Hearth turns out perfect pizzas, and the flavours here are bolder than you might get at other pizzaries. Think a no-holds barred Anchovies pizza, strewn with melty buffalo mozzarella and sous-vide eggs, or a salty Pepperoni e Salami, the twin sausages of Italian life paired with capers and piquant tomatoes. For a more carnal approach, order off the grill, with numbers like a juicy New York Strip Steak and a tender Baby Lamb Rack Au Jus sure to sate your carnivorous streak. Craft beers, Japanese whiskies, and punchy cocktails may have to do in place of dessert, because the night is young, and what else are you going to do with that food coma? (Feb 2018)

data.title: BLVD @ MBFC
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 8 Marina Boulevard#01-02Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1Singapore (018981)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Gyoza, Seared Sirloin Cubes, Teriyaki Chicken Buns, Mushroom Linguine
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by Manhattan’s classy uptown vibes, BLVD @ Bayfront brings to diners a differentiated dining experience with premium quality gastronomic offerings and first-class hospitality service. Boasting an unrestricted view of the Marina Bay Waterfront, the restaurant offers an unparalleled wine and dining experience under the stars accompanied by breathtaking panoramic views of Singapore’s iconic central boulevard area. 

Designed for guests to network, kick back and relax, the classic bar is decked with flamboyant bottles of all assortments. Before getting down to business, order the Chicken Gyoza to fill your stomach. A popular bar bite, the pan-fried dumplings are stuffed with juicy chicken and drizzled with sesame soy vinaigrette. A serving of eight pieces, there’s more than plenty to go around! If you’re still feeling peckish after a hearty round of delicious dumplings, the Seared Sirloin Cubes are a good choice to add to the table.

Mains on the menu include stone-fired pizza, mini burgers as well as a plethora of pasta options. With teriyaki sauce, Japanese mayonnaise and slapped between two fluffy brioche buns, the tender, melt in your mouth chicken is the star of the Teriyaki Chicken Buns, a must-order dish. (Nov 2020)

data.title: BTM Mussels & Bar
data.Hours: Tue-Wed: 5-11pm (Last Order: 10pm)Thu: 12-11pm (Last Order: 10pm)Fri-Sat: 12pm-11:30pm (Last Order: 10:30pm)Sun: 12-11pm (Last Order: 10pm)Closed Monday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mussels and Fries, Fresh Oysters, Smoked Bacon and Caramelised Onion Tarte Flambée, Grand Marnier Soufflé
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by chef and restaurateur Olivier Bendel’s experience in being the first to expand and popularise Belgium’s signature ‘mussels and fries’ restaurant concept throughout France, this elegant bistro aims to do the same on our sunny shores. In addition to Mussels and Fries, it serves a wide selection of comfort food from the Benelux region of Europe.

Needless to say, the Moules-frites is a must-try here. Plump, juicy gems of the sea are cooked in a sauce of your choice, alongside a generous portion of golden fries. Bring along your appetite so you can indulge in the hearty servings that come in 500g, 750g, or 1kg portions. 

Another favourite is the Tarte Flambée, an oven-baked flatbread from Alsace. BTM does it three ways: Smoked Bacon and Caramelised Onion, Escargot and Parsley Butter, and Porcini and Comté.

End your meal on a sweet note with a selection of traditional French desserts, including Grand Marnier Soufflé and Tarte au Citron. For a little extra indulgence, pair your dishes with a glass of wine or cocktail. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Baba Chews Bar and Eatery
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: X.O. Pork Belly Char Siew Rice Bowl, Chicken Rendang Lasanga, Peranakan Pulled Pork Burger, Chilli Crab Tagliatelle
data.ABOUT:
Baba Chews is a restaurant inspired by our vibrant neighbourhood - Katong. The name “Baba Chews” pays homage to Mr. Chew Joo Chiat (1857–1926), a wealthy local Chinese landowner and philanthropist, known as the ‘King of Katong’ for his contributions to the local community. Our restaurant sits on the site of the former Joo Chiat Police Station (1928 – 1987), built by the British in the late 1920's when Singapore was still a British Colony, which was granted conservation status by the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) of Singapore for its architectural & heritage value. 
Baba Chews serves a diverse menu of Mod-Sin (Modern Singaporean) dishes, local favourites, and Western comfort dishes along with quality brews from Common Man Coffee Roasters & TWG tea, beers and alcoholic beverages.
Popular items include our 'Kopi C' Flavoured Bbq Pork Spareribs, Chicken Rendang Lasagne & Ondeh Ondeh cake. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Baci Baci
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cacciucco, Antipasto, Submarine Pizza, Risotto Al Nero, Costolette di Agnello, Branzino Al Forno
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away in a corner of Lichfield Road, Baci Baci (or kiss kiss in English) is the place for you if you’re looking to relax with a glass of wine and a nice meal. Soak in the rustic, welcoming ambience of the restaurant as you wait for your food to arrive, and take in the tasteful wine bottle displays – it’s the perfect refuge for those looking to unwind from the stresses of city life.

Of course, ambience would mean little if the food wasn’t up to par, and at Baci Baci, even the most exacting of diners will find little to complain about. Dig into a plate of Risotto Baci Baci, and savour every forkful of delicious crustacean goodness. Generous in taste, it’s a fresh pasta dish that you won’t be forgetting in a hurry! The Costolette di Agnello , or grilled lamb rack, will delight meat eaters with its tenderness, its succulence, its flavorsome juiciness. Fair warning, try and resist the urge to wistfully nibble at the bones when you’re done – it’s that good.

Amidst the sea of Italian restaurants in Singapore, Baci Baci stands out for its quiet authenticity and intimate warmth. With good food, good drink, and good service – you’ll want for nothing here. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Bailamos Bistro Bar & Cafe
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Fusion, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Pizza, Burgers, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Chicken Wings, Squid Balls, Lasagna, Margarita Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Located in the cultural epicentre of Little India, Bailamos Bistro Bar & Cafe provides a warm, friendly and laid-back atmosphere with good food and drinks for diners to relax, reconnect, and recharge with friends.

Kickstart your meal by ordering some finger food. The Bailamos Platter contains a little bit of everything, allowing you to try the restaurant’s wide variety of options — favourites include the Fried Chicken Wings, Squid Balls, and Chunky Fries. For something more filling, the toast bread menu is a good place to begin. Opt for the Tomato Bruschetta with Ricotta to enjoy a naturally sweetened dish of ripe tomatoes. Cheese lovers should definitely not miss out on ordering the Cheezy Meatball with Garlic Toast. With a choice of chicken or beef, indulge in this cheesy goodness accompanied with a lightly grilled bread. 

Perfect for sharing, the Margarita Pizza is a tasty blend of mozzarella cheese, fresh basil and tomatoes. Speckled with sea salt, the pizza is a hot favourite with everyone. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Bakalaki Greek Taverna
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tzatziki, Spanakopita, Moussaka, Beef Souvlaki, Paidakia (Grilled Lamb Chops), Htapodi (Grilled Octopus), Mixed Grill Fish & Seafood Platters, Baklava, Loukoumades (Greek Doughnuts)
data.ABOUT:
Situated in the hip and buzzy Tiong Bahru neighbourhood, this charming restaurant and taverna draws upon the rich culinary history of the Eastern Mediterranean basin to conjure up scrumptious dishes that will leave you wanting more. Authenticity is the foundation of BAKALAKI's cooking, and the eatery prides itself on importing traditional ingredients from the motherland to incorporate into their meals.
Start your meal with any one of the restaurant's mouthwatering dips. The classic Tzatziki is one of our favourites, featuring cucumbers, garlic, and olive oil folded into a refreshing light Greek yoghurt. Other winning appetisers include the Kalamari Tiganito, where a straightforward dish of crispy fried squid is enhanced with a dash of lemon juice. Indecisive diners should opt for the Mixed Grilled Meat Platter, available for sharing between two to four diners. Here, you get to sample all the best grilled meats, which include beef and kebab skewers, chicken yiros, lamb chops, meatballs, and beef sausages.
Love what you ate? Why not take home a slice of Greek heritage and culture from the adjoining deli? The array of delicacies up for sale include cheeses, olives, honey, pulses, sauces, herbs, traditional sweets, and Greek wines. When done well, Greek cuisine can be downright phenomenal. So expect nothing less when you dine at BAKALAKI Greek Taverna - you have our word for it. (Jun 2017)

data.title: Bali Thai (Causeway Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Appetiser Platter, Phad Thai with Satay, Nasi Goreng Istimewa, Sago Gula Melaka
data.ABOUT:
Where ‘Thai-riffic’ meets ‘Indo-licious’, Bali Thai is the perfect combination of Thai and Indonesian cuisines in one place! A halal-certified restaurant chain in Singapore known for serving authentic delights in a family-friendly setting, it’s a great place for a hearty meal.  

 

Whet your appetite with one of their many starters. A dish that comes highly recommended, the Appetiser Platter comes with prawns cakes, chicken satay and crispy chicken, making it a tasty spread for sharing. Wrapped in fragrant pandan leaf, the Pandan Chicken is also another traditional delight that consists of juicy scented coriander chicken. Move on to the signature Phad Thai with Satay. A Thai staple not to be missed, this delicious mix of stir-fried noodles with eggs, vegetables and tofu is tossed in a delectable blend of spices for that extra kick of flavour. The skewered sticks of succulent meat complements the dish by adding different layers of texture and flavour.  

 

Other mouthwatering dishes include the Mee Goreng with Satay, Fried Kway Teow and Nasi Goreng Istemewa. Conclude your meal with the restaurant’s refreshing bowl of Sago Gula Melaka for a genuine fusion dining experience. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Bali Thai (Ngee Ann City)

data.Address: 391A Orchard Road#05-29 Ngee Ann City Podium BlockSingapore (238873)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Appetiser Platter, Phad Thai with Satay, Nasi Goreng Istimewa, Sago Gula Melaka
data.ABOUT:
Where ‘Thai-riffic’ meets ‘Indo-licious’, Bali Thai is the perfect combination of Thai and Indonesian cuisines in one place! A halal-certified restaurant chain in Singapore known for serving authentic delights in a family-friendly setting, it’s a great place for a hearty meal.  

 

Whet your appetite with one of their many starters. A dish that comes highly recommended, the Appetiser Platter comes with prawns cakes, chicken satay and crispy chicken, making it a tasty spread for sharing. Wrapped in fragrant pandan leaf, the Pandan Chicken is also another traditional delight that consists of juicy scented coriander chicken. Move on to the signature Phad Thai with Satay. A Thai staple not to be missed, this delicious mix of stir-fried noodles with eggs, vegetables and tofu is tossed in a delectable blend of spices for that extra kick of flavour. The skewered sticks of succulent meat complements the dish by adding different layers of texture and flavour.  

 

Other mouthwatering dishes include the Mee Goreng with Satay, Fried Kway Teow and Nasi Goreng Istemewa. Conclude your meal with the restaurant’s refreshing bowl of Sago Gula Melaka for a genuine fusion dining experience. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Bangkok Jam (Great World City)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tod Mun Pla, Tom Yum Goong, Peek Gai Tod Nam Pla, Khao Na Pla, Khao Neaw Ma Muang, Tap Tim Krob
data.ABOUT:
Thai cuisine has long been a firm favourite with many Singaporeans, and Bangkok Jam goes a good way towards satiating the nation’s cravings. Offering up a smorgasbord of delectables that are sure to make your mouth water, this restaurant expertly tempers classic Thai spices and cooking techniques with a modern sensibility for a combination that works.
Have an appetising serving of the restaurant’s Tod Mun Pla, and savour the explosion of flavours with every bite you take –  you won’t be forgetting these fish cakes in a hurry, that’s for sure - or dip your spoon into a delightfully spicy bowl of Tom Yum Goong, which comes with helpings of sweet and juicy prawns to add on to the sour tang. If you’re a dessert person, then the Tap Tim Krob, or red rubies topped with coconut ice cream, will be a perfect, refreshing way to end your meal. You won’t regret having the crowd-pleasers either, like the heavenly Khao Neaw Ma Muang (mango sticky rice), with its pleasantly chewy and fragrant rice.
Although it’s perfectly understandable if all your attention is focused on trying not to stuff your face with the goodies on offer at Bangkok Jam, or if you’re actually doing the deed and completely disregarding your surroundings (we get it), do take some time to soak in the ambience. With its casual décor reminiscent of a crowded street in the Thai capital, it’s hard not to be charmed. So make a booking at Bangkok Jam soon – you won’t regret it! (Dec 2019)

data.title: Bao Makers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Mentaiko Bao, Salted Egg Chicken Bao, Chilli Crab Bao, Crabmeat Beancurd, Kecap Manis Chicken, Beef Cubes with Goose Liver Sauce, Cookie Bomb
data.ABOUT:
Think there's nothing more to baos than those run-of-the-mill coffee shop snacks? Pay a visit to Bao Makers, try some of their innovative creations, and let your eyes and taste buds be opened to the all the delicious possibilities the bao has to offer. With mouth-watering items incorporating everything from beloved local flavours to japanese-inspired fillings, you're sure to fall back in love with the humble bao.

Sink your teeth into the oh-so-sinful Salted Egg Chicken Bao and feel the crunchy exterior of the deep-fried bao give way to a soft, fluffy middle as the signature salted egg sauce and tender, juicy fried chicken flood your mouth with a myriad of heavenly tastes and textures. Just thinking about it is getting us hungry! If you're looking for something more subtle and gentle on the palate, try the Salmon Mentaiko Bao, featuring fried salmon, cod roe sauce, tobiko, and cheese. It's an umami bomb that will leave you craving more.
Baos aren't all they have to offer though. Be spoiled for choice with their extensive menu of salads and artisan rolls, as well as a plethora of Japanese rice bowls by day and heavier, meat-based dishes by night. Top all that off with speciality coffees, sakes, and red and white wines for one satisfying meal. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Bar Bar Black Sheep (Bukit Timah)
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Indian, Vegetarian Friendly, Southeast Asian, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Sheep Ale, SweetWater, Tandoori Platter, Kashmiri Naan, Briyani, Wok-Grilled Whole Squid, Pad Thai
data.ABOUT:
A modern take on the Singapore-style coffee shop bar, come to Bar Bar Black Sheep for a laidback experience. Located along Cherry Avenue, Bar Bar Black Sheep features a casual coffee shop setting offering a range of dishes across Thailand, North Indian and Western.

Relax and unwind at Bar Bar Black Sheep with the bar’s wide range of beer, ciders, wines, and cocktails. Try their exclusive beer, the Black Sheep Ale, as well as at Bar Bar Black Sheep only Sheep Shape Wines.

Prepared freshly and at a great value by various independent food operators, the extensive menu is best enjoyed with a wide variety of drinks on offer. Great with beers, the Tandoori Platter features large prawns, fish, chicken tikka and a kebab of your choice. Also great are their wide variety of naans, from Butter and Cheese Naan, to Sesame and Kashmiri Naan. From the Thai Kitchen, Wok-Grilled whole squid and Pad Thai is a must try!

Bar Bar Black Sheep also serves up alcoholic pints such as SweetWater Brewery Seasonal Tap, Brewdog Punk IPA and Asahi Super Dry Black as the perfect beverage to pair your meals with. 

Staying true to the local coffee shop culture, here’s one place you don’t have to pay GST and service charge. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Bar Bar Black Sheep (Robertson Quay)
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Indian, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Burgers, BBQ
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Chicken, Tandoori Platter, Pad Thai, Wok-Grilled Whole Squid, Roast Beef Bruschetta, Singapore Wings, Brewdog Punk IPA, Crossroads Summer Ale, Black Sheep Golden Ale
data.ABOUT:
A modern take on the Singapore-style coffee shop bar, come to Bar Bar Black Sheep for a laidback experience. Relax and unwind at Bar Bar Black Sheep with the bar’s wide range of beer, ciders, wines, and cocktails as you wine and dine with your choice of Thai, European or North Indian cuisine. Located at Robertson Quay, Bar Bar Black Sheep brings to diners a comprehensive by the river dining session filled with a variety of alcoholic beverages to quench your thirst!

Prepared freshly and at a great value by various independent food operators, the extensive menu is best enjoyed with a wide variety of drinks on offer. Great with beers, the Tandoori Platter features large prawns, fish, chicken tikka and a kebab of your choice.

Popular choices include exclusive Black Sheep Ale and Sheep Shape Wine. Gaining popularity is the locally brewed Crossroads Brewery Singapore Summer Ales, that has a distinctively bittersweet aftertaste. Available anytime of the day, the Frizzante 1754 by the glass is a well-balanced and bubbly Prosecco perfect for pairing meals with. 

Besides serving unique craft taps, Bar Bar Black Sheep also serves up alcoholic pints such as 1644 Blanc, Carlsberg Danish Pilsner, and Asahi Super Dry Black as the perfect beverage to pair your meals with. 

Aside from dining in, the craft taps beer are also available for takeaway.

Staying true to the local coffee shop culture, here’s one place you don’t have to pay GST and service charge. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Bar Bar Q
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala Grilled Fish, Korean Fried Chicken Set, Salad Black Fungus W/ Cucumber, Skewers
data.ABOUT:
Bar Bar Q is a music haven that presents a unique dining experience. Come on down to Suntec City to indulge in a delicious array of BBQ skewers and alcoholic beverages! 

Spice up your nights with the restaurant’s sizzling Szechuan spices to delight your taste buds. Grilled and poached over a precise fire in a rich broth alongside other ingredients such as chilli and assorted vegetables, the Mala Grilled Fish only makes an appearance on the weekends and is a well-loved favourite. Pair the restaurant’s happy hour skewers with their enticing beer promotions for an all around great time! Healthier options are also aplenty here with a crowd favourite being the Salad Black Fungus W/ Cucumber. A nutritious mix of black fungus and diced cucumbers, this cold dish is peppered with bits of chilli for that extra kick. 

Deep-fried to crispy perfection upon order, the Korean Fried Chicken Set features two best-selling Korean flavours - Korean soy sauce with garlic and sweet & spicy gochujang. The perfect accompaniment to a glass of ice-cold beer, this tasty duo is a musty try. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Bar Canary
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Coco Chanel, Endless Summer, Passionfruit Mint Boozy Pop, Coconut Lemongrass Boozy Pop
data.ABOUT:
A well-kept secret among the well-heeled bar mavens of the city, Bar Canary offers breezy boozing and exceptional offers on drinks and boozy pops that are a rare find in its Orchard neighbourhood.
Take the lift at Grand Park Orchard up a few floors to Bar Canary and you can nearly imagine yourself as the petite bird it's named after. Rather than soaring high above the sparkling city, with knee shaking views of the ground below, you perch happily on the fourth floor for a similarly sunny outlook without the extra fuss that comes with extra altitude. Here the vibe is laid back, as you literally lean upon low slung, canary yellow deck seating. The efficient bar is backed by a glowing BC sign, and serves up suitably strong champagne, cocktails, and boozy pops that any boozehound would approve of. The air is often filled with DJ spun beats, working with warm yellow lighting dripping from wires to set the mood for a fun, fierce, and relaxed evening out. (Aug 2015)

data.title: Bar Rouge
data.Good For: City Views, Drinks, Private Functions
data.ABOUT:
Bar Rouge takes crowning residence at the pinnacle of the city’s tallest hotel on the 71st floor of Swissôtel The Stamford. Enjoy cocktails and bar bites with unparalleled cityscape panoramas featuring iconic local landmarks including the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay and watch the sunset turn into a mesmerising star-studded skies.


Bar Rouge Singapore has carved a name for itself in the city’s dynamic nightlife scene since its arrival, combining high-altitude views with great value drinks and high-octane entertainment – from dusk till dawn. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Bar Stories & Habibi-san
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Iberico Pork Jowl, Burrata Di Puglia, Truffle Brie, Berries & Cream
data.ABOUT:
One roof, two delicacies — Bar Stories and Habibi-san unite the best of both worlds in one single location. Pairing Japanese-inspired Middle Eastern fare from Habibi-san together with Bar Stories’ customisable cocktails, the restaurant is the perfect place for after-work socials with friends or colleagues. 

Live a little and try something different when you create your dream cocktail here at Bar Stories. With an emphasis on fresh ingredients, artisanal spirits and proper techniques, the bar is known for its no menu approach when crafting cocktails, giving customers the opportunity to explore the endless combinations of different liquors. 

Drawing on influences from Japanese cuisine and culture, Habibi-san boasts Middle Eastern flavours in its convivial and free form menu that encourages sharing among diners. Can’t decide what to eat? Habibi-san’s Feeeeed Me menu has got you covered. Featuring a great cross-section of what they offer, this specially crafted menu has got just the perfect mix of dishes for you! Selected by the chefs, sit back and indulge in an intimate dining experience curated solely for you. Signature favourites include Iberico Pork Jowl, Burrata Di Puglia, Truffle Brie and more. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Bar-Roque Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Seafood Platter, Char-Grilled Octopus served with Arugula, Tomato Confit, Almonds, and Romesco Coulis, Free Range Chicken, "Mom's Recipe" Apple Pie
data.ABOUT:
Bar-Roque Grill at the Amara Hotel is the actualisation of a dream many years in the making. Chef Stephane Istel was determined to open his own restaurant by the time he was thirty-five years old, and the food on offer at the modern rotisserie and bar provides an intimate insight into the experiences that have made the man.
The heart of the menu, of course, is made up of the meats from the rotisserie. Both the French Free Range Chicken and Australian Pork knuckle have won rave reviews, and we could definitely understand why. But don't fixate on just those items though, because while the rotisserie may be the heart, Chef Stephane's deft touch and heartfelt recipes are the soul of what's on offer. Whether it be the tarte flambee, signature to his home town of Alsace, or his mother's apple pie recipe, there's a delicate balance of tradition and modernity in the food and the decor that makes the entire experience undeniably unique.
And when you finally look up from your empty plate, sated and satisfied, contemplate the open kitchen and the stoic, rustic materials of stone, wood, and cement. There's a soft harmony to the design that maintains an elegant poise, a perfect mirror to the generous food served by Chef Stephane paired with the impeccable service directed by manager Kori Millar. It's a restaurant born of dreams, love, and togetherness, and their motto, "Love on the Plate" couldn't be any more apt. (Jul 2013)

data.title: Bar-beque
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Malaysian, Seafood, Local, Peranakan, Zi Char, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sambal Kang Kong, Sambal Stingray, Sambal Lala, Oyster Omelette
data.ABOUT:
Bar-beque is a prison-themed bar concept and zi char restaurant that located along Prinsep Street.

Bar-beque offer diners an unique experience of being captured and captivated with the set up of prison cells. They have furnitures which are the exact replica of a prison cell. Hence, even the cocktails are literally served through a pigeon hole similar to how an old prison would do so.

Whether if you are looking for a place to chill or a place for a hearty meal, Bar-beque is the go to place! (Jan 2020)

data.title: Barossa Bar & Grill (VivoCity)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Carnivore Platter, Char Grilled Rib Eye, Beef Ragout Pasta, Wild Mushroom Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Famed for their beef, burger and beers, Barossa is the perfect Australian-inspired restaurant and bar for meat lovers to satisfy their carnivorous cravings! Unpretentious, laid-back and rustic, the inviting ambience of the restaurant makes it a great place to chill out after a hard day’s work and tuck into hearty Australian fare.

Made only with the freshest ingredients and premium grades of Australian beef, the restaurant menu features a wide selection of dishes alongside an extensive range of fine wines and champagnes. Relish in Warrnambool striploin, deep-fried pork knuckle, lamb short loin chops, and stuffed mozzarella cheese pearl with The Carnivore Platter. A colourful plate of meaty goodness, fried bites and salad, this huge platter is sure to fill you up. Other signature dishes include the Beer Battered Fish and Chips, BBQ Berry Ribs, Char Grilled Rib Eye, Beef Ragout Pasta and more. 

Apart from a fine selection of meaty delights, vegetarian options are also available at Barossa. The Barrosa Salad and Wild Mushroom Pizza are crowd favourites and must-orders whenever you pop by the restaurant. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Bar·Celona
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fresh Oysters, Jamon Platter, Nachos with Beef and Cheese, Truffle Fries, Baked Figs with Blue Cheese, Chili Crab Dip, Steak Ribeye and Veggies, Cavajito, My Passion Cocktail
data.ABOUT: Located at 21 Duxton Hill, Bar·Celona is a Cava (Spanish wine) haven (the first of its kind in Singapore) serving up a dynamic range of specialty Cavas. From Rosato and Selecte to Brut Nature and Brut Nature Reserve, all the Cavas Bar·Celona doles out  are sourced from Can Paixano, Barcelona and are guaranteed to be the most authentic! Paired with their delightful gourmet tapas like their Chili Crab Dip or their signature Jamon Platter, and you’ve got an outta-this-world meal fit for a king! (Dec 2015)

data.title: Basil & Thyme
data.Cuisine: Thai, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Burgers, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Satay Gai, Tod Mun Goong, Kaeng Daeng, Pad Thai, Khao Niao Mamuang
data.ABOUT:
With a beautiful view of the beach, and a bustling atmosphere, it’s easy to sit back and relax in Basil & Thyme. The food here leans towards the fiery side of Thai cuisine, so come prepared to take the heat. Start your meal with some appetisers to share, such as Satay Gai (chicken with peanut sauce) skewers, or some Tod Mun Goong -- fried prawn patties with a side of sweet and sour plum sauce for dipping. 

Love curries? The ones at Basil & Thyme don’t shy away from the heat. Tuck into Kaeng Daeng, a creamy and spicy combination packed with your choice of chicken, beef, or seafood. For milder versions, try the Kaeng Khiew Hwan Gai, a lighter green curry that is more gentle on your tastebuds. Be sure to also order a side of roti (flat bread) to sop up all the spicy, creamy gravy. 

The classic Pad Thai ranks high on the must-try list. Here, the stir-fried noodle dish is redolent with a smoky char, tossed with a generous helping of plump prawns, fresh seafood, or chicken. An interesting rice dish to try is the Khao Tom Pla, a watery congee made from soft-boiled rice with slices of tender fish. 

Be sure to save some space for dessert as well. The crowd-favourite Khao Niao Mamuang is one of the best versions of mango sticky rice in town, drizzled with a fragrant and rich house-made coconut cream. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Basilico
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Costolette D'Agnello alla Griglia con Olive Taggiasche, Pomodori Arrosto, Basilico e Crostone di Melanzane, Lasagnette con Ragu' di Manzo, Basilico e Crema al Parmigiano, Beef Carpaccio
data.ABOUT:
Basilico entices with an emphasis on fresh, seasonal and authentic Italian cuisine. Enjoy a la carte options featuring a dazzling array of signature dishes and sumptuous spreads of antipasti, mains and desserts.
Enlivening the dining experience is the theatre of activity surrounding a rotisserie, espresso bar and walk-in wine cellar, and an al fresco dining area on the terrace overlooking the pool. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Basque Kitchen by Aitor
data.Hours: Tue-Sat: 12-2:30pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6:30-11pm (Last Order: 8:15pm)Closed Sunday and Monday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address:
3 Fullerton Road
#02-01/02/03 
The Fullerton Waterboat House
Singapore (049215)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chorizo Brioche Bun, Chocolate, Vegetable Bomba Rice, Golden Snapper
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Basque Kitchen reopens at iconic Fullerton Waterboat House 

New home opens a fresh chapter for the Michelin one-star restaurant by Chef-Patron Aitor Jeronimo Orive 

April 2021, Singapore - Where ships entering the harbour of Singapore came for fresh water, now gastronomes flock to for a fresh new dining experience. Introducing Basque Kitchen — back after a brief hiatus — in its new home at the historic Fullerton Waterboat House.  

The second home marks the beginning of a new chapter for Basque Kitchen. Established in October 2018 as Singapore’s first Basque-centric restaurant celebrating the country’s indigenous culture and produce, Basque Kitchen was awarded its first Michelin Star in the 2019 edition of Michelin Guide Singapore.  

In the new location, Chef-Patron Aitor Jeronimo Orive — alumni of the Michelin-starred kitchens of The Fat Duck in London, Mugaritz in San Sebastián and Neura in Bilbao — and his team continue to stay true to the produce-driven culinary philosophy that their customers love, executed with even greater finesse while remaining approachable. The Basque gastronomic experience is also more immersive, with a pintxos bar and lounge welcoming diners to unwind over a flute of cuvee champagne created especially for the restaurant, and to tease the tastebuds with the diverse range of light bites. In the semi-open kitchen, a duo of handsome Josper grills, custom-designed for the restaurant, anchor the space, offering diners a glimpse of the deliciousness to come. Within the 38-seat main dining hall of the new Basque Kitchen, a private dining room that seats eight makes a perfect venue for small, discreet gatherings.  

Basque Kitchen will also host the exclusive members-only space for American Express Centurion and Platinum Card Members, called Platinum at Basque Kitchen. Comprising 18 seats at the dining hall and 18 seats at the pintxos bar, the dedicated space boasts the finest views of the Fullerton waterfront. Centurion and Platinum Card Members will also enjoy priority reservations, and a suite of complimentary experiences including valet service and welcome drinks.

An Immersive Experience 

Premier design agency Grey Matters, the same behind the likes of Cloudstreet, Tippling Club, and W Maldives, draws on the elements of Earth, Water, Fire, Air — also considered the four cornerstones of Basque cooking — to create a space that marries rusticism with modern sophistication. Think the juxtaposition of charcoal stained oak floorboards against plush velvet banquettes; the cool of gleaming embossed metal detailing balanced by the buttery softness of cream-hued leather; rippled glass creating a dance of light as water does; contoured lines all around, reminiscent of the coast of the Basque country, facing the Bay of Biscay. Dressed in a harmonious palette of charcoal greys, warm orange and oaky tones and given accents of gold and copper, it’s a space that is as invitingly comfortable as an old friend’s home as it is elegantly refined and fitting of special occasions.  

The pinxtos bar and lounge that seats 33 persons sets the tone for enjoyment. From the a la carte menu comes exquisite offerings such as artisanal Sanfilippo anchovies — perfected over 125 years by five generations of a Cantabrian family and exclusively available in Singapore at Basque Kitchen — served simply with tomatoes atop crisp curasao flatbread; a classic dish of goose barnacle slivers served with tender nuggets of sous vide abalone, piparras olives, piquillo peppers; and a moreish wagyu burger with amera tomato, pickled cucumber, caramelised onions and epoisses cheese. Apart from the authentic light bites served on bar plates made by Catalan tableware design studio Luesma & Vega, patrons can also indulge in oysters served four ways, or caviar by the tin before moving on to the main meal.  

In the dining room, a tasting menu is offered exclusively for lunch and dinner (from $158++ for lunch to $248++ for dinner). Crafted using painstakingly sourced Basque produce, complimented by premium seasonal ingredients from Japan — such as deep sea fish, uni and scallops, the menus also showcase house-aged beef. In the aging fridge — two to three times bigger than before — prime cuts such as Australian and Japanese wagyu are meticulously dry-aged for a minimum of 45 days. Following the style in the Basque country, the team also sources for beef from mature livestock about eight years of age — that which presents intensely deep and complex flavours and textures. 

Charcoal-grilled items anchor the tasting menus: such as Charcoal grilled blackspot bream and razor clam dressed in a typically Basque Donostiarra sauce made from the classic San Sebastián style pil pil; and a charcoal grilled old beef loin, its rich flavours amplified by a smoked garlic mousseline and a drizzle of truffle jus. Accompanying these are inspired items such as a jelly of tomato essence served with a tomato sorbet and Japanese fruit and micro tomatoes, and a sea anemone served with bomba rice and sea succulents, finished with a fragrant chive aioli — further demonstrating the breadth and depth of Chef Aitor’s evolved and elevated repertoire.  

Complementing the food is an expanded beverage list personally selected by General Manager Vincent Jaureguiberry. The industry veteran who has passed through the doors of Pierre Gagnaire in France and Saint Pierre Restaurant in Singapore looks beyond prized vintages and awards to find the true merit in good wines. He sees wines as expressions of the people behind each bottle, and takes the effort to meet the winemakers. As such, Basque Kitchen’s list of over 600 wines is a unique collection comprising of fine and rare wines from both prestigious houses and small producers. Each bottle also represents a moment in Vincent’s wine journey — and that of the restaurant’s wine service team.  

Some highlights from the collection include a vintage juice made from an apple variety native to the Basque country, commissioned by the restaurant, a terroir-driven French Basque natural cider from Domaine Bordatto, exclusive to Basque Kitchen; and an exclusive vintage collection from Basque winery Artadi. Of note is also the Jean Louis Vergnon Champagne “Conversation”, a blanc de blanc produced especially for Basque Kitchen in the renowned Cote des Blanc, homeland of the oldest and most mineral Chardonnay. Patrons can also look forward to weekly vineyard highlights, with wines offered by the glass, to be introduced at a later stage.  

On the list is also an extensive range of sherries, from crisp Finos to nectar-like Pedro Ximenez. Connoisseurs will take delight in exquisite drops such as those from celebrated Andalusian sherry maker Bodegas Pérez Barquero. The Solera Fundacional 1905 and Solera Cincuentenario 1955 from the 116 year-old bodega are considered guardians of a classical, extraordinary style, and at Basque Kitchen sherry enthusiasts will have the opportunity to sample the Amontillado 1955 and Oloroso 1955 from the Solera Cincuentenario series of the house, amongst other noble selections. 

“Basque Kitchen by Aitor is a celebration of Basque heritage, but it is also a celebration of the hearts and minds of our team,” shares Chef Aitor. “Every dish is a loving tribute to my own grandmothers; and every bottle marks a personal moment in the wine journey of our sommeliers. We hope not just to intrigue you with an immersive gastronomic experience, but also touch your heart with every drop and morsel presented.” (Apr 2021)

data.title: Bayswater Kitchen
data.Hours: Tue-Thu: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10.30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat & PH Eve: 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sun & PH: 11am-3:30pm (Last Order: 3pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Closed Monday
