data.Address:
2 Keppel Bay Vista
Marina At Keppel BaySingapore (098382)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jumbo Crab Cakes, Lobster Bisque, Chef’s Seafood Platter, Braised Ox Cheek, Linguine Vongole, Margaret River Angus Grain-Fed Tenderloin
data.ABOUT:
Bayswater Kitchen offers informal, happy seafront dining with an approachable seafood-centric menu.
 
Located right by the waterfront at the scenic Marina at Keppel Bay, Bayswater Kitchen is a celebration of all things related to the sea, from the bountiful fresh produce to the laidback and relaxed atmosphere that being by the seaside inspires.

Featuring an extensive a la carte menu and bi-weekly set lunches that celebrates seasonality and freshness, Bayswater Kitchen introduces you to the simple pleasures of seafood cooked honestly yet creatively to enhance their inherent flavours and textures. Bayswater Kitchen is all about the joy of social interactions, so meat lovers and vegetarians will not be left out as the menu will also feature grills, pasta and vegetarian options that are perfect for sharing. Highlights from the menu include Tuna Tartare; chargrilled Octopus; Seared Beef Tataki; Butcher’s Platter; Grass-Fed Hanging Tender; as well as a Fisherman’s Feast with seasonal seafood served with handmade Linguine. 

Enjoy Bayswater Kitchen’s Sunday Brunch By The Bay where diners can choose from a sumptuous a la carte brunch buffet ($68/pax), including Mussels & Clams In A Pot, Fisherman’s Feast, Grilled Bacon Cheese Burger, Chef’s Seafood Platter, with options to add in a free-flow drinks package of Prosecco or Champagne. Small-eaters fret not, because a la carte options as well as a dedicated vegetarian/vegan menu are also available. If you fancy, you can even stay on for more seafood as Bayswater Kitchen opens for Sunday dinner as well.

If you just want to grab a quick nibble, Bayswater Bar also serves up small bites in the evenings daily which can be washed down with cocktails, beers, wines and other fun tipples. This alfresco bar is ideal for star-gazing and breezy social catch-ups. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Beach Road Kitchen (JW Marriott Singapore South Beach)
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Indonesian, Italian, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fresh Seafood, Freshly Grilled Premium Meat, Roast Beef, Italian Antipasti, Signature Chicken Rice, Laksa, Funghi & Formaggio Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Beach Road Kitchen, a member of Marriott Bonvoy unique Chefs-on-show weekend dining concept elevates every diner experience with a feast for the senses highlighted by Chefs' specialty passaround and roving live station that teases palate. Don't miss out top picks from the menu including Seafood on Ice, Chilli Crab with homemade mantou, Lobster Laksa, Baked Charcoal Salt Crusted Fish and a dessert take on Nasi Lemak packed with a punch of flavours.

On weekdays, relish in the joy of sharing over bold and homemade a-la-carte dishes!  Bond over sharing plates of  Charcuterie & Salads and be spoilt for choice with local and international mains including Singapura Delights, homemade Pasta & Crisp Crust Pizza, as well as signature Chophouse Selections featuring the Charcoal Grilled Tomahawk! Share the best of everything with the Get Social set perfect for groups from 2 to 8! (Feb 2021)

data.title: Bearded Bella
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spiced Scramble, Fowl Play, Donut Sliders, Smashed Avocado, Iced White Coffee
data.ABOUT:
Be prepared to be won over by Bearded Bella, a cute little cafe located on Craig Road that is as charming and quirky as its name suggests. At this lavender-hued shophouse, this eatery serves up Melbourne-style coffees, pristine-looking cakes, and hearty cafe bites.

Don’t be surprised to spot a fair number of coffee aficionados at this joint. Under the helm of Bearded Bella’s, a former Singapore National Barista Championship winner, baristas are taught how to craft each cup of joe with great precision and care. Then pair your coffee with a Spiced Scramble. A clever take on scrambled eggs, this cafe gussies this dish up with turmeric and truffle, alongside the medley of mushrooms, kale, and dehydrated tomatoes. And there isn’t any foul play to be had with the cheekily-named Fowl Play, which combines crumbled chicken thigh, charred miso corn, roasted cauliflower, and sage into one delightful dish. Looking for something sweet? Then check out the sweet and citrusy Donut Sliders, composed of yuzu and chocolate ice cream, crushed Tim Tam’s, raspberry, and basil coulis.
 
A perfect blend of great bites, pleasing ambience, and Aussie-style coffees, Bearded Bella is making a name for itself with its unique flair and style. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Beast & Butterflies
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Fusion, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Patties, Salted Egg Yolk Popcorn Chicken, Salmon and Alaskan Crab Salad, Scallop Carpaccio, Crispy Pork Knuckle, Tamarind Beef Short Ribs, Lobster Porridge, Singapore Laksa, Yam Brulee, Durian Waffle
data.ABOUT:
Rooted in the belief that food and drinks bring people together, Beast & Butterflies — the hotel’s main dining hall — is a flamboyant social space where all manner of creature comforts are satiated. The restaurant serves up dishes that seamlessly meld influences from East and West, showcasing Modern Asian Cuisine that bring diners on a discovery of social, communal dining.

Social barflies can quench their thirst with artisanal cocktails prepared by in-house mixologists, as the 13-metre bar counter offers a meeting point for fellow travellers to swap stories on exciting adventures to be found just outside of the river. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Beats Bites & Cocktails
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Japanese, Fusion, International, Vegetarian Friendly, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bertha Ash Biscuits, Nambanzuke, Tontoro Pork Cheek, Ice Kacang
data.ABOUT:
Swing by for the ultimate night out with cocktails and fine wines paired with delicious bar bites grilled over bincho-tan at Beats Bites & Cocktail. A welcome addition to Bukit Pasoh, the bar features an open kitchen concept with a built-in chef’s table that allows diners to catch the visual performance of the chefs while waiting for delicious bites served straight from the kitchen. 

Mixing up classic cocktails with a twist, the beverage menu at Beats Bites and Cocktails showcases a modern take on spirit-forward cocktails. Throwback to the 80s with Purple Rain. Dedicated to the eclectic 80s music icon, this meticulously crafted drink is a heady mix of Widges Gin infused with hibiscus and butterfly pea. 


Looking for your favourite local flavours in a glass? Try the Ice Kacang. A visual spectacle of shaved ice, grilled pineapple spiced syrup and cranberry tea, this innovative combination definitely makes a worthy tribute to our beloved local dessert. Using high heat grilling, the amazing flavour is imparted to menu options such as the Bertha Ash Biscuits, Nambanzuke, Tontoro Pork Cheek and more. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Bedrock Bar & Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bedrock Smoked Tomato Soup, Tomahawk Steak,  Bedrock Pepper Steak, Whole Rack of Lamb, Double Cut Dry Aged Porterhouse, Waffle Ice Cream Sandwich
data.ABOUT:
Bedrock Bar & Grill is a modern grill and steakhouse with quality dining and service. Decorated with unfinished wood and rough granite elements, the entire space is warm and intimate. Diners sink into the plush, custom-made leather booths, ready for a delicious meal shared with friends and loved ones. As a fine testament to the quality service and memorable dining experiences provided to guests over the years, Bedrock Bar & Grill swept a series of awards in the 2020 edition of the prestigious Haute Grandeur Global Restaurant Awards, including ‘Best Steakhouse in Asia’, ‘Best Grill in Asia’, ‘Best Wine Selection in Singapore’, and ‘Best Restaurant Manager on a Global Level.
Distinguished chefs with a great respect for tradition and premium quality meats were heavily involved in the crafting of Bedrock Bar & Grill's award-winning menu. Wood-grilled, smoked hot, cold, with exotic spices, or just keeping things classic, the selection of meat cuts and seafood is sourced from farms in the USA, Japan, and Australia for superior quality and sustainability.
If the entire table is feeling adventurous, the Tomahawk Steak is one for the picture books! Coming in at around 1.4 to 2kg per serving, this grilled, 400-day grain-fed F1 long-bone wagyu ribeye beauty feeds at least 3 people comfortably. If you would prefer to have a steak to yourself, the Bedrock Pepper Steak, a 300g ribeye cap served with a mouthwatering black peppercorn sauce, is a surefire way to ensure a return visit. Charred to perfection on the outside, while remaining juicy on the inside, it's no wonder that this dish has gained a large following. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Bee Cheng Hiang Grillery
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Croissant Sandwich (Monster), Steamed Egg Custard, Sliced Pork, Chili Pork
data.PRESS RELEASE: Bee Cheng Hiang Singapore announced the opening of the latest evolution of its Bakkwa flagship store, the Bee Cheng Hiang Grillery, in Singapore at 1359 Serangoon Road. The concept flagship store is the fruition of a decade-long dream to elevate the Bakkwa experience to an unprecedented height. This unique Bakkwa experience also allows customers to engage with Bee Cheng Hiang’s passion through the Bakkwa wine pairing menu. (May 2019)

data.title: Bee's Knees
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 50 Cluny Park RoadLevel 1The GarageSingapore Botanic GardensSingapore (257488)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Morocan Salad, Truffle Tater Tots, Shrooms Pizza, Beef Cheek Bolognese, Pandan Pancakes
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Bee’s Knees draws inspiration from the highly social, evolved behavior of bees. Located on the ground level of The Garage, Bee’s Knees aims to pollinate the Singapore Botanic Gardens with warm hospitality and sincere service. Family-friendly café and bistro by day and casual hangout spot by night, Bee’s Knees is a fun and comfortable idyll to stop and relax in the Gardens.
The restaurant's seven round-topped entryways are elegantly screened with glass, creating a cheery interior of clean-lined functionality. Different materials and finishes on walls and floors efficiently demarcate areas, and graphic colors and botanical patterns enliven the space.
Bee’s Knees menu offerings range from eggs, croissants, salads, fruit bowls, pizzas, pasta, sandwiches, snacks, waffles, ice cream, pancakes, coffee and drinks with a wide variety of food and beverage options.
‘Bee social,’ ‘bee connected’ is the friendly promise here.

data.title: Beer Factory
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Indian, Fusion, Middle Eastern, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buffalo Wings, Mixed Peppers Vegetarian Quesadilla, Spicy Chicken Pizza, Finger Food Platter, Samosa Platter, Paneer Pakora, Papad Chat, Lamb Sheekh Kebab, Chicken Tikka
data.ABOUT:
With its atmospheric open-to-sky setting, and chilled-out, laid-back ambience, Beer Factory on Church Street is the perfect place to stop, relax and unwind after a hectic day at the office. Located in the heart of the Central Business District, Beer Factory is also great for quick, informal meetings with colleagues, clients or friends. 

Beer Factory offers a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, including many well-known beers, wines, and cocktails.  In particular, an extensive selection of Red Dot Brewhouse beers is available. The Monster Green Lager Beer, with its distinctive green colouring, is particularly refreshing. Clean and crisp with hints of malt, it is absolutely thirst-quenching on a hot, sunny afternoon. Delicious bar bites are also available. The spicy and flavourful Tandoori Chicken is an instant taste bud pleaser - huge, juicy, chunks of chicken are marinated in a spicy yoghurt sauce and grilled to perfection. The Deep Fried Chicken is another spectacular hit worth sampling. Accompanied by garden-fresh vegetables and a zesty dip, tender pieces of chicken are deep fried till golden-brown according to a special recipe. Don’t be surprised if you order second or third helpings of this dish! With its extensive beverage list, as well as mouthwatering bar bites, Beer Factory is a good choice for drinks and snacks with colleagues, clients and friends. (Feb 2017)

data.title: Beirut Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mixed Grill Kebab Platter, Mezze Platter, Kunefe, Hummus, Falafel
data.ABOUT:
Set on the historic Bussorah Street with a picturesque backdrop of the majestic Sultan Mosque, this award-winning boutique Arabic lounge serves up some of the finest Lebanese and Middle Eastern cuisine in the city. All key spices and herbs are imported from the finest shops in Lebanon, making it that little bit more authentic!
Entice your senses with their famed mouth-watering mezza infused with olive oil, spices and herbs. Other crowd favourites include the Mixed Grill Kebab Platter and the Sizzling Kefalotyri Cheese with Caramelized Onions. On weekends witness their bellydancer dance to the beat of Arabic music while you dine, indoors or alfresco!
They have recently won the coveted TripAdvisor Travellers Choice Award in 2020, Singapore's Top Restaurant (by Wine & Dine for the third year in a row) & are listed as one of TimeOut's Recommended restaurants for 2020. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Bella Pasta
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Linguine Frutti de Mare, Pappardelle Boscoiala, Cavatelli Con Prosciutto E Spinaci, Grigliata Gamberi E Calamari.
data.ABOUT:
An offshoot of the immensely popular Bella Pizza, its sister restaurant next door, Bella Pasta takes the pizza kitchen’s fine nose for good flavour, steady Italian-trained hands, and generous love for everything rich and creamy, and dishes out a heavy-hitting menu of delicious pasta plates.

If you’ve ever chowed down on the deluxe pizzas at Bella Pizza, you know you’re in for a treat. Here, there’s a full Italian menu including pastas and charcoal grilled meats, turned out by a highly-trained team of chefs drawn from top Italian restaurants all over the island. Dine alfresco to really soak up the Robertson Quay vibes, but also because pasta tastes better with a side of people watching - and you’ll be doing a lot of people watching, because one plate won’t be enough. Think chewy batons of Cavatelli pasta tossed with wilted spinach and salty Parma Ham or a bountiful Linguine Frutti de Mare, a garlicky toss-up of linguine and tender shrimp, clams, and squid. One of the highlights is a beautiful, generous portion of Pappardelle Boscoiala, ribbony strips of pasta in a rich, tomato-based mushroom sauce. Beyond pasta, fill up on their hefty charcoal grilled meats and seafood. A particularly attractive Grigliata Gamberi E Calamari sees smoky grilled squid and fleshy big prawn served with little other than a squeeze of lemon and their own juices with fresh arugula.

River breeze, hot pasta, and the capable hands of an Italian kitchen - Singapore rarely gets better than this. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Bella Pizza
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pizza Cipolla, Burrata Pizza, Napoletana Pizza, Salmone Pizza, Fettucine Salciccia Fe Tartufo, Pizza Porchetta, Fagotino Di Bufala
data.ABOUT: Along Robertson Quay, which overflows with one great foodie option after another, this winning pizzeria stands out for its excellent gourmet-inflected pizzas, made lovingly with Italian ingredients and exacting Italian taste. Grab a seat in the alfresco area and you could almost be on a Roman street, soaking up the sights, sounds, and, most importantly, smells. Here, the pizza is made fresh by hand in the Neapolitan style, meaning the crust has the perfect balance between chewiness and crispiness. That sweet spot is probably why the pizzas here are regularly touted amongst some of the best in town. Obviously it’s not just about the crust: imagine the sinful appeal of a pizza crowned by wobbly mounds of creamy Burrata cheese, or topped with an elegant fan of thinly sliced salmon on a bed of spinach. If all that’s too rich, reach for the bright flavours of anchovies, capers, and tomatoes in their Napoleon pizza, or the simple pleasures of Gorgonzola, browned onions, and Mozzarella in the Pizza Cipolla. There’s also pastas, like the especially indulgent Truffle-bomb, Fettuccine Salciccia Fe Tartufo, where noodles are tossed in a truffle cream, topped with freshly-shaved black truffle. It’s very hard to top the joy of pizza, but here it becomes an art. (Mar 2017)

data.title: Belo Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab Fries, Spam Fries, Hojicha Molten Waffle, Chicken Parmigiana
data.ABOUT:
Opened with the aim of giving locals a taste of the French patisseries of old, this spot serves up cakes, pastries, and delicious mains. Located on Upper Thomson Road, this is the perfect place for weekend hangouts with friends and casual brunches. Grab a chair, soak in the relaxing atmosphere, and treat yourself to some delicious grub. 

Dig into one of their signature waffles. The Hojicha Molten Waffle. Made with roasted matcha and topped with Kurogoma Ice Cream, this dish is both Insta-worthy and delicious. The earthy, smoky flavour of the matcha in the pancake adds depth to the sweetness of the ice cream, with each bite melting in the mouth. Diners who prefer something savoury will enjoy the Chicken Parmigiana. A classic pub grub dish jazzed up with jalapeno and mozzarella cheese, this is the perfect option to enjoy with a pint of beer. 

Lighter snacks are also available in the form of soups, and various fried items. The Spam Fries are a popular option, and it’s not hard to see why. Made with chunks of luncheon meat deep fried to crisp perfection, these “fries” are an excellent option for barflies to snack on. For something a little closer to home, opt for the Chilli Crab Fries. Crisp fries topped with chilli crab sauce and chunks of crab, this unique side will have you licking your fingers (and lips!) long after the last bite. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Beng Hiang Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fish Maw with Crabmeat Soup, Stewed Black Chicken Herbal Soup, Oyster Omelette, Kong Ba Bao, Hokkien Mee, Double Boiled Bird's Nest Soup
data.ABOUT:
Started in 1978, Beng Hiang Restaurant has since established itself as one of the best Hokkien restaurants in Singapore. The interior's simple, homely decor is a nod to the type of fare served here, with unpretentious and hearty Hokkien dishes done right.

The piping hot soups are sure to start your meal on the right note, with creations like Fish Maw with Crabmeat and Stewed Black Chicken Herbal Soup. Continue the feasting with a variety of meat, seafood, vegetables, and rice and noodle dishes. Don’t miss traditional Hokkien favourites such as Oyster Omelette, Kong Ba Bao (savoury braised brisket in a steamed bun), and Suckling Pig.

The Hokkien Mee is a must-try too, with springy noodles and fresh seafood coated in a generous portion of smoky and umami gravy. There are even premium selections such as Braised Whole Abalone and Drunken Lobster for that special occasion.

End your meal on a sweet note with the Peanut Soup with Dough Fritters or Cheng Teng. For a little extra indulgence, opt for the Double Boiled Bird's Nest Soup. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Beng Who Cooks
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab's Well, Bak Chor Rice, Son of a Fruit Seller, Happy Ending
data.ABOUT: Defying odds in a difficult year, 'Beng Who Cooks' shows us all that dreams can still come true. The 'Bengs' in question are Jason Chua and Hung Zhen Long, and in 2020, they moved their operations from their Hong Lim Hawker stall into a brand new restaurant on Neil Road. The new premise sports a sleek and industrial theme that allows it to transition from a bistro in the daytime to a fine dining experience at night.The revamped concept comes with two brand new menus. Their lunch menu featuring reasonably priced rice and salad bowls is a more casual concept to cater to the easygoing office and gym crowd. In contrast, their dinner degustation menu is done omakase style for fine dining aficionados.Chef Jason takes inspiration from his family in the form of dishes such as 'Son of a Fruit Seller' seeing how his parents sold fruits for a living, and 'Siew Ting's Cake' which is a dessert named after his mother. Visit often as the menu is often refreshed to keep things novel. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Beppu Menkan Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address:
3 Pickering Street# 01-32/33
China Square Central Nankin Row
Singapore (048660) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oniyama Jigoku Ramen, Hiyashi Ramen, Beppu Ramen, Tori Karaage
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located in China Square Central, Beppu Menkan Restaurant specialises in Ramen and Tori Karaage. The restaurant is well-known for their spicy ramen, where you can decide the spiciness level – from no chilli at all to a whopping 8 chillies if you dare.

Head down to Beppu Menkan Restaurant for an affordable, comforting bowl of delicious ramen at one of Singapore’s longest-standing ramen stalls. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Beurre
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Pithivier, Seared Scallop Risotto, Angus Beef Stuffed Foie Gras, Deep Sea Argentina Prawns
data.PRESS RELEASE: Situated along Bukit Pasoh Road, Beurre’s new attentively crafted menu celebrates the art of French culinary techniques through unique dishes that blend the modern European and Asian flavours. Helmed by Chef Darwin, Beurre is committed to create and serve innovative plates your taste buds won't let you forget. New highlights include Lobster Pithivier, Seared Scallop Risotto, Angus Beef Stuffed Foie Gras, Deep Sea Argentina Prawns, and more. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Bijan Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Indonesian, Malaysian, Seafood, Local, Southeast Asian, Peranakan, Halal Certified, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
511 Guillemard Road
#B1-02/09
Grandlink Square
Singapore (399849)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Popiah Goreng, Daging Bungkus Kukus, Traditional Kerabu Rice Bijan, Gulai Lemak Daging Salai Dengan Jantung Pisang, Fried Mee Mamak, Banana Fritters with Coconut Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
If you find yourself craving the vibrant flavours of Malay cuisine, head to Bijan Restaurant. This homely eatery serves up familiar, comforting flavours with plenty of homemade touches. 

The Popiah Goreng, for instance, is an appetiser not to be missed. The vegetable spring rolls are made in-house, and deep-fried until crispy. Perfect for dipping into a house-made spicy chilli sauce. Another popular appetiser is the Daging Bungkus Kukus. This rare treat features a fluffy pancake, filled with juicy ground meat marinated with herbs and bathed in a housemade gravy, 

If you’re craving a bowl of hot soup, be sure to try the restaurant’s signature Sup Ekor Sapi Bijian. This savoury soup is redolent with freshly ground spices, and chock-full of tender braised oxtail. For mains, Bijan serves a selection of Western and Malay classics, with the occasional fusion dish. The Spaghetti Rendang, for instance, is the perfect dish for diners who crave a little pasta, but still want to inhale the aroma and heartiness of beef rendang. 

From the wok, expect fluffy rice infused with Malay herbs over roaring flames. The smoke-kissed Traditional Kerabu Rice Bijan is packed with flavour, and served with crackers for garnish and strips of juicy beef. Also good from the Mains selection is the Gulai Lemak Daging Salai Dengan Jantung Pisang. Made the traditional way, this hearty stew features fresh banana flower cooked in a turmeric gravy, with slices of fork-tender chargrilled Australian sirloin. 

Be sure to save some space for dessert as well. The Banana Fritters with Coconut Ice Cream is a gourmand’s dream, where golden-brown sweet pillows of fruit are topped with a creamy coconut ice cream, and drizzled with a rich gula melaka. Order this one to share. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Bincho at Hua Bee
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yakitori Dishes (Chicken Parts), Stuffed Mentaiko Wings, Miyazaki Style Grilled Chicken Necks, Seasonal Vegetable Platter, Tsukune with Egg Yolk
data.ABOUT:
Bincho at Hua Bee, quite literally tucked away in a disguised heritage coffee shop near Tiong Bahru, is an attention-grabbing new spot by famed restaurateur Loh Lik Peng. Inspired by a yakitori-ya in Osaka, the all-in-one Japanese yakitori restaurant by Chef Asai Masashi is a true find for more than one reason! 

Head down the Moh Guan Terrace alley and around the back of the unassuming Hua Bee stand to find a metal door with small, wiry Bincho lettering. Then down the rabbit hole you go, transitioning briskly from the traditional neighbourhood feel to the likes of an underground bunker, complete with rough edges, shady lighting, and oxidized copper tones. Take a seat at the marble bar for a front row seat to all the grilling action, or the domed booths to get your drink on, like the restaurant's most notable fruit, herb and sake-centric cocktails from the resident barkeep. With both food and drink menus largely in-flux at the whim of the chef and cocktailier, it's best to go with the daily recommendations.

Food wise, get ready for a smoky experience of grilled goodness and smoky delights. With a menu inspired by the 24 micro-seasons in Japan, expect only the best produce of the season being featured on the menu. Available all year round, try the restaurant's famed protein - the tori (chicken), popular cuts like wings, breast and thighs masterfully executed over the bincho-tan charcoal. Or for a unique experience, chicken tail, cartilage, heart, gizzard, liver and cockscomb. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Bincho at Min Jiang
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yakitori Platter, Uni Shabu Shabu, Grilled Japanese Squid with Liver Sauce, Yasai Maki (Vegetable Rolls), Snow Crab Fried Rice
data.ABOUT:
Nestled behind a lush foliage of greenery, Bincho at Min Jiang brings delicious skewers of smoke-kissed meat to the Dempsey enclave. The restaurant is chic in frosted glass panels, a vaulted roof, and copper-hued accents, with Japanese folk songs as the soundtrack to your dinner. All meats and vegetables are grilled over the restaurant’s signature Bincho-tan, Japanese white charcoal. 

For the best experience, order the Yakitori Platter to share. Here, you’ll find every bit of chicken — from safer parts like thigh and wing, to the lesser-ordered neck and tail — grilled to charred perfection. This second Bincho outfit also has new menu items, such as the Uni Shabu Shabu. The light, creamy broth is infused with Japanese sea urchin, forming the base for an array of succulent seafood like prawns, oysters, and abalone. Get your daily dose of greens with the Yasai Maki (vegetable rolls), where wafer-thin slices of pork and beef are wrapped around yam, corn, and mushrooms, then grilled over an open flame. Wash it all down with cups of sake, or some rare Japanese whiskies. (May 2019)

data.title: Binomio
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Croquetas Binomio, Grilled Cuttlefish served with Sofrito, Slow-cooked Beef Short Ribs with Cauliflower Puree,  Squid Ink Paella, Traditional Spanish Roasted Suckling Pig
data.ABOUT:
A binomial is composed of two parts that form a single one. With that, Binomio Spanish Restaurante, is the combination of two vital concepts in the Spanish cuisine: Tapas and Restaurant Quality food inspired by the traditional Spanish taste is served. One can experience an elegant and warm service that is sure to leave unforgettable personal memories.

Head chef Gonzalo Landin has worked with the biggest names in the culinary world, in some of the world’s best restaurants since graduating from London’s Le Cordon Bleu. At Binomio, Chef Gonzalo takes classic Mediterranean dishes and adds the skills and techniques he’s learnt from the masters. Binomio’s focus on traditional Spanish cuisine allows Gonzalo to do what he cherishes most - putting his Spanish identity on a plate. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Birds of a Feather
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pig Ear Mosaic, Fortune Skewer in Sichuan Pepper Broth, Sweating Mussels, Hot & Sour Chazuke
data.PRESS RELEASE:
It’s easy to mistake Birds of a Feather for yet another pretty cafe. The space is filled with natural light from two air-well openings, and hand-crafted art pieces and copper pipes are a chic finish to the walls here. 

But the dishes here are far from the typical Eggs Benedict or pancake stack. Instead, the food is a delicious fusion of Western with Sichuan influences. Take the Yuxiang (fish fragrance). The sauce is traditionally made by frying doubanjiang, garlic and ginger with pickled chilli, served with meaty eggplants. At Birds of a Feather, the same dish comes with an extra layer of mozzarella cheese, and a generous sprinkle of mantou crumbs. 
If you’re a big fan of spicy food, items like the Fortune Skewers are a must-order. This crowd favourite has gotten a new twist, and now comes with a fiery Sichuan red oil. Birds of a Feather specially pick their spices from Chengdu’s spice market, and these are laboriously  fried with chillies to create this house-made oil. 

Not all Sichuan dishes are numbingly spicy, either. The Sichuan Oxtail Soup is a light, clear broth, akin to the familiar pig’s trotters soup. Chinese herbs and fresh leek infuse this comforting soup with plenty of flavour. 

Just looking for a relaxed night out, with drinks and some simple grub? The street food-inspired selection is the perfect bar snack. Definitely order the Charcoal Grilled Pork Bits. Inspired by barbecued pork belly skewers sold along the streets, Birds of a Feather does a luxe version with Duroc pork belly, crispy rice crackers, charred green chilli, and Japanese sweet potato. (July 2018)

data.title: Biseryu Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address:
14 Scotts Road
#02-59
Far East Plaza
Singapore (228213)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Lamb Don, Gyutan (Ox Tongue), Omurice, Aperol Spritzer
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Biseryu Japanese Restaurant is a new restaurant concept with over 12 popular and famous award-winning restaurants from different parts of Japan represented under one roof.


Taste the exotic Gyutan or Ox tongue from the famous Senri restaurant in Sendai or if lamb is your preferred red meat, then come try Shibaura Genghis Khan’s Grilled Lamb Don. For something out of the ordinary, savour the ever popular Omurice (omelette rice) set and try the fragrant pan-fried egg omelette over Japanese Niigata rice.

We will also be serving alcohol throughout the day but a must try is our signature Aperol Spritzer with Sparkling sake! There will also be a carefully selected range of sake for your enjoyment.

If you are looking for a cosy no fuss Japanese restaurant with good ambience and friendly servers with exceptional tasting food, look no further! Biseryu is also a great place to entertain your guests as well as having group gatherings. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Bistro G
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Assorted Bread Basket, Beef Wellington, Lobster Roll, Chocolate Choux Puff
data.ABOUT:
Bistro G is a bistro concept headed by chef Gwen Lim of Patisserie G and chef Christopher Grilo of Bakery Artisan Original. Together, they boast an impressive resume of experience in managing Michelin starred restaurants in Singapore and across the globe. 

Take your pick of an Assorted Bread Basket, the Cold Cut Platter, or a steaming bowl of the Soup of the Day to kickstart your meal. Filled with mini croissants, baguette, sourdough and onion sea salt rolls, the bread basket is a great starter perfect for sharing. With so many varieties of bread to choose from, there is something for everyone. 

A signature item on the menu, the Beef Wellington is made up of tenderloin, oxtail ragu, mushrooms encased in a puff pastry that rewards with a burst of exquisite flavours when bitten into. Another worthy contender you simply have to order is the Lobster Roll. Dressed with lemon mayonnaise dressing and infused with fresh herbs, the tender and juicy canadian lobster makes for mouthfuls of delight. 

Wrap up your meal with a decadent Chocolate Choux Puff for a sweet ending. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Bistro XY
data.Cuisine: Bar, Fusion, Seafood, Steakhouse, Local, Cafe, Pizza, BBQ, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salted Egg Spring Rolls, Truffle Fries, Big Tiger Prawn Aglio Olio, Ondeh Ondeh Cake
data.ABOUT:
Eat, drink, and be merry at Bistro XY. Housed in an art, design and smart boutique hotel in Singapore, the restaurant serves delectable fusion dishes. With a variety of great options, it’s a suitable choice for casual dining and after work drinks.

Start with the Salted Egg Spring Rolls. Dipped and fried in lightly salted egg batter, the spring rolls encase tasty fillings of vegetables and carrots. Accompany this crispy dish with a side of Truffle Fries for a great mix of sweet and savoury flavours. Move on to the Big Tiger Prawn Aglio Olio. Garnished with huge, juicy prawns, this pasta dish is a must-try. For those in groups, order the Mixed Grilled Meat Hot Platter or Mixed Grilled Seafood Platter for a filling meal. 

This well-loved dessert is beautifully plated and makes for a sweet ending to any dining experience. Alternatively, you can opt for the Mixed Fresh Fruits Platter to cleanse your palate. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Black Angus Steakhouse
data.Cuisine: American, Steakhouse, South American, Burgers, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Slow Roasted Prime Rib of Beef, New York Steak, Golden Spike, Sky-High Mud Pie
data.ABOUT:
Passionate about good tasting steaks, Black Angus Steakhouse opened its doors in Orchard Rendezvous Hotel to bring to diners tasty primary cuts of USDA Black Angus beef that are well marbled and of high quality. 

Aged for a minimum of 21 days, the restaurant’s exquisitely hand-cut steaks are grilled over an open flame for exceptional flavour and tender mouthfuls of delicious meat. Dig into the Slow Roasted Prime Rib of Beef for a taste of juicy and succulent meat, roasted to perfection with hints of that “under-the-stars” and “by-the-campfire” flavour. 

Hearty and robust, the New York Steak is the perfect balance of flavour and texture. Add on a side to fill you up — we recommend the Multi-Grain Bread. Served with delicious whipped butter, the sliced multigrain bread is an excellent side to compliment your meaty meal. 

Quench your thirst at Black Angus Steakhouse with the restaurant’s extensive drinks menu. Order a Hand Shaken Mojito or Golden Spike and sip on the cocktails as you wrap up your meal with a deliciously sweet Sky-High Mud Pie. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Black Marble
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 30 Days Dry Aged T-Bone, A4 Japanese Kagoshima Beef, Angus Tenderloin, New Zealand Sea Bream with Crispy Skin
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Led by one of the most respected veterans of Singapore’s F&B industry, Chef Otto Weibel, Black Marble brings the best of farm to table for its discerning diners. With over 16 years of culinary experience under his belt, Head Chef Jay Siaw has a special expertise in working the char grill. Look forward to an irresistible selection of meats from Australia, Japan, and USA, all char grilled to perfection. 
	
Black Marble believes in using the freshest ingredients harvested at their peak. All our sauces and jus are lovingly from scratch in our kitchens, so no detail is spared. No secret to those who appreciate the finer things in life, clink your glasses of sublime wines to go along with our hearty fare at great prices.

Join us at Black Marble – where food, people and passion come together for moments of magic. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Black Pearl Steakhouse
data.Cuisine: American, Modern European, French, Australian, Fusion, International, Seafood, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Burger with Fries, Olive and Mushroom Aglio Olio, Grilled Argentina Ribeye, Banana Mousse
data.ABOUT:
Big on flavours and huge on joy, Black Pearl Steakhouse offers the best Western cuisine featuring a tantalising collection of dishes that are made for gatherings of friends, colleagues and family. 

Located along Upper East Coast Road, the restaurant’s all-encompassing menu caters to every palate. From salads to steaks, there’s something for everyone here at Black Pearl Steakhouse. Aside from premium steak cuts, the restaurant's menu also boasts a selection of pasta, delectable French-inspired mains, as well as mouth-watering desserts. 


Incorporating modern elements into classic dishes, the restaurant’s signature Wagyu Beef Burger with Fries delights both the young and old. Tender and juicy slices of beef fill up fluffy buns and are served with a side of thinly sliced and well-seasoned fries. 

For those with a big appetite, opt for an add-on of Tiger Prawns or a Sunny Side Up to have a taste of all that Black Pearl Steakhouse has to offer. If you prefer dining with courses, go for the four-course meal dinner set. Comprising a starter, main, dessert and drinks, you can expect nothing but the best from the restaurant's signature dishes. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Blu Kouzina
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tzatziki, Bifteki Stin Sxara, Baklava
data.PRESS RELEASE: Blu Kouzina, a favourite destination for authentic Greek cuisine in Singapore for the past few years, is moving to a new location on Dempsey Hill. The new space brings together elements of Greek mythology and design along with Singapore's Chinese heritage and its colonial past. Stepping through the entrance, graced with two Mycaenian Lions, onto the black-and-white tiled floor and surrounded by the decorative Meander pattern, one isn't only transferred to Greece's rich ancient culture. The patterns also strike a familiar tone with designs seen in ancient China as well as Singapore's black-and-white houses. It's a marriage of culture that will make you feel at home as you settle for a culinary adventure a world away. The combination of past and present continues in the menu, where fresh and quality ingredients are used in dishes both traditional and creatively contemporary. (Apr 2016)

data.title: Blue Jasmine
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address:
10 Farrer Park Station Road
Level 5
Park Hotel Farrer Park
Singapore (217564)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Blue Mango Sticky Rice, Phad Kee Mao, Red Ruby, Southern Roasted Chicken, Tom Yum Goong
data.ABOUT:
Boasting interiors which draw inspiration from Asia’s rich tapestry of cultures, Blue Jasmine is a casual yet chic restaurant that serves up the best of Southern Thai and Esarn cuisine at Park Hotel Farrer Park. The restaurant’s rustic red bricks and crisp white tiles form a minimalist backdrop to the Blue Jasmine’s colourful Peranakan Kebaya digital print centerpiece, creating a stylish atmosphere in which diners can enjoy great Thai cuisine.
The menu features a wide selection of dishes, all inspired by the traditional flavours of Thailand, as well as its bustling street food culture. The Southern Roasted Chicken is a favourite - chicken is marinated in a cornucopia of aromatic Thai herbs and spices, before being roasted till all the flavours are absorbed. Sink your teeth into a piece of the Southern Roasted Chicken, and you’ll be amazed at how heaven can exist on a plate! As for desserts, the Blue Mango Sticky Rice is a modern twist on a Thai classic.  Of course, the stars of the show are ripe and juicy mangoes. Butterfly pea flowers are used to colour the accompanying glutinous rice a bright, vibrant blue. Paired together, the sweetness of the mangoes is perfectly counterbalanced by the sharpness of the blue sticky rice - a timeless combination! What are you waiting for? Awaken your senses with the delectable dishes available at Blue Jasmine!  (May 2017)

data.title: Blue Lotus Chinese Eating House
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Fried Salmon Skin, Crispy Fried Squid Tentacles, Blue Lotus Signature Chilli Pomelo Crab, Wok Fried Kagoshima Wagyu Beef Tenderloin, Poached Chinese Spinach, Crispy Fried Durian Ice Cream, Lemongrass Gelo
data.ABOUT:
A popular destination for chilli crab lovers, Blue Lotus Chinese Eating House in Quayside Isle, is the perfect escape from the urban jungle that is Singapore's city centre, and a well-loved departure from your usual chilli crab hotspots.
Garnering rave reviews for their skillfully prepared dishes, it's pretty clear that this joint is more than just a dining destination with a stunning view. The Blue Lotus Signature Chilli Pomelo Crab - what can be considered their claim to fame - has people flocking from far and wide just for a taste. Simmered with lemongrass and curry leaves, and with just enough chilli to give it a kick - it's one creation we can't get enough of. And don't even get us started on their Wok Fried Kagoshima Wagyu Beef Tenderloin served with peppercorn. Using half-cooked well-marbled beef which is then put into a heated stone bowl to finish cooking, get ready for a piping hot bowl of deliciousness.
To end the meal opt for one of their unique dessert choices. The Lemon Gelo served with a lime sorbet, one of our favourites, is a refreshing treat. With an invigorating citrus punch and a sweet jelly base, it's one dessert you'll be craving for days to come! (Mar 2020)

data.title: Blue Pier
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Southeast Asian, Steamboat, Zi Char, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address:
Block 1202 East Coast Parkway
#01-03
East Coast Seafood Centre
Singapore (449881)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala Small Lobster, Signature Serawak Black Pepper Crab, Spiced Salt Red Grouper Fish, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg, Beijing Crispy Duck
data.ABOUT:
Unsurprisingly, a bevy of seafood restaurants line up along East Coast Parkway but Blue Pier stands out for its super-fresh seafood and inventive dishes. Dine outdoors for maximum enjoyment - it cannot get any better than indulging in some live seafood and traditional Chinese barbecue dishes while enjoying the sweet coastal breeze. Prefer the indoors? The nautical-themed decor’s sure to get you in the mood for some delish seafood. 

Singapore’s world-renowned chilli crab is given due respect here with its thick, luscious gravy that’s not too sweet and not too spicy. Don’t forget to scoop up all that precious sauce with some fried mantous! Other uber fresh delights include the Signature Sarawak Black Pepper Crab, the Spiced Salt Red Grouper Fish Head, and the irresistible Mala Small Lobster. The Beijing Crispy Duck’s strictly not in the seafood department, but is executed well nonetheless, with a crisp, aromatic skin and some juicy, succulent meat that sure does not disappoint. 

Still not sure what to order? Maybe the restaurant’s resident robot, Lucy, can help. Programmed to serve food, she can even dance to some catchy tunes, making for some good techy entertainment that both kids and adults will find intriguing. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Bob's Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Drinks
data.Address:
1 The Knolls
Sentosa Island
Singapore (098297)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bob’s Old Fashioned, Hemingway Daiquiri, Navegante Rum
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Unwind with an aromatic Cuban grill-out at Bob's Bar and celebrate the end of a long work week with a distinctive experience.
Escape to a tropical paradise, leaving the bustle of the city behind and let the tantalising aromas of fresh and zesty herbs captivate your senses as you unwind in the warm glow of sunset at Bob's Bar's elegant alfresco terrace. Enjoy succulent grilled meats marinated in flavoursome spices and pair them with authentic Caribbean sauces and condiments. Then wash it down with handcrafted cocktails like our signature Bob's Fresh Pressed Mojito or the Sentosa Sling, which is our unique twist that pays respect to Singapore's famous sling. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Bodacious
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bodacious Eggs Benedict, Harissa Baked Eggs & Meatballs, Tofu Burger, Tenderloin Steak & Fries, Duck Confit, Shibuya Toast
data.ABOUT: The joy of good American food is a combination of big flavours, honest-to-god generous portions, and lots of smoky, off-the-grill goodness. That’s the deal here at Bodacious, and the name describes pretty much everything about this place, from its glitzy and contemporary diner vibe to its menu of meaty burgers, pastas, and steaks. Here, breakfast means sidling up to a hulking platter of meatballs served up with baked eggs seasoned with zingy harissa, or the restaurant’s signature Eggs Benedict, a plate overflowing with globes of hollandaise-topped poached eggs, smoked salmon, juicy grilled tomatoes, mushrooms, and English muffins. Later in the day, burgers, including a particularly delectable Tofu Burger, fly out of the kitchen, followed swiftly by nifty twists on classic Western plates like battered cod with sweet potato chips and a salted egg yolk dip, or a flower-clam studded spaghetti tossed in piquant laksa sauce. A juicy Tenderloin Steak & Fries, as well as a crisp-skinned Duck Confit, round up this menu of Western favourites, and if you’re audacious enough, you can finish it all off with a thick serving of Shibuya Toast loaded with salted butter and ice cream. Bodacious food, generous portions, and a food baby to nurse on the way home: don’t say we didn’t warn you! (Feb 2017)

data.title: Bollywood Spice
data.Cuisine: Bar, Indian, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Burgers
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Potato Chunks, Grilled Thai Chicken Burger, Pita and Hummus Platter, Bollywood Triplesome Sliders
data.ABOUT:
Situated among the hustle and bustle of the lively crowds in Boat Quay, Bollywood Spice is an exciting restaurant and bar that is perfect for business meetings, casual drinks, private meetings, and more. Grab your friend and head on over to Bollywood Spice for a quick drink after work with the bar’s extensive alcohol options.

Enjoy Asian, North Indian, and Middle Eastern cuisines as you bop your head along to Bollywood music beats. Indulge in a basket of Potato Chunks. Steamed and deep fried to perfection, this dish features Russet potato bits rubbed with paprika. Slapped between two fluffy brioche buns, the marinated chicken patty is cooked with Thai herbs and decorated with lettuce and tomato, then finished off with a tasty dressing of onion and spicy mayo to make up the signature Grilled Thai Chicken Burger. Made for sharing, the Pita and Hummus Platter is a classic Middle Eastern delicacy dished up with grilled chicken, wholemeal pita bread, tahini hummus and salad for a hearty meal. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Bones 'n Barrels (Sentosa)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
6 Sentosa Gateway
#01-05
Sentosa Boardwalk
Singapore (098072)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pasta All'Astice, Neapolitan Caprese Pizza, Butter Chicken Masala, Paneer Saagwala
data.ABOUT:
Modelled after Western casual dining, this family-friendly paradise in Sentosa is the perfect place for a pint after a long day in the sun. This relaxed spot offers an array of hearty European and Mexican classics, as well as unbelievable offers on their booze, which means that diners who enjoy their tipples will love this restaurant. 

Seafood lovers are sure to enjoy the Pasta All'Astice - a hearty lobster pasta dish made with noodles cooked in seafood stock and topped with tomato and sprinkled with parsley. The seafood stock gives the pasta noodles a flavourful facelift, and the tangy combination of tomatoes and parsley adds vibrance to the dish, giving it a appealing appearance. For something to share instead, opt for the Neapolitan Caprese Pizza - made with tomato and buffalo cheese for a unique flavour that will leave you wanting more. 

Prefer something a little more fiery? The contemporary Indian menu is sure to deliver. With everything from Butter Chicken Masala to Paneer Saagwala on offer, there’s something for everyone, regardless of dietary requirements.  While tucking in to the delicious dishes, be sure to check out the amazing alcohol on offer as well. The beer of choice is San Miguel, but there is also wine, vodka, and rum for seasoned connoisseurs. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Bornga (Suntec City)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address:
3 Temasek Boulevard
#01-641/642
Suntec City
Singapore (038983)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Woo Samgyup, Budae Jjigae, Haemul Pa Jeon, Jap Chae, Mansinchang Samygyeopsal in Spicy Sauce, Nokdu Samgyetang
data.ABOUT:
The brainchild of Chef Paik Jong Won, one of Korea’s most successful and renowned celebrity chefs, BORNGA has anchored itself as a popular household favourite! With an empire of more than 33 branches in Korea and three stellar outlets in Singapore -  a meal at this global Korean BBQ chain is sure to be a treat!

Focusing on delivering the most authentic Korean cuisine with a wide selection of quality dishes and generous portions at affordable prices, expect some spectacular eats. They’ve got all the BORNGA signatures like Haemul Pa Jeon and Woo Samgyup, a secret (and patented) recipe created by Chef Paik that takes thinly sliced beef and drenches each piece in their signature BORNGA dressing aka Woo Samgyup Sauce. Imported from Korea, trust us when we say you won’t find any other place in Singapore who can replicate the magic that comes out of BORNGA! (Dec 2015)

data.title: Boss Bistro & Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hearty Greens, Seafood Pot, Signature Roasted Pork Belly, Seafood Pomodoro
data.ABOUT:
Pamper your taste buds at Boss Bistro & Bar with good food and great drinks. Serving diners a wide range of Western bistro food at affordable prices, Boss Bistro & Bar has a huge menu of a variety of draught beers on offer to complete your night.

Start off with a bowl of Hearty Greens. Nutritious and delicious, this bowl features a healthy mix of grilled chicken ,greens, tomatoes, walnut and almond flakes topped off with a light balsamic dressing. A vegetarian version of this dish is also available on the comprehensive menu. Follow up with the bistro’s Signature Roasted Pork Belly. Served with mesclun salad and french mustard, this mouthwatering dish is a hearty serving of succulent roasted pork belly that will surely satisfy all your carnivorous cravings.

Seafood lovers can indulge in the delectable Seafood Pot or a platter of crispy Calamari Rings, served with home-made tartar sauce. Alternatively, the Seafood Pomodoro is a tantalising combination of prawns, squid, mussels, and clams drizzled in home-made pomodoro sauce before being speckled with Italian herbs and parmesan cheese for extra flavour. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Botan Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Pitan Tofu, Ikura Onsen, Assorted Sashimi, A5 Miyazaki Wagyu Beef
data.ABOUT: A traditional Japanese restaurant that specialises in sushi, sashimi and omakase, Botan Japanese Restaurant is helmed by well-known chef Thomas Kok. Executing every dish with creativity and passion, chef Thomas believes in using only premium ingredients for an authentic taste of Japan.Great for intimate dinners or casual dates, the Signature Set serves two with a variety of dishes that make up the appetisers and mains. Kickstart your meal with a bowl of Signature Pitan Tofu. An interesting take on tofu, the cold tofu was garnished with fish role, spring onion and bits of finely chopped century egg. Drenched in a fragrant mixture of sesame and century egg sauce, this dish is a delightful start to the omakase meal.Another tasty dish on the set is the Ikura Onsen. An egg-on-egg concept that is beautifully executed, the ikura complements the mellow onsen egg, leaving a mildly sweet aftertaste. The melt-in-your-mouth assorted sashimi is definitely the highlight of the set. Refresh your palate at the end of a heavy meal with a scoop of Hokkaido Ice Cream before leaving happy and satisfied. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Botanico at The Garage
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
50 Cluny Park RoadLevel 2
The Garage
Singapore Botanic GardensSingapore (257488) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: "Assam Laksa" Ceviche, Asparagus Tempura, "Assam Pedas" Snapper, Slipper Lobster Tagliatelle, Jalapeño Ice Cream.
data.ABOUT:
Nestled within the Botanic Gardens, Singapore’s only UNESCO Heritage site, Botanico has enchanted diners with its beautiful 1920s Art Deco conserved architecture with its lush indoor hall and air-cooled outdoor garden terrace bar, surrounded throughout by greenery.

With dishes served bistro-style, Botanico is rooted in contemporary European methodology and integrated with Asian inflexions with Singaporean Chef Sujatha Asokan bringing her distinctive voice and the stories she sees in the ingredients, some of which are grown in the Botanic Gardens, to the table.

Dishes that encapsulate Chef Sujatha Asokan’s ‘ideology’ of seamless East-West synergy include the Seabass Ceviche, a blend of the zingy citrus of cold ceviche with the spicy tanginess of assam laksa, cooled with savoury shrimp paste ice cream and scented with ginger flower. Botanico’s Iberico Char Siew is another dish that is not to be missed - the top loin is smoked, chargrilled and accompanied by carrot ‘noodles’, carrot puree and honey pork jus that not only goes well with the 30 premium wine labels (all rated 90 points and above by the Wine Spectator) that are available by Coravin, but also with their signature botany-inspired tipples such as the Garage Gin’onic or the Thyme Lemonade. 

At Botanico, the dishes and cocktails are crafted to tell stories of botanical adventure, evoking emotion and igniting the imagination and making the experience come alive through the palate and the mind. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Box n Sticks
data.Hours: Sun-Thu: 11:45am-2:45pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6-10pm Fri-Sat & Eve of PH: 11:45am-2:45pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6pm-12am (Last Order: 11:15pm) Closed PH
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bara Chirashi Don, Asari Aglio Olio, Salmon Mentaiko Don, Kushiyaki
data.ABOUT:
Straight from the backstreets of Tokyo, Box n Sticks is a hidden home-style Japanese izakaya which is located just a few streets away from well-known Haji Lane and offers value-for-money lunch sets by day and a relaxed izakaya by night.  

In the afternoon, it draws in the lunch crowd with its value-for-money lunch sets and small plates. The Bara Chirashi Don — an assortment of fresh sashimi chunks, tamago, and tobiko on sushi rice — is a crowd favourite. For something unique, go for the fusion Asari Aglio Olio that comes with a generous serving of clams. Even the Salmon Mentaiko Don gets a twist with the addition of crispy tempura crumbs. Each main course also comes with one or two complimentary sides and a drink so you definitely won't leave hungry. 

As the sun sets, the menu expands to include maki rolls, kushiyaki (grilled skewers), yaki mono (grilled meats), and more. The kushiyaki is a must-try. Choose from a wide array of meats and vegetables such as the Gyu Niku with Pineapple, Ebi Butter, Bacon Mochi, and Sweet Corn Teriyaki.
No trip to an izakaya is complete without tipples to pair with the food, and Box n Sticks certainly doesn't disappoint with its selection of draft beers and sakes. With the food and drinks nailed, all you need are your buddies for a great night out. 

Box n Sticks is highly recommended and heavily featured in media as one of the best Japanese dining place to visit for good value and quality food. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Braci
data.Good For: City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Location: Boat Quay, Raffles Place, Clarke Quay
data.ABOUT: Perched on the top two floors of a restored heritage shophouse by the Singapore River, Braci (pronounced ‘bra-chee) is the Michelin Star modern Italian restaurant and rooftop bar by renowned chef-restaurateur Beppe De Vito and Executive Chef Mirko Febbrile. An exclusive Italian hideaway in the heart of bustling Boat Quay overlooking the river, the modern-luxe open-kitchen restaurant and bar feature contemporary Italian cuisine and classic cocktails that are reinvented through modern techniques. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Brasserie Les Saveurs (The St. Regis Singapore)
data.Hours: Lunch | Mon – Sat: 12 – 2pmAfternoon Tea | Mon – Sat: 3 – 5pm, Sun: 3:30 – 5:30pmDinner | Daily: 6:30 – 10:30pmSunday Champagne Brunch | Sunday: 12 – 2:30pm
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
29 Tanglin Road
Lobby Level
The St. Regis Singapore
Singapore (247911)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Foie Gras Terrine, Salade de Crabe Royal, Thon Rouge a la Plancha, Bisque de Homard, Porc Iberic, Loup de Mer, Selle d’Agenau, Tarte au Chocolat, Fraisier
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by heritage and tradition, borne of luxury and refinement, Brasserie Les Saveurs at The St. Regis Singapore provides a refuge of timeless elegance and discerning taste, dedicated to the art of culinary excellence and classic epicurean experiences.

Delight in modern interpretations of classic French cuisine and enjoy a showcase of entrees which include Pâté en croûte, a pastry-enveloped terrine comprising pork and foie gras pate flavoured with pistachios, herbs and onion compote, served chilled to reveal its fullest flavours. For an alternate taste, the Escargots de Bourgogne is a choicest option, with its nutrient-rich snails poached in a court bouillon then baked in “beurre d’escargots”, allowing the buttery sauce to melt completely into the meat.  

Other epicurean moments features exceptional signatures such as Legine Australe of Patagonian Toothfish with Bell Pepper Piperade, Chorizo and Rocket Pesto, and a convivial platter of Cote de Boeuf, a wonderful 1kg of robustly flavoured beef prime rib paired with roasted potatoes, mixed vegetables, mushrooms and bearnaise sauce.

From gastronomic signature experiences, vibrant afternoon tea, to indulgent Sunday Champagne brunch, Brasserie Les Saveurs brings destination dining to a new level, with masterful, personalised service. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Bread, Beer & Brez'n
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: White Wine Garlic Roasted Half Chicken, Funghi Pizza, Vegan Burger, Schöfferhofe
data.ABOUT:
Finish your evenings with a delicious dinner and a bucket of ice cold beer when you drop by Bread, Beer & Brez'n. Available all day long, the down to earth sanctuary serves up a wide range of tasty German delicacies alongside an impressive collection of beer garden classics at wallet friendly prices. 

A full meal here comprises one main dish accompanied with two sides. Marinated with herbs and spices, the White Wine Garlic Roasted Half Chicken is a fragrant dish that packs a punch of flavours. Sink your teeth into the juicy meat to taste the tantalising explosion of a harmonious combination of spices and herbs. Recommended side dishes include the Roasted Vegetables and Potato Salad. 

For those dining in groups, the Funghi Pizza is a great go-to option that is drizzled with an extra dash of truffle oil. Vegetarians will be delighted to know that there are also vegan dishes here at Bread, Beer & Brez'n. Served with a huge portion of salted fries, the Vegan Burger is a mouthwatering dish that even non-vegetarians will love.  End your meal on a sweet note with the plethora of cake options on offer. (Feb 2021)

data.PRESS RELEASE: Founded in 1997, Brewerkz is recognised as Singapore's longest-running craft brewery experience. Conveniently located at the Singapore Indoor Stadium, Brewerkz welcomes diners from all walks of life to indulge in a true craft beer experience. At the restaurant, the team extends their expertise beyond the handcrafted award-winning beers and has created dishes with a modern Asian twist and fan favourite beef burgers, such as the Cowboy and Meat Lovers Pizza. (Sep 2019)

data.ABOUT: Brewerkz kick-started Singapore’s craft beer story in 1997. Bringing full-flavored fun to the local indie beverage scene, Brewerkz brews a constant flow of tasty experimental beers - a product of their love for exploration and a passion for the artisan craft. Our cuisine is contemporary Western and Asian-inspired with a touch of local flavors, prepared using local and sustainable produce where possible. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Brotzeit Katong
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Oven Roasted Pork Knuckle, Sausage Platter, Honey Bavarian Ribs, Wonder Platter
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Since its inception in 2006, Brotzeit has emerged as a culinary force to be reckoned with. Loved for spinning up authentic German meals and ice-cold beers, Brotzeit can often be seem packed with the food-loving, beer-guzzling crowd at all hours of the day.
 
There’s nothing more German than huge swirling hunks of sausage. So there’s little surprise to see Brotzeit featuring a wide array of such sausages, the showstopper being the Thuringer Pork Sausage, which comes with a generous heaping of mashed potatoes, sauerkraut, and sweet onion sauce. But the Sausage Platter, another fan fave, serves all the top hits from the kitchen, from grilled pork, spicy chicken, to the garlic pork sausages. 
 
Want something other than sausages? Then have your pick of hearty dishes that include the traditional Goulash Soup, so authentic any German grandmother would approve of it. Featuring generous chunks of tender beef in a herb-tinged soup, this soup is perfect on a rainy night. And the Crispy Oven Roasted Pork Knuckle is another must-try. A Brotzeit staple, this pork shank is oven-roasted until it achieves its fork-tender perfection with a crispy layer of crackling skin to boot. And wash your meal down with a beer or two, and you have all the ingredients for what is just about to be your next perfect meal. (Jan 2019)
