data.title: Brunetti
data.Cuisine: American, Italian, Seafood, Steakhouse, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Masala Omelette, Eggs on Toast, Home-made Muesli, Butternut Pumpkin Soup, Brunetti Club Sandwich, Spaghetti Carbonara, Grilled Herbed Salmon, Chocolate Cannoli, Pear & Crumble Cheesecake
data.ABOUT:
Originating from “the land down under”, Brunetti at Tanglin Mall is a bustling gelateria, cioccolateria, and pasticceria offering a little something for everyone. From cakes and pastries to breakfast and savouries, even the most finickiest of eaters will find something to indulge on at this popular Tanglin hotspot.
Not sure what to try first? Check out their breakfast offering of Home-made Muesli. Served from 9am and onwards, this healthy and flavourful treat with Greek yogurt, home-made preserve, fresh berries, and milk will have you feeling energized the entire day. Offering heartier options as well, the Brunetti team also dishes out some killer Eggs On Toast, Grilled Herbed Salmon, decadent cannolis, a mouthwatering Pear & Crumble Cheesecake, and tons more! (May 2016)

data.title: Buko Nero
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buko Nero Tau Kwa Tower with Sauteed Vegetables and Asian dressing, Artisanal Rigatoni Pasta with Sausages and Fennel Seeds Ragu, Creamy Porcini Mushroom Soup with White Truffle Oil Drops, Baked Fillet of Cod with Olives Crust in a Sweet Bell Pepper Coulis, Dark Chocolate Tart with Homemade Peanut Butter Gelato
data.ABOUT:
Mention to Singapore foodie friends that you have found a tiny down-to-earth place where, for the past 16 years, the owners themselves have put their own Asian twist on mind-blowingly amazing Italian food, and it’s likely that the name Buko Nero will pop up. One-of-a-kind in terms of its compact dynamism, Buko Nero prides itself on serving food that they themselves would want to eat, if they were the customer. The wife, Tracy, who is Singaporean, handles the front of the restaurant, while the husband, Oscar, an Italian, is the chef. Together, they have created something that is semi-legendary in the Singapore dining scene because of the quality of food and the waiting list for this restaurant. 

Top of the list of recommendations for this unique establishment is the Buko Nero Tau Kwa Tower with sauteed vegetables and Asian dressing, which was created as a stacked dish consisting of vegetables such as parsley, carrots, and enoki mushrooms layered atop a big piece of tau kwa (firm tofu). Kecap manis (Indonesian sweet soya sauce) is drizzled over it, giving the entire concoction an extra oomph. Deceptively simple, this dish has won fans because of its unique flavour combination and freshness of vegetables used. The Baked Fillet of Cod, which is presented with a crust made of olives and a sweet bell pepper coulis, has also won praise for its simple yet effective use of basic ingredients. For cosy Italian fare in the heart of Singapore, it is hard to find a more intimate, homely dining experience than this well-loved restaurant that serves food straight from the heart. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Buona Terra
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 12-3pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 9:15pm)Sat: 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 9:15pm)Closed Sunday & PH
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
Helmed by chef de cuisine, Denis Lucchi, Buona Terra on Scotts Road is a stunning example of immaculately interpreted classic Italian fare in the heart of the city. Sourcing only the freshest ingredients, diners can expect to be delighted by the gastronomic journey that is guaranteed to unfold
From the Seppia, a salad with cuttlefish prepared using the sous-vide method, to the mouth-watering Filetto di Manzo made from high-quality Cape Grim beef tenderloin - the artfully crafted dishes presented are creative expressions of Northern Italian cuisine at it’s finest. Even the simply dressed Rombo is worth raving about. Using fresh line caught wild Turbot, filling it with Sicilian Red Prawn, and topping it off with black rice crust - it’s got immense flavour without being overdone.
And as always, no Italian dining experience is complete without a plate of pasta so be sure to save room for their Tagliolini ai Pioppini. Made of homemade truffle tagliolini and baby oyster mushrooms - it’s one delectable dish you won’t want to miss out on! (May 2016)

data.title: Burlamacco Cafe & Pizzeria
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ravioli, Ananas Pizza, Margherita Pizza, Rib Eye Steak
data.ABOUT:
Tucked along Kung Chong Road is Burlamacco Cafe and Pizzeria, a cosy and friendly go-to cafe for delicious pizzas at affordable prices. 

More than just serving up great pizzas, Burlamacco Cafe and Pizzeria’s signature dishes include the impressive Vongole, as well as an age old italian favourite, Ravioli. Featuring juicy and fresh clams, white wine is infused into the dish to bring out the clams’ briny flavour. Another must-try for seafood lovers is the Aglio Olio, with succulent prawns drizzled in olive oil. Pair any of these sumptuous signature dishes with a bottle of wine for a fulfilling meal. 

One simply cannot leave without ordering a pizza. The Margherita and Ananas Pizzas come highly recommended. Made with tomato, bell peppers, zucchini, artichokes and mushrooms, the Vegetariana is a yummy vegan-friendly option.

If you’re still not full after a round of pizza, go for the Rib Eye Steak. Served with a generous side of mashed potatoes, asparagus and carrots, this dish is sure to fill you up! Baked to golden brown perfection, indulge in an assortment of pastries before you pick up the tab. (Jul 2020)

data.title: Burlamacco Ristorante (Stanley Street)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fritto Misto, Battuta, Involtino, Fegato, Linguine, Capellini, Pappardelle, Tonnarelli, Cacciucco, Manzo, Tagliata, Agnello, Tiramisù, Pannacotta, Tortino, Fondente
data.ABOUT:
Restaurant critics generally give new restaurants 3 to 4 months to "hit their stride". Well at Burlamacco Ristorante, there's none of that. Opened in November 2012, this new Italian favourite has been making waves from day one, and already has a legion of fans, an endless list of favourable reviews, and quite frankly, an entire menu of delectable Italian delights.
Chef Gabriele Piegaia is an old hand at the Singapore restaurant scene, honing his skills in Michelin-starred kitchens across Italy, then learning the nuances of the Singaporean palate at Senso, Hotel Michael, and most recently, as the executive chef of Alkaff Mansion. Adhering to the golden rule of "what you see on the menu is what you see on the plate", the signature dishes are authentic, direct, and robust. Ingredients are allowed to shine, and there has been no compromise on quality and execution. (Apr 2014)

data.title: Burlamacco Ristorante @ East Coast
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eggs Royale, Yoghurt, Tagliata, Pesce Burro
data.ABOUT:
An Italian restaurant nestled at the ground floor of 217 East Coast Road in Singapore, Burlamacco Ristorante presents an authentic dining experience with traditional Tuscan cuisine. Served with a delightfully modern twist, the wide variety of mouthwatering dishes and excellent wines are carefully crafted to give your palate a sure treat. 

From early morning to mid afternoon, stop by Burlamacco Ristorante to enjoy a plate of Eggs Royale. Sitting on a platter of smoked salmon, two perfectly poached eggs are accompanied with a pesto hollandaise sauce on a fluffy piece of sourdough. Pair this hearty platter with a Yoghurt for a filling meal. Served with freshly diced fruits, granola, fruit preserves and a spoonful of acacia honey, the artisan greek yoghurt is as delicious as it is nutritious. Main dishes here include the Tagliata and Pesce Burro. 

For those looking to satisfy their pasta cravings, a wide selection of different pastas awaits. Prepared with different traditional Italian cooking methods, each pasta will certainly bring you on a gastronomic journey for an authentic taste of Italy. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Butcher Boy
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: US Prime Beef Short Rib, Butcher Boy Bacon & Cheese Burger, Chilli Crab Buns, Black Angus Striploin, Welsh Lamb Rump
data.ABOUT:
A newly launched space rendered for the meat-lovers and the ones in search for highs and good vibes, Butcher Boy is an Asian-inspired bar & grill set along the Keong Saik dining enclave. The second and newest venture by Chef-OwnerAndrew Walsh of Cure, Butcher Boy’s key offerings, as its name suggest, are a sizzle of luscious meats alongside a selection of cocktails, buns, sharing plates, and oh-so-decadent sundaes. 
Taking its naming inspiration from Walsh’s all-time-favourite novel and movie, The Butcher Boy, the space is intended for guests to escape from the bustle of life and ease over a laid back atmosphere of great food, tipples and music. Against a raw and no-frills setting amped with a DJ booth, guests can slip into chill over Asian-inspired tipples including 'Smoking Carriage Cocktail', that are expertly blended by award-winning mixologist and Butcher Boy bar manager, Knut Randhem. 

Following through the Asian influence, Butcher Boy presents carnivorous grill options for guests to sink their teeth into, with freshly-fired meats including, the 'John Stones Irish Rib Eye with XO Sauce' amongst other cuts, that are all finished with dollops of accompanying sauces of various Asian flavours. Diners can also expect a range of small plates of tartare and baos (Asian buns) on the menu. 

Open for dinners (except Mondays) and lunch (Fridays and weekends only), the venue plays up its casual vibe with Sunday Roast & Lunch intended for guests to kick back over slow-roasted meat specials and indulgent sundaes to aptly round the week satiated. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Butcher's Block (Raffles Hotel)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 328 North Bridge Road#02-02 to #02-07Raffles ArcadeSingapore (188719)(Accessible via North Bridge Road entrance)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ibérico Sando, Charred Bone Marrow, Kusunoki Wagyi Beef A5, Tomahawk 1.5kg
data.PRESS RELEASE: Discover some of the world's finest cuts of meats personally sourced and procured by Chef Rémy Lefebvre from dedicated farms that show utmost care and respect for their livestock at Butcher's Block. These premium meats are cooked using the time-honoured craft of wood fire employing a variety of techniques, such as smoking, grilling and slow cooking in embers, to impart distinct flavours and aromas.With almost two decades of culinary experience at several highly-acclaimed independent restaurants and luxurious 5-star hotels, Chef Rémy Lefebvre heads the kitchen at Butcher's Block. His favourite method of cooking is using wood fire which showcases various techniques and uses different wood from trees such as cherry, oak and almond, and Japanese binchotan charcoal to deliver a delicious experience. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Butter & Spice
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.Address:
66 East Coast Road
#01-06
The Flow MallSingapore (428778)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Chicken, Fish Tikka, Prawn Chatpata, Kabuli Channa Masala, Kashmiri Naan, Kadai Paneer
data.ABOUT: Tucked away in The Flow mall along East Coast Road, Butter & Spice dishes out authentic North-Indian fare at wallet-friendly prices. From the glowing belly of the tandoori comes a delicious spiced grilled chicken, enjoyed in half or full portions if you’re hungry. Make sure to share the Fish Tikka, a sumptuous treat of charred fish cubes that have been marinated in tandoori spices for that hint of heat. Love seafood? The Prawn Chatpata is a popular favourite, with juicy prawns cooked with black pepper, onions, and green chilli, and a dash of lime juice for that refreshing citrusy kick. Sop up the rich gravy with a selection of tandoori-grilled naan, available in classic flavours like cheese, garlic, and butter. Try the Kashmiri Naan if you have an adventurous palate — the flatbread with dry fruits is a sweet savoury treat that goes well with the thick curries here. Butter & Spice is also one of the few Northern-Indian restaurants to serve set menus. Each set meal comes with a side of basmati rice and naan, perfect for the days when you’re looking for a quick fix. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Byblos Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hummus, Mezze Platter, Lamb Kofta, Chicken Kofta, Shish Taouk, Falafel Wrap, Lamb Chops
data.ABOUT: Busy Bussorah Street plays host to a bunch of Middle Eastern restaurants, and Byblos Grill is one of the true hidden gems amongst them. Helmed by Chef Mohamad Salim, who brings true craft and authenticity to his Lebanese cuisine, made with imported Lebanese ingredients and spices, and served up in a truly homey style. In the tradition of a true mezza, begin with a sharing platter of some of the most beautiful hummus in town: topped with a party of pine nuts, herbs, minced lamb, and olive oil, this creamy hummus, eaten with crisp pita, is heaven on earth. Alongside that, a mezze platter of Babaganoush, Labneh, Moussaka, and Arabic Salad, gives you extra pita-dipping options, and all this before the main course of grilled meats. From fragrant, smoky Lamb Kofta to tender Shish Taouk (chicken breast in a zesty marinade), nothing speaks of the Middle East quite like its stunning array of grilled, marinated meats. But it’s the charcoal-grilled Lamb Chops, paired with spicy harissa, grilled vegetables, and rice that makes for a truly climactic moment: the smoky, meaty flavours are brought out perfectly by the zingy harissa, and the meat comes off the bone in chewy, tender bites. A vibrant meal in one of the most vibrant parts of Singapore, Middle Eastern fare is making a comeback: come see why! (Jun 2017)

data.title: Bōruto
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tako Wasabi, Ebi Maki with Burrata Cheese, Ise Ebi, Cold Angel Hair Pasta, Foie Gras Nashi with Cipollini onions, Wild Mushroom Pappardelle, Miso Braised Short Ribs, Wagyu Beef Tartare.
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Fusion Japanese and Sake galore is what Bōruto delivers. Located a 
stone’s throw away from the CBD and styled as a modern day Izakaya, 
the double-storey, industrial chic establishment is helmed by Chef 
Patrick Tan, owner of Japanese robatayaki restaurant Tamashii Robataya.

The first floor of Bōruto offer foodies a casual dining experience by 
dispensing out a plethora of shareable dishes from their 
Italian-Japanese menu like Hotate & Kanpachi Carpaccio, thinly sliced 
Hokkaido Scallops & Amberjack, and Risotto Croquettes, delicious stuffed 
potato croquettes with Tomato Risotto. 
Translating into “Vault” in Japanese, the name Bōruto is a nod to 
the bank that operated in the same premises and the original bank vault, 
still functional, sits on the second floor and now securely showcasing 
the most premium bottles of Sake available. Here, Sake Connoisseurs can 
enjoy the novelty of walking into the Vault, selecting from a range of 
up to 30 of the most high-end Sakes available and enjoy a more exclusive 
experience! (Jan 2019)

data.title: CARNE
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Chicken Burger, Veggie Burger, Triple Cooked Agria Fries, Toast and Dip
data.ABOUT:
Discover the first international outpost of CARNE created by lauded Argentinian chef Mauro Colagreco in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District along Amoy Street. Offering an irresistible all day menu of customised burgers, milkshakes, local craft beers and a healthy breakfast selection, drop by this innovative burger chain to explore sustainable gastronomy. 

With three Michelin stars under its belt, CARNE consistently works together with a community of local artisans, sustainable growers, and organic purveyors to serve up dishes that not only is suited for the Singaporean palate, but also stays true to its Argentinian heart. 

Specially crafted for locals, the Crispy Chicken Burger is made for the meat lovers by combining a locally sourced poussin chicken thigh with fresh green cabbage, chilli pickled organic cucumber and drizzled with an organic yoghurt dressing. Vegetarian options such as the Veggie Burger are also available. Sandwiched between two fluffy turmeric buns, dig into mouthfuls of grilled portobello, local oak lettuce and charred halloumi cheese for a hearty burger feast. Fill up by adding a side of fries and soft drink to  create a combo. (May 2021)

data.title: CHILLAS Indian Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shahi Malai Kofta, Fish Head Curry, Chicken Tikka Masala, Prawn Vindaloo
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Established in 2008, CHILLAS Indian Restaurant specializes in authentic North Indian Cuisine. They’ve built a household name for themselves with a loyal following as they’ve never failed to satisfy the taste buds of their customers.

You’ll be spoilt for choice at CHILLAS Indian Restaurant, as the robust menu boasts a wide array of meat and vegetarian dishes. The house specialty tandoori meats, marinated and cooked until perfection in the tandoor, is definitely not to be missed. Vegetarians can choose from a variety of Paneers cooked in different curries, Shahi Malai Kofta, mixed vegetables and cottage cheese dumplings simmered in a creamy almond sauce.

And of course, well-loved staples like Fish Head Curry, Chicken Tikka Masala and Prawn Vindaloo are guaranteed to leave you with a happy belly! (Apr 2019)

data.title: CHIRU
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffled Beef Donburi, Aburi Salmon Yuzu Maki, Bonded Scallop Foie Gras, King Oyster Mushroom and Salmon Belly Yakitori
data.ABOUT:
Tucked along Duxton Road, CHIRU is a modern izakaya restaurant that houses all your Japanese favourites under one roof. 

Delicacies here feature the Bonded Scallop and Foie Gras, Salmon Steak and Pan Seared Foie Gras. Top your pan-seared foie gras with uni and caviar for the ultimate indulgence with just a few extra dollars! Health-conscious diners can go for the Salmon Avocado Salad. A delightful mix of Yakitori salmon cubes, cherry tomatoes, pistachio nuts, this nutritious bowl is drizzled with sesame dressing for maximum flavour. A different kind of cocktail, the Torii Cocktail is made of fresh uni, sweet shrimps, caviar and finished with a dash of special dressing created in house. 

Those with a larger palate can opt for the tasty and filling donburi bowls. Signature specials include the Truffled Beef Donburi and Tempura Garlic Fried Rice. The latter consists of a perfectly poached egg sitting atop soft fluffy rice mixed with scallion and flavourful seaweed strips. 

End your meal with a platter of authentic Japanese yakitori. Popular favourites such as the Pork Belly Teriyaki, Jumbo Black Tiger Prawn and Sweet Potato are not to be missed out on. (Mar 2021)

data.title: CIA ToP Table
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Romantic Dates
data.Address: Block 31 Tampines Avenue 1Level 3Temasek Culinary AcademyTemasek PolytechnicSingapore (529757)                                                Map
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Whenever you dine at The CIA Top Table restaurant, you are helping to support the future of the food service and hospitality industry. As an independent, not-for-profit college, The CIA directs its resources right back into our core mission – to provide the best professional culinary education to thousands of students each year in our degree, professional development, and food enthusiast programs. 

The students who have prepared and served your meal today are fulfilling their degree requirements at The CIA. We encourage you to engage them in conversation, ask them about their education experience, and provide any useful feedback that can help them improve their performance and your overall dining experience. (Aug 2019)

data.title: CIN CIN
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 100 Peck Seah Street#01-02Oasia Hotel DowntownSingapore (079333)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Fries, Gruyere Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms, Spicy Fried Calamari, Pulled Pork Sliders, Honey Soy Chicken Wings, Spicy Sriracha Buffalo Wings
data.ABOUT:
CIN CIN derives its name from the sound of clinking glasses amidst lively celebrations. Located in the heart of the Tanjong Pagar district, CIN CIN is the perfect spot to raise a toast to the good life. With delicious bar bites and close to 100 different labels of gin sourced from across the globe, what's there not to love?

The bar food menu is tightly curated, while also maintaining multiple choices for vegetarians. The Truffle Fries are a surefire crowd-pleaser - delicious french fries are tossed with roasted garlic aioli, shaved parmesan and sliced truffles, resulting in a dish that is simply divine! The Gruyere Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms is another tempting delight. Button mushrooms are encrusted in panko crumbs, before premium gruyere cheese is melted all over it. Served with a roasted garlic aioli dip, this mouthwatering dish will be gobbled up before you know it. The Spicy Sriracha Buffalo Wings are a modern take on an old favourite. Breaded chicken wings are deep-fried and then dunked in the universally-beloved Sriracha Ketchup sauce till deliciousness oozes out of every bite. Apart from enjoying the bar bites straight up, diners will definitely not want to miss trying a tipple or two from CIN CIN's extensive bar menu! (Jun 2017)

data.title: COCA at Kallang Leisure Park
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Thai, Seafood, Local, Steamboat
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Lunch Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Dinner Last Order: 9:45pm)Sat & Sun: 11:15am–10:30pm(Lunch Last Order: 3:45pm, Dinner Last Order: 9:45pm)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Prawn Paste, Spicy Thai Silver Noodle Salad, Pad Thai
data.ABOUT:
Originated from Bangkok, COCA Restaurant first opened its doors in Singapore in 1987 and remains well-known amongst Singaporean diners as an established Thai-Chinese hotpot restaurant.

By marrying authentic Thai cuisine with traditional elements of Cantonese home-style cooking, it is COCA’s distinctive flavours which resonated well with many through the decades.

Take your pick from COCA’s scrumptious House Specialties such as Fish Glue, Shrimp Paste and Handmade Dumplings, along with an endless array of fresh seasonal vegetables, meat, and seafood offerings.

Be spoilt for choices, only at COCA! (Aug 2018)

data.title: COLLIN'S® (Cineleisure)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Manhattan Seafood Chowder, Gouda Cheese Sticks, Collin’s Special, Caramelized Banana Creme Brulee
data.ABOUT:
Curated with quality and the freshest ingredients, Collin’s seeks to bring together family, friends, and loved ones during meal times to indulge one's company with the language of love. With a dedication to making great food accessible and affordable, the restaurant’s carefully selected menu delights your taste buds through wholesome cooking.

Established since 2012, Collin’s is an award-winning F&B local brand that has grown to be a household name with multiple outlets across Singapore. Visit Collin’s at Marina Square to enjoy freshly prepared meals. Dig into a hearty bowl of Manhattan Seafood Chowder with a piece of fragrant Homemade Garlic Bread to kickstart your meal. Featuring creamy tomato chowder, prawn, mussel, squid, baby clam, and an assortment of colourful vegetables, the latter is a piping bowl of comfort, perfect for any day.

For cheese lovers, the Gouda Cheese Sticks is a deliciously cheesy choice that is sure to have you raising your hand for seconds. Other signature dishes fall under the restaurant’s extensive menu of pasta, meat, pizza, and desserts. (Mar 2021)

data.title: COLLIN’S® (Changi Airport)
data.Hours: Sun-Thu & PH: 10am-11pm (Last Order: 10pm)Fri, Sat & Eve of PH: 10am-12am (Last Order: 11pm)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.Address:
65 Airport Boulevard
#03-21
Changi Airport Terminal 3
Singapore (819663)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled German Pork Bratwurst, Duo of Mushroom Potato Au Gratin, Fresh Mussels in Casserole, Signature Roasted BBQ Sauce Pork Ribs, COLLIN’S Mixed Combo, Sea Tiger Prawn & Mixed Fungi, Luxury Wagyu Beef Bolognese Baked Rice
data.ABOUT:
With a local presence of over 18 restaurants islandwide, this spot is a testament to homegrown talent Collin Ho’s  passion for providing delicious fare at affordable prices. The restaurants have amassed numerous accolades over the years, most notably the Singapore Prestige Brand Award for Most Popular Promising Brand. 

The dishes here are both Instagram-worthy and delicious. The Charcoal Grilled Octopus Leg is a unique looking dish served on a wooden board with Potato Gratin and Romesco Sauce. Items on the Epicurean menu are a little moreish, and consist of a meat main, salad, and fries. These dishes are all under $20, which means that you can have a sumptuous meal without breaking the bank. Some of our favourite dishes include the Collins’ All-Day Brunch, which is a plate filled with brunch staples like bratwurst and sunny-side up. The Dry Aged Beef Burger is another crowd favourite. The patty is made of dry-aged beef and topped with honey baked ham, cheddar, and egg. 

Diners who are after something healthier and lighter will love the Grilled Chicken Salad. Generous chunks of grilled chicken breast are tossed with mesclun salad, tomatoes, and refreshing Japanese cucumber. The Grilled Jumbo Asparagus is excellent, and dipped in the Romesco sauce the dish is served with, it’s almost heavenly. (June 2018)

data.title: CURATE
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: “Krabben Broetchen” (sweet prawn puff), Foie Gras Pate with Pickled Cucumber, Steckerlfisch (smoked fish tartare), Russishes Ei
data.ABOUT:
If you’re a diner who enjoys trying the food of visiting chefs from out of town, then book your table at Curate. This RWS stalwart is helmed by resident chef Benjamin Halat, who is joined every three months by international guest chefs from Michelin-starred restaurants overseas. who create fine degustation menus together with him. 

Chef Halat’s pedigreed background means he can hold his own, too. When not joined by visiting chefs, the German native consistently turns out bold, cutting-edge European dishes. Appetisers begin on a fun note, with a picnic basket of homemade German pretzels and obatzda, camembert cheese infused with cumin and paprika. These lead the way to equally creative mains, like a smoked fish tartare with pickled daikon that is the chef’s interpretation of a popular charcoal-grilled fish you’ll find in the beer gardens of Bavaria in springtime. The star of the show, though, Russishes Ei. Chef Halat, turns an organic farm egg into a light and fluffy souffle texture, placing it atop a bed of potato cream and champagne foam on the side, with a dollop of Beluga caviar. It’s a luxurious dish that is light as air yet tasty at the same time, and is what keeps you coming back to Curate even when there isn’t a visiting chef in town. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Cafe Mosaic
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Queen Scallops, Black Mussels, Tiger Prawns, Slow Baked Lamb Tandoori, Wok Fried Fish in Kam Heong style, Braised Herbal Chicken, Rojak, Chocolate Mousse, Café Mosaic Burger, Singapore Nonya Laksa, Nasi Goreng Istimewa, Fried Hokkien Noodles, Seafood Pizza
data.ABOUT:
An understated buffet experience awaits you at Carlton Hotel, conveniently located at Bras Basah. From fresh seafood to irresistible mains, the resplendent array of international delicacies means that you’re assured of an elevated dining experience at Café Mosaic you’ll not forget. Even the little ones will relish their time here with a string of activities such as storytelling and cupcake decoration during weekend afternoons.
The contemporary and cosy restaurant space is fit for a king’s feast, so get ready to tuck into the scrumptious fare at once. Choose from an assortment of appetisers and seafood on ice such as fresh Queen Scallops, Black Mussels, Tiger Prawns, and Smoked Salmon, before moving on to some Slow Baked Lamb Tandoori, Wok Fried Fish in Kam Heong style, and Braised Herbal Chicken. Both theatrics and gastronomy are showcased effortlessly at the live station, where skillful chefs cook up your favourite local delights such as Laksa, Mee Rebus, and Prawn Noodle Soup. Alternatively, get your hands dirty at the DIY station, where you’ll get the chance to prepare your own plate of Rojak or Gado Gado. End the meal on a sweet note with the wide selection of delectable desserts including freshly baked pastries, cakes, and other sweet treats such as Chocolate Mousse and Ice Kachang. The only problem left is how to enjoy the wide spread in one sitting! (Sep 2017)

data.title: Cafe de Paris
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Rose Cake, Mango Bon Bon, Ondeh Ondeh Cake, Sweet Potato Latte
data.PRESS RELEASE: Established in South Korea in 2009, Cafe de Paris has went on to become a renowned international franchise.Conveniently located at 313 Somerset, Café de Paris is the perfect place for you to relax, hang out with friends, enjoy a session of Art-jamming and take instagrammable pictures. It is also a great place for Team-bonding activities, Parties, Workshops and Celebrity events. Enjoy their Specialty Korean Bonbons – a refreshing sorbet topped with your choice of fresh, quality fruits and non-dairy cream from Korea. Complete your invigorating experience with coffee/ French tea and cakes! Small bites and meals are served as well. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Caffe Fernet
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mafaldine Cacio e Pepe, Whipped Ricotta, Mushroom Argodolce, Pompano Piccata
data.ABOUT:
Hurrah, the Jigger & Pony Group have done it again! The brilliant minds behind some of our favourite cocktail spots such as Jigger & Pony, Sugarhall, and Gibson, have created an exciting dining concept that we absolutely adore.
Situated in the historic Customs House by the uber-scenic waterfront, Caffe Fernet is a beautiful 130-seater establishment where Italian-inspired nibbles and drinks are served with style and flair. On good days, we prefer to opt for the casual and breezy alfresco dining area where we can sip on a drink while enjoying views of the Marina Bay skyline. 
The food here promises to be fresh and exciting. Instead of the heavy, traditional Italian nosh, Caffe Fernet takes these tried-and-true Italian flavours and breathes into them fresh life. Indulge in delightful plates such as the minimalistic Cacio e Pepe that showcases nothing but freshly cracked black pepper and high-grade cheese. Looking for finger food instead? Then opt for the delightful morsels of Saffron Arancini or a bowl of Marinated Olives. And be sure to order up an evergreen cocktail such as a Spritz or Negroni that never goes out of style.  
Whether you’re a food or cocktail aficionado, you won’t regret swinging by Caffe Fernet for a contemporary restaurant and bar experience done right. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Caffé B
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Burrata Cheese, Farmer’s egg & Sea Urchin, Hokkaido Sea Urchin Cold Capellini, Spaghetti Vongole, I am Crazy Singapore, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away in the corner of Club Street, there is a historical gem that has been transformed into an elegant, contemporary dining & drinks destination.
​
Whatever the occasion, the highly experienced Caffé B team will deliver. Be it just cocktails after work, light bites, or a sit-down dinner, we are here to indulge. Choose from our selection of artisanal cocktails, impressive wine list, beers on tap and bar bites curated to complement our drinks menu.

For lunch Service, We serve our set lunch in 5 executive options, Salmon Mushroom Risotto, Spaghetti Bolognese, Spaghetti Sakura Shrimp, Spaghetti Carbonara & Pasta Orecchiette. All set lunch comes with freshly brewed  Green Tea, Mixed Green Salad, and Homemade Bread. 

For dinner service, you have a choice of dining downstairs or heading upstairs as our three-story heritage shophouse transforms into a beautiful dinner venue. Take a culinary adventure of stunning Italian fare with accents of stunning Japanese ingredients. 
​​
A Dining Experience Next to None!

data.title: Café 2000
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Chicken Pie, Wagyu Beef Burger, Black Angus Beef, Café 200 Laksa, Fried Hokkien Prawn Noodle, Awesome Meat Lover Pizza
data.PRESS RELEASE: Dine in our newly refurbished Café 2000 and look forward to a leisurely meal within the contemporary and sleek décor of the restaurant, accompanied with friendly staff all ready to be at your service. Get set for a gastronomical ride of a lifetime at Café 2000! Take your pick from a dizzying array of a la carte dishes; the likes of juicy & succulent Wagyu Beef Burger, Grilled Norwegian Salmon, or sprung for a specially curated 3 to 5-course Western set menus with free-flow of appetizers, western/local soups, bread, your choice of chef’s main course specials such as Premium Lobster pasta, sizzling Black Angus Steak and unlimited desserts. Ideal for a business luncheon, celebratory or treat-yourself a break! (Aug 2020)

data.title: Café Iguana
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 5-10pmFri: 5-11pmSat: 12pm-11pmSun & PH: 12pm-10pmPH: 12pm till lateEve of PH: Open* - 1am**Opening on eve of PH depends on the day of the week
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Camarones al Diablo, Quesadillas, Shredded Steak Tacos, Flank Steak Fajitas, Red Snapper Enchilada, Ancho Chile Chocolate Cake
data.ABOUT: One of the first places in Singapore to make Mexican food hip and part of the buzzing nightlife at Clarke Quay, Cafe Iguana is a favourite among night-birds drawn to its high-energy atmosphere (helped along by joyful Mexican music played through the speaker), strong, frosty drinks, and friendly crowds. They’re famous for their well-endowed margaritas, including their house favourites that come in sweet and tart flavours like peach, lime, and Soursop, though more premium numbers, mixed up with top-shelf tequilas, are also available if you’re looking for something complex to nurse through the night. Before the binge-drinking, line your stomach with the hearty Mexican fare on offer. Think soft corn tacos filled with tender red snapper, fatty pork carnitas, or shredded steak, perfect with a dash of salsa and pico de gallo. If you’re looking for something heftier, full plates are available too, featuring chow like a Mulato Rib Eye, a chargrilled cut of Australian beef that’s intensified with Mexican spices and a fiery chili sauce, served alongside beans and rice. The house specialty is the Green Chile Stew, made with pork in a rich broth of chile verde, served with tortillas and rice, for a hearty, spicy centrepiece that’s perfect for sharing. Take down the heat with an icy margarita, or a smoky Mezcal cocktail, and soak up the riverside vibes: the night is only beginning. (Apr 2017)

data.title: Cali, Ascott Raffles Place
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Modern European, Italian, International, Southeast Asian

data.PRESS RELEASE:
Situated at the heart of Singapore in the CBD area, Cali Restaurant at Ascott Raffles Place is not your typical eatery. Enjoy the gastronomic experience of eating curated dishes, made with the freshest ingredients the market has to offer! The passion for food has been incorporated into our menu that offers a wide selection of South-Western dishes to choose from.

We are perfect for any occasion, any time of the day. Looking for a place to have a meal with an important client? From our elegantly plated food to the calming ambiance, we are just the place you need to have your important meeting while you enjoy scrumptious South Western cuisine as well as options from a healthier menu.

Come on down to Cali at Ascott Raffles Place and allow us to demonstrate what we do best! (Jan 2021)

Welcome to Cali at Park Avenue Rochester! Join us on this gastronomical journey through the Southwest where we charm you with our delicious food and restaurant decor. Cali has brought the taste of the Southwest right to this little red dot we call home. Indulge in Southwestern favorites that we've perfected.

With years of culinary experience and F&B excellence, Cali at Park Avenue Rochester is a place that is perfect for meetings, family gatherings, and intimate dinners. We want to bring you the best southwest culinary and olfactory experience. Classics like fajitas, jalapenos poppers with tostadas and many more scrumptious dishes that will surely satisfy any cravings are sine of the dishes you wouldn’t want to miss out on.

Whether you're in the area or not, you'll want to get a taste of the myriad of options we have to offer! (Jan 2021)

data.title: Camden Hill Restaurant & Bar
data.Cuisine: American, Italian, Fusion, British, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: BBQ Pork Ribs, Pan Seared Barramundi, Cobb Salad
data.ABOUT:
Housed in a beautiful post-colonial building, Camden Hill Restaurant and Bar is the perfect hideaway to enjoy a meal away from the hustle and bustle of city life and amidst lush greenery. Open every day of the week, the Camden Hill Restaurant and Bar is a family friendly eatery with a relaxing and kids-friendly atmosphere.

Offering a variety of modern food options and all-day dining, the restaurant serves everything from Asian favourites to Dutch specialities and even international dishes. Healthy food options are an important staple of their diverse menu, with a host of vegetarian and gluten-free choices available.

Cheese lovers rejoice as the restaurant serves up a tantalising Cheese Platter. Featuring premium cheeses, the platter also comes with the quintessential water crackers, grapes, dried fruit and nuts for a complete experience. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Candlenut
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Homemade Kueh Pie Tee, Westholme Wagyu Beef Rib Rendang, Blue Swimmer Crab Curry, Buah Keluak Fried Rice, Red Lion Snapper Fillet with Black Green Mango Sambal, King Tiger Prawn with Fresh Chilli Sambal, Classic Chendol Cream, Textures of Coconut
data.ABOUT:
Warm, full-bodied, and complex are often adjectives people use describe the beloved and traditional Peranakan cuisine. At Candlenut, this uniquely Southeast Asian cuisine is getting its time in the limelight thanks to chef-owner Malcolm Lee’s deft work and skill that garnered him a Michelin star two years in a row.  

With high ceilings, clean lines, and plenty of sunshine, it’s almost impossible to feel stressed in the relaxed and laidback atmosphere that Candlenut exudes. While this 92-seater establishment includes a private room for more intimate dinners, guests also have the option of sitting in the al fresco area for a night under the stars. 

There are a fair number of classic Peranakan dishes on a menu that spans across 40 appetisers, mains, and desserts. Be prepared to fall head over heels for standouts such as the Red Lion Snapper, accompanied by fresh chilli sambal and charred garlic chives. The King Tiger Prawn, featuring local ingredients such as gula melaka coconut sauce, lemongrass, and Thai basil, is also another hit. Of course, indecisive eaters can always go for the playfully-named Ah-Ma-Kase tasting menu to sample a little of everything. 

With a new home at the ultra-hip COMO Dempsey, Candlenut promises a night (or afternoon) filled with contemporary Straits-Chinese cuisine amid the lush greenery that is Dempsey Hill. (Aug 2017)

Whether you are looking to relax over coffee and cake, have a quick bite to go with your furry four-legged friend, or gather with family and friends for some drinks, Canopy provides a picturesque view to unwind to, or make your Instagram followers green with envy.(Oct 2020)
