data.title: Canteen Bistro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 80 Stamford Road#B1-61SMU School of Information SystemsSingapore (178902)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Combo Platter, Wagyu Beef Burger, Grilled Chicken Chop, Creamy Salmon Linguine
data.ABOUT:
Serving yummy plates of omurice at pocket friendly prices since 2002, Canteen Bistro is a casual western style restaurant nestled in the heart of town at Singapore Management University. 

Featuring an impressive spread of burgers, pasta and meat dishes, the restaurant is a great hangout spot with friends as their snack menu offers multiple dishes great for sharing. The Combo Platter is the best way to have a taste of everything on the snack menu. With four types of flavoured fries, Fried Chicken Wings, Fried Calamari and Tempura Prawns, there’s something for everyone on this platter. For an indulgent meal, go for the Wagyu Beef Burger. Accompanied with a generous serving of fries, the wagyu beef is tender and melts in your mouth. Slapped between two fluffy buns and drizzled with a delicious sauce, take a bite to enjoy a burst of savoury flavours. 

Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with a plate of Grilled Chicken Chop. Grilled to perfection, the chicken chop is covered in a rich, bold black pepper sauce and comes with a side of fresh salad and fries. Other signature items on the menu include the Creamy Salmon linguine, Crispy Chicken Cutlet and Pulled Pork Burger. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Cappadocia Turkish Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Middle Eastern, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Halal Certified, Turkish
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Shawarma Sandwich, Karisik Kebab Maxim, Tabbouleh, Kunefe Turkish Dessert
data.ABOUT:
Located in Kampong Glam, Cappadocia Turkish Restaurant is dedicated to serving quality interpretations of classic Turkish dishes.
Kick things off with the Karisik Kebab Maxim. This indulgent culinary creation features a magnificent feast of succulent lamb, beef, and chicken kebabs with a side of butter rice and vegetable salad, and has fast become one of the restaurant's signature dishes.
For the health-conscious food lover, their Chicken Shawarma Sandwich will do the trick. Stuffed with sliced shawarma chicken, lettuce, and pickles, the sandwich is lightly drizzled with garlic sauce and lightly toasted. The Tabbouleh is yet another nutritious option, featuring a delightful bowl of fresh chopped Lebanese parsley mixed with bulgur, tomato, onion, lemon juice and topped off with extra virgin olive oil. 

End off with a fan favourite sweet treat - the Kunefe Turkish Dessert. Made out of thin vermicelli pastry baked in soft cheese and syrup, this each delightful morsel is worth its waiting time! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Capri Trattoria & Pizzeria
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gamberi e Cappesante alle Erbe, Asparagi dello Chef, Carpaccio di Pesce, Insalata di Rucola, Scialatielli di Capri, Ravioli di Vitello, Risotto Gamberi e Porri, Trionfo di Mare, Calzone, Classic Tiramisu’
data.ABOUT:
A Bukit Timah favourite for mouth-watering pastas and authentic pizzas, Capri Trattoria & Pizzeria is an Italian eatery we’re certain everyone will love. Offering a warm and rustic ambiance, along with an authentic region-centric menu, it’s one spot that’s got traditional Italian eats in the bag!
With something on the menu for everyone, Capri Trattoria’s à la carte menu is where most people will want to start. From seafood fans who’ll find the Gamberi e Cappesante alle Erbe, warm prawns and scallops with mediterranean herbs, remarkable to the meat eaters who’ll yearn to devour the Cotoletta alla Milanese, a juicy 300g bone-in deep-fried breaded veal chop, substantial eats is what this Italian eatery is all about! (Mar 2016)

data.title: Captain K Seafood Tower
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions

data.title: Carnivore Brazilian Churrascaria (CHIJMES)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Rump Cap, Chimichurri Sauce, Bacon Wrapped Chicken, Brazilian Cheese Bread
data.ABOUT:
Forget the meat-and-potatoes steakhouse. A lively Brazilian churrascaria is what you should seek for an eventful and delicious evening out. 

The idea is simple. You sit down, and passadors bearing skewers of grilled premium meat, carve moist slivers directly onto your plate. Beef, chicken, lamb, fish – there's no need to limit yourself. It's an endless flow of meaty goodness where all you have to do is sit, and eat. And eat. And eat. Just when your palate is starting to feel a little jaded, you order a portion of grilled caramelised pineapple whose sharp, tangy sweetness is the perfect way to whet your appetite all over again. All so you can get back to those delicious cuts of meat. 

Don't just be dazzled by the succulent barbecued meats, rotisserie-cooked to perfection. There's also a buffet spread that shouldn't be overlooked! With staples like salads and pastas, it's where you should turn to if you feel that you've met your match on the protein front. 

The meat though, is undeniably the draw of this restaurant, and with a name like Carnivore, that shouldn't be a surprise. 

Stationed near the archways of the iconic CHIJMES pavilion, this Carnivore outlet is undeniably unique. Softened by the backdrop of the gorgeous white chapel, the outdoor dining option here is a must, creating an incomparable ambience that makes this unique dinner experience all the more special. So sharpen those claws and polish those canines my friends, because there's no better place to meet. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Caruso Ristorante
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: La Burrata, Insalata Di Polipo, Pappardelle Con Ragu Di Agnello, Costolette Di Agnello Al Timo, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
If you think Italian cuisine is all about rich pastas and creamy sauces had by dim lighting in a cozy dining room, Caruso Ristorante will make you think again. In place of exposed brick and traditional white table cloths, Caruso features crisp, white stone arches, an airy bar and dining room, and bright citrus walls. Its concrete floors, sleek furniture and two storey-foyers are modern, while mainstays of Italy are sprinkled about, with poppy Italian tunes playing and vintage photos of the restaurant's namesake singer dotting the wall.
While the interiors exude an air of Southern Italy, the flavours from the dishes that fly out of the kitchens here will truly transport diners to the heart of Puglia at first bite. Start your meal right with La Burrata, Puglia’s renown burrata cheese with wild rocket and cherry tomatoes, or sink your teeth into the beautifully fresh and tart octopus salad Insalata Di Polipo. Follow that with famous lamb dishes that Puglia is famous for: the Pappardelle Con Ragu Di Agnello features slow braised lamb that’s cooked for 8 hours and served over homemade pasta, while Costolette Di Agnello Al Timo brings you gorgeous thyme-roasted lamb chops with artichokes, spinach, and roasted potatoes.
With the brilliant lightness of all the dishes, saving room for dessert isn't a concern. And with dessert just as light and perfect as the rest of the meal, we were left wishing it did not have to end. (Nov 2017)

data.title: Casa Roma Ristorante Italiano
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gamberoni alla Griglia, Conchiglie con Pollo e Pomodorini Secchi, Tagliatelle ai Funghi Porcini, Risotto ai Funghi Porcini, Mixed Cheese Platter, Ravioli Magro Panna E Prosciutto
data.ABOUT:
In Singapore, the best food is always tucked away in hard-to-reach places, and that seems to be the case for Casa Roma, which is hidden away in quiet Bukit Timah, some 15 minutes away from the mania of Orchard Road. The space, done up to resemble a bustling Roman trattoria, is homey, rustic, and welcoming, and a large mural of Roman landmarks reminds you that you’re here to tuck into the hearty food of this storied city.
Here, they offer a traditional multi-course Italian meal, which you kick off with some pasta, like the classic Spaghetti Alla Carbonara and little pillowy Ravioli stuffed with cheese and served with Parma ham, before diving into its meaty mains. Choose from dishes like a crisp-skinned Branzino al Pomodoro, a fillet of bass served with piquant capers and salty anchovies in a light tomato sauce, or a hefty Vitello Al Funghi Porcini, a tender veal loin grilled to perfection then dressed in a creamy porcini sauce, all delicious paired with one of the restaurant’s great beers or wines. A sweet ending is compulsory, so end the night with a Budino Al Latte, a milky creme caramel, or the ubiquitous but irresistible Tiramisu.It’s time to gear up for your very own Roman holiday, transported to Rome not by plane, but by delicious Italian plates. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Casa Tartufo
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Capesante Casa, Alex’s Carpaccio, Fiorentina Della Casa, Risotto Casa, Truffle Gelato
data.ABOUT:
Tuck into Italian truffle dishes at Casa Tartufo. Located at 6 Mohamed Sultan Road, the ‘House of Truffles’ (as its name means in Italian) is a cosy family-run restaurant that serves authentic truffle specialties.

As the name suggests, the restaurant boasts a huge selection of truffle-centric dishes that are sure to delight your taste buds. Whether you’re a meat lover or a seafood lover, there’s something for everyone.

Try out Alex’s Carpaccio (named after the chef-owner) if you’re a meat lover. Deliciously rich and wholesome, this dish features raw beef topped with a sprinkle of truffle and mushroom cream that melts in your mouth. Seafood lovers should go for the Capesante Casa. Fried scallops are the main draw here, with each mouthful packing a punch of ingredients such as parmigiano and truffle fondue, and smoked caviar.

Truffles for dessert? Why not. Order a Truffle Gelato to complete this unique dining experience. Topped with savoury truffle bites, this sweet and milky ice cream will leave you coming back for more. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Casa Verde
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Singapore Laksa, Bak Kut Teh, Gourmet Breakfast, Chicken Wings, Carbonara, Chicken Truffle Pizza, Carne Pizza, Grilled Vegetable Pizza, Tiramisu
data.PRESS RELEASE: Casa Verde is a casual trattoria nestled within the lush greenery of the Singapore Botanic Gardens. Our name, which means 'Green House' in Italian, is particularly apt for our restaurant, given its relaxing atmosphere amidst verdant garden landscapes.Apart from wholesome and affordable pastas, Italian sandwiches, and wood-fired thin crust pizzas, Casa Verde also offers a number of local favourites, appealing to both Singaporeans and tourists alike. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Casserole
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 101 Siloso RoadDine On 3 at Level 3Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & SpaSingapore (098970)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: King Prawns, Atlas Lamb Tagine, Gosht Rogan Josh Kashmir, Murgh Makhani, Crab Meat Masala, Braised Wagyu Beef Cheeks
data.ABOUT:
Chuck a few ingredients into a casserole dish, leave it in the oven to cook slowly, and what you’ll get is a casserole. Well, maybe there are a few more steps in between but we’d rather leave the details to the experts.
Succinctly named, Casserole at the Shangri-La boasts a menu of – you guessed it – casseroles. But these are no homemade messes, friends. Drawing on an slew of influences that span the globe from Southeast Asia to Morocco and beyond, Casserole plies you with well-finessed exotic dishes like Crab Meat Masala, Atlas Lamb Tagine (leg of lamb infused with the quintessential ras el hanout mix of spices, saffron and honey, slow-cooked until fork-tender), and Duck a l'Orange. If one-dish meals never appealed to you before, it’s probably because you’re lacking a Casserole experience in your life! (Mar 2016)

data.title: Cassia
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wok-Fried Carrot Cake with XO Chili Sauce, Double Boiled Thick Chicken Broth Soup, Peking Duck, Wok-fried Wagyu Beef, Steamed Charcoal Barbecued Avinyó Omega 3 Pork Bun with Black Truffle
data.ABOUT:
Learning Cassia is located near the southernmost point of continental Asia probably evokes images of beach-goers with cocktail glasses basking in the sun, sand and sea. Cassia surprises diners by offering a gorgeous view overlooking Sentosa, with the sprawling cityscape an impressive backdrop. Definitely considering dining outdoors, it's surprisingly cool in our tropical climate! That is probably kudos to the lush greenery on the island, which makes a trip to Capella feel like a trip out of Singapore.
Cassia is as much a feast for the eyes as much as it is for your belly. Admire the colonial architecture of Capella Hotel while sampling their must-try dim sum like the Steamed Barbecued US Kurobuta Pork Bun, or the Hong Kong-style Peking Duck. Recipes are based upon traditional, regional cooking and blended with haute Cantonese technique. The chic décor of the restaurant compliments beautifully with (and definitely brings out the best in) the haute yet classic cuisine Cassia serves so well. (Jun 2012)

data.title: Catfish
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Squid and Chicken Wing Ramen, Sesame Prawn Toast, Scallop Green Apple
data.ABOUT:
A contemporary fish grill and raw bar by Andrew Walsh’s Cure Concepts, Catfish offers an Asian fusion menu that highlights the best finds from the region. 

Helmed by head chef Erik Gustafsson, the restaurant is focused on serving dishes that are complex yet easy to enjoy. Its menu elevates the natural flavours of the ocean with innovative culinary techniques, resulting in delicious Asian fare that combines elements of French and Swedish cooking. The culinary team focuses on techniques and matching flavour profiles to present shareable plates divided into ‘Snacks’, ‘Raw’, ‘Small’, ‘Fish’, ‘Vegetables’, ‘Others’ and ‘Desserts’. 

Quality takes precedence at Catfish. Ingredients such as mussels and fish are scouted from neighbourhood markets to ensure the freshest pick of the produce.

The Squid and Chicken Wing Ramen is a must-try, with ramen noodles recreated with squid confit and topped with black truffle shavings. A toast to try is the Sesame Prawn Toast which uses Argentinian red prawn and scallop mousse for a textured take, topped with decadent uni and caviar. Another must-try is the Scallop Green Apple, Hokkaido Scallop Ceviche of apple, citrus, clementine and yogurt dressing with a dash of dill oil and toasted almond.

Above and beyond the wonderful seafood dishes, you can expect an eclectic selection of hand-crafted cocktails and highballs with a twist of Asian flavours. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Cavemen Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Baby Squid, Bone Marrow with Veal Jus and Baguette, Kawaebi with Mentaiko Mayo, Aged Chicken Wings, Malibu Grilled Pineapple
data.ABOUT: Get ready to unleash your inner caveman and satisfy all your meaty desires. Started by Yvonne Ng, Cavemen Restaurant & Bar is a top-notch butchery and cafe that boasts a range of meats, cheese, and wines at pocket-friendly prices. After you’re done shopping, why not take a breather and spend an afternoon tucking into the well-curated meat-centric dishes this place has to offer? As is expected of any good butchery, the meats here are simply to die for. Take, for example, the perfectly-seared US Angus Ribeye. Served with mash and veal jus, this delectable hunk of meat is sure to drive meat-lovers crazy with delight. Other stellar options also include the 72 Hours Beef and our Aged Chicken Wings. And don’t miss out on the fresh and fruity Leafy Salad topped with grapes, mixed berries, and drizzled with a sweet and tangy honey balsamic vinaigrette. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Central Perk (F.R.I.E.N.D.S Cafe)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Joey's Fisherman Stew, Ross & Rachel's Breakup Pizza, Heavy Fudge Chocolate Mudcake, Janice's Oh My God Baby Back Ribs, Phoebe's I Can’t Eat Meat Steak, Chandler's Thanksgiving, Joey's You're My Everest Turkey
data.ABOUT:
You probably grew up seeing the gang on Friends spend half their lives at this fictional New York cafe, and now it's your time to experience it for yourself. A full-fledged replica of the hit TV show's punnily-named Central Perk (after New York's Central Park, get it?) cafe is now taking waves of Friends fans on a nostalgic pilgrimage.
It's uncanny how true-to-life this cafe is, and you'll feel just like you're on the set of Friends with its weathered couch and cozy ambience. Sort through your romantic crises, tell silly stories, and fantasise about your favourite characters walking in through the door as you tuck into hearty plates with gourmet touches, cheekily named after characters and catchphrases from the show.
Joey's Fisherman Stew is a hearty pot of mussels, clams, octopus, salmon, and prawns in a rich, slow-cooked broth. Janice's Oh My God Baby Back Ribs features free range Iberico pork for an extra fatty, tender finish. Rachel fans will dig the appropriately healthy Rachel "Green" Salad, a Mediterranean toss-up of pesto, olives, feta, and compressed fruits. Roast chicken and Chandler devotees will enjoy Chandler's Thanksgiving, a gravy-doused bird served with a side of, ahem, "Chanberry" sauce.
It's all puns, good food, and fond TV memories here at Central Perk cafe, where you can recreate the show to your heart's content while tucking into great food and the enthusiastic company of other devotees. (Dec 2016)

data.title: Chang Korean BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Chang Korean Charcoal BBQ cuts above the rest. At Chang, we strive to provide a variety of health-conscious choices. Our specially-designed menu includes traditional, yet modernized foods to satisfy the taste buds.

Having set in mind the foods we prepare are for our dedicated loved one, we strive to present culinary delights of Korean traditional dishes. Adapting modern taste to the very authentic taste wouldn’t be easy without passion.

Chang Korean BBQ has been remarked as one of the luxurious places opted for fine dining experiences, occasions and corporate dinners. Serving delectable and authentic Korean cuisine, Chang BBQ continues to be a culinary delight and serves up exceptionally crafted Korean dishes. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Chao Chao Gyoza
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ponzu Buta Gyoza, Tebasaki Gyoza, Cabbage Gyoza, Onsen Egg & Cheese Gyoza, Negi Gyoza
data.ABOUT:
If you can’t get enough of these deep-fried delights, there’s finally a place to sate your cravings. Founded in Osaka in 1971, this historic restaurant pays homage to the beloved Japanese dumpling. The recipe was perfected by Kenzo Nishi and the basic ingredients have not been modified since. Every single dumpling is filled with the right amount of filling and is fried to crisp perfection without a hint of greasiness.

The gyoza here are stuffed with a variety of fillings and topped with everything from cheese to citrus sauce. Vegetarians will be glad to know that Cabbage Gyoza is also on the menu. Diners looking for a unique dish can try the Ponzu Buta Gyoza - a delicious serving of pork gyoza drenched in a citrus and ponzu sauce. The combination may sound off-putting to some, but don’t knock it till you’ve tried it. The sharp citrus flavours cut through the richness of the meat and creates a contrast that will leave your taste buds wanting more.

Curious carnivores should opt for the Tebasaki Gyoza - two pieces of chicken stuffed with gyoza meat. The chicken is crisp and flavourful, and when combined with the gyoza filling, this is a dish you’ll want to have seconds of. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Chao Niu Hot Pot
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located along East Coast Road, meat-lovers will be able to find a hotpot joint that specialises in different cuts of beef. Chao Niu Hot Pot offers an extensive variety of beef parts you won't usually find at other hotpot restaurants, such as the flank, legs and chuck cuts.

Spice addicts will be able to enjoy their signature Mala soup base with rich notes of Sichuan peppercorns and a secret mix of spices. Diners who prefer to have their beef with a lighter soup base are able to choose between their other popular options such as the collagen or sweet corn soup. (Feb 2019)

data.title: ChaoTa
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Pork Ribs, Chaota Fu, Chao Ta Pork Belly, House Special Banana Cake
data.ABOUT:
Chao Ta? We never thought a restaurant would be called this, ever. But ask any Singaporean and he or she will tell you that the chao ta, or “burnt” part of a meat dish is usually the best. There’s just something irresistible about the crispy black crust and smoky flavour. That nostalgic flavour is what the folks at this homely eatery aim to showcase in its array of chargrilled mains.

Their signature dish is the Pork Ribs, with grilled prime ribs that are crisp on the outside, yet tender and juicy on the inside. To add another dimension of flavour to the dish, it’s served with a homemade spicy dipping sauce and a wedge of lime. Another specialty is the Chaota Fu, an umami dish of deep-fried tofu topped with aburi mentaiko sauce, tobiko, and bonito flakes. Wash the goodness down with an ice-cold glass of their house-concocted Sake Mojito.

The desserts, which bring back old school flavours with a twist, are not to be missed either. Choose between their House Special Banana Cake with caramel rum sauce, or a brownie with ice cream for a satisfying end to the meal. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Chapter 55
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5:30pm-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat, Eve of & PH: 11:30am-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sun: 11:30am-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.ABOUT:
Italian bistros are a dime a dozen, but rarely do you happen upon one
boasting a large, well-executed menu with an equal number of classic
dishes and inventive new recipes. Chapter 55 is a homely little spot
with friendly service and delicious food that will transport you
straight to the heart of Rome.

The Bonito Pizza is a fusion dish made with Tonkatsu sauce, bonito
flakes and ham, which has a unique umami taste that gives the cheesy
pizza base a new dimension of flavour.

While the main items are certainly tempting, the true highlight of the
menu are the desserts. There is a variety of waffles with gelato on
offer - from Salted Caramel to Butterscotch Banana. The Chapter 55
Gelato Waffle, however, is simple and perfectly delicious. Served with
fresh fruits cooked in cinnamon sauce and Chantilly cream, this dish is
the perfect way to end off an authentic Italian meal at this cosy
bistro.

"I never say no to Gelato." Chapter 55 is known for producing its own
small batches of artisan Gelato In-House. We have now created over 60
different flavors. Our Gelato are produced Fresh Daily using Premium
Grade Ingredients. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Char
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Char Siew, Crispy Roast Pork Belly, Jasmine Roast Duck, Soya Sauce Chicken, Passionfruit Prawn Ball
data.ABOUT:
Helmed by two brothers from the UK, Char aims to revolutionise the roast meat scene in Singapore with a balance of traditional and innovative flavours.

Their rendition of the roasts are indeed drool-worthy. Think: Melt-in-your-mouth slices of char siew slathered in a sweet and savoury glaze, crackling pork belly roasted to golden brown perfection, and tender yet crispy jasmine-infused roast duck.

Besides roast meats, they have an impressive array of Chinese appetisers, soups, and mains to satiate your hunger. Seafood fans will love the Passionfruit Prawn Ball, where crunchy deep-fried prawns are coated in a refreshing passion fruit dressing. Even humble carb dishes get a makeover, such as the Char's Special XO Sambal Fried Rice and Crispy Egg Noodles with Kurobuta Pork. Don't forget to throw in a comforting bowl of Char's Signature Double Boiled Chicken Soup, a flavourful broth brimming with tender pieces of chicken and scallops.

As a nod to the founders' hometown, British ales, ciders, and drafts complement the dishes and provide a unique dining experience. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Charcoal Grill and Bar by Kurry Korner
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Paneer Butter Masala, Butter Chicken, Goan Fish Curry, Vegetable Briyani
data.ABOUT:
Indian cuisine is diverse and unique, and few restaurants in Singapore have captured the true essence of quintessential Indian dining. Kurry Korner is set to change that, however, with a wide variety of dishes that combine techniques and ingredients from all over India. Think Tandoori Chicken, Palak Paneer, and Vindaloo Curry.  Health-conscious diners will be happy to note that all the food here are free of MSG, artificial colours, and preservatives. The ingredients used are also fresh, which ensures that dishes are wholesome and delicious.

Whet your appetite with some Kurry Korner Chicken Soup. This Insta-worthy starter is just oozing with flavour. Made with chicken, thickened with cream, and spiced with garlic, the smell of this dish alone will have you salivating. Rich and earthy, this is the perfect pick-me-up on a rainy day or for when you just need some comfort food. For a taste of the South, try the Chettinad Chicken - a searing curry made with red chilli and sauteed coriander seeds best enjoyed with some steamed Basmati rice. 

Craving dessert? You can’t go wrong with the Gulab Jamun, caramelized milk dumplings floating in a sweet cardamom syrup. Every bite explodes with delightfully sweet filling, and makes for the perfect way to end your meal. (March 2019)

data.title: Charlie's Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Rosemary Lamb, Quesadillas, Squid-Ink Paella, Jamon Serrano, Patatas Bravas
data.ABOUT:
Located in a rustic shophouse amidst the hustle and bustle of the Central Business District, Charlie’s Tapas Grill & Bar takes diners on a mouthwatering journey full of excellent margaritas and dazzling tapas. With its superior picturesque view over Boat Quay and delicious food, dining at Charlie’s Tapas Grill & Bar is always a treat! 

The menu contains an extensive selection of traditional tapas as well as vegetarian options to cater to any dietary restrictions. The Almejas Y Mejillones is a longstanding favourite – fresh clams and mussels are marinated in a sweet white wine, resulting in heaven on a plate! The Gambas Pil Pil is great for those craving something more spicy – large, fresh prawns are cooked in a hot, sizzling sauce, setting your tastebuds on fire! Of course, the more substantial main course options are equally exciting. The Signature Baby Back Ribs (available in 2 serving sizes) are scrumptious – pork ribs are stone-grilled until the the flavours are locked in, then glazed with a secret barbecue sauce. Served with sides of coleslaw and fries, the meat falls off the bone as you sink your teeth in. Charlie’s Tapas Grill & Bar is immensely popular among the working crowd, so don’t wait too long before making your reservation! (Mar 2017)

data.title: Chatterbox
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 333 Orchard RoadLevel 5Mandarin Orchard Hotel SingaporeSingapore (238867)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mandarin Chicken Rice, Chatterbox Lobster Laksa, Seafood Hor Fun, Vegetarian Bee Hoon, Wafu Salad, Wagyu Beef Burger, Nasi Lemak
data.ABOUT:
When it comes to Chicken Rice, there are many who attempt but only a few who can deliver! Chatterbox, located on Orchard Road, is one of those places. They’ve perfected the art of the simple Mandarin Chicken Rice and though that’s not all on the menu, it is their claim to fame.
With earthy hues of green and beige sprinkled with pops of color, Chatterbox is not only inviting, it’s also delicious. They’ve taken what everyone loves about Singaporean culture and have meticulously crafted award-winning dishes (again, like the Mandarin Chicken rice) we just can’t get enough of. Offering up Western dishes with local twist, as well, this is one place the entire family, including grandma and grandpa, can come to for a laid back, mouthwatering dinner! (Jul 2015)

data.title: Cheek Bistro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oysters with Smoked Tomato Granita, Waffle with Chicken Liver Parfait, Buttermilk Quail with Sriracha Mayonnaise, Lamb Ribs with Eggplant, Yoghurt & Mint, Fish & Chips, Mushroom On Toast, Slipper Lobster Po Boy, Rosemary Panna Cotta with Figs & Ricotta Ice Cream
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Conceptualised by Chef Rishi Naleendra and his wife Manuela Toniolo, the newly opened Cheek Bistro offers modern Australian fare - marrying the fresh, eclectic flavours of the cuisine style, with the comforting, hearty notes of bistro cooking. The kitchen is helmed by a young culinary team that trained under Chef Rishi at Cheek by Jowl.
Highlights on the a la carte menu include distinctively Cheek creations of Beef Tartare with Millet, Smoked Maple, Endives; Spanish Mackerel with Zucchini, Basil; and a dessert of Goat's Cheese Parfait with Berries and White Chocolate. To complement the food, the wine list offers over 80 labels from Burgundy to Burgenland. Cocktails and other beverages are also available.
Fans of the former Cheek by Jowl can expect to enjoy the same level of casual but attentive service that the restaurant was known for, in a more convivial setting that features cosy booth seats and an open kitchen. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Chef's Table by Chef Stephan
data.Cuisine: Modern European, French, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
Aiming to create a space that is all about the best produce cultivated by local and global farmers who work tirelessly to bring this to the table, Chef’s Table by Chef Stephan Zoisl brings gourmet food, premium ingredients, fine wine, and more to Tras Street.

Through a range of menu offerings, the Chef Stephan draws on his creativity and imagination to present a dinner crafted with the freshest produce and seasonal ingredients. Kick back and leave yourself in good hands as you savour incredible recipes and exceptional bottles from the experts! (Jan 2016)

data.title: Chengdu 成都
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Griddle Cooked Trotters, Secret Recipe Spring Frog, Chengdu Style Trotter Soup, Duck Soup with Sour Radish, Saute Spicy Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Looking for somewhere to indulge your spice cravings? Look no further. Sichuan food is known for its fiery flavours, but there are not a lot of restaurants that can serve up authentic nosh like this place can. From searing soup bases to healthy stews, there’s something for everyone at this centrally-located spot.

Adventurous patrons looking for the spiciest dish can refer to the number of chillies next to its name on the menu to gauge its spice level. Daredevils can start with the Secret Recipe Spring Frog, a delicious dish of chilli, frog meat, and a combination of secret sauces. The dish has a spicy, salty flavour that pairs perfectly with white rice. A little less ambitious? Start with the Griddle Cooked Trotters and work your way up.

Diners who wish to steer clear of the spice will be glad to know that there is a wide variety of healthy soups available. The Duck Soup with Sour Radish is a simple dish that is easy on the digestive system is a touted to have a “cooling” effect on the body. For something a little moreish, opt for the Chengdu Style Trotter Soup. This dish is richer due to the use of pork, and comes with a serving of vegetables. (May 2018)

data.title: Cherry Garden
data.Hours: Wed-Sun: 12-2:30pm, 6:30-10pmSat-Sun & PH: 11am-1pm (1st Seating), 1:30-3:30pm (2nd Seating), 6:30-10pmClosed Monday & Tuesday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions
data.Location: City Hall, Marina Bay, Promenade, Marina Central
data.Address: 5 Raffles AvenueMarina SquareThe Mandarin OrientalSingapore (039797)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Peking Duck with Traditional Condiments, Chinese Crepes & Homemade Sauce, Honey-Marinated Baked Cod Fillet with Black Pepper, Pan-Fried A4 Miyazaki Wagyu Beef Sirloin with Garlic Barbecue Sauce and Sautéed Vegetables, Five Grain Fried Rice with Cantonese Pork Sausage & Vegetables
data.ABOUT:
One of the most beautiful restaurants in Singapore, Cherry Garden offers an eclectic menu of Cantonese cuisine, presented with artistic modern flair. Entered via a striking antique doorway, the restaurant has been designed according to Feng Shui. Charcoaled teak panels and slate floors recreate the look of a splendid Oriental residence. 

Using fresh, seasonal produce, the menu changes regularly but always offers authentic Cantonese dishes. A varied wine list features a balanced selection of old and new world wines specially selected to match the menu. A wide selection of Chinese teas is also available. 
 
In addition to our main dining area, we have three private dining rooms. Lotus and Jasmine seat up to 12 guests each and can be combined. Bamboo is larger and can seat up to 24 guests. (Jan 2016)

data.title: Cheval Cafe Bar Bistro
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 1 Equestrian WalkSingapore Turf Club Riding CentreSingapore (737863)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cheval Platter, Waffle Sandwich, Truffle and Wild Mushroom Carbonara, Sea Meets Land, Lobster Bisque
data.ABOUT:
Named after the French word for horse, this restaurant serves up a range of brunch staples and mains in an upscale setting boasting an expansive view of the rolling greens of the turf club. This is the perfect spot for brunch with friends on the weekends, or a casual lunch date. 

The Smoked Salmon Salad is an excellent option for diners who are watching their waistlines. Made with tender pieces of smoked salmon tossed in crunchy greens, this dish is best enjoyed with one of their classic cocktails or the ever-popular Frozen Margarita. Not a fan of alcohol? Fear not, as the mocktail options are just as numerous. We like the Shirley Temple for it’s citrus flavour sweetened by a hint of Grenadine syrup. 

For something a little moreish, opt for the Sea Meets Land - the perfect dish for meat and seafood lovers. Think surf n’ turf, but more upscale - this dish is made with treasures from land, like foie gras and ribeye steak, as well as tiger prawns and scallops. This dish is large enough to be shared by two people. Don’t like sharing? Dig into one of their pasta dishes instead. The Crab Meat Marinara Spaghetti is a crowd favourite, and features juicy chunks of crab meat tossed in a tangy tomato sauce. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Cheval Chi Bao
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 2 Bukit Batok West Avenue 7#01-09BHometeam NS ClubhouseSingapore (659003)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hong Kong Roast Chicken, Curry Fish (Whole Red Snapper), Sweet & Sour Pork, Signature Truffle Fried Rice with Egg & Crispy Shredded Dried Scallops, Crispy Homemade Tofu with Minced Pork
data.ABOUT:
There are plenty of Chinese restaurants in Singapore, but few can offer the innovative dishes that Cheval Chi Bao does. Look past your run of the mill Curry Fish and Hong Kong Roast Chicken, Cheval Chi Bao draws on ingredients from other cuisines to create drool-worthy dishes using traditional techniques. With its inviting atmosphere and pocket-friendly prices, this is the perfect place to take your friends for a catch-up session over lunch or dinner.

Dig into the crowd favourite dish like Grandma's Prawn Ball - a dish that warms up your heart and gives you that nostalgic dining experience with your loved ones. Take advantage of their extended happy hour and grab a pint at half-price before 9pm on weekdays! Diners who prefer non-alcoholic beverages have the option of the ever-popular Thai Iced Milk Tea, as well as a range of fruit teas. 
Cheval Chi Bao Platter - Pandan Chicken or Thai Fish Cake are the perfect options for adventurous diners.  Choose 3 items from a wide range of platter with only $23 to satisfy your various appetites. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Chicken Up (Buangkok)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Watermelon Soju, Crispy Up, Spicy Up, YangNyum Up, Blooming Onion, Beerita
data.ABOUT:
It seems that Korean fried chicken has cemented its place in the Hallyu revolution, and fans of the crispy treat have had good cause to rejoice since the introduction of Chicken Up. Moist, tender, and coated with that addictive thin, crunchy, less greasy coating, Chicken Up's exact technique is a closely guarded secret.
While the classic version holds a special place in our hearts (and stomachs), those who enjoy a little spice should head straight for their signature Spicy Up and the milder, sweeter YangNyum style. Fried chicken in Korea is often accompanied by alcohol beverages but those not looking to take advantage of the restaurant's beer and soju offerings can easily content themselves with a traditional bingsu dessert instead. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Chicken Up (Tanjong Pagar)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Watermelon Soju, Crispy Up, Spicy Up, YangNyum Up

data.title: Chico Loco
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Not Your Average Nacho, Rotisserie Chicken & Lamb, Mexican ’Elotes’ Street Corn, Tacos, Grilled Marinated Chicken Thigh Burger, Chico Slaw, Churros and Coconut Soft Serve
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Winner of Best F&B establishment casual dining 2019 (Epicurean Star Award Singapore )

Chico Loco prides itself on delivering on taste without compromising on health with their concept of ‘dirty healthy plates’.

A meal here would be incomplete without their signature rotisserie chicken. Undoubtedly the star of the menu, this bird has been slow-roasted with Chico Loco’s signature herb blend for over an hour. Dip into any of their house-made sauces to enjoy a taste of Mexico and enjoy your mains alongside a selection of sides such as a refreshing Thai-inspired slaw. The lamb is also note-worthy. Each bite is beautifully tender with the perfect meat-to-fat ratio that just melts in your mouth.

Making a debut on the new menu after much demand are Tacos that The Loco Group are known for. Choose from 4 different delicious fillings such as the pulled rotisserie chicken, pulled slow cooked "barbacoa" lamb or mexican-spiced jackfruit. Finish your meal with crispy hot Churros or a guilt-free natural Coconut Soft Serve. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Chinoiserie
data.Cuisine: Modern European, Chinese, Fusion, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 2 Bayfront AvenueB1-15The Shoppes at Marina Bay SandsSingapore (018972)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Duck Foie Gras Xiao Long Bao, Steamed Scallop and Sea Urchin Har Gow, Crispy Scales Wild Coral Cod Fillet, Claypot Rice, Banana Flambe in Rum with Salted Gula Java Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Nothing is as you’ll expect when you come for a meal at Chinoiserie. A scallop har gow, for instance, is not just a plump sliver of scallop wrapped in a starchy white parcel. Instead, you’ll find your ‘dim sum’ presented as a light, fluffy scallop mousse, piped onto a hotate shell with a layer of crab bisque. There’s something new to discover each time you have dinner at Chinoiserie. Chef Justin Quek is no stranger to fine dining cooking, and he’s taken his knowledge of French techniques and married it with his penchant for Asian flavours. 

Menus here are prix fixe or a la carte, and you’ll find seasonal ingredients like French Challan ducks and Manjimup black truffles. But rather than roasted in their own fat, the gamey ducks, are tossed in a wok and cooked over roaring flames to medium rare. Vegetables like artichokes and asparagus are stir-fried Asian-style, rather than served as a Western salad. 

Popular favourites here include a wild coral cod fillet, seared till the scales are crispy and served in a sweet-sour sauce, as well as French poussin stuffed with claypot rice. Leave room for the desserts — the banana flambé in rum and salted gula java ice cream is a great way to end an ever interesting meal. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Chojiro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shrimp Nigiri, Kyoto Style Pressed Mackerel Sushi, Hanahitohira Set, Chawanmushi
data.ABOUT:
Well-known for its extraordinary sushi and sashimi, Chojiro serves a wide range of grilled and tempura dishes to satisfy your cravings. A snugly hidden gem in Telok Ayer, this affordable conveyor belt sushi restaurant from Osaka is staffed by a team of six experienced Japanese sushi chefs that plates up high-quality sushi offering you more bang for your buck. 

Nigiri lovers should definitely kickstart their meal with the Tuna Nigiri and Shrimp Nigiri. Served atop expertly rolled rolls of fluffy short-grained rice, the fish is fatty and luscious while the prawns are juicy and succulent. The classic Salmon Nigiri is also not to be missed out on! Plump and slightly chewy, the slices of raw fish are perfectly seasoned. 

For those feeling adventurous, you can opt for the Kyoto Style Pressed Mackerel Sushi. Packed with black fungus and mushroom bits, the slices of sushi are fragrant and extremely flavourful. Fancier options include the Hanahitohira Set. This exquisite meal includes as many as 10 different sushi such as Ikura Gunkan and Tuna Otoro Nigiri alongside traditional favorites such as the Chawanmushi. (May 2021)

data.title: Chong Qing Grilled Fish (Bugis)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Grilled Fish, Dry Pot Willow Mushroom, Hot-Plate Mutton with Cumin, Offal Slices, Spicy Chicken Cubes, Sichuan 'Water-cooked' Beef in Fragrant Chilli Oil
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Chong Qing Grilled Fish presents the best of grilled fish with Sichuan hotpot as well as other classic and modern renditions of authentic Sichuan cuisine. With its first dining concept set up in 2010, Chong Qing Grilled Fish is the first in Singapore to brings to the local F&B scene the best representation of the vibrancy and multiplicity of Chong Qing cuisine. To sum up, the brand represents ‘A Celebration of Cultures’, fusing authentic Chinese cuisine with innovative modern creation; taking diners on a gastronomic and cultural experience.

Chong Qing cuisine has always been known for its deliciously bold flavors, unapologetically rich, savory and spiciness. The soup base is packed with heavenly flavors of the stock and various ingredients have been sensibly incorporated for that added richness to appeal to the younger crowd and elderly folks. (Jan 2021)
