data.title: Chopsuey Cafe Dempsey
data.Cuisine: Chinese, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Traditional Har Gao, Crispy Lobster Wantons, Orange Duck Dumplings, Cooky’s Pork Chop with Chips & Edamame, Szechuan Pepper Chilli Chicken, Steamed ‘Lasagna’ of Snapper & Tofu
data.ABOUT:
Brought to you by the same guys who own homegrown culinary behemoth PS.Cafe, Chopsuey Cafe promises an East-meets-West escapade with its intriguing bevy of traditional Chinese dishes and creative new takes on favourites which pay homage to the relief and fond memories of tucking into comfy Chinese food while abroad.
Tucked away within hip Dempsey Hill, Chopsuey is situated within a charming black-and-white colonial-style building. Take a seat within and enjoy the wide selection of  traditional and creative dim sum handmade daily and steamed-to-order. From the humble Traditional Har Gao and Char Siew Pau to the more decadent Crispy Lobster Wantons and Orange Duck Dumplings, we love all of them. Don’t forget to enjoy a few of the brunch specials, featuring the likes of the tantalising Bully Beef & Crackling Egg Pie and the irresistible Chopsuey Big Breakfast, where generous portions of crispy bacon, eggs, sesame-soy mushrooms, sweet & sour baked beans, and other wholesome goodies are served up on a platter piping hot. As for mains, the Hainanese-inspired Cooky’s Pork Chop with Chips & Edamame as well as the Steamed ‘Lasagna’ of Snapper & Tofu are hot favourites that you cannot miss. Wash it all down with a refreshing cocktail, concocted with the freshest fruits, herbs, and spices from the region.
One thing’s settled, for your favourite Chinese dishes with a twist, look no further than Chopsuey Cafe. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Choupinette
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eggs Benedict, French Toast, Croque Monsieur, Quiche of the Day, Apple Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Hidden away in the Bukit Timah enclave, this quaint cafe has been serving up classic French dishes since 2002. The menu boasts a variety of brunch items, tartines, mains, and desserts, making it a perfect stop at any time of day.

The all-day brunch plates offer the ultimate comfort food experience. Regular patrons swear by the Eggs Benedict, where two perfectly poached eggs and ham sit on toast, drizzled with creamy hollandaise sauce. For those who prefer something sweet to start the day, go for the French Toast that's drizzled in a berry compote, or pick from a selection of freshly-baked pastries.

Other quintessential French favourites include the Croque Monsieur, an open-faced ham sandwich topped with melted cheese, and the Quiche of the Day. No meal would be complete without a serving of their savoury Apple Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream, or the burnt goodness of a Crème Brûlée.

The cafe also doubles up as a baker, with homemade loaves displayed in rustic wooden baskets. You won't be able to resist picking up a few on your way home. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Chuan Hung
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mian Yang Noodles, Fried Crispy Pig Intestines, Braised Eggplant
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Chuan Hung’s name is beautifully straightforward belying the respect, thought and care that was put into it, much like its offerings. Chuan Hung or ‘Sichuan Alley’ focuses wholeheartedly on one particular Sichuan ingredient known as Mian Yang rice noodles. At Chuan Hung, these noodles are served the way they have always been for millennia: with a choice of different broths, and a variety of toppings such as braised beef and pig intestines.
Chuan Hung’s rice noodles are, admittedly, a little more distinctive: they are specially sourced from one particular artisan who lives in a village deep in Sichuan. Research for months into about 50 different Sichuan noodle shops led the Chuan Hung team to understand that only one particular shop sold the exact type and style of Mian Yang noodles that they wanted to present to Singaporeans – but it took close to a year and dozens of personal trips to the shop in sincere appeal before the owners finally softened and agreed to speak to them. It took even longer to research and try the different noodles the artisan made: every detail was examined, down to the gauge of the noodles in millimetres.The noodles now served in Chuan Hung are customised for the noodle house, and found nowhere else in Singapore or South East Asia. The noodles may be ordered with the clear or red soups as well as the uniquely Sichuan mix of red and clear. In addition, Chuan Hung also offers a third broth option: a deceptively clear soup that is piquantly infused with Sichuan vine pepper, and a dry-tossed version. Those with bigger appetites can feel free to order “add-ons” as extra toppings for the noodles, and a curated selection of small plates – archetypal Sichuan sides such as Fried Crispy Pig Intestines and Braised Eggplant – as accompaniment.
The interiors of Chuan Hung is deserving of attention from the diner as well. Located in a side alley just off the far busier main street in much the same way that noodle shops in China have been set up for years, Chuan Hung is a little haven of gently coloured wood, bamboo furnishings and warm lighting. The small space of half a dozen tables – bustling when full, and tranquil when quiet – is inspired by the aforementioned noodle shops though elevated with thoughtful design details to ensure comfort for the guest even at the busiest of times. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Chug Chug (PLQ)
data.Hours: Kitchen: Mon-Fri: 11am-3pm, 5-10pm Sat-Sun: 5pm-1am      Drinks: Mon-Fri: 11am-1am Sat-Sun: 5pm-1am
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Milky Mushrooms, Japanese Pidan Tofu, Tom Yum Seafood Pasta, Scallop Mentaiko Pasta, Chug's Prime Beef Burger
data.ABOUT: Chug Chug has always envisioned to become the second home for everyone. We play with Western and Asian flavours in our first outlet at Tanjong Pagar and always try to come up with interesting new twists and fusions. For our second outlet at PLQ 3, we are using mainly Korean and Japanese flavours and creating our very own versions of comfort food. From hearty stews to savoury wagyu sandos, we strive to provide a completely different twist and flavours from our first outlet - keeping it fresh and exciting for our Chugger family! Pop by to try! (Dec 2019)

data.title: Chug Chug Singapore
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Milky Mushroom, Japanese Pidan Tofu, Fresh Oysters, Chug Chug Tom Yum Pasta, Truffle Mushroom Pasta, Chug's Prime Beef Burger, Fish & Chips.
data.ABOUT:
After a long day at work, it’s time to retire to your second home: that place where you can chill with friends, grab some tasty food, and maybe trade a few nuggets of office gossip. Chug Chug promises to be that home away from home, and it helps that the food and drinks here are stellar. Kick off your post-work feast with some of their signature Fired Milky Mushrooms or Japanese Pidan Tofu, or opt for the succulent Fresh Oysters for a bit of mid-week indulgence. There are also nods to zi-char food with their mouth-watering Fried Garlic Pork, perfectly complemented by some Karaage Chicken.

More hefty fare comes in the form of pastas, including an unusual Bacon Aglio Olio, ropey pasta with charred bacon tossed in a delicious sauce of garlic infused olive oil, Parmesan cheese, and plenty of chili. The signature pasta here is the Chug Chug Tom Yum Pasta, featuring seafood tossed in a citrusy and creamy Tom Yum Sauce that’ll you definitely be back for. Do not miss the kitchen’s spin on the classic Beef Burger. The Chug's Prime Beef Burger features a beautifully charred U.S.A prime beef patty served with onion jam, arugula, monterey jack, aged cheddar and fries. Wash that all down with a frothy pint and you’ll be so at home you might not want to grab that Uber back to your actual place!

data.title: Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Crab, Braised Duck, Boiled Live Prawns, Chilli Crab, Teochew Style Roasted Suckling Pig, Fish Maw Soup with Crab Meat, Teochew Braised Duck, Deep Fried Ngoh Hiang, Claypot Braised Beancurd with Seafood, Braised Conpoy with Eight Vegetarian Treasures, Orh Nee, Encrusted Deep Fried Yam Sticks
data.ABOUT:
Located on a quiet side street off Newton Circus flanked by towering apartment blocks is a very unlikely building. The structure is a sight to behold: through an ancient Chinese gateway with giant roaring lions guarding either side of its doors lies the Chui Huay Lim Club. Founded in 1845 as a place for prominent Teochew families to meet, you wouldn't guess the site's 166-year history from the brand new building that just opened in October.
The home of Singapore's oldest Teochew community club, you can be sure that dining at Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine restaurant is one of the most authentic Teochew experiences possible. Run by the JUMBO Group of Restaurants, the food here has been refined to perfection by the keen eyes of generations of critical Teochew matriarchs. Classic dishes range from Cold Crab to Braised Duck, but for variety you'll also find some familiar favourites like Boiled Live Prawns and Chilli Crab. The seafood comes from tanks lining the restaurant, and was some of the best steamed pomfret the Chope Team has ever had. The house specialty though is clearly the Teochew Style Roasted Suckling Pig, which multi-generations seem to flock to the restaurant for day after day.
Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine offers traditional cuisine in a comfortable and tasteful setting - a must-try dining experience for your entire family, and you don't even need to be a member of the club! (Feb 2012)

data.title: Chunqiu Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fish with Pickled Vegetables, Black Pepper Sauce Beef Cube, Dumplings Stuffed with Pork and Chives, Homemade Winter Melon Tea
data.ABOUT:
Chunqiu Restaurant, also known as Spring and Autumn Restaurant, is a restaurant dedicated to serving the most exquisite dishes from Shandong’s rich culinary history and culture. Combined with the freshest ingredients that accentuate and elevate ancient recipes, it’s the perfect place for the modern gastronome. 

With an extensive variety of dishes on offer, Chunqiu Restaurant has something for everybody. Seafood lovers should try the Fish with Pickled Vegetables. The tang of the pickled vegetables perfectly complements the sweet and tender meat of this fish. If you prefer red meat, try the Black Pepper Sauce Beef Cube. The intense flavours of the black pepper sauce from the spices perfectly enhances the juicy beef. Cut into cubes, every inch of the meat is entirely coated with this sauce.

If you prefer something small, try the Dumplings Stuffed with Pork and Chives. The pork is tender and flavourful, while the chives give a burst of flavour that will leave you wanting more. End your meal with the sweet and refreshing Homemade Winter Melon Tea. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Chutney Mary (East Coast)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pani Puri, Pav Bhaji, Dokla, Shammi Kebab, Tandoori Chicken, Raan Peshawari, Goan Prawn Curry, Butter Chicken, Allu Gobi Mattar
data.ABOUT:
Imagine walking along the busy streets of an Indian town, chomping heartily on some crispy samosas while slurping up some refreshing lassi, a welcome respite from the hot Indian sun. Now, experience incredible India not too far from home as Chutney Mary transports you there with their popular Indian street-style delights. 
We hear their piping hot chaats are consistent crowd favourites and we instantly see why. Choose from more than 10 options hailing from all across India, but we recommend the Bhel Puri, a tantalising combination of crispy flour pancakes and puffed rice served with onions and potatoes mixed with spices. Meat-lovers will enjoy the interesting selection of kebabs and scrumptious mains like Butter Chicken, Goan Prawn Curry and Raan Peshawari, a spring lamb leg marinated in yoghurt, herbs and spices. Vegetarians alike have a wide selection to choose from, but we say go for the Allu Gobi Mattar, a gorgeous dish of potatoes mixed with yummy cauliflower and green peas.
Pair your dishes with some Naan or Dum Biryani, wash it all down with a Mango Lassi, and there you go, satisfying Indian food at reasonable prices doesn’t take a trip to India to find! (Jul 2016)

data.title: Cibo Italiano
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Puccia, Ravioli Aragosta & Granchio, Bolognese, Tagliere di Affettati, Porcini  Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Specialised marts are fast becoming the norm here - if you've never browsed through the quirky and unusual items in a Japanese grocery store, you're really missing out - and Cibo is undoubtedly one of the best we have.
If you're a nonna at heart, their extensive range of quality basics to more artisanal ingredients and drinks imported straight from Italy, will have you in raptures of joy. Neatly displayed in the modern store, the open wood and metal shelves stand out against the white exposed brick walls, and invite you to browse the aisles stocked with things you'd never find in our general supermarkets.
But as all good nonnas know, nothing beats actually trying the products. The good news is - you won't have to go far! Cibo cannily provides a menu of handmade dishes like Lasagna and Ravioli Porcini & Tartufo (homemade egg pasta stuffed with porcini and truffle in creamy sauce), appetisers like Tagliere di Addettati (a selection of cold cuts) and Puccia, their own special sourdough sandwich stuffed with Italian special varieties, as well as a long list of pizzas. If you're simply peckish, their fresh cheeses and wines make for a good snack as well.Perhaps this really is your first foray into specialised marts. In which case, Cibo's friendly staff, attractive mix of traditionally Italian items, modern grocer décor, and unpretentious Italian classics, will have you glad to say 'Ciao'. (Jan 2016)

data.title: Cicada Singapore
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 3 River Valley Road #01-10 Clarke Quay Block C Singapore (179022)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cicada Smokin’ Dumplin’s, Sakura Ebi Capellini, Forest Fungi Thin Crust Pizza, Trio Chocolate
data.ABOUT:
Fancy a romantic getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city? A tropical paradise conveniently located right in the heart of Singapore’s busiest district, Cicada is the perfect place in Clarke Quay for intimate meals, social gatherings, company get togethers, after parties and everything in between. 

Replete with lush and leafy foliage, the soothing interior is bathed in natural sunlight and makes for the perfect lighting for brunch and dinner dates. Offering one-of-a-kind concoctions with signature boba cocktails and cocktails on tap, Cicada serves up an array of delectable modern Asian tapas made from quality ingredients. Helmed by Chef Derek, the passionate team behind the scrumptious dishes are well-trained by him. With more than a decade of culinary experience, Chef Derek has been instrumental in innovative cuisine development and business profitability. 

Beautifully plated, the Sakura Ebi Capellini features a char-grilled king prawn and sakura ebi garnished with bonito flakes and shredded nori. Other equally mouthwatering dishes include the Forest Fungi Thin Crust Pizza, Cicada Smokin’ Dumplin’s and Trio Chocolate. For those feeling adventurous, opt for the Cake of the Day for a sweet surprise. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Citrus By The Pool
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 11am-10:30pm (Last order at 9:30pm)Fri-Sun & Public Holidays: 11am-11pm (Last order at 10pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Seafood Pasta, BIG Boss Burger, Cajun Lamb Rack, Catch of the Day, Smoked Duck Breast, Molten Chocolate Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
Take respite from Singapore’s sweltering heat at Citrus By The Pool, a cosy, air-conditioned restaurant with large windows letting in lots of natural light. Conveniently located at the Woodlands Swimming Complex (a 10-minute walk or short drive from both the Woodlands and Marsiling MRT stations), Citrus By The Pool is a great for a relaxing meal or a casual tea with friends. 


The menu offers a variety of appetizers plus Fusion mains, thirst-quenching drinks, and desserts at pocket-friendly prices. The star of the menu is the Tom Yum Seafood Pasta, where the spicy and piquant flavours of a Thai classic have been expertly interpreted into a contemporary pasta dish, replete with fresh prawns, mussels, and squid. Dare to be bold and different with the Chef’s specialty BIG Boss Burger which consist of a tender and juicy beef + mutton (BM) patty, accompanied with crispy fried onions, sliced tomato, cucumber, crispy lettuce and purple cabbage slaw, smothered in the all-time favourite satay sauce on charcoal buns. Of course, no meal is complete without dessert and the Molten Chocolate Lava Cake is not to be missed. These incredibly decadent individual chocolate cakes with oozing molten centres are the best way to end off a great meal. Citrus By The Pool is an ideal option for all kinds of celebrations and every meal in between. (Jan 2019)

data.title: City Hot Pot Shabu Shabu (Guoco Tower)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Scallops, Homemade Prawn Paste, Wagyu Chuck Eye Roll, Braised Pork Rice, Fried Tofu Puff
data.ABOUT:
A view of the CBD. Quality meats. Interesting soup bases. City Hot Pot Shabu Shabu checks all of these boxes. Located at the tallest building in Singapore, City Hot Pot Shabu Shabu's second outlet at Gucco Tower is the hot pot restaurant to go to after work when you’re craving for something comforting and soupy.

The soup bases here are extensive, from Herbal Chicken to Tomato and Korean Kimchi flavours. Most interesting is the fish soup with milk, a soup base not commonly found in many hotpot restaurants in town. Order this creamy rich broth and get plenty of seafood to swish in it, such as plump juicy scallops, fresh fish fillets and prawns, homemade prawn paste and clams. They also serve individual hotpots for hot pot fans we are not keen on sharing.

If you’re a meat lover, City Hot Pot offers quality meats at great value. Tuck into beautifully marbled cuts like wagyu chuck eye roll and Angus short ribs, and savour the meats as the melt easily in your mouth. (Oct 2019)

data.title: City Hot Pot Shabu Shabu (Raffles Place)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Scallops, Homemade Prawn Paste, Wagyu Chuck Eye Roll, Braised Pork Rice, Fried Tofu Puff
data.ABOUT:
A view of the CBD. Quality meats. Interesting soup bases. City Hot Pot Shabu Shabu checks all of these boxes. Located on level 4 of One Raffles Place, this is the hot pot restaurant to go to after work when you’re craving for something comforting and soupy.

The soup bases here are extensive, from Herbal Chicken to Tomato and Korean Kimchi flavours. Most interesting is the fish soup with milk, a soup base not commonly found in many hotpot restaurants in town. Order this creamy rich broth and get plenty of seafood to swish in it, such as plump juicy scallops, fresh fish fillets and prawns, homemade prawn paste and clams.

If you’re a meat lover, City Hot Pot offers quality meats at great value. Tuck into beautifully marbled cuts like wagyu chuck eye roll and Angus short ribs, and savour the meats as the melt easily in your mouth. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Clan Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cage-Free Fry Up, Steamed Mussels, Miso Roasted Salmon, Pastrami Sandwich
data.ABOUT:
Clan Cafe brings the essentials of good living into one ethereal space. The all-day menu delivers nourishing fare that comforts both the palate and the soul with its selection of brunch favourites and East-Asian inspired plates.


Start the day off right with a healthy homemade granola, or nosh on brunch staples like smashed avocado toast to a good classic fry-up – eggs any way you like – to stay energised throughout the day. Beyond the usual brunch fare, expect hearty offerings with distinctive Asian inflections. Indulge in an irresistible bowl of mussels in an aromatic coconut curry with crusty garlic bread – perfectly paired with a crisp white wine, tuck into a wholesome miso-roasted salmon brown rice bowl with seaweed and pickled lotus root, or settle for a crowd-pleasing pastrami sandwich with crispy shoestring fries. 


Enjoy a moment of calm from the daily grind with a slice of your favourite chocolate cake or kueh salat, complemented with a cup of coffee by Papa Palheta or invigorating tea blends by A.muse Projects. Recharge with a variety of locally-brewed kombuchas and cold pressed juices, or relax and unwind with an elegant selection of wines, craft cocktails and premium gin & tonics.



A tropical respite in the heart of the Chinatown precinct, the cafe is here to host your daily breakfast conversations, lunch meetings, and gatherings all throughout the day. The cafe extends to a tropical floral concierge by This Humid House – set against a whimsical botanical mural by Ripple Root. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Clinton Street Baking Company
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken & Waffles, Pancakes with Warm Maple Butter, Eggs Benedict, Southern Breakfast, Huevos Rancheros, Clinton Street Omelette, Blueberry Pancakes
data.ABOUT:
The first global outpost of the famous New York institution, Singapore's Clinton Street Baking Company is like a cleaned-up, swisher version of the slightly weathered original that, over almost three decades, has won ceaseless crowds over with its comforting brunch options and charming East Village bonhomie. Already a popular favourite amongst in-the-know brunch crowds here, the Singapore outlet at quiet Purvis Street offers an understated variation of the bustling New York experience.
All the classics from its savoury-sweet Southern-style brunch menu are here in Singapore: crispy-skinned and tender Buttermilk Fried Chicken served on maple-kissed waffles, and fluffy hotcakes slicked with warm maple butter then paired with your choice of tangy blueberry compote, chocolate chunks, or banana walnut.
What's brunch without some eggy indulgence? Other New York staples include the ubiquitous Eggs Benedict, here served over a crumbly Southern buttermilk biscuit, and hearty Huevos Rancheros - fried eggs in a party of Mexican beans, guacamole, sour cream, and tomato salsa, all topped with a heap of Monterey Jack, then broiled to cheesy perfection. The unspoken crowning glory here is the brunch cocktails you can get round the clock for that real "Sex and the City" touch of weekend revelry; Mimosas, Bellinis and Whisky Sours paired with your carby breakfast keep Brunch O' Clock going before you sensibly sober up with a bracing black coffee and hit the town. (Nov 2016)

data.title: Clos Pasoh
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Foie Gras, Tête de Veau, Trippes et Caviar, Bisque Coco-Homard, Pot-Au-Feu, Volaille aux Écrevisses, Mont Blanc Cassis, Chariot de Riz Au Lait
data.ABOUT: Nestled in the Bukit Pasoh conservation area, Clos Pasoh is a chic reimagining of the French brasserie for today's urbane food and wine lover. Both its menu and wine list reflect current tastes for seriously good things sourced with intent and expertise presented in an unpretentious, casually sophisticated style.Hidden away on the second floor of a heritage building built in the early shophouse style circa 1840, it is named for the clos (meaning a "walled vineyard" in French) and the pasoh (a nod to its location and the Malay name for earthen pots used to store water and rice). Every space - from the Dining Room to the Terrace, Wine & Cheese Room and Chef's Table - cradles guests in effortless luxury that is designed to take you from tête-à-têtes and power lunches to lazy weekend brunches and lively nights on the town. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Cloudstreet
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Celebrated Chef Rishi Naleendra proudly unveils his highly-anticipated new undertaking, Cloudstreet, a showcase of thoughtful, expressive dishes and immaculate service distilled through an unrivalled culinary experience.

What started as a chance encounter between Chef Rishi and Gareth Burnett, Cloudstreet's General Manager, resulted in the genesis of a concept that reflects the duo's shared desire to create a dining room that exists on the philosophy of true hospitality. Joined by Sommelier Vinodhan Veloo, whose expertise has led him to devise the wine programs at Michelin-starred venues, they have forged the perfect team to see this vision to fruition.

Guests can expect a progressive yet sophisticated approach to gastronomy - marrying disparate cultures and influences in an exuberant expression, it champions ingredient-driven cuisine and seasonality. The food is enhanced by a wine list featuring around 350 natural and classic style wines which pay homage to some greats alongside small, independent winemakers from around the world. The restaurant has a strong focus on beverage pairings both alcoholic and temperance.

Choose from 5 or 7 courses at dinner, with a few bits and pieces to bookmark the menu, and for lunch a choice of 3 or 5 courses. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Clove
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Modern European, Fusion, International, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Burgers, Vegetarian, Dessert Only
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.ABOUT:
Look no further than Clove for comfort food with a gourmet touch! Boasting an exciting casual concept, the restaurant impresses with a wide variety of handcrafted burgers that are sustainably sourced alongside healthy salads, irresistible drinks and decadent sweet treats. Great for families, Clove also has a specially curated kids menu to cater to the little ones! 

Quench your thirst at Clove with one of their six boozy milkshakes. A coffee-inspired rendition, the Kopi Cane is infused with a shot of plantation original dark for a strong yet refreshing kick. Known as Singapore’s biggest burger, The Big Devil Burger is a must-order dish that draws in handsome crowds daily. Presented with three signature fries, a portion of this gigantic burger serves up to six pax and consists of braised pulled pork, seared foie gras, cheddar cheese, streaky bacon and a host of other mouthwatering ingredients you simply can’t miss out on trying. 

Other delightful burger and shakers options await you at Clove. Tickle your tastebuds with The Greek Wedding or Double Up to enjoy Stanbroke Angus beef patties done differently and paired with bacon, pickled chili, cheddar cheese between two fluffy buns. Vegan and vegetarian options are available on the menu as well. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Coastes
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Big Bad Wolf Pizza, Coastes Chicken Wings, Eggs Benedict
data.ABOUT:
Sometimes, we forget we live in the Tropics, where people travel miles to for their summer vacations. When that happens, we need places like Coastes to remind us what life can be like as an islander, eating and drinking on one of the nicest beaches we have to offer.

Situated along a golden stretch of Sentosa's Siloso Beach, Coastes offers rustic charm and a casual, laid-back beach vibe where the sunbeds and deck chairs flow right to the water's edge. This breezy beach bar serves premium beers, house pour spirits, and hearty beach food. It has been a popular spot for families with young children precisely for the kid-friendly food as well as for couples on romantic dates and beach bums who would enjoy the stretch of lovely warm sand. Coastes is the perfect place to chill while indulging in good ol’ comfort food, so tuck into the generous servings of mouthwatering burgers, pizzas, pastas, and delicious fresh seafood, and soak in the resort island-feel and carefree vibe. The meals here are soul-warming and homely, so with the sun, the sand, and the sea, we can't think of a better island getaway less than an hour away from the heart of the city. (Sep 2016)

data.title: Cocobolo Poolside Bar + Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 1 Unity StreetLevel 2Park Hotel Clarke QuaySingapore (237983)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: A La Carte Local and International Fare: Nasi Goreng, Seafood Char Kway Teow, Singapore Laksa, Satay, Angus Rib-Eye, Trio Cheese Pizza and Chicken Teriyaki Sandwich.Weekend Free-Flow BBQ Dinner, Roast Pumpkin, Oven-baked Cauliflower with Mint Yogurt, Warm Pudding, Chilled Desert in Casserole
data.ABOUT:
Cocobolo Poolside Bar + Grill is a fun-filled poolside retreat at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay offering an impressive char-grilled spread that has been a weekend destination for visitors and in-the-know locals alike.

There's nothing quite like an outdoor grilling party. The sounds of splashing in the pool just seem to harmonize with the sizzling of the grill. And if the scent of flame-kissed steaks getting its caramelized char from the grill doesn't get your mouth watering, few things will! This is the concept behind this hangout venue, where instant summer pool parties are a daily affair from its lively outdoor grill and bar.

Weekend Free-Flow BBQ Dinner (available on Fridays and Saturdays) consists of a heavenly combination of charcoal-grilled premium meats and succulent seafood like New Zealand Angus Beef, Australian Rack of Lamb, Assorted Grilled Sausages, Stingray with Spicy Shrimp Paste, Tiger Prawns with Saffron Spices, and Turmeric Spiced Squids that are expertly prepared by an efficient team of chefs, alongside mouth-watering spreads of appetizers, sides and desserts. 

On weekdays, there's no shortage of refreshing tipples and sumptuous local and international favourites for you to kick back and relax with friends, colleagues and associates, as the sun dips down below the garden lined horizon - amid a kaleidoscope of lights, sights and sounds in the buzzing neighbourhood of Clarke Quay, Singapore's top entertainment hotspot. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Coleman's Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Scallop Salad, US Black Angus Tenderloin, Five Spice Lamb Rack, Atlanic Cod, Thai Red Curry Chicken, Japanese Katsudon, Banana Spilt
data.ABOUT: Located on the fifth floor of Peninsular Excelsior Hotel, Coleman’s Cafe takes its name from the eponymous street it is located on. With both indoor and outdoor seating, the buffet spread here is a feast of local to international delights. For starters, tuck into the slices of sashimi or seafood on ice. Craving a lighter start to the meal? Opt for a simple salad or soup to whet your appetite. No buffet is complete without a live carving station, and Coleman’s Cafe checks this box. Head to this station for hearty cuts of meat, with chef’s recommendations being the skewers of lamb, chicken, salmon or prawn. Get a selection of these as well as a side serve of fried potato sticks and salad for a balanced and satisfying meal. Don’t miss out on the DIY Ice Kachang for dessert! (July 2018)

data.title: Colonial Club Signatures
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address:
290 Orchard Road
#B1-43
Paragon Shopping Centre
Singapore (238859)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hainanese Chicken Rice, Nasi Lemak Tower, Nyonya Laksa, Hainanese Chicken Chop
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Get a taste of nostalgia at Colonial Club Signatures and embark on a gastronomical journey through Singapore’s rich culinary heritage.
Savour a delectable mix of heritage cuisines, including Hainanese style western delights, Nyonya dishes and local favourites with British-Colonial influence. To curate the menu, the chefs had traveled to different parts of Singapore and Malaysia to suss out the dishes that is most representative of the colonial era; and diligently mustered their recipes to showcase the best of Singapore's colonial favorites. Don't miss the signature Hainanese Chicken Rice, Nasi Lemak Tower, Nyonya Laksa and Hainanese Chicken Chop. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Colony (The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore)
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Japanese, Indian, Indonesian, Malaysian, International, Seafood, British, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fresh Oysters & Sashimi, Foie Gras, Colony Laksa with Homemade Lobster Ball, Hainanese Chicken Rice, The Upper Crust
data.ABOUT:
At first glance, Colony looks like yet another hotel buffet restaurant, but a clever hand with the interior blends the nostalgia of a bygone British-colonial era with more modern trappings. Partitions, vintage furnishings, and a smattering of tartan and houndstooth prints provide the charm, but it’s the impressive gastronomic journey that will keep you coming back for more.
The seven kitchens and accompanying 'live cooking stations' highlight the best of local cuisines and include Chinese, Indian, Indonesian, Malaysian, and Western dishes. You'll be inundated with choice - fresh seafood, perfectly grilled meats, laksa and other signature Singaporean dishes, dim sum, breads baked the traditional Tandoor way, and a wide variety of pastries and desserts. Wash it all down with refreshing juices or seek out Colony's resident mixologist to whip up specialty cocktails like the "Bengal Brew" or the "Governor's Invitation". Diners looking for buffet options that cover the expansive culinary heritage of Singapore will not be disappointed. (Nov 2016)

data.title: Columbus Coffee Co.
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Low & Slow Beef Brisket, Breakfast Steak & Eggs, Smoked Salmon Benny, Cereal Prawn Pasta, Beef Bolognese
data.ABOUT:
From the folks that brought you Lunar Coffee Brewers and Atlas Coffeehouse, comes this classy addition to the Upper Thomson cafe strip. Named after the great explorer Christopher Columbus, this sizeable spot serves up dishes inspired by a range of cuisines - this is not your usual cafe fare.

The Soft-Shell Crab Burger is a crowd favourite, and for good reason. Fluffy brioche buns encase a crisp deep-fried soft shell crab patty topped with delicious furikake eggs and caramelised onions. The curly fries on the side go perfectly with the rich burger. Another popular, albeit lighter, option is the Salmon Soba Noodles. Made with poached salmon, bouncy soba noodles, and topped with cilantro-lime nori yogurt, this dish is tangy, gentle on the palate, and won’t undo any diet plans you may have. For something a little sweeter, opt for the Candied Bacon Buttermilk Waffle, a soft waffle served with bacon that has been tossed in sugar - the unique sweet and salty flavour combined with the tenderness of the waffle makes for a delicious and memorable dish.

Cafe junkies after their caffeine fix will be glad to know that Columbus offers specialty coffee from local roasters Two Degrees North. From a smooth latte to a sophisticated v60 filter brew,  the rigorous standards and consistency held by the team is the foundation of their success.  (Oct 2018)

data.title: Comida Mexicana
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Burrito with Chipotle Cream Sauce, Carnitas, Mexican Yucatan Chicken, Enrollados, Kabrita, Chimichanga, Mashed Avocado Sopes, Chorizo with Red Wine
data.ABOUT:
Feast on a spread of classic Mexican favourites at Comida Mexicana! In a sign of the restaurant’s dedication to authenticity and quality, the dishes served are made from scratch using fresh ingredients imported directly from Mexico and the US. Expect dishes that are as much a feast for the eyes as they are for the stomach – vibrant colours abound in lip-smacking creations such as the Chipotle Sweet Potato Bowl.

Start off with a serving of Chile Con Queso, an addictive combination of jalapenos, melted red cheddar and jack cheese, as well as onions and tomatoes. This one will tickle your taste-buds and get your appetite all whetted and raring to go. For your main, you can’t go wrong with a good helping of Carnitas, or traditional Mexican pulled pork. This yummy dish comes with warm corn tortillas, salsa rojas, salsa verde, and guacamole – a real scrumptious option that’s worth every cent, if you ask us. Finish off on a high note when you scarf down a sweet treat such as the Kahlua Tiramisu, which gives a distinctively Mexican twist to this beloved Italian classic. Strong in flavour and extremely indulgent, there are few better ways to end your meal. If you’re up for good Mexican grub, Comida Mexicana is the place to visit. (Nov 2017)

data.title: Common Man Stan
data.Cuisine: Australian, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: New York Bagels, Broiche French Toast, Common Man Fluffy Pancakes, CMCR Full Breakfast, Grilled Juicy 'Chilli' Chicken, Cubanos Sandwich, Common Man Burger
data.ABOUT:
Have you met Stan? The man of the people, Stan is a no-nonsense straight-talker who champions good coffee done right. That’s the promise behind the unpretentious cafe Common Man Stan, located in the heart of the Central Business District, and boy has the establishment succeeded at delivering what it set out to do.  

Brought to you by the people behind Common Man Coffee Roasters, Common Man Stan is a mecca for those who love their cups of joe. Aside from turning out Instagram-worthy cups of espresso, Common Man Stan also boasts cutting edge brewing gear and tapped in nitro cold brew and tea! 

Whether you’re an early riser who prefers to kickstart the day with a hearty breakfast or a late owl who crawled out of bed just in time for lunch, Common Man Stan has you covered.  Have your pick with a freshly made New York Bagel topped with herb garlic or sun-dried tomato cream cheese. We also can’t get enough of droolsome Potato & Leek Rosti, which is perfectly paired with wild mushrooms, gruyere and chilli poached eggs on toast. So if you’re in need of a midday caffeine boost or a scrumptious meal, swing on down to Common Man Stan. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Communal Coffee
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: B&B Waffles, Classic Carbonara, Sunny Egg Croque Madame, Yummie Sarnie, Toastwich
data.ABOUT:
Sharing its space with Stage Music Bar, this spot is a coffeehouse by day and live music venue at night. Founded with the aim of giving communities a free space to meet and mingle, this casual joint in the heart of the city is perfect for everything, from casual weekend brunches to serious business meetings. Serving coffee approved by the Specialty Coffee Association, the brews here are sure to impress connoisseurs.

Heading here for breakfast? Brave the Pancake Tower, a pile of thick, fluffy pancakes topped with a range of ingredients, such as fruit and crumbled cookies. Seafood lovers can opt for the Crab Wrap, a tortilla wrap filled with mesclun salad and a generous portion of lightly sweet crab meat. For something a little moreish, be sure to try the Chicken Aglio Olio, a light dish of linguine topped with smoky grilled chicken and seasoned with chilli flakes. Lightly spicy, flavourful, and filling, this is a great option for lunch. Watching your waistline? The Spanish Flying Fish might be what you need. Light barramundi is fried to crisp perfection and served with searing pico de gallo and salsa. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Como Cuisine
data.Cuisine: Modern European, International, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kingfish Sashimi, Our Big Raw Salad, Lobster Roll, Snapper Curry, Maori Lakes Lamb Cutlet, Burrata Tartine, French Toast, Chocolate
data.ABOUT:
Clean, contemporary, and healthful. That’s the philosophy underpinning the cooking at COMO Cuisine, a dining establishment that formerly existed as a pop-up but has now found a permanent home on the chic grounds of COMO Dempsey. 

By drawing inspiration from the region’s rich culinary heritage, the restaurant surprises and astounds with its clever use of Asian ingredients and techniques. Perennial favourites include the heaping Our Big Raw Salad, which features a guilt-free indulgence of fresh and raw fruits and vegetables. There are a number of featured dishes inspired by the Indian subcontinent, such as the crunchy Samosas stuffed with spiced lamb and topped with a sweet and tangy mango chutney. Or opt for the Lamb Kofta, which has a hint of smokiness from the tandoor that’s fired by coconut charcoal. To make dining a family-friendly affair, the restaurant shies away from predictable kids’ menus. Instead, COMO Cuisine encourages young diners to expand their palates by choosing any dish that is served in a smaller portion. 

Designed by Italian architect and designer, Paola Navone, COMO Cuisine’s decor is a stunning interplay of light and elegant elements to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. Come for the innovative food, but stay for the warm ambience and truly exceptional dining experience that makes you feel like royalty. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Conrad Lobby Lounge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Quiet Dinner

2 Temasek Boulevard
Conrad Centennial Hotel
Singapore (038982)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ronnefeldt Tea, Morgentau, Pastrami and Egg Salad with Swiss Cheese, Avocado And Cajun Sauce, Singapore Laksa, Smashed Avacado, Smoked Salmon Sourdough Toast & Hainanese Chicken Rice
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Tucked off to the side of the hotel's lobby, and impeccably dressed in its cushioned chairs and wood paneling stands Conrad Centennial's Lobby Lounge - an oasis of old world charm, sophistication, and delicious food. On weekdays, they offer an afternoon tea set that includes a selection of sandwiches, pastries and sweets.

Afternoon tea is, was, and always will be one of the best ways to indulge yourself. And at the Lobby Lounge, they wouldn't have it any other way. (May 2021)

data.title: Cook & Brew
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
12 Marina View
Level 33
The Westin Singapore
Asia Square Tower 2 Singapore (018961)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Whipped Buffalo Milk Ricotta Cheese, Roasted Arctic Cod, Beef Pot Roast, Handmade Ricotta Cavatelli, Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cake
data.ABOUT:
It’s easy to lose track of which bar is which amidst the slew of hotel bars in Singapore. Not so for Cook & Brew, which stands out from the rest with its vast selection of craft beers, mouthwatering nosh, and tasteful aesthetic (think dark red leather bar stools and a black marble-topped bar). The food isn’t any run of the mill finger food; rather, take your pick from a range of skilfully-cooked local and international delights that will be sure to impress even the most discerning palate.
Kick start your meal with bar bites including Pad Thai Fries, a delicious combination of sweet potato fries tossed in a heady mix of pad thai sauce and freshly squeezed lime, adorned with chicken, prawns, crushed peanuts and dried sakura shrimps, and Whipped Buffalo Milk Ricotta, Truffle Honey and Grilled Bread – whipped to create a delicate texture and sweetened with truffle honey to complement the crusty grilled sourdough, alongside a selection of craft beers. For dessert, you definitely can’t go wrong with the decadent Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cake.
It’s hard not to have a wonderful time at Cook & Brew, with its quality eats and tipples (don’t forget to make use of the beer pairing suggestions for your dish). Don’t just take our word for it though - head down sometime soon for an exquisite dining experience you won’t forget! (Dec 2020)

data.title: Cool Cats
data.Good For: Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Duck Roll, Fried Padron Peppers, Wasabi Prawn, Kinglas Fillet
data.ABOUT: Paint the town red on a night out at Cool Cats, The NCO Club's live music lounge and cocktail bar, which sees a stalwart assembly of musicians from the local circuit gracing its stage weekly. Curated by head mixologist Nicola Paterno, discover 14 signature cocktails dedicated to the history of jazz, revolving around stories about the mavericks and legends behind the genre. With each signature drink inspired by a particular moment in time and distinct flavour profile, choose from sultry and smooth to edgier and more up-tempo creations as the music take you away.Live music performances start at 9.30pm. (March 2020)

data.title: Copper
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address:
167 Penang Road
#01-01 Winsland House
Singapore (238462)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tenderloin Beef Steak, Seafood Soup Noodles, Barrel Aged William Wallace cocktail, Coppertone cocktail, Grilled Stingray Fin
data.PRESS RELEASE: The only bar in town to offer 2 styles of craft highball served direct from the tap, fresh and crisp; a great accompaniment with our modern Asian-inspired foods. Or indulge in some of Cadenhead whiskies; the world’s oldest independent bottlers. Here at Copper, you will be pleased to find the drinks are as well crafted as the foods. Whether you’re a whisky connoisseur, or simply looking for a trendy spot to imbibe and indulge, Copper will check all your boxes for a great night out. (Jun 2021)

data.title: Copper Chimney (Marina Bay Financial Center)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
12 Marina Boulevard
#02-01
Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 3
Singapore (018982)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Chicken, Chicken Tikka Biryani, Paneer Manchurian Gravy, Gulab Jamun
data.ABOUT:
The Copper Chimney chain of restaurants has long been recognised as a place for hearty Indian and Indian-Chinese fusion dishes under one roof, with long queues testifying Singaporeans’ seal of approval for the fare served.

Dig into favourites like Butter Chicken with tender chunks of chicken swimming in creamy tomato-based sauce, or Mutton Roganjosh for a spicy kick. Don’t forget to order a basket or two of naan to soak up the flavourful gravies and curries. Briyani lovers will also be delighted to know that there are no less than five types of this famed rice dish to choose from.

If you're up for an adventure (which is highly recommended at Copper Chimney), go for their unique fusion dishes that marry the best of Indian and Chinese cuisine. You can't go wrong with the Paneer Manchurian Gravy, where cottage cheese cubes are submerged in a spicy and tangy sauce. Their Triple Szechuan Rice is also popular.

End the meal with a variety of traditional Indian desserts like Gulab Jamun and Pistachio Kulfi, or perhaps a refreshing Mango Lassi to wash all the goodness down. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Copper Chimney (Syed Alwi)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fish Tikka Masala, Mutton Roganjosh, Veg Jaipuri, Chicken Lollipop, Rumali Roti, Sizzling Brownie with Ice Cream
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Amongst the hustle and bustle at the heart of Little India’s Syed Alwi Road, a Chindian restaurant is spicing up the vibrant Indian food scene with a new chef and a new menu.
Copper Chimney, the 10-year-old Syed Alwi flagship which prides itself in its distinctive North Indian and Chinese Indian cuisine, has gotten a fresh new interior on Level 2 with cosy private dining rooms and a revamped menu since CEO Adnan Bamboat took over in 2014.

Diners can choose from a wide variety of vegetarian and meat dishes on the new menu.  For vegetarians who want to try something different from the popular paneer variations, they can tuck into the Methi Malai Mutter, a creamy Punjabi dish of peas cooked in fenugreek leaves and spices. The Veg Jaipuri, a Rajasthan dish featured in Copper Chimney’s newly revamped menu, consists of a colourful medley of spring vegetables, simmered delicately in piquant cream, and served on a bed of peppered papad shards.
Seafood and meat lovers can tuck into Copper Chimney’s Fish Tikka Masala, one of the most popular Indian dishes in the United Kingdom, and the Mutton Roganjosh, a delightful Kashmiri dish that’s brimming with flavours of fennel, ginger and marked by a striking red hue. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Coq & Balls @ Tiong Bahru
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 6 Kim Tian Road Kai Fook MansionSingapore (169246)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lemongrass Chicken Wing, Chicken Quesadilla, Coq’s Delight Pizza, Green Curry Chicken, Minced Pork Basil and Fish & Chips
data.ABOUT: Tongue-in-cheek is fine, especially when taste-in-mouth is this good. With a bold name like Coq & Balls, you'd expect merry vibes and strong drinks, and you'd be right. With a variety of beers & ciders - bottled and draught - from the US, Japan, Britain, France, Germany, and also local original brews, the list reads like the United Nations of beer. Also featuring ciders, single malt whiskeys, cheeky cocktails, wines and sake, Coq & Balls has always been generous in letting you pick your poison.With raw, modern furnishing, an eclectic mix of jams and TV screens ready for the big game, it made sense that the owners drew inspiration from Melbourne's alternative bar scene. So we were not surprised to see filling tapas like Lemongrass Wings, Popcorn Chicken & Nachos, even a special Thai cuisine to escort our drinks. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Coriander Leaf @ CHIJMES
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Watermelon, mint, pomegranate, Turkish white cheese (v), Pomelo, green mango, coriander leaf, chili-lime dressing, Samia's signature frontier chicken, coriander seeds, chilli, yogurt cream, mizuna, lemon, Miso marinated silver cod, Braised beef brisket, kimchi, daikon slaw, steamed bun, Charcoal baby lamb chops, harissa, yoghurt, dried chili paste, pickled onions, Soft shell crab, salted duck egg yolk sauce, curry leaves, Bulgogi wagyu short ribs, wok-fried bean sprouts, sesame, Spiced Valrhona lava cake, teh tarik ice cream, White rabbit, ice cream sandwiches
data.ABOUT:
Dining at Coriander Leaf is akin to taking an unforgettable culinary journey through Asia, where memories of authentic flavours and journeys are evoked as friends, loved ones, and dining companions share in an exceptional sensory experience together. Established in 2001, the Coriander Leaf brand is one of the most recognised names in Singapore’s food and beverage industry, and with its delectable Pan-Asian cuisine, it comes as no surprise!

The menu is divided into five flavour profiles: fresh, familiar, spicy, umami, and sweet.  While each dish is amazing, the standout is the Samia’s Signature Frontier Chicken with Coriander Seeds, Chilli , Yoghurt Cream, Arugula, and Lemon - it’s a dish that guests return to Coriander Leaf for time and time again! Otherwise, the Charcoal Grilled Baby Lamb Chops, Harissa, Yoghurt, Dried Chilli Paste, Pickled Onions is a crowd favourite too! The mélange of flavours ranging from the spicy dried chilli paste to the zesty harissa, sour pickled onions and milky and creamy yoghurt is truly a treat for your stomach! With time-tested dishes that have diners returning for more, it’s no wonder that Coriander Leaf stayed on as one of Singapore’s most loved restaurants! (May 2017)

data.title: Corner House
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, French, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
1 Cluny Road
Singapore Botanic Gardens
EJH Corner House
(Nassim Gate Entrance)
Singapore (259569)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Chef David’s Archard, Wagyu2ways, Rendang, Canapé, Koo Chye, Chicken Satay, Risotto & Mont
Blanc
data.ABOUT:
Founded in 2014, Corner House is the articulation of a culinary vision by creative restaurateur and
wine aficionado Renny Heng. Its name references the eminent botanist E.J.H. Corner, whose former
abode is now a fabled, irreplaceable Black and White Colonial House and the sophisticated setting
for a Michelin-starred restaurant. Its location in the UNESCO World Heritage Site Botanic Gardens
sets the stage for a multi-layered meal that combines its storied past, the botanical bounty of the
world, and a future that looks towards exhilarating, modern French-Asian interpretations by
Executive Chef David Thien from Bordeaux
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Since taking the helm of Corner House in March, just two weeks before stringent Covid-19 measures
took hold of the island-state, Executive Chef David Thien has spent his time dreaming up culinary journeys for returning guests. Even while the restaurant team contributed to feeding frontline heroes during this period, Chef Thien was inspired to compose a poem for the description of a mystery dish. Finally, with the lifting of dining-in restrictions on 19 June, Corner House is thrilled to reopen to the public with a daringly original new menu that showcases its prowess in contemporary seasonal cuisine.
Since its opening in 2014, Corner House has earned multiple recognitions including the award of one-Michelin-star since 2016 and a rise to #42 on Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants 2020 list. The
appointment of French-Chinese-Mauritian David Thien ushers in a fresh perspective as he debuts an exploratory world of fine flavors, inspired by his adopted home of Singapore since 2007.
The eagerly anticipated new menu at Corner House showcases intimate sessions where Chef Thien prepares dishes inspired by personal stories, thoughts, and memories. The dining experience is designed to inspire and surprise. He elaborates, “My hope is that guests develop a deeper
appreciation and connection with the food that they eat, relishing the thought behind it.”
The menu continues to be organized by three, five, and seven-course sets for lunch, and five, seven, and chef’s course for dinner. Guests are presented with chapters authored by chefs, detailing stories
accompanied by visuals that delve into each ingredient or concept. The menu is dynamic and everchanging to adapt to the seasons, sources, and customers. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Coucou
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Canton of Fribourg cheese, Potato Rosti with Beef Patty, Fillet of Trout in Geneva Style, Zurich style Ragout, Ovaltine Mousse
data.ABOUT:
For a spot that dishes out classic Swiss cuisine, head to Coucou. This no-frills restaurant serves a good selection of Swiss cold cuts and cheeses, from Canton of Fribourg and Bern to Valais & Vaud.

While cold cuts are a delicious start to the meal, the rosti selection here is also not to be missed. The Potato Rosti with Beef Patty, for instance, is a hearty affair showcasing a generous minced patty blanketed in melted Swiss raclette cheese and some onion confit.

For mains, try the Fillet of Trout cooked Geneva-style — with salty capers, butter, and lemon for a kiss of citrus. Also good is the Zurich-style Ragout, where your choice of veal or chicken is grilled until tender and swathed in a creamy mushroom sauce. End dinner on a sweet note with Ovaltine Mousse served with shards of spiced gingerbread. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Coyote Ugly Saloon
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Coyote Shooter, Road Kill, Burger
data.ABOUT:
An iconic establishment with 25 franchises around the globe, Coyote Ugly Saloon brings to Singapore nights of great booze and entertainment. Inspired by a cult movie with the same name that was aired in 2000, the bar’s decor is reminiscent of an American diner filled with witty graffiti. 



Grab a beer and sit back in comfort as you relish in the well-rehearsed dance routines performed by female bartenders. Known as Coyotes, the bartenders are dressed in eye-catching plaid shirts, denim shorts, rhinestone belts, bandanas and cowgirl boots. They take to the stage every 20 minutes to wow the crowd with their show-stopping moves. 



Opt for a platter of bar bites and cocktail refills during breaks between the performances to keep your energy levels up. Platters start from $35 and consist of generous servings of chicken and fries, with a side of authentic smokey barbeque sauce. The bar also offers separate appetisers such as burgers and pizza for those who want more.



As the most famous bar on the planet, Coyote Ugly Saloon is a one-of-a-kind bar and restaurant that provides one stop entertainment all seven days of the week. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Craft Pizza
data.Good For: City Views, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Craft Red, Carne Rossa and Spicy Arrabbiata, Black Truffle
data.ABOUT:
Dedicated to creating the most delicious artisanal pizza using only the finest high-quality ingredients and authentic techniques, Craft Pizza’s superior pizzas demonstrate the prowess of their team of skilled artisans love of tradition and craftsmanship.

Made from a unique blend of four different types of flour, the pizza crust receives special attention from the poolish to the fermentation process, resulting in a crust structure that is light and airy with a crisp exterior texture. Placing a strong focus on sustainability and the procurement of the finest imported Italian San Marzano Tomatoes, homemade sausages and cheese, together with other locally sourced produce, Craft Pizza brings to diners a luxurious dining experience with Italy’s most well-loved dish. 

Have your pick of white or red pizza bases. Signature red pizzas include the Craft Red, Carne Rossa and Spicy Arrabbiata. For those leaning towards white pizzas, the Black Truffle pizza is a tasty option made of homemade ricotta cheese and layered with truffle, fontina cheese and aged parmesan — the perfect pick for truffle and cheese lovers. Alternatively, craft your very own artisan pizza by mixing and matching your favourite sauce and toppings. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Crossings Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
55 Waterloo Street
#01-01
Catholic Centre Building
Singapore (187954)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crossings Laksa, Miso Pork Burger, Truffled Mac & Cheese, Signature Chilli Crab Pasta, Fish & Chips
data.ABOUT:
Cosily ensconced along Waterloo Street, Crossings Cafe is a casual dining spot with a social cause — giving back to charity and providing employment opportunities for the disadvantaged. From the menu, tuck into comfort nosh such as Mushroom Soup, Crossings Laksa, or a hearty Fish & Chips. A bowl of creamy soup, laced with slivers of chunky mushrooms, is a warm, fuzzy way to start the meal. Laksa and curry are two popular Asian staples, and they grace the menu at Crossings Cafe with much aplomb. The Crossings Laksa, in particular, is a crowd-favourite; thick rice noodles in a rich coconut curry gravy is packed chock-full of plump fishcakes, springy tau pok (beancurd), prawns, and crunchy bean sprouts. 

For a Japanese-inspired take on a classic, the Miso Pork Burger showcases a juicy slab of miso-marinated pork belly sandwiched between toasted buns. In the mood for something heartier? Tuck into the chef’s signature Fish & Chips served with crisp, fluffy fries. Or try the Truffled Mac & Cheese, where smoky bacon and pasta are baked together in a blanket of golden cheese, with lashings of fragrant truffle oil. Wash it all down with fresh juices, or a Belgian Trappist beer. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Crown Coffee
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala Vegetarian, Pesto Chicken Sandwich, Crown’s Thick Burger with Truffle Fries, Curry Seafood Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Serving honest coffee one cup at a time, Crown Coffee acts as the converging point for people to nourish, socialise, and unwind with hearty cafe fares. Using only the freshest ingredients with no artificial flavourings, the cafe seeks to offer good food in a place with good vibes abound. 

Enjoy lunch perks when you pick up a quick meal during your mid afternoon break or grab a coffee to perk you up and fuel you the busy day ahead. A fiery bowl of US asparagus, tomatoes, button mushrooms, fresh rocket, the Mala Vegetarian is finished off with parmesan shavings and drenched in a flavourful Mala sauce. 

Prefer eating clean? The Pesto Chicken Sandwich is a delicious option featuring Italian herb-marinated grilled chicken stuffed with lettuce, sliced tomatoes, and slathered with mozzarella cheese with pesto spread. Big eaters, on the other hand, can opt for the Crown’s Thick Burger with Truffle Fries. Slapped between two fluffy brioche buns, the house made beef patty is tender yet succulent. Bite into one to savour the harmonious taste of crispy bacon, avocado, beef and melted cheese. Made for sharing, the Curry Seafood Pizza is a localicious spin featuring prawns, mussels and squids. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Crystal Jade Dining IN
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Baked Crab Shell stuffed with Seafood Paste, Sautéed Beef Cube in Black Pepper Sauce, Pan-fried Kurobuta Pork Chop with Teriyaki Sauce, Deep Fried Butter Prawn, Sauteed Scallop with Walnut in Spicy Sauce, Braised Ee-fu Noodle with Live Prawn in Black Truffle Oil, Homemade Crispy Seafood Spring Roll with Portuguese Sauce
data.ABOUT:
The décor is modern, but still recognisably Chinese, and boasts plenty of seating meant for large groups. No surprises there since even the name draws inspiration from the dining table, a central anchor in the life of a typical Chinese family.
Likewise, the menu features plenty of favourites and an abundance of sets that might make ordering for your passel of folks that much easier. Think Baked Crab Shell stuffed with Seafood Paste, Sautéed Beef Cube in Black Pepper Sauce, Deep Fried Butter Prawn, Braised Ee-fu Noodle with Live Prawn in Black Truffle Oil and Pan-fried Kurobuta Pork Chop with Teriyaki Sauce. It’s a smorgasbord of delectable items ranging from the tried-and-tested abalone and fresh seafood to meats and vegetarian creations jam packed with flavour. The name ‘Crystal Jade’ is a crowd favourite in all its iterations and, given the quality and ambience of Crystal Jade Dining IN, it looks like its stellar track record remains yet to be beat! (May 2016)

data.title: Crystal Jade Golden Palace
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions
data.Address:
290 Orchard Road
#05-22
The Paragon
Singapore (238859)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sautéed Carrot Cake with XO Sauce, Double-Boiled Chicken Soup with Fish Maw & Dendrobium, Baked Lamb Rack with Red Wine & Pepper, Angel Hair Pasta with Seafood & Black Truffle, Roasted Suckling Pig with Black Truffle Pearl Rice, Poached Garoupa with Chinese Wine, Pan-Fried Japanese Wagyu Steak with Sea Salt, Crispy Chicken with Foie Gras & Mango, Fried Minced Grain Rice with Prawn Bits
data.ABOUT:
Walking past the grand entrance of Crystal Jade Golden Palace and into the equally opulent dining space, 'sumptuous' may very well be the only worthy description. In true Crystal Jade style, the décor boasts neutral colours, underscored by shades of berry, and eye-catching light stands. It's a timeless ambience, bold enough to have you steeped in admiration, but subtle enough that it doesn't take away from the main highlight - the food.
It is the modern, prettily plated Chinese dishes that are, for the most part, comforting in their familiarity, but will occasionally throw you for a loop with unexpected ingredients or presentations. Hint: some of the dim sum pastries come in quirky forms! Sample the Combination of Chilled Foie Gras with Japanese Sake, Chilled Abalone & Crab Meat Salad, or Sautéed Carrot Cake with XO Sauce.
Like some of its other sibling restaurants, the menu boasts multiple pages dedicated to a variety of premium ingredients, from bird's nest, abalone, and shark's fin to exquisite soups like Buddha Jumps Over The Wall and live seafood such as lobster, Sri Lankan crab, or succulent prawns and fishes. The selection is truly vast - a blessing when catering to a range of tastes and diets - and the urge to order more than you can stomach will be strong.
The next time a family occasion rolls around, this restaurant should top your list of places to go! (May 2016)

data.title: Crystal Jade Hong Kong Kitchen (Causeway Point)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address:
1 Woodlands Square
#05-10
Causeway Point

data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Pork Belly, Black & White Har Kau (Shrimp Dumpling), Homemade Charcoal Tofu with Assorted Mushroom, Fried Brown Rice with Black Bean Dace Fish & Egg White, Double-boiled Cordyceps Flower & Peach Resin in Chicken Soup
data.ABOUT: Indulge in the rich flavors of Crystal Jade Hong Kong Kitchen, where you can find your favourite Cantonese Hong Kong dishes prepared by our stellar team of talented chefs. Inspired by joyous dining occasions with hearty laughter amongst family and friends, satiate with a line up of piping hot Dim sums, velvety Hong Kong Congees and Noodles, Roasted Delicacies and heavenly Wok dishes and relax with loved ones in a relax and causal setting. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Crystal Jade Hong Kong Kitchen (Great World City)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address:

data.title: Crystal Jade Jiang Nan (VivoCity)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cheesy Crisp Mochi Ball, Pu-Er Tea Smoked Crispy Duck, Sautéed Spicy Shredded Pork with Assorted Mushrooms & Asparagus, Poached Fish with Mustard Greens in Hot & Sour Broth, Stir-Fried Shredded Glazed Cabbage with Shiitake Mushroom,
data.ABOUT:
At Crystal Jade Jiang Nan, the food of the region south of the Yangtze River is firmly on display here. Best known for its skillfully crafted snacks and delicacies, this cuisine leans towards subtle and light flavours that will nevertheless tantalise your tastebuds.  

With bamboo shoots being one of the region’s most cherished crop, it’s inevitable this ingredient would make its way onto the menu. Under the deft hands of the chefs, this eatery spins this humble ingredient into culinary gold, creating dishes such as the intensely fragrant Stewed Bamboo Shoot and Deep-fried White bait in Wuxi Style. The delicious yet nutritious Double-boiled Chicken Soup is another dish that will undoubtedly impress any health-conscious diner. Meanwhile, one cannot pass up on the Crystal Jade Steamed Assorted Flavours Xiao Long Bao. These little balls of perfection come in an assortment of flavours which include salted egg yolk, chilli crab, and mushroom. For those with a sweet tooth, prepare to indulge in the many desserts that include the Pan-fried Red Bean Pancake and Osmanthus with Wolfberry Cake. 

There may be no lack of Chinese food in Singapore, but for discerning foodies like us, Crystal Jade Jiang Nan holds a special place in our heart thanks to its unique regional fare and swift service. (Aug 2017)
