data.title: Crystal Jade Palace
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order 2:30pm), 6pm-10:30pm (Last Order 10pm)Sat: 11am-3pm (Last Order 2:30pm), 6pm-10:30pm (Last Order 10pm)Sun & PH: 10:30am-3pm (Last Order 2:30pm), 6pm-10:30pm (Last Order 10pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crystal Jade Suckling Pig, Roasted Crispy Pork Belly, Roasted Peking Duck, Sautéed & Deep Fried Whole Live Garoupa, Double boiled Whole Yellow Melon Soup with Assorted Seafood, Braised Superior Bird’s Nest with Crab Meat and Crab Roe, Braised Whole Fresh Australian Abalone with Oyster Sauce, Baked Australian Live Lobster with Superior Stock, Pan-fried Beef Fillet with Lingzhi Mushroom, Braised Seasonal Vegetable with Crab Roe, Braised Three Types of Vegetable in Oyster Sauce, Braised Lingzhi Mushroom with Vegetable with Mushroom, Fried Rice with Seafood & wrapped in Lotus Leaf, Crystal Jade Palace Fried Rice, Deep-Fried Rice Roll with Salted Egg Yolk Shrimp
data.ABOUT:
Like a grand dame that’s stood the test of time, Crystal Jade Palace remains an elegant mainstay in one of the most iconic malls along Orchard Road. The neutral colours and dark woods create a timeless ambience as points of light from the magnificent crystal chandeliers sparkle off the reflective surfaces of marble and glass. But what’s looks without substance? Crystal Jade Palace’s classy décor is only superseded by their masterful Chinese cuisine.
Be spoilt for choice from authentic Cantonese dim sum, congee, appetisers, traditional roasted classics like Peking Duck and Suckling Pig to Bird’s Nest, Abalone, Lobster and Live Seafood. Crystal Jade Palace seeming endless iterations of family favourites makes a clear winner for families looking to order items like Roasted Peking Duck, Sautéed & Deep Fried Whole Live Garoupa, Double boiled Whole Yellow Melon Soup with Assorted Seafood, Fried Rice with Seafood & wrapped in Lotus Leaf, Pan-fried Beef Fillet with Lingzhi Mushroom and more! It takes a lot to remain constant in Singapore’s culinary scene but Crystal Jade Palace sure makes it look easy! (May 2016)

data.title: Cuba Libre Cafe & Bar (Clarke Quay)
data.Cuisine: Bar, Spanish, South American, Vegetarian Friendly, Caribbean, Mexican, Cuban
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mojito Chicken, Ropa Vieja, Nachos, Garlic Prawns, Summer Crab Rolls, Colombian Empanadas, Beef Rendang Croquetas
data.ABOUT:
Cuban fare may just have found its way to our shores, but it’s already developing a growing fanbase. Cuba Libre- named after the highball rum and coke cocktail - aims to cater to that fanbase and create new converts with its selection of seafood platters and Spanish-inspired meals.

Located in the party central of Singapore, Clarke Quay, this is the perfect place to go for a hearty pre-drink meal or a tipple or two to fuel your wild night out. Cuba Libre at Clarke Quay has an extensive selection of whisky, gin, tequila, and much more at affordable prices, so you can drink to your heart’s desire.

Offering a new menu with healthy and contemporary Latin American fare, their irresistible signature dishes include the famous Mojito Chicken and Seabass Ceviche that will make your tummy growl for more. Explore the Cuban culinary cuisine with Cuban sandwiches, Roasted Butternut Squash Soup, Argentine Style BBQ Pork Ribs and so many more! (Jan 2019)

data.title: Cuba Libre Cafe & Bar (Frasers Tower)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mojito Chicken, Ropa Vieja, Paella, Classic Signature Mojito, Vinales Board, Seabass Ceviche, Crab Spring Roll, Rack Of Lamb, Chicken And Mango Salsa Wrap, Seafood Jambalaya
data.ABOUT:
This is the tamer, more elegant sister of the Cuba Libre outlet in Clarke Quay. Serving up Spanish inspired fare for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, this restaurant has been a hotspot for Tanjong Pagar natives since its opening in 2006. With a bright interior and a warm atmosphere, this is the perfect place to grab drinks with friends on the weekend. With a menu inspired by the Caribbean, as well as parts of Asia and Europe, the food here draws inspiration from plenty of sources, but the combination of flavours is set to wow your tastebuds.

The Seafood Jambalaya is a unique dish native to Louisiana and made with tomato rice, parsley, mozzarella, and chilli. This hearty plate is topped with a healthy portion of tiger prawns and mussels for a rich seafood flavour. Carnivores will love the Rack Of Lamb - meat marinated with mushroom pepper sauce and served with tomatoes, asparagus, and capsicum. The lamb is tender and buttery, and the pepper marinade gives it just the right amount of spice. For a hearty meal, opt for the Chicken And Mango Salsa Wrap. The combination of sweet and savoury flavours, along with the spice in the accompanying condiments makes for a unique dish that will leave you wanting more. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Cucina Restaurant & Catering
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gamberi al sugo di Pomodoro, Pizza Oli di Funghi e Tartufo, Pizza Quattro Stagioni, Lombata d'agnelio alla Griglia, Primo a base di carne
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Cucina Restaurant & Catering is a Halal-certified and NEA licensed establishment that prides itself on the quality of our food. Serving up a mouthwatering fusion of flavours derived from a variety of Western, Malay, Italian, Chinese & Fusion dishes. 

 
With our range of salads, antipasti, seafood & meat dishes as well as fantastic pizzas and pastas, your party would surely find something that fits everybody across the table. In addition, we also do indoor and outdoor catering, mini buffets, bentos, themed parties and cater to events for all occasions. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Cure Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
An exciting venture from Chef and owner Andrew Walsh, Cure Singapore on Keong Saik Road is a creative shophouse space offering a casual yet refined environment to dine, drink, and whisk the night away. 

Integrating many years of his experience cooking in acclaimed Michelin star kitchens across Dublin, London and New York Chef Walsh's fervour for presenting only the finest seasonal produce, ingredients, and flavours shows in each dish presented at Cure. Unconstrained by cuisine, technique, or theme, expect to be blown away with a revolving menu, top-notch service, and unique dishes that transcend time! (Mar 2016)

data.title: Curry Bowl
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Chicken Masala, Prawn Chettinad Gravy, Mutton Kola Urundai, Chicken Tikka Briyani
data.ABOUT:
Curry Bowl is a casual diner specialising in — you guessed it — curries! A variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian curries are served, with favourites including the Butter Chicken Masala, Paneer Tikka Masala, and Prawn Chettinad Gravy. Don't forget to order a basket of fluffy naan to soak up all the leftover gravy at the end of the meal.

Besides curries, a wide range of appetisers, tandoori, rice dishes, and more are available. For something unique, try the Mutton Kola Urundai with spice-flavoured mutton meatballs, or the Honey Paneer. If you’re looking for classics done right, you can’t go wrong with Chicken or Mutton Biryani.

Wash all that spicy goodness down with an ice-cold Sweet Lassi or comforting Masala Tea. (Dec 2019)

data.title: D9 Cakery
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic American Cheesecake, Yuzu & Passionfruit Cake, Signature Double Chocolate Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE: An afternoon tea affair with the finest Valrhona all-chocolate high tea set of sweet treats, chocolate fondue with accompaniments & savory gourmet canapés. Elevate the experience & top it up with a premium mixed cold seafood platter with ocean-fresh oysters, lobsters & a 2-hour free flow of bubbly Prosecco. (Mar 2021)

data.title: DD Eatzakaya
data.Cuisine: Bar, Japanese, Korean, Fusion, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Australian Lobster, Famous Pork Knuckle Bee Hoon, California Maki, Salmon Ikura Don
data.ABOUT:
An Asian fusion restaurant located in the heart of Chinatown, DD Eatzakaya is a fun-loving bistro and cocktail bar boasting charcoal grilled yakitori, artisan pizza, Japanese bubble tea and more all in one place.

Pamper yourself with a Donburi for lunch when you drop by the restaurant for a fuss free one dish meal. Alternatively, have a flaming good time with family and friends as you indulge in DD Eatzakaya’s wide selection of freshly grilled seafood in the state on your plates. Bestsellers include Grilled Australian Lobster, Medallion Scallops and Fresh Grilled Snow Cod Fish. For sushi lovers, there’s an abundance of sashimi and sushi bites available on the menu! The California Maki is a classic Japanese favourite that rewards with flavour and chunks of avocado, crab and cucumber. Fresh and crunchy, this delicious rice roll is a must order. Pair with your favourite alcoholic beverages for an unforgettable meal.

Other Asian-inspired fares on the menu include the restaurant’s Famous Pork Knuckle Bee Hoon. A yummy mix of fried bee hoon tossed with hearty portions of melt in your mouth pork knuckle, this bowl of Asian delight is sure to have you coming back for seconds! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Da Long Yi Hot Pot
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kurobuta Pork Belly, Golden Beancurd Rol, Handmade Meat Balls, Vegetable Platter
data.ABOUT:
If you’re a fan of mala hotpot (who isn’t?), you’ll want to book your seats at Da Long Yi. This Chinese export is well known for its fiery soup base, which comes with oil or butter to cut through the richness of the broth. 

The food portions here are generous as well. Pick from the usual platters of US beef or wagyu, Kurobuta pork belly or loin, as well as slices of lamb. The golden straw mushrooms are a universal favourite among the selection of vegetables, along with leafy greens such as spinach or Chinese cabbage. 

Fans of the six-second beancurd skin roll will also find this available on the menu here. Simply dip the golden beancurd roll into the soup to sop up all the flavours of the broth. Enjoy your meats and vegetables with your choice of condiments, from cut chilli to sesame oil and chopped coriander. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Da Paolo Dempsey Restaurant & Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Italian, Vegetarian Friendly, Pizza
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Baked Salmon and Avocado Kale Bowl, Butternut Pumpkin Mezzelune, Spicy Lobster Tagliolini, 8-Cheese Pizza, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
With a live pasta-making station and a lively Italian wood-fired oven, dining at Da Paolo Dempsey Restaurant & Bar is a visual treat.

For lunch, pick from a selection of Italian cold cuts and cheeses, or nibble on some antipasti like fresh calamari or burrata cheese with smoked eggplant puree. Healthy eaters will also love the Wholesome Kale Bowls, topped with delicious options such as Baked Salmon and Avocado Rice, or Beef Romanesco.

Come dinner, load up on freshly made pastas and pizzas. The Butternut Pumpkin Mezzelune is a vegan’s dream come true, with a light cashew cream and pumpkin carpaccio piped into delicate half-moon shaped pasta. Also good is the Spicy Lobster Tagliolini, featuring slipper lobster, a sweet tomato sauce, and plenty of garlic. Fancy a pie? The 8-Cheese Pizza is a different take of the usual quattro formaggi — with twice the cheesy goodness, and some smoked date cream and truffle honey to balance out the richness.

Save some space for the Tiramisu. Light, fluffy, and dusted generously with cocoa powder, this dessert is a sweet treat to be savoured at the end. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Da Paolo Pizza Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buffalo Wings, Truffled Mac & Cheese, Margherita Pizza, Tiramisu
data.PRESS RELEASE: Known as much for its authentic pizza as for its uniquely fun pizza flavors, the pizzeria also offers an array of salads that are impressively tasty yet healthy. The cow-hide ceiling makes an awesome setting for a glass of wine or craft beer with friends. (May 2019)

data.title: Daisy's Dream Kitchen
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Itek Tim, Kueh Pie Tee, Babi Pongteh, Beef Rendang, Sambal Stuffed Fried Fish, Nonya Chap Chye, Sambal Petai Ikan Bilis
data.PRESS RELEASE: Daisy's Dream Kitchen exudes the charm of the good old days of Singapore Kampong spirit, where mouth-watering Peranakan dishes and other local delicacies are made from scratch with plenty of heart and soul, and shared among friends. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Dallas Restaurant & Bar (Boat Quay)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Fries, Dallas Chicken Wings, Classic Wagyu Burger, Quesadillas Platter
data.ABOUT:
Located within the heart of Singapore, Dallas Restaurant & Bar is a contemporary bar-bistro concept with outlets at two prime locations in the central business district. A popular hangout spot for Singaporeans, expatriates and tourists alike, their Boat Quay outlet is the perfect choice for a mouthwatering lunch, a delectable dinner or just casual drinks. 

Dive into a tasty basket of Truffle Fries! Sprinkled with grated parmesan and truffle oil, these thick and crunchy fries are a huge hit among the young and old. Another all-time favourite is the Dallas Chicken Wings. Marinated, seasoned and chargrilled, the wings come paired with a homemade Dallas devil & ranch sauce that adds a wonderful burst of flavour. Looking for a larger bite? Served with Dallas fries and coleslaw, their Classic Wagyu Burger comes highly recommended. The hearty bun features American cheese, tomato, lettuce and caramelised onions atop a tender wagyu beef patty. For bigger gatherings, sharing platters such as the Quesadillas Platter and The Dallas Platter are noteworthy too. 

Offering an irresistible variety of culinary delights along with a great selection of fine wines, Dallas Restaurant & Bar is also a great venue to host corporate events, private parties and live sports screenings. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Dancing Crab (Orchard Central)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Dungeness Crab, Lobster Roll, Seafood Gumbo, Beer Batter Cajun Calamari, Crab Cakes
data.ABOUT:
Dancing Crab is at it again! With a new location at Orchard Central, they’re rolling out the same  intense Creole flavors at the Turf Club now smack-dab in the middle of the city.
Inspired by New Orleans, Louisiana, you can expect only the freshest shellfish, specialty lobsters, dungeness crab, and various other seafood critters to be hitting the table. All packed with tons of flavour, these babies are perfect for pairing with just about anything. So go ahead and order the Spicy Cajun Fries, the Seafood gumbo, and the Beer Batter Cajun Calamari!
Don’t forget to come prepared just in case those bold flavours take a liking to your clothes by leaving the white shirt behind. This is one place you want to get down and dirty! 
(June 2015)

data.title: Dancing Crab (Vivocity)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Dungeness Crab Combo Bag, Lobster Roll, Seafood Gumbo, Beer Batter Cajun Calamari, Crab Cakes
data.ABOUT:
Crabtastic news! The wildly popular Dancing Crab has now opened its claws at Vivocity so get ready to dig into finger-lickin' Louisiana seafood cuisine. Don’t worry though, they’ve got the same country-style Cajun recipes, flavours, and spectacular seafood favourites we fell in love with at the other outlets - so expect the same great treats!
We're talking about their Combo Bags bursting with prawns, clams, potatoes, corn and sausages, crowned with your choice of Sri Lankan crab, Dungeness crab or lobster. Add in their signature Dancing Crab sauce, and you've got hours a good eating. Irresistible sides like the Spicy Cajun Fries, Seafood Gumbo, and the Beer Batter Cajun Calamari are definitely a must-try so don’t forget to put in a few orders - you’ll be thanking us later.
Oh yeah, and don’t forget to come prepared just in case those bold flavours take a liking to your clothes by leaving the white shirt behind. Don't say we didn't warn you! (Oct 2015)

data.title: Dating Fish 鱼你有约“音乐主题餐厅
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Pepper Prawn, Grilled Fish, Marmite Chicken, Spicy Chilli Prawn
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Dating Fish is a musically themed restaurant that serves both an ala carte menu and also buffets.  

Staying true to the name, the restaurant offers free KTV sessions that can be enjoyed alongside their mouth-watering food and dining. 

It is an ideal venue for both business meetings in their private dining rooms and also for gatherings amongst family and friends. 

An evening spent here is guaranteed to leave a lasting and memorable impression for all. (Oct 2019)

data.title: De Dimension
data.Good For: Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mocha, Cheese Fries, Red Velvet Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE: Put yourself in the windy snow when the outside world is under tropical hot sun. Or be surrounded by the plants and flora deep inside the forest. Experience our immersive projection themes which bring you to the scenes where you may feel peace and joy. A place you can spend time with your friends, family, and loved ones for a relaxing moment in a busy day. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Decker Barbecue
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Brisket, Burnt Ends, Dinosaur Rib, Spare Ribs, Mac 'n Cheese, Brisket Beans
data.ABOUT:
Meat-lovers would be proud to call Decker Barbecue their second home. This casual, no-frills establishment located along charming Robertson Quay serves up authentic Texan-style barbecued meats that have gone through the time-honoured tradition of low and slow smoking within Decker’s custom-built smoker for 16 hours. 

A collaboration between Club Street Social and Bali’s famed Smokehouse BBQ, Decker also prides itself on quality meats at reasonable prices. Meats here are sliced to order and sold by weight, so you can have as much or as little as you like of that fall-off-the-bone goodness. Look forward to a meaty affair with Decker’s delicious Brisket, Spare Ribs, Buffalo Wings, and Chopped Beef. There is no bad choice here - the perfectly smoked meats are tender, juicy, and bursting with flavour. On weekends, treat yourself with the Pork Belly Burnt Ends and the aptly-named Dinosaur Rib, a succulent 600-gram bone-in beef short rib. The sandwich combos are also worthy of mention, and our favourite has got to be the “Big Daddy” Fried Chicken, where a chunky piece of crispy fried chicken is piled high with slaw, jalapenos, and barbecue sauce and slapped between two plump buns.

Amp up your meat order with classic all-American side dishes made in-house daily such as the Brisket Beans (barbecue baked beans and smoked brisket), mouthwatering Cornbread, and of course,  Mac ‘N Cheese. End off with the Banana Pudding with an authentic southern dessert that we just can’t get enough off. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Dejâvu Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Fries, Milk Ramen, Mala Fried Rice, Kani Mayo Sandwich
data.ABOUT:
Helmed by Michelin-starred chef Carles Abellan, Dejavu Bar is the first Asian outpost of the iconic Barcelonian concept. This elevated neighbourhood all-day tapas bar tucked away along Prinsep Street offers a buzzy atmosphere accompanied by unfussy service and sublime tapas. 

Featuring high quality Spanish products and a variety of authentic tapas dishes, discover the best of Spain’s viticulture with these curated offerings. Start off small with a platter of Truffle Fries or Popcorn Chicken before diving into the fresh catch of the day with the bar’s signature Fish & Chips. A hearty serving of fries and fish fillet, this delightful one meal dish tastes even better than it looks! 

Other innovative dishes here include Milk Ramen and Mala Fried Rice. Topped with generous chunks of perfectly diced seafood pieces, this fiery bowl of fried rice is a great way to end your night on a high note. Alternatively, drop by for a fuss-free afternoon pick-me-up from the bar’s wide selection of sandwiches. The Kani Mayo Sandwich and Fried Chicken Sandwich are signature favourites recommended for a quick snack. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Delhi Express Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Chicken, Mutton Briyani, Chicken Tikka, Kaju Masala
data.PRESS RELEASE: At Delhi Express, you will find all your favourite classic Indian dishes in one place. Located along 1 Hoe Chiang Road, the restaurant is within walking distance of Tanjong Pagar MRT. Here, we serve crowd favourites like Butter Chicken, Mutton Briyani and Chicken Tikka. It opens from 11am to 10pm, perfect for professionals and executives looking to satisfy any Indian food cravings during lunch and after-work hours. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Delhi Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Biryani, Fish Curry, Rumali Roti, Tandoori Pomfret, Butter Chicken
data.PRESS RELEASE:
A veteran of Indian dining since the 80s, it doesn’t get much better than this. Founded by a couple in 1988 with the aim of bringing the best of North Indian cuisine to Singapore, Delhi’s Restaurant has grown from strength to strength and now operates in two locations in Little India - on Serangoon and Race Course Road. If the posh saffron and wood interior isn’t enough to entice you in, the smells from the kitchen certainly will. Think spicy masala and freshly cooked naan. With friendly servers and an excellent array of dishes, it’s easy to see why the pioneering Indian eatery has built up a loyal following over the last three decades. 

The Romali Roti is a must-try. Translated to mean “handkerchief bread” this unique dish is made in an overturned wok to give it its delicate texture. The roti is paper-thin and soaks up the flavour of any curry that it is dipped into, making it the perfect accompaniment to the many curries on offer here. The Fish Curry is a great option for diners who are tired of the diluted versions offered at other restaurants. The curry is robust and spicy, and is best enjoyed with some steamed rice or naan bread to soak up all the flavour. (March 2019)

data.title: Deli's Kitchen
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 100% Kuroge Wagyu Avocado Quattro  Cheese Burger, Wagyu Hamburg Steak  Set, Ox Tongue Steak Don, Roast Beef Don, Hakata Black Curry
data.ABOUT:
This classy spot in Sunshine Plaza is the first offshore outlet of the beloved cafe which has been making waves in the Japanese dining scene for nearly a decade. The dishes on offer here are based on traditional dishes from all over Japan - from Osaka to Sendai, and the menu includes classics such as Hakata Black Curry and Ox Tongue Steak Don. 

The Avocado Quattro Cheese Wagyu Burger is perfect for health nuts who are looking for something moreish. The Wagyu Burger is cooked to your desired doneness, topped with creamy avocado and a decadent helping of cheese. The buns are soft, fresh and have an added crunch from the sesame toppings.

The Hakata Black Curry is a unique dish of rice, vegetables, and thick gravy. The curry is made with miso, chicken and pork broth, and spices. Mix the steamed rice that comes with this dish with the curry and vegetables provided for a dish that is filling, healthy, and flavourful. 

Adventurous diners can opt for the Ox Tongue Steak Don, a beloved delicacy of Sendai. The meat is grilled to perfection and is tender and juicy, which goes perfectly with the fresh steamed rice the dish comes with. (June 2018)

data.title: Der Biergarten
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Goulasch Souppe, Roast Pork Knuckle, Sausage Platter, Boxing Drumlet, Deep-Fried Mushroom Fritters
data.ABOUT:
Nestled along a row of shophouses on Prinsep Street, Der Biergarten, ‘The Beer Garden’ in German, has been attracting quite the crowd for its accessible and mouthwatering German beer and dishes. Inspired by the traditional beer gardens typically found in the Bavarian region, the unassuming space is perfect for an intimate dinner or post-work drinks.

Tuck into German classics like the Goulasch Souppe, a luscious and nutritious beef stew served with fluffy German bread, or the traditional Sausage Platter, featuring a medley of different sausages along with the typical German sides of mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. The Roast Pork Knuckle, a famed favourite, is an oven-roasted pork hock served with dark beer gravy, mashed potatoes, and sauerkraut - a definite crowd pleaser as well. Crispy, crackling skin gives way to tender, succulent meat accentuated by the bittersweet notes of the dark beer gravy.

Looking for finger food to accompany the drinks instead? Tantalising bar bites such as the Boxing Drumlet or the Deep-Fried Mushroom Fritters are the perfect partners-in-crime to traditional draft beers such as the world-famous Paulaner Original Munich Hell. If you aren’t looking for a beer, a bevy of other options including an eclectic wine and cocktail list, are available as well. Guess it’s time to make a trip down for a tipple or two soon! (Aug 2017)

data.title: Derwish Turkish
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Meze Tabagi, Saksuka, Testi Kebab, Kasarli Kofte
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in the Malay enclave on Kampong Glam is the gorgeous restaurant serving up delicious Turkish dishes. With blue-tiled walls and oud music in the air, you’d be forgiven for thinking you were in Ankara when you first enter this restaurant. The smell of fresh flatbread and stews, as well as the welcoming atmosphere of this restaurant make this the perfect place for a hearty meal with family and friends.

The Patlican Musakka is a classic Turkish item that is not to be missed. Made with chicken or lamb, eggplant, potato, and topped with a generous helping of cheese, this rich dish is baked in a claypot for maximum flavour. Earthy, buttery, and delectable, this is an absolute must-try for diners who are new to Turkish cuisine. If you’re looking for a Turkish take on a classic dish, look no further than the Pasta Carbonara. Made with some additional herbs and spices and without the addition of bacon, this is a Middle Eastern rendition of the classic Italian dish and just as good as the original.

data.title: Di Wei Teochew Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Teochew Cold Crab, Liver Roll, Prawn Balls, Pork Rib Yam Ring and Yam Paste with Gingko Nuts or Pumpkin
data.ABOUT:
A heartwarming cuisine that  fills the stomach and soul, Teochew food is the culinary balm we need on cold rainy days. And when the craving for this notable cuisine hits, there’s no better place to go than Di Wei Teochew Restaurant. This humble eatery, which first opened its doors in 2014 at the Singapore Botanic Gardens, has now expanded to a grand colonial bungalow that’s located in Seletar Aerospace Park. 

Sit around one of the restaurant’s round table and be amazed by the seemingly endless amounts of food that Chef Khoo Tai Guan and his team puts out. The menu at this restaurant is built around lightly-flavoured delicacies made from only the freshest ingredients the kitchen staff can buy. If you come here on any given day, don’t be surprised to see dishes such as the Teochew Cold Crab, deep-fried Prawn Balls, or crispy Pork Rib Yam Rings flying out of the kitchen doors. Craving something more luxurious? Then be sure to give the Crayfish Porridge or the Pomfret Porridge a try. 

At Di Wei, Chef Khoo takes the classic and cherished Teochew dishes and modernizes them for the new generation. (May 2018)

data.title: Dian Xiao Er (Bedok Mall)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 311 New Upper Changi Road#01-73/74Bedok MallSingapore (467360)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Herbal Roasted Duck, Mongolian Spare Ribs, Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce, Dong Po Pork, JiangNan Baked King Prawn
data.ABOUT:
Dian Xiao Er’s decor is meant to look like one of those old-school Chinese inns you see in movies -- you know, the sort where Shaolin Warriors stop at, mid-journey, on their quest for justice and peace. Timber furniture, carved wooden screens, red cloth aplenty, you half expect an epic fight to break out in Dian Xiao Er, with kungfu kicks and wine barrels flying around.

Except the only fight one can imagine here is over the famous Herbal Roasted Duck that has been the mainstay of the Dian Xiao Er menu for the last 12 years. The dark herbal gravy that the duck comes bathed in is made of 10 Chinese herbs that include codonopsis root, foxglove root, and licorice root. This gravy is said to have a calming effect while relieving mental stress and revitalizing energy. We were definitely very energized after eating this duck, not least because of its succulence and moistness. The duck skin itself is also crispy and adds a satisfying crunch to the dish. Paired with fragrant steamed rice, the flavours of this dish are strong, but not overpowering. 

Try the other dishes on the menu as well; Dian Xiao Er specializes in traditional Chinese comfort food such as melt-in-the-mouth Dong Po Pork and refreshing Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce. For a taste of traditional Chinese inn food, Dian Xiao Er is the place to go. (Sept 2016)

data.title: Dian Xiao Er (Hillion Mall)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Herbal Roasted Duck, Mongolian Spare Ribs, Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce, Dong Po Pork, JiangNan Baked King Prawn
data.ABOUT:
Dian Xiao Er symbolizes a pit-stop for travelers (customers) to rest and replenish their energy fully before setting off to continue their hectic journeys again. Dian Xiao Er not only provides to the travelers a place of warmth, satisfaction and happiness as they indulge in the delectable dishes, it is also a place for them to interact and build relationships with one another. Dian Xiao Er also symbolizes an element of blessing and fellowship as everyone is brought together in Dian Xiao Er.

The ambience at Dian Xiao Er is intentionally planned to be rustic and raw with the careful selection of materials to complement the freshness of the herbal roast ducks which are prepared and roasted in the display kitchen daily. Customers can expect to experience a choice of dining ambience varying from dining inside a traditional Chinese inn to dining inside a rustic timber shed at the foot of a stone cliff. (Sep 2018)

data.title: District 10 (Suntec City)
data.Hours: Mon-Fri, Eve of PH & PH: 11:30am-10:30pmSat: 4-10:30pmClosed Sunday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 45 Days Home Dry Aged Corn Fed Traditional Fiorentina Steak, Puglia Burrata with Organic Italian Tomato, Grilled Calamari with Tomato and Capers
data.ABOUT:
The small and neat 1,800 square-foot restaurant comes complete with a European Meat Showcase and Chiller for its Dry Aged Meat to cater to its Gourmet Loyalists. This meticulous Dry-Aging procedure allows the enzymes to break down the connective tissues in the muscles, leaving behind a surprisingly higher concentration of natural flavors that consumers get to savor- the tasty and tender goodness of Dry Aged cuts.
 Choose from beautifully cooked main courses such as Pappardelle with Dry Aged Black Angus Ragout with Porcini Mushrooms, 45 Days Home Dry Aged Corn Fed Traditional Fiorentina Steak or our 30 Days Dry Aged Black Angus Burger with Parmesan Chips and Tomato Salsa on Rosemary-Garlic Bun. (Aug 2016)

data.title: District 10 (UE Square)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Black Angus Beef Burger, Spaghetti Carbonara with Black Truffle, Homemade Foie Gras Ravioli, Oven Baked Eggplant Alla Parmigiana style, District 10 Eggs Benedict, Farmer’s Style Breakfast
data.ABOUT: The Flagship outlet of District 10 Bar & Restaurant located at UE Square boasts of a main dining hall, a private dining room and an extensive bar. On top of keeping some of Bonta’s bestselling items, the menu is refreshed with classic Italian dishes as well as a more extensive wine list with boutique labels. District 10 Bar & Restaurant continues to offer an extensive menu of substantial and value-for-money fare.Luca Pezzera, the group’s Executive Chef and Partner, explains that District 10’s gastrobar concept works well with the separate outdoor and indoor spaces. “Our outdoor area appeals to diners who want a casual ambience with the option of bar bites and lots of great cocktails. For the indoors, we take things up a notch by offering a more gourmet menu. This allows our guests to have the option to choose between the different dining experiences” (Aug 2016)

data.title: Dolce Vita
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 5 Raffles AvenueMarina SquareThe Mandarin OrientalSingapore (039797)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ricciola, Pappardelle, Rombo, Filetto, Crostata al limone
data.ABOUT:
Enjoying a relaxed, convivial atmosphere, Dolce Vita puts a uniquely modern twist on the alluring flavours of authentic Italian cuisine. Passionate about retaining the true spirit of traditional Italian cuisine, Dolce Vita features the freshest of produce and the finest seasonal ingredients, which are translated into delicious daily creations.
Providing the perfect setting for a memorable experience is Dolce Vita’s elegant décor that exudes a sophisticated and chic vibe. Unwind in the spacious main dining area and catch a glimpse into the chefs’ culinary world through a feature wall with vertical windows. A stone finish backdrop and black granite countertop at the bar further accentuate its luxe character as diners peruse an outstanding collection of fine wines meticulously curated by the award-winning sommelier. Complete with floor-to-ceiling glass windows leading to an outdoor alfresco area, Dolce Vita regales guests with picturesque views of the city’s skyline to complement the wonderful menu. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Don Ho - Social Kitchen & Bar
data.Good For: City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 1 Keong Saik RoadThe Working Capitol BuildingSingapore (089109)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Blackened Chicken, Black Bean Hummus, Charred Octopus, Hamachi Crudo
data.PRESS RELEASE: Don Ho Social Kitchen & Bar is located along Keong Saik Road. The restaurant’s tropical decor brightens up the space with a groovy feel and features a menu with exquisite cocktails and modern Australian plates. Whether you are looking for a social evening experience or a trendy dining venue, Don Ho Social Kitchen & Bar exudes chill and trendy vibe, making it a suitable for any occasion. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Donna Restaurant and Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Angus Beef Hor Fun, Chongqing Grilled Fish, Lasagna, Seafood Aglio Olio
data.ABOUT:
Escape the hustle and bustle of the city at this semi-alfresco restaurant at One North. They specialise in Asian and Western cuisine, serving up a variety of dishes like Angus Beef Hor Fun, Chongqing Grilled Fish, Lasagna, and Seafood Aglio Olio. While the dishes may seem simple at first glance, they ultimately pack a punch in the flavour department.

The interior also boasts a well-stocked bar, adorned with premium wines and spirits from around the world, and a draft beer tap for beer enthusiasts. Their proudest creations are, however, their selection of house-concocted cocktails such as the Ice Kachang cocktail, Gin Bramble, and Donna Colada.

The next time you're in the area, pop by to get your fill of comfort food and a drink or two. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Drinks & Co Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Char-grilled Beef Skirt Steak, Greek Salad, Truffle Pizza, Samurai Pizza, New Zealand Marinated Lamb Chops, Burrata Cheese & San Daniele Ham, Shrimp Beignet with Cocktail Sauce, Mixed Grill Platter, Wagyu Burger
data.ABOUT:
The original Club Street bottle-shop concept has been a long-standing favourite amongst discerning night owls in Singapore, and here the people behind Drinks & Co have expanded down the street into a larger space. Also expanded is their food menu, with an extensive grill section. This is definitely a more dressed up version of the brand, perfect for dates and big groups, especially since the heaving portions here demand to be shared. Off the grill comes the Co Wagyu Burger, enrobed in melty cheese and served with freshly-baked buns for mouthfuls of perfection. Then there’s the Char Grilled Beef Skirt Steak, still smoking at the edges as it arrives served up with a zingy chimichurri sauce and fluffy fried potatoes. 

If you’re looking for a more restrained booze and bites situation, the elegant tapas menu here is the right fit. Think delicate little Shrimp Beignets with a twee and old fashioned cocktail sauce, or Burrata Cheese & San Daniele Ham for a little hit of creamy, salty, gooey goodness to go with some bubbly. Then there’s the Fried Brava Potatoes with Chili Mayo & Ricotta Cheese for a carb bomb that’s actually worth it. Meanwhile, booze is available by the bottle at super friendly prices, a deal that’s increasingly hard to find in this city. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Drinks & Co Kitchen
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The C° Wagyu Burger, Signature Mix Meat Platter, Grilled Coconut Corn, Cold Cut Charcuterie Board, Smoked Salmon Pizza, Classic Fish & Chips, Raspberry Dome
data.ABOUT:
Drinks & Co, stalwarts of the Club Street scene, have powered into the original nightlife enclave: Holland Village. Riding on their celebrated bottle-shop plus bistro concept, the group has devised a more French brasserie approach for this Village outpost, with a menu devised by chef Adama Koita. Open with a classic Cold Cut Charcuterie Board, a playground of your favourite cured meats including pork rillettes, chorizo, and salami, served up with crunchy cornichons and artisanal bread. There’s also an Artisanal Cheese Platter to go with the bright, robust wines on offer from the shelves. 

Mains here come in the form of smoky grilled meats. Think hearty steaks like the Grilled Ribeye served with a medley of seasonal vegetables and red wine jus, or the New Zealand Rack of Lamb served up with French ratatouille and a salad of puffed rice. Other mains take a more British gastropub turn, with a Classic Fish & Chips, featuring beer battered Sea Bass, and Bangers & Mash made with fatty Kurobuta Pork Toulouse Sausages, crowning the menu. Dessert is a classic Chocolate Lava Cake affair, though you should also get the Raspberry Dome, an elegant, tangy confection, and make a double-dessert night of it. After all, this place is all about sharing, and with vibes this good, you’ll definitely want to bring a friend or two along for the ride. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Drunken Farmer
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
SG Stracciatella, Couvert (Sourdough Bread with Homemade Butter & Smoked
Maldon), Karaage Sourdough (Crispy Chicken Thigh with Kimchi Mayonnaise), Cacio & Pepe Sourdough Pizza, Shrooms & Goat Cheese Pizza
data.ABOUT:
We believe all good things come from the earth. The gut-pleasing grapes and grains free of nasty chemicals. Fermented with love to give you the best natural wines and sourdough pizzas.
Started as a passion project with a whole lotta kung fu in the backroom of Tiong Bahru Bakery, Drunken Farmer makes crazy-delicious sourdough pizzas and fermented snacks paired with extraordinary natural wines. All our cheeses and butter are handmade in our kitchen using milk of Singapore's very own cows. Indigenous ingredients sourced from local farms go into our dips and sauces. That’s real, handmade action to create food that’s 100% good for your gut.  Our name is inspired by the drunken kung fu masters, a reminder of the mastery and skill behind the natural wine farmers and bakers that influence our cuisine. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Duckland (Paya Lebar)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 10 Paya Lebar RoadB2-33Paya Lebar QuarterSingapore (409057)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roast Duck, Duck Confit & Waffle, Duck Fried Rice, Duck Pie, Irish Lamb Stew
data.ABOUT: Roast duck or duck pie? At this modern Chinese restaurant by the TungLok group, you can have both. Using ducks from Silver Hill Farm Hill in Ireland — known to breed the ‘wagyu’ of ducks — the juicy, tender meat is the result of feeding the birds well and keeping them in a spacious environment. Try the duck typical Asian-style, roasted in a combi-oven with herbs, wine and spices. Or a savoury Duck Broth, an intense bone soup that is packed with flavour. From the Western side of the menu, the Duck Confit & Waffle is a fun twist on the typical fried chicken and waffle combo. The fork-tender meat is drizzled with maple syrup and a generous slab of butter that melts over the hot, fluffy waffle bed. Another must-try is the Duck Pie, where buttery shortcrust pastry is wrapped around thick slices of juicy duck meat. Pure decadence in every bite. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Dusk Restaurant & Bar
data.Hours: Mon-Thu, Sun: 4-11pm (Last Order 10pm)Fri-Sat, Eve of PH: 4pm-2am (Last Order for Alcohol Drinks 10pm, Food 1am)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Dusk Signature Prawn Capellini, Cote de Boeuf, French-Cut Rack of Lamb, Seared Duck Confit, Sous Vide Beef Cheek, Forest Mushrooms, Hokkaido Scallops, Fremantle Octopus, Guinness Chocolate Cake, Classic Baked Alaska
data.PRESS RELEASE: Located 100 metres above sea level at Mount Faber Peak and surrounded by lush rainforest, Dusk Restaurant & Bar is an ideal destination on the hilltop at Mount Faber to capture the best view of sunsets in the city-state. A place like no other, patrons entering the restaurant are enveloped in an atmosphere of laidback elegance in an alfresco setting. Specializing in Modern European cuisines and with a great selection of wines, the restaurant is curated specially for communal dining, complete with Instragram-worthy cocktails, views and photo points to take in with your favourite people! (Dec 2017)

data.title: D’Mahal Egyptian & Indian Cuisine
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Arabic Salad, Fattoush, Pepperoni Pizza, Chicken Shawarma Wrap
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in the Kampong Glam enclave, D’Mahal Egyptian & Indian Cuisine is a quaint restaurant serving up authentic Lebanese and Middle Eastern dishes that are both vegetarian and vegan-friendly, with gluten free options.

For the health-conscious, the restaurant provides a huge selection of various salads. Opt for the Arabic Salad if you are looking for a classic mix of lettuce, tomatoes and herbs. The Fattoush is also a brilliant salad choice. Served in a fanciful fashion, the salad contains a mishmash of Middle Eastern herbs and spices with a mix of greens.

D’Mahal Egyptian & Indian Cuisine’s low-carb options are their wraps and rolls. The Chicken Shawarma Wrap is a classic that can’t go wrong. With generous slabs of chicken shawarma slices tightly bundled with a lightly toasted wrap, this is a one-dish meal that’s both nourishing and satisfying. Pizzas and pastas are also available at D’Mahal Egyptian & Indian Cuisine in a variety of flavours. The Pepperoni Pizza comes highly recommended. A fusion of aromatic herbs and diced tomatoes, the Penne Arrabbiata is especially addictive. (Jul 2020)

data.title: EMPRESS
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat-Sun: 11am-4pm (A La Carte Last Order: 2:30pm, Dim Sum Last Seating: 2pm, Last Order: 3:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab Mantou Buns, King Prawn Dumpling in Supreme Broth, Wok-Charred Broccoli & Broccolini Salad, Seared Angus Beef Tenderloin Cubes, Triple Roast Platter, Hokkaido Scallop & Prawn ‘Mapo’ Tofu, Dragon's Breath Angus Beef Hor Fun, Sticky Date & Longan Pudding, Pandan Crème Brûlée
data.ABOUT:
The Privé Group's first foray into Chinese cuisine, EMPRESS snags a prime spot in the Asian Civilisations Museum. Offering up waterfront dining, the restaurant boasts an excellent view of the Singapore River. A theme of mixing old and new flows throughout the restaurant and nicely echoes the design philosophy of the museum. It's contemporary interior and vibrant décor contrasts with the colonial facade, and diners will surely enjoy the juxtaposition of casual dining whilst nestled in the confines of a formal museum.
This trend continues with the menu. EMPRESS features dishes that are a mainstay of Cantonese cuisine but does so in a way that blends good ole' Cantonese flavours with more modern touches. Don't worry, you'll still be able to recognize items from dim sum to their signature roast meats. Speaking of which, the Triple Roast Platter, which showcases Spare Ribs, Char Siew, and Roast Pork, all of which are carefully cooked to retain that perfect level of juiciness, is a team favourite! EMPRESS is also one of the first few restaurants in Singapore to give an Asian-slant to Impossible Meat – the Impossible Meat Gyozas and Kway Teow are truly delicious. EMPRESS also bucks convention with their Western-style salads and plated desserts including the decadent Sticky Date & Longan Pudding. On weekends and public holidays, EMPRESS also offers a sumptuous dim sum buffet which you can pair with champagne for an indulgent treat.
All in all, EMPRESS hopes to eradicate the notion that Cantonese cuisine can be a bit stuffy, and you'll no doubt agree once you experience the relaxed environment and accessible dishes. (Mar 2020)

data.title: ESCAPE
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Cream of Champignon, 
Chicken Tikka Lovers, 
The Hangover Burger, 
Locally Farmed Miso Barramundi,

data.PRESS RELEASE: Relish hearty international favourites and grilled specialities in a panoramic al fresco setting at Escape. Located at level 6 of One Farrer Hotel, the poolside venue captivates with sweeping views of the Singapore skyline. Diners may also enjoy a variety of handcrafted spritzers and cocktails from the attached Sunset Bar. (Jan 2021)

data.title: EagleWings Loft
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 9 King Albert Park#01-14/33/34/56/57KAP Residences MallSingapore (598332)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pomelo Pick Me Up, Treasures in a Bun, Foie Gras Wagyu Burger, Lobster Risotto, Pasta Truffle Blackbeard Chocolate Cherry Dome
data.ABOUT:
You can almost hear a sea-breeze at this cozy cafe and restaurant. The charming nautical-themed decor and handsome wooden touches throw you straight into a seafaring fantasy right in the middle of King Albert Park. It’s the perfect mid-shopping getaway for those tired feet and hunger pangs: expect comforting nosh and hearty cafe grub, alongside an invigorating cup of strong coffee. Except this isn’t your usual cafe fare. There’s a healthy amount of kitchen wizardry at work here. Think of hefty appetizers like their signature Treasures in a Bun, a pillowy steamed bun stuffed with slow-braised pork belly done up with caramelized ginger chili sauce and crunchy fried shallots. This is matched with fiery Thai-influenced salads like the Pomelo Pick Me Up, a salad of tender poached prawns tossed in a zingy sweet chili lime dressing, dressed with peanuts, and scattered with tart pomelo gems for a true party in the mouth.
Mains here go straight to comfort food territory with numbers like the Lobster Submarine, a buttery roll filled with poached lobster that’s dressed with lemony mayo, crunchy tobiko, and crunchy vegetables. For something even heftier, and more indulgent, get the Foie Gras Wagyu Burger, which hits all the luxury eating sweet spots: meltingly fatty foie gras crowns a juicy Wagyu patty that’s sandwiched between fluffy brioche buns and held together by a lovely onion marmalade and mushrooms. If there’s room for dessert, the Chocolate Cherry Dome, a beautiful confection of chocolate, berries compote, strawberries, and meringue, will seal the deal on your visit. Pop by for their High Tea too for tiers of similarly elegant desserts and a quiet afternoon in one of the city’s most charming neighbourhoods. (Oct 2017)

data.title: East Coast Commune
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Brekkie, CharMee, Fried Chicken, Granola Bowl
data.ABOUT:
Look forward to specialty coffee, cold pressed juices, hearty sandwiches, fresh bakes and more at East Coast Commune. Tucked away in Marina Cove, indulge in the restaurant’s selection of wholesome fare aimed at delighting both the palate and the soul. Committed to connecting communities through unforgettable experiences centered around food, wellness and art, this inviting space has lots to offer. 

East Coast Commune’s all day menu delivers a wonderful dining experience any time of the day. Get your daily dose of coffee with a classic set of The Brekkie. With your choice of croissant, sourdough, or sourdough waffle, tuck into classic breakfast staples like pork fennel sausage, sauteed mushrooms and greens and perfectly fried eggs. Move on to the mains, such as a big bowl of mouthwatering “CharMee”. Infused with black garlic and garnished with sesame seeds, this pasta dish is a unique take on a local classic. 

For a savoury option, the Fried Chicken will not disappoint! Accompanied by roasted corn waffle, chilli pickled daikon and drizzled with maple syrup, this sweet and savoury dish is a menu option not to be missed out on. Pick your poison from the vast selection of craft beer and organic natural wines for a relaxing afternoon by the coast. (Nov 2020)

data.title: East Treasure Chinese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 3 River Valley Road#01-16Clarke Quay, Block BSingapore (179021)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Double Boiled Tonic Soup with Crocodile Meat, Stir-fried Okayama Wagyu Beef and Fresh Mushrooms in Black Pepper Sauce, 60 hr Dry-Aged Roasted Duck, East Treasure Chilli Crab
data.ABOUT:
A pocket-friendly Chinese restaurant, East Treasure offers an array of exquisite and delectable Chinese cuisine born from a hybrid of the freshest ingredients and different cooking techniques. Bringing out the natural aromas and wonderful flavours of high-grade ingredients, the restaurant’s dishes are set to charm your palate.
Must-try dishes such as Double Boiled Tonic Soup with Crocodile Meat, Chilli Crab and the famous Dry-Aged Duck are the highlight of the menu at East Treasure. Other chef specials include the Stir-fried Okayama Wagyu Beef and Fresh Mushrooms in Black Pepper Sauce and East Treasure Chilli Crab. Choose from the half roasted or whole roasted 60 hr Dry-Aged Roasted Duck to have a taste of the juicy duck meat that keeps diners coming back. Do note that this signature dish requires an advance order, so enquire about the lead time to avoid disappointment!
Seafood lovers will be delighted at the wide selection of live seafood available at East Treasure. With 10 different methods of serving crabs, there is surely something for everyone! If you’re feeling adventurous, go for the Sake and Chinese Wine cooking style for a unique spin on this traditional seafood favourite. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Eat Cetera
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, German, Cafe, BBQ, Russian, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hungarian Goulash, Austrian Kaiserschmarrn, German Wurst Sausages, Russian - Belarusian Style Meat Skewers
data.ABOUT:
Travel the world through EatCetera’s delectable menu. Influenced by the flavours of Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Russia and Belarus, EatCetera presents a Pan-European dining concept offering honest, satisfying food for all ages. Born out of friendship and a genuine desire to create an inviting space for good company and conversation, EatCetera aims to give diners new flavour profiles with each visit. 

Bring your dining passport and get ready to embark on a gastronomic adventure featuring a variety of traditional eats from all over Europe. Signature dishes include the famous Hungarian Goulash, German Wurst Sausages, tongue twisting Austrian Kaiserschmarrn and more. 

The in-house specialty, the Russian-Belarusian Style Meat Skewers, are not to be missed out on. Grilled to smoky perfection over a charcoal Josper oven, the morsels of meat are flavoured with the restaurant’s unique blend of marinades and sauces.

The perfect accompaniment to delicious dishes, EatCetera bar is fully stocked with a vast collection of the best beers Germany and Belarus have to offer. Perch by the bar with your choice of wine, cocktail or beer to wrap up a sumptuous meal. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Eat@Taipei (Kallang Wave Mall)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oyster Mee Sua with Oyster & Pig’s Intestines, Braised Pork Belly Noodles, Matcha Soft Serve Toast, Oyster Omelette, Fried Chicken Chop, Spring Onion Pancake, Crispy Fried Tofu with Minced Pork & Pickled Radish
data.ABOUT: For those craving the yummy goodness of Taiwanese street food, look no further. With Eat at Taipei, you can chow down on your favourite Taiwanese specialties, and you certainly won’t need to step on a plane to get the restaurant! Featuring a large variety of tasty treats that feel like they just came from the streets of Shihlin Night Market, you’ll be absolutely spoilt for choice. From the eatery’s affordable sets for those who want to get value for their dollar to street snacks like the ever-popular Crispy Fried Chicken Chop and fragrant Oyster Omelette, it’s hard to decide what to get!To help things along, here are some of our favourites; we love the Oyster Mee Sua with Oyster & Pig’s Intestines, what with its generous helpings of juicy oysters and its flavourful finish, and we highly recommend you try the Braised Pork Belly Noodles, a sinful dish with juicy and tender pieces of pork belly that melt in the mouth. For the desserts, which are popular in their own right, you should definitely give the Matcha Soft Serve Toast a try. The strong, pleasantly bittersweet taste of matcha is balanced out by the crisp but soft texture of the toast, making for an all around enjoyable dessert. But don’t limit yourself to these dishes only; with such an extensive selection of dishes on offer, who can resist ordering heaps of food? So make a booking at Eat at Taipei, where you’ll be able to feast until you burst! (Jan 2018)

data.title: Eatzi Gourmet Bistro (Paya Lebar Square)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 60 Paya Lebar Road#B1-15Paya Lebar SquareSingapore (409051)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ribeye Steak, Sambal Steak, Mushrooms with Slipper Lobster and Crabmeat, Seafood Spaghetti Marinara, Nasi Goreng with Prawns & Chicken Satay
data.ABOUT: The people behind Singapore’s favourite steakhouse, Jack’s Place, bring you Eatzi Gourmet Bistro, a Halal restaurant that serves up tasty Western plates. Here, there’s everything from Jack’s Place’s classic hot-plate steaks to all-day breakfasts, a little bit of everything for the whole family. Whether it’s house favourites like sizzling cuts of New Zealand Grass Fed Beef, or tangles of spaghetti in rich seafood sauce, all the hallmarks of the Jack’s Place experience are here. There are even some special local flavour options like a zingy Sambal Steak, a tender cut of beef served up with a chunky sambal sauce, and savoury Nasi Goreng served up with satay and prawns. Apart from mains, there’s also a hefty selection of delicious appetizers, like juicy mushrooms stuffed with slipper lobster and crab or crispy batons of deep fried chicken meat luncheon meat, as well as an array of milkshakes, smoothies, and waffles, to keep you sated whether you’re in search of a light afternoon bite, a sweet treat at tea time, or a more substantial family dinner. With its extensive menu and commitment to providing variety, it won’t be a surprise if this becomes your go-to destination for birthdays to anniversaries, and everything in between. (Feb 2017)

data.title: Edge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Boston Lobster, Wagyu Beef, Suckling Pig, Prime Rib, Duck Confit Ravioli
data.ABOUT:
Presenting a diverse and interactive dining experience at the stunning Pan Pacific Singapore, Edge, a multifaceted buffet restaurant, showcases a culinary tour of Singapore and the Pacific Rim right in the heart of the city.
Offering a whopping seven live food theatres, as well as a la minute presentations which include an extensive array of Asian and Pacific delicacies inspired by umami rich flavours and sophisticated cooking techniques from the region, Edge goes above and beyond the typical hotel buffet in every sense. They even give diners the opportunity to observe and connect with the chefs while exploring the substantial selection of almost 120 dishes and 35 desserts, and well, if that's not going above, beyond, and possibly over the "edge", we don't know what is! (Mar 2016)

data.title: Eight Treasures Vegetarian Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Thai Sauce Cod Fish, Vegetarian Peking Duck, Marmite Vegetarian Pork Ribs, Nyonya Fish, Wasabi Prawn
data.ABOUT:
This vegetarian restaurant has been around since 2007, and if that isn’t a testament to its food, we don’t know what is. Located just steps from the iconic Buddha Tooth Relic Temple, this eatery has a menu that could easily convert any carnivore. The restaurant’s motto, meatless does not mean tasteless, is echoed in many of the menu items, which are made with plant-based meat alternatives that are just as good, if not better than the original.

The Marmite Vegetarian Pork Ribs are a chef specialty, and made with soy and yeast extract. While it may not sound very appealing, the combination of rich soy meat and earthy Marmite makes for a delectable combination - perfect as a snack or as an accompaniment to some freshly steamed jasmine rice.

Another dish worth trying is the Vegetarian Peking Duck. The clever use of fresh yam fried to crisp perfection to make the “duck meat” and the delicious taste of the of the dish itself are enough to convince you that you’re chowing down on real meat. Hankering for some treasures of the sea? Fret not, as they’ve got that on the menu as well. Try the Thai Sauce Cod Fish - a spicy sour dish of mock fish meat doused in a Thai-inspired dressing. (Jun 2018)

data.title: El Mero Mero x Senor Taco
data.Cuisine: Bar, Seafood, Steakhouse, South American, Vegetarian Friendly, Mexican
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tortilla Soup, Atlantic Grilled Octopus, Crab Cones, San Remo Prawn Ceviche, Kurobuta Al Pastor Tacos, Street Food Corn Sampler, Tiger Prawn Tempura Taco, Roasted Poblano Pepper, Tequila Pecan Pie
data.ABOUT: Get ready for a fiesta of flavours at El Mero Mero X Senor Taco in CHIJMES as they dish out unique dishes with surprising ingredients sourced directly from Mexico and a wide selection of Tequila, Mezcal, Spanish spirits, cocktails, beers, wines, and more!With an open-kitchen concept greeting diners looking to be seated indoors and a stunning terrace for those looking to soak in the sun, El Mero Mero X Senor Taco’s got a little something for everyone. Take their sensational menu for instance. Structured around the two seating plans of the restaurant, you can either enjoy the Terrace Menu or relish in the Cocina Menu. Both menus feature small plate offerings, traditional tacos, Josper grilled favourites, and a plethora of desserts. The San Remo Prawn Ceviche with sea urchin, mango, and chili is a personal Chope favourite, and pairs along quite well with the Tiger Prawn Tempura Taco loaded with coconut, mango, and cabbage on a freshly prepared corn tortilla.For dessert, we suggest ordering a big slice of El Mero Mero X Senor Taco’s signature Tequila Pecan Pie. Served with a generous scoop of cinnamon ice cream - it’s just the zesty ending the meal calls for! (Dec 2015)
