data.title: Employees Only Singapore
data.Hours: Dine-in Operating Hours:Mon-Sun: 4-10pm (Last Order 9:45pm)Delivery/Takeout Operating Hours:Mon- Sun: 4:30-9pm
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.Location: Chinatown, Raffles Place, Tanjong Pagar, Telok Ayer
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Half Roast Chicken, Bone Marrow Poppers, Hand Cut Steak Tartare, Whole Rainbow Trout, Ribeye Steak, Manhattan, Ginger Smash
data.ABOUT:
With noted New York restaurants popping up all over Singapore, it’s quickly beginning to feel like the city is turning into a satellite state of the Big Apple. But with nightlife legends like Employees Only leading the charge, there’s very little to complain about. Loved by night owls in New York for its kooky, offbeat service, strong classic cocktails, and delicious comfort food, this West Village institution is now in Singapore, headed by one of the original bosses, the affable Igor Hadzismajlovic. Employees Only’s Singapore outpost is the bar’s first such international undertaking, and has landed at swish Amoy Street, to join the belt-of-sin’s constellation of upmarket speakeasies.
Past the friendly door-keeps, you’re greeted by a surly, turban-wearing fortune teller (don’t ask) before you go through velvet curtains into a Moulin-Rouge-esque carnival of raucous chatter, Motown, and the chaotic sounds of a busy bar. The crowd is one of the friendliest in town, standing-room only on the best of nights with plenty of good booze to keep conversations going. Sip on one of the bar’s superb classic Manhattans as you scoot over to your table and sit down to a supper of comforting favourites like the joint’s famous Bone Marrow Poppers and Hand Cut Steak Tartare. Earlier in the night, dinner plates include a Roasted Half Chicken adorned with cauliflower, capers, and parsley, a tender Porterhouse Pork Chop with black eyed peas and savoy cabbage, and a grilled Whole Rainbow Trout.
But with accolades including Spirited Awards’ “World’s Best Cocktail Bar”, Employees Only Singapore guides your focus to the well trained bar-team, led by veteran bartender Steve Schneider, which turns out classic cocktails and new signatures made from a hefty selection of boutique spirits, house-made syrups, tinctures, and other goodies. Employees Only is all good: the vibes, the food, the drink, and, employees or not, we’re glad it’s in Singapore! (Jan 2017)

data.title: En Dining
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Rainbow Maki, Kaisen Chirashi Don, Miyazaki Wagyu Hitsumabushi, Kani Fried Rice
data.ABOUT:
Well-known for its quality Japanese all-you-can-eat a la carte buffet, En Dining is conveniently situated at Capital Tower, right in the heart of the CBD. Pop by during lunch for an affordable and filling meal, or for a casual dinner with family and friends. 

En Dining offers a huge variety that spans classic Japanese categories such as Sashimi, Maki, Sushi, Appetisers, Salad, Stir-Fry, Deep-Fry, Rice, Noodles, Hotpot, and Desserts. The restaurant even boasts a special Okinawa section featuring favourites from the prefecture. 

A moreish mix of tuna, prawn, snapper, salmon, crab stick together with black and orange flying fish roe, the Rainbow Maki is a great hit among the old and the young. The Avocado Maki is another tasty option that is packed with crab stick, egg and cucumber. Topped with generous slices of avocado, this maki roll is a nutritious option that tastes delicious! Other delightful dishes here include fusion creations such as Mentaiko Spaghetti, Buta Kimchi, Kani Fried Rice and more. 

Perfect for those looking for an affordable and fuss-free alternative in town, value for money lunch sets are also available at the restaurant. End your meal on a sweet note with a scoop of Matcha or Vanilla Ice Cream. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Enjoy Eating House and Bar @ Jalan Besar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: 383 Jalan Besar RoadKam Leng HotelSingapore (209001)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, Salt-baked Whole Barramundi, Chef Joel's BBQ Pork Cheek
data.ABOUT:
Located in the vintage brownstone Kam Leng Hotel on Jalan Besar, this restaurant exudes retro charm, even from the exterior. From the twinkling lights illuminating the signboard to the pop art illustrations of Chinese ladies with coiffed hair adorning the menu, stepping into this restaurant is like going back in time. The concept may be dated, but the food certainly isn’t. Founded solely on the principle of enjoying life while it lasts, this spot serves up delicious nosh at an affordable price.

Chef-Owner Joel lives by one principle, and that is making the most of precious moments by enjoying some of the best food life has to offer. Therefore it’s no surprise that the menu here consists of hearty local comfort food such as the Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, and XO White Fish Soup.

The Curry Chicken is a must-try. The chicken is cooked in a special blend of spices till it is tender enough to fall off the bone, giving the dish a richness that is reminiscent of zi char stalls in the olden days. The Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon is a great option for diners who love hawker food. Made with thin stands of vermicelli tossed in a smoky, savoury homemade sauce, and topped with a generous portion of melt-in-your-mouth braised pork, this is the perfect dish to warm you up on a cold day. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Enjoy Eating House and Bar @ Stevens
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, White Pepper Alaskan King Crab, Salt-baked Whole Barramundi
data.ABOUT:
Staying true to his local roots, owner and head chef Joel Ong, continues to keep our Singaporean traditions alive with his wok. Innovating his menu with unique twists and simple tweaks, Chef Joel brings his brainchild — Enjoy Eating House and Bar to the neighbourhood of Stevens. Situated away from the hustle and bustle of city life, Enjoy at Stevens will spot a familiar yet modernistic experience.

Established since 2018, Enjoy's regulars will be familiar with their hearty recipes, inherited from Chef Joel's grandma, that are zhng-ed to give a contemporary interpretation of zi char delights that come with a strong wok hei flavour.

With a new elevated menu meticulously curated by the Enjoy team, one can expect an array of quality selections exclusive to the latest flagship outlet such as the Classic Yu Sheng Ceviche, White Pepper Alaskan King Crab, Popiah Garden, and more. So get seated, it's seriously time to ENJOY now! (Jan 2021)

data.title: Epiphyte
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: USDA Superprime Ribeye Steak, Sting Ray with Tamarind Broth, 48 Hour Pork Belly with House Yogurt, Blue Butterfly Pea Risotto with Crab Croquettes, Epiphyte’s Terrarium, Ube Cake
data.ABOUT:
Epiphyte is conceptualized as a Modern-Asian Bistro that focuses on regional ingredients to craft our food and cocktails. Set in a conserved shop-house along bustling Neil Road, Epiphyte is a sanctuary for night revelers with a menu suitable for dinner, supper or a drinks night out. We also offer an extensive range of non-alcoholic selections for an inclusive space to hang out. 

There is also NO SERVICE CHARGE for patrons of Epiphyte , as we believe it is our privilege to serve you. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Erwin's Gastrobar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Italian, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Pasta, Hot Guy Pizza, Veggie Parmigiana, Beef Burger, Baked Salmon
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Inspired by cafés and bars of Italian origins in financial districts of metropoles such as New York City and Sydney, this cheerful gastrobar is a dining destination offering wholesome mains, great bar bites and a wide range of sides and desserts. With an extensive menu full of gut-satisfying food, Erwin’s Gastrobar is bound to wake up the palate of its diners! Appealing dishes such as hearty burgers, pastas, fresh salads and pizzas will help to pique all senses.
M
After a hard day’s work, chill out over happy hours with our Paulaner beers on draft, quality Italian wines and Prosecco by the glass or carafe at great value and also imported specialty beers by the bottles. Erwin's Gastrobar is the go-to venue for coffee breaks, breakfast, lunch, happy hour drinks and dinner with colleagues and friends.

At Erwin’s Gastrobar, we bring you the option of dining and drinking to your heart’s content amidst the casually preppy indoor dining area; or go alfresco in our breezy laid back outdoor area. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Esquina
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Spanish Octopus, Esquina's Spanish Omelette, Crispy Baby Squid, Sardines with Samfaina, Pigeon with Forest Berries Escabeche, Basil Sorbet & Strawberries
data.ABOUT:
If you're a tapas lover, you've probably already met, fallen for, and likely tried to marry Esquina, a charming hole-in-the-wall restaurant wrapped around a corner of Jiak Chuan in Keong Saik. With nostalgic Spanish kitchen curios and rough-hewn textures, the final product is a modern depiction of an urban canteen in Seville.
Esquina has seen two chef changes since its founding, but the tradition of strong flavours and Spanish flair continues on with Executive Chef Carlos Montobbio. Born in Barcelona, the 28 year old has over ten years of experience despite his youth, including time spent in Michelin-starred restaurants, which accounts for the sophistication of the food and plating.
While the second storey offers a quieter and equally quaint setting, you might prefer to sit around the frenetic open kitchen on the ground floor to marvel at the works of art being created not two feet away. Perfectly tender Grilled Spanish Octopus, the deceptively plain-sounding Spanish Omelette, and more unique Wagyu Beef Intercostals are just a few of the delicious plates you can find on the six-sectioned menu. The tiny digs may leave you without a seat if you haven't made a reservation, but Esquina is definitely worth the wait. (Jan 2016)

data.title: Etna Italian Restaurant (Duxton)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Linguine al Granchio, Lasagna alla Bolognese, Stracotto, Dentice Stufato, Etna Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in an elegant and cosy setting along Duxton Hill, Etna serves up modern Italian cuisine with a Sicilian touch. Dining here is almost like dining in a good friend’s living room — the intimate 40-seater is warmly lit, and has a homely vibe to it.  For appetisers, the Parmigiania de Melanzane is a good way to whet the appetite, with its baked eggplants layered with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. The meaty aubergines are soft, bathed in a sweet tomato sauce perfect for dipping into with some focaccia bread. 

Pastas here are simple yet delicious. A popular dish is the lobster ravioli, with butter pistachio cream and prawns, as well as the carbonara, which comes with a dollop of caviar and mullet roe, generously sprinkled with a crack of fresh black pepper. Etna’s specialty is the housemade pizzas, with a crispy base that supports fresh ingredients like mushrooms, artichokes and mixed seafood. 

For dessert, the classics don’t disappoint. Get the tiramisu, and pair the creamy layered treat with a scoop of gelato to end the meal on a sweet note. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Etna Italian Restaurant (Upp East Coast)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Burrata Pizza, Dentice Stufato, Le Carni, Vongole e Cozze al Vino Bianco, Stinco di Agnello al Nero d'Avola
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in an elegant and cosy setting in East Coast, Etna serves up modern Italian cuisine with a Sicilian touch.

For appetisers, dig into the Parmigiania de Melanzane, where baked eggplants are layered with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. The meaty aubergines are soft, bathed in a sweet tomato sauce perfect for dipping into with some focaccia bread. Pastas here are simple yet delicious. A popular dish is the lobster ravioli, with butter pistachio cream and prawns, as well as the risotto calamari, where al dente rice grains are mixed with squid, sea urchin and crispy leek. For mains, tuck into Italian classics like the Fiorentina steak. The juicy T-bone steak is big enough for two to share, with a side of roasted vegetables and mashed potatoes. 

For dessert, the classics don’t disappoint. Try the traditional Sicilian cannoli stuffed with ricotta cheese and candied fruits for a sweet ending to your meal. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Euphoria
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oignon doux des Cévennes, Oignon Jamboree, Maine Lobster, Patin Fish
data.ABOUT:
Restaurant Euphoria is the showcase for Gastro-Botanica, the culinary philosophy by celebrated chef Jason Tan.  The name ‘Euphoria’ and the Chinese character ‘忆’ in the logo convey the promise of delight, wonderment, and enduring memory awaiting the diner. With Restaurant Euphoria, Chef Jason introduces Gastro-Botanica 2.0,  the elevated iteration of his original cuisine that showcases carefully sourced and prepared premium vegetables, meats and seafood, where prominence and elaboration are given to botanical elements of vegetables, tubers, herbs, spices, and fruits. 

Version 2.0 introduces botanical essences to create base sauces known as Gastro-Botanica Essences – La Symphonie de Légumes. In doing so, Chef Jason radically departs from the foundational ‘mother sauces’ of French haute cuisine, thus blazing the trail for further innovation. Euphoria features completely new 2.0 creations, along with Chef Jason’s signature dish of the Cévennes onion in four ways called ‘My Favourite Vegetable’. Located in vibrant Tras Street, the restaurant recreates a lush garden within its heritage shophouse interior, setting the stage for a gastronomic journey with a ground-breaking chef at the peak of his craft.

data.title: Extra Virgin Pizza (Asia Square)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hot Wings, Oven-Fired Clams, Pistachio & Pumpkin Pizza, Guanciale & Egg Pizza, Pepper Pig Pizza, Shellfish Love Pizza
data.ABOUT:
When we think of pizza, we think of a solid, golden, crispy crust, fresh, just-off-the-vine tomatoes blended to make a savoury sauce, and endless amounts of cheese, and that’s exactly what Extra Virgin Pizza in Asia Square delivers.

With flour shipped straight from Italy and tomatoes imported from “the golden state”, it’s no wonder why with every bite we feel so entranced by the authentic and harmonious flavours.

The creations by Extra Virgin Pizza are famous for evoking all of your taste buds and with starters like Hot Wings, it only makes sense that you come prepared to indulge. The Oven-Fired Clams, another popular starter on the menu, are drizzled with white wine sauce and encased with garlic, making for the perfect introduction to the meal.

As for their glorious pizzas? You probably should gather all your friends so you can try all the amazing concoctions. From the Pepper Pig Pizza, a crowd-favourite for meat-lovers, to the Pistachio & Pumpkin, a pistachio pesto-based pizza topped with pumpkin, baby arugula, lemon vinaigrette, and three cheeses - the endless unique options make this pizzeria stand out from the rest.

Pair any of the pizzas with their housemade sodas, beers (on tap or bottled), a cuppa of specialty coffee roasted by Papa Palheta, or a glass of wine. (Nov 2018)

data.title: FIRE @ 1-ATICO
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mud Crab ‘Rescoldo’, Patagonian Red Prawns ‘Parilla’, Black Cod ‘A La Plancha’, Crispy Argentine Style Artichoke
data.ABOUT:
A contemporary Argentinian restaurant that specialises in a variety of wood-fired cooking to produce a plethora of sumptuous dishes, FIRE @ 1-ATICO is passionate about creating legendary gastronomic creations. Diners can look forward to a feast of fire, where superior standard and top shelf meat cuts, seafood and vegetable-based dishes are all cooked to perfection. 

Striving for authenticity and excellence, the restaurant constantly produces beautiful and modern presentations of authentic Argentinian recipes and methods by working closely with a taste panel from the Embassy of Argentina in Singapore that was exclusively established for the restaurant. Start by ordering your favourite bottle of red or white from the carefully curated list of the wines of Argentina before diving into the appetisers. 

Seafood lovers can satisfy their cravings with the Mud Crab ‘Rescoldo’, Patagonian Red Prawns ‘Parilla’ or the New Zealand Mussels ‘Caldero’. Air flown all the way from New Zealand, the fresh green lipped mussels are steamed in a heady mix of white wine, bay leaf and thyme and finished off with a fragrant garnish of garlic butter crumb. 

The restaurant also offers a set menu for couples or for groups of five, filled with the restaurant signatures and well-loved dishes. (Dec 2020)

data.title: FLNT @ 1-ATICO
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 2 Orchard Turn#55-01 ION Orchard Singapore (238801)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Nikkei Bara Chirashi Don, Sashimi Of The Day, Tsukune, Shishito Yaki
data.ABOUT:
As Singapore’s only Nikkei gastrobar, FLNT @ 1-ATICO presents a unique dining experience for a high-energy social spot for friends to bond over elevated cocktails, artisanal sakes and innovative cuisine. Featuring an open kitchen concept, the magic takes place in the buzzy kitchen which takes center stage in the restaurant, where a plethora of sharing plates is prepared with immaculate precision over a binchotan-fueled grill. 

Inspired by the flavours of Nikkei culture in Peru, the Japanese Sumiyaki Grill offers affordable lunch sets. Served with momotaro, miso soup and a light snack , pick from three delicious Japanese menu options for a satisfying and fulfilling meal. The Nikkei Bara Chirashi Don is a popular dish that features the chef’s selection of the multiple kinds of fresh sashimi, topped over rice and peppered with amarillo, avocado and corn nuts. Sashimi lovers rejoice as small plates of sashimi, ceviche, tataki and momotaro are available over at the raw bar here at FLNT @ 1-ATICO. Indulge in delectable flavours of your favourite fish with the Sashimi of the Day platter that comes in either a small plate of three of five different types of fish.

Wrap up your meal with a dish from the sumiyaki grill. Grilled over a curated selection of white and charcoal binchotan, the Tsukune is a flavourful dish of minced chicken and cheese that will surely have you coming back for seconds. (Dec 2020)

data.title: FLUTES Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
93 Stamford Road
#01-02
The National Museum of Singapore
Singapore (178897)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Traditional Mulligatawny Soup, Pan Seared Foie Gras, Seared Venison Loin, Grain-fed Lamb Rack, Angus Cote de Boeuf, Queen's Chocolate Perfection Pie, Fig Clafoutis
data.ABOUT:
A perennial favourite on the Singapore culinary scene, FLUTES has continued its preeminence long after moving from Fort Canning to its stately post at the National Museum of Singapore. The setting lends an air of well-deserved authority to FLUTES, where the kitchen is seasoned with both wit of contemporary styling, and wisdom of classic Anglo-European gastronomy.
A beautifully appointed dining room is drowned in natural light by day, from parallel rows of tall, arched windows. In the evening, the terrace is backed by the historic building's stunning facade. It's unsurprisingly the choice for many a romantic evening and impressive lunch, serving cuisine that's frequently regarded as among the city's finest. Any foodie worth their salt would agree! (May 2014)

data.title: FOC Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Toasted Bread with Tomatoes, Mushroom Croquettes, Cod Fish Puff Fritters, Octopus Galician Style, Watermelon Gazpacho with Smoked Olive Oil Ice Cream, Scallops "Ceviche", Spanish French Toast with Vanilla Ice Cream, Madame Butterfly, Blacked Out In Bangkok
data.ABOUT:
Like a magician with a particular flair for showmanship, Spanish maestro Nandu Jubany of Michelin-starred Can Jubany fame, produces a gastronomical spectacular of sorts, cloaked by the industrial facades of Hong Kong Street.
With his lovely assistants Jordi Noguera of Foodbar Dada lineage, and Dario Nocentini plucked from the Catalunya bar, Jubany conducts quite a show of Spanish culinary arts. The restaurant has just the fitting look, with zany motifs reminiscent of Picasso, materialized as if from a dreamscape. Pepper grinder light fixtures and super-sized sculptures of familiar faces float above the dining space. A vintage motorcycle adorns the walls, and the food too has a quirky appearance that eclipses the unexpectedly classic flavours. Jubany introduces Catalan folk cuisine, and with a wave of the wand, adds brilliant Asian twists.
The black Mediterranean paella is filling yet nuanced in taste, and the patatas bravas and tomato bread both show a different side of the traditional tapas dishes. On the more Asian end of the spectrum, the Thai razor clams are delightfully piquant, while the roasted duck with orange zest dumplings show the chef's hubris in remaking local favourites. The varied menu even includes gluten-free options like the chocolate hamburger, a dessert indicative of the humourous approach FOC takes to dining.
From the bar, brilliantly innovative cocktails are not in short supply. The menu is a clear demonstration of Nocentini's flexing of his creative muscles, using such unique ingredients as Matcha powder, cornflakes vodka, and galangal rum (though not all in the same drink).
If the name of the restaurant sounds like the slip of the tongue could be a dangerous one, it’s not an unintentional coincidence. Meaning fire in Catalan, FOC certainly plays with fire both in its name, its daring dishes, and its unapologetically unconventional approach to nouveau dining. (Sep 2014)

data.title: FOC Sentosa - Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eggplant with Sobrassada Sausage, Parmesan Cheese & Honey, Iberian Pork Paella with Spring Onion Foam, Mediterranean Turbot with Roasted Cauliflower, Oreo XXL, Ibiza Martini, Matcha Colada
data.PRESS RELEASE:
FOC Sentosa brings a taste of the Mediterranean spirit to Singapore's premier beach destination, with a cosmopolitan and exuberant beach restaurant and bar. Inspired by Barcelona's vibrant beach culture, FOC Sentosa delights with an elegant, yet relaxed atmosphere, combined with exquisitely prepared Mediterranean cuisine focusing on fresh and delectable grilled produce from the sea and soil, paellas, summery signature cocktails and carefully selected sunny wines.
The resplendent interiors are completed by breezy beach hammocks, plush cabanas, a pool deck and plenty of space to lounge. FOC Sentosa is the new destination for effortless beachside living and events. (Sep 2016)

data.title: FOOK KIN
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Golden Lotus Root Chips, Honeyed Char Siew, Roasted Char Siew, Fook Kin Tofu
data.PRESS RELEASE:
If the blaring Cantonese remixes, neon lights, and painted pigs on the walls didn’t give it away, this is not your typical Chinese restaurant. Established by radio veterans “The Muttons” in collaboration with the celebrated Old Airport Road Hawker stall Roast Paradise, this restaurant is the perfect place to go to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Cantonese Roast Meat is the name of the game here, and diners looking for a delicious plate of meat to stick their forks in will not be disappointed!

Honeyed Char Siew with crisp edges is an excellent option for diners who are new to Cantonese Roast Meat. Cooked with a deliciously tantalising honey glaze atop a slab of tender pork meat, this dish is juicy, mildly sweet, and is best enjoyed warm. The Roasted Char Siew is another option that is perfect for seasoned connoisseurs. The meat is flame-grilled for maximum flavour, giving it a slick glaze and smoky flavour.

Not a fan of pork? The Fook Kin Tofu is a silken tofu dish topped with salmon roe and cooked with traditional spice and sauces. This dish is tender, flavourful, and best enjoyed with a bowl of steamed rice. For something a little crunchier, opt for the Golden Lotus Root Chips - thin slices of lotus root fried to crisp perfection. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Face Restaurant | Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mac & Cheese Balls, Mala Glazed Prawns, Angel Hair Pasta, Yam Paste Nouveau
data.ABOUT:
A modern Asian facade that synthesises both the energetic ambience of the nightclubs and bars together with the chic potency of the restaurant culture, Face Restaurant | Bar seeks to provide a safe haven to accommodate people from all walks of life. 

Kickstart your dining experience here with the classic Mac & Cheese Balls. Breaded and served with egg salad cream sauce, these tasty balls are made up of macaroni and cheese together with yummy bits of bacon. Diners looking for dishes with a fiery punch to start their meal can opt for the Scallop & Papaya Spicy Thai Salad or the huge and juicy Mala Glazed Prawns. De-shelled and glazed with a mouthwatering coat of Szechuan Mala Mayonnaise, the succulent tiger prawns are a must-try! 

Pasta lovers should try the Angel Hair Pasta. A delicious combination of Thai basil pesto angel hair pasta with ikura, this dish is a unique spin on the well-loved spaghetti dish. Served with sea bird’s nest coconut sauce, wrap up your meal with a refreshing bowl of Yam Paste Nouveau. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Famous Treasure
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steamed Empress Chicken, Kway Teow Fried with Chye Poh and Kai Lan, Marinated Cockles Teochew-Style, Baked Flower Crab with Sea Salt, Orh Nee (yam paste)
data.ABOUT:
Chilli crab and Hainanese chicken rice have become the hallmark of Singaporean-Chinese cuisine. But, head to Famous Treasure for a taste of lesser-known dishes that are a nod to Singapore’s melting pot of cultures. Dinner starts with little saucers of tangy pickled papaya and sour plum-infused tomatoes that are meant to whet your appetite for the savoury plates to come. A dish of Steamed Empress Chicken is a well-loved Cantonese favourite. The fresh, plump chicken is lightly salted and steamed, drizzled with Shaoxing wine and soya sauce, then garnished with julienned ginger for a hint of heat. Also, try the Whole Steamed Fish with sour preserved vegetables, peanuts, and roast pork in a brown sauce for an uncommon pairing of ingredients.

Carbs are a must-have at every Chinese restaurant, and the Teochew-style Kway Teow Fried with Chye Poh and Kai Lan is a humble dish redolent with wok hei (a complex, charred aroma). The flat rice noodles are tossed with preserved radish and chopped Chinese broccoli, then skillfully cooked at high heat over roaring flames for that deep, smoke-kissed flavour. 

Apart from its extensive food menu, Famous Treasure also offers a vast selection of wines and whiskies, including limited editions such as a Balvenie 30-year-old Scotch as well as a 30-year-old Glenglassaugh. Sip on these rich, smoky spirits that are the perfect complement to a meal here. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Farangse
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Seared Foie Gras With Apple Chutney and Blinis, Braised Beef Cheek with Red Wine and Mushrooms, Black Cod Fish & Chips, Deep-Fried Thai Pork Neck Nahm Jim, Warm Apple Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away in Greenwood Avenue, Farangse is the go-to for comfort French food tinged with a Thai flair. Start the meal on a refreshing note with dishes such as tuna ceviche dressed in a zesty calamansi vinaigrette. If you want something more, go all out for indulgent French classics like the Burgundy Escargots Baked in Garlic Herb Butter, or Pan-Seared Foie Gras With Apple Chutney and Blinis. 

Meat-lovers are in for a treat at Farangse, which leans towards a beef-centric menu. Tuck into the Braised Beef Cheek with Red Wine and Mushrooms, a flavourful dish where the meat is simmered in a rich wine sauce until fork-tender and paired with earthy mushrooms, for a treat. Steaks are also done well in this French-Issan outfit, with crowd favourites such as grass-fed beef striploin and tenderloin char-grilled to perfection and served with a dollop of silky mash. Another favourite is the grilled iberico pork, dressed in lashings of honey and sweet roasted vegetables on the side. Be sure to save some space for dessert as well - the warm apple tart with a scoop of house-made vanilla ice cream is reminiscent of grandma’s cooking. For a fusion sweet treat, go for the Thai mango sticky rice. (May 2019)

data.title: Fat Cow
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Fat Cow Wagyu Sandwich, Saga A5 Wagyu, 21 Days Dry-aged Nagasaki A5 Wagyu Striploin, Fat Cow Premium Donburi, Donabe Fat Rice, Fat Cow’s Daiginjo Label
data.ABOUT:
Fat Cow is an award-winning modern fine-dining Japanese restaurant by Refinery Concepts, it has received ‘Best Japanese Restaurant Fine Dining’ Award at the RAS Epicurean Star Awards in 2019 and Chope Diner’s Choice ‘Best Restaurant of The Year” Award for two consecutive years (2018, 2019).

Opened in 2011, its calm interior is founded in the concept of wabi-sabi – the art of finding beauty in things modest, simple and humble.

At the eight seater omakase counter, the Chef’s Table brings a contemporary and creative approach to seasonal fresh produce. Fat Cow is led by veteran Tokyo-born Chef Shigeru Kasajima.

The luxurious Japanese restaurant serves an extensive handpicked selection of finest Wagyu from reputable farms in Japan.  For a customised experience, you can enjoy Wagyu prepared in various Japanese methods such as Shabu-Shabu or Sukiyaki. Its bar menu features list of Japanese-inspired cocktails and shochu infusions, curated wines and sakes for an enjoyable wine and dine experience. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Fat Prince
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cashew Hummus, Fried Cauliflower, Spring Pea Falafel Kebab, Grilled Octopus, Omega Lamb Porterhouse, Wagyu Beef Cheek, Chocolate Cardamom Cake
data.ABOUT: We are a modern Middle Eastern restaurant that defies tradition and explores the facets of creativity to offer an elevated, energetic and engaging dining experience. Let your hair down and soak in the sights and sounds of our stylish surrounds and funky beats; all while enjoying our unconventional KEBABS and “KOKTAILS”, inspired by the streets and stories of today’s nomad. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Fatboy's The Burger Bar (Holland Village)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The YOLO, Wimpy, Country Fried Steak, Salted Egg Fries
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Fatboy's provides a casual and laid back atmosphere for diners of all ages to dine in tune to sixties oldies providing a picture of the forgotten malt and soda shops of old. The 45-seater restaurant has a mix of old school benches and modern high tables to complete it's casual look. 

Fatboy's The Burger Bar was opened with the aim whooping up authentic home made burgers to hungry folks. Fatboy's menu features hamburgers recipes that are authentic and defines what a real burger should be according to the brothers. 

Additionally, Fatboy's also feature a build-your-own-burger menu where you can choose how you want your burger. Choose from a wide array of buns, patties, add-ons and sauces to create your very own gourmet burger. 

Fatboy's has grown since running multiple outlets in Singapore, Malaysia and China. More outlets in Asia are also in the pipeline. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Feast Roxy
data.Hours: Mon, Wed-Thu: 12-10pmFri-Sun: 12-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:30 pm)Closed Tuesday
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 50 East Coast RoadGrand Mercure Singapore RoxySingapore (428769) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Divine Laksa River Prawn, Udang Asam Pedas, Signature Roxy Durian Paste, Seafood Platter
data.ABOUT:
Eat, drink and meet at Feast Roxy, a new multi-concept restaurant set as the ideal venue to cater to multiple lifestyle settings. Be it a casual dinner, intimate catch up or small scale gatherings, Feast Roxy is a great place for all.

Choose from two different dining concepts. Drop by on weekdays to have a taste of their all-day dining menu, or head down on weekends to enjoy the restaurant’s a la carte buffet. A specially curated selection featuring local and Western cuisine, the all-day dining menu includes hearty classics such as the Signature Divine Laksa River Prawn, Monthly “Gossip” Bowl, Rendang Duck Meet Hainan Toast, and more. The Signature Divine Laksa River Prawn is a creamy mix of coconut milk with fragrant herbs and spices that elevate the flavours of the traditional noodle dish. 

The a la carte buffet also boasts similarly local offerings with familiar favourites such as Udang Asam Pedas, Signature Roxy Durian Paste and more. Made for sharing, the Seafood Platter is a dish that all seafood lovers will surely fancy. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Feng Shui Inn
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Double-Boiled Black Chicken Soup with Fish Maw and Cordyceps Flower, Chilled Prawn with Lemon Sauce, Pan-Fried Wagyu Beef in Teriyaki Sauce, Pan-Seared Japanese Kurobuta Pork Loin, Double-Boiled Hashima with Red Dates
data.ABOUT: Helmed by Hong Kong veteran chef Li Kwok Kwong, this elegant restaurant decorated with gold leaf ceilings serves up Cantonese masterpieces that are exquisite in presentation and taste. The extensive menu features perennial favourites like Chinese barbecued meats and dim sum, as well as nourishing double-boiled soups that are a staple in Cantonese cuisine. The Double-Boiled Black Chicken Soup with Fish Maw and Cordyceps Flower is lovingly prepared from a stock of Chinese Jin Hua ham, pork shoulder, and old fowl that is simmered over low heat for six hours to coax out deep, rich flavours. For mains, the signature dishes at Feng Shui Inn are a must-try. Chilled Prawn with Lemon Sauce is given a modern twist with a side of fluffy lobster pancakes, drizzled with salted egg yolk and buttercream sauce. Order also the Pan-Fried Wagyu Beef in Teriyaki Sauce, where cubes of tender and juicy medium-rare steak are tossed in a sweet sauce. Other must-tries include Pan-Seared Japanese Kurobuta Pork Loin, as well as Roast Quail Drumstick in Black Truffle Sauce. For carb-loves, ‘Kampong Uncle’ Fried Rice in Hot Pot is a sizzling dish with delicious crispy bits at the bottom of the claypot. End the meal on a sweet note with traditional desserts like Double-Boiled Hashima with Red Dates and Double-Boiled Almond Cream with Glutinous Rice Balls. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Firangi Superstar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates

data.title: Firewood Chicken Korean Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Charcoal BBQ Chicken, Samyang Spicy Hot Chicken Noodles, DIY Rice Ball, Namsan Mountain Brew
data.ABOUT:
The first Korean firewood chicken place in town, Firewood Chicken Korean Restaurant treats diners in the East to an authentic spread of Korean chicken, alongside a variety of fun fusion dishes. 

Hailing from the shopping streets of Myeongdong, this deep fried dish pays homage to Korea’s street food. Aptly called Myeongdong Chicken, this traditional fried chicken is moist on the inside and crispy on the outside, affording diners with savoury juiciness with every bite. The Charcoal BBQ Chicken is another signature favourite that features bite sized marinated chicken paired with tteokbokki, finished off with a deliciously fiery pool of hot and spicy sauce that’s guaranteed to bring you maximum delight.

For spice lovers, rise to the challenge with the Samyang Spicy Hot Chicken Noodles. The intense heat is sure to satisfy your cravings. Sweet Spicy and Garlic Soy options are also available. Pair these with the restaurant's authentic Jeju beer to complete the Korean dining experience. Favourites include the Namsan Mountain Brew and Jeju Baengnokdam Brew. 

If you’re ready to get down and dirty, the DIY Rice Ball is a delicious bowl of rice, tobiko and chicken meld that is extremely filling and absolutely scrumptious! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Fish Pool
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oscietra Caviar, Kinglas Scottish Salmon, Oyster Platter
data.PRESS RELEASE:
With its red carpet entrance, Fish Pool at The NCO Club is an electrifying champagne, caviar, and oyster bar embellished with an elegant aquatic diving pool showpiece for the city's glamorous rendezvous and events.

Be mesmerized by the venue and indulge in its raw bar selection, complemented by award-winning champagne. The finest oysters, available in platters of 6 or 12, come straight from brackish waters in France and are freshly shucked for diners. Buttery, briny, and tender, this is the perfect treat to accompany a glass of bubbly.

Prefer something more substantial? The Kinglas Scottish Salmon is a generously portioned meaty treat. The smooth salmon flesh is sliced fresh and served cold, the way salmon should be. The Oscietra Caviar pairs perfectly with any of the champagnes available and is best enjoyed with a Mother-of-Pearl spoon. The soft, small grains are tender and briny and are countered by the sharp sweetness of champagne. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Five &2
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Singapore Laksa, Fish & Chip, Dried Tom Yum Seafood Linguine, Carbonara, Vongole in Light Cream Sauce,Pumpkin Tart
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Nestled within Punggol Park’s luxuriant foliage, Five &2 is a restro-bar that is committed to our community members – our customers, our employees and the underprivileged.

Sustenance is the cornerstone of one’s body and mind development, yet not everyone has access to such basic provision. We are thus dedicated to reaching out to the underprivileged in our midst, so they too can enjoy good nutritional food necessary for productive and positive living. Five &2 partner family welfare groups in our vicinity to provide complimentary nutritious meals to families from resource-poor backgrounds.

By embracing disruptive technologies to create an inclusive workplace environment at Five &2, we are also able to provide equal job opportunities for all, including persons with disabilities and ex-inmates, creating a sustainable and meaningful future for the different multitudes in our community.

For customers, we focus on bringing hearty cuisines with drinks of great value in an inclusive environment. Some customers’ favourites include Singapore Laksa, Fish & Chip, Dried Tom Yum Seafood Linguine, Carbonara, Vongole in Light Cream Sauce and Chendol. If you are a fur-parent, you can also enjoy a great meal at our alfresco dining area while your fur-kids dig into pet-treats sold onsite! (Jan 2020)

data.title: Five Oars Coffee Roasters
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Siren’s Allure House Blend, White Wine Vongole, Iberian Pork Burger
data.ABOUT:
Five Oars Coffee Roasters, located in the hip Tanjong Pagar neighbourhood, is simultaneously lush and yet, minimalist. It promises tranquillity in the heart of a vibrant city, as well as a wonderful cup of joe to start the day. 

Coffee connoisseurs rejoice, as Five Oars Coffee Roasters serves two tantalising house blends, rotated every fortnight. If you prefer something light, try the Siren’s Allure. With tasting notes of berries, dark chocolates and hazelnuts, the resultant cup is light and fruity, perfect for balmy afternoons. For those who prefer stronger coffees, be sure to sample Poseidon, a much more potent blend. Its resultant cup is fuller, with aromatic notes of berry that will leave your tongue tingling. 

Non-coffee drinkers can indulge in Five Oars Coffee Roaster’s excellent selection of bottled sodas, craft beers and juices. Feeling hungry? Five Oars Coffee Roasters consistently pushes the culinary boundaries of cafe fare, elevating standards to create dishes that are both delicious, and aesthetically pleasing. Be sure to try favourites including the Five Oars Breakfast, which includes sourdough, mesclun mix, and portobello mushrooms, and do not miss the White Wine Vongole, served in white wine sauce and clams. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Fleur de Sel Le Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Les Saint-Jacques, Le Homard, La Truite, Le Cabuillaud, Le Lapin, L’agneau, Le Boeuf, Les Assortiments, Le Baba
data.ABOUT:
What's a chef with a serious love for excellent French cuisine and years of experience working in renowned kitchens to do? Open up his own restaurant, of course. Chef Alexandre Lozachmeur's Fleur De Sel is a quaint shophouse space outfitted with aged French furniture and a bar, whilst an open-concept kitchen provides tantalising glimpses into the culinary behind-the-scenes.
There aren't a lot of seats, a blessing when you're trying to have an intimate meal, so diners are guaranteed lavish amounts of attention in the form of carefully prepared, complex dishes, warm service, and much more. Find yourself enamoured by a la carte options and set menus filled with incredibly detailed French classics like Le Homard (poached Maine lobster, fork mashed ratte potatoes, chives, bisque jus, and basil oil), L'agneau (8 hour slow cooked Lamb rump with garlic, Green peas, organic carrots, and rosemary lamb sauce), and Les Saint-Jacques (pan seared scallops, mushrooms, arugula, Parma ham, and chicken jus). Distressed over what to order? You'd be more than welcome to partake in Chef Alexandre's degustation experience instead, where delightful seasonal ingredients do their best to blow you away.
Constantly evolving fine French fare, cosy elegance, lovely ambience, we could go on and on, but we thought we'd leave some of Fleur De Sel's impressive list of top qualities for you to discover on your own! (Apr 2016)

data.title: Flying Monkey
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Galouti Kebab, Calamari 65, Quail Musallam, Nalli Gosht, Goa Mamma Lassi, Yo Yo Mani
data.PRESS RELEASE:
A new Indian tapas restaurant  and bar is all geared up to be the next culinary star at the heart of Kampong Glam. Flying Monkey will offer diners delectable dishes of contemporary pan-Indian cuisine served tapas style, as well as classic international cocktails with an Indian twist on flavours. As the only full-fledged kitchen and bar situated amidst the bustle of Bussorah Street, Flying Monkey is also one of the few restaurants in the vicinity to have bespoke cocktails available.

Their best-selling small plate dish is the Galouti Kebab ($14). The word 'Galouti' means to melt in one's mouth, and this dish truly lives up to its name.This was achieved by mincing the meat no less than 13 times, then marinating the meat with certain spices and unripe papaya.

Other tapas signature dishes include Tandoori Chicken ($10) marinated in yogurt and spices; Tulsi Cod ($15) or Cod Fillet marinated with basil creating a greenish hue charred in the Tandoor; Calamari 65 ($10), a spin on 'Chicken 65' that is relished in Indian cuisine and would complement their cocktails well; and crispy Truffle Naan ($14) served with paneer mousse and pear chutney.

Big Plate highlights include Quail Musallam ($26), which features a whole quail slow-cooked and served on Kashmiri Pulao, and Nalli Gosht ($26), which is a lamb shank cooked overnight and bathed in a creamy peanut-cashew curry served with garlic naan.
For dessert, diners can enjoy Jalebi ($10), a traditional crispy Indian Pretzel dipped in aromatic syrup. Freshly made from the kitchen, it  is served warm and topped off with a sprinkle of Pistachio. (Mar 2017)

data.title: Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant 佛有缘素食馆
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sweet and Sour Fish, Mango Roll, Sliced Vegetarian Roasted Pig with Honey Sauce, Vegetarian Prawns in Butter Sauce
data.PRESS RELEASE: Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant offers the finest Vegetarian Food. Our newly renovated and fully air-conditioned restaurant dishes out delicious dishes to satisfy your taste buds. No matter the occasion, be it a wedding, anniversary, birthday or any celebrations and luncheon, you will be served with a sumptuous 8-course meal or in Buffet Style. Hurry down to Fo You Yuan Vegetarian Restaurant to savour the tastiest, healthy food. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Folklore
data.Cuisine: Malaysian, Fusion, Local, Southeast Asian, Peranakan, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address:
700 Beach Road
Level 2
Destination Singapore Beach RoadSingapore (199598)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ayam Sioh, Fish Head Curry, Chap Chye, Buah Keluak, Kueh Kosui
data.PRESS RELEASE: At Folklore, we believe that food has to be cooked right, where nothing is rushed and everything from the preparation of ingredients to the cooking of the dish should be done the traditional way, allowing you to savour how things were done in the past. Serving up nostalgic flavours, Folklore seeks to bring back fond memories for the older generation and remind the young of our fading food heritage. (Jul 2017)

data.title: Folks Collective - The Eclectic Emporium (AXA Tower)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
8 Shenton Way
#01-15/18/23
AXA Tower
Singapore (068811)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: FOLKS Spring Rolls, Glass Noodle Salad, Morning Glory Stir-fry, Chargrilled Pork Collar Salad, Crackling Pork Belly
data.ABOUT:
The original outpost of the Folks’ Collective empire, Folks’ Collective - The Eclectric Emporium is an homage to all things royal. An effervescent fusion of artfully mismatched antiques amongst walls adorned with portraits of Thailand’s Royal Family and Grace Kelly, Folks Collective - The Eclectric Emporium is a great place to enjoy Thai cuisine while feeling like royalty.
There is an extensive menu of small plates for sharing - with the Pandan Chicken as a clear stand-out. The flavour from the Pandan leaves infuses the chicken with a distinctive taste that can only be described as scrumptious. The fragrant and moist parcels of chicken go well with the accompanying sweet chilli dip. Another favourite from the selection of main courses available is the Chargrilled Pork Collar. An indulgent treat of marinated pork collar tossed in lime and herbs with toasted ground rice, you’ll want to order second and third servings! Be sure to save space for dessert as the selection is exciting - the Chaffogato is a twist on the classic Affogato, except this time, it is Thai iced milk tea with is served with vanilla ice cream. This surprising combination is refreshing and delightful, making it the best end to a stellar meal. There is truly no better way to wind down after a long day than enjoying a meal at the Folks’ Collective - The Eclectric Emporium with friends. (Mar 2017)

data.title: Folks Collective - The Vintage Shophouse (Cross Street)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
20 Cross Street
#01-25
China Square Central
Singapore (048422)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Angel Wings, Pomelo Salad, Crispy Fish Skin, Massaman Chicken Curry, Three Mushroom Salad, Lychee Red Curry, Papaya Salad
data.ABOUT:
One of the best-hidden secrets in town is the vintage wonderland that spreads out across China Square every weekend, and this new cafe and bistro, sharing this love for quaint old things, offers a menu of hearty favourites inspired by Bangkok vintage markets, where great food and quaint knick knacks rub shoulders. If you’ve ever found yourself hankering for those sweaty Bangkok nights hunting for great vintage finds, with a yummy Thai snack in hand, this place will jog those memories and fill your tummy at the same time.
Scrumptious Thai street food takes center stage here. Think chicken wings stuffed with minced meat and vegetables, little parcels of pandan-infused grilled chicken, crispy fish skin coated in salted egg yolk on a bed of vermicelli, and Fried Prawn Cakes served with sweet and sour plum dip. Heftier plates include set meals of Massaman chicken curry, steamed fish, and rice, or lychee red curry sweetened with pineapples, tomatoes, and filled with tender mounds of duck. For some extra heat, Thai salads like vibrant pomelo salad, little juicy pips tossed with peanuts, lime, shrimp, and chilies, and a zingy three mushroom salad with enoki, shimeji, and oyster mushrooms tossed in a chili lime dressing. In addition, we also offer a wide variety of vegetarian and vegan friendly and healthy options such as Buddha Japchae Bowl and Salt & Chilli Aubergine & Tofu as well as an authentic new monthly Chef's Specials of truly Thai Salads "Yum and Tum", (i.e. Flower Crab Salad, Cockles Salad), Prawn Sashimi & Royal Kapi Rice that will bring Thailand to your palate from the very first bite. A surprise Thai food gem in the middle of Telok Ayer, in gorgeous vintage trappings, this Instagram worthy spot is perfect for a Sunday afternoon lunch amidst antique and vintage shopping haunts. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Food Capital
data.Cuisine: American, Buffet, Chinese, Japanese, Indian, International, Seafood, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
392 Havelock Road
Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Singapore (169663)                                                Map
data.ABOUT:
Here at the elegant lobby of the Grand Copthorne Waterfront is its premier dining destination, Food Capital, an international buffet that spans the gamut of everyone's favourite food offerings from all over the world, with a great view of the Singapore River to boot.

Open a meal here with selections from its cold seafood bar that ranges from shucked oysters to freshly sliced sashimi and sushi, then move on to its impressive rotisserie section featuring a hulking beef stripling and super gourmet slow-cooked veal shank served with a truffled potato mousseline. The local selections here are especially good, featuring a beautiful tureen of chili crab and the famous Grand Copthorne Laksa, followed at the end by a selection of local kueh like ondeh ondeh and kueh lapis sagu, which you can pair with Western petits fours and parfaits.

All this gluttony takes place in a gorgeous and sophisticated dining area with massive windows looking out onto the world outside. The view is best on a bright Sunday morning, just in time for the restaurant's luxurious brunch buffet. Head down to the Waterfront and get your tummy filled! (Mar 2017)

data.title: Food Exchange
data.Cuisine: Indian, Thai, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
28 Stevens Road
Novotel Singapore on Stevens
Singapore (257878)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mee Goreng, Beef Bulgogi, Slow Cooked Beef Cheek, Giant Wagyu Beef Burger
data.ABOUT:
If you value freshness and quality of your meals, then Food Exchange is the surefire place to hit up. Comfortably nestled in Novotel Singapore on Stevens, this sleek eatery spins up a plethora of fresh healthy eating plates, allowing you to tuck into a delectable food while overlooking the view of the hotel's infinity pool.


At Food Exchange, the delicious plates of food start flying out the kitchen doors at the crack of dawn, as chefs churn out a generous and overflowing bounty of food to satiate eaters young and old. Have your pick from a wide selection of fresh breads, pastries, cereals, as well as regional and international specialities. For lunch and dinner, the staff turn their focus on regional cuisines, offering a tempting fusion of Asian and Western Dishes. Dishes are skilfully prepared using freshest regional ingredients at the open kitchen. 

Dining with out-of-towners? You'd want to introduce your guests to beloved local dishes such as the Beef Rendang and Nasi Goreng. Or if you love indulgent weekend brunches, then Food Exchange has got you covered, with a menu that encompasses fresh sashimi and seafood, and hot cooking stations serving up Egg Benedict, Foie Gras, Beef Rump, Baked Salmon Laksa as well as BBQ and Grill. Food Exchange is on a mission to prove that hotel food doesn't have to be stodgy, and they sure do deliver. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Food For Thought (National Museum of Singapore)
data.Cuisine: American, Italian, Fusion, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Southeast Asian, Cafe, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Full Works, Mixed Berries Cream Cheese Pancake, Roast Beef Salad, Lemon Dill Fish & Chips, Soft Shell Chilli Crab Linguine, Spicy Pulled Pork Linguine, Ma Ling Fries, Old School Apple Pie
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Housed in Singapore’s oldest yet still progressive museum (National Museum of Singapore), Food For Thought exudes heritage charm and grandeur, with lots of natural light. Playing to the mantra of ‘Share the Good Times’, the restaurant’s appearance honours Singaporean traditions through an emphasis on stories. Food For Thought's space invites you to share conversations about our city’s past, present and future. 

The beautiful marble table tops, wall mosaic and wooden chairs are a homage to the home-style dining rooms and kopitiams in which many Singaporeans grew up with. Due to Food For Thought's museum locale, you’d find carefully curated items and exclusive Singaporean tales on the feature shelf in the atrium of the restaurant too. 

Food For Thought serves up hearty, community-inspired bistro fare – honest food in Southeast Asian flavours with a globalised influence. Their menu showcases unique food dishes inspired by exhibits within the museum as well, so be sure to check back often! (Jan 2019)

16 Sentosa Gateway
