Resorts Word Sentosa
Singapore (098133)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Milky Chicken Broth, Ah Sam Abalone Mee Sua, Mapo Tofu and Crab Meat with Japanese Pearl Rice, Kagoshima Wagyu Striploin, Textures of Black Sesame, Reconstructed Egg Tart
data.ABOUT:
High ceilings and a lush rainforest-themed decor make dining at Forest a serene experience. It’s easy to settle in and relax while perusing a menu that offers modern Chinese food with a focus on wellness. Helmed by celebrity chef Sam Leong, his signature dishes include Milky Chicken Broth and Ah Sam Abalone Mee Sua. The former is a nourishing double-boiled broth with morel mushrooms and bamboo pith served in a young coconut, while the latter is a comforting bowl of thin vermicelli noodles with plump abalone and fresh Sri Lankan crab meat in a tasty chicken soup. 

For diners who can handle the heat, try the Mapo Tofu and Crab Meat with Japanese Pearl Rice — a generous chunk of Sri Lankan crab claw is tossed in a searing hot wok together with a spicy Szechuan chilli sauce that will leave your tongue tingling from the first bite. 

Desserts are by chef Joe Leong (yes, chef Sam’s son), who turns traditional Chinese desserts into creative sweet treats. Try the Textures of Black Sesame, a molten lava cake with a nutty sesame filling. Topped with black sesame crumble and a scoop of black sesame ice cream, this is a fun take on the typical black sesame paste dessert. A sweet ending to a satisfying meal. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Foresta Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 200 Turf Club Road#01-16The Grandstand Singapore (287994)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Butter Prawns, Sambal Sausages, Buffalo Wings, Padaiyappa Rice, Laksa Goreng
data.ABOUT:
Dempsey welcomes a new bar to the hood in the form of Foresta, a newest drinking hole dishing out Asian delights.

To begin, whet your appetite with the Spicy Butter Prawns. Buttered up and spiced for that additional kick, this flavour-packed starter will keep you wanting more. Another starter worth trying are their Sambal Sausages. Slightly sweet and spicy, this lip-smacking dish gives you just the right kick.

Moving on to the mains, savour Foresta’s Asian plates spruced up with a local twist. Sample their signature Padaiyappa Rice, named after Indian superstar Rajini. The delectable dish is available in three flavours of chicken, mutton, and combination. For drinks, quench your thirst with Foresta’s very own Petta Bomb Shots. An exciting concoction of tequila, jägermeister, and vodka, you’re sure to get high on these unassuming shots.

Every Friday and Saturday, harmonious notes from the live band can be heard serenading guests as they wine and dine. Exuding a cosy ambience, Foresta makes a great new spot for hangouts with friends and family. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Four Points Eatery
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address:
382 Havelock RoadFour Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview
Singapore (169629)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bak Kuh Teh, Boston Lobster Laksa, Nasi Goreng Istimewa, Mookata, À la carte Zi Char Buffet
data.ABOUT: Sunlight spills through the ceiling-to-floor glass windows at this beautiful all-day dining restaurant, with a stunning view of the Singapore River to boot. There’s a slightly better view inside, though, of heaving platters of delicious food, all at your disposal. Treat yourself to tantalizing local, Southeast Asian and international cuisine with the choice of dining indoors or at the sheltered al fresco dining space. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Four Seasons Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Steamboat, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address:
78 Airport Boulevard
#B2-227/228
Jewel Changi Airport
Singapore (819666)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Durian Dome Mirror Cheesecake, Crispy Durian Rolls, Mao Shan Wang Fried Rice, Durian Hot Pot, Mao Shan Wang Pizza
data.ABOUT:
If you’re a big fan of the king of fruits, you’ll want to check out Four Seasons Restaurant. This specialty restaurant serves up the creamy yellow fruit in a myriad of ways, whether it’s in a soft mousse or wrapped and deep-fried in a spring roll. 

Desserts are the safest to start with. The Durian Dome Mirror Cheesecake, for instance, is a rich and indulgent sweet treat where the bitter-sweet fruit is blended with soft cheese and turned into a light, fluffy dessert. And if you love ice cream, the Mao Shan Wang Ice Cream is a must-try. 

For mains, whet your appetite for creative takes on Chinese cuisine. There’s Crispy Durian Rolls, as well as Mao Shan Wang Durian Fried Rice. The latter sounds like an eclectic combination, but the hints of savoury and sweet works like a charm. There’s even Durian Hotpot for the steamboat lovers! 

If you want a more Western take, try the Mao Shan Wang Pizza — the sweet durian paste turns this Italian staple into a dessert. There’s also a selection of non-durian dishes if it all becomes a tad overwhelming. Cool down with a light pistachio ice cream, or tuck into a comforting bowl of Laksa Pasta. Whether you love the king of fruit or not, there’s bound to be something for everyone here at the Four Seasons Restaurant. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Fratelli
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address:
26 Sentosa Gateway#02-145
Resorts World SentosaSingapore (098138)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bianca Pizza, Pici del Buttero, Oro Noro Pizza, Tartufo Pizza
data.ABOUT:
This rustic pizzeria boasts a larger space that is perfect for families or large groups. And it’s a good idea to invite more friends along — you’ll want to pace yourself so you can get a slice of everything. The Bianca Pizza is a safe bet to start with, made from a Japanese flour-based focaccia with a scoop of soft, creamy burrata (fresh Italian cow’s milk cheese). Generously marbled slivers of 20-month aged parma ham from renowned supplier, Pio Tosini, completes this elevated ‘ham-and-cheese’ combination. 

Truffle lovers will love the Tartufo Pizza, which boasts a thin crispy crust topped with chunks of buffalo mozzarella and generous shavings of black truffle. You’ll be lured in by the earthy aroma of fresh truffles, but what really makes this pizza a flavour bomb is the rich and buttery fontina ‘snow’. 

For a true taste of glamour, be sure to order the Pizza Oro Nero. This squid ink pizza comes laden with mussels, salted cod fish, calamari, and gleaming pearls of trout roe. It’s a generous dish as is, but a sprinkle of edible gold dust turns this into a picture-perfect creation. Get your cameras (and stomach) at the ready. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Freehouse
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wide Range Of Beers And Minimal Intervention Wines, Hand-cut Chips With Trout Roe And Sour Cream, Hamachi Tartare, Miso Mushrooms
data.ABOUT:
Along the quaint five-foot ways of Gemmill Lane find Freehouse, a spacious haven for all-day drinking and dining well. Conveniently located in Telok Ayer, it’s a hop and skips away from the nearest train station and downtown business district. Drop by for your coffee, a hearty lunch, a midday nip, or a big evening of drinks and moreish eats.   

On our impressive, curated drinks list find 16 rotating taps and canned craft beers, minimal intervention wines, sought-after sakes as well as culinary-inspired cocktails, making us the spot that offers the greatest variety of drinks in town. There’s always something to suit your mood. Feel free to approach our in-house sommeliers and experts who are always keeping a pulse on what’s best and latest. 
An all-day dining sharing menu accompanies the vast beverage options. Not tied to one particular cuisine, our produce-driven food is comforting and communal, and boasts strong modern Asian flair. Start with a mouth-watering Scallop Sashimi or Miso Mushrooms, before moving onto full-flavoured Curry Cauliflower Steaks and Spiced Snapper. Whatever you’re craving for, we’ve got you sorted. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Fremantle Seafood Market
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Make Merry Chilled Seafood Platter, Fisherman Hot Seafood Platter, Crustacean Sensation, Seafood Tapas, Oven-Roasted Whole Barramundi, Fremantle Aglio Olio
data.ABOUT:
Named after the Australian port city famed for its harbourside seafood markets, Fremantle Seafood Market lives up to its name by offering up a plethora of fresh and succulent seafood delights. With the restaurant having all its seafood air flown into Singapore on a regular basis, diners certainly won’t be complaining about a lack of freshness! Even in Singapore, where restaurants serving seafood are a dime a dozen, this elegant Clarke Quay restaurant manages to stand out from the rest of the pack by the sheer quality of ingredients it uses and the care with which the dishes are prepared and served.
In this hot and humid climate, diners will be sure to appreciate the Make Merry Chilled Seafood Platter, a gargantuan masterpiece piled high with five juicy oysters, several large King Crab legs, half a lobster, assorted sashimi, and four seafood tapas of choice – it’s a rare person who can resist and stop him or herself from salivating at such a luscious combination. Or for something a little closer to home, do try the Fisherman Hot Seafood Platter, which includes some local touches like steamed butter prawns and soft-shell crab served with helpings of piquant chilli crab sauce and fried man tou. With such quality seafood on offer, diners will most certainly be getting a bang for their buck. And as for the oft-asked question ‘to visit or not to visit’, for us it’s a real no-brainer! (Oct 2016)

data.title: Frenchie Wine Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Foie Gras Terrine, Cervelle Des Canuts, Cod Fish, Charcuterie Board
data.PRESS RELEASE: You’ll be unsurprised to hear that at Frenchie Wine Bar we’re very passionate about French food and wine. We’re only a small wine bar and restaurant on Tras Street in Tanjong Pagar, but we prepare classic French dishes with the finest, freshest ingredients we can find to bring you the most authentic tastes from one of Europe’s most loved cuisines. We have a wide variety of French wines that we’ll be happy to tell you all about and help you pair with your food. Why not reserve a table online and come and pay us a visit? We can’t wait to welcome you. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Frieda (The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
15 Stamford Road
Arcade @ The Capitol Kempinski
Singapore (178906)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Traditional “Wiener Schnitzel”, Semolina Pudding with Sour Cherry Compote, Grandma’s Potato Cream Soup with Leek and Croutons, Housemade Bread & Butter, Pork Knuckle, Veal Schnitzel, Pretzel Dumplings
data.ABOUT:
Frieda, named after the daughter of the Kempinski brand founder Berthold Kempinski, is a casual dining German restaurant that knows how to entertain.

On one side is the Daybar and Frieda Garden, a relaxing botanical dining area complete with palm trees. This bright garden venue beneath the glass atrium is ideal for lunch with a friend, complete with refreshing wine or German beer on tap. But Frieda really turns on the charm come 5pm with its daily selection of Happy Hour offers. Frieda Restaurant, on the other side of the walkway, is a cosy dining space for German fare just as you would have it at home.

You can’t go wrong with the crispy Pork Knuckle, succulent Veal Schnitzel or the deliciously savoury Pretzel Dumplings. It’s all so sinfully decadent, and even though you know you shouldn’t, you will be glad you did. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Friends Bak Kut Teh
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lamb-Kut Teh, Thai-style Steamed Squid, Canton Chee Cheong Fun, Butterfly Bun
data.ABOUT:
Feast on traditional favourites at Friends Bak Kut Teh with their signature renditions of the classic local delight. Slow brewed with pork bones for two hours to extract the innate flavours of each ingredient, the rich and flavoursome broth comes in two different flavours: a herbal Klang and local Teochew style. Diners can also find unique and inspired takes on the traditional broth in the menu. Opt for the Lamb-Kut Teh or Herbal Frog Leg Soup for a different but equally delicious dining experience. 

Complete your meal with a seafood dish from the restaurant’s comprehensive menu. Choose from fresh seafood specialties such as Thai-style Steamed Sea Bass, Thai-style Steamed Squid or Steamed Clams to satisfy your seafood cravings. Friends Bak Kut Teh also whips up steamed selections great for sharing, such as Canton Chee Cheong Fun, Butterfly Bun, Ham Chim Peng, and yummy handcrafted baos. With so many flavours to choose from, pick your choice of sweet or savoury for a tasty lunch or a mouthwatering afternoon tea session. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Friends Tasty Korea
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Backbone Stew, Budae Stew, Stir-fried Octopus, Seafood Pancake, LA Galbi
data.ABOUT:
Riding the ever popular K-Wave comes this affordable and delicious restaurant in the north. Serving up a range of popular classics like Korean Fried Chicken, Bibimbap, and even Korean BBQ items, diners are sure to be spoiled for choice here, and if you weren’t a fan of Korean food before, you sure will be after a visit here!

Diners who enjoy the hotpot will be glad to know that there is a range of flavours available. The Pork Backbone soup base is popular with diners, and there is also a Chicken Ginseng option for diners who prefer something a little healthier. Seafood lovers can opt for the Grilled Saba fish, a sizeable whole fish grilled with a smoky and rich flavour. The meat is good on its own, but is best enjoyed with a bowl of freshly steamed rice.

The Kimchi Fried Rice is the perfect dish for diners who are going solo. Stir-fried rice with pickled cabbage, chicken, and various other vegetables, this dish is spicy, crunchy, and surprisingly healthy. Sipping on some Soju? There are some Korean bar bites that go perfectly with that! The Stir-Fried Octopus is a spicy, chewy dish that pairs well with the sweet coolness of soju. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Frog Meat Fish Head 美蛙鱼头
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala Fish Head and Frog Leg Soup, Cereal Prawns, Stir-Fried Clams, Casserole Crayfish
data.ABOUT:
Frog Meat Fish Head is named quite literally after the famous Chongqing hotpot. Needless to say, it is the restaurant's speciality, using only quality fish and frog legs to ensure the meat remains tender when cooked.

Those who can handle the heat should go for the Mala Fish Head and Frog Leg Soup, with its lip-numbing yet addictive broth. If not, the pork and tomato-based soups are just as tantalising. Gather your friends and order a variety of other hotpot ingredients as well, from homemade meatballs to beef slices and veggies, and have fun dunking them into the piping hot soups.

Besides hotpot, the eatery also serves a range of cooked dishes like Cereal Prawns, Stir-Fried Clams, and Casserole Crayfish.

What makes this restaurant truly unique is their DIY bubble tea station, where you'll get to fill your cup with as much boba as you want before topping it up with creamy milk tea. You couldn't ask for a better ending to a hotpot meal. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Fu Lin Bar & Kitchen
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Location: Tanjong Pagar, Club Street, Telok Ayer
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fu Lin Yong Tau Foo, Dali’s Pork Feet, Iberico Steak, Prawn Pasta
data.ABOUT:
Another place with hawker roots turned 2-in-1 eatery, Fu Lin Bar & Kitchen serves its famous style of yong tau foo during the day before switching over to fusion Asian tapas and a menu of alcohol at night. Fair warning though, if you’re expecting the healthy type of yong tau foo with plenty of soup and boiled ingredients, turn back now. Their best-selling version of yong tau foo involves deep frying the typical tofu and meat options till they turn deliciously golden, before you slurp it all down with a bowl of thick vermicelli noodles and signature braised mushroom gravy. Alternatively, the ingredients can be boiled but, if you’d like to have your calories and eat healthy too, stick to deep frying and add a portion of vegetables instead.
Mid-afternoon is when the yong tau foo disappears but their Asian-inspired tapas won’t leave you missing it too much. Bacon Bak Gua, Camembert Toast, Dali’s Pork Feet and more, their small plates combine both western and Asian flavours with gusto, certainly a far cry from the more humble morning fare. Order dishes to share, get lost in their extensive sake menu, and settle in for a meal amidst industrial chic settings. (Nov 2015)

data.title: Fuego Bar & Kitchen
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
438B Alexandra Road
01-01Alexandra Technopark
Block B
Singapore (119968)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Satay, Questo Mixto, Chicharron & Chorizo Mixt, Spaghetti Carbonara
data.ABOUT:
Named after the Spanish word for hot, diners can expect a fiery dining experience here. Located in Alexandra Technopark, this bar and kitchen will wow you with its muted lighting, colourful chairs, and chill vibes. From a tantalizing tapas menu to drinks that won’t burn a hole in your pocket, we wouldn’t be surprised if you ditched your regular watering hole for this gem. 

There is a wide variety of beers available here - from French Kronenbourg to the classic Corona. There are also Sake, Wine, and Whisky lists that will make even the most seasoned connoisseur swoon. Not a fan of booze? The range of mocktails on offer are sure to delight those looking for fun, sober-nights. 

The bar bites menu is a mix of Mexican and local cuisine. Think Chicken Satay, Questo Mixto, and Nachos. The Chicken Satay is done perfectly here - the marinade is rich and the smokiness of the grill elevates the flavour of the meat. The accompanying peanut sauce and acar make the grilled snack perfect with a cold beer. The Chicharron & Chorizo Mixt is a great option for diners who love meat. Made with buttery pork belly and chimichurri sauce for some spice, this is a great option for diners who prefer fiery flavours. (March 2019)

data.title: Fukusen Izakaya
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Gizzard, T-Bone Steak, Grilled Squid
data.PRESS RELEASE: Fukusen Izakaya is a Japanese bar that serves tasty and inexpensive dishes that are best accompanied with alcoholic drinks. Come and experience this Japanese culture with us during lunch and after work! (Feb 2020)

data.title: Full of Luck Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Honey Glazed Char Siew, Moonlight Truffle Beef Hor Fun, Signature Seafood Dancing Rice in Superior Collagen Broth, Glutinous Rice Wrapped in Lotus Lead with Lup Cheong & XO Sauce, Signature Poached Fish Soup with Chinese Wine
data.ABOUT:
Cantonese cuisine isn’t always synonymous with slightly over-the-top restaurants, slightly gaudy with one traditional embellishment too many. Here at modern-Cantonese restaurant, Full of Luck Restaurant, you’d be hard-pressed to imagine Cantonese food coming out of the kitchen. Beautiful, homely with earth tones, the space welcomes everyone with inventive Chinese family cuisine. The two-storey shophouse interiors have been designed to exude the familiarity of home with a twist. A mixture of vintage materials like rattan weave, terrazzo and teak wood have been juxtaposed with contemporary detailing and open space planning. The look makes perfect sense, given the menu’s lineup of progressive, contemporary Cantonese dishes and Chinese-inspired cocktails. It’s less Chinese restaurant than it is, well, a chill Cantonese cocktail bar.

The chef’s signature Honey Glazed Char Siew is a specialty here with melt-in-the-mouth pieces of Char Siew blowtorched over sugar to give a sweet crisp exterior. Other dishes include a selection of Dancing Rice (aka ‘pao fan’) – dancing fried rice crisps in sizzling hot fragrant broth filled with poached rice and fresh toppings. Other family favourites are the Braised Garoupa with Beancurd in claypot and the tender Herbal Emperor Chicken with Collagen. Indulgence comes in the form of the classic Beef Hor Fun with an aromatic truffled twist. Classic Cantonese food, shot-through with local zhi char flavours, is given a bold, contemporary twist. Come re-acquaint yourself with one of Singapore’s favourite cuisines! (Jun 2019)

data.title: G7 Sin Ma Live Seafood and Frog Porridge
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Frog Leg Porridge, Chilli Crab, Drunken Prawns, Bamboo Clams and Marmite Pork Ribs
data.ABOUT:
Since 1999, G7 Sin Ma Live Seafood and Frog Porridge has been on a mission to provide the best frog leg porridge in Singapore. From its first humble bowl of porridge, it has expanded its menu to include premium live seafood and various zi char dishes. 

A good frog leg porridge is a foodie's dream, with tender chunks of meat marinated in a savoury combination of soy sauce, spring onions and spices, accompanied by a starchy bowl of rice congee to balance out the flavours. It's no wonder that it's been ranked highly in Singapore's list of comfort foods. The one at G7 is even cooked the traditional way, in a clay pot to preserve its taste and nutritional benefits. 

While you might have come for the iconic dish, you won't be able to resist trying other highlights like the Chilli Crab, Drunken Prawns, Bamboo Clams and Marmite Pork Ribs. After all, who can say no to live seafood and zi char dishes done right? (Nov 2019)

data.title: GIO - Gourmet Italian Osteria
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pizza Fritta, Caponata di Melanzane e Stracciatella, Rigatoni alla Carbonara, Braised and crusty beef cheek, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
Located in Singapore’s Central Business District, Gourmet Italian Osteria is inspired by the love of a simple yet generous Italian way of cooking. Setting out to recreate the same sense of community you feel while feasting at a typical Italian family table, chef David Marchioro revisits classic recipes to reinvent innovative dishes filled with fresh, contemporary flavours for an exclusive experience. 

A popular choice, the Polpette comes in four pieces with your choice of beef, chicken or tuna. Shaped into small balls and enriched with parsley, eggs, garlic and cheese, dunk these Italian meatballs into a special house sauce for a delicious burst of flavours. 

For those who prefer a hearty platter of small bites, the Tramezzini Selection offers Italian triangular sandwiches made with chevy, crustless white bread. Move on to signature favourites such as the Vitello Tonnato and Tagliatelle al Ragu in the four course meal before ending on a sweet note with the Tiramisu cake. (Apr 2021)

data.title: GREAThai (East Village)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Red Soup, Thai Styled Fried Kallan, Sweet & Sour Fish, Masamann Chicken Curry, Prawn Omelette, Thai Roasted Chicken, Thai Fish Cake, Sweet Tapioca with Coconut Milk
data.ABOUT:
Though adventurous palates once had to journey to Bangkok for authentic flavours, these days you can find delicious Thai favourites including Seafood Pad Thai, Thai Iced Milk Tea, Mango Sticky Rice, and more in just about every corner of Singapore. However, even with all the Thai options, finding something truly delectable is a little tough - well, it was until we chanced upon Greathai in East Village.
Serving up an array of Thai flavours, everything from a spicy Tom Yum Red Soup to a mind-blowingly delicious Masamann Chicken Curry, this little eatery is one of our go to spots when in the area. Along with the eats the service is impeccable so whether you're going with a group of two or twenty - one thing is certain, you won't leave here disappointed! (Mar 2016)

data.title: GRUB (Bishan Park)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 510 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 1Bishan Park 1 Singapore (569983)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mentaiko Fries, Crispy Fish Burger, Double Cheeseburger, Maple Bacon Burger
data.ABOUT:
Slinging good old-fashioned Western style - well, grub - with a thoughtful approach to local ingredients, it may surprise you to learn that GRUB's less about greasy fast food and more about gratifying fare.
The founders of GRUB set out to build a diner with inspired, responsible and delicious food. And though many restaurants start out with such good-hearted intentions - recalling sustainable sourcing, organic harvesting, and no artificial preserving - the results are often less satisfactory to both the palate and wallet. Based on the buzz generated by GRUB since opening, and its bubbling-over space located off the beaten path in Bishan Park however, GRUB has nailed it. The window-encased space lends an eco-friendly vibe to the otherwise urban-hip decor. The mingling of hungry diners with park goers on the al fresco patio is the vision of peace, love and good eats.
And quite tasty eats they are. The lion's share of the menu is dedicated to burgers of every sort - typical grub if there was one. Beef burgers are made from 100% grass-fed hormone-free beef, which is freshly ground in-house, a distinction you can taste in the moisture content and firmness of the patties. The juicy chicken burgers use antibiotic-free poultry as well. For vegetarians, the Portobello Burger subs the patty for a meaty mushroom cap topped with creamy crumbled feta, fresh lettuce and tomatoes. The combination is simplistic and satisfying.
Of the signature dishes, the Mentaiko Fries are a must-try, featuring crispy shoestring fries crowned with marinated roe of pollock, and sprinkled with confetti of nori seaweed for a umami textural play that's truly unique. Another play on trendy Japanese flavours of the moment is the Sakura Ebi Linguine with crispy fried Sakura Ebi, tiger prawns and a hint of mentaiko. (Jan 2017)

data.title: Gabbar Bistro & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Chicken Tikka, Fish Amritsari, Rogan Josh, Paneer Tirangi
data.ABOUT:
Gabbar Bistro & Bar Clarke Quay is the most hotly anticipated addition to Singapore’s bustling party destination Clarke Quay. Gabbar is a One-Stop Food and Live Entertainment Venue for Foreign Expats, Tourists, and Big Groups. Seating Capacity of over 120+ pax Indoor and Outdoor.

Gabbar takes Indian Dining to a new exciting level with Melt-in-the Mouth spicy Chicken/Lamb Tikka’s, Hot Mutton Kebabs, Spicy Tandoori dishes and Mouth-Watering Curries from North India, while you enjoy your meal - a renowned Live Music Band pumps up Bollywood and Commercial Music till midnight. Post-midnight the place turns into a foot-tapping, beer-fueled and fun-filled destination for Foreign Expats and Tourists as an International Bollywood and Commercial House DJ take control and lets you unwind to Retro and Commercial House Music till 3:00 AM.

The Bar is stocked with Rare Single Malts for the Exclusive few from across the lands, Crafted Beer, and Bottled Beers are always on offer. The Wine list is curated to match the Spicy Rich North Indian Cuisine, please ask staff for Gabbar’s offers and recommendations. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Gaig
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jamón Ibérico de Bellota Joselito, Roasted Suckling Pig, Seafood Paella with Calamari, Shrimps and Urchin, Stuffed Baby Calamari in Stew, Pig Trotter with Turnip, Roasted Chicken Croquette, Cherry and Tomato Cold Soup with Crab, Our Catalan Crème Brûlée
data.ABOUT:
Satisfy those niggling cravings for Spanish food when you dine at Gaig. Opened by Carles Gaig, whose family has owned the Barcelona restaurant Taberna d’en Gaig (renamed Restaurant Gaig in 1989) since 1869, you’re more or less guaranteed an authentic Catalan dining experience. With its delicious paellas, tapas plates, and other tasty dishes, even the most discerning patrons will find little to complain about.

Savour every bite of the spellbinding Jamón Ibérico de Bellota Joselito; this prized ham comes from the famous Iberian pig, and the reason why it is held in such high esteem quickly becomes apparent from the first mouthful. The Patatas Bravas is another one to try, bringing with it all the satisfaction that deep-fried food can inspire – comforting and very much a Spanish dish, try not to gorge it all down too quickly!

The paellas are also a tasty option; do have a go at the hearty Seafood Paella with Calamari, Shrimps and Urchin, and relish the generous helpings of seafood. The restaurant also does lovely meat dishes, and you’ll adore the Pig Trotter Catalan Style with Turnips, a decadent and oh-so-delicious main if there ever was one. Finally, top off your meal with an Orange Ice-cream Soufflé, which will wow you with a light, zesty flavour that’s ideal for this tropical climate. You’ll have a great meal and memorable dining experience at Gaig, that’s for sure! (Jul 2017)

data.title: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Capelli d’Angelo con Ostriche e Caviale, Gratin di Asparagi Bianchi, Gnocchi Al Gorgonzola, Spaghetti Aglio Olio, Sogliola, Braciola di Maiale, Tiramisu’ of Mamma Bice
data.ABOUT:
A popular destination for a romantic date night, Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar is one of our favourite spots when it comes to an intimate dining experience pulling out all the stops. From the complimentary olives and cheese spread upon entering to the attentive service and remarkable dishes - venturing out to to this oasis on Purvis street is a sure treat from the get-go. 

The a la carte menu, hand crafted by Chef-Owner Roberto Galetti, is a force to be reckoned with. Bringing together fresh produce and authentic recipes to create traditional and delightful Italian dishes - the team here has definitely  mastered the art of pasta. Their Spaghetti Aglio Olio with Scallops and Sardinian Bottarga, as well as the Ravioli Al Funghi Porcini stuffed with veal and porcini mushrooms are undeniable proof.

Though we’re not sure what exactly takes mainstage (because the entire menu is so impressive), the dolce and formaggi (also known as desserts) offerings are also worth taking a look at. With an artisan selection of gelato, Pannacotta Fragole Balsamico, and Tiramisu’ of Mamma Bice on the menu - one thing is certain, dessert never sounded so good! (Jan 2016)

data.title: Gaston
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truite a l’Aligoté, Éclair au Cassis
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Set within bustling Keong Saik Road, Gaston epitomises the French 'joie de vivre' with its convivial atmosphere and vibrant setting. The all-day bistro and wine bar evokes a sense of being in the heart of a kitchen in Burgundy; expect authentic, comforting French fare and delicious wines combined with exceptional hospitality.

Deeply rooted in the Burgundian heritage, embrace classic homemade specialties from the region including Jambon Persillé, Truite a l’Aligoté and Éclair au Cassis. With dishes crafted with the utmost respect for tradition, enjoy the freshest, seasonal ingredients sourced directly from artisanal producers at Gaston.

A meal isn't really fulfilled without a glass of wine - look forward to an extensive selection of quality, great value wines of close to 350 labels from France and beyond. Committed to ensuring that the wine programme is highly accessible, varied and exciting, most of the wines are sourced directly from the vintners themselves. With an extensive wine-by-the-glass selection of up to 15 wines, as well as a rotating 'Wine Flight of the Week', there is something for everyone from novices to seasoned drinkers. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Gattopardo Ristorante di Mare
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spiced Octopus Leg with Lemon Potato, Radish, Bottarga Mayonnaise, Red Prawn Ravioli with Black Truffle and Burrata Sauce, Angel Hair Pasta with Hokkaido Sea Urchin and Bottarga, Salt-Baked Mediterranean Seabass, Signature Seafood Stew
data.ABOUT: A marriage of sustainable seafood & the warmth of Italian souls.​Continuing the legacy of award-winning years as one of the best Italian Restaurant in Singapore. Enforcing our pledge to a sustainable path, we no longer serve a-la-carte menu. Our executive set lunch, degustation menu and omakase menu are curated with natural ingredients, Sicilian superfoods and sustainably farmed seafood available for the season. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Gem Bar
data.Hours: Mon-Thu, Sat: 4pm-1amFri & Eve of PH: 4pm-2amClosed Sunday & PH
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salted Egg Chicken Karage, GEM Burger, The Nutmeg & Clove Bao, 7 Sins of Yishun, Perfection, Mojito Grande, The R & K
data.ABOUT: If you like your night outs buzzing with action, then GEM Bar is the place for you. It’s hard to miss this rowdy bar located at the intersection of Ann Siang Hill and Club Street, with pulsating music and an exciting buzz that surrounds it. The cocktail menu here is bound to be a source of amusement, with the creative names the GEM Bar team have come up with. Fancy a pretty cocktail? Flower Song Served In A Teapot, a delicious mix of vodka and chrysanthemum tea, is perhaps one of the sweeter names here. Kyoho Pornstar will have you chuckling while wondering how else you can ask for this drink without blushing. But the sexy gin-based cocktail, mixed with Kyoho grape juice, prosecco, elderflower and lychee, is hard to resist. Order some bar snacks to go with the cocktails, like the Salted Egg Chicken Karaage and the GEM Bao served with chilli con carne and cheddar cheese. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Genius Central Singapore
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Flavour of Asia Bowl, Mexican Bowl of Glory, House Hot Smoked Salmon Risotto, Khichdi
data.ABOUT:
A place where health and wealth align, nourish your body with whole foods that are as close to nature as it is intended to be with low human interference. Genius Central Singapore is a place for entrepreneurs, change-makers, health-conscious and digital nomads. This restaurant caters to gluten-free, dairy-free, vegan, vegetarian, egg-free, and nut-free options.

Headed by Chef Ilham Tahirov, a renowned figure in the whole foods scene, Genius Central Singapore’s culinary team is dedicated to preparing meals that are delicious, healthy, and most importantly, house-made. We take pride in creating food items in-house, from our sauces to raw desserts to locally-farmed produce. This goes the same for our meat options, where we ensure that we only serve high-quality organic chicken; prawns, and fish wild-caught, that is, they are caught in their natural environment by fishermen. Ingredients such as organic basmati rice, gluten-free soy sauce, wolfberry, haricot fine beans, and gluten-free batter can be found in the extensive menu.

To get your day started for breakfast, start with a Smoothie Bowl or our famous Smashed Avocado, a healthy breakfast seasoned in Himalayan pink salt that sits on a 36-hour fermented toast, sprinkled with house-made dukkah and balsamic glaze, and topped with a chunky tomato salad and fresh herbs. For lunch, our popular Falafel bowl from the Longevity Bowls section makes a great lunch option. It is filled with a variety of mixed mesclun, cherry tomato salsa, tabouleh, traditional hummus, beetroot hummus, house-made falafel, mixed herbs, avocado, house-made plant-based raita, house-made flatbread, dukkah. Looking for something to fill your tummy after a long day? Genius Central also has you covered. Mains include the Creamy Mushroom Pasta, a healthier version to the traditional Italian favorite, a dish which Genius Central uses cashew milk to create the creamy texture.  Guests can also opt for gluten-free pasta. Khichdi is something that will fill your belly, with yellow mung lentils and plant-based raita cooked together with organic basmati rice. Genius Central Singapore’s menu also extends to desserts. Indulge your sweet tooth with raw bars such as the Cranberry Slice, Peanut Butter Slice, as well as options like the Vegan Chocolate Mudcake and Vegan Chocolate Cake.

With ample electrical outlets and table space, the restaurant is uniquely designed to accommodate any party size of guests. (Feb 2021)

data.title: George Town Tze Char & Craft Beer
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Thai Style Curry Fish Head, Kungfu Pork Ribs, Rendang Crab, Crispy Soft Shell Crab with Salted Egg Yolk Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Located in the heart of Boat Quay, Georgetown Penang Tze Char & Craft Beer is a short and scenic walk from Clarke Quay MRT. Providing quality food and drinks at an affordable price, the restaurant whips up mouthwatering Penang Tze Char that perfectly complements the craft beers on offer. 

Promising amazing Penang seafood at incredibly low prices, relish in Penang comfort food when you head down to the restaurant. Must-try dishes include the Thai Style Curry Fish Head, Kungfu Pork Ribs and more! Elevate your dining experience to the next level when you pair these fiery dishes with fine wines, gin or Brewlander Craft Beer — available on the menu. Alternatively, diners can indulge in a lip-smacking session with the restaurant’s signature Rendang Crab. Skillfully prepared by award-winning chef, Geroge Tan, the juicy and succulent crab meat is coated with a flavourful layer of Indonesian spicy gravy to excite your senses. 

Another innovative offering here is the Crispy Soft Shell Crab with Salted Egg Yolk Sauce. Drenched in a rich golden sauce, the soft shell crab is accompanied by a row of shiny golden mantou buns.  (Dec 2020)

data.title: Georges @ The Cove
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Georges Wings, BBQ Pork Ribs, Pork Knuckles, Grass Fed Ribeye, Clam Ala Vino
data.ABOUT:
Capitalizing on Singapore’s scenic coasts and waterways, the Georges group of bars and grill restaurants are all situated at prime waterfront locations for that gorgeous night out. The Pasir Ris Park branch, Georges @ The Cove, blends in with the relaxed Pasir Ris vibe and lush surrounding greenery to give you a welcome escape from the city. Think a sea breeze in your hair, a cold beer in your hand, and hearty food in your tummy. This charming, rustic beach house right on the eastern edge of the island has great views of the coast and starlit sky. If you’ve been feeling cooped up in the city, this breezy escape is just a quick drive away.
The vibe may be chill and relaxed, with the occasional sports match screened on TV, but the food is not lightweight. Whether it’s a smoky platter of ribs, sausages, and spicy braised lamb; George’s popular crispy fried wings, or even a flame grilled tenderloin, the extensive, meat-forward menu will make sure you leave well fed. And if you’re in a big group, even better: order a massive beer tower to go with those succulent ribs and you’ve found yourself one of the sweetest spots on the island.  (Sep 2016)
