Capitalizing on Singapore’s scenic coasts and waterways, the Georges group of bars and grill restaurants are all situated at prime waterfront locations for that gorgeous night out. The Punggol Point branch, Georges By The Bay, is found by the calm and beautiful Punggol waterway, for a chill night with a gentle sea breeze in your hair, a cold beer in your hand, and hearty food in your tummy. This charming bar overlooks the Johor Straits and has choice views of the starlit sky. If you’ve been feeling cooped up in the city, this breezy escape is just a quick drive away.
The vibe may be chill and relaxed, with the occasional sports match screened on TV, but the food is not lightweight. Whether it’s a smoky platter of ribs, sausages, and spicy braised lamb, George’s popular crispy fried wings, or even a flame grilled tenderloin, the extensive, meat-forward menu will make sure you leave well fed. If you’re in a big group, even better: order a massive beer tower to go with those succulent ribs and you’ve found yourself one of the sweetest spots on the island. (Sep 2016)

data.title: Gibson
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cod roe mousse, octopus terrine, scallop ceviche, barramundi
data.ABOUT:
The savoury cousin of the better known Martini, a classic Gibson introduces a pickled onion in place of the famous olive. Just like its namesake, Gibson offers a different spin on typical expectations, and is taking bar food to a whole new level!

The folks here serve up a sparkling menu of cured seafood, including smoked salmon dip, octopus terrine, scallop ceviche and barramundi, alongside a cornucopia of fresh seafood like raw oysters. The breadth of flavours from the tartness of the cured items to the sweetness of the shellfish allow for plenty of mixing and matching with the extensive list of cocktails, something the team will be more than happy to help you with.

Which of course, brings us to the soul of Gibson. The cocktail menu. The 'Seasonal’ section explores on a single ingredient that changes consistently, with a focus on banana this season and the creation of three delicious cocktails. In ‘Classics’, this section allows you to indulge the familiar, the creative, and the flamboyant respectively, with plenty of space for future exploration. So if you, like us, compulsively need to try everything on the menu, be prepared for a journey of fun, quality, and above all, deliciousness. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Gin Khao (One Raffles Place)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Seafood Soup, Juicy Chicken in Green Curry Broth, Thai Style Grilled Pork Belly, Stir-Fried Squid with Runny Salted Egg, Khao Phat Dtaeng Moe, Mango Served with Black Sticky Rice, Green Curry Gelato
data.ABOUT:
When you think of Thai food you don’t exactly think of Singapore’s Raffles Place, but that’s soon to change because tempting Bangkok eats is exactly what you get when dining at Gin Khao!
Meaning “eat rice”, Gin Khao brings rice front and center with dishes like Prawn & Green Mango Relish served with Thai Rice Crackers, Khao Nuea Phat topped with spicy stir-fried beef, and with desserts like the ever-so-sweet Mango with Black Sticky Rice.
That’s not all though! The amazing street food offerings are perfect for indulging so pick one (or all) and enjoy bold eats like fried noodles, Tom Yum Chicken wings, Deep-Fried Squid and more! (Jun 2016)

data.title: Gin Khao (SAFRA Tampines)
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 12-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Fri:12-3pm,5-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat:12-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sun:12-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Dong Po Meat, Tom Yum Hotpot, Green Curry Prawn Fried Rice, Salted Egg Squid, Steamed Black Cod with Superior Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Ever had a craving for Mee Pok and Pad Thai at once? The menu here marries Thai and Chinese cuisine seamlessly to create dishes that are spicy, flavourful, and memorable. With a 3500 square foot venue and 10-person round tables dotting the floors, this is the perfect place for large family gatherings. Located at Tampines SAFRA, Easties are set for an excellent Sino-Thai time. 

The menu here consists of inventive Sino-Thai dishes, as well as an array of Thai and Chinese classics. The Green Curry Prawn Fried Rice is a must-try. Made with the same spices as the beloved Thai staple, this dish is earthy and spicy, and makes for an excellent main. Made with a generous portion of prawns and served in a coconut husk, it’s one item you’ll want to have the cameras out for. While you’re at it, indulge in another classic Thai flavour with the Tom Yum Hotpot - the soup is spiced with lemongrass, chilli, and young ginger, and lends a sharp spicy flavour to any dish that goes in the hotpot. For something more Chinese, opt for the Braised Dong Po Meat - a braised pork belly dish, excellent with rice. (April 2019)

data.title: Gin Khao Bistro (Sentosa Cove)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Seafood Soup, Juicy Chicken in Green Curry Broth, Thai Style Grilled Pork Belly, Stir-Fried Squid with Runny Salted Egg, Khao Phat Dtaeng Moe, Mango Served with Black Sticky Rice, Green Curry Gelato
data.ABOUT:
The fun and patriotic Gin Khao Bistro is full of dining surprises, where you will find the national flag not on the roof but served up on a plate in the form of a striped red-white-blue cake. Combine its exotic creative food with its relaxing location at the Sentosa Cove in Quayside Isle and you have the perfect spot for a quick Thai getaway without even leaving Singapore. Take a seat at the restaurant’s extensive outdoor dining area to enjoy the views of the luxurious villas and ease into the relaxing rhythm of the docked yachts bobbing along gently in the cove.
With a restaurant name that humbly means “eat rice” in Thai, you can expect simple home-style Thai comfort food such as Juicy Chicken in Green Curry Broth, sour and spicy Tom Yum Seafood Soup that is served with rice or rice crackers of course. Make sure you leave room for  Gin Khao Bistro’s modern and innovative interpretations of traditional Thai dishes. Pineapple is replaced with watermelon to produce a refreshing and sweet version of the fried rice dish in Khao Phat Dtaeng Moe. For the adventurous foodie, go for a spicy dessert experience with the Green Curry Gelato with Sticky Rice. Visit Gin Khao Bistro to give your mind and palate a Thai-flavoured break.  (Nov 2015)

data.title: Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Le Confit de Canard, Steak Frites, Scottish Salmon, La Joue de Boeuf, 1-Meter Cold Cuts and Cheese Board, Beef Tartare, Australian Wagyu Steak
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar is a buzzy bistro-style restaurant and wine bar in the heart of Singapore’s Arts District making it the ideal spot to mix and mingle and make new friends in the city. The cosy venue serves happy hour prices all day, where patrons can choose from more than 90 varieties of wine, sparkling or champagne by the glass, all starting from a pocket-friendly price of just $6++ per glass and $30++ by the bottle.

Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar is an in-vogue escape that offers something for everyone. Service evolves throughout the day, starting with a morning buffet spread accompanied by takeaway breakfast options. 

 

Perfect for those on the go, lunch is an easy fix with a two-course set priced at $15++. For steak-lovers, premium quality beef such as Pure Black Angus and Australian Wagyu M5 are available at affordable prices – go for the dry-aged selection if it suits your palette. Want to bring the Ginett experience home? Wine and cheese can be purchased on retail, with prices starting from $30+ for wine bottles and $18+ for a selection of 2 cheese.

Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar is the perfect place for a city escape, just a stone’s throw away from the Orchard Road, Bugis and City Hall entertainment and business districts. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Ginger
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 7500 Beach RoadPARKROYAL on Beach RoadSingapore (199591)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Seasonal Lobsters & Crabs (*), Oyster Omelette, Bak Kut Teh, Satay

(*) Served in, and with, flavourful spices and sauces such as chilli, mentaiko, pumpkin and more.
data.PRESS RELEASE: Drawing inspiration from Singapore's culturally-rich ethnic enclaves of Kampong Glam, Little India and Chinatown, as well as the country's history as a Straits Settlement, Ginger at PARKROYAL on Beach Road presents a sumptuous buffet spread featuring an array of well-loved crabs, seafood on ice, alongside a live carving roast meat station, and selections of pastries and desserts, all crafted by Executive Chef Vincent Aw. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Ginza Shinto
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Forget Me Not Nigiri Sushi, Miyazaki A5 Wagyu, Ikura Uni Don, Sashimi Platter
data.ABOUT:
The latest addition to the variety of Japanese restaurants in Singapore, Ginza Shinto brings the best cuisine from the Land of the Rising Sun to the heart of Singapore. Located along Mohamed Sultan Road, Ginza Shinto is a contemporary Japanese sushi and omakase restaurant where fresh produce and rich flavours are the secrets to a hearty meal. 

The restaurant has separate menus for lunch sets, a la carte appetisers and sashimi platters. The Omakase menus are also updated biweekly to incorporate the freshest produce of the week. Watch the chefs in action as they expertly prepare a variety of different Japanese delights to tantalise your tastebuds. Diners can expect an extra creative touch to your dishes, elevating the traditional tastes of authentic Japanese favourites. 

A truly unforgettable combination of nigiri and mini roasted, crispy rice puffs, look out for the Forget Me Not Nigiri Sushi for a wonderfully textured contrast and burst of flavours. Best enjoyed by mixing the egg yolk with beef sauce, dip the Miyazaki A5 Wagyu into the sauce for a tender mouthful of premium wagyu meat. Other signature treats include the Ikura Uni Don. Crowned with fresh salmon roe atop fluffy Japanese rice, the dish is a delicious mouthful of fatty minced tuna and sea urchin. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Godmama
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Babi Assam, Popiah, Beef Rendang, Sambal Sotong
data.PRESS RELEASE:
A marriage of cooking styles, Peranakan cuisines combine the preparation techniques of both traditional Chinese and Malay cooking. This unusual pairing gives Peranakan cuisine its distinctive taste, filled with exciting flavours from the use of local herbs and spices. 

Located in Funan, Singapore's latest lifestyle destination in the heart of the Civic District, Godmama is a modern Peranakan restaurant for guests who are looking for an uplifting and lively dining experience. Offering a contemporary setting with both indoor and alfresco dining options, Godmama delivers both authentic Nyonya cuisine and innovative Peranakan food creations in a vibrant atmosphere. 

With uncompromising quality for authenticity and honouring our Godmama's treasured recipes, every dish we sere you is legacy on a plate. 

From our hands, to yours. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Goku Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hakata-Style Sesame Mackerel, Stir-Fried Squid with Salted Fish, Nagoya-Style Chicken Wings, Crab Cream Croquette, Grilled Eggplant
data.ABOUT:
From the folks that brought you Hokkaido Manpei in Central Mall comes this dinner-only restaurant along the Mohammed Sultan stretch. This is one of only three restaurants in Singapore that offers motsunabe, a richer version of the beloved Japanese hotpot made with miso and offal. Another key ingredient in their dishes is  beef intestines, which is incorporated into several of their small plate offerings, as well as several main dishes. The soft innards are cooked in a broth to bring out their flavour and collagen, and is said to be perfect for women looking to improve their complexion.

Seafood lovers won’t be missing out either since Motsunabe will be dishing out creations like the Stir-Fried Squid with Salted Fish. This dish is a briny combination of tender fish meat and firm squid tentacles stir fried in a savoury sauce. Perfect with steamed rice or even on its own, this is one dish that showcases the best of the treasures of the sea. The Hakata-Style Sesame Mackerel is another delicious dish featuring soft fish flesh bathed in thick, earthy sesame sauce.

With a fun environment, variety of dishes and a communal dining feel, this is the perfect place to unwind on weekends with family and friends without missing any of the action of the city. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Golden Peony
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions
data.Location: City Hall, Marina Bay, Promenade, Marina Central
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bi Feng Tang’ Crispy Half Maine Lobster topped with Spiced Almond Flakes, Braised ‘Dong Bo’ Pork Belly served with Crispy Bun, Double-boiled Baby Abalone Soup with Sea Whelk, Conpoy and Bamboo Pith in a Whole Young Coconut, Roast Peking Duck served with Homemade Pancakes and Condiments
data.ABOUT:
Golden Peony is an award-winning restaurant which elevates Chinese fine dining to a whole new level. From their elegant plating, delicious flavours and excellent service, Golden Peony is already a favourite among businessmen who bring their clients there for lunch to seal the deal.
Chef Ku Keung from Hong Kong never fails to impress guests with his innovative dishes and beautiful presentation. If you have been to a wedding banquet at this hotel, count yourself lucky to have tasted the wonderful cuisine here! Everything from the beancurd skin to the sauces and garnishes are handmade in the kitchen. The flavours are subtle and pair well together in their dishes.
Aside from their cuisine, their top-notch attention to detail is evident in the decor, from the trademark peony images on the wall to the custom-made yellow shaw plates. Orchids are elegantly placed in vases on every table, and should you require a private room, Golden Peony's is inviting and tastefully furnished.
Head over to this hidden gem and prepare to be blown away by their untraditional Chinese cuisine. (Jul 2015)

data.title: Goldleaf Restaurant (Katong)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chye-Por Omelette, Honey Glazed Chicken, Goldleaf Prawn Rolls, Braised Pork with Preserved Vegetables, Steamed Pork Patty with Salted Egg Yolk
data.ABOUT: This long-standing Taiwanese restaurant is a place for family to gather over heartwarming and nostalgic fare. Known for its porridge buffet, Goldleaf has also launched their first-ever a la carte buffet featuring eight of the restaurant’s signature dishes that diners can enjoy in unlimited servings. Start dinner with a chilled portion of the Double Beancurd Platter, where century egg (imported from Taiwan) is sprinkled with pork floss, bonito flakes and a touch of soy. The contrast of smooth, cold beancurd with the piping hot Taiwanese porridge is a great way to whet the appetite! The Omelette with Chye Poh (salted preserved radish) is reminiscent of grandma’s cooking, where the golden, fluffy egg is filled with bits of salty, crunchy radish. Good to share are dishes like Steamed Pork Patty with Salted Fish, and the Braised Pork Belly with Preserved Vegetables. All items are cooked a la minute, upon order, so you can be assured of enjoying them fresh and piping hot off the stove! (Sep 2018)

data.title: Good Bites
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Herb & Citrus Chicken Bowl, Prawns with Pineapple Salsa Bowl, Smoked Salmon Soba Bowl
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Good Bites is the latest F&B brand under Citrus By The Pool, offering customizable healthy bowls.
With the belief that food can be made healthy and delicious, Good Bites focuses on homemade recipes and preparation methods that retain and maximize the taste and nutritional value of the food. Customers can create their healthy bowl based on their nutrition goals and preferences.
Located at the heart of Bishan Sports Centre, the café is a tranquil space surrounded by full-length windows that fill the space with natural light. The café seats up to 60 pax and is available for private events that can accommodate up to 80 pax. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Good Time Eat Drink
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chili Full of Crab Tofu, Good Time Carbonara, Oven Baked Nonya Sambal Barramundi, Fiery Claypot Bak Kut Teh, Hurry! Hurry! Chicken Curry
data.ABOUT:
Located in the historic Katong Heritage district, this restaurant serves up delicious and authentic Peranakan delicacies made from natural ingredients. Many of the dishes consist of familiar flavours with a Straits Chinese twist. The menu was carefully curated by the owner-chefs who are both true blue Peranakans.

Seafood lovers are sure to appreciate the range of seafood dishes on offer here. The Oven-Baked Nonya Sambal Barramundi is a popular dish perfect for sharing. The tender flesh of the barramundi is flavoured with traditional Straits Chinese spices, giving it a fiery bite that is best enjoyed with a bowl of steamed rice. For something a little less fiery, the Sticky Shiok Sotong is a great option. Made with a generous portion of springy squid, tossed in a mix of chilli and sticky sauce, this dish is the perfect accompaniment to a bowl of soup, and can even be enjoyed on its own. 

Looking for a unique take on a classic Singaporean dish? Look no further than the cheeky Chilli Full of Crab Tofu. The base of the dish is the beloved chilli crab, and beneath the tender whole swimmer crab is a large block of egg tofu that has soaked up the chilli broth. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Goro Japanese Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shake Shio Bento, Bara Chirashi Don, Steak Set, Ebi Udon, Omakase Set
data.ABOUT:
Goro Japanese Cuisine is a laid-back eatery tucked away in the Holland Drive estate. Serving up a variety of sashimi, makis, bentos, udon bowls, and more, it’s the perfect spot to drop by for a quick and hearty lunch or dinner. 

The wholesome bento boxes are popular with the crowd. The Shake Shio Bento is a favourite, with grilled salmon, veggies, rice, and your choice of salmon sashimi or California maki. Sashimi lovers must also try the Bara Chirashi Don, where fluffy Japanese rice is topped with fresh chunks of salmon and tuna sashimi, tobiko, tamago, and cucumber.

As dinner’s a lengthy indulgence, opt for Goro's seven course omakase, consisting of an appetiser, sashimi, yaki (grilled dish), teppan, donburi, soup, and dessert. With the chef boasting 37 years of experience, you'll definitely be in good hands. Don't forget to order an ice-cold beer or sake as the perfect pairing to your meal. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Grand jetè izakaya
data.Cuisine: Bar, Japanese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Ikura Bowl, Barachirashi, Miyazaki Pork Belly Bowl, Wagyu Yakiniku Rice, Tempura Rice Bowl
data.ABOUT:
For an unfussy but authentic Japanese lunch, Grand jetè izakaya is hard to beat. Named after the word for “rice” in Japanese, Grand jetè izakaya really cuts to the heart of the Japanese love affair with this fluffy grain: the focus at this Japanese-run joint is the delicious rice bowl, put together by the people who also run and own Kacyo, the upmarket Japanese restaurant at Bukit Pasoh Road.
For seafood lovers, there’s a bountiful Barachirashi featuring sushi rice topped with chunks of tuna, salmon, swordfish, and ikura, matched only by a delicious Salmon Ikura Bowl generously topped with slices of tender fatty salmon and salty roe. Meatier affairs include the Stewed Miyazaki Pork Belly Bowl, think a rice-bowl equivalent of chashu ramen with chunks of fatty pork belly, stewed egg, and wakame seaweed atop rice. A beef equivalent, the Wagyu Yakiniku Rice Bowl, sees stewed beef and a crunchy green salad on rice. Tempura Rice Bowls and even a Japanese Curry Rice Bowls round up the menu here, a true testament to the delicious simplicity of the humble donburi. (Jan 2017)

data.title: Granny’s Secret
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Three Treasures, Traditional Handmade Popiah, Chef Specialty Assam Fish, Nutritional Flower Tea
data.ABOUT:
At Granny’s Secret, every dish is prepared based on traditional recipes. Tucked away in a homely corner in OG Albert Complex, savour memories of your granny’s recipes with every bite.

Although the eatery’s menu is inspired by traditional flavours, Granny’s Secret occasionally welcomes new dishes onto the menu to provide novelty to customers. Popular dishes include the exquisite Three Treasures, Traditional Handmade Popiah, Chef Specialty Assam Fish and more. 

Aptly called Three Treasures, this dish is made of organic glutinous rice, yam, and pumpkin cake, doused with the eatery’s in-house sauce to make this dish effortlessly extraordinary. The signature Chef Specialty Assam Fish dish is the eatery’s favourite that keeps diners coming back for more. 

Relive the memories of your grandmother’s cooking with these nostalgic and yummy dishes prepared with love, that can be enjoyed any time of the day. (Jul 2020)

data.title: Grapevine @ Guillemard
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fish & Chips, Chicken Chop, Steak, Sliders, Craving for Seafood, Homemade Angus Burger, Chilli Crab Pasta, Iberico Pork Shogayaki
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Grapevine @ Guillemard is a casual bistro, bar and restaurant, tucked nicely in Guillemard and just outside the hustle and bustle of the city area.  

With our vast experience from our first outlet at Upper Serangoon Road, we continue to provide our customers with a wide variety of food and beverages. We serve a good selection of draft beers, chilled bottled beers, fine wines and whiskies from various regions. Our Western cuisine ranges from delicious bar food, hand-made pizzas, hearty hamburgers and classic main courses like Fish & Chips, Chicken Chop and Steak. In addition to our Western cuisine, we have introduced our Japanese Donburi bowls which have been well received by our customers.   
 
We believe in putting continuous effort and resources to serve an ever-improving selection of food and beverages for our customers. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Grapevine Bar & Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grapevine's Platter, Spam Fries, Baked Garlic Oysters, Homemade Angus Burger, Iberico Pork Shogayaki, Craving for Seafood
data.ABOUT: This no-frills neighbourhood bar along Upper Serangoon is hard to miss. The cheerful red walls decorated with paraphernalia, as well as the pool tables on display, are easy to spot when walking about this quaint neighbourhood. Food and drinks here are kept simple, but you’ll definitely enjoy tucking into favourites like an icy-cold, thick and chocolate-y Oreo Frappe. Or how about a refreshing frosty beer to go with the live screenings of soccer that are a highlight at this bar? The best bit — dress code is casual, which means you can saunter over to Grapevine in just shorts and flip-flops if you so desire. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Gravy Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kali Mirch Chicken Soup, Palak Paneer, Lamb Biryani, Kulfi
data.ABOUT:
Sample the best of Indian cuisine at Gravy Restaurant and Bar. Within walking distance of Tanjong Pagar MRT, this authentic joint is a hit with the office crowd who work in the vicinity.

To start, try the Kali Mirch Chicken Soup, a delicious chicken broth that is seasoned generously with black pepper to pack a flavourful punch. Don’t miss out on the Subz Desh Videsh, a medley of marinated vegetables grilled in the tandoor to fully extract the flavours. 

For the entrees, we recommend the Palak Paneer. A beloved Indian culinary classic of cottage cheese and creamy spinach gravy. Seafood lovers, look out for the Prawns Hari Mirch Masala - succulent tiger prawns cooked in zesty green chilli and mint sauce. The Lamb Biryani is beautifully set on a bed of fragrant Basmati rice and further flavoured with cinnamon sticks, cloves and other spices. 

End your meal on a sweet note with some Kulfi, a delicious dessert of homemade ice cream, saffron, pistachios, nuts and cardamom. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Green Common
data.Cuisine: Modern European, Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Pizza, Zi Char, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Meatless Meatballs, Omni Luncheon Fries, Rainbowl, Pomegranate and Orange Salad
data.ABOUT:
The world’s first plant-based eatery and grocery concept store aimed at bringing a revolutionary food and lifestyle experience through the introduction of the most advanced global food-tech innovations, Green Common sets out to change the food mindset of Asia. As a wholesaler and distributor of vegetarian, vegan, organic and natural foods, Green Common believes that the future is plant-based and hopes to make change happen and make green common. 

Kickstart your meal with a bowl of their famous Meatless Meatballs. Featuring Omnimeat and Beyond Meat Meatballs drenched in marinara sauce, bite into one for a delicious burst of flavours! Love fries? Green Common offers a variety of different flavoured fries sure to satisfy your cravings. Choose to indulge in the Sweet Potato Fries, Potato Fries, or Omni Luncheon Fries with either a truffle, Thai chilli, BBQ or honey mustard dip.

Salad options are also aplenty here at Green Common. Pick your favourite combination of veggie delights with the different salads. Popular choices include the Rainbowl, and Pomegranate and Orange Salad. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Greenhouse Cafe
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Japanese, Italian, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fresh Juices, Maki Rolls, Prawn Laksa, Crispy Spiced House Wings, Naan Pizzas, NZ Grass Fed Steak, Variety of Roasted Ribs and Japanese Bento Meals as well as Cake of the Day selections
data.ABOUT:
One common gripe of workers way out in Tuas is that there is no decent food around for miles. This industrial zone is proliferated with hawker stalls, hawker stalls, and, of course, more hawker stalls. For those who are sick and tired of sweating profusely while dining on overly oily local fare, check out Greenhouse Café.

High ceilings, a wall of windows for natural light, the air-con cranked up high, lots of greenery, beers at lunch, and even a foosball and billiard table: Greenhouse Café is like an urban oasis in the middle of Tuas. It’s got a refreshing vibe, great service, and fantastic prices that are just unparallel in Singapore.

Greenhouse Café serves a mish-mash of Western fare ranging from simple soups and salads to sandwiches, pastas, and even grilled items. They also offer a nice selection of fresh-squeezed juices for a fraction of the price of stalls that dot Orchard Road.

While service at the restaurant is friendly and efficient, the creators of Greenhouse Café kicked things up yet another notch by launching their very own Build Your Own, Salad & Wrap Bar, launched Nov'2018. Stay healthy and eat healthy with us! (Dec 2018)

data.title: Greenwood Fish Market @ Asian Cuisine
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Homemade Spring Rolls, Fried Edamame Beans, Russian King Crab Leg, Live Mussels
data.ABOUT:
Greenwood Fish Market @ Asian Cuisine is your one-stop center for fresh seafood in Singapore.

A meal here typically starts with entrees such as Homemade Spring Rolls, Crabmeat Omelette or Korean Squid to whet your appetite. Be it lobster or crab, there are plenty of options here at Greenwood Fish Market @ Asian Cuisine for you to choose from.

Enjoy Russian King Crab Leg, Mud Crab and Live Boston Lobster, with your choice of sauce. Izakaya snacks are also available here. Seasoned with salt and chili, the Fried Edamame Beans are savory and satisfying. Have this with a plate of Salmon Belly for a complete Japanese-inspired dining experience.

The star of the show at the restaurant is definitely the catch from the sea. Live mussels and clams are cooked in your choice of yellow Thai curry, sambal chili ginger and garlic steam or laksa, resulting in a flavorful plate of shellfish. Order a side of six pieces of mantou to enjoy the delicious sauce. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Cake, Hot Smoked Ocean Trout, Cold Seafood Platter, Marinara Linguini, Lobster & Beef, Seafood Rice, Red Miso Cod, House Fish & Chips, Blackcurrant Cheese Tart, Valrhona Chocolate Cake
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in the Greenwood housing estate just off Bukit Timah Road, lies an institution dedicated to fresh seafood. Judging by the army of loyal clientele who swear by it and visit on a regular basis, Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah can't really be considered a hidden gem. However, if you haven't heard of it before, consider yourself now in on this open secret.
It started originally as a fish market at 34 Greenwood Avenue with a small bistro at the back to cater to the appetite of its customers who couldn't wait to eat the day's freshest catch. It is testament to its popularity that it quickly outgrew its premises and expanded, offering a much larger dedicated dining room along with outdoor seating. Specialising in fresh seafood flown in from all over the world, daily deliveries ensure that you are getting only the best. You'll also be spoiled for choice with their truly impressive wine selection that boasts over 120 different bottles to perfectly complement any meal or budget.
Staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and always keen to recommend the freshest catch, cooked in a style that really brings out the natural flavours and textures of the fish. By taking a "less is more" approach, Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah lovingly showcases the freshest seafood and allows it to take center stage, where it belongs. (Oct 2011)

data.title: Greenwood Fish Market @ Quayside Isle
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Seafood Platter, Smoked Platter, House Fish & Chips, Crab Cakes, Swordfish Carpaccio, Red Miso Cod, Hot Smoked Ocean Trout
data.ABOUT:
Greenwood Fish Market has been an icon in the Bukit Timah neighbourhood for many years, and has since opened another outlet amidst the lush greenery of Dempsey. From the menu comes a delicious variety of fresh seafood, prepared in different styles at this outlet. True to Greenwood Fish Market "Sea to Table" philosophy, this Quayside Isle outlet continue to directly import seafood fresh from Canada, Holland, New Zealand, South Korea, and the United States to the kitchens in weekly shipments.
Given the many sources for their produce, Greenwood has a vast selection of fresh seasonal fish, shellfish, live Maine lobsters and even Dungenese crabs. Using their very own smoker, they proudly produce in-house hot/cold smoked salmon, mackerel, sardines and pork belly to offer customers a taste that is unique to Greenwood. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Grids & Circles
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tamago Sando, Summer Pasta, Strawberry Wonderland, Matcha Affogato
data.ABOUT:
Just a short walk away from Chinatown and Hong Lim Food Centre, Grids and Circles is a tranquil oasis right in the heart of the bustling CBD. The three-storey lifestyle cafe and workshop space is housed in a charming, modernised shophouse. The cafe inhabits the first floor while the upper floors feature a lifestyle store and private space dedicated to workshops, corporate events and lifestyle classes. The interiors across all three floors feature granite floors, white-washed walls, soft lights and wooden furniture to create a serene haven away from the stresses of the city.

Coffee is a definite must and we just can’t have enough of the mouthwatering Western-Japanese fusion fare served up here. Varied, refreshing, and elevated, dishes here are executed with a touch of artistic flair that goes beyond your usual cafe grub. Take the Tamago Sando for instance, where fluffy Tamago-style eggs, paired with a konbu-infused mayo and pear sauce, are tucked snugly between toasted bread; or the Mondanyaki Beef Angus Slider, an intriguing cross between a burger and okonomiyaki that will have you coming back for more. For an instant pick-me-up on a rainy day, the Salmon Ochazuke does a perfect job; featuring a perfectly poached salmon slab atop some plump Kinmemai brown rice, salted plums, nori, and chopped shiso. A clear bacon dashi green tea stock comes on the side, to be poured across over the dish for a wholesome, healthy, and satisfying meal. Prefer something sweet instead? The Strawberry Wonderland, featuring a stack of fluffy pancakes and sprinkles of mint and basil will satisfy any sweet-toothed cravings.  

A perfect escape from the city complete with good coffee and delicious grub? Sign us up anytime! (Sep 2018)

data.title: Grill Ninety Nine
data.Cuisine: American, Fusion, Seafood, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly, Halal Certified, Cafe, Pizza, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cream of Mushroom, Crispy Crab Cakes, Angus Beef Ribs, Rotisserie Chicken, Lamb Shank
data.PRESS RELEASE: Located conveniently near Bugis MRT at Arab Street, Grill Ninety Nine serves fine western cuisine that are mostly homemade and prepared with passion from our top-notch chef using halal certified ingredients. Stay tuned to updates on our social media and at our store. Do look out for our mouth-watering signature dishes as well as new items launched every now and then, while we are in the midst of preparing for halal certification. (May 2019)

data.title: Grissini
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
392 Havelock RoadGrand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel
Singapore (169663)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Polpo Alla Griglia, Risotto Con Foie Gras, Classic Tortelli Di Zucca, A4 Wagyu Beef, Tiramisu
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Grissini welcomes Chef Kenny Huang as the newly appointed Head Chef. At just 33 years of age, Chef Kenny is young, innovative, and passionate about the culinary arts. Having honed his skills in Italy, diners can expect a menu that is expertly executed with authentic Italian cooking techniques and fresh produce with a Japanese touch. Treat yourselves to an exquisite meal at the elegant indoor dining space or choose to dine alfresco along the romantic waterfront area.
To complement the revamped menu, Grissini also has a new pairing team to help guests select the right wines for their meals. Embodying Singapore’s multiracial roots, the pairing team comprises Mr. Mayandi, Head Chef Kenny Huang, and Sommelier Uzair Yaacob who is certified by the Court of Master Sommelier Worldwide, European Chapter. These gentlemen will satiate your palate with exquisite culinary creations and fine wines. (May 2021)

data.title: Group Therapy Coffee (Cross Street Exchange)
data.Cuisine: American, Australian, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Skinny Eggs Ben, Pumpkin Pancakes, Organic Granola & Muesli, Chicken Mushroom Bread Bowl, Pulled Pork Charcoal Burger, Steak & Cheese Pie, Roasted Pumpkin Salad, Corn & Zucchini Fritters
data.ABOUT:
Housed on the second-story of a restored conservation shophouse in the heart of Tanjong Pagar, Group Therapy at Duxton is one of our favourite spots when we're yearning for an intimate setting with a laidback ambiance. Exuding both character and charm, with the aroma of scrumptious delights greeting diners as they enter, this is certainly the place to go when brunch is on the mind.
With an array of all-day breakfast offerings as well as hearty sandwiches, salads, and burgers being served up daily, let's just say that trying to decide on just one item from the menu is close to impossible. That's why we suggest being bold and ordering a little bit of everything. From the subtly sweet Pumpkin Pancakes to the Chicken Mushroom Bread Bowl, you're likely to be pleased with the result. (Feb 2016)

data.title: Gu Ma Jia
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Glutinous Rice with Ice Cream, Assam Fish Curry, Stir-Fried Black Pepper Beef, Crispy Bean Jal, Siam Style Hot Plate Prawn
data.ABOUT:
This homely restaurant on Tai Thong Crescent is sure to remind you of meals at Grandma’s. From the inviting atmosphere to the delicious smells wafting from the kitchen, this is the perfect place to go for some fuss-free local delights. Named after the owner’s nickname and founded on her love for cooking and enjoyment of family meals, diners can expect large portions, authentic flavours, and comforting homeliness. 

This spot may be famed for its Assam Fish Curry - an aromatic dish that goes perfectly with rice - but there are plenty of other dishes that are just as noteworthy. The produce used is handpicked by Gu Ma daily, so diners can rest assured that they’re eating dishes made with the freshest ingredients. There are also some creative vegetable dishes, like the Crispy Bean Jal - which is made with thin strips of crispy deep-fried brinjal and French beans. The Stir-Fries Black Pepper Beef is another popular dish. Made with thin strips of meat stir-fried in a spicy sauce, this dish bursts with flavour with every bite. 

Save some room for the Black Glutinous Rice with Ice Cream, a delicious dessert made with sticky Taiwanese rice topped with a generous helping of ice cream for a unique take on a local dessert. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Guccio Ristorante
data.Good For: Fine Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sicilian red prawns from Mazara, green pea coulis, lemon scented buffalo ‘ricotta’; Pan-seared Rougie foie gras, 70% Valrhona chocolate, red apple compote, raspberry; Linguine Spanner crab, marinated fresh tomatoes, grated roe ‘bottarga’ from Sardinia; Poached and pan-seared Sardinian octopus, seasonal vegetables, ‘salmoriglio’ dressing
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Guccio, representing the surname – and hence, the origins of Chef Marco - will offer Executive Chef Marco Guccio’s culinary philosophy: an Italian fine dining cuisine journey, from a homemade, hearty cuisine to a global fine dining success.
While using top ingredients is not unique per se, Marco’s signature cooking style is: in his cuisine, the core ingredient becomes the main actor in the opera. Each dish has one ingredient at the center of the flavor experience. While the presentations are at times a contrast of colorful and complex textures, Marco’s dishes create a balance of supporting flavors, similar to how supporting artists dance in harmony, in the background of the leading act.
This philosophy is pushed to its boundaries at Guccio, with critics sometimes claiming that a blindfolded customer would always be able to recognize the chief ingredients in the dish she is eating. This style won chef Marco a Bib Gourmand from the prestigious Michelin Star Guide for
two years in a row, in 2016 and 2017.
Chef Marco welcomes you to his restaurant. Its décor is, once again, balanced and aims to be comfortable, while remaining in the background. At Guccio, customers will be at the center of the experience, with the colors and design elements to balance the surroundings. In the background of Marco’s main culinary signature style, Guccio will further differentiate itself by taking its diners onto a seasonal journey across the various regions of Italy, their fertile lands and their precious seas. At regular intervals, aligned with the four seasons of Europe, chef Marco will explore regional ingredients and recipes associated to each season, a unique opportunity to visit Italy even when 10,000 km away from it.
Marco’s creation will be paired by the best Italian wine labels available. As for the culinary ingredients, Guccio will not focus so much on education about new ingredients or unknown brands, but on outright enjoyment of the best that Italy has to offer. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Guenpin Fugu & Snow Crab Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Puffer Fish, Grilled Puffer Fish, Puffer Fish Hot Pot, Porridge Set, Puffer Fish Sashimi, Parboiled Puffer Fish Skin Sashimi
data.ABOUT: Perhaps more legend attends to the infamous puffer fish (‘fugu’ in Japanese) than any other edible marine creature: tales of venom, stings, and the brave chefs who train for years before they are allowed to prepare this fish for customers hungry for its rich, bouncy flesh, and bragging rights. Here at Guenpin Fugu Restaurant, a Singapore outpost of the popular Japanese franchise, puffer fish is the name of the game, and it is the crowning highlight of the menu here. Whether in thick, raw slices of sashimi or sushi, lightly battered and served fried, or served in meaty chunks ready for cooking in a flavourful dashi hotpot, just about any method of cooking and eating this delicate fish is available here. One popular option is to have the meaty fish brewed with a light porridge, the perfect premium comfort food. Even the skin, lightly parboiled, is served, sashimi-style, with a zesty ponzu sauce. The puffer fish shares star billing with other premium seafood here: fleshy snow crab claws are served cold, cooked tempura-style, grilled, or hot-pot style. This is a rare treat made readily available, so grab a booking now! (May 2017)

data.title: Gully
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Greek Gyro, Zucchini Salad, Street Skewers, Gully Burger
data.ABOUT:
Introducing a progressive culinary collaboration with Blu Kouzina, Gully brings a modern twist to global street flavours and cocktails. Tucked along Hong Kong Street, drop by Gully today to curb your travel blues with a hearty serving of the restaurant’s range of platters, dips and meats. 

Begin your meal with a trio of wholesome Mediterranean inspired dips served alongside a platter of crispy Pita bread. Featuring a juicy portion of Taiwanese fried chicken marinated with Gully’s very own secret spice mix sandwiched between two soft pillowy fried buns, the Taiwanese Chicken Bun with Shallots & Arugula is another petite serving of sliders perfect to kickstart your meal. 

Don’t leave without trying the Greek Gyro. The restaurant’s very own take on the well-loved classic street food in Greece, this tasty menu option consists of tender yet succulent organic chicken drenched in a generous mix of home-made Tzatziki and sauce and smoked paprika. Made of perfectly striped yellow and green zucchini and crunchy walnuts together with lemon and cumin infused yoghurt sauce, the Zucchini Salad is a popular option among the young and old. 

Other signature favourites at Gully include the Street Skewers, Gully Burger and Fish Taco. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Gunther's
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Angel Hair Pasta, Oscietra Caviar, Beef Carpaccio, Bone Marrow, Braised Pork Cheek Grand-Mère, Charcoal Grilled Wagyu Steak, Roasted Suckling Pig
data.ABOUT:
Stepping into Gunther’s is like entering a different world. It is a world of opulence, yet with a certain earnest simplicity and elegance. The Art Nouveau-inspired decor, with its highly stylised flowing, curvilinear designs of fauna and floral motifs, is stunning but not overwhelming, gorgeous without being showy. While the restaurant boasts furniture pieces from luxury brands, the overall sense one gets is of warmth and welcome.
This sense of elegant simplicity is evident in the menu as well. Gunther’s fans will undoubtedly be familiar with signature dishes like the Cold Angel Hair Pasta that has earned the restaurant accolade after accolade since its opening. The Oscietra caviar is delicately scented with truffle, which marries the flavours of the dish together perfectly. The delectably crispy Suckling Pig with Kriek Beer Sauce is yet another favourite. While the dish itself is evocative of wedding dinners, come prepared to be amazed by the range of savoury flavours that is packed into Gunther’s rendition. Other carefully thought-out creations such as the Carpaccio of Wagyu Beef “Tartare” style are also delightful. The meat is served with crispy potato – a beautiful contrast against the marbled Wagyu beef. Likewise, the Floating Island of Champignon de Paris on Consommé of Poultry is a magical concoction with the rich taste of egg yolk and mushrooms in every mouthful.
Apart from signature desserts like the delicious Fine Apple Tart “à la dragées” with Havana rum raisin ice cream or the warm soufflé with daily flavours, Gunther’s whimsical dessert creations are worth a try. Choose from 350 labels of wine to end your meal on a high -- it will be a suitably simple and elegant way to toast to an equally exquisite gastronomic experience. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Gustoso Ristorante Italiano
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Iberico Pork, Gustoso Pizza, Chicken with Porcini Sauce, Tortino Di Lava
data.ABOUT:
Located in the laidback Seletar Hills estate, this casual Italian eatery is the perfect place to kick back on the weekend with friends and family. With someone like decorated chef Peter Neo at the helm, diners can rest assured that they will be served the most authentic Italian classics.  

Meat lovers are sure to enjoy the Grilled Iberico Pork, served with a generous side of gravy. The juicy cut of pork is grilled to tender perfection and seasoned with herbs to make for the perfect main dish. Drizzle the meat with the accompanying gravy, grab a forkful of vegetables for some crunch, and tuck in. Prefer poultry? The Roasted Chicken With Porcini Sauce comes with hearty sweet potato and is large enough to be shared. The chicken meat is tender and juicy, and the accompanying gravy gives the dish an extra touch of spicy earthiness.

For a sweet treat to end the meal, dig in to the Tortino Di Lava. This molten chocolate cake is what dreams are made of. From the rich chocolate that oozes out from the first cut to the velvety soft ice cream it is served with, this dish is a treat -in every sense of the word. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Gyu-Kaku (CHIJMES)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Stew with Baguette, Choregi Salad, Camembert Cheese Skewers with Honey and Baguette, Australia Wagyu Thick Tongue, Gyu-Kaku Karubi (Tare)
data.ABOUT: We at Gyu-Kaku take pride in bringing you authentic ‘Yakiniku’ (Japanese BBQ) experience. We serve premium ‘Kagoshima Wagyu’ and many other quality food items at reasonable prices. Our menus include mouth-watering appetisers, fresh salad, tantalising seafood items, desserts, beverages, and so much more. Come dine at Gyu-Kaku for that exquisite taste of Japan, served to you at your table!  (Apr 2019)

data.title: Gyu-Kaku (City Square Mall)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Tofu with Banbanji Sauce, Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Kagoshima Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, Kurobuta Pork Belly
data.ABOUT:
Consider Gyu-Kaku a meat-lover’s dream come true. This family-friendly Japanese yakiniku chain is all about the BBQ experience, with good meats and vegetables to match. 

Start the meal with a light, refreshing dish of Cold Tofu with Banbanji sauce, a spicy sesame dressing that adds a hint of heat to the chilled beancurd. For meats, the Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. Enjoy your meats bursting with bold flavour? Try the selection of Harami here, where slices of beef are pre-marinated in garlic, shio, or spicy miso for an extra punch. 

Fans of thick-cut meats will love the Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, which is juicy and full of flavour when grilled over charcoal. Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, from the belly cuts to the collar, and the jowl. Dip your meats into the tasty choice of accompanying sauces -- a herby garlic butter, a grated radish ponzu, a spicy garlic chilli oil, and even sukiyaki truffle oil with a half-boiled egg. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Gyu-Kaku (KINEX)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Tofu with Banbanji Sauce, Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Kagoshima Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, Kurobuta Pork Belly
data.ABOUT:
If you love meat, then make Gyu-Kaku a go to this weekend. 

Prime Kagoshima wagyu is the star on the menu here, and it’s easy to see why — the meat is tender and bursting with clean, beefy flavours, padded with extra marbling to give it that melt-in-your-mouth feel. 

Start the meal with a light, refreshing dish of Cold Tofu with Banbanji sauce, a spicy sesame dressing that adds a hint of heat to the chilled beancurd. Otherwise, skip the preliminaries and make a beeline for the beef. The Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. There’s also the Kagoshima Wagyu Premium Loin Steak if you prefer grilling an entire slab of meat on your own, and getting it to the right doneness. 

Fans of thick-cut meats will love the Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, which is juicy and full of flavour when simply grilled over charcoal. Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, from the belly cuts to the collar, and the jowl. Dip your meats into the tasty selection of accompanying sauces -- a herby garlic butter, a grated radish ponzu, a spicy garlic chilli oil, and even a sukiyaki truffle oil with a half-boiled egg. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Gyu-Kaku (Novena Square)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Stew with Baguette, Choregi Salad, Camembert Cheese Skewers with Honey and Baguette, Australia Wagyu Thick Tongue, Gyu-Kaku Karubi (Tare)
data.PRESS RELEASE: We at Gyu-Kaku take pride in bringing you authentic ‘Yakiniku’ (Japanese BBQ) experience. We serve premium ‘Kagoshima Wagyu’ and many other quality food items at reasonable prices. Our menus include mouth-watering appetisers, fresh salad, tantalising seafood items, desserts, beverages, and so much more. Come dine at Gyu-Kaku for that exquisite taste of Japan, served to you at your table! (May 2019)

data.title: Gyu-Kaku (The Centrepoint)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Stew with Baguette, Choregi Salad, Camembert Cheese Skewers with Honey and Baguette, Australia Wagyu Thick Tongue, Gyu-Kaku Karubi (Tare)
data.ABOUT:
Gyu-Kaku aims to stand out from the many BBQ restaurants all over Singapore by bringing consumers an authentic Japanese yakiniku experience, and serves a range of premium meats - most notably, Kagoshima Wagyu - a premium cut of beef that is excellent on barbecues. 

Barbecue meats are not the only highlight of the menu here, though. Japanese appetisers and snacks are also available for diners who wish to dine on something a little lighter. The Choregi Salad is a mix of greens, cucumber, and mushrooms, and is a perfect accompaniment to the large menu of meat available. The Chicken Caesar Salad is also a must-try. Made with greens, spiced chicken, and cranberries and walnuts for an sweet crunch, this dish is refreshing and the perfect way to start your meal here.

The meat selection is one of the widest available islandwide. Along with the aforementioned Kagoshima Wagyu, there is also Wagyu Kurubi, Kurobuta Pork, and Pork Belly in a variety of seasonings, including miso for an authentic umami taste and chilli oil for an extra kick. There is also a wide seafood selection - with fresh king prawn, scallops and squid available for grilling. 

Still feeling peckish after your meal? Opt for some ramen - Gomanegi Ramen is a popular choice. Tonkotsu ramen with egg and cha shiu, this dish is perfect to wash down the meat-heavy dishes from the barbecue. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Gyu-Kaku (The Star Vista)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 1 Vista Exchange Green#02-17The Star VistaSingapore (138617)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Kagoshima Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, Scallops with Butter and Soy Sauce, Gyu Kaku Signature Milk Pudding
data.ABOUT:
If you love meat, then make Gyu-Kaku a go to this weekend. 

Prime Kagoshima wagyu is the star on the menu here, and it’s easy to see why — the meat is tender and bursting with flavour, padded with extra marbling to give it that melt-in-your-mouth feel. 

Start the meal with some edamame and fried gyoza, and order up some asparagus and assorted mushrooms with cheese to add some greens to your meal. For meats, the Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. There’s also the Kagoshima Wagyu Premium Loin Steak if you prefer grilling an entire slab of meat on your own, and getting it to the right doneness. Fans of thick-cut meats will love the Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, which is juicy and full of flavour -- best enjoyed with a generous squeeze of lemon.

Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, as well as seafood such as King Prawns, Scallops with Butter and Soy Sauce, or Greenland Halibut. End the meal on a sweet note with Gyu Kaku’s signature Milk Pudding, or some Matcha and Black Sesame ice cream. (Apr 2019)

data.ABOUT:
Enjoy grilling meats over burning charcoal, but not a fan of doing the whole set-up yourself? Head to Gyu-Kaku -- a family-friendly Japanese yakiniku chain that’s all about the BBQ experience, with good meats and vegetables to match. 

Prime Kagoshima wagyu is the star on the menu here, alongside other premium cuts of meats and an assortment of appetisers and crunchy salads. Start the meal with a light, refreshing dish of Cold Tofu with Banbanji sauce, a spicy sesame dressing that adds a hint of heat to the chilled beancurd. For meats, the Kagoshima Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. There’s also the Kagoshima Wagyu Premium Loin Steak if you prefer grilling an entire slab of meat on your own, and getting it to the right doneness. 

Enjoy your meats bursting with bold flavour? Try the selection of Harami here, where slices of beef are pre-marinated in garlic, shio, or spicy miso for an extra punch. 

Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, from the belly cuts to the collar, and the jowl. There’s also a wide variety of seafood, with favourites like the butter scallops and jumbo prawns. (Apr 2019)

data.title: HACK IT (Pop-Up)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.PRESS RELEASE:
JUMBO Seafood, one of Singapore's most recognizable home-grown brands, has over the years built its name on quality seafood at reasonable prices. This has earned it a name as one of the must-go places for its famous Chili Crab amongst locals and tourists alike. However, it should be noted that JUMBO is famous for so much more than just its award-winning Chili Crab. Some of its other signature dishes include Fried Prawns with Cereal, Crispy Baby Squid and Golden Egg Salted Prawns.
Having built a name and an excellent reputation, JUMBO has since expanded with numerous outlets dotted across the island. Moreover, each outlet has its own distinctive menu in addition to the brand's signature dishes. It is little wonder that customers are encouraged to make reservations, or as Singaporeans would say, "CHOPE" seats before heading down, especially on Fridays and the weekends.
If there is anything that should be remembered about JUMBO Seafood, it should be its consistent quality, excellent service and undeniably fresh seafood. (Jul 2013)

data.title: HANJIP Korean Grill House
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Striploin, Wagyu Brisket, Pork Belly, Spicy Chicken Feet
data.ABOUT:
Looking to be the most authentic traditional Korean barbeque restaurant in Singapore, HANJIP Korean Grill House is one of the biggest Korean barbeque restaurants in Singapore. Well-known for its extensive range of aged Australian Wagyu, USDA Prime Beef, as well as Kurobuta Berkshire Pork, the restaurant offers as many as seven different curated themed private dining rooms to elevate your dining experience. Be prepared for an ultimate grilling experience like no other, with top notch service provided by the attentive wait staff.

HANJIP Korean Grill House aims to bring the distinguished taste of Korean barbeque to your tables with its delicious menu offerings. Start your meal with a thick slab of rich Australian Wagyu. Succulent and juicy, the beautiful marbling gives the tender steak a melt-in-your mouth texture that you’ll never forget. Choose to go with a piece of Wagyu Striploin or a Wagyu Brisket for a yummy experience.

For those with a lighter palate, meat lovers can also look to satisfy their meat cravings with the Pork Belly, Pork Jowl or Pork Collar options. Complete your meal with a serving of Spicy Chicken Feet for an authentic Korean barbeque experience. (Jan 2021)

data.title: HANS IM GLÜCK German Burgergrill (Boat Quay)
data.Hours: Mon-Sun, Eve of PH & PH: 11am-11pm (Last Order: 10:30pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hans Im Gluck, Klassik, Birkenwald, Henne, Sommernacht, Wohlfein
data.ABOUT:
Hailing from Germany, this popular burger eatery has set up shop at Boat Quay, tantalising famished diners with its amazingly solid burgers, salads, and ice-cold cocktails. 

At this burger bar, drool-worthy burgers is the name of the game. Depending on your preference, they come plated on sourdough or multigrain buns. Not a fan of bread? Then go for the low-carb “naked” burger where your buns are substituted with lettuce and vegetables. A number of interesting ingredients span the menu so you won’t see a boring run-of-the-mill cheeseburger here. We’re especially fond of the ELSÄSSER Burger, which comes topped with brie and cranberries. Vegetarians and vegans won’t feel left out either, as this burger joint spins up a jaw-droppingly wide array of burgers well suited for every eater. One vegetarian favourite is the WOHLFEIN Burger, comprising a walnut patty, aged cheddar cheese, cranberries, and stuffed with more walnuts. Then wash down your burger bites with a cocktail or two, including the LEICHTSINN cocktail concocted from a intoxicating blend of Baileys, Amaretto, and raspberry. 

Toss away your stereotypical notions of German food, because HANS IM GLÜCK takes the standard American burger and gives it a finely-crafted German twist. (Aug 2018)
