data.title: HANS IM GLÜCK German Burgergrill (VivoCity)
data.Hours: Mon-Sun, Eve of PH & PH: 11am-11pm (Last Order: 10:30pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hans Im Gluck, Klassik, Birkenwald, Henne, Sommernacht, Wohlfein
data.ABOUT: Stepping into Hans Im Gluck might feel like you’ve been transported into a German fairytale forest. You’ll spot a rustic Bavarian alps cottage at the entrance, whimsical wooden swing sets, and idyllic alpine landscape views from the windows. And if you’ve ever wondered how the Germans cook their burgers, you’ll find out here at Hans Im Gluck. On the menu is an extensive selection of burgers that span beef, chicken, vegetarian and vegan. A popular favourite is the Birkenwald, a combination of mushrooms and sour cream-scallion sauce. The Horntrager is a good way to show off how delicious going vegetarian can be, with a walnut pattie topped with crumbly feta cheese and a sweet fig jam. There’s a choice of sourdough or multigrain for buns, or you could go completely naked — with patties wrapped in lettuce and lots of salads. (Dec 2018)

data.title: HQ Italia
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Margherita Pizza, Spicy Salami Pizza, Tomato Basil Pasta, Pesto Pasta
data.ABOUT: HQ Italia is where you can experience true Italian culture, cuisine & lifestyle. We hope to satisfy any of your addictions and help you discover new ones.  Chef Marcello is a lover of Italian food, wines & life and he would love to share his love with Singapore. Coming from the land of the best Italian ingredients, Puglia, on the southern coast of Italy, he accepts no compromise on quality. (Jun 2021)

data.title: HUSH by Mimi
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 3A River Valley Road#01-02 Clarke QuaySingapore (179020)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Unsubtle Truffle Mein, Saucy Crab and Egg Affair, Roasted Duck with Foie Gras Sauce, Clear Soup Angus Beef Lionhead
data.ABOUT:
Housed under the oldest heritage mansion in Singapore, Hush is the latest experiential dining concept at The Riverhouse. A hidden secret den behind the golden door, Hush features multiple VIP booths that allow an intimate dining experience amongst friends and a main dining hall that can accommodate up to 200 pax.
 
The venue oozes an oriental charm on the outside and modern glamour on the inside, with lush cushion seats, sleek marble floor and an intricate golden and bronze theme that help create a sophisticated lounge for the best vibe dining experience.
 
Putting together the most creative culinary and bar team, patrons are guaranteed to find the most delicious Modern-Asian tapas and innovative cocktails that are often crafted or infused with Chinese tea, herbs and florals. Curated playlists will also be a staple feature with a different theme each night. From classics to the latest hits, explore the best of Electro House, Future Bass, Hip-Hop, R&B, Moombahton and commercial beats.
 
If you expect great service, quality food, premium drinks and music, hush is the perfect lifestyle destination for you to seek specialty cocktails, premium spirits, wine, delicious Modern-Asian tapas and the best music in town.
 
At Hush, everyday is a celebration. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Habits Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: “NACHO” Average Chip, Beef Sliders, Mushroom Risotto, Seafood Aglio Olio
data.ABOUT:
Habits Restaurant & Bar resides along Sembawang Road, making it a great place to dine for those residing in the North. A themed restaurant, the place whips up tasty Western fusion dishes in a cosy and comfortable setting. 

Start your meal with a sharing plate of Truffle Fries. Garnished with parmesan cheese and parsley, the thick cut fries are crispy and rewards diners with a satisfying crunch. Another sumptuous option would be the “NACHO” Average Chips. Drizzled in homemade salsa, cheddar and mozzarella, this interesting take on your classic bowl of chips is a great start to any meal. For those looking forward to a more filling appetiser, the Beef Sliders or Crab Cakes comes highly recommended. 

Move on to the mains with a fragrant bowl of Mushroom Risotto. Absolutely delicious, this dish features perfectly diced portobello mushrooms and is finished off with a dash of truffle oil. The Roasted Chicken is another worthy contender that is served with a side of mash, sauteed greens in a rich pan sauce. Made for the seafood lovers, the Seafood Aglio Olio is a fiery dish filled with generous portions of king prawns and scallops. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Hai Tien Lo
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steamed Charcoal Barbecue Pork Bun with Black Truffles, Steamed Pork and Prawns Dumplings with Fish Roe, Double-boiled Mini Buddha Jumps over the Wall with Morel Mushrooms, Stir-fried Sliced Grouper with Salted Fish and Ginger Spring Onions, Braised Classic Whole Abalone and Beancurd accompanied with Broccoli in Supreme Stock, Combination of Pan-fried Scallop and Sliced Crispy Barbecued Suckling Pig stuffed with Prawn Paste in Thai Sauce, Deep-fried Crispy Sea Cucumber stuffed with Minced Pork and Shrimps accompanied with Preserved Vegetables
data.ABOUT:
We’re in a country where food is almost an obsession and new eateries pop up by the dozen, despite a landscape already saturated with restaurants. So when a dining establishment like Hai Tien Lo manages to capture the notoriously short attention spans of gourmands and draws in crowds consistently, you know it’s got to be something special.
The dim sum menu features signatures like Steamed Charcoal Barbecue Pork Bun with Black Truffles and Steamed Pork and Prawns Dumplings with Fish Roe, but if baskets of bites don’t strike your fancy, the exquisite mains and sets are well worth a try. Further enhancing the dining experience are Executive Chef Ben’s new culinary creations of Double-boiled Mini Buddha Jumps over the Wall with Morel Mushrooms, Stir-fried Sliced Grouper with Salted Fish and Ginger Spring Onions, Braised Classic Whole Abalone and Beancurd accompanied with Broccoli in Supreme Stock and more.
We think Hai Tien Lo – which means ‘stairway to heaven’ – was aptly named, indeed! (May 2019)

data.title: Hai Xian Lao 海鲜捞 (Chinatown)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kurobuta Pork Belly, Spanish Pork Collar, Angus 150 Days Grain-fed Beef, Deer, Lamb Shoulder, Fresh Oysters, Fish Skin, Scallops, Sliced Dory
data.ABOUT:
Singapore may be smoking hot, but there’s nothing like a heartwarming hotpot session to up the ante. At Hai Xian Lao, their exciting soup bases pack a fiery punch that you won’t forget. From the intense Mala broth to familiar flavours like Laksa, Tom Yum, and Chicken Broth, there’s something for everyone. If you ask us though, our top choice will have to be their thick and flavoursome collagen soup. Boiled using the freshest ingredients, the soup base sits patiently on the stove for eight whole hours before being served up as a rich, MSG-free soup.

Sink into their plush leather chairs (yes, leather chairs), and you will find yourself spoilt for choice with a wide variety of fresh and quality produce available here. As you feast on your usual steamboat offerings, don’t forget to treat yourself with their premium selection that includes the likes of Kurobuta Pork Belly, US Wagyu Beef Striploin, Lamb Shoulder, and more. For those with a penchant for live seafood, you’ll be delighted to know that Fresh Oysters, Lobsters, Prawns, and Alaskan King Crabs await you!

Whether you’re looking for some family fun, or for some comfort food, Hai Xian Lao won’t disappoint with their yummy soup bases, crazy variety of yummy steamboat offerings, live seafood, and quality meats! (Jan 2019)

data.title: Hair of the Dog
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lychee Martini, Pina Colada, Garlic Prawns, Mala Chicken Cube, Hair of the Dog Cocktail
data.ABOUT: Crafted with you in mind – conversations, companionship, cocktails. Make merry with a curated series of palatable wines. Take your friendship deeper with whiskeys and cocktails. Enjoy bar bites and main dishes that satisfy. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Halcyon & Crane
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Chinese, Australian, Fusion, International, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ham & Cheesy Egg Crepe, King’s Chicken Hash Benedict, Pistachio & Apple Birches Muesli, Fresh Berries & Honey Granola, Smoked Tuna Tataki Salad, Beetroot & Seafood Risotto, Baby Chicken Roulade, Mushroom & Pork Scallion Pancakes, Chengdu Baked Egg Pancakes
data.ABOUT:
Perched on the third level and boasting a cosy interior, the main draw of this spot is it’s restorative atmosphere, touted as the “best moment of your day.” Named after the birds of tranquility and longevity in Chinese and Greek folklore, the menu here is crafted with a focus on wellness and the healing effect of food.

The menu seamlessly weaves in hints of Sichuan flavour into traditional European classics, so don’t expect the usual cafe fare here. An expert team of chefs from China and Singapore work together to create unique dishes that will leave you wanting more. The Cured Sausage Shakshuka is a rich and unique dish that will surprise you with every bite. Spicy sausage chunks cooked with corn, tomato, and mushrooms, this dish is spicy, sweet, and flavourful. Dip the accompanying slices of beetroot toast into the stew for an added burst of flavour.

For something a little lighter, opt for the H&C Beef Caesar Salad, a delicious dish of tender braised beef tossed in a mix of greens and eggs. This dish is crisp and soft in equal measure, and for a salad, it’s pretty moreish. The fibre from the vegetables and the richness of the beef make this a good option even if you’re famished. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Hana Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 583 Orchard Road#01-17Forum The Shopping MallSingapore (238884)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Sukiyaki, Truffle Uni Chawanmushi, Hana Signature Maki, Chef Special Chirashi
data.ABOUT:
Named after Japan’s sprawling florals, Hana Restaurant is a traditional Japanese eatery adorned with stunning Sakura cherry blossoms, beautiful black barstools, and bright lights that look as if they are falling from the sky.
They serve up some pretty authentic & inspirational eats like the Nama Kaki Ponzu, Ika Kyuri Su, and Sushi Sarada. And if you’re looking for a delicious deal to snag up with a group of friends or the entire family, check out the Shabu Shabu Buffet! Like their namesake, they offer tons of variety and are a Japanese blossom everyone will love! (May 2015)

data.title: Hanashizuku Japanese Cuisine
data.Hours: LunchMon-Fri: 11:45am-2:30pm (Last Order: 2pm)DinnerMon-Thu, Sun: 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)  Fri-Sat & PH: 6-11:30pm (Last Order: 11pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Ikura Don, Mentaiko Pasta, Buta Kimchi Nabe (Miso-flavoured & Kimchi Pork Clay Pot), Wa Gyutan Shio Kosho Itame (Stir Fried Slice Wagyu Beef Tongue), Scallops Carpaccio with Ponzu Jelly and Truffle Salsa, Saikoro Steak
data.ABOUT:
Couched in the quieter parts of Orchard Road, Hanashizuku Japanese Cuisine serves up authentic Izakaya-style cuisine that won’t break the bank. The best part? Quality and freshness is the name of the game here, with seafood flown in thrice weekly from Japan while their extensive menu is prepared using only the finest ingredients. Paired with an ambience that’s both modern and elegant, Hanashizuku brings you a peerless dining experience.
There are familiar eats such as Edamame but tickle your taste buds with their Octopus with Wasabi, Yamaimo Tanzaku (Japanese Yam) or the Buta Kimchi Nabe (Miso-flavoured & Kimchi Pork Clay Pot). We also definitely recommend going for their Carpaccio dishes like the Gyu Tataki Carpaccio (Sliced Row Beef with Garlic Ponzu Sauce). Classic choices such as the Salmon Ikura Don and Mentaiko Pasta are however just as delightful, a testament to the chef’s masterful skills.
If you’re looking for some drinks, stop by and choose from an impressive selection of premium alcohol from specially imported Sake to Shochu and Japanese beer. You don’t have to thank us for this hidden gem! (Jul 2016)

data.title: Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cocaine Wings, Ayam Panggang, Hainanese Pork Chop, Righteous Pork Ribs
data.ABOUT:
Ever dreamt of being a part of a biking crew but you’re too worried that if you actually learnt to ride a motorcycle, you would quit your job for the thrill of the open road and never turn back? Well dream no more! Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks is here to fulfill your inner biker fantasies!
Opened by two fellow bike enthusiasts, Handlebar achieves the atmosphere of a rough-and-ready bikers’ den while serving unpretentious, mouthwatering international and local favourites. One of the favourites on the menu is undoubtedly the Cocaine Wings: smothered in smoky barbecue sauce, and coming in various levels of spiciness, these lip-smackingly delicious chicken wings are highly addictive. The Ayam Panggang dish is an instant mood-lifter. A large piece of chicken is marinated with a cornucopia of traditional spices such as candlenut, ginger, lemongrass, and lime, before being grilled till perfection and served with rice and accompanying vegetables. It’s also a treat to realise that Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks has the traditional Hainanese Pork Chop available on its menu. Popular with the older generation, this dish is making a comeback and it’s not hard to see why - a delicious delicacy, it’s crispy on the outside but stays soft and juicy on the inside. Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks is strong on atmosphere and food, so treat yourselves today! (Mar 2017)

data.title: Hannibal, European Grill & Pizza-Bar
data.Cuisine: Italian, Steakhouse, German, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.Address: 80 Mohamed Sultan Road#01-04 The Pier at RobertsonSingapore (239013)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Cuts Platter, Bacon Cheese Rolls, Risotto Seafood, Beef Lasagna
data.ABOUT:
Located in the heart of the trendiest entertainment district of Singapore, Hannibal European Grill and Bar is the perfect place for young professionals looking for a casual and laid back evening in town. With a selection of gourmet delights ranging from hamburgers, steaks, and meat skewers to thin-crust pizzas and Italian egg-based pastas, the bar attracts a cosmopolitan crowd of expats, locals, and fashionable night owls. 

The Cold Cuts Platter is a great way to kickstart your meal. Featuring parma ham, mortadella, salami, mixed vegetables and eggs, this tapas item is a simple, crowd-pleasing spread to share with family and friends. An innovative offering, the Bacon Cheese Rolls are made of crisp fried bacon stuffed with mozzarella and pistachio cream that gives a satisfying crunch when you bite into the rolls of cheesy goodness. Order the Risotto Seafood to savour tasty creamy rice mixed with seafood in a light tomato sauce. Other delectable options include the Beef Lasagna and Spring Chicken. 

Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with the plethora of charcoal grill options available at Hannibal European Grill and Bar. Take your pick of kebabs, burger, skewers or sausages for a hearty feast. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Happy Dining Seafood 喜来聚海鲜
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seafood Platter, Sea Bass in Soy Sauce, Baby Lobster, Steamed Fish Head
data.ABOUT: With origins as a seafood distributor, you can trust that Happy Dining Seafood 喜来聚海鲜 knows how to do seafood. Chinese seafood, in particular, with dishes that can be traced back to the Dongbei region of Northeast China. An underrated regional cuisine, it can be characterised by its use of pickled cabbage, potatoes, carrots, as well as wheat and corn instead of rice.The folks at this Chinese and seafood restaurant use fresh ingredients each time, offering an array of shellfish, fish, meat and vegetable dishes. Diners choose how they’d like their seafood to be prepared, and which sauce or broth to accompany — whether it’s 'hot & spicy', 13 spices, garlic or black pepper. Great for friends and families to share, the Seafood Platter is a mammoth creation, offering your favourite seafood staples in one set. The Baby Lobster is a juicy bite, while the Sea Bass in Soy Sauce tastes like something closer to home.Meat lovers can enjoy the spoils too, with Smoked Pork and Braised Pork Ear as some of the restaurant’s favourites. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Hard Rock Cafe (Cuscaden)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fajitas, Pork Ribs, Beef Brisket, Classic Nachos, Tupelo Chicken Tenders, New York Strip Steak, Original Legendary Burger
data.ABOUT:
This gem of a London export needs no real introduction. The international franchise brings its brand of hard-pumping rock music, hearty food, strong booze, and top-notch entertainment everywhere it goes. This Singapore outpost, established in 1990, has the added advantage of being somewhat of an institution amongst late-night revelers at the lively Cuscaden area, a mix of interesting characters, a diverse mix of folks from die-hard rockers to curious tourists, all seeking the restaurant-bar's hearty food, hard-rocking local bands, and the raunchy humour of its resident standup comics.
The memorabilia is what keeps the Hard Rock family united across the world, but put that aside for a second and consider the grub. Think American dive bar with a little upmarket touch: chicken tenders in a smoky glaze of hickory barbecue sauce and honey mustard, buffalo-style wings in a piquant dry rub served with the customary blue cheese and celery, and the franchise's famous fajitas filled with your choice of grilled meat, tangy pico de gallo, and melty cheese. For something heftier, there's also grilled steaks and a selection of meats from the smokehouse, think massive pork ribs and beef brisket in a tangy, hickory-spiked barbecue sauce. Good food, good times, and good music have always been part of the Hard Rock promise, and at this grand old dame of the late-night Orchard scene, the party never stops. (Dec 2016)

data.title: Hard Rock Cafe (Sentosa)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 26 Sentosa Gateway#01-209-214 The Forum, Sentosa Island Singapore (098138)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Nachos, Original Legendary Burger, The Impossible Burger, New York Cheesecake
data.ABOUT:
Located at Resorts World Sentosa, Hard Rock Cafe boasts a world-famous American menu that offers the best American bites with a mix of regional favourites.

For starters, dig into the restaurant’s signature slow roasted wings tossed in classic buffalo or barbeque sauce. Whipped up with carrots, celery, and blue cheese dressing, each mouthful of tender, juicy chicken packs a punch of flavours. For those who love their chips, the Classic Nachos will definitely satisfy your cravings. Layered with ranch style beans and a four cheese sauce blend, dip the crispy tortilla chips into the cheesy mess for a delicious time! 

Don’t leave without taking a bite out of the burger that started it all. Featuring applewood bacon, cheddar cheese, crispy onion ring, leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, the Original Legendary Burger is set to wow you in both size and taste. The Impossible Burger is an equally tasty rendition of the legendary steak burgers which are vegan friendly. 100% plant based, the burger is served with fresh toasted buns and a generous side of fries for an indulgent meal. 

End off your meal the American meal with a decadent slice of New York Cheesecake. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Harry's (18 Tai Seng)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Laksa Popcorn Chicken, Otah Toasties, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Curried Lamb Shank, Beef Rendang
data.ABOUT:
There’s something relaxing about hanging out in a bar, listening to the soulful voice of a singer on stage washing your workday blues away. At Harry’s, the music is always on point and the food’s always comforting. 

Laksa Popcorn Chicken, for instance, will win the hearts of all fried chicken fans. The crispy golden-brown nuggets of fried chicken are accompanied by a slightly spicy, piquant laksa mayonnaise that is so tasty, you might be forgiven for double-dipping. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks — the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast. 

If you’re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Oct 2019)

Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Harry's (Riverside Point)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Laksa Popcorn Chicken, Otah Toasties, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Curried Lamb Shank, Beef Rendang
data.ABOUT:
There’s something relaxing about hanging out in a bar, listening to the soulful voice of a singer on stage washing your workday blues away. At Harry’s, the music is always on point and the food’s always comforting. 

Laksa Popcorn Chicken, for instance, will win the hearts of all fried chicken fans. The crispy golden-brown nuggets of fried chicken are accompanied by a slightly spicy, piquant laksa mayonnaise that is so tasty, you might be forgiven for double-dipping. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks — the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast. 

If you’re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Hathaway
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pengat Pisang French Toast, Hathaway’s Big Breakfast, Octopus Bakar & Sambal Udang, Ode to Plum Powder
data.ABOUT:
Hathaway is a restaurant in Dempsey that brings together the diverse Singaporean identity to your table. Presenting the best memories around taste and embracing the new food culture and sensibilities of the modern generation, Hathaway is great for both lunch or dinner.

For a catch up with friends, Hathaway’s brunch menu offers a plethora of delightful options. If you’re feeling peckish, the Pengat Pisang French Toast is a great dish to go for. Featuring caramelised bananas stewed in fragrant coconut milk, the slices of deliciously toasted bread are topped off with a generous scoop of Apom Berkuah Ice Cream for the ultimate indulgence.

For those with a hearty appetite, Hathaway’s Big Breakfast will surely satisfy you. With homemade chicken sausage, smoked beef brisket, potato latkes and kacang pool, there’s no lack of flavour on this platter of decadent brunch delights. Seafood lovers should definitely opt for the Octopus Bakar & Sambal Udang. Served with charred polenta and coriander lime relish, the grilled octopus is enhanced by the spiciness of the sambal udang and makes for a deliciously fiery dish. (Oct 2020)

data.title: HaveFun Bistro
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Japanese, Fusion, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers, Zi Char
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: HK Style Cheese Baked Pork Rice, HK Style Wonton Dry Noodles, Japanese Takoyaki Ball, Japanese Breaded Prawns
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by Hong Kong-style cafe staples, Japanese street fair as well as Western classics, HaveFun Kitchen brings together a plethora of internationally well-loved dishes that will delight all foodies. Affordable, accessible and fun, the bistro is a great place for gatherings over food with family and friends in the heartlands up north. 

A delicious fusion of Cantonese fare with your favourite Western dish, the HK Style Cheese Baked Pork Rice delights your tastebuds with a mouthful of cheesy goodness and tender pork atop a bed of soft, fluffy rice. Made for seafood lovers, the HK Style Cheese Baked Seafood Rice is an equally yummy rendition of the restaurant's signature cheese baked rice. Noodle fans simply cannot leave without trying the HK Style Wonton Dry Noodles with Char Siew. Topped with steamed vegetables, tasty pork dumplings and succulent pieces of Char Siew, this bowl of tangy noodles tastes even better than it looks. 

Western options here include a variety of burgers, pizzas and mouth-watering sides but the menu doesn’t stop there! Japanese sides are also available on the bistro’s extensive menu. Bite into Japanese Takoyaki Balls or Breaded Prawns for a taste of Japan in HaveFun Kitchen. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Haven Bistro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Piquant Fisc, Crabby Wabby, Haven’s Club, Pinky Salmon, Her-Bi-Game
data.ABOUT:
Located just a short walk from Bendemeer MRT station, they’ve already gained a loyal following within weeks of opening, and it’s easy to see why.  Diners can sit back, relax, and unwind at this breezy bistro on Jalan Besar. Touting itself as an oasis for stressed city-folk, Haven Bistro serves up exciting Euro-Asian fusion fare at affordable prices. Forget overpriced eggs benedict and smoothies. Haven Bistro is redefining what it means to “brunch”, one plate at a time. 

The Haven’s Club is a signature sandwich and a must-try for first time visitors. Made with a slab of grilled chicken, tomato, lettuce, cheese, and egg, this dish is generously portioned and loaded with healthy ingredients, so it’s perfect even for guests who are watching their waistlines. The adorably named Crabby Wabby is another great option for when a sandwich won’t cut it. Made with perfectly al dente spaghetti and soft-shell crab, the flavours of the ingredients meld perfectly together. Craving something classic? The Piquant Fisc is right up your alley. Made with steamed rice and sambal fish, it’ll make you reminiscent of the simple times. The humble combination of fiery sambal and rice is an ode to the flavours of Singaporean cuisine. (April 2019)

data.title: Heart of Darkness
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salted Crispy Cauliflower, Thai Crispy Chicken Skin, Trio Sausage, Yakitori Combo, Classic Top Shell, Vietnamese Grill Scallop
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Heart of Darkness is all about duality. Good and evil. Sane and insane. It is about big, bold, crafted brews that will challenge the way you think about beer; thirst-quenching session beers that will have you bouncing off the walls and hop bombs that will give you a kick-to-the-teeth, while still being balanced and delicious. Whatever your taste, we’ve got it.

Our taproom is a communal eating and drinking experience, built around a vibrant, passion-filled menu and our tasty brews. We’ll have 20 taps on-site with 10 tried-and-true flagships, and 10 rotator taps - there will always be something new to tickle your taste buds. We put a whole lot of love into every brew, and our relentless pursuit of quality means that we use only the finest ingredients from around the globe. 

We are prolific brewers - having brewed over 220 different styles of craft beer since we opened in October 2016. A hoppy twist to a porter? Easy. A 10% ABV, 70 IBU Pilsner?! True story. A 123 IBU Indian Pale Ale? Definitely! Each and every beer is brewed to the same amazing standard of quality. Every. Single. Time. It’s our brewers’ mastery of balancing hops, malts, and yeasts that ensures quality and consistency. 

Here at Heart of Darkness, we’re all about the good life... Great food, even better beers and amazing service. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Heirloom Bistro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.ABOUT: Located in the bustling borough of Holland Village, where the arts, food, wine and connection comes to life, Heirloom believes that there is something for every palate. Cosy up here for an evening of taste-tangling bites with friends, or late night drinks with an extensive wine list and alternative wines which feature female sommeliers who have shattered glass ceilings in the wine-making industry.Look out for the 'Weekend Kitchen Takeover' where each week a different local chef gets to showcase their skill. No matter the occasion at Heirloom Bistro, you're in for a treat. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Hibachi
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Omakase, Sake, Braised Kurobuta Pork Belly, Grilled Niigata Snow-aged Wagyu
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Set in quintessential Orchard Road lies a jem in Hibachi Casual Dining. Simple and minimalistic, Hibachi exudes Japanese modernity charm.
 
Serving a hybrid between Kappo and Izakaya food, our fresh ingredients find justice over the warm chargrill fire. They are simply grilled over applewood dusted binchotan, leaving the meats and seafood a smokey finish, boasting their undeniable umami flavour. Whet your appetite with meticulously prepared otoshi food and sides, drink to your hearts content with a range of delectable wines and spirits. Hibachi also serves Omakase featuring our Yukimuro (Snow-aged) Beef from Niigata which is a highlight of the restaurant. 
 
Hibachi is officially opened for business from 27 April 2021. Hibachi means a traditional Japanese grill. During the harsh cold winter in certain parts of Japan, it is always warming to have meats and seafoods grilled over hibachi. The aromas fill the room while savoring the food over drinks. The very simple way of enjoying grilled food is exactly what Hibachi Casual Dining is all about.
 
And the cherry on the top? Artfully curated Omakase desserts with a touch of French flair. (Très chic!)
 
Do make a reservation with us today and experience a gastronomical journey!!
 
Dewa, Itadakimasu!

data.title: Hide by Hide Yamamoto
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Chawanmushi, Young Chicken Stuffed with Soy Truffle Butter Rice, Sami Bento, Tonkotsu Soy Ramen, Japanese A5 Wagyu Steaks
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Dedicated to bringing you the finest ingredients directly from Japan, our company prides itself in our team’s ability to mark your dining experience with great flavours and presentation.

We curate our menus to emulate classic yet contemporary dishes, expertly paired with an extensive beverage menu.

Our singular aim is to create an immersive dining experience by stimulating the senses of our diners through taste, smells, colours and textures of the dishes in a comfortable environment.


Have it your way at Hide. From customer favorite Whole Chicken Stuffed with Soy Truffle Butter Rice to Japanese A5 Wagyu Steaks, choose between our Teppanyaki and general dining experiences. We even have bento sets for the picnic crowd. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Holey Moley Golf Club (Dining)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Beeferoni, The Dirty Birdie, The Really Hot Dog, Golden Basket
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Whether you’re scouting out somewhere sweet to dine on the weekend, looking to book the best birthday party ever for a caddy kid, or locking down an adorable date spot for your par-crossed lover, Holey Moley is the destination for you.

Pull up a seat and settle in at our fully-equipped cocktail bar. We will take care of you, with a wild range of crazy cocktails, beers on tap and fine wines. Worked up an appetite? With our American themed menu, our range of delicious burgers, hotdogs and more will take care of all your needs.  (Aug 2019)

data.title: HolyCrab
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hokkien Mee, Succumb Clam Bee Hoon Noodle, Succumb Crab, Balsamic Crab, Devil's Crab
data.ABOUT: There’s an exquisite simplicity to the menu here, but be warned: if you cannot eat crab, just go somewhere else. Basically, you order a crab done in one of their six styles, and have them with some carbs. The carbs are amazing though: think heavenly, lard-and-seafood kissed, wok-breath infused Hokkien Mee, a fine Bee Hoon steeped in a rich clam broth, or the HolyCrab Fried Rice stirred up with flecks of crab meat. But all this is only accessory to the real deal: massive crabs cooked in rich sauces. The signature item is the Holy Crab, an angelic vision featuring a Crab cooked in a rich crab broth, with lots of vermicelli to soak up the goodness. Then there’s the Orgasmic Crab, with a little sin injected by way of a salted egg & curry leaf gravy that is the perfect foil for sweet bouncy crabmeat. For something with more unusual twist, there’s the Balsamic Crab, with the meaty crustaceans bathed in a pungent, sweet, and acidic sauce made with balsamic vinegar, fresh herbs, and spices. Then there’s the house version of Singapore’s national dish: Singapore Chili Crab, and there are five levels of spiciness you can choose from, one for each decade of our independence. If you’re feeling a little crabbed out, throw in some decorative Seasonal Vegetables, or better yet, carb out some more with an order of fried Mantou buns to soak up all that sauce with. Don’t tell your cardiologist. (Jun 2017)

data.title: Home Of Seafood
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deluxe Live Lobster Platter, Black Pepper Crab, Chilli Crab, Salted Egg Crab, Bee Hoon Crab Soup, Lobster with Chef's Superior Sauce, Stir Fried La La with Sambal Chilli, Wok-Fried Prawns with Fragrant Butter
data.ABOUT:
From its humble beginnings at Yio Chu Kang in 2008 to its present day expansion to Joo Chiat, Home of Seafood has been winning numerous awards for their aromatic seafood. Recipients of "Singapore's Favourite Food" in 2013, and also voted the "Best Pepper Crab in Singapore", it's clear that diners love the restaurant's ability to serve that perfect pincer.
One taste of their famous signature Black Pepper Crab and you'll be in love too! Their use of a milder pepper gives just enough heat to allow the sweetness of the ocean-fresh Sri Lankan crab to really come through, and often means you'll be down two claws before you've even realised how much you've eaten!
These capable culinary captains of crustaceans are capable of more than just that though. At Home of Seafood, you have the option of having your crab steamed, buttered, chilled, cocktail-ed, claypot-ted, or spiced up with chilli. Our personal favourite of the lot? The Salted Egg Crab. Salty, sweet, savoury, and velvety smooth, their version of this increasingly popular dish has us wondering if the days of Chili Crab as the ambassador of Singaporean cuisine might indeed be limited.
So whether you vote chili, pepper, or salted egg, rest assured that you've got a home away from home nestled in the increasingly hip neighbourhood of Joo Chiat. (Oct 2015)

data.title: Honguo (Bugis Junction)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: XO Seafood Fried Noodles, Pork Ribs Yunnan Noodles Soup, Cross Bridge Vermicelli, Pork Dumplings with Chilli Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by the classical story of a virtuous scholar and his wife, Honguo hopes to translate the warmth and comforting moments of the story into piping hot bowls of soup for diners.  

 

Visit Honguo during weekdays and be rewarded with a weekday special set meal. Consisting of a main and a side dish, this deal will definitely afford you with more bang for your buck. Go for the XO Seafood Fried Noodles. Lightly fried, this deliciously sinful dish is an indulgence not to be missed. The Pork Ribs Yunnan Noodles Soup is a healthier dish that includes sweet corn, leafy vegetables and braised pieces of pork ribs. Also available with beef, these noodle options are delicious and nourishing.  

 

The star of the show is none other than the Cross Bridge Vermicelli. Double boiled for hours with selected duck, chicken and pork parts, the broth is extremely flavourful. Tuck in while it’s boiling hot to enjoy! (Sep 2020)

data.Good For: Casual Dining
