data.title: HooHa Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 3 South Buona Vista Road#B1-06 Viva Vista MallSingapore (118136)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oysters Monay, Meat Lovers Pizza, Spaghetti Carbonara, The Ultimate Tenderloin Steak, Hooha's Kungfu Laksa
data.PRESS RELEASE:
HooHa Cafe is Singapore's most unique hole in the wall cafe, with over 22 years of experience in serving up excellent food and service.

Come and experience a hidden gem in the west that serves the best Angus tenderloin steak air-flown from New Zealand and kungfu laksa. Not forgetting our other award-winning dishes - fresh and baked oysters in secret cheese sauce and thin-crust pizzas. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Hopscotch (Capitol)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 15 Stamford Road#01-83Arcade @ The Capitol KempinskiSingapore (178906) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Tagliatelle, Ribeye Steak, Garden City Sling and Milo Medley
data.ABOUT: The Capitol Arcade location is perhaps Hopscotch’s most iconic home so far. Located right outside the historic Capitol Theatre, Hopscotch once again finds itself close to the arts – a place with almost a century worth. After its revamp in 2015, the immediate area surrounding Capitol Theatre was transformed into the picturesque sunlit atrium where Hopscotch (Capitol) nests at today, “Arcade @ The Capitol Kempinski”.The fully air-conditioned atrium exudes old world charm reminiscent of Colonial era streets with modern expression, a fascinating amalgamation of the old and new. Being located at City hall also offers much accessibility, a convenience that our original 28 Maxwell location once had. To us, this is the perfect space for merry men, lively crowds, and vibrant atmosphere, the perfect place to host guests. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Hopscotch (Gillman Barracks)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hyogo Oysters, White Sands, Skewers, Ice Man, Sinseh’s Mulled Wine
data.ABOUT:
Gillman Barracks is already famed in the local art scene for its unique collection of restaurants, art galleries, and bars. Hopscotch adds to the mix by offering a selection of unique cocktails and libations for adventurous barflies. You can easily spot the bar due to its unique red brick exterior, decorative gears, and exposed piping on the outer walls. 

The highlight of the menu would has to be the bespoke cocktails. Crafted with a local palate in mind, many of the drinks combine familiar flavours with exquisite liqueurs to create unique concoctions. The White Sands cocktail, for example, will have you longing for warm beach days. Served in a seashell and made with a heady mix of Kwai Feh lychee liqueur, Nigori Sake, and a coconut sorbet for some extra sweetness, this is the perfect pick-me-up drink for those sweltering days you’d rather be by the sea. Pace yourself with the alcohol by indulging in some bar bites, like the Hyogo Oysters. Reasonably priced and specially flown in from the Hyogo Prefecture in Japan, these plump little gems provide a briny flavour tempered by dashi to cleanse the palate and prepare it for more flavours. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Hot Stones Steak and Seafood
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tajima Wagyu Beef, Kurobuta Pork, Hot Stones Surf & Turf, U.S Black Angus Sirloin Steak, Cod Steak, Salmon Steak
data.ABOUT:
This family favourite at Clarke Quay offers a fun communal dining experience with a smoking hot “pre-historic” twist. This restaurant does exactly what it says on the cover: using an ancient, stone-age cooking method, your food arrives raw on the table before gradually cooking on sizzling-hot serpentinite stones from the European Alps that store heat well and, apart from giving your food to a perfect, juicy sear, keeps them warm throughout the meal.
With a great view of the river outside, especially from the lofty second floor dining area, part of the charm is a friendly crowd, made up of families and customers who’ve been coming here since 1992. Can you blame them? The premium meats here are cooked to smoky, piping-hot perfection. Choose from beautifully marbled Kurobuta pork or high-grade Tajima Wagyu, both of which sing on the hot stones and soften to sweet, tender, melt-in-your-mouth chunks. If riverside dining is not complete without some seafood, they’ve got hefty slabs of fish steaks, from salmon to cod, as well as Boston lobsters! Come sizzle away on these volcanic stones and get in touch with your pre-historic side! (Oct 2016)

data.title: House of AnLi Bistro
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Carbonnads de Chez Nous, Maria’s Moussaka, Ghentse Waterzooi, Chocolate Tart, Smoked Salmon on Sourdough Toast, Zucchini Bacon Quiche
data.ABOUT: Quiet Tanglin Mall is a treasure trove of undiscovered F&B gems, and the achingly pretty House of AnLi is probably the shiniest one. An extension of a chi-chi furniture store, the interiors here are, needless to say, well-considered. Handsome wooden touches offset a gorgeous black-and-white theme, with quirky decorations adding some humour to the space. Add some coffee and gorgeous Belgian-inspired plates, and it feels like you’ve walked into the pages of Kinfolk. Whether it’s the baked goods at the counter, a fragrant Mariage Frères tea, or punchy Allpress Coffee, this is the hottest spot for a premium afternoon. There’s also heartier bites like open-faced sandwiches topped with farm-fresh produce: beautiful eggs, vegetables, and meats elegantly arrayed on artisanal bread and drizzled with light dressing. Tuck into Maria’s Moussaka, a cheesy, eggplant-based Belgian “lasagna” filled with minced beef and a light bechamel sauce, or the house Carbonnades, a ragout of beef cheek, yellow spud potatoes, tender baby carrots, and a malty Trappiste beer sauce. Chase all of that with an intense chocolate tart, some coffee, and a spot of furniture shopping, some of life’s great pleasures all rolled into one, perfect location. (Apr 2017)

data.title: House of Kebab
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tabbouleh, Tzatziki, Mix Grill, Signature Lamb Chop
data.ABOUT:
Swing by the House of Kebab to grab a quick yet mouthwatering shawarma sandwich made from an assortment of freshly roasted meat. Located along Arab street, the restaurant serves up authentic Middle Eastern cuisine that’s delicious and affordable.

Start off light with the Tabbouleh. A cold appetizer made of chopped parsley, freshly cut tomatoes and garnished with onions, mint and bulgur, this traditional salad is a nutritious way to kickstart your meal. For those who prefer a salad with fewer greens, the Tzatziki is a refreshing salad made with diced cucumbers and strained yoghurt. Tossed in a blend of garlic, salt, olive oil and lemon juice for extra zest, order one before diving into the steamy main courses. 

Served fresh from the grill, the Mix Grill is a combination platter that features different cuts of meat — perfect for large gatherings. Other signature meat menu options include the Signature Lamb Chop, Shish Kebab and Chicken Kabsa. Sandwiches and wraps are also available here at the House of Kebab. Pair with the Signature Drink Lemonade with Mint for a great meal. (Dec 2020)

data.title: House of Seafood (Clarke Quay)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 3A River Valley Road#A2-02Clarke Quay Singapore (179020)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab, Wok-Fried Cereal Prawn, Seafood Tower, Stir Fried Lala with Sliced Chilli
data.ABOUT:
Offering a wide array of exquisite and mouth watering dishes, House of Seafood is a family oriented restaurant serving an extensive range of fresh and savoury seafood dishes. 

Best known for their award-winning Chilli Crab, dig into a wonderful myriad of savoury and sweet flavours accompanied with a lovely side of crispy and fluffy mantou buns. Another one of the restaurant’s signature dishes, the Wok-Fried Cereal Prawn is a plateful of huge prawns deep fried with oats for a crunchy and savoury taste. Fried over high heat, fresh and juicy clams are coated in a fiery layer of sambal sauce, resulting in the well-loved Stir Fried Lala with Sliced Chilli dish. Other side dishes that taste equally delicious include the Steamed Scotland Bamboo Clams with Minced Garlic. Sprinkled atop the steamed clams, the chopped garlic enhances the flavour and fragrance of this dish, making it a huge hit among both the young and old. 

The star of the show at House of Seafood is definitely the stunning Seafood Tower. Consisting seven layers of seafood, indulge in your favourite seafood with a steaming pot of highly addictive broth. (Nov 2020)

data.title: House of Seafood (Punggol Point)
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Local, Dim Sum, Zi Char
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address:
3 Punggol Point Road
#01-01/02
The Punggol Settlement
Singapore (828694)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Pepper Crab, Salted Egg Crab, Pan Fried Chicken Cutlet with Special Sauce, Fried White Bee Hoon with XO Sauce
data.ABOUT: Mention 180 Yio Chu Kang and your thoughts might jump to House of Seafood. Started in 2008, this restaurant has garnered plenty of fans willing to queue for their fresh seafood and mouth-watering crab dishes, and has now found a spot at The Punggol Settlement.It’d be best to go in a group because you won’t want to order just two dishes off the menu. Pan Fried Chicken Cutlet with Special Sauce, Steamed Marble Goby with Soya Sauce, and Sautéed Fresh Hokkaido Scallops with Broccoli are some of the a la carte options you can have, but save some stomach space for their signature crabs. There’re the ever popular options of chilli and black pepper, but for something a little richer, House of Seafood’s salted egg and creamy butter versions are deliciously sinful. What was once at Yio Chu Kang is now at Punggol and the lines are still as long as ever. Who says there aren’t any restaurants in the North worth traveling for? (Dec 2015)

data.title: Hua Ting
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.Address:
442 Orchard Road
Orchard Hotel Singapore, Level 2
Singapore (238879)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Baked Mango Chicken Tartlet, Steamed Seafood Dumpling Abalone, Crispy Roasted Duck, Dong Xing Garoupa Rice, Mango Purée, Pomelo, Sago, Herbal Jelly
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in Orchard Hotel since 1992, the award-winning Hua Ting Restaurant boasts an amazing repertoire of Cantonese plates.

Embark on your Hua Ting journey with the Baked Mango Chicken Tartlet. The tartlet’s crust crumbles in your mouth, revealing a filling of soft, buttery chicken and mango chunks. Complement this starter with a basket of Steamed Seafood Dumpling Abalone. The thin, doughy skin breaks apart with a bite before the succulent, briny abalone greets your tastebuds.

Brace your stomach for Hua Ting’s signature Crispy Roasted Duck. Here, the duck fat’s been skillfully rendered off, resulting in a crispy layer of caramelised skin that’s accompanied by tender duck meat. If you prefer something lighter, refresh your palate with the Dong Xing Garoupa Rice. A simmering broth is poured over slices of premium fish, cooking the meat instantly. This comforting dish seals the deal with its crispy rice that adds a crunchy texture to the broth.

Round off your experience at this family-friendly restaurant with the Mango Purée, Pomelo, Sago, and Herbal Jelly, a twist on the familiar Cantonese dessert. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Humpback
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Octopus Terrine, Charred Cabbage, Lemon Scampi Spaghetti, Lemon sole 500gm
data.ABOUT:
The owners of Jigger & Pony and Sugarhall are bringing you the latest and greatest in fresh and breezy seafood dining with Humpback. Hidden away in a charming shophouse on Bukit Pasoh, this Seattle-style seafood haven brings together our love for seafood, tapas, and tempting craft cocktails, creating a spectacular feast for all.
Greeting guests with their trademark raw seafood counter and pails of oysters, the staff at Humpback meticulously source just about everything on the menu for a truly memorable experience. For those who are yearning for something more than just seafood, the "Garden", "Snacks", and "Seasonal" section of the menu are full of delicious options. We love the Charred Cabbage with curd and pine nuts featured in the "Garden" section, and the seemingly random assembly of Octopus Terrine from the "Pantry" section is something we could nibble on all day.
As for the drinks, they've curated 8 signature cocktails to take dining here to the next level. Add in the selection of white wines and champagnes, and there you have it - everything you need for one heck of a night out! (Aug 2015)

data.title: Hutong
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sweet Scented Osmanthus Root with Glutinous Rice, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg, Grilled Premium Beef
data.ABOUT:
Known for its abundance of flavours, Hutong aims to preserve and recreate the different types of traditional Chinese delicacies. Boasting a wide variety of Chinese delights, Hutong’s extensive menu features a host of nutritious and mouthwatering Chinese cuisine. 

A beautiful appetiser to start with is the Sweet Scented Osmanthus Root with Glutinous Rice. Stuffed with sticky glutinous rice and slow-cooked in a sweet broth, children love it for its sweet flavour, while you’ll appreciate its nutritious value. Alternatively, kickstart your meal with the Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg. Crispy and tasty, it’s the ultimate pre-main course choice.

Sweet and salty, the Deep Fried Softshell Crab is accompanied with a side of Mango Salad. The two differing flavour profiles perfectly complement one another, rewarding you with savoury mouthfuls of crunchy crab meat and cucumber. Spice lovers will also be glad to know that Hutong serves up a fiery pot of Mala. 

Treat yourself to the Grilled Premium Beef when you drop by Hutong. Juicy and fragrant, the slices of glistening red meat are speckled with thinly sliced garlic and sesame seeds for extra crunch and flavour. (Oct 2020)

data.title: I am... (Haji Lane)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: I am...Platter, Fries & Mayo, Charcoal-grilled Sloppy Beef Burger, Fish ‘N’ Chips, Soft-Shell Crab Burger, Crayfish Arrabiata & Italian Basil
data.ABOUT:
While traversing through the streets of Amsterdam, Muhamad Jamuri bin Busori fell deeply in love with the city. From its vibrant atmosphere and the beautiful bridges, to the Dutch’s bicycle-oriented lifestyle, he knew that there wouldn’t be anything quite like Amsterdam. Upon returning to sunny Singapore, his love affair led him to start a cafe in 2013 that would be all things Dutch.

Now, the I am… Cafe is serves up amazing cafe grub to a bustling crowd everyday. And in case you were wondering, yes, the name is inspired by Amsterdam’s iconic ‘I amsterdam’ sign. Must-trys include the Dutch-inspired Fries & Mayo, featuring crispy thick-cut fries with a generous helping of rich mayonnaise. If you’re here with a group of friends, go for the I am... Platter, an elaborate showcase of all their starters such as the half-shell mussels, soft-shell crabs, buffalo wings, and many more. The perfectly battered Fish ‘N’ Chips has also garnered considerable fame, so be sure to try it while you’re here. You probably would have seen photos of their homemade cakes on your instagram feed, such as the cafe’s popular Rainbow Cake that’s as delicious as it is insta-worthy. The cake has seven layers, representing the rainbow’s seven colours of course. Top it all off with alcohol-free concoctions like the Virgin Lychee Mojito and the Bushramint, and your day’s made! (Oct 2016)

data.title: IB HQ Singapore
data.Hours: Tue-Fri: 5-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat: 3-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Closed Monday and Sunday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT: If you’re a fan of Kamil Foltan’s (formerly Black Swan, Potato Head and Tippling Club) cocktails, you’ll want to check out IB HQ - The Indigenous Bartender Headquarters. And if you haven’t heard of Foltan, then you should still check out IB HQ anyway. Tucked away above Restaurant JAG along Duxton Road, this stylish 30-seater bar is one for serious cocktail aficionados. Ever heard of parsnip vodka? Foltan mixes it with a luscious Pineapple Caramel for a cocktail named, well, Pi Pa. There’s also a refreshing Pandan-infused whisky, with fig-infused cognac, yellow chartreuse and aromatic bitters. And if you really enjoy Japanese produce, then the Peach & Wasabi Fizz — a strangely delicious combination of London Dry Gin, peach, egg white and wasabi — is a must-try. Check out our bar snacks that are prepared by Restaurant JAG. (Jun 2020)

data.title: IKKI Izakaya
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chashu Sliders, Enoki Mushroom Wrapped with Pork Belly, Stir Fried Ginger Pork Don, Bara Chirashi Don, Chicken Breast Fillet with Spicy Cod Roe, IKKI Maki, Cold Udon Broth with Assorted Tempura, Grapefruit Hi
data.PRESS RELEASE:
IKKI is the little known Japanese incarnation of "bottoms up". The kanji or Chinese letters are extremely apt, literally translating it to "one breath". And at IKKI, lunch is like a battlefield, with the kitchen dishing out lunch set after lunch set, the staff seemingly holding their breath until the whole ordeal is over.
Transitioning to the lull afternoon, IKKI brings their own blend of artisanal coffee with waffles, Japanese style. Known as Mochi Mochi waffles or Mmoffles for short, these Japanese waffles are crispy on the outside and extremely chewy on the inside. The waffles can be paired with salty sweet mitarashi and red bean, or customers can opt for the savoury ham and cheese version.
Night at IKKI is a different affair altogether. The whole place slows down and the menu changes from lunch sets to Yakitori or barbecued skewers, and a plethora of Japanese tapas that allow customers to eat and drink at their leisure. And to keep the festivities going, IKKI features local bands playing from Tuesday to Friday. (Nov 2014)

data.title: Ice Edge Cafe (Kovan)
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 02:30pm), 5:30-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat, Eve of & PH: 11:30am-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sun: 11:30am-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Homemade Gelato, Freshly Made Waffle, Nachos, Fatty Fries, Tom Yum
Seafood Linguine, Giant Chicken Schnitzel
data.ABOUT:
Pizza, Pasta, Gelato – those are the three words prominently displayed underneath Ice Edge Cafe’s marquee. But if you ask us, this cushy little bistro located along Kovan Road offers much more than that. Spinning up incredible, family-friendly nosh in a plush environment, Ice Edge Cafe is the go-to hangout for lazy weekend afternoons spent gabbing over the latest gossip and making new memories with friends, all while sipping on cups of coffee or digging into excellent Western-styled nosh.

With an extensive menu, you won’t find it hard to pick out your new favorite dishes. For heartier fare, be sure to check out the Tom Yam Seafood Linguine. This Asian-inspired dish is made from generous amounts of prawns, squid, clams, and garlic, and is served over a bed of noodles. And of course it wouldn’t be a kid-friendly place without a kid-centric menu with options such as Chicken Cream Spaghetti or the finger-licking Nuggets N’ Chips.

Ice Edge Cafe is known for producing its own small batches of artisan Gelato In-House. We have now created over 60 different flavors. Our Gelato are produced fresh daily using premium grade ingredients. Gelato are typically healthier choice as compared to ice cream. They are denser in flavour & offers fewer calories, lesser sugar & lower fat content per serving than ice cream.

So pack your day with good food and great company, all in the serene setting of Ice Edge Cafe. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Idle @ Infinite Studios
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: BBQ Baby Back Ribs, Beer battered Haddock Sticks, Cheese Baked Oysters
data.PRESS RELEASE:
2019 marks IDLE’s decade-long presence in the F&B industry. Having grown from our humble first shop set up back in 2008 at Dempsey Hill, IDLE now boasts 3 outlets spanning Singapore’s Central, West and East zones.

IDLE was not conceptualized out of idle but created from the idea to provide people with an affordable drinking spot to relax and unwind without burning a hole in their pockets. Pioneering Singapore’s liquid buffet concept, IDLE is proud to be the industry innovator offering a fixed-price drink-all-you-can selection of gin, vodka, rum, bourbon, whiskey, beer, and even cocktails/party drinks/shooters. (May 2019)

data.title: Iggy's
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address:
581 Orchard RoadLevel 3
Hilton Hotel
Singapore (238883)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hokkaido Scallops, Miyazaki Wagyu, Tale of Two Livers, Walnut
data.ABOUT:
Iggy's is an institution in Singapore’s dining scene. With its innovative creations that use only the freshest seasonal produce from Japan and around the world, it’s been consistently earning a Michelin star since 2017. The space is elegant and intimate, with only 38 seats so diners can have the best dining experience.

Behind Iggy’s is Ignatius Chan, a restaurateur and sommelier with over three decades of experience. Working closely with the culinary team, he has designed a menu of modern European dishes that exude Asian flavours to suit the Singaporean palate. He also handpicks labels for Iggy's wine cellar, with a big focus on Burgundy wines.

Both lunch and dinner offer set menus that showcase the chef's picks of the season. Naturally, menu items change regularly according to the ingredients that are available, but for a feel of what to expect, think Hokkaido Scallops with Oscietra Caviar, Vichyssoise and Apple Snow, Miyazaki Wagyu with Green Dragon Vegetable Shishito, and Foie Gras with Chinese Liver Sausage. (Dec 2019)

data.title: In Piazza
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spaghetti alle Vongole, Pasta alla Norma, Costata di Manzo, Pizza Contadina, Pizza in Piazza, Margherita Pizza, Spaghetti alla Carbonara, Bucatini alla Amatriciana
data.ABOUT:
This funky Italian restaurant presents traditional Italian fare in relaxed but hip digs overlooking a lovely green patch of the Stevens Road area. Priding itself on authentic fare, a smoky oven churns out pizzas to order, and these pies have attracted quite a following among in-the-know foodies in the neighbourhood. Choose from a comprehensive menu of practically every pizza flavour known to Man, from a piquant Puglia pie topped with anchovies, kalamata olives, artichokes, and mushrooms to the ubiquitous and controversial Hawaiian. If you’re a purist, stick to classic flavours like Cipolla e Pancetta, a red-sauce pie scattered with crispy pancetta, onions, and melty cheese. 

There’s also pasta dishes that will help fix any Italian craving. Think well-made authentic pasta plates here, none of that watered-down business you tend to find in Italian joints around the city. The Bucatini All’Amatriciana is a heavenly plate of tubular spaghetti tossed in a spicy, porky sauce of tomatoes, cured Guanciale (pork cheek), and tangy pecorino cheese. The Carbonara is a close cousin, made with a cheese and egg sauce instead of tomato, and prepared exactly as it is in Rome, with lashings of spicy rendered lard, black pepper, and no cream whatsoever. Grilled steaks and fish round out the menu, though honestly we think the hefty pizza and pasta plates will keep even the greediest of diners happy. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Indian Curry House (Siglap)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Zafrani Chicken Tikka, Onion Pakoras, Guizaar Tandoori Prawns, Mutton Vindaloo, Kadai Chicken
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Indian Curry House is founded in 2008 by a team of three professionals who have a combined experience of 30 years in Food & Beverage industry.

In 4 years, the brand expanded to 3 outlets in Singapore Expo, Sixth Avenue and Upper Bukit Timah Road, serving the same authentic taste to diners. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Indian House (49 Boat Quay)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Tikka, Tandoori Chicken, Chicken 65, Chilli Prawn
data.ABOUT: If you can’t decide whether you’re in the mood for North or South Indian food, Indian House lets you have the best of all worlds when you’re looking for a taste of India. The menu here spans from curries to tandoor-grilled meats. For starters, take your pick of vegetarian or non-vegetarian options, like the Padi Chaat (vegetarian) or the chicken vindaloo. The latter is a popular Indian dish in the region of Goa, and packs a fiery punch on the spicy scale. For a meatier curry, the mutton korma is another favourite. Cubes of tender lamb meat is swathed in a creamy lightly-spiced sauce, perfect for dipping into with pieces of garlick-y naan. Work off the indulgent dinner after with a stroll along picturesque Boat Quay. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Indigo Blue Kitchen
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Nyonya Poh Piah, Bakwan Kepiting Soup, Satay Babi Lemak, Otak-Otak Jantan, Apom with Two Pengats
data.ABOUT:
Les Amis Group’s expansion through the past 25 years has been guided by a strong passion for food cultures. Today, the group taps into the rich tapestry of Singapore’s culinary heritage by opening Indigo Blue Kitchen. A restaurant serving traditional Peranakan cuisine in a modern setting. 
With an emphasis on recreating distinctive Peranakan flavours of old, Indigo Blue Kitchen is about a family’s food heritage. The concept is anchored by Les Amis Group Chairman, Desmond Lim’s food memories of growing up in a true blue Peranakan household in the 1960s, and is a personal tribute to his grandmother. The restaurant is an open invitation for one and all to rediscover the flavours of a bygone era and is also a platform for the continuation of a family’s culinary legacy. (May 2019)

data.title: Indline Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fish Head Curry, Zafrani Chicken Tikka, Lamb Chops, Mam Mia Mutton, Garlic Naan, Peshwari Naan, Non-Veg Kebab Platter
data.ABOUT:
A quick-service Indian eatery located along Keong Saik Road, Indline is a sleek and modern eatery that serves up contemporary Indian fare in a comfortable environment. 

It’s easy to get overwhelmed when flipping through the numerous pages of this eatery’s menu. But rest assured that you’re guaranteed a great menu no matter which dish you decide to go with. Staples, such as Paneer Tikka made from cottage cheese cubes marinated in spices and roasted in the tandoor, are not to be missed. Fans of seafood would appreciate the evergreen Mahcli Tikka, featuring grilled dory fish brightened with a dash of lemon juice. The gold standard for any good Indian restaurant is in the vegetarian dishes, which are thankfully outstanding here. Dig into the creamy chickpea-based Chana Masala, cooked in a Punjabi-style sauce, or the Dal Makhani, where lentils are painstakingly simmered overnight in a mix of fragrant spices and herbs. Then wash your meal down with one of the four flavoured lassi drinks, the Rose Lassi being our go-to pick. 

Whether you’re in a hurry or want to slow down and savour a gut-busting meal, Indline consistently is our pick for a great meal that won’t cost too much money. (Jun 2017)

data.title: IndoChine (Chijmes)
data.Cuisine: Bar, Thai, Vietnamese, Fusion, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Garlic and Pepper Poached Prime Beef, Grilled Lemongrass Chicken of Savannakhet, Pomelo & Tiger Prawn Salad, Indochine Platter
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in the gorgeous and historic CHIJMES, this unique restaurant offers a peek into the lesser-known facets of Indo-Chinese cuisine. Forget Ayam Penyet and Mee Soto — Indo-Chinese cuisine combines the delicate flavours of Chinese cuisine with uniquely Southeast Asian ingredients like Tiger Prawns and Lemongrass. With a stunning wood-panelled interior reminiscent of the temples of Bali, this spot is sure to wow guests from the moment they walk in.
Start by whetting your appetite with a light salad. The Pomelo & Tiger Prawn Salad is an excellent option. This unlikely yet tasty combination works wonders, due to the contrasting flavours of the seafood and fruit balancing one another out. The Grilled Lemongrass Chicken of Savannakhet is another must-try. The lemongrass gives this dish its mouthwatering fragrance, while the grilling process gives the chicken a smoky flavour while sealing in the juices of the meat. Meat lovers are sure to love the Garlic and Pepper Poached Prime Beef. Cooked with earthy garlic and searing pepper, this dish is fiery and not for the faint of heart. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Indocafe - The White House
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kueh Pie Tee, Otah Klasik, Organic Ayam Buah Keluak, Wagyu Beef Rendang, Sayur Lodeh, Chendol Panna Cotta, Bubur Cha Cha
data.ABOUT:
Indocafe's grand black-and-white compound is a historic remnant of Singapore's past, so it's only fitting the cuisine boasts equal cultural significance. In an interior done up to look like a warm dining room - parquet floors, Peranakan antiques, and cosy lighting - orders are brought to your table with little fanfare, confident in their authentic flavours and contemporary touches.
Fundamental Nyonya techniques, classic recipes, and fresh spices, pounded together using the tried-and-true pestle and mortar method, result in fragrant traditional offerings like Kueh Pie Tee (crisp pastry cups filled with shredded turnip, served with prawns, crabmeat, and homemade chili dip), Ngoh Hiang (homemade five-spiced pork meat roll wrapped in soy bean curd skin and deep fried), and Organic Ayam Buah Keluak (braised organic chicken with black nut and exotic spices).
That's not to say that Indocafe is stuck in the past though; little tweaks to suit modern tastes are a constant feature in their menu. Feast on dishes such as the Otah Klasik (steamed 'Chawanmushi' egg custard with fish fillet, seasoned with coconut milk, and a special blend of herb and spices) and Chendol Panna Cotta, both great examples of when past and present collide.
Once you're done tasting a slice of Singapore's heritage, don’t forget to trot over to their Arts & Cultural Central where a little coffee appreciation and afternoon performance might go a long way! (Apr 2016)

data.title: Indulge Teppanyaki & Grill
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Indulge Bowl, Grilled Cajun Chicken Breast, Pan Seared Scallop Soba, Mixed Grill
data.ABOUT:
Well-known for serving traditional Western food in a fusion style, Indulge Teppanyaki and Grill House menu boasts a variety of classic Japanese favourites with a delicious twist. Health-conscious diners are also in for a treat with the restaurant’s soba and salad options that offer Steak, Salmon and Grilled Chicken Chop as toppings. For those who love to mix things up, you can create your own pasta with your choice of protein and sauce.

The Indulge Bowl is the star of the show. A custom bowl filled with fluffy short grain rice, customise your dining experience with your own pick of tasty toppings such as Chicken Cutlet with Nacho cheese, Clams with Hae Bee Hiam or the Truffle Mushroom.

Other affordable one-dish meal options include the Grilled Salmon Fillet, Grilled Cajun Chicken Breast, Pan Seared Scallop Soba, and more! Enjoy a little bit of everything on the menu with the restaurant's Mixed Grill. Featuring a generous serving of chicken chop, striploin steak, tiger prawn and fresh scallops, this mouthwatering mix of meat options is every meat lover’s dream come true. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Ippoh Tempura Bar
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tsuki Set, Sesame Tofu with Sea Urchin, Shrimp Toast, Anago Fish, Seasonal Fruit from Japan
data.ABOUT:
The wait is over. Hailing from Osaka, the highly-exalted tempura restaurant, Ippoh, has finally set up shop on our sunny shores. Loved by gourmands for turning what is assumed to be a simple deep-fried dish into an art form, Ippoh will now introduce Singaporeans to its perfectly-cooked tempura with Ippoh Tempura Bar by Ginza Ippoh. 

Based in the sleek and stylish COMO Dempsey compound,  Ippoh Tempura Bar serves a handful of small appetisers and tempura dishes guaranteed to astound and dazzle. The secret to these exquisite nibbles is in the restaurant’s use of fresh and premium ingredients, such as top-quality safflower oil. Furthermore, the chefs painstakingly fry each piece of tempura individually to ensure that the oil at the optimal temperature so that the tempura attains its crispy golden layer. 

With a small seating capacity of 18, including a 12-seat tempura bar, dining at Ippoh Tempura Bar by Ginza Ippoh promises to be an intimate affair with its warm, personalised service. While an a la carte menu is available, we prefer the lunch and dinner set menus, which feature varying amounts of tempura, pickles, and rice. A selection of sakes, wines, and beers are also on-hand to complement a dining experience you won’t forget. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Issho Izakaya (Great World City)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 1 Kim Seng Promenade#01-123Great World CitySingapore (237994)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Carpaccio, Crab Zosui Nabeyaki, Crab Dou Special, Kushiyaki Tebasaki, Buta Tomato and Foie Gras, Warabi Mochi, Sake, Shochu, Wine
data.ABOUT:
If you find yourself craving Japanese food while shopping, make a beeline for issho izakaya. This modern Japanese outfit has something for everyone. For starters, try the Truffle Carpaccio or a comforting pot of Crab Zosui Nabeyaki, a Japanese porridge prepared with crab broth made by painstakingly simmering premium live crabs for hours. The result is a silky porridge that is sweet, boasting a delicious smoky flavour. 
Do check with our friendly staff for our seasonal fishes for the best cuts of sushi and sashimi which changes regularly. 
Being an izakaya, we are proud to have over 100 unique labels of sakes, shochu, wines and beer. Which are perfect for pairing with our live station – Kushiyaki skewers. Our crowd favourites skewers – Tebasaki (chicken wings), Buta Tomato (bacon-wrapped cherry tomato), Wagyu beef and much more perfectly grilled kushiyaki selection!

For a sweet treat, snack on some Warabi Mochi. The all-time favourite Japanese dessert is coated in slightly bitter matcha powder, served with Japanese black honey on the side. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Isuramuya Japanese Restaurant and Marketplace
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chawanmushi, Deep Fry Edamame Stick, Sashimi Moriawase, Salmon Mentai
data.ABOUT:
Looking for a Muslim-friendly Japanese restaurant? This restaurant cum marketplace offers some of the most popular Japanese dishes made with Halal and premium imported ingredients. From Norwegian Salmon Sashimi to Japanese Tuna that melts in the mouth from the first bite, there’s something for everyone.

Kick things off with the traditional Japanese steamed egg, Chawanmushi. This savoury egg is packed with umami flavour and served piping hot — the perfect pick-me-up on a rainy day. Prefer a plant-based starter? You can’t go wrong with the Deep Fry Edamame Stick, which consists of breaded beans deep fried to crisp perfection. The lovely earthy flavours of the edamame itself make this an addictive starter. Get the best of sashimi on offer with the Sashimi Moriawase platter, a combination of Hamachi, Ikura, Salmon, and more. Prefer sushi? There is a variety of delicious Nigiri options available as well, from the regular Inari, to Salmon Mentai, which sees sushi rice topped with seared salmon and a unique mentaiko sauce.  (Oct 2019)

data.title: Izakaya Hikari
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hiyayakko Tofu, Sashimi Platter, Chicken Karaage, Surume Ika
data.ABOUT:
An affordable and authentic Japanese restaurant, Izakaya Hikari offers a huge variety of Japanese food, from appetizers to the well loved sashimi and donburi bowls.

Start with a small bowl of Edamame. Seasoned with salt and pepper, the beans are extremely flavourful. The Hiyayakko Tofu is also a popular appetizers. Served cold and garnished with spring onions, this dish is refreshingly tasty. The Sashimi Platter consists of  five different kinds of sashimi, including Aka Ebi, Hotate, Salmon, Hamachi and Maguro. For grilled meats, the Yakimono Set combines the restaurant's signature skewers onto one scrumptious platter. 

Still hungry? Try the Kawa Ebi or Chicken Karaage. Satisfyingly crunchy, these fried dishes are sure to fill you up! Last but not least, order the Surume Ika. Lightly grilled, the squid has a smoky charred taste that packs a punch of flavour. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Izakaya Shun
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Charcoal Grilled Sea Eel from Nagasaki, Grilled Half-Dried Mackarel, Lightly Roasted Wagyu Beef Salad, Marinated Kagoshima Bluefin Tuna with Mustard
data.ABOUT:
This cosy spot is the sister of Kappo Shashui next door, and is a veteran of Tokyo’s Bib Gourmand list, having been featured on it from 2015 to 2017. Seating only 28 people, this is one place where a reservation is essential. With a kitchen led by chef Issey Araki, who was the sous chef at Kappo Shunsui, you can rest assured that you are in good hands. Start with the Lightly Roasted Wagyu Beef Salad, a light dish of crisp greens tossed with buttery chunks of beef. Prefer something a little heartier? The Crispy Deep Fried Chicken is a great option for diners looking for a delicious starter. Hot and crunchy on the outside, tender on the inside, this is the perfect way to whet your appetite before savouring the rest of the menu.

Brave diners have the option to leave their meal in the hands of the talented chefs here with the Omakase menu. From starters to desserts, the chefs will take you on a culinary journey throughout Japan, with mouthwatering dishes from land and sea, like the Giant Unagi Sushi, and Charcoal Grilled Kumamoto Kuroe-Wagyu Sirloin. Pair your meal with a traditional Japanese sake - the extensive options available here will leave you spoiled for choice. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Izy Fook
data.Cuisine: Bar, Local, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hangover Stew, Madai Coconut Ceviche, Sakura Pork Ribs (Khao Kha Moo), Iberico Red Curry, Tiger Prawn Ramen
data.PRESS RELEASE:
IZY was an urban contemporary Izakaya Bar serving quality Japanese fare to young working professionals on Club Street. In her 2019 revamp, IZY FOOK aims to provide top Singaporean dishes alongside key Cantonese delights in a newly renovated space that’s edgy and bold – a cool new hangout spot. 
Together, IZY FOOK (一起福), that cheekily translates to “together, let’s prosper” is a hip Japanese kitchen inspired by old school Singapore Cantonese restaurants and the energy of late night Chinatown watering holes back in 1970s Singapore. IZY FOOK takes a creative approach towards incorporating roasted and charred Cantonese meats into quality, classic Izakaya dishes. (Jul 2019)

data.title: J Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.ABOUT:
Step away from the usual Shenton Way watering holes and give this hidden gem a shot. Whether you want to enjoy sunset skyline views or lounge on sleek upholstery, this bar in M Hotel Singapore is the place to go. 

Boasting a live band, visitors can expect soothing tunes all night long as they relax and unwind from the hustle and bustle of daily life. With pocket-friendly promotions such as free-flow champagne during ladies’ night among others, J Bar is one place for post-work drinks that won’t burn a hole in your pocket. (March 2019)

data.ABOUT: J65 features the freshest seafood on ice and a range of multicultural cuisine of Singapore as well as signature home-style dishes. With buffet themes specially curated by our talented chefs in an open kitchen, take a look at mouth-watering dishes being crafted. Here, there’s something for every occasion and celebration. (Jul 2019)

data.title: JTSH Cafe
data.Cuisine: American, Vegetarian Friendly, Halal Certified, Cafe, Pizza
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Laksa Prawn Claypot Pasta, Chicken Spaghetti Goreng, Wagyu Beef Burger, Chicken Waffle Burger, Seafood/Hawaiian Half-and-Half Pizza.
data.PRESS RELEASE: Formerly known as DC Super Heroes Cafe, as operated by JT Network, JTSH Cafe continues the food experience of delectable Western, Asian-fusion and local inspired fare. JTSH stands for JT’s Singapore Homemade. It represents an inventive take of what exactly makes a dish local in cosmopolitan Singapore. Fusions such as Laksa Prawn Claypot Pasta and Chicken Spaghetti Goreng, have proven to be hits at the cafe. Discover burgers, pastas, rice dishes and Asian fusion food at JTSH Cafe. (Dec 2020)

data.title: JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.PRESS RELEASE:
JUMBO Seafood, one of Singapore's most recognizable home-grown brands, has over the years built its name on quality seafood at reasonable prices. This has earned it a name as one of the must-go places for its famous Chili Crab amongst locals and tourists alike. However, it should be noted that JUMBO is famous for so much more than just its award-winning Chili Crab. Some of its other signature dishes include Fried Prawns with Cereal, Crispy Baby Squid and Golden Egg Salted Prawns.
Having built a name and an excellent reputation, JUMBO has since expanded with numerous outlets dotted across the island. Moreover, each outlet has its own distinctive menu in addition to the brand's signature dishes. It is little wonder that customers are encouraged to make reservations, or as Singaporeans would say, "CHOPE" seats before heading down, especially on Fridays and the weekends.
If there is anything that should be remembered about JUMBO Seafood, it should be its consistent quality, excellent service and undeniably fresh seafood. (Apr 2013)

data.title: JW360 Suju Masayuki Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gindara Misozuke Yaki, Torimomo Kurozu Itame, Hamburg Steak, Mixed Katsu
data.ABOUT:
Short for Japan Way Three Sixty, JW360 Suju Masayuki Japanese Restaurant aims to establish a gateway to Japan’s lifestyle and culture through food and retail.

Diners can look forward to the restaurant’s four seasonal concepts that boasts traditional Japanese methods of cooking. Glazed with a sweet miso sauce, the Gindara Misozuke Yaki is a signature dish made of grilled cod fish marinated in a homemade miso sauce. Moist and tender, the sweet codfish gives a subtly satisfying smoky aroma with every bite. 

An aesthetically pleasing dish is the Torimomo Kurozu Itame. Featuring a medley of eggplant, chilli corn and chicken well seasoned in a light but tangy vinegar sauce, this fried chicken dish is one of the best sellers at JW360 Suju Masayuki Japanese Restaurant. Meat lovers should not leave without trying the Hamburg Steak. Drenched in cheese and demi-glaze sauce, sink your teeth into firm and succulent meat for a wonderful one-dish meal.

Using Japanese ingredients, JW360 Suju Masayuki Japanese Restaurant promises decadent sweet treats that will end your meal on a delicious note. Make sure you check out the retail corner for the tastiest snacks and souvenirs before you leave. (Aug 2020)

data.title: JYPSY Martin Road
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Obasan’s Sticky Beef Sliders, Jypsy Sashimi, Classic Sashimi, Nest Of Fries, Green Tea Noodle Salad
data.ABOUT:
Brought to you by the people behind PS Cafe, this lovely spot on Martin Road is the perfect place for weekend brunches and romantic dinner dates. Boasting a menu bursting with remakes of Japanese classics crafted with fresh produce, this cafe is your go-to place for food, friends, and fun times.

The menu here consists of classic cafe fare with a Japanese twist. Try the Nest Of Fries - crispy shredded potatoes served with wasabi mayo and teriyaki balsamic sauce. The condiments are the true highlight of this dish - they give it a tangy, briny flavour that pairs perfectly with the warm crispness of the fries. Obasan’s Sticky Beef Sliders are another crowd favourite, and for good reason- a saucy slider made with juicy wagyu beef and crispy cabbage encased in pillowy soft buttered brioche. 

It wouldn’t be a Japan-inspired cafe without some traditional fare. Feast your eyes and taste buds on the excellent Classic Sashimi - made of fresh fish flown from Japan served with nama wasabi - made from authentic paste, not powder - and shoyu. Diners looking for something unique will love the Jypsy Sashimi - available in Bluefin Tuna, King Salmon, Yellowtail, and Swordfish Belly, and served with inimitable condiments like lime mayo and yuzu-coriander miso. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Jade
data.Hours: À La Carte and Set Menu:Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6:30-10:30pmSat-Sun: 6:30-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Weekend Yum ChaSat-Sun & PH: 10:30am-12:30pm, 1:30-3:30pm
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crystal Shrimp Dumplings, Abalone Siew Mai, Xiao Long Bao with Foie Gras, Braised Bird’s Nest with Truffle Egg White in Superior Broth, Braised Sweet Corn Soup with Minced Chicken, Braised Egg Noodle with Boston Lobster, Peking Duck, Pan-fried Lamb Ribs, Beef Ball with Sun-dried Orange Peel, Taro Paste wrapped with Truffle and Mushroom
data.ABOUT:
For 11 years, Jade restaurant has offered diners an authentic Cantonese cuisine of exceptional quality and hospitality of unforgettable warmth, amply earning for itself the revered reputation of its precious gemstone namesake. With its revamp in 2017, the restaurant upped the ante by unveiling a more focused culinary direction by Executive Chinese Chef Leong Chee Yeng and new interiors, enhancing the dining experience for connoisseurs.

 

The 120-seat establishment, featuring two private rooms and two partitioned areas, is beautifully appointed in a colour palette reflecting the lustre of jade, specially commissioned wallpaper and evocative overhead lantern lighting among other exquisite design elements. Housed within the historic and beautifully conserved The Fullerton Hotel Singapore, itself a national treasure, Jade restaurant represents a fusion of heritage, design, culture, and exquisite dining that is unique to the Singapore culinary scene.

 

In line with government regulations, please note that the sale and consumption of alcohol in all food and beverage establishments are prohibited after 10.30 p.m. daily.

 

The safety and well-being of our guests and team members are our top priority at The Fullerton Hotels and Resorts. We have set up rigorous cleanliness practices and safe distancing measures at our restaurants to ensure that you can experience an enhanced level of protection.(Jul 2020)

data.title: Jag Wine
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jag’s Chicken Wings, Crispy Soft Shell Crab, Crab Meat Pasta, Filet Mignon, Baked Mussels, Sausage Platter, Molten Lava Cake with Ice Cream, Creamy Avocado with Ice Cream, Steak Bites with Blue Cheese Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Sit back and relax at Jag Wine, where good food and drink come hand in hand to make for a winning combination. With its wood-finished walls and candlelit tables, this classy establishment is a good place to go for a corporate event, a romantic night out, or, well, a great meal.

Have a go at one of the tapas dishes – the Crispy Soft Shell Crab will prove highly addictive as you crunch on each tasty mouthful. The Steak Bites with Blue Cheese Sauce is another (rather decadent) option, where sirloin cubes are accompanied by fragrant helpings of blue cheese sauce for a mouthwatering, unforgettable dish. If you’re hankering for a hearty plate of pasta, you can’t go wrong with the Crab Meat Pasta, where angel hair is topped with chunks of flavourful crab meat, mixed bell peppers, and red onion – it might sound like a fairly basic combination, but it works.

Few meals are complete without a dessert to top everything off, so why not take a stab at the Molten Lava Cake with Ice Cream? Its nuanced, bittersweet taste will serve as the perfect denouement to your meal, and it’s a take on the popular dessert that’ll be as good as you’ve ever tasted. So head down to Jag Wine sometime soon for a good meal, a nice wine, and a great dining experience that’s hard to beat. (Apr 2017)

data.title: Jamie's Italian (Forum)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 583 Orchard Road#01-01/04Forum The Shopping MallSingapore (238884)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crostini Selection, Crispy Squid, Crispy Mushroom Fritti, Ultimate Garlic Bread, Gennaro’s Tagliatelle Bolognese, Risotto of Wild Mushrooms, Penne Carbonara, 280g Rib-eye Steak, Seared Tuna, JI Chicken Caesar, Funghi Misti, The Parma, Tiramisu, Creamy Panna Cotta, Molten Chocolate Praline Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Whether you're a foodie or not, you know that Jamie Oliver is synonymous with uncompromisingly fresh, sustainably sourced and whole foods cooking, so you’ll be glad to know that know his delicious dishes are also available at the Forum!Without compromising the taste or quality originally adored from the VivoCity location,  diners can enjoy an array of sensational nibbles from cured meats to seasonal vegetables as well as savour mains such as a juicy 220g Rump Steak, Chicken Al Mattone, or a mushroom-laden Funghi Pizza. Their handmade pastas are other surefire winners, packed full with flavour and boasting the right amount of chewiness whilst abiding by the unrelenting freshness of country ingredients.
So whether you’re a big fan or a newfound follower of Jamie Oliver and the VivoCity outlet, head over to the Forum for the same quality with a new and refreshing setup. (Aug 2015)

data.title: Jekyll & Hyde
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Char Kuay Teow, Peach Please!, Chili Crab Nachos, OG B&B, PB &J, Kurobuta Carrot Cake, Mr Hyde's Satay
data.ABOUT:
Established in August 2013, Jekyll & Hyde is a whimsical cocktail bar located in the heart of Singapore. Started as a nail parlour by day and speakeasy by night, we've come a long way since, and we are proud to be known as one of Singapore's pioneer cocktail bars today. Graduating from a curation of cocktails inspired by unique Singapore flavours, our current edition by Head Bartender, Michael Foong,  focuses on twists of classic cocktails, while incorporating funky food ingredients found in everyday life. Discover flavours like bacon, peanut butter, bananas and exotic spices, as your tastebuds take flight through our collection of signature cocktails.

Chef Alvin Tan, formerly head chef at Shanghai Dolly and Straits Clan now heads up our kitchen. At Jekyll & Hyde, we are pairing our cocktails with Modern Singapore cuisine, taking your experience at Jekyll & Hyde to new heights - elevating local cuisine and creating a new dimension and perspective to our childhood favourites. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Jia He Chinese Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 1 Farrer Park Station Road#01-14/15/16One Farrer Hotel ConnexionSingapore (217562)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steamed Xiao Long Bao with Bak Kut Teh, Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, Peking Duck, Deep-fried Sesame Ball with Durian, Deep-fried Yam Dumplings with Minced Meat
data.ABOUT:
Featuring both classic Chinese delicacies and contemporary creations for everyone to enjoy, Jia He Chinese Restaurant sets the table for a life well lived by encouraging strong familial bonds over a delicious meal. 

Begin your feast with an impressive selection of masterfully crafted Dim Sum offerings. Made with premium herbs and spices, the Steamed Xiao Long Bao with Bak Kut Teh is a comfortingly tasty dish where the peppery and garlicky Bak Kut Teh is the star. A truly innovative fusion dish, beetroot juice is used to turn the dumplings into a lovely shade of pink, making this dish extra classy. Other dishes that come highly recommended include the Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, Steamed Phoenix Prawn Siew Mai and Deep-fried Yam Dumplings with Minced Meat. 

Don’t leave without ordering the restaurant’s famous Peking Duck. The highlight of many Chinese dinners, Jia He Chinese Restaurant brings you an exquisite Peking Duck experience with the traditional accompaniments of cucumber, spring onion and a dash of plum sauce for a decadent mouthful. End your meal on a sweet note with the Deep-fried Sesame Ball with Durian. Another interesting combination, this sweet treat is sure to leave you coming back for more! (Aug 2020)

data.title: Jia He Xing Dumpling 嘉合兴
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Boiled Joyful Three Delicacies Dumplings, Boiled Pork and Chive Dumplings, Chicken and Fragrant Mushrooms with Rice, Chilled Glutinous Rice Roll
data.ABOUT:
Known for their made-to-order boiled dumplings and signature noodles, Jia He Xing is an authentic dumpling restaurant established in 1998. 

Offering a wide choice of main courses, appetizers and beverages, the restaurant prides themselves on serving freshly prepared dishes. Made to order, delicious dumpling choices include the Boiled Joyful Three Delicacies Dumplings, Boiled Pork and Chive Dumplings, as well as Vegetarian Dumplings. Order the Chicken and Fragrant Mushrooms with Rice with a basket of dumplings for a satisfying meal. Fried together with tender pieces of chicken, the mushrooms add an earthy flavour to the dish.

Sweet and glutinous, the Chilled Glutinous Rice Roll consists of yummy red bean paste topped with grated nuts. A traditional Beijing snack, the rice roll is a sweet end to your meal. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Jia Wei Chinese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chef Special Ocean Gems Vermicelli in Opeh Leaf, Peking Duck, Chilled Homemade Coconut Pudding with Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
It is not just food but the rich history and innovation connected to it that comes to life with each tantalising bite. That is the Jia Wei promise. To present Chinese cuisine that honours the rich traditions of taste and authentic family recipes, hints to the contemporary and sparks personal conversations with your palette.

 

We are pleased to see this promise come alive in our new menu, a gastronomic delight with a selection of true-blue Chinese classics and modern creations built upon traditional recipes.

 

New dishes to try : Crispy local farm soft shell crab with Yuzu Dressing, Poached corn-fed chicken with creamy spicy sauce, baked local farm barramundi fillet with chef’s honey pineapple sauce, crispy deep ocean prawn with creamy butternut sauce, crispy sea cucumber stuffed with minced prawn in abalone sauce. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Jiak Modern Tzechar (Esplanade)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fish Head Curry, Prawn Paste Chicken, Sambal Kangkong, Broccoli With Scallop, Oats Sotong
data.ABOUT:
It’s hard enough to find an authentic Chinese restaurant that is also halal, much less one that serves up traditional and tasty Tzechar dishes. This lovely spot serves up Muslim-friendly dishes that are so delicious, you wouldn’t even know they are pork-free!

Treat yourself to some crispy Prawn Paste Chicken - delicious, non-greasy and the perfect dish to start off with. The vegetable dishes are nothing to turn your nose up at either. We love the Sambal Kangkong for its homemade taste and spice, and the Broccoli with Scallop for its rich, briny flavour and generous helping of seafood.


While these dishes are definitely delicious, Jiak’s claim to fame is their Fish Head Curry. The curry is aromatic and spicy, but it is the fish that is the true highlight of the dish. The fish absorbs the spices from the curry and is cooked till tender - the meat is so soft, you can cut it with a fork! Pair this dish with some steamed rice for the perfect midday meal. (Nov 2018)
