data.title: Jiang-Nan Chun Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 190 Orchard BoulevardLevel 2Four Seasons Hotel SingaporeSingapore (248646)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Peking Duck, Dragon Tiger Garoupa, Sea Whelk, Maka, Dried Scallops & Pork Ribs Soup, Steamed Scallop Dumpling with Crab Meat & Shrimp, Baked Flaky Pastry with Smoked Ham
data.ABOUT:
Making the luxurious Four Seasons its home, the equally majestic Jiang-Nan Chun consistently wows diners with their exquisite, award-winning gastronomy. Head up a flight of marble stairs and you will find yourself at a regal labyrinth with opulent furnishings - think intricately carved wood, plush leather couches, and handsome carpets - fit for an emperor's palace.
Enjoy some top-notch Cantonese fare here, including chef-crafted dim sums, double-boiled soups, and Jiang-Nan Chun's signature Peking Duck roasted in a mesquite wood-fired oven and served with caviar. This traditional technique roasts the skin to a satisfying crisp while keeping the duck meat juicy and succulent; take a little dollop of caviar with the red meat to elevate the dish with a subtle sweet-salty aftertaste.
Gorgeous double-boiled soups such as the Hot & Sour Soup with Lobster or the signature Sea Whelk, Maka, Dried Scallops & Pork Ribs Soup are not to be missed either: wholesome ingredients are boiled for more than 15 hours to make soups that are rich, sweet, and highly nutritious. Other highlights include exquisite dim sum favourites such as the Steamed Scallop Dumpling with Crab Meat & Shrimp and the Baked Flaky Pastry with Smoked Ham, along with live seafood dishes such as the impeccably fresh Live Prawns and Dragon Tiger Garoupa.
With a bevy of lavish eats to choose from, one visit to Jiang-Nan Chun is definitely not enough! (Sep 2017)

data.title: Jigger & Pony
data.Good For: Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Rendang Rice Box, Bamboo Chicken Rice Box, Bikini Sandwich, Mineral Vodka Soda, Crystal Ramos Gin Fizz, Cacao Pulp SourMore
data.ABOUT:
Jigger & Pony set the bar — literally — for craft cocktails in 2012, when they opened their doors at Amoy Street. Now located in Amara Singapore hotel, Jigger & Pony continues to shake up delicious cocktails with interesting ingredients. Pick up a copy of their unique magazine-style menu, and flip through the pages of witty copy and beautiful pictures to choose from the bar’s signature and innovating cocktails.

The section on Basic Bubbles are back, for instance, showcases cocktails going back to basic: Highballs. Vodka Sodas. Gin & Sonics. The higher level of craft we reach, the more we feel the need to strip it all back to basics. There’s Whisky Highball and what’s make it special is that Hokkaido super soft water (maewari) is mixed with whisky, creating a softer blend. Or be adventurous with the Cacao Pulp Sour, the Kindred Spirits section where cocktails are in collaboration with local chocolate maker, Fossa Chocolate.

The nosh to go with your craft cocktails is equally delicious with their On the High Rice pop-up edition, featuring speciality local inspired rice box series such as Beef Rendang rice box. Cosy up in the teal blue booths or sink into the velvet chairs, and relax with a good cocktail and delicious food. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Jim Thompson Thai Restaurant and Wine Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Poh Pia Gai, Thod Man Pla, Yam Ma-Moung, Larb Gai, Tom Yam Talay, Gayeng Mussaman Neau, Khao Phad Graprow Gai, Phad Thai Goong Sod Rue Gai, Goong Oob Mor Din, Rad Prik, Phad Bak Boong Fai Dang, Som-Chun
data.ABOUT:
A legendary oasis for those yearning for a bit of an escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life, Jim Thompson offers exciting Thai cuisine in a stunning British colonial barrack in Dempsey Hill. Bringing together rave-worthy dishes in a heritage venue with such a rich history - this is one of our favourite places for a Thai escape.
We can’t stop raving about the spacious restaurant venue, itself. The clever layout and wide pillars looming throughout the room make the dining experience more intimate, while the modern furniture evokes a sense of grandeur.
However, what’s most impressive about Jim Thompson is their menu. With over 80 classic Thai dishes on the menu, it’s safe to say diners are spoilt for choice. From the crispy Poh Pia Gai to the fiery Khao Phad Graprow Gai (it’s got two chilli peppers next to the dish name on the menu so expect to be sweating) and the refreshing Som-Chun with orange, lychees, and shredded mango - this spot guarantees a delightful foodie-approved journey from beginning to end! (Nov 2015)

data.title: Jimoto Dining
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pitan Tofu, Tuna Katsu Tataki With Ponzu Sauce, Yuzu Sorbet, Saito Junmai Ginjo Genshu
data.ABOUT:
Jimoto Dining presents an authentic Japanese omakase experience. Touted as the best omakase restaurant in the Joo Chiat neighbourhood, the restaurant serves their omakase over the counter, presenting you with a wonderful opportunity to see the expert chefs at work.

A nice wake-me-up after a day at work, the ice-cold  Saito Karakuchi is a smooth, crisp house pour sake that is moderately sweet. Pair it with the Pitan Tofu, a go-to appetiser at Jimoto Dining. Sitting in a housemade sauce of sake, mirin and shoyu, the silken tofu is served cold. To go with the rest of the meal, order a bottle of Saito Junmai Ginjo Genshu. Boasting robust and tangy flavours, it complements the meal perfectly.

 Start off with Sashimi Platter, which consists of lightly torched kurodai, yellowtail and tachiuo. Move on to the Tuna Katsu Tataki With Ponzu Sauce, which is a harmonious bite of meat and fatty tuna. End the meal on a sweet note with the restaurant’s refreshing Yuzu Sorbet. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Jin Fine Dining
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Omakase, Maitake Truffles with Foie Gras Tofu, Kuruma Ebi Tempura, Tofu Cheese Cake
data.ABOUT:
Situated along Telok Ayer Street, Jin Fine Dining is dedicated to serving up delicious and authentic Japanese cuisine that’s great for your next omakase lunch or dinner. Marrying Japanese culinary techniques with fresh air-flown ingredients, get ready to be transported to Japan by their extensive menu of multiple omakase, lunch and premium set meals on offer.

Helmed by chef Ray Phun, the restaurant’s Classic Omakase is a great meal option that introduces you to a variety of sushi. Start with an exquisite plate of five kinds of Sashimi before moving on to interesting combinations such as the Maitake Truffles with Foie Gras Tofu. Finish off your delightful omakase experience with a soothing bowl of Asari Somen.

Desserts are delightful too. An interesting take on the traditional cheesecake, the restaurant serves up Tofu Cheese Cake and Sasa Custard which ends the meal on a refreshingly sweet note. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Jinjo
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yaki Goma Tofu, Ankimo, Nodoguro, Truffle Donabe, Jinjo Warabimochi
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Opened in April 2018, Jinjo is a modern Japanese sumiyaki restaurant by the Les Amis Group that focuses on the Japanese art of grilling.
Japanese charcoal-grilling mastery is celebrated through a prefecture focused menu where prime seasonal ingredients are sourced from all the Japan, just so that guests get the best flavours of the season. Cooked over charcoal, these ingredients are imbued with a delicious smokiness and transformed into delectable dishes.
Complementing the dining experience sits carefully curated sake menu, which is also prefecture focused and selected to match the taste profile of Jinjo’s sumiyaki items. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Joo Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Joo Calamari, Dak Kang Jung, Joo Bossam, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
Touted as Singapore’s first Makgeolli bar and restaurant, Joo Bar is conveniently located along Tan Quee Lan Street within a three-storey heritage shophouse. Offering top notch Korean bites and creative drinks in a cosy, laid-back environment, Joo Bar is the place to recharge, rejuvenate and re-energise after a long day at work.

Featuring an array of quintessential Korean dishes with a twist, a huge crowd favourite is the Joo Calamari. Served with lime, the accompanying kimchi tartar sauce is made from Joo Bar’s signature in-house recipe, adding a delightful kick when eaten with the crispy squid rings. For those who love chicken, the Dak Kang Jung is a fiery dish that is sure to blow you away! A tantalising mix of chicken tenders, spring onion, tteokbokki, and honey butter glaze, this flaming dish is a unique spin on a usually sweet and savoury dish set to delight your taste buds. 

Another highly recommended dish is the Joo Bossam. Braised pork belly is the star of the dish, with its flavours further enhanced by a side of spicy radish salad and white yucha kimchi. (Jul 2020)

data.title: Jun BBQ & Beer
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Bulgogi Seoksoe Hanpan, Makgeolli, Sujeonggwa
data.ABOUT:
Jun BBQ and Beer has a homely and relaxed atmosphere and is committed to serving dinners affordable and high-quality Korean food.

Lovers of Korean barbeque are in for a treat. Beef-lovers, try the Galbisal Seoksoe Hanpan, a charcoal-grilled beef rib, cooked to perfection and deliciously tender. Alternatively, the Beef Bulgogi Seoksoe Hanpan is marinated in a mix of soy sauce, brown sugar and a variety of spices. The meat’s flavours are then enhanced by the smoking over the grill.

Beyond barbeque, try the entrees, including the Budae Jjigae Hot Pot. A hearty dish with flavourful umami broth with thick sausages, juicy dumplings, luncheon meat, vegetables and ramyeon. It is sure to satisfy even the biggest eaters. 

And be sure not to miss the fantastic variety of drinks which includes K-favourites Makgeolli, Soju and Hite Beer. Non-alcoholic beverages include Sikhye, made of malt and rice and Sujeonggwa, a punch made with ginger and cinnamon sticks. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Junior The Pocket Bar
data.Good For: Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 6 Ann Siang Hill Road Singapore (069787)                                                Map
data.PRESS RELEASE: Meet Junior the Pocket Bar. Junior is a platform to showcase our most beloved terrains and traditions in the world of cocktails and spirits through intimate, authentic experiences. (Jul 2020)

data.title: JustIN Flavours of Asia
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 2 Bayfront Avenue#L1-83The Shoppes at Marina Bay SandsSingapore (018972)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wok-Fried Angus Short Ribs, Charcoal-Grilled New Zealand Lamb Leg Satay. Kampot Black Pepper Beef, Sweet & Sour Iberico Pork ‘Goo Lou Yok’, Hokkien Mee with Live Maine Lobster
data.ABOUT: Perched atop Justin Quek’s upscale outfit Chinoiserie, with a view of the Singapore River, JustIN Flavours of Asia is a casual eatery that shows off local fare made with gourmet ingredients. Fan of popcorn chicken? The Wok Fried Angus Short Ribs here easily reminds you of everyone’s favourite snack, with its coating of sea salt, garlic, and chilli. Tossed in a wok that’s warmed to high heat, the cubes of fried beef ribs are juicy with a crisp exterior and are dangerously addictive. Another popular dish is chef Justin Quek’s take on the humble satay. Here, generous cubes of New Zealand lamb leg are grilled over burning hot charcoal for that smoky aroma. Dip the Charcoal-Grilled New Zealand Lamb Leg Satay in an accompanying crunchy peanut sauce. Zichar classics are must-haves for dinner and the kitchen fires up the wok to churn out elevated renditions of Kampot Black Pepper Beef, Sweet & Sour Iberico Pork ‘Goo Lou Yok’, as well as a hearty plate of smoke-kissed Hokkien Mee with Live Maine lobster. Come with friends, and come with an appetite. (Feb 2019)

data.title: JÙN Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, International, Seafood, All-Day Breakfast
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Singaporean Chilli Crab, Teochew-style Steamed Fish, Salted Egg Chicken, Chilli Crab Rillette Kueh Pie Tee, Beef Short Rib Rendang, Baked Chempedak Crumble
data.PRESS RELEASE:
JÙN, weaving the essence of a charming dining scene, aims to deliver the authentic
Singapore experience through its charismatic culinary expertise. Our chefs draw
inspiration from Singapore’s rich migrant Nanyang heritage, fused with generations of
local recipes to represent the melting pot of culture that is Singapore today.

Highlighting the union of traditional cooking techniques paired with the freshest
ingredients, JÙN puts a new spin on familiar Chinese and local cuisine, promising diners a
hearty feast and a visual treat. At JÙN, patrons can indulge in conventional favourites such
as Singaporean Chilli Crab, Teochew-style Steamed Fish, and Salted Egg Chicken. Diners
can also look forward to experience innovative dishes like Chilli Crab Rillette Kueh Pie Tee,
Beef Short Rib Rendang and Baked Chempedak Crumble.

Situated at the heart of Chinatown, JÙN fills itself with a chinoiserie-chic interior brought
out by oriental elements, multicoloured walls and furniture with a tinge of gold contrast
to accentuate the overall design aesthetic. Ideal for an intimate family gathering,
corporate events or even a romantic wedding, each visit warrants a tantalising meal that
awakens one’s palates. (May 2019)

data.title: KOB - Kingdom of Belgians
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Carbonnade, Toast Cannibal, Waffles a la Mode

data.title: KOMA Singapore
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Pillow, D.I.Y. Spicy Tuna (Do It Yourself), KOMA Roll, Wild Mushroom Fried Rice, Hobayaki Snow Aged Niigata Wagyu Ribeye
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Featuring sushi, robata and izakaya style dining, KOMA is a Japanese restaurant and sushi bar offering a modern interpretation of Japanese cuisine through innovative, original creations. The restaurant also boasts a bar and lounge that serves an extensive selection of over 30 types of sake sourced from across Japan.

Designed by renowned American design firm Rockwell Group, the 230-seat restaurant, bar and lounge is truly a one-of-a-kind work of art that is breathtaking in every way. Guests arrive through a striking 20 metre-long passageway that is inspired by the torii gates of the Fushimi Inari Shrine in Kyoto. Once inside the bar and lounge, guests are greeted by glass owls which line both the bar and a large wood "grid" suspended from the ceiling. The owls represent wisdom, luck, and good fortune. The "WOW" moment however, is the 2.5 metre-high Japanese bell with 20 different faces that overlooks a traditional Japanese foot bridge and reflecting pool.

The soaring 7-metre high ceiling features decorative acoustic panels in the shape of lily pads and is designed to mimic the surface of a pond. Anchoring the dining room is the 15-seat sushi bar with a dazzling display of the day's offerings.

On the mezzanine floor, a semi-private dining room caters to intimate group gatherings, while offering an expansive view of the action below.

data.title: KOMYUNITI
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Cheeseburger Sliders, Salmon Poke
data.ABOUT:
Located in the heart of Orchard Road yet tucked away from the bustle is KOMYUNITI. Opened on 1st November 2018, KOMYUNITI, located on the 10th floor of YOTEL, is a place where people connect over food and drinks. 
KOMYUNITI presents a completely curated food and cocktail menu and is currently helmed by Head Chef Mark Tai and F&B Manager, As’ad Isnin – both of whom will bring guests on a journey with their various experiences, inspirations and memories. The menus feature dishes and drinks that are all about fun and creativity, ensuring that a visit will always be memorable. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Ka-Soh (Outram)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Rice with Shelled Large Prawns with Gravy, Fish Fillet with Ginger and Spring Onions, Frogs with Dried Chillies, Braised Sea Cucumber with Mushroom, Fish Fillet with Sliced Fish Noodles
data.ABOUT: Mention Ka-Soh to any self-respecting Singaporean and the reaction is always one of joy and enthusiasm. Ka-Soh, an institution beloved for its comforting, flavourful fish noodle soup, is a firm favourite across all generations.Available in a few variations based on the choice of the various parts of the Snakehead Fish, Ka-Soh’s Signature Fish Noodle Soup is milky, tangy, and robust. The juicy white rice noodles, together with the fragrant fish broth and crunchy vegetables, make it an unforgettable combination. Other zi char favourites, such as Prawn Paste Chicken, are also available on the menu. Each piece of the chicken is marinated with a generous coating of prawn paste before being deep-fried to a rich, golden-brown colour. Eaten piping hot, this dish is highly addictive.  Another crowd-pleaser is the Fish Slices with Tossed Hor Fun and Bean Sprouts. Deceptively simple, the potent flavour of the dish comes from achieving the perfect balance between the saltiness of the fish against the crunchiness of the vegetables, as well as the softness of the hor fun noodles. Having been around for more than 40 years, and with an extensive array of traditional zi char dishes, plus its Signature Fish Noodle Soup, it is easy to see why Ka-Soh occupies a special place in every Singaporean foodie’s heart. (Feb 2017)

data.title: Kai Garden (Marina Square)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Garoupa in Lobster Soup, Peking Duck, Sweet & Sour Pork on the Rocks, Double-Boiled Japanese Matsutake in Hot Pot
data.ABOUT:
As the saying goes, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it" and Kai Garden at Marina Square Mall wisely heeds this advice. While the menu does serve a range of more modern items, the majority of the dishes feature traditional Cantonese flavours without introducing too many fancy tweaks. In fact, any change that executive chef and owner, Fung Chi Keung, makes is carefully chosen to enhance your dining experience.
Dishes manage to achieve full flavours without compromising the delicate tastes of ingredients, and presentations don't lack for fun or interest. The Garoupa in Lobster Soup will have your server bringing forth a whole garoupa - freshly sliced - to be cooked in an intensely orange lobster soup right at your table. The resulting broth is deep and chock full of tender fish. Their Peking Duck is a signature, understandably so given the deliciously crispy skin, and will be sliced and prepared at the table to be served with a selection of innovative wraps and sauces. Not to worry, their less exorbitant items are equally as amazing. Try their surprisingly succulent Sweet & Sour Pork on the Rocks which are served like colourful lollipops on a bed of ice.
With over 15 years and a previous position with Paradise Group, Chef Fung's expertise reaches from dim sum to excellent roasts, and Kai Garden is the perfect place to sample his creations. (Dec 2015)

data.title: Kakurega (The Lair)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chashu Ringo Sauce, Kohitsuji Yaki, Hotate Mentai, Shime Saba Aburi, Kaki Ponzu, Gyu Tataki
data.ABOUT:
A casual Japanese bar dedicated to the twin pleasures of Yakitori and Premium sake, Kakurega oozes charm with an expansive menu that features items made from superior Japanese ingredients.

Enter the lair and kickstart your Japanese dining experience with Oysters from Hyogo and Mie prefecture in Japan. Freshly shucked and delivered, these juicy oysters go best with a steaming hot bowl of Asari Miso Soup. Infusing a Japanese spin on the well-loved pork belly, the Chashu Ringo Sauce at Kakurega is a unique mix of pork belly and apple sauce. If you are a lamb lover, never leave the restaurant without ordering their Kohitsuji Yaki, a rack of lamb with garlic chips. For a grilled-meat lover, you can try the Gyu Tataki dish. The Meltique beef melts in the mouth with garlic chips as the side dish. 

Seafood dishes here include the Hotate Mentai and Shime Saba Aburi. The Hotate Mentai offers a mix of fresh scallops with Mentaiko sauce, and the must-try Shime Saba Aburi serves up a flamed-seared cured mackerel. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Kam's Roast (Jewel Changi Airport)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roast Duck, Suckling Pig, Toro Char Siu, Wonton Noodles, Red Bean Soup with Aged Orange Peel
data.ABOUT:
Kam's Roast has become a household name for succulent Hong Kong-style roasts ever since it arrived on our sunny shores in 2017. The outlets here are led by the same folks behind the original restaurant in Hong Kong, which have consistently garnered one Michelin star status since its opening.

Signature dishes include the Roast Duck, a perfectly-roasted duck that's juicy on the inside yet crispy and golden on the outside, and the Suckling Pig, with paper-thin slices of crackling pork skin — a hallmark of culinary finesse. Other favourites are the Toro Char Siu, made from prime pork belly for the perfect balance of fat and meat, and the Wonton Noodles that come with plump prawn-and-pork dumplings.

For a refreshing end to the meal, go for the Red Bean Soup with Aged Orange Peel, a subtly sweet dessert delicately brewed with premium red beans and orange peel that has been aged for at least a decade for the best flavour. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Kan Sushi (Robertson Quay)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chirashi, Omakase Lunch Course, Yasai Tempura, Seafood Salad
data.ABOUT:
An authentic Japanese restaurant with a cosy ambience, Kan Sushi's beautiful interior is reminiscent of the hole-in-the-wall dining places commonly found in Japan. 

Using only the best seasonal fish imported from Asahi Fisheries to prepare the dishes, diners can expect nothing but the best from Kan Sushi. Keeping things fresh with the use of unique seasonal fish like hamo and shima-aji, diners can also look forward to different menu options each time they pop by. 

If you’re in the area for lunch, pay a visit to Kan Sushi to try out the Chirashi. A popular menu item, this fuss-free meal features ebi, uni, ikura, hotate and toro alongside other seasonal fishes and is a great quick meal fix. If you’re in the mood for a fancier meal, try the Omakase Lunch Course. Starting with three kinds of appetizers, this comprehensive eight course meal consists of the well-loved and innovative sushi and sashimi. Fried Japanese delights are also available at the restaurant. The Ebi Tempura and Yasai Tempura are signature favourites not to be missed out on. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Kan Sushi (Tanjong Pagar)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Assorted Sashimi, Ladys Set, Special Omakase Course, Japanese Boiled Pork Dish.
data.ABOUT:
Located in Tanjong Pagar, Kan Sushi is an authentic Japanese restaurant that is dedicated to serving only the best of Japanese fare with their selection of the best seasonal fish from Asahi Fisheries in Japan. 

Made for sharing, the Assorted Sashimi is a great platter of a variety of sushi. Take your pick of Makimono (Roll Sushi), Sashimi and traditional sushi favourites such as Sea Urchin, Salmon Roe and Unagi to fill up. Part of the lunch menu, this delicious set consists of a variety of Japanese favourites from half udon noodle and chawan mushi to four different kinds of tempura. For those who prefer to indulge in a treat of everything, the a la carte menu has much to offer. Choose from starters such as Edamame, Umaki or Morokyu before moving on to the wide range of grilled dishes on offer. Signature favourites on the menu include the Simmered Tuna with Ginger, Japanese Boiled Pork Dish and kaki Fry. 

Treat yourself to the Special Omakase Course and enjoy the best of Kan Sushi with six kinds of appetisers, five kinds of sashimi, dessert and more! (Oct 2020)

data.title: Katachi Style Sushi
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sushi, Sashimi, Oyster, Bara Chirashi, Promotion Course Menu, Sashimi 1-For-1
data.ABOUT:
This Japanese restaurant in Capitol Piazza aims to not only serve fresh and authentic Japanese cuisine, but also to create an unforgettable dining experience. Helmed by chef Keiji Matoba, this veteran chef has spent years honing his skills in various fine dining establishments around the world.
There is a wide variety of Japanese classics on the ala carte menu, including sushi, sashimi, tempura, grilled meats, noodles, and desserts. The lunch menu adopts a more casual approach compared to its dinner counterpart, focusing on bento-style sets that come with a main dish and an assortment of appetisers. Dinner, on the other hand, provides an elevated dining experience with individually-plated dishes.
Opt for their signature Kaiseki-style omakase set that’s available throughout the day. This traditional multi-course meal presents the best produce on hand. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Katong Kitchen
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Malaysian, Seafood, Local, Peranakan, Halal Certified
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 25 Marine Parade RoadLevel 4Village Hotel Katong Level 4Singapore (449536)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ayam Buah Keluak, Ayam Pangang, Whole Sea Bass with Calamansi Sambal, White Pepper Crayfish, Durian Pengat, Cempedek Crème Brulee
data.ABOUT:
Located in the heart of the food district of Singapore, Katong Kitchen at Village Hotel Katong aims to bring diners on a culinary journey through Singapore’s heritage with traditional classics and modern favourites.

 

The halal-certified buffet spread presents the Favourites of Singapore, including familiar dishes from the Malay, Chinese, Indian, Peranakan and Eurasian cuisines. From Peranakan Ayam Buah Keluak to Eurasian Shepherd’s Pie, Indian Spicy Mutton Masala to Malay Asam Goreng Berempah and the classic Katong Laksa, guests can tuck into a myriad of flavours representing the different cultures and traditions of Singapore.
 

Katong Kitchen is a Halal certified all-day dining and buffet restaurant. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Kausmo
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wild Fish Congee, Chipotle-Berry Glazed Wagyu Beef D-Rump, Upside-Down Fruit Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
This new venture promotes thoughtful living by challenging food norms that bring about unnecessary food wastage. Derived from the word "cosmos" - a system of thought, Kausmo is the brainchild of co-founders Lisa Tang and Kuah Chew Shian.
The design of the 16-seater restaurant revolves around the concept of a "blank canvas", setting the stage for the transformation of aesthetically imperfect ingredients into delicious dishes. Every dish created at Kausmo incorporates thoughtfully sourced ingredients; seafood from small farming communities in the region, secondary cuts of meat which are often overlooked in favour of prime cuts, as well as forgotten native greens and florals. Combining European techniques with Asian influences, Lisa, who has worked at Pollen, Jaan, and Les Amis, demonstrates how lesser-loved ingredients are no less delicious than their popular counterparts.
Expect to be greeted with a sense of comfort too as parts of the menu draws inspiration from the team's cultural roots, such as Lisa's Teochew heritage. Each meal at Kausmo presents a thoughtful approach for guests to think about how they can all make more conscientious choices in their everyday lives and contribute to a more sustainable ecosystem, in Singapore and beyond. The restaurant even has a dedicated retail and feature space that showcases works by local businesses, artists and craftsmen with thoughtfulness as their focus.
Ultimately, Kausmo offers good food with a good cause, creating an authentic and warm space for conversations about thoughtful choices and conscientious living to happen around the dining table. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Kazbar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mixed Cold Mezzeh, Mixed Hot Mezzeh, Mixed Grill Platter, Joojeh (Iranian) Kebab, Shish Taouk, Lamb Chops, Lamb Kebab Kishkash, Kofta Kebab
data.ABOUT:
Kazbar is just the place to head to when you're yearning for life-changing Babaghanoush, craving tender grilled meats, or hankering for a little dose of Lebanon in Singapore.
Widely known for having some of the best kebabs in town, this Far East Square hotspot is quintessential for everything from a laid-back lunch to a post-work hangout. Offering a menu with a wide range of Lebanese dishes - the Mixed Cold Mezzeh, Mixed Hot Mezzeh, and Mixed Grill Platter are perfect for trying a little taste of it all. Loaded with Hummus, Moutabel, Mohammarah, Babaganoush, and Tabbouleh, the Mixed Cold Mezzeh is one of our favourite appetisers on the menu. And for those hungry meat-eaters? There's plenty for you to feast on as well. The Mixed Grill Platter follows suit with juicy Lamb Chops, flavourful Shish Taouk, Chicken Kofta Kebab, and more! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Keef The Beef
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 200 Turf Club Road#01-12 The GrandstandSingapore (287994)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Handcut Fries, New Zealand Grass Fed Ribeye, Australian F1 Wagyu Op Rib, USDA Prime Beef
data.ABOUT:
Keef The Beef is a steakhouse in Singapore that uses the highest grading USA steak, expect a divine steak experience with an emphasis on tenderness and meat structure. 

Apart from carefully selecting premium quality beef, each steak is also sous vide before the grilling process to ensure precise doneness. Afterwhich, the steak is grilled into a crust at perfectly high temperatures to lock in all the flavour to ensure deliciousness in every bite. 

Sink your teeth into a beautifully charred and juicy hunk of meat with their range to steaks, from the New Zealand Grassfed Ribeye to the top of the line Australian F1 Wagyu Op Rib. Broiled in a deluge of melted butter, the USDA Prime Beef is an indulging dish not to be missed out on. The restaurant also offers starters and sides for sharing before you dive into the mains. Made in-house, the Handcut Fries are crunchy and tasty — a great way to whet your appetite while you await your steak! (Nov 2020)

data.title: Kelly Jie Seafood (Formerly TPY Mellben)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Claypot Crab Thick Bee Hoon Soup, Cereal Prawns, Wasabi Mayo Prawn, Salted Egg Yolk Crab, Coffee Pork Ribs
data.ABOUT:
Googled Mellben Seafood Toa Payoh but your efforts were in vain? Fear not, Mellben’s Toa Payoh offshoot has merely undergone rebranding and is now known as Kelly Jie Seafood. Wondering who Kelly Jie is? She’s the superwoman behind the scenes, having been the bustling restaurant’s manager since its opening in 2006. She has even become somewhat of an icon as regulars greet her by the affectionate term “jie”, or “sister” in English. Queues at this humble restaurant known for its out-of-this-earth seafood delights are still as long as ever, so remember to book your place before heading down to secure your place at the coveted dining table. 

In fact, there’s word around town that you haven’t experienced Mellben if you haven’t slurped up their signature Claypot Crab Thick Bee Hoon Soup, where sweet crab meat and generous portions of comfy bee hoon is served in a thick, milky broth. Kelly Jie’s Chilli Crab, the famous local delight, also reaches heavenly status in our books with its thick and luscious sweet and spicy egg sauce. Don’t forget to order some fried mantou buns to help you soak up all that divine goodness! Other perennial crowd favourites include Cereal Prawns, Wasabi Mayo Prawn, and Coffee Pork Ribs, so it’s about time you gather your crew for a big night out! (Jul 2017)

data.title: Keyaki
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seasonal Omakase Kaiseki, Sukiyaki Prix Fixe, Yaki Nasu, Nikudoufu Kushiyaki, Moriawase Gyuniku, Hotatemaki, Mitarashi Dango
data.ABOUT:
Sitting pretty on the 4th level of Pan Pacific Singapore, Keyaki is an elegant Japanese restaurant that has a whole lot to offer. Boasting a menu with freshly sourced sashimi, authentically prepared teppanyaki, immaculately presented sukiyaki, and more - this Japanese wonderland is ideal for just about any occasion.
Renowned for the masterful skills of their chefs, Keyaki serves up a culinary experience that is as fresh as the quality seasonal ingredients they use. Our favourites? The Yaki Nasu, Japanese Grilled Eggplant, is simple yet delicious while the Sukiyaki Prix Fixe is a sophisticated presentation of a few of their finest dishes.
The impeccable eats, along with their serene koi pond and beautifully sculpted Japanese garden provide an authentic setting for an exquisite epicurean journey. (Mar 2016)

data.title: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Gobhi, Bharwan Masala Baingani, Chicken Manchurian, Mutton Korma, Strawberry Lassi
data.ABOUT:
The flavours of India comes alive at Khansama Tandoori Restaurant, a casual and wallet-friendly eatery located on Serangoon Road that stands out with its straightforward, no-nonsense Indian cuisine that is so authentic you’ll feel as though you’ve been whisked back to the Punjab region.
  
Like any good Indian restaurant, there are numerous options for vegetarians such as the delicious appetiser Tandoori Gobhi where cauliflower pieces marinated in yogurt and spices are beautifully baked in a charcoal oven. Meanwhile, the house specialty Bharwan Masala Baingani is not to be missed. Here, sliced eggplants are stuffed with a spicy dry masala mix and sautéed to perfection.
 
Meat lovers, on the other hand, need not despair, as the dining joint serves up an equally mind-boggling array of meat dishes. The Chicken Manchurian is a unique dish that fuses fuses the best of Indian and Chinese cuisine. Featuring boneless chicken, this meat is then chopped into cubes and fried before being slathered in a sauce made of sweet and sour gravy and soy sauce. Finally, might we recommend ordering up several freshly cooked Naan to mop up the remaining bits from the stews and curries.
 
Sate your Indian cuisine cravings with some of downright excellent fare at Khansama Tandoori Restaurant. (Feb 2018)

data.title: Khansama Tandoori Village
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Gobhi, Bharwan Masala Baingani, Chicken Manchurian, Mutton Korma, Strawberry Lassi
data.ABOUT:
The flavours of India comes alive at Khansama Tandoori Village, a casual and wallet-friendly eatery located on Science Park Drive that stands out from the pack with its straightforward, no-nonsense Indian cuisine that is so authentic you’ll feel as though you’ve been whisked back to the Punjab region.
  
Like any good Indian restaurant, there are numerous options for vegetarians such as the delicious appetiser Tandoori Gobhi where cauliflower pieces marinated in yogurt and spices are beautifully baked in a charcoal oven. Meanwhile, the house specialty Bharwan Masala Baingani is not to be missed. Here, sliced eggplants are stuffed with a spicy dry masala mix and sautéed to perfection.
 
Meat lovers, on the other hand, need not despair, as the dining joint serves up an equally mind-boggling array of meat dishes. The Chicken Manchurian is a unique dish that fuses the best of Indian and Chinese cuisine. Featuring boneless chicken, this meat is then chopped into cubes and fried before being slathered in a sauce made of sweet and sour gravy and soy sauce. Finally, might we recommend ordering up several freshly cooked Naan to mop up the remaining bits from the stews and curries.
 
Sate your Indian cuisine cravings with some of downright excellent fare at Khansama Tandoori Village. (Feb 2018)

data.title: Ki-Sho
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Assorted Sashmi, Hokkaido Uni with Cavier and Season Vegetables, Konnabe, Wild Caught Blue Fin Otoro with Hokkaido Uni
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Meaning “aristocratic craftsmanship”, Ki-sho reflects a value deeply ingrained in every aspect of the dining journey we intend for our guests. From the architecture of the building and the vessels that contain the food, right down to the seasonally inspired ingredients you savour and the sake you sip, Ki-sho is a culinary showcase for Japanese artisanship delivered with omotenashi.
Set in a heritage black-and-white bungalow along Scotts Road that once served as a residence for colonial era civil servants, Ki-sho offers a kappo-style dining room with an L-shaped hinoki wood counter that sits 11 guests. Additionally, two dining rooms –for eight and 12 guests respectively -on the upper deck offer guests an exclusive space to dine in complete privacy.(Jan 2018)

data.title: Kilo Kitchen
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wasabi Tuna Tartare, Crispy Soft Shell Crab, Seafood Ceviche, Beef Tongue Tacos, Spicy Duck & Pomelo Salad, Chicken Bulgogi, Sourdough Beignets
data.ABOUT:
Kilo Kitchen is more than just a restaurant. This warm and friendly eating spot, which first opened its doors in 2011, is an inviting hearth where friends are invited to share heartfelt conversations over a sprawling lunch or dinner. 

Drawing inspiration from global cuisines, Kilo mashes up some of the most interesting cultures (like Italian, South American, and Thai just to name a few) to create drool worthy plates that will have you coming back for more. Some signature highlights found here include the Seafood Ceviche, made from a tuna, salmon, and octopus trio. The Beef Tongue Tacos will add excitement to anyone’s night, with its accompanying apple miso slaw, roasted jalapeños, and garlic butter. And fans of beef will undoubtedly be thrilled by the addition of the restaurant’s aging room, where the eatery is ageing a number of meats such as the Wagyu Brisket, 100-day Grain-fed Angus  Rump Cap, and Wagyu Skirt.

Located in Duxton, Kilo Kitchen has created a cosy space for anyone to linger over their meals while basking in the natural light that pours through the large windows. So come here and stay awhile and create memories among family and friends that you won’t forget. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Kin
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kerabu Ikan Goreng, Heritage Salsa, Gulai, Babi Masak Assam, Opor Ayam, Red Debal, Fishmonger’s Haul, Kueh Kosui, Kueh Bengkah
data.ABOUT: Kin is a restaurant in the lobby of Straits Clan that serves heritage cuisine by Chef Damian D’Silva. The menu is a retrospective look at the origins of Singaporean cuisine, showcasing time honoured cooking methods, recipes and ingredients that have been left behind.Paired with an inspired beverage offering and genuine hospitality to complement the simple joys of sitting around the dining table with loved ones. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Kin-D
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kin-D Egg Volcano, Moo Ping, Yam Pak Boong Korp, Tom Yum Goong, Phad Thai Goong
data.PRESS RELEASE: Kin-D is an affordable Thai restaurant serving 100% authentic Thai cuisine prepared by our Thai chef. Ingredients and spices are specially selected, and dishes are handmade daily. We are the first Thai restaurant to serve up Steamed Egg Hotpot (Kai Thoon) and have named it as our signature dish - "Kin-D Egg Volcano". To complement the dishes, our bar also offers a wide selection of beer, cocktails and hard liquor suited for all tastebuds. (Jul 2019)

data.title: King Army Stew
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Army Stew, Beef Bulgogi Stew, Kimchi and Bacon Pancake, Seafood Pancake
data.ABOUT:
Delivering amazing flavours at great value, King Army Stew is dedicated to bringing you an authentic taste of Korea in a fun, intimate and casual setting. Located in Fortune Centre, the eatery is conveniently located within walking distance from Bugis MRT station.

With four types of stew available at King Army Stew, diners will find themselves spoilt for choice. The Classic Army Stew is a brimming pot of onions, lettuce, luncheon meat, bacon, kimchi, mushrooms and more stewed in the eatery’s homemade spicy paste, topped with a yummy layer of cheddar cheese. Add-ons such as chicken franks, tteokbokki and other seafood delights are also available. Crafted by their very own Korean chef, this steaming hot stew was specially modified to suit local taste buds!

Complete your meal with King Army Stew’s signature Kimchi and Bacon Pancake. Seafood lovers can opt for the Seafood Pancake instead. Stuffed with squid, prawn, scallop and cheese, this delicious rendition of the classic Korean delight is not to be missed out on! Those with a lighter palette will enjoy the Beef Bulgogi Stew. Peppered with fresh mushrooms, glass noodles and marinated beef bulgogi in a clean taste broth, this menu option is great for sharing. (Feb 2021)

data.title: King and the Pawn
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffled Honey Croque Madame, Spiced Apple French Toast, Camembert Brulee, Date Bacon Jam & Cheese
data.ABOUT: If you’re a fan of board games, and looking to disconnect from your computer screen for awhile, King and The Pawn is where you can do just that. This cafe and bar along Purvis Street is decorated in a cosy and chic fashion, taking inspiration from old-school games like Snakes & Ladders and Tetris. Spot the hanging ladder against the brick wall, or the drinks’ coasters made with Scrabble tiles! Choose your favourite from a selection of over 300 board games, and order up some tasty nibbles to share. The camembert brulee is perfect for two to three, where you get slices of crostini to dip into the wheel of gooey cheese, along with some roasted grapes and pears. Grilled cheese sandwich gets a quirky twist with the addition of date bacon jam, and if you’re here for brunch, don’t miss the spiced apple French toast with nutty maple bacon and swirls of salted caramel. Recharge your brain with a selection of locally-roasted coffees, or craft beers and cocktails if you’re playing on into the night! (Oct 2018)

data.title: King's Laksa Steamboat
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Laksa Soup Base, Seafood Soup Base, Mala Soup Base, Pork Belly, Sliced Beef, Flower Crab, Cockles, Kelp Strips
data.ABOUT:
If you’re looking for steamboat with some extra ‘kick’, then boy do we have the place for you. With a name like King’s Laksa Steamboat, we can’t help but think that it’s rare to see so many good things crammed into a restaurant name – it just calls to mind the image of steaming spoonfuls of spicy laksa soup being ladled into your bowl, complete with the richness of flavour that only truly quality steamboat can have. To sweeten the deal, you won’t have to break the bank to feast like a king here (apologies for the pun); for extremely affordable prices, you’ll get a yummy, all-you-can-eat experience that’ll leave you full to bursting and satisfied beyond measure.
As mentioned earlier, the eponymous Laksa Soup Base is an undisputed hit and a definite must-try. You won’t regret sipping on this intensely flavoursome concoction that’ll leave you with a warm, tingling sensation down to your fingertips! Take your pick from other soup bases as well, with flavours such as Seafood and Mala among them. And of course, no steamboat is complete without ingredients to throw into the soup; choose from old favourites such as Pork Belly and Fresh Prawns, and after you’ve made your selections, just settle down and dig into a nourishing spread that promises to make your dining experience one to remember! (Nov 2016)

data.title: Kings' Seafood
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shrimp Paste Curry Leaves Crab, Seafood Silver Fish Fried Rice, King’s Signature Prawn, Fried Mini Squid
data.ABOUT:
Indulge in delicious seafood here at Kings’ Seafood with meals of excellent quality featuring quality consistent seafood that tastes great every single time!

Have your favourite crab your way with the restaurant’s wide variety of sauces and cooking methods. Steamed with egg white and topped with roasted and fried garlic, enjoy a tasty mix of fresh, juicy crab meat bursting with garlic mix flavours when you opt for the Garlic Mix and Egg White option. For spice lovers, the Shrimp Paste Curry Leaves Crab is a mouthwatering alternative to the local Singapore Chilli Sauce favourite. Pair with a fragrant bowl of Seafood Silver Fish Fried Rice for a delicious seafood feast. Other signature sides to complement your meal here include Seafood Tofu, Fried Mini Squid, Braised Sweet Corn Soup and more.

Drenched in gong bao sauce, the “Kungfu” Prawn features huge prawns that are cooked to perfection. Another popular crowd favourite is King’s Signature Prawn. A unique platter served in a creamy pumpkin sauce, this dish is the restaurant’s bestselling seafood speciality loved by many. Wash it down with a cup of Fresh Coconut to end your meal on a refreshing note. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Kinki Restaurant
data.Hours: Mon-Sat: 12-3pm, 6-10:30pm(Bottomless Brunch available on Sat: 12-3pm)Closed Sunday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Golden Age, Cowabunga, High Roller Wagyu Don, Unagi Claypot, Crusty Lamb Rack, Crispy Ume Kurobuta, Kickass Chrashi Don, Ohmi Wagyu Houba Yaki, Wagyu Garlic Teppanyaki, Pomegranate Miso Black Cod
data.ABOUT:
A heavyweight in the sushi counter-culture, Kinki Restaurant has been wowing the hip and tasteful crowds along Marina Bay for years, and the throngs of merrymakers show no signs of slowing down. Situated atop the Customs House building with knockout views of MBS, it's no surprise to learn that Kinki has some celebrity backing. However, given the edgy, underground vibe of the place, it makes sense that the celebrity in question is a fictional sumo wrestler, who defies all odds to allow his culinary alter ego to shine. His story is etched all over the restaurant and bar, from the wild floor mural by an artist of "Miami Ink" TV fame, to the graffiti clad walls and comic book styled menu.

 

Despite the laidback persona of the place - with sneaker-wearing waitstaff and up-to-the-moment beats always pumping - the cuisine at Kinki Restaurant is nonetheless inventive, high-end and would make the restaurant's namesake proud. A palatable selection of mains includes the High Roller Wagyu Don - features ohmi A4 wagyu, Hokkaido uni, ikura, summer black truffle, onsen egg, Premium Unagi Claypot with homemade umami sauce and more. There's also traditional sushi and sashimi handled by masterful chefs behind the ice bar. "Rock & Roll" offers an interesting mix of creative maki rolls that lesser sushi restaurants are too risk-averse to try.

 

If there ever were a sushi bar bold enough to go for it, while still paying respects to the artistry of the cuisine, Kinki would be it. The Foie Gras and Scallop Nigiri features delicate, pan seared foie with a plump, juicy Hokkaido-bred scallop, while the Golden Age offers an expert balance of meaty fish and bright fruit. There are more filling mains and cleverly crafted cold dishes as well, a selection that is well suited for any range of hunger.

 

On the alfresco front, level three rooftop bar is a frequent hangout for the after-work crowd, with a plentiful selection of sake as well as the envelope-pushing cocktails you would expect from such a thrilling spot as Kinki. Long-standing favourites are the Kinki Mango Mint and Gin Berry. Their food menu also features an array of small bites such as Karaage Chicken Bao and Squid and chips.

 

Now a well-established mainstay along the Marina Bay waterfront, rest assured there are no kinks to be worked out in Kinki Restaurant's daring and delicious concept. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Kinou
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Basque Taloa, Xipiron, Piquillos, Txuleta
data.ABOUT: The brainchild of Chef and founder Benjamin Tilatti, Kinou is both an eclectic infusion of fond memories and robust flavours, as well as a heartfelt ode to Benjamin’s mother, who ignited his passion for cooking and whose nickname is honoured in the restaurant name.No wonder that Kinou makes for the perfect place to share a meal with friends and family. The concept’s Basque tapas (pintxos), designed for sharing, include several favourites like the Basque Taloa (a powerful combination of duck confit, Foie Gras, and cheese).Unabashed meat-lovers who prefer something heavier will find their wildest dreams fulfilled with the Xuleta (OP Rib), sinfully cooked in duck fat and butter, and featuring onion compote and hand-cut fries.For some smashing dessert, we wholeheartedly recommend the real and traditional Gateau Basque.Wash it all down with over 100 wines picked out by the Chef himself, and you've got yourself a treat that you will remember! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Kintamani Indonesian Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gado Gado Jakarta, Rendang Daging Sapi, Tahu Telur Surabaya, Udang Goreng Mentega, Rojak Mangga Muda, Iga Daging Sapi Bakar, Ikan Bakar Jimbaran, Es Chendol
data.ABOUT:
Indonesian cuisine has much to offer - we've had those cravings for addictive sambal heat, tender rendang, not to mention the depth and savouriness that come from a masterful combination of spices - and Furama RiverFront's halal-certified Kintamani Restaurant is a fantastic place to savour it all.
A delectable buffet spread boasts authentic bites like Gado Gado Jakarta (a traditional mix of vegetables and peanut sauce) and Mee Soto Ayam (egg noodles in clear chicken broth topped with shredded chicken), as well as mains such as Rendang Daging Sumatra (richly spiced beef braised in thick coconut gravy) and Tahu Telur Surabaya (deep-fried beancurd and egg tossed with grated vegetables and spicy sauce).
Second guessing your choice to go a la carte? Don't worry, that menu is equally packed with enticing delights like Udang Goreng Mentega (deep-fried buttered prawns tossed with egg yolk and curry leaves), Sate Lilit Bali (minced seafood skewered with lemongrass Balinese style), and Rojak Mangga Muda (Indonesian young mango salad) - all paired with fragrant rice, of course.
These traditional beauties and fusion fare are the work of talented Chef I Gusti Nyoman Kaler and his team, so if you've got a sudden desire for lovely Indonesian plates, trot down to Kintamani where their expertise will leave you with a leisurely meal or delicious takeaway. (Mar 2016)

data.title: Kitchen by Food Rebel
data.Cuisine: All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ultimate Breakfast, Cinnamon Spiced Overnight Oats, Chicken Protein Buddha Bowl, The Rebel Chicken Burger
data.ABOUT:
Healthy food and great taste go hand in hand at Kitchen by Food Rebel. We'd say half the battle is won when the meals are made from scratch, omitting any refined sugars, MSG or artificial preservatives. Coupled with an innovative menu that combines both Western and Eastern flavours, the health nuts at Chope are sold.

Kickstart your day with the cafe's energy-boosting selection of breakfast items such as the Cinnamon-Spiced Overnight Oats or the hearty breakfast platter with the works. Come lunchtime, keep your health game going strong with one of their well-loved Rebel Buddha Bowls. These nutritious, well-balanced bowls taste as good as they look. When the midday sugar craving hits, the snacks and cakes provide a guilt-free indulgence.

Whether you're a meat-lover, vegan, or just looking to lead a healthier lifestyle, Kitchen by Food Rebel is one stop you shouldn't miss. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Kith Cafe (Ascott Orchard)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Calamari, Kith Super Salad, Roasted Pumpkin Salad, Carbonara, Gnocchi, Wagyu Beef Burger, Kith Super Juice, Ice Blended Watermelon Lychee
data.ABOUT:
Built around the concept of bringing the community together over good coffee, food and company, Kith is the quintessential all day hangout.
The heavenly aroma of roasted coffee beans is just the start of the mouth-watering experience at Kith. Using a rotating custom blend of specialty beans from various regions such as Brazil and India, coffee drinkers can look forward to a consistent cup of joe that is smooth, thick-bodied, with underlying tones of dark fruits and cocoa.
Known for its tasty breakfast bites like Housemade Pancakes with poached pears, mixed berries and honey mascarpone, and the all-too photogenic Better than Benny with a mouthwatering combination of poached eggs, crispy bacon and creamy hollandaise, Kith also serves up a delectable Wagyu Beef Burger that comes laden with sharp cheddar, caramelised onions, and avocado mayo.
For those on the lookout for something healthy yet hearty, Kith's Super Salad, power-packed with quinoa, greens, kale, walnuts and more, is sure to garner high praise from the healthy set. On the other side of the spectrum, the Carbonara pasta with morsels of smoky bacon in an indomitable creamy egg and parmesan sauce is always a smart way to go! (Jan 2017)

data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions

data.title: Kiwami (Chinatown Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kiwami Tonkotsu Ramen, Red Tonkotsu Ramen, Hokkaido Ebi Tonkotsu, Tantan Mazesoba
data.ABOUT:
Looking for the ultimate bowl of ramen crafted with Hokkaido wheat? Simmered over 10 hours using 100% Japanese pork bones, the broth from this ramen restaurant perfectly complements the noodles. Experience the exquisite flavours of Japan through the restaurant’s carefully selected menu that features top notch ingredients imported directly from Okinawa.

Dig into a bowl of the signature Kiwami Tonkotsu Ramen. Made with the restaurant’s original recipe pork bone broth, savour this flavoursome bowl of springy noodles with your loved ones for an intimate dining session. For the spice lovers, there’s no greater challenge than the Red Tonkotsu Ramen. Heating things up with Japanese red chilli oil and a dash of hot miso paste, this fiery broth is a dish made for those who simply can’t live without spice. Add-on options such as corn, beansprouts, Toroniku Cha Shu and more are also available on the menu.

Swimming in a rich Tonkotsu broth, the huge prawns in the Hokkaido Ebi Tonkotsu enhances the delicious flavour of the thick broth. A dry version of this popular dish can also be found on Kiwami’s expansive menu. (Feb 2021)
