data.title: Kiyoshi Japanese Restaurant
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 11am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Fri-Sat: 11am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5pm-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sun: 5-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Aburi Salmon Salad Udon, Kiyoshi Combination Udon, Kimchi Nabeyaki Udon, Prawn Udon
data.ABOUT:
Kiyoshi Japanese Restaurant specialises in Inaniwa udon, a type of udon made in the Inaniwa area of Inakawa Machi, Akita prefecture. Slightly thinner than your regular udon but thicker than somen or hiyamugi noodles, this cream coloured udon is hand-stretched for that great bite.

With a main focus in providing light and wholesome dishes, try a hefty selection of chilled and warm udon, as well as Nabe Mono, with udon in a hotpot — there’s also a kimchi edition! Besides seafood and meat, there are also options for vegetarians. For a light teaser of its many udon varieties, try the canape-like Kiyoshi Combination Udon, with three kinds of Japanese cold noodles: Ikura Salmon Udon, Tempura Udon, and Nebaneba Udon. Love Japanese curry rice? Try it with udon — the Pork Katsu Curry Udon is our top pick.

While this Japanese restaurant attracts udon lovers, lovers of the cuisine can also enjoy other dishes in the menu that include sushi and sashimi platters, rice bowls, ramen, and more. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Kko Kko Na Ra (Tanjong Pagar)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Soy Garlic Chicken Wings, Ginseng Chicken, Spicy Kko Chicken, Bu Dae Jji Gae
data.ABOUT:
For foodies like us, Korean fried chicken is a marvel, an amazing alchemy of crunchy fried chicken slathered with a sauce that’s part spicy and sweet. And when the craving for Korean fried chicken hits, we head on down to KKO KKO NARA, which stands above the competition for its solidly delicious chicken and spicy Korean bites. 
 
KKO KKO NARA was the brainchild of Eon Lee, a self-taught Korean cook who spent six months labouring over her fried chicken recipe. And her efforts have paid off, as seen by the teeming crowds who pack the Tanjong Pagar restaurant till the wee hours of the morning. Choose from four different flavours of fried chicken: original, soy garlic sauce, sweet & spicy, as well as hot & spicy. Can’t decide? Then the Combo Chicken Set is probably your best bet. 
 
And fried chicken isn’t the only thing up for grabs here, with accompanying sides and mains that are worth their weight in gold. Dining in a group? Then go for the Bu Dae Jji Gae, better known as the Army Stew. This bubbling pot of vegetable stew comes bursting with noodles, spam, and mushrooms, and is more than enough to fill the tummies of several ravenous diners. 
 
Whether you’re looking for an after-work hangout for some top-notch Korean grub, KKO KKO NARA is sure to meet those expectations and more. (Dec 2017)

data.title: Knockhouse Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.ABOUT:
As caffeine addicts, we like to think of coffee as the elixir of life that helps us power through the day. And after sampling many of the specialty coffee places around town, we can honestly say Knockhouse Cafe stands out above the crowd for its well-crafted cups of joe. 

Nestled on Upper Thomson Road, Knockhouse Cafe is the brainchild of the good people behind Oz Specialty Coffee and their Thai counterparts. The result is a sleek and starkly minimalistic cafe that’s the perfect venue for a mid-day hangout session where you can sip on a cup of coffee while soaking in the sunlight pouring in from their ceiling-to-floor windows. Aside from the coffees, this bistro also pumps out a fair number of cafe bites that are equal parts hearty and equal parts pleasing. Kick off the morning with large plates such as Breakfast Platter, featuring oodles of toast, grilled corn, pork sausage, hash, thick bacon, amongst others. Not a fan of breakfast? Then you won’t go wrong with unforgettable picks such as the Cajun Chicken Burger or the Wild Mushroom Aglio Olio. 

Whether you’re here for a casual business lunch or a lazy Sunday brunch, Knockhouse Cafe is a spot that’s worth checking out the next time you’re in the neighbourhood. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Koh Nangkam
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Koh Nangkam Steamed Sea Bass, Steamed Lemon Sea Bass, Phad Thai, Coconut Nectar
data.ABOUT:
Immerse yourself in Koh Nangkam’s long list of authentic Thai dishes that aims to bring the southern flavours of the country to the table. Located a stone’s throw away from Bugis MRT, this two-storey restaurant features a cosy interior with numerous seating options. 

Quench your thirst with a refreshing cup of Coconut Nectar. Colourful and flavourful, this makes for an invigorating start. The restaurant’s signature Koh Nangkam Steamed Sea Bass is great for sharing. A wonderfully aromatic dish, the fish is steamed with ginger and plum. Tinged with a hint of herbs, the succulent flesh is light on the palate. 

For those who prefer a spicier kick to their fish, the Steamed Lemon Sea Bass is a great option to consider. Sweet, sour and fiery, this classic Thai dish is peppered with chilli padi for an extra dash of heat. 

Indulge in Phad Thai with a twist here at Koh Nangkam. Stir fried and cut into smaller pieces, the mouthwatering noodles feature generous toppings of squid, prawn and fresh cabbage, giving the dish a commendable crunch. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Koji Sushi Bar (Pickering Street)
data.Hours: Mon-Sat: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9pm)Closed Sundays & Public Holidays
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon and Roe Rice Bowl, Wagyu Sukiyaki + Gohan, Koji Sashimi Moriwase, Sushi Set C
data.ABOUT:
Named after the culture that is used in the brewing of various fermented ingredients in Japanese cuisine, this spot has a simple menu focused only on quality sashimi and sushi. This restaurants provides bang for diners’ bucks, with undersized servings of rice topped with oversized pieces of seafood at bargain prices. The sushi is made from Japanese rice that is imported, and cooked in charcoal-filtered water to get the most authentic taste possible.

The Kome platter is the perfect item to try all the best that Koji has to offer. A 10-piece dish made with swordfish, tuna, salmon, and various other premium seafoods, this plate is a collection of some of Koji’s most popular menu items, and is priced affordably. Not a fan of sushi? There are also some innovative Donburi dishes that you’ll want to get your hands on. The Salmon Avocado Tartare Don bring together the buttery flavour of avocado and the tenderness of salmon to make a delicious dish that is perfect with a glass of Sake. This spot even has an affordable Omakase set available for diners who wish to leave their dining experience entirely in the hands of the chef - and with the attention to detail here, you know you’re in good hands. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Koji Sushi Bar (Raffles City)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 252 North Bridge Road#03-28ARaffles City Shopping CentreSingapore (179103)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chirashi Don, Salmon Avocado Tartare Rice Bowl, Nigiri Sushi
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Koji Sushi Bar is a trendy and casual Japanese sushi and sashimi-only joint with a simple menu focusing on quality fresh sea produce and with speed and affordability in the day to cater to office crowd. In the evening, Omakase (chef decide) menu is served along with a good selection of sake and shochu for a relaxed dining experience.

This restaurant is committed to using the Japan-produced rice and charcoal-filtered water to achieve the best tasting sushi rice. Diners have a choice of white rice or the healthier mixed grain rice for their donburi. There is a small but carefully selected range of artisan sake, shochu and craft beer for the diners. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Kontiki
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Buffet, Italian, Seafood, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mussels in Outlaw Gumbo, Double Cheese Burger, Love-Eat Beef Short Ribs, Roasted Portobello Mushroom Soup, Arugula Salad
data.ABOUT:
There’s nothing better than good food, good vibes and the company of good friends and family, and Kontiki at Passion Wave @ Marina Bay is just that! Located next to the Benjamin Sheares Bridge, and with an awe-inspiring view of the Singapore city skyline as well as the meandering Kallang river, Kontiki provides a great location to catch up with family and friends over good food.
The menu features an extensive selection of casual American food. To start with, the Roasted Portobello Mushroom Soup comes highly recommended. Button and Portobello mushrooms are combined to give the soup a rich and creamy texture. Dip the accompanying toasted cheese bread into the soup, and you would just have had a slice of heaven! The Mussels in Outlaw Gumbo is a refreshing twist on the usual mussel dishes available on the market. A generous portion of black mussels is cooked in a Cajun gumbo broth, adding an extra tangy kick to the sweet freshness of the mussels. Of course, the bestseller at Kontiki is the Double Cheese Burger. As the name suggests, it’s a cheeseburger but double of everything - double patties, double slices of cheese, and a huge portion of fries on the side! At Kontiki, you’re definitely in good hands. (Mar 2017)

data.title: Kopi Tiam
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 2 Stamford RoadLevel 2, Swissotel The StamfordSingapore (178882)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salted Egg Yolk Crispy Calamari, Fish Head Curry, Wok-fried Beef Tenderloin, Honey Sauce, Teochew-Style Steamed Whole Seabass, Marmite Prawns
data.ABOUT:
The perfect place for locals and tourists alike, Kopi Tiam aptly displays Singapore’s vibrant cosmopolitan culture with comforting home-style dishes. Satisfy your local cravings and delight in rich flavours when you dig into Singaporean favourites such as Crispy Shrimp Paste Chicken, Fish Head Curry, Fried Carrot Cake and more! 

A uniquely Singaporean dish, Rojak is their local take on the classic Chinese salad. Tossed in prawn paste and fiery chilli sauce, pineapples, cucumbers, sweet turnips and dough fritters make up the dish. Seafood lovers can choose either the Crispy Salted Egg Yolk Calamari or Stir Fried Cereal Prawns to kickstart their meal. Vegetarians also have their fair share of options here at Kopi Tiam. Topped with mushrooms, mixed vegetables and mock goose, the Wok Fried Vegetarian Bee Hoon is a fragrant plate of tangy rice vermicelli fit for a delectable one meal dish. 

Wash down your meal with your favourite Kopi Tiam specialities such as the well-loved Milo Dinosaur or a pot of hot tea. For those on the hunt for something fancier, the restaurant offers bottles of bubbly or exquisite bottles of red and white wine. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Korean Fusion BBQ (Dunlop Street)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Pepper Pork Belly, Korean Spicy Pork Belly, Bak Kwa, Curry Chicken, Bulgogi Beef, Black Pepper Fish, Spicy Fish
data.ABOUT:
Dig into the smorgasbord of yummy treats offered at Korean Fusion BBQ (Dunlop Street). With its buffet-style spread, you can chow down on a night of unlimited supply of your favourites till your stomach’s fit to burst. And it’s definitely the place for meat-lovers – featuring an extensive list of marinated and unmarinated pork belly and chicken options (just to name a couple), release your inner carnivore and eat to your heart’s content.
Chomp on a mouthful of Black Pepper Pork Belly, and savour the tasty nature of the meat – it’s testament to the type of marinade and duration for which the meat was marinated. The Korean Spicy Pork Belly is another one you won’t regret trying; quality always tells, and it shows in the addictive tenderness of the meat. This is a buffet, however, so do be sure to check out the restaurant’s numerous takes on pork (including the non-marinated options) – each one is sure to be a delicious treat for the taste-buds. There’s even a Bak Kwa option (yum)!
Of course there are other meats too; as mentioned earlier, there’s chicken in several different marinades, beef (which includes the ever-beloved Bulgogi Beef option), and seafood. Do be sure to try the Prawns and the Black Pepper Fish, especially if you’re looking for a non-red meat selection. So head down to Korean Fusion BBQ (Dunlop Street) sometime soon, and have a whale of a time busting your belly with its plethora of tasty barbequed eats! (Aug 2017)

data.title: Kotuwa
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Kottu, Crab Cutlet, Mutton Rolls, Wattakka Kalu Pol, Seeni Sambol, Dallo Baduma, Watalappam Tart
data.ABOUT: Kotuwa is Chef Rishi Naleendra's highly anticipated third and brand new venture. With an emphasis on a lively, modern and casual vibe that focuses on traditional Sri Lankan cuisine, Kotuwa pays homage to the 35-year-old's Sri Lankan heritage.Kotuwa, named after the Sri Lankan capital's central business district, aims to bring the sights, sounds and tastes from Sri Lankan's streets and markets to the Singapore diner. It also means "fort" in Sinhalese, a reminder of the ancient landmarks built by Sinhalese kings and the Portuguese, Dutch and British settlers that have influenced the country's rich history, culture and cuisine.Embodying Sri Lanka's vibrant and generous way of life, diners can expect bright, creative dishes made from quality ingredients that are as robust and flavourful as the culture and history that inspire them. From famous Sri Lankan short eats, to a myriad of curries and housemade sambols and preserves, Kotuwa looks forward to spicing-up and invigorating diners' palates, one meal at a time! (Dec 2020)

data.title: Kumoya @ Jalan Klapa (Crayon Shinchan x Kumoya Pop-Up Cafe)
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chill-To-The-Max Pomodoro MeatBalls Pasta, Shiro and The Lucky Stars Ebi Burger, So Mischievous Japanese Seafood Curry Rice, Shinchan Fuji-san Chiffon Cake, Relaxing Onsen Pudding Parfait, Piak! Piak! Matcha Frappe
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Get ready to meet the most iconic and mischievous boy in town!
He’s kawaii, he’s full of mischief and pranks, but much-loved throughout the manga universe. And he is Crayon Shinchan! Welcome Crayon Shinchan to Kumoya x Crayon Shinchan pop-up from Wednesday, 5 May 2021.
Who or what is Shinchan? He is a 5-year-old kindergarten boy living in the suburbs with his father, Hiroshi, a carefree office worker, his mother Misae, his little sister Himawari, and their family dog Shiro. Shinchan likes pretty girls and to enjoy the “Chocobi” snack. He is quite a handful to his mother and father, and his funny acts often trouble adults around him.
Come say “Hello” to Shinchan and his many antics. Kumoya is glad to have him with us and curate a whole range of Shinchan-inspired dishes in his honour, courtesy of Shirley Wong (@littlemissbento) and our kitchen crew. And of course, our outlet will be transformed into the animated world of Shinchan and his limitless antics. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Kumoya @ Orchard Central (Sumikkogurashi Pop-Up Cafe)
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mini Eclairs, Tiramisu Pancake, Sakura Yoghurt Parfait
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Brace yourself for a kawaii dose of kooky characters.

What sits in the corner of the room and rushes back when you try to get them to the centre? It’s the kawaii and wonderful Sumikkogurashi! And Kumoya is happy to host them in the corner of our café for the Sumikkogurashi x Kumoya pop up cafe from Friday, 12 March 2021.

You can expect a load of fun from this merry gang as we transform our café into their living space. Special dishes will carry the Sumikkogurashi inspired theme, designed exclusively by Shirley Wong (@littlemissbento) and our very own Kumoya kitchen crew. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Kurama Robatayaki x Sushi Murasaki
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Surume Ika, Tsukune, Wagyu Kushi
data.PRESS RELEASE: The chefs at Kurama Robatayaki are bringing more Japanese cuisine to Nihon Street. Robatayaki is the style of food preparation that allows for interaction between the chefs and the guests, as chefs grill the selection of seafood, vegetables and more. Pop by for dinner and stay for a casual drink of sake and enjoy bar snacks. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Kure Menya @ Frasers Tower
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tori Chashu Ramen, Tori Sukiyaki Ramen, Tori Fest Ramen, Tori Nacho Bomb
data.ABOUT:
A ramen restaurant in Tanjong Katong, Kure Menya is dedicated to serving nutritious and mouthwatering bowls of comfort Japanese broths. Meticulously prepared with attention, knowledge and precision, each bowl of ramen features a collagen-rich chicken broth that is as flavourful as it is nourishing. 

With a choice of original or spicy, Kure Menya’s signatures include Tori Chashu Ramen, Tori Sukiyaki Ramen, Tori Fest Ramen, and Maze-Men. Perfect on a rainy day, the piping hot bowl of Tori Chashu Ramen features melt-in-your-mouth slabs of fatty chashu with bursts of umami flavour hidden in the rich collagen soup base. For those looking for something non-soupy, the Maze-Men is a bowl of dry ramen. Garnished with coriander, the thick noodles are mixed with soy sauce and the restaurant’s homemade sauces.

Pair your bowl of noodles with a fried side dish to enjoy the complete Japanese experience. The Deep-Fried Gyoza is a classic favourite that will never go wrong. Crunchy and cheesy, the Tori Nacho Bomb is another delightful side dish with a nacho filling that oozes out with every bite. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Kuriya Dining
data.Hours: Kuriya DiningMon-Sun: 11:30am-2.30pm (Last Order: 1:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 9pm)  Kuriya Dining (Omakase) Mon-Sun: 11:30am-2.30pm (Last Order: 1:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 9pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 1 Kim Seng Promenade#01-127Great World CitySingapore (237934)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Utage Sashimi, Nigiri Sushi Assortment, Japanese Wagyu Beef Steak, Iberico Fatty Pork, Kuriya’s Original Junmai Daiginjo (Sake)
data.ABOUT: Located on the office tower ground floor of Great World in central Singapore, Kuriya Dining is an award-winning restaurant specializing in a melange of authentic Japanese cuisine and exquisitely unique creations that transcend the boundaries of Japanese gastronomy. It also has an exclusive space to entertain clients or dine with family, with 3 private rooms accommodating up to 8 guests each and providing diners a luxurious dining space to spend quality time with guests in an intimate, private setting. (May 2020)

data.title: Kushi Japanese Dining
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shiro Maguro Aburi Sushi, Ton Toro Kushiyaki, Surume Ika, Kaki Fry, Pork Belly Shogayaki, Rib Eye Steak, Hamachi Kama, Premium MazeChirashi, Deep Fried Salmon Fin, Lobster Porridge, Mentaiko Salmon Spaghetti, Asari Butter Yaki
data.ABOUT:
As a pioneer of premium Japanese ala carte buffets, Kushi Japanese Dining caters to everyone with two dining alternatives - Classic Buffet and Premium Buffet. The buffet features a range of tantalising dishes like Shiro Maguro Aburi Sushi, Ton Toro Kushiyaki, Surume Ika, Amaebi, Pork Belly Shogayaki, Rib Eye Steak and Hamachi Kama. Bringing authentic top-notch quality food to you at affordable prices, Kushi Japanese Dining offers set lunches such as the popular Premium MazeChirashi. Kushi Japanese Dining’s ala carte menu also aims to provide each and every diner with an opportunity to taste a wide variety of flavours.
To enjoy a unique and tantalising experience and kickstart your weekend, the weekend brunch brings out the best of both worlds. From a wide array of Japanese culinary favourites, including Lobster Porridge, Teppanyaki, Deep Fried Oyster & Salmon Fin to a specially curated variety of Japanese fusion fare such as Spaghetti, Smoked Salmon and Shrimp Popcorn, as well as Japanese
desserts - Crepe cake and Mochi to all-time favourite brunch items such as Scrambled Eggs, Bacon
and Sausages, you will be asking for more!
Not forgetting, drink and be merry by topping up for free flow alcoholic drinks or enjoy alcoholic drinks at discounted price during their happy hour!
Kushi Japanese Dining is definitely the place to go for your quality Japanese food fix. (Nov 2017)

data.title: Kwee Zeen (Sofitel Sentosa)
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 2 Bukit Manis RoadSofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & SpaSingapore (099891)                                                Map
data.ABOUT: Kwee Zeen invites you to its spacious establishment with high ceilings, gilded frames, dark mahogany wooden fixtures in a tasteful maroon and cream palette. Head on to the alfresco area where live stations and dedicated chefs meet you. Serving an extensive selection of Pan-Asian, Western and French cuisine, Kwee Zeen tempts and delights with sumptuous ala carte and buffet offerings - made fresh to order. With French hospitality at the heart, Kwee Zeen offers premium and attentive service with a smile. An all-encompassing experience of living the French way, Kwee Zeen’s Sunday Brunch offers over 80 food selections, with premium ingredients, free-flowing champagne, and fun activities for the whole family. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Kyoten Japanese Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Sando, Aburi Don, Ikura Gunkan Maki, Uni Bafan Roll
data.ABOUT:
Kyoten Japanese Cuisine is the newest kid on hip gastro-street, Yong Siak. Serving traditional Japanese fare, their Chefs are at the forefront of Sushi ageing which can be enjoyed in through their Omakase experience, lunch sets or an ala carte selection. 



Kyoten Japanese Cuisine serves top-quality Japanese fare by sourcing the freshest ingredients. The Sea Urchin that goes into their Uni Bafan Roll, for example, is air-flown right after the auctions at the Toyosu fish markets are concluded four times a week. A generous portion of the precious Sea Urchin is then laid on a special mix of young and old Sasanishiki rice from Miyagi prefecture and served with premium seaweed. 



No meal here is complete without the restaurant’s signature dish - Wagyu Sando: a thick slice of pan-fried A5 Wagyu sandwiched between lightly toasted crustless white bread. We hear the considerate Chefs at Kyoten Japanese Cuisine also do a Hokkaido Buta Sando for patrons who do not eat Beef. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Kyuu by Shunsui
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Assorted Sashimi, Kagoshima A4 Wagyu Salad with Yuzu Dressing, Japanese Omelette Rolled With Bonito Stock, Kagoshima A4 Wagyu H-Bone with Wasabi, Salt and Wine Sauce, Kagoshima A3 Sirloin with Wasabi, Salt and Wine Sauce
data.ABOUT:
This cosy Japanese spot in Keong Saik is one of the most underrated sashimi and robatayaki spots around. The sister the famous Kappo Shunsui, of Bib Gourmand Tokyo fame, this restaurant is just as dedicated to their craft. With a kitchen helmed by Chef Takamasa Suzuki, diners can expect artful platings, fresh ingredients, and authentic cuisine. Sashimi lovers are sure to enjoy the fresh seafood options available. 

The Charcoal Grill options are an excellent way to enjoy your choice of plant-based or seafood and meat dishes in a healthy and hearty manner. The Lotus Root With Sweet Soy Sauce is an excellent dish. Crunchy lotus root is grilled to smoky perfection and drizzled with a salty-sweet soy sauce for a flavour-rich dish with a unique texture. For something a little moreish, you can’t go wrong with the Oyakodon - a hearty chicken and egg rice bowl flavoured with a dash of mirin and scallions. 

Adventurous diners can even opt to have Chef Suzuki take over their meal for the night, by choosing the Omakase option. With a range of appetizers, assorted sashimi, and charcoal grill dishes available to savour, this is the perfect option for diners looking to taste the best of what Kyuu has to offer. (Nov 2018)

data.title: L'Angelus
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Traditional French Onion Soup, Burgundy Snails, Mini Raviolis, Pan-Fried Duck Liver 'Angelus' Style, Rib Eye Steak, Pan-Fried Dover Sole, Roasted Welsh Lamb, Hot Chocolate Cake
data.ABOUT:
L’Angelus, Singapore was established in 1998 and is the oldest single-location French restaurant in the city. Its dedication to exceptional food as well as its exclusive French wine list has earned it its spot in history – and a number of awards to go alongside. 

Reminiscent of the charming restaurants tucked away in quiet corners of Paris, the setting and décor of L’Angelus evoke a very warm and familiar feeling, emitting an incandescent love of everything French.

Casier à serviettes, wooden pigeonholes for patrons' napkins line the walls, vintage posters lend a dramatic feel and colourful cut-glass ceiling lets in warm tones of daylight and fill the room with colour!

The chefs follow traditional French cooking techniques, showcasing classic and interpreted dishes made from recipes honed to perfection through the centuries. The menu is expressed by dishes spectacularly simple and yet exquisite, devoted to using the highest quality ingredients, mostly air-flown directly from Rungis France.

The food is complemented by a unique and highly curated wine list, full of gems and vintages for wine aficionados. 

The bar is perhaps the best-kept secret of L’Angelus. Apart from an exhaustive wine selection from France, the bar offers a great selection of spirits, liqueurs, cocktails, and Armagnacs.

To experience the ‘true joie de vivre’ that comes with eating classic French cuisine, L’Angelus is the place to dine at. A reservation at L’Angelus is always a good idea! (Dec 2018)

data.title: L'Entrecôte The Steak & Fries Bistro (Customs House)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Trimmed L’Entrecôte Steak, House-made Duck Foie Gras Terrine, Oven-Baked Beef Marrow, Crêpes Suzette, Profiteroles de “L’Entrecôte”, Deep-Fried Frogs Legs, Tarte Flambée, Beef Tartare Toast, La Planche De Charcuteries et Fromages
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Almost ten years after first bringing the authentic L’Entrecôte experience from the streets of Paris to the quaint Duxton Hill, Singapore, Deliciae Hospitality Management (DHM) now brings the Parisian flair of L’Entrecôte The Steak & Fries Bistro to another new neighbourhood – at Customs House in the heart of Singapore’s bustling CBD, overlooking the stunning vistas of Marina Bay.
Staying true to the original L’Entrecôte experience at Duxton Hill, the authentic Parisian bistro will serve its signature French fare, and will also boast the addition of the distinctively French Ricard Bar. The Ricard Bar, set to open in mid-April, features airy al fresco seating, a bright yellow tone, and is set to offer respite and a much needed ‘pick-me-up’ to guests, both during the busy work week and on weekends. (Mar 2019)

data.title: L'Entrecôte The Steak & Fries Bistro (Duxton)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Escargots de Bourgogne, Oven Baked Beef Marrow, Trimmed Entrecôte Steak, Pâté de Campagne, Profiteroles de "L’Entrecôte", Homemade Lemon Tartlet
data.ABOUT:
The tree-lined, cobblestoned nook of Duxton Hill makes quite the pretty picture and L’Entrecote’s classy white doors and red awning blend right into the quaint scene. The decor beyond its entrance is redolent of Paris – more specifically the relaxed bistro culture that’s so common to the French city – as diners sit shoulder to shoulder in a long, cosy stretch whilst wine and conversation flow freely.
The Plat du Jour is always their classic Steak Frites, slivers of succulent prime meat generously doused with a secret sauce that pairs perfectly with each melt-in-your-mouth bite. Accompanying those piping hot babies are a fresh green salad and a heaping pile of crispy, golden fries. Finished your first round and hungry for more? That’s when the servers offer you the second helping that’s been kept warm on burners.
Of course, other bistro options such as Leek and Vinaigrette and Oven-baked Beef Marrow with Rock Salt are on the menu, along with decadent desserts like the Vacherin du Bistrot (meringue, vanilla ice cream, and hot chocolate sauce) but really, there’s nothing like sitting in that buzzing atmosphere, especially in the dim lights at night, and enjoying slices of beef or delightfully savoury cheeses. Bon appétit! (Apr 2016)

data.title: L'éclair Pâtisserie
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 190 Clemenceau Avenue #01-28 Singapore Shopping Centre Singapore (239924)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lychee White Peach, Banana Walnut, Pistachio and Strawberries, Chouquettes
data.ABOUT:
Singapore’s first eclair speciality shop, L'éclair Pâtisserie, offers up to ten unique flavours of eclairs daily. Best enjoyed with a fragrant pot of loose tea or a cup of speciality coffee, come down to Singapore Shopping Centre at Clemenceau Avenue and treat yourself to a box of sweet delights.  

Inspired by a stint in Paris and enriched with training at the famous Le Cordon Bleu, founders Sarah Tan and Michelle Looi toyed with multiple flavours before coming up with a multitude of exquisite desserts. Featuring innovative combinations, look forward to pairings such as salted caramel with caramelised popcorn, rose with lychees and strawberries, and more. 

Made in-house daily, the cafe offers eclairs in two sizes: Regular and mini. Beautifully packaged, select your favourite flavours and seal the deal with a coloured ribbon of your choice. The Lychee White Peach is a classic mix of sweet and savoury, with a refreshing fresh fruit cream on the inside. Coated in pink and decorated with petals, this eclair tastes just as heavenly as it looks. Other equally enticing flavours include the Banana Walnut as well as Pistachio and Strawberries. 

Apart from eclairs, L'éclair Pâtisserie also serves Chouquettes, Scones and Pies. Perfect for a high tea session, these stunning desserts are impossible to resist. (Sep 2020)

data.title: LAVO
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Parmigiano, Meatball Brick Oven Pizza, Pistachio Iberico Pork Chop, 20-Layer Chocolate Cake
data.ABOUT:
Experience Italian-American cuisine, 57 stories above ground with LAVO. Bringing to diners the ultimate dining experience with spectacular views in the heart of the city, LAVO flaunts a luxurious lounge with a fully equipped DJ booth situated within the restaurant, making it the perfect pre-party spot before a wild night.

Indulging diners in hearty Italian-American cuisine accompanied by electrifying music, all-time favourites here include the classic Chicken Parmigiano and the famous LAVO meatball. Made of fresh imperial wagyu beef and premium Italian sausage, the meatballs are spiced to perfection and topped with layers of whipped ricotta cheese. An alternative way to enjoy these signature meatballs is to order the Meatball Brick Oven Pizza. Topped with wagyu meatball, tomato agrodolce, ricotta and capsicum, this tasty mix is perfect for sharing among family and friends. Served with braised pork belly and charred eggplant, the Pistachio Iberico Pork Chop is coated in pistachio crust and best enjoyed medium rare. Hearty and satisfying, this huge piece of meat is sure to satisfy your carnivorous cravings.   

Wrap up your meal with LAVO’s famous 20-Layer Chocolate Cake. A highlight not to be missed out on, this decadent chocolate cake is layered with peanut butter mascarpone for a wickedly rich and luscious treat. (Feb 2021)

data.title: LINO
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Italian, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chittara Ala Carbonara, Mixed Mushroom Pizza, Burrata Pizza, Octopus, Calamari, Pork Bolognese Garganelli, Spinach Ricotta Ravioli, Seafood Stew, Char-grilled Iberian Pork Secreto
data.PRESS RELEASE:
LINO is a contemporary, Italian-inspired restaurant located in Singapore’s Binjai Park. The name LINO comes from the word linen, which is used to cover pizza dough as it leavens – a traditional method that helps the dough naturally ferment without interference. Our food is rooted in this same philosophy of utilizing classic cooking techniques that allow flavors to develop naturally and honestly. We specialize in fresh, handmade pizza, pasta, and small plates, and offer a unique beverage program focused on wine, spritzes, craft beer, digestifs, cocktails, and coffee. LINO is your go-to Italian restaurant that provides a relaxed, casual, yet elegant dining experience with both indoor and al fresco seating.

LINO delivers a unique culinary approach to Singapore’s current dining scene by creating contemporary Italian-inspired food that showcases seasonal and locally sourced ingredients. The highlights of LINO’s menu are the homemade, hand-filled pasta and hand-crafted, 48-hour proofed pizza that’s prepared fresh daily and cooked to perfection in a wood-burning oven. (Jan 2019)

data.title: LINO Pizza & Pasta Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Calamari, Burrata, Malfade Cacio e Pepe, Truffle Macaroni & Cheese, Pumpkin Cappellacci
data.ABOUT:
Located in Shaw Centre, LINO Pasta Bar prides itself on its simple and comforting dishes. Boasting a minimalist and sleek interior with delicate touches of olive green and soft pink, LINO Pasta Bar provides a cosy and tranquil establishment that is perfect for an intimate meal.

Prices differ based on the time of your visit, with slight variations between the Lunch and Dinner menu. Start your meal with the Caesar Salad, served with poached egg and delectable pancetta strips, and drizzled with anchovy dressing. For pastas, we recommend the Pumpkin Cappellacci, accented with brown butter, sage, and balsamic. Beyond pasta, LINO Pasta Bar also provides a variety of mains, including the crowd-favourite Eggplant Parmigiana, and the Braised Beef Cheek, marinated in red wine and served with celeriac mash. 

Finish off your meal with dessert and a drink. Sample the delectable Sticky Date Pudding, topped with Vanilla Ice Cream, and wash it down with some sparkling Prosecco. (Jan 2020)

data.title: LQV Le Quinze Vins
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Croque Monsieur, Charcuterie, Squid Ink Risotto, Sharing Platter
data.ABOUT:
Born of a love for the vino, this wine bar was named famously “Best Wine Shop of the Year” by La Revue des Vins de France in 2013, and has grown from strength to strength since. This nook on Boon Tat Street aims to provide an engaging environment for wine enthusiasts to congregate and enjoy some of the best bottles the wineries around the world have to offer. There are over a thousand labels for the picking here, which means that no matter your taste, there is bound to be a wine that will catch your fancy. Can’t make up your mind? An expert French sommelier is on hand to provide tailored advice to suit every palate, event, and budget.

The menu here consists of light nibbles that pair perfectly with wine, such as artisanal cheeses, Croque Monsieur, and Charcuterie. Large groups will find that the Sharing Platter - with cheese, cold cuts, gherkins, and olives - presents a diverse range of pairings for diners to enjoy. For something a little moreish, try the Squid Ink Risotto, a hearty dish flavoured with squid ink for a unique, briny flavour best enjoyed with a glass of red. (March 2019)

data.title: LUKA @ Cross Street Exchange
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Corned Beef Hash Tacos, Ikasumi, Marinara Pizza, Wagyu Skirt Steak, Wagyu Corned Beef Hash Tacos
data.ABOUT:
Known for affordable food, great wine and delightful service, LUKA @ Cross Street Exchange is the perfect place to spend a relaxed evening with friends. 



Headed by chef Takashi Okuno, the Italian restaurant offers over 10 handmade pasta options to choose from, it’s impossible to pick the best! Opt for the Ikasumi for a unique combination of squid ink cream and tomato sauce. 




Sourced from Japan, the wagyu is reared by specialists using traditional Japanese methods, resulting in high quality premium beef roasted in the restaurant's wood fire oven. Similarly, the Neapolitan-style pizzas at LUKA @ Cross Street Exchange are made with specially selected quality ingredients and baked fresh in a handmade oven. Signature dishes include the Wagyu Corned Beef Hash Tacos and the Grilled Sardine Tacos.




Check out the beverage menu and choose from a wide selection of wines, beers and pots of tea to complete your meal. (Feb 2020)

data.title: LUKA @ Tanjong Pagar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Bresaolav, Gnocchi Formaggi, Acqua Pazza, Risotto Di Mare, Margherita, Luka Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
Classy interiors, a wallet-friendly menu, and a central location, are just some of the things that make this gorgeous restaurant one of the most popular watering holes around. Head here with friends after work for some tipples to welcome the weekend at the bar, or romance a date in the elegant ambience of the restaurant - whatever the occasion, this spot has got you covered.
With esteemed chef Takashi Okuno helming the kitchen, diners can expect a riot of flavours from the dishes here. Fresh ingredients, innovative cooking techniques, and an unorthodox take on classic Italian cuisine make for a menu bursting with dishes you wouldn’t find at a typical Trattoria. When in doubt, you can’t go wrong with something that is housemade.Start with the Housemade Wagyu Bresaola- an air-dried cured beef bursting with flavour. The meat has more intense flavours due to the dry ageing process, and as a result, this dish is perfect paired with a glass of red wine from the bar. For something a little moreish, opt for the Gnocchi Formaggi - a four-cheese pasta dish topped with creamy sauce. End off a meal here with the Luka Tiramisu - a coffee flavoured dessert that will leave your taste buds tingling. (Jul 2018)

data.title: La Boca Bistro Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Caribbean, Cuban
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pulpo Gallego, Caribbean Jerk Chicken, Daily Catch, Rum and Raisin Gelato
data.ABOUT:
Sitting in the heart of Kampong Glam, La Boca is a Cuban fusion bistro bar set to bring diners on a gastronomic adventure to the tropic and briny breezes of the Caribbean islands and seas in a burst of rich flavours.

Kickstart your meal with a small plate of Pulpo Gallego. Made with Galician-style octopus and finished with chorizo and Spanish paprika, this yummy plate is great for sharing. Tailored for two pax, the Daily Catch menu option is perfect for an intimate dining session with your significant other. Add on a side of Salsa and Corn Chips or Mixed Greens if you’re still feeling peckish!

Healthier meat options here include the Pulled Goat Curry on Flatbread and the Caribbean Jerk Chicken. Oven-baked to achieve a wonderful golden hue, the chicken thigh is served with black beans, rice and salsa for a filling meal. Throw some Cuban Grill Skewers into the mix for extra flavour. Finish with the bistro’s signature Rum and Raisin Gelato for a refreshingly savoury end. (Mar 2021)

data.title: La Bonne Table
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Seared Castaing Foie Gras, Duck Confit, Tuna Tartare, Five Cheese Pizza, Chocolate Tarte, Creme Brulee
data.ABOUT: Decked out in fairy lights with an airy alfresco dining patio, La Bonne Table is all about bringing a touch of homely comfort to restaurant dining. Run by a husband-and-wife team, the kitchen here dishes out rustic French cuisine with an Italian touch. Indulge in the Pan-Seared Castaing Foie Gras, a slab of creamy goose liver with a buttery crust, served on a slice of toasted French bread with caramelised apples and honey to cut through the richness. A fan of fork-tender meat? La Bonne Table’s duck confit comes apart at the lightest touch. The bird is massaged with salt, garlic, and herbs, and then poached in its own fat for that melting tenderness. Diners will find the Italian touch in creative, house-made pizzas like the Pizza du Chef, topped with three types of cheeses, fresh apples and homemade strawberry balsamic cream. Chill out after dinner with a glass of wine (or two) while you contemplate dessert. The Chocolate Tarte and the Creme Brulee are both to-die-for. (Feb 2019)

data.title: La Braceria
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Antipasto Braceria, Insalata di Rucola, Spaghetti alle Vongole, Ossobuco alla Milanese, Spaghetti with Mixed Seafood, Tiramisu, Mama Cake
data.ABOUT:
Even those ambitious enough to search the streets of Singapore for hidden gems may not come across La Braceria. Located among a row of unassuming stores on a quiet street in the residential neighbourhood of Bukit Timah, La Braceria is an Italian eatery with food so authentic, it will transport you to the Mediterranean Coast.
Although not nearly as understated as its storefront, La Braceria's interior is still modestly decorated, with just a few pieces of artwork on the walls to spruce up the decor. The real focus at La Braceria is the food. The traditional menu includes a variety of antipasti, pastas, meats and pizzas from Naples. Although dishes like Insalata di Rucola, Spaghetti alle Vongole, and Ossobuco alla Milanese may seem standard, La Braceria's food is anything but ordinary, thanks to their fresh ingredients and superior preparation.
Be sure to look in the back for the walk-in wine cellar, where guests can peruse a large selection of wines. After a satisfying meal of high quality, authentic Italian food accompanied by a glass of fine wine, the trip out to La Braceria may seem more than worthwhile. (Oct 2011)

data.title: La Brasserie
data.Hours: A La Carte MenuMon-Fri: 11am-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Le Brunch by the BaySat-Sun: 12-3pm (Last Order: 2:45pm)DinnerMon-Sun: 6:30-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 80 Collyer QuayLobby LevelThe Fullerton Bay HotelSingapore (049326)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steak Frites, Signature Duck Confit with Truffle Potato Mousseline
data.ABOUT:
Located in the heart of the historic Fullerton Heritage precinct, La Brasserie serves local and international specials including classic French bistro favourites in a sleek modern setting alongside salubrious views of the Marina Bay waterfront. With two spacious salons and a private room, all with 10-metre-high windows, and an al fresco terrace, it is an ideal choice for business lunches, intimate dinners and weekend brunch.

 

In line with government regulations, please note that the sale and consumption of alcohol in all food and beverage establishments are prohibited after 10.30 p.m. daily.

 

The safety and well-being of our guests and team members are our top priority at The Fullerton Hotels and Resorts. We have set up rigorous cleanliness practices and safe distancing measures at our restaurants to ensure that you can experience an enhanced level of protection. (Aug 2020)

data.title: La Dame de Pic
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Berlingots, Saga Wagyu Beef, White Mille-feuille, Araguani Chocolate
data.PRESS RELEASE:
One of the world's top female chefs with a total of 7 Michelin stars under her belt, Anne-Sophie Pic makes her much-anticipated debut into Asia with La Dame de Pic, Raffles Singapore.  Anne-Sophie Pic hails from a long lineage of chefs with the Pic family's culinary heritage beginning since their first restaurant started in 1889. As a third-generation Michelin-starred chef, Anne-Sophie Pic follows in the footsteps of her father and grandfather, perfectly reflecting Raffles Singapore's rich heritage that has inspired generations since the iconic property was established in 1887. Indulge in exquisite signature creations such as the Berlingots – iconic pasta parcels found in all of Anne-Sophie Pic's restaurants around the world with unique and slight adaptations to reflect the character of each establishment's locale. At La Dame de Pic, Raffles Singapore the incarnation of the signature Berlingots incorporates an Asian touch with a new flavour association using Red Kampot pepper, which enhances the Berlingots' French cheese fondue filling. Other specialties include Saga Wagyu Beef, roasted Japanese wagyu accompanied with smoked beetroot and a osmanthus-infused mushroom broth; and Blue Lobster slow-roasted with shellfish butter and served with a coriander-and-barley-infused broth. 
The culinary magic continues with desserts such as Anne-Sophie Pic's signature White Mille-feuille, featuring ginger flower light cream, confit grapefruit and Litsea cubeba emulsion; and Araguani Chocolate, which contrasts light Araguani chocolate mousse, Nikka whisky caramel and smoked Tahitian vanilla ice cream for a decadent finish to the dining experience. 
Guests can look forward to beverage pairing options available on request, with an in-house sommelier on the floor to offer recommendations catered to guests' personal preferences. Guests are welcome to bring one bottle of wine of their own and enjoy complimentary corkage when they purchase a bottle of wine. Our sommeliers will also be on hand to enhance your dining experience with a curated wine list that reflects Anne-Sophie's culinary vision.  (Dec 2019)

data.title: La Jiang Shan Hotpot & BBQ (Clementi)
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Steamboat, BBQ
data.Good For: Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.ABOUT:
If you’re someone who can take the heat, make your way over to La Jiang Shan Hotpot & BBQ for a fiery feast.

The mala broth here is packed with a generous amount of dried chilli peppers, giving the soup that spicy and numbing sensation loved by mala fans around town. For those who prefer a milder soup to dip your meats and vegetables in, get the chicken broth, a tasty and flavourful alternative to its spicy sister. All soups are served in individual pots, so there’s no need to fight over the choice of soup base.

La Jiang Shan Hotpot & BBQ offers a value-for-money buffet option for lunch and dinner, where you can enjoy a wide selection of fresh meats, vegetables, and traditional steamboat items. The US beef slices here are generously marbled, and you’ll also find options like golden mushrooms, fresh mussels, juicy tiger prawns, and homemade meatballs. (Apr 2021)

data.title: La Jiang Shan Hotpot (Dhoby Ghaut)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)

If you’re someone who can take the heat, make your way over to La Jiang Shan Hotpot for a fiery feast. 

The mala broth here is packed with a generous amount of dried chilli peppers, giving the soup that spicy and numbing sensation loved by mala fans around town. La Jiang Shan Hotpot offers a value-for-money buffet option for lunch and dinner, where you can enjoy a wide selection of fresh meats, vegetables, and traditional steamboat items.
