data.title: La Maison du Whisky
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 80 Mohamad Sultan Road#01-10The Pier @ Robertson QuaySingapore (239013)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Cocktails, World Spirits
data.ABOUT:
La Maison du Whisky is a bit of a dream. A boutique bottle-shop that brings in some of the hardest-to-score spirits, liqueurs, and mixers into town, it’s also a whisky and cocktail bar that turns its on-shelf selections into some of the best drinks on the island. It’s a one-stop cocktail nerd destination, oh, and of course, one of the city’s best-stocked whisky bars. With knowledgeable bartenders, cocktail gurus, and suppliers constantly on hand to answer your questions or turn you on to their new favourite tipple, this is a veritable temple of booze where you always come away feeling a little more knowledgeable about your tasty poisons.
If you’re looking to be schooled on classic cocktails, look no further. You can order a bracing Sazerac, a classic Old Fashioned, a refined Manhattan, or a frosty Mint Julep, and those are just the whisky cocktails. And if you like what you taste, your bartender can point you to the right spirit so you can take on home to rinse and repeat as much as you like. If you prefer your whisky by the dram (or bottle), simply ask for a recommendation and the bar team will help you out with their cavernous whisky selection, and possibly even arrange for a tasting flight. They’re here to help you have a good time, so just ask away. It’s a small bar, so book your space today! (Feb 2018)

data.title: La Nonna (Holland Village)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Caprese, Mozzarella E Parma, Pappardelle, Lasagna, Macaroni & Cheese A La Nonna Holland Village, Agnello, La Nonna Pizza, Calzone, Panna Cotta, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
There are those restaurants you go to for a cutting-edge, hyper-fusion-y, once-in-a-lifetime experience, and then there are those you keep going back to for good solid food. La Nonna confidently sits in the latter category, with country style Italian fare that not only draws diners, but creates loyalists.
Meaning "grandmother" in Italian, La Nonna indeed channels soulful and rustic fare with an understated decor, and a vast menu that does most of the talking. Go for the classics at La Nonna, where the pasta is lovingly prepared daily, and pizzas are kneaded and wood-fired to cracker-thin perfection. As if straight from a family's recipe book, the simply prepared dishes place great value on the integrity of a just a handful of wholesome ingredients.
At the Holland Village outlet, opt for a table outdoors, ideal for spectating, and nuanced by sparkly, atmospheric lighting. Order a house specialty, the Macaroni and Cheese Della Holland Village for a more authentic version of the pasta dish, with a bright tomato sauce and gratinated Italian cheeses blanketing al dente noodles. The results will tempt you to kiss your collected fingers in the satisfaction that you can only get from a good Italian meal. (May 2014)

data.title: La Pasteleria Kitchen and Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Burnt Cheesecake, Sea Salt Caramel Brownie, Chocky & Chip Muffin, Acai Happiness Bowl
data.ABOUT:
Great for dessert lovers, La Pasteleria is an artisanal patisserie focused on creating delightful cheese cakes, pastries, breads and high quality coffee. With a wide selection of flavours in a variety of pastries made from freshly prepared ingredients, drop by to catch up with friends or family over their delicious Basque Burnt Cheesecake.

A reinvention of the Basque Burnt Cheesecake originating from La Vina, La Pasteleria’s recipe adds a twist to appeal to the local palate. Baked at high degrees in the oven, the cheesecake’s edges caramelize into a natural crust, resulting in a deliciously creamy dessert between a flan and a New York Slice. Available in Oreo, Lemony Cream, and a whole lot of other delectable flavours, these sweet treats are a must try. Other bakes in the store include cookies, brownies and muffins. For a quick meal, salad bowls and wraps are also on the menu. (Nov 2020)

data.title: La Pizzeria at Bridge and Beacon Bar
data.Hours: Tue-Thu: 12-2:30pm, 6-10pmFri-Sat & Eve of PH & PH: 12-2:30pm, 6-11pmSun: 12-2:30pm, 6-10pmClosed Monday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Primavera, Ravioli Spinach and Ricotta, Sautéed Mussels, Vegetable Pizza
data.ABOUT:
La Pizzeria at the Bridge & Beacon Bar is an authentic Italian Restaurant with the guidance of Italian Chef Francesco Romano.

Chef Francesco bring the Romano Family culture to Singapore through his Grandmother recipes to the kitchen set up of the restaurant.

With the warm breeze rolling in from the Gulf of Naples into their rustic kitchen in Lettere, Gennaro Romano and his wife Anna worked diligently with partial skim milk to create the “Caseificio Romano” - a cheese house. This was in the heart of the 1925. The Mozzarella was traditionally made of buffalo milk, Gennaro introduced in his factory a combination of whole cow milk producing a “Fior di Latte”. This mozzarella was sold and distributed from its humble origins in Lettere throughout the Naples, spanning from the Salerno to the rocky cliffs of Roma.

​In 1961, Caseificio Factory changed hands, passing to Gennaro’s son, Vittorio. He kept the original name of the factory and increased production. The family-run cheese factory became well known within Italy for its handmade authentic buffalo Mozzarella and Fior di Latte and up today Vittorio’s son Francesco, continues the tradition from the creation, to the production, to the sales of Caseificio hand-crafted cheeses and as corporate Chef of Italian restaurant chain in Italy and Dubai.

Chef Francesco’s passion and expertise are in each single dish of La Pizzeria at the Bridge & Beacon Bar, all made respecting the traditional recipe of his Grandmother and with the same passion, he trained all our resident Chef.

So come taste a piece of Italy right here in Singapore. These family recipes have been handed down for generations. Be our guest - you will feel right at home. (Jun 2018)

data.title: La Salsa
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pescado a la Brasa, Paella Valenciana, Carne Chimichanga, Langostinos Burritos
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located in Singapore's Dempsey Hill - a world all its own, offering a tantalising Latin menu in a classy domain.

La Salsa features an exotic menu with mouth-watering selection of appetizers, soups, salads and main courses that will tantalize any taste bud. Be prepared to savour the distinctive flavours of Chimichangas, Burritos, Chilli Con Carne, Fajitas and crunchy Nachos. Relish our authentic and scrumptious Quesadillas, Enchiladas with favourite thirst-quenching, full-flavoured Margaritas and our classic homemade Sangrias. (Jul 2019)

data.title: La Scala Ristorante (The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 13 Stamford RoadArcade @ The Capitol KempinskiSingapore (178906)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Burratina & Pomodorino, Spaghetti Costiera, Pizza Calabrese, Mini Cannoli Siciliani, Gnocchi Mammoli, Zuppa Pescatrice
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Taking its name from the La Scala Opera House in Milan, the world-renowned theatre inaugurated in 1778 and is today considered one of the most important and beautiful opera theatres, La Scala Ristorante sets to bring the flavours of Italy in its modernized space that still retains touches of Italian tradition like exposed red-brick walls, wooden floorboards and white Roman pillars, tied together with by a striking green oven, in which pizzas are baked fresh.
La Scala Ristorante seeks to bring the tastes, sights and sounds of a buzzing Italian summer’s day to Arcade @ The Capitol Kempinski with a menu that shines with antipasti, soups, pastas, pizzas and desserts, complete with the most wholesome Italian touch. (Sep 2019)

data.title: La Stella by Tamaya
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cappuccino Style Mushroom Soup, Gnocchi Roma, Cartoccio, Manzo
data.ABOUT:
From handcrafted pizzas and pastas, as well as Ossobuco and Chicken Piccata to Beef Carpaccio, La Stella By Tamaya has got it all! A celebration of comfort food, the Italian restaurant is tucked away on the second floor of a shophouse right in the heart of Singapore. 

Ready your stomach for the feast ahead with a Cold Meat Platter. A delicious mix of sherry figs, cornichon and roasted capsicums, the platter can be shared amongst all at the table. Follow up with a warm bowl of Cappuccino Style Mushroom Soup. 

Dig into the highly recommended Gnocchi Roma. These homemade potato dumplings are made up of bacon, cherry tomatoes and topped with chilli and fresh basil. For the pasta lovers, the Cartoccio is a bowl of tangy spaghetti accompanied by prawns and scallops cooked in a mouthwatering tomato sauce, before being baked in parchment paper. Meat lovers can look forward to satisfying their carnivorous cravings at the restaurant with the Manzo. A plate of braised USDA beef short ribs, this meaty dish is absolutely delightful.

Wrap up your meal with the Panna Cotta for a deliciously sweet ending. (Feb 2021)

data.title: La Strada
data.Good For: Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Whole Organic French Chicken, Lamb Ragu Tagliatelle, Japanese Red Seabream in ‘Aquapazza’, Smoked Pigeon, Amera Tomatoes
data.ABOUT:
La Strada, which means ‘The Street’ in Italian, is a modern Italian restaurant set up to bring reimagined Italian dishes to people who enjoy an intimate meal in a comfortable yet modern setting. Located along the corner street of Shaw Centre, the journey of our guest begins right from the moment we open the doors till they take their leave. Get ready to be swept away by this charming ristorante.

Start strong with signature starters like the succulent Roasted Australian Rock Lobster served alongside celery and almonds with aged balsamic; the flavoursome Smoked Pigeon accompanied by a unique combination of spinach, beetroot and horseradish; the Japanese Amera Tomatoes a beautifully curated dish of full-bodied Amera tomatoes, zucchini, capsicum and fennel pollen. Spectacular new mains will feature a hearty Lamb Ragu Tagliatelle and the flavourful Japanese Red Seabream in ‘Acqua Pazza’ with clams, kombu, and tomato broth. Alternatively, enjoy the perfectly juicy Roasted Whole Organic Chicken with acquerello risotto, perfect for sharing between two people. End the meal on a sweet note with La Strada’s range of desserts which include Cannoli and the all-time favourite Limoncello Tiramisu. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Lafiandra Ristorante
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bruschetta ai formaggi con funghi, Vitello Tonnato, Melanzone alla parmigiana della nonna, Linguine di grano duro alle Vongole, Tagliatelle Rustichella alla Boscaiola, Ossobuco di vitello da latte con risotto alla parmigiana, Costata di vitello Alla Milanese
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Lafiandra Ristorante opened in 2003, and has recently moved from their previous location at the Singapore Art Museum to their new home in Tanglin.

Brenda handles the front of house, while Cataldo cooks every dish in the kitchen. Wiith an extensive selection of antipasti, homemade pasta, risotto and main courses, the 80-seater restaurant offers a wide section of authentic Italian fare. Cataldo strongly believes that everything should be cooked a la minute, and there is no such thing as a quick meal at his restaurant. (May 2019)

data.title: Lagnaa... barefoot dining
data.Good For: Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Chicken, Threadfin Fish Curry (Ikan Kurau), Kathri Pachadi (Aubergine), Yoghurt Rice, Cranberry Naan
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Lagnaa, a one-of-a-kind bistro on Upper Dickson Road in Little India, is a welcome refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city. You are invited to take off your shoes, sit on the floor, and enjoy the restaurant's Indian cuisine.

For those who are not really into sitting on the floor, the restaurant's ground floor offers an alfresco seating arrangement. The graffiti wall is something to behold. The "vandals" have expressed themselves.

Owner and Chef Kaesavan (K7) who oversees every aspect of the restaurant from music to menu says: "At Lagnaa we invite you to bare your feet and feed your soul."

The cuisine at LAGNAA, is the expression of the surrounding... and the best of Indian food.

Come sit with me on the floor.
The Drinks Cold
The Foods Warm
The Friendship’s Free. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Lai Bao Fish Head Steamboat 徕寶鱼头炉
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Steamboat, Zi Char, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sixties Fish Head Charcoal Steamboat, Curry Assam Prawn in Claypot, Grandma’s Recipe Pork Belly, Pomelo Salad Yam Ring
data.ABOUT:
Lai Bao Fish Head Steamboat 徕寶鱼头炉 located in Toa Payoh aims to bring the best of local Singaporean Zi Char to your dinner table. Elevating local Zi Char fare, it provides an innovative reimagination of local favourites that remain rooted in its origins.

Try Lai Bao’s Sixties Fish Head Charcoal Steamboat. The broth, comprised of collagen soup, is creamy and deliciously thick. Simmering for hours on end, the flavours of the soup are rich and warms you right to the core. The use of charcoal creates an aromatic smokiness to the soup, creating a robust flavour. Diners can choose between grouper and snapper, as well as a spicy or original soup. Further add-ons include pork meat pies, forest mushrooms, yam, and an assortment of fresh vegetables.

Don’t miss Lai Bao’s other dishes, including the gorgeously plated Pomelo Salad Yam Ring, adorned with poached chicken slices, cherry tomatoes, peanuts and prawn. The aromatic Curry Assam Prawn in Claypot is also great. The intense earthy flavours from cooking in the clay pot complement the sweet taste of the prawn, with a sweetness that’s further accentuated by the medley of spices in the curry. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Lantern
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 80 Collyer QuayThe Fullerton Bay HotelSingapore (049326)                                                Map
data.ABOUT:
Recognised as one of the best hotel bars in the world by CNNGO.com, Lantern is a stylish addition to the bar scene at the sophisticated Marina Bay waterfront area. With an unbeatable view of the resplendent Singapore skyline, it’s no surprise that Lantern attracts only the most stylish and trendiest people in Singapore. 

Paying homage to its locale and setting, the custom–designed circular bar counter is shaped like a lantern with bronze metal fins and is where the magic happens. Skilled bartenders sling out a wide variety of cocktails, including the Peach Berry Sling, a modern take on the classic Singapore Sling. The smoky and intense 45–day aged Bourbon whisky adds a certain depth and complexity to the classic Manhattan cocktail. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Lao Beijing
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5:30-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Sat-Sun & PH: 11am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 3-5pm (Last Order 4:45pm), 6-10pm (Last Order 9:30pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Skin Roast Duck, Beijing-style Sweet and Sour Fish, Xiao Long Bao, Shrimp, Pork and Chive Guo Tie, Dan Dan Noodles
data.PRESS RELEASE: Serving authentic Northern Chinese fare, noodles and juicy dumplings, Lao Beijing is a favourite venue for family dining and cosy gatherings. Diners can expect to tuck into all-time favourites such as Crispy Skin Roast Duck, Beijing-style Sweet and Sour Fish, Xiao Long Bao, Shrimp, Pork and Chive Guo Tie, Dan Dan Noodles and many more delectable dishes. It has bagged numerous awards and retains its position as one of Singapore's top restaurants in Singapore Tatler's 'Best Restaurants' guide. (Jul 2017)

data.title: Lau Nuong Saigon - Vietnamese Steamboat and Charcoal BBQ
data.Cuisine: Vietnamese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Southeast Asian, Steamboat, BBQ
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Saigon Crispy Fried Spring Roll, Salad Bowl, Steamboat, Charcoal BBQ
data.ABOUT:
An authentic Vietnamese restaurant that offers steamboat and charcoal BBQ, Lau Nuong Saigon is centrally located along Circular Road. Boasting an extensive menu of family-style delights, revel in crowd favourites such as your classic Vietnamese rolls, pho, banh mi and more! 

Dive head first into the messy yet delicious process of creating your own banh xeo. Stuffed with cilantro, basil and lettuce, this savoury crepe packs a punch with its sweet and sour dipping sauce that will definitely make your day. The Saigon Crispy Fried Spring Roll is a tasty sharing dish made for enjoying with family and friends. Shatteringly crisp on the outside, each spring roll is filled with a juicy pork, mushroom and vegetable filling that will have you reaching out for seconds. Enhanced by rich and flavourful spices such as cinnamon, cloves and cardamom, the steamboat broth is chock full of flavour and will surely transport you to the streets of Vietnam. 

If you’re craving a lighter bite, choose from one of the three Salad Bowls available at the restaurant for an equally scrumptious meal filled with fresh vegetables, dry rice vermicelli and a protein of your choice. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Lawry's The Prime Rib Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 333A Orchard Road#04-01/31Mandarin Gallery Mandarin OrchardSingapore (238897)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Roasted Prime Rib of Beef (Lawry's Cut), Broiled Atlantic Lobster Tails, Truffle Rosemary Crusted Lamb, Traditional Lump Crab Cake, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail, Atlantic Lobster Dinner, Lawry’s Idaho Baked Potato, Silver Side Trio
data.ABOUT:
Located in the heart of Orchard Road, Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore is distinguished for its exceptional American cuisine; serving only the best.

Overlooking the vibrant streets of Orchard Road through the 4-metre high floor-to-ceiling windows, Lawry’s boasts a seating capacity of up to 170. It exudes an air of opulence with its sleek interpretations of luxury.

Be prepared to indulge in their authentic Signature Prime Rib of Beef! Each standing roast is aged for up to 28 days to heighten tenderness and slowly roasted on beds of rock salt, a method that forces the juices inward and ensures uniformly juicy and flavourful meat. It is then carved from the famous Silver Carts and served with table-side showmanship of the Original Spinning Bowl Salad. End your meal on a sweet note with Lawry’s Signature dessert- the Strawberry English Trifle.

data.title: Lazat
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Indonesian, Malaysian, Vietnamese, Local, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 2 Bukit Batok West Ave 7 #01-09C Singapore (659003)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Nasi Lemak, Belachan Drumlets, Signature Truffle Fried Rice, Salted Egg Prawn
data.ABOUT:
Get more bang for your buck at Lazat! Located right in the heartlands of Bukit Batok, the restaurant offers authentic and traditional Malay, Chinese and Grilled Fare at pocket-friendly prices.

Choose from a wide array of mains, toast, and drinks for a fuss-free lunch. A delicious rendition of Singapore’s local favourite, the Nasi Lemak is a tasty plate full of coconut rice, fiery prawn paste and crunchy bits of ikan billis. The Lontong is also another equally fragrant dish that features sweet slabs of compressed rice cakes drenched in a mouthwatering coconut milk based soup. Fill up your stomachs by making it a set with a steaming hot cup of Hot Kopi or tea. 

Take your pick of flavoured toast from the restaurant’s extensive menu of signature toasts. The Tuna Mayo and Peanut Butter are popular crowd favourites that you simply can’t leave without trying. Add on a side of Belachan Drumlets or Truffle Fries for a delightful meal filled with different fusion fare. For those looking for a taste of authentic chinese cuisine, indulge in a bowl of mouthwatering Signature Truffle Fried Rice with a plate of Salted Egg Prawn, Kung Pao Chicken and many other Chinese classic delicacies. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Le Bistrot Du Sommelier
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: L'Entrecote de Boeuf au Poivre, Rabbit Rillette, Country Style Pork Terrine, Garbure, Cuisse de Canard Confit aux Choix, Creme Brulee a la Vanille de Madagascar, Duck Rillettes
data.ABOUT:
Located along the historic Armenian Street, Le Bistrot Du Sommelier feels so French you half expect to find Marius and Cosette from Les Misérables sitting at the next table having a quiet tête-à-tête.
Indeed, the menu is filled with dishes that are as quintessentially French as the Eiffel Tower. The restaurant makes all its dishes daily, and aims to fill you up with traditional French food created with seasonal ingredients. A highlight not to be missed here is their beef menu - L’Ardoise de Boeuf - which offers an array of beef served in various styles that ring true to the French way of cooking. Classics include the Tartare de Boeuf (beef tenderloin tartare served with French fries) and Joue de Boeuf Braisée au Vin Rouge (red wine braised beef cheeks). Looking to share? The Côte de Boeuf Angus Rôtie Au Four sees oven roasted Angus prime beef ribs, served with shallots and garlic confit, makes for a perfect dish for two.

Whatever you do, do not miss the very popular Rillette Bar where you can savour homemade French charcuteries. The rillettes, pâtés, terrines, and sausages are all available in small servings, which means that you can go crazy as you try the whole range available, before washing everything down with a choice wine from the extremely impressive wine list. The only thing left to do after that is to stagger out into the sunshine with a very contented belly. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Le Bon Funk
data.Hours: Tue-Thu: 5pm-10:30pmFri-Sat: 12pm-10:30pmWe serve an extended bar menu between 2:30pm-5pmClosed Sunday and Monday
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Naturally Leavened Sourdough Bread, House-Cured Charcuterie, Vegetable Crudités with Whipped Roe, Cedar Jelly with Foie Gras on Toast, Grilled Iwashi Sardines, Whole Heritage Chicken, Celery Custard and Buckwheat
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Le Bon Funk is a natural wine bar by The Lo & Behold Group. Located on 29 Club Street, it is the brainchild of Chef-Owner and Burnt Ends alumnus, Keirin Buck.
Le Bon Funk brings "fine casual" to Singapore's food and beverage realm with its refreshing blend of exceptional boutique wines and elevated plates, all set in a convivial atmosphere. The name, Le Bon Funk, is a tongue-in-cheek jibe at the misconception that all natural wines taste funky (we think they are much more). It is an open invitation to not take oneself too seriously and to always be a 'glass half full' kind of person. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Le Fusion
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Imperial Double Boiled Soup, Braised Abalone Seafood Rice, Chendol
data.ABOUT:
Located in the hip Mohamed Sultan area, Le Fusion specialises in modern Chinese fusion cuisine that intersects East and West. Offering a one-of-a-kind dining experience, Le Fusion is a melting pot of well-loved recipes and modern cooking techniques. 

The interior of Le Fusion is apt, a true amalgamation of Eastern and Western traditions in all forms. Gently lit by red lanterns, its walls are decorated with graffiti-esque pop art, with neon signs providing an extra je ne sais quoi. Be sure to try their Imperial Double Boiled Soup, accompanied with premium nu er hong. Alternatively, the Pan-seared Salmon that is infused with Japanese mirin, and further seasoned with bearnaise sauce and baby romaine is also a standout.

No meal is complete without some dessert! Be sure to try Le Fusion's excellent Chendol, topped with coconut milk and Bailey's cream, for an additional pick-me-up! (Dec 2019)

data.title: Le Noir (Marina Bay Sands)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 2 Bayfront Avenue01-84Bay Level, The Shoppes at Marina Bay SandsSingapore (018972)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Cakes, Lava Burger, Trio Cheese Pizza, Classic Breakfast
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Le Noir offers a full food, drinks & live entertainment experience while enjoying spectacular views of the Singapore River.

Located along the promenade of the iconic Marina Bay Sands, the venue features a unique blend of wood, marble and touches of gold; emanating in a sophisticated yet cozy atmosphere that is perfect for any occasion.

Wine, dine and dance the night away, with a delectable variety of western fare including our must-try lava cheese wagyu burger and savory crab cakes; delicious signature cocktails, and a line-up of live performances from talented local and international artists. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Le Rida (Mediterranean, French & North Indian Cuisine)
data.Cuisine: Bar, Indian, French, Greek, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: French Onion Soup, Foie Gras, Black Angus Sirloin Steak, Lebanese Kofta Kebab, Shish Taouk, Beef Shikaf Kebab
data.ABOUT:
Meat is the name of the game at Le Rida in Bukit Timah, a cosy little eatery that specializes in mezze-style grilled meats and steaks. Riding on its mezze theme, communal dining is encouraged, and a big part of the menu is shared platters of pitas and hearty Middle-Eastern dips like hummus, Iabneh, and motabal, which whet your appetite for the main part of your meal: the grilled meats.
A mix of Middle-Eastern skewering and French-style grills, the menu here features classics like spicy tender lamb-mince kofta kebabs served on saffron rice and crunchy greens, minced chicken kebabs flavoured with Iranian spices, and flame-grilled seafood kebabs. These rub shoulders with French classics like French onion soup, grilled foie gras in a savoury-sweet orange sauce, and other carnivorous plates like crisp-skinned duck confit, a rich fricassee of chicken with cepes mushrooms, and a selection of premium flame-grilled Angus and Wagyu beef steaks, each steak served with a classic Bordelaise sauce, pomme frites, and buttered haricot beans. At Le Rida, there’s a little bit of something for different carnivorous appetites. Plus you get to jump across continents and cuisines, all at the same dinner table! (Nov 2016)

data.title: LeBar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort and Spa Hotel2 Bukit Manis RoadSentosaSingapore (099891)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Afternoon High-Tea, Tuna Tataki, Singapore Chilli Crab Cakes
data.ABOUT:
An breezy gourmet bar nestled within the Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & Spa, LeBar is a stunning, uniquely designed colonial pavilion channeling the 19th century. Overlooking the resorts pool, the sun-drenched bar serves as the quintessential spot to mosey around or enjoy a tête-à-tête with friends and family as you nibble on artisan sandwiches, French pastries, fragrant teas, and more.
And well, if you're looking for something a bit glamorous, wait till the sunsets. The contrast of the the mahogany floors and eclectic furnishings, along with the glistening waters, creates a stunning stage to whisk the night away with their tempting tipples and tantalising tapas. (Dec 2015)

data.title: LeVeL33
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 8 Marina Boulevard#33-01 Marina Bay Financial CentreSingapore (018981)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Tri-Tip, Spent Grain Pasta, Layered Honey Cake
data.ABOUT:
Standing at 156 meters above ground level, LeVeL33 literally rises above all breweries as the world's first microbrewery installed at the penthouse of a skyscraper. Located on the 33rd floor of Marina Bay Financial Centre, the restaurant houses 8,000 kg of state-of-the-art microbrewery equipment in a spacious restaurant featuring breath-taking panoramic views of Singapore skyline, as well as an open-air Terrace.

LeVeL33 offers guests a multi-zone dining experience and ambiance, from refined privacy to social revelry.

The refined LeVeL33 Dining Room exudes a mellow ambiance suited to business lunches, dinners and/or special occasions and is specially designed to ensure more comfort and privacy.

LeVeL33 Social was designed for social interaction and encourages a buoyant atmosphere for guests to relax. With sharing menu and the new Raw Bar that offers an array of seafood such as oysters, guests are able to enjoy a truly heightened dining experience. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Legacy Seafood
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shimmering Sand Crab, Claypot Crab Bee Hoon Soup, Golden Pumpkin Prawns, Salted Egg Prawns
data.ABOUT:
Draped in quirky crab regalia is a quaint little seafood cove doling out the best of crab, fish, prawns, and more! Legacy Seafood is simple seafood done exceptionally well. The menu has it all, from traditional favourites to unique renditions, so ordering one of everything is a must!
The family-style concept is perfect for those groups looking to try a little bit of everything, with items like their Shimmering Sand Crab - also their claim to fame - being a true delight. The mesmerizing Claypot Crab Bee Hoon Soup is a personal favourite, and we've come to learn the hard way that one order is never enough. The broth is simmered for hours which makes for an extremely flavourful stock, and a dish we really begrudgingly share with friends and family - it's just that good! (Jan 2016)

data.title: Leopold
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Vegetarian Friendly, German
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Traditional Beef Goulash, Curry Sausage, Slow Roasted Marinated Pork Collar, Leopold Chicken Drumlets, Austrian Apple Strudel, Cajun Shoestring Fries, Calamari Rings, Austrian Apricot Dumpling
data.ABOUT:
With a sleek modern décor and cosy ambiance, Leopold, a 40 seater restaurant on Tanjong Pagar serves the first of its kind in Singapore, the AGS menu. AGS stands for Austrian, German and Swiss. The concept of sharing plates, a half portion of the main course plating was the idea by owner, Klaus Leopold. He wanted to give guest the opportunity to savour common cuisines of German speaking countries.
Choose from Leopold’s modern take on the beef goulash, using wagyu beef slow cooked for 3 hours, traditional food like Swiss Rösti or the Austrian Leberkässemmel (meat loaf bread roll sandwich) as well as German sausages and Flammkuchen.  Match your dinner from the over 50 labels of wine or try Leopold’s own spirit brand, Leopold organic sloe gin or the list of own cocktail concoctions.
Served with passion, modern yet original is the key. It’s clear to see why Leopold guarantees a great time with your friends and colleagues. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Lerouy
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.ABOUT: It’s modern French cooking that’s served at Lerouy. True to the modern ethos that permeates the entire establishment, the setting features an elegant, winding counter which curves around an open kitchen. The restaurant offers a tasting menu which evolves and changes from time to time, but which constantly features exciting creations with the chef’s strong individual stamp. Diners can choose between the Petit or Grand options, with the difference being the number of courses. The only thing predictable about Lerouy is the consistently excellent cooking which never fails to impress, so do head down sometime soon and give it a go! (Oct 2020)

data.title: Les Amis
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cold Angel Hair Pasta, Erquy Scallop & Caviar, Roasted Line Caught Seabass, Camus Artichoke, Pheasant, Williams Pear, Crisp Sugar Sphere
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Since its inception in 1994, Les Amis, the sophisticated first-born of the Les Amis Group, has always strived to maintain the restaurant's philosophy - to deliver the ultimate fine-dining experience realized through attention to detail and dedication to sourcing and serving the finest ingredients.
After picking up the reins at Les Amis in 2014, Chef Sebastien has made it his mission to further the restaurant's philosophy by emphasizing the focus on the quality of ingredients used, rather than targeting the latest cooking trends. Today, 90% of the ingredients used at Les Amis are imported from France, carefully crafted and skilfully presented in an elegant setting of luxurious comfort. (Nov 2016)

data.title: Les Bouchons @ Ann Siang
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Os a Moelle (Beef Bone Marrow  with Toast), Grilled Black Angus Rib Eye Steak with Vigneron Butter, Jumbo Prawn Grilled with Olive Oil, Giant “Cote de Boeuf”
data.ABOUT:
A classic destination for the tradition of bistro style steaks and the ever important French fry, Les Bouchons is certain to become your next go-to steakhouse.

The look of Les Bouchons defies any whim of trendiness and sticks to the standards of bistro design: curvy backed chairs and white tablecloths simply dressed with the essential fork, steak knife, burgundy napkin, and wine glass, sit upon tiled floors both inside and out on the charming patio. The shophouse locale fits the look, transporting the restaurant to a simpler time and slowed down pace in small town France. And with the upcoming selection of to-die-for steaks and free flow fries, you'll be glad to feel the minutes slipping by at their leisure.

Start with the Os A Moelle, or beef bone marrow served with crisp toasts. The meaty butter-like spread is indulgently delicious, and an ideal primer to the protein heavy meal. The mains are simply stated, and all come with sides of salad and endless frites. The Grilled Sirloin Steak with Herbs is a particular star as is "The Real Entrecote" from Normandy, which is best to be shared among pairs. The steaks are clearly of premium quality and cooked to rosy pink perfection with a caramelised char on the outside. The accompanying fries are of medium thickness with fluffed centers and crisped coatings, ideal for dipping into the classic sauces of mustards, bernaise, mayonnaise and horseradish.

However, the steak haven is no one-trick pony. On the weekends, the talented kitchen pulls out all the stops with the Couscous Royal, a tempting platter of marinated and grilled lamb, chicken and Merguez sausage upon a flavored bed of couscous. Or else try the Jumbo Prawn, kissed by the grill and drizzled with olive oil to bring out the natural sweetness of the crustacean. The dish is another reminder from Les Bouchons that French cooking needs only the very basics to be done well. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Les Bouchons Rive Gauche at Robertson Quay
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Os a Moelle (Beef Bone Marrow with Toast), Grilled Black Angus Rib Eye Steak with Vigneron Butter, Free-flow Homemade French Fries and Salad, Jumbo Prawn Grilled with Olive Oil, Giant “Cote de Boeuf”

data.title: Levant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Smoked Duck & Truffle Samosas, Avocado Hummus, Sundried Tomatoes, Citrus Tree
data.ABOUT:
Perched on the rooftop of a conservation shophouse in Tanjong Pagar, Levant is a stylish, cosmopolitan open-air bar that crafts out sleek cocktails and Mediterranean-inspired mezze plates perfect for sharing. The menu plays with the flavours of the region, mingling citrus with exotic spices and florals.

Smooth grooves, sassy beats and the cool city breeze set the tone for nights of reunions and rendezvous. Stylish and bold, the expansive menu experiments with the different flavours of the region, mingling citrus with exotic spices and florals. Gear up for a lovely feast featuring the restaurant’s sleek cocktails and Mediterranean-inspired mezze plates here.

Embark on a journey of sensual florals, intriguing herbs and spices with a hot mezze starter. Truffle lovers should opt for the Smoked Duck & Truffle Samosas. A hearty serving of meat and samosas, this delicious plate is drizzled with Mango Amba sauce for a refreshing finish. Served with pita bread, the cold mezze options are also aplenty. The Avocado Hummus is a nutritious and tasty dish perfect for the health-conscious. Other vegetarian menu options include Stuffed Olives, Sundried Tomatoes, Roasted Artichokes and more. 

Wash your meal down with a glass of Citrus Tree. A heady mix of Gin, Citron and Citrus Smoke, enjoy your cocktail spiced, dry, or spirituous here at Levant. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Li Bai Cantonese Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shark’s Cartilage Soup, Crystal Skin Dumpling, Bird’s Nest Soup, Barbecued Peking Duck, Steamed “Live” Red Garoupa
data.ABOUT:
Named after the famous Tang-dynasty poet, the ambience at this Sheraton Towers stalwart is a feat in and of itself. Think Jade table settings, bone chopsticks, and discreet waitstaff. The dining concept here harkens back to the days of grand Emperors in China, so you can expect fresh ingredients and premium nosh in an equally opulent setting. Located centrally, the menus here cater to a variety of diners, so whether you’re after a exquisite business lunch or a cosy dinner, veteran chef Chung Yiu Ming’s delicious creations have got you covered.
The executive lunch set is a big hit with office workers, as is the dim sum menu, which features an array of delicate nibbles crafted with premium ingredients. We especially love the Crystal Skin Dumpling, a tender creation bursting with colourful vegetables. Meals here begin with the classic Chinese delicacy, Shark’s Cartilage Soup. Rich, tender fish maw and Goji Berries are the crowning glory of this light soup, that makes for the perfect precursor to the carefully curated cuisine that follows.
Whether you’re a seasoned diner or completely new to Cantonese cuisine, if you’re after a taste of Hong Kong, this is the place for you. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Lighthouse Bistro & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Norwegian Salmon Bath, Milked-Battered Calamari, Maine Lobster Tail, Fishermen’s Board, Darling Downs Wagyu, Fishermen’s Angel Hair, Mary’s Butter Cake, Honey Charred Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by their illustrious maritime history, Lighthouse Bistro shines brightly in a little corner off Jellicoe Road. Since 2003, it has provided both members and non-members of the Singapore Maritime Officers’ Union with a place to socialise and unwind. If you want to enjoy fresh and tasty seafood in a good ambience, you won’t go wrong with Lighthouse Bistro.
If you’re in a big group, pay homage to the bistro’s past by having the Fishermen’s Board - a platter of tiger prawns, fresh blue mussels, crispy Atlantic dory, and garlicky, spicy batavia squid. Enjoy the Milk-Battered Calamari that is topped with copious amount of chicken floss and tangy lemon tartar sauce. For mains, the Fishermen’s Angel Hair is a great fusion noodle dish with a spicy sambal kick. If seafood is not your thing, fear not! Soaked in a special marinate for 24 hours, the Honey Charred Chicken emerges completely tender and succulent, definitely a crowd favourite for a reason. For a sweet finish, try Mary’s Butter Cake, which is a buttery vanilla cake topped with either chocolate or vanilla ice cream, cookie crumbles, and berries.
The team at Lighthouse Bistro is extremely dedicated and driven to create good memories for you. Since its founding, it has undergone three major revamps to provide a refreshing experience. By providing quality at affordable prices, it is of little wonder that many of the diners are repeat customers. For those looking to experience the trinity of great food, great price, and great ambience, look no further than Lighthouse Bistro! (Nov 2016)

data.title: Lime House Caribbean Restaurant & Bar
data.Hours: Tue-Fri: 5-10:30pm (Last Order Food & Drink 10pm)Sat: 12-10:30pm (Last Order Food & Drink 9:45pm)Sun: 12-10:30pm (Last Order Food 8:45pm & Drink 9:45pm)Closed Monday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oxtail Eggplant, Dhal Mushrooms, Seafood Tostones, Caribbean Rice Bowls, Curry Goat, Signature Jerk Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Here at Chope, we are willing to do a lot for great eats. But if satisfying our Caribbean cravings means taking a long haul flight to the western hemisphere, that's where we draw the line. Thankfully, all we need is a trip to Chinatown, where buzz-worthy Lime House Caribbean Restaurant & Bar is just the place to get our Caribbean eat, drink, and party on!
 
Set in a beautifully restored shop house, the ambiance prepares you for "liming", which is Caribbean lingo for chilling with friends. Given rave reviews for its authentic island cuisine - a rare find in Singapore - Lime House Caribbean is a mecca for those looking to indulge in good vibes, friendly gatherings and a Caribbean menu devised by their head chef from Barbados, Kirk Brathwaite. Having had extensive experience working at some of the most luxurious resorts in the Caribbean, he means serious business when it comes to churning out delicious fare.
 
Kirk puts his spin on classics but isn't afraid to introduce new and exciting dishes that evoke the Caribbean. Pepper Shrimp, Seafood Cakes, Calypso Fish, Blue Mountain Steak, Fire Roasted Stuffed Sweet Potato, and Tropics Cheesecake, it's an endless list of punchy flavours. With a “welcome home” philosophy at the core of the Lime House Caribbean Experience, diners are also free to make themselves comfortable by sharing hearty platters of Wings, Sliders, and an assortment of other trademark Caribbean bites that are sure to become favourites.
 
Renowned philosopher Captain Jack Sparrow once posed the existential question, "But why is the rum gone"? Well, we're happy to confirm that it isn't, and that Lime House Caribbean has a plentiful stash that would make any pirate jealous! That being said, you are encouraged to continue your liming on the second floor, with a classic punch in hand! (Dec 2018)

data.title: Lime Restaurant at PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering
data.Cuisine: Bar, International, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: 3 Upper Pickering StreetPARKROYAL COLLECTION PickeringSingapore (058289)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Hokkien Prawn Noodle Soup, Truffle Mac & Cheese, Lobster Risotto with Blue Swimmer Crab Meat, 36-Hour Braised Australian Wagyu Cheek, Singapore Luxe-sa with Maine Lobster, Organic Corn Fed Chicken Breast filled with Forest Mushrooms
Please note that the above dishes are from the à la carte menu.
data.ABOUT: Lime is a vibrant, modern restaurant with a friendly, welcoming atmosphere, offering guests a warm and inviting setting to enjoy a wide range of local, Southeast Asian and International culinary delights. Three open kitchens set the stage for a fascinating display of skill, as in-house chefs deftly transform an assortment of fresh ingredients into signature creations. (Apr 2016)

data.title: Limoncello
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ravioli Della Casa, Rucola e Prosciutto di Parma, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT: Limoncello is a hidden gem in Robertson Quay. Located below the residences at the Riverside, Limoncello serves up freshly made pizzas and pastas in a spacious, yet inviting setting. This laidback Italian eatery is great for a casual date or even a night out with the family. (Aug 2011)

data.title: Lin Rooftop Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Empress Har Cheong Wings, Truffle Fries, Salted Egg Calamari Rings, Garlic Butter Grilled Prawns
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Lin [林] is a contemporary Asian alfresco rooftop bar located right in the heart of Tiong Bahru. Positioned on the rooftop of Link Hotel, we stay true to our philosophy of “doing it better on top”.

Lin [林] is focused on entertaining you 6 days a week and serving up delicious authentic Asian cocktails with a twist. Expect fine whiskeys paired alongside local favorites such as Empress Har Cheong Wings, truffle fries, salted egg calamari rings and other delicacies. As the night progresses, it’s no surprise you’ll find yourself dancing under the moonlight! (Sep 2019)

data.title: LingZhi Vegetarian (Liat Towers)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mixed Fresh Fruits and Kale Salad with Vietnam Rice Skin, Mushroom Truffle Bisque, Homemade Carrot Cake Topped with Ice Cream, Poached Mixed Rice with Vegetables, Vegetarian Satay Served in Fresh Pineapple
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Chinese Vegetarian Gourmet Cuisine is served at LingZhi. Its innovative and quality dishes have kept many, vegetarians and meat-lovers alike, coming back for more since 1991. Gone are the primitive, conservative style of preparing vegetarian dishes with mock meats, artificial colouring, and additives. In its place, is a range of dishes filled with wholesome goodness, and tonifying fare prepared from the finest, freshest, natural as well as organic ingredients.
Each dish is meticulously prepared to ensure that it is well-represented and the cooking methods used allow maximum retention of the original tastes and nutritional values. This, of course, is no small feat, achievable only by chefs who have honed their culinary skills over several years of hard work. So whether you follow a strict vegetarian lifestyle or are someone who's looking for healthier, tastier options, we welcome you to the exciting culinary world of LingZhi Vegetarian. (Jul 2017)

data.title: Little Elephant SG Thai Bistro
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Kung, Grilled Pork Neck, Stir-Fried Morning Glory, Prawns in Lemongrass and Honey Sauce, Mango Sticky Rice
data.ABOUT:
Little Elephant SG Thai Bistro will whisk you to the land of smiles with its array of authentic Thai dishes and decor that evoke the vibes of an old-school Thai eating house. As with most Thai restaurants, dishes are served communal style, so grab a few buddies.
Start with several hot and cold appetisers such as the Papaya Salad, Homemade Prawn Cake, and Grilled Pork Neck. Get the feast going with a selection of Thai soups, curries, mains, and rice and noodle dishes. All-time favourites such as Tom Yum Kung, Pineapple Rice, and Pad Thai star alongside lesser-known gems like Stir-Fried Morning Glory and Prawns in Lemongrass and Honey Sauce.

After working up a sweat with all that spicy goodness, cool down with a refreshing Thai Milk Tea or Chang Beer. Be sure to leave room for dessert too. You won't want to miss their rendition of the sweet and tangy Mango Sticky Rice. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Little Farms Bistro
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Australian, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Burgers
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Big Breakfast, Vegetarian Burrito, Classic Reuben Sandwich On Rye, Flourless Chocolate Cake Slice
data.ABOUT:
Specialising in dishing up healthy bites that feel good and taste delicious, Little Farms Bistro uses the highest quality fresh ingredients that are all-natural for a mindful approach to healthy living. Fresh for the neighborhood, look no further than Little Farms Bistro to feast without guilt on savoury dishes and sweet pastry treats along with coffee, juices and smoothies. The bar also serves up a specially curated wine list alongside craft beer on tap and a wide range of signature cocktails that are as delicious as they are eco-friendly.

Start off your morning strong with a shot of Macchiato. Sure to leave you refreshed and rejuvenated, this shot of caffeine is all you need to fuel you up for a busy day ahead. Pair with a side of Big Breakfast to complete your morning. Featuring baked beans, grilled mushrooms, vine ripe tomatoes, bacon, and sourdough toast, take your pick of beef or pork sausage and enjoy this hearty serving of breakfast delights.

Fresh sandwiches are also available on the menu for a quick grab and go. Recommended favourites are the Vegetarian Burrito and Classic Reuben Sandwich On Rye. Wrap up your meal with a tantalising slice of Flourless Chocolate Cake Slice for a decadent end! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Little Lamb Hotpot Suntec (小尾羊)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 3 Temasek Boulevard#03-304/305Sky Garden Suntec City MallSingapore (038983)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lamb Ribs, Braised Lamb, Mala Xiang Soup, US Beef Slices, Kurobuta Pork Slices
data.ABOUT:
Nothing spells communal dining quite as much as a hotpot dinner. Adding to the fray of hotpot joints in Singapore is Little Lamb (Xiao Wei Yang), located in Suntec City mall.

The star of the show here is the Mala Xiang (spicy Sichuan) soup, made from plenty of dried chilli peppers, ginger and ginseng for a vibrant red soup base that packs a fiery punch. Order from a wide selection of fresh meats to swish and swirl in your choice of broth. The US beef slices and Kurobuta pork slices are generously marbled, and you’ll want to save room for the Lamb set as well. Try the signature Lamb Ribs, or the Braised Lamb that is good for sharing between three to four persons. 

Wash it all down with a pot of hot Chinese tea, that will help to balance out the rich dinner. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Little Lazy Lizard
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Poached Salmon, Roasted Game Hen, Triple Cheese Beef Burger, Lazy Lizard’s Sirloin, Green Tea Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
Just a stone’s throw away from Sixth Avenue MRT, Lazy Lizard is a quaint restaurant that dishes out Western cuisine at pocket-friendly prices. 

A must-try on the menu is the Crispy Poached Salmon, a wholesome dish showcasing a fork-tender fillet of slow-cooked fish, scented with a citrusy lemon oil, and paired with roasted garden vegetables. The Roasted Game Hen is another delicious dish to tuck into. Here, half a spring chicken is generously seasoned with garlic and herbs, then roasted to yield a crispy, golden-brown skin and succulent, juicy meat. The dish is served with red mashed potatoes and a drizzle of red wine sauce. 

If you are looking to sink your teeth into a juicy burger, the Triple Cheese Beef Burger is the thing to order. US choice beef patty is stacked with grilled bacon, mushrooms, and triple gruyere cheese. A sunny-side up egg completes the tasty picture. Best savoured with your bare hands, and plenty of napkins on the side to wipe away those delicious juices. (Sept 2019)

data.title: Little Sheep Hot Pot @ One Fullerton
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Australia Sirloin Beef Cubes, Lamb Roll, Double Flavour Hot Pot, Four Mushroom Soup, Tomato Soup
data.ABOUT:
If hotpot’s your thing, Little Sheep Hotpot spot is sure to be right up your alley! Founded in the early 2000s in Inner Mongolia, this greenhorn shook up the hotpot scene in China with their innovative hotpot -- minus the dipping sauce. Their rich broth all but made up for the lack of condiments, and the recipe has stayed consistent for over eighteen years. What’s so special about the broth? The savoury soup base, made with seven special spices and mutton from Inner Mongolia, retains its signature flavour even after long hours of boiling. 

The Four Mushroom Soup is one of their most popular broths. Earthy and not too spicy, this base choice adds richness to all the items added. Meat-lovers are sure to enjoy the array of dishes on offer for the hotpot. The Australia Sirloin Beef Cubes are rich and buttery, and absorb the spices of the soup, enhancing the meat’s flavour with a spicy kick. One of their most raved options for hotpot is the Lamb Roll, which consists of paper-thin slices of lamb rolled into small tubes. The meat cooks quickly and is thin enough to soak up all the broth’s flavours. The lamb cuts are available on their own or as a combination with beef slices. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Live Twice
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wasabi Cheese Terrine, Hamachi Tartare, Cheese Sando, Beef Katsu Sando
data.ABOUT:
Live Twice, the Jigger & Pony Group’s newest cocktail establishment, is an intimate cocktail bar that takes inspiration from the mid-century modern era in Japan. Vintage fittings and cosy alcoves transport guests to the heart of Tokyo — notably post-war Ginza in the ‘60s.

The minimalist menu features 14 cocktails, each carefully crafted to celebrate the true character of spirits. If you’re fluent in Japanese cocktails, you’ll know that nothing in the drink, even the condiment, is unnecessary.

For a rich and complex drinking experience, try the Mizuwari, a combination of Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, Nikka Coffey Malt Whisky, and Hokkaido soft water that’s been steeped in an earthen pot for at least three days. Those who prefer a dessert in a glass should go for the Almond Mimosa, an ambrosial potion of prosecco blended with toasted almonds and marzipan.

Besides tipples, Live Twice excels in the food department too, offering a selection of elevated izakaya food. Light bites include the Wasabi Cheese Terrine, where fresh wasabi is grated on cubes of cream cheese, while heartier appetites will be satisfied by a range of sandwiches such as the Beef Katsu Sando. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Lobby Lounge & Bar at Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
data.Cuisine: Bar, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 11 Cavenagh RoadHoliday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre,Singapore (229616)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Sliders, Fish Fingers, Grilled Mini Sausages, Homemade Potato Wedges
data.ABOUT: The perfect venue for daily Happy Hours and all the latest sporting action, Lobby Lounge & Bar is the place to unwind after a day of sightseeing, shopping or work. Guests can pamper one’s self with a dainty high tea set or simply enjoy a collection of tasty cocktails complemented with savoury snacks from the kitchen. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Lobby Lounge @ Marriott Tang Plaza
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Raspberry Lychee Red Velvet Cupcake, Mini Sugar Donut, Brandy Dark Chocolate Cake, Salted Caramelised Rocher
data.ABOUT:
Offering an elegant and comfortable setting, drop by The Lobby Lounge @ Marriott Tang Plaza anytime time of the day to enjoy a casual, open layout with natural lighting, textured stone floors and wooden panels. A great place with beautiful sunlight for a cup of traditional afternoon tea, the lounge transforms into an ideal spot to unwind over red wine and martinis by night. 

Indulge in the old-school charms of traditional English afternoon tea and satiate your taste buds with a selection of delicious afternoon snacks and assorted savourites. Pair with your choice of tea or coffee for a relaxing afternoon catch up with family or friends. 

Inclusive of a complimentary glass of welcome cold brew white tea, the English Afternoon High Tea set comes with a variety of sweet and savoury treats. Start with the Raspberry Lychee Red Velvet Cupcake. With a harmonious balance of sweet and sour, the subtle lychee flavour provides a refreshing hint that ties in the different flavours together perfectly. A sugary treat to satisfy your sweet tooth cravings, the Mini Sugar Donut tastes as sweet as it looks. Sprinkled with sugar and glazed, these mini donuts are the epitome of sinfully sweet confection. For those who like a hit of extra zing, the Brandy Dark Chocolate Cake is a decadent indulgence not to be missed out on. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Lobby Lounge at The Westin Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cantonese Fried Marinated Shrimp Paste Chicken, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg Yolk Sauce, Grilled Chicken and Beef Satay, Green Day Cocktail, Gin Basil Smash Cocktail, Seafood Afternoon Tea
data.ABOUT: With the Marina Bay area getting prettier by the day, you’ll want to get a seat at this lobby cafe which offers some of the most gorgeous views of the waterfront on the island. It helps that the view is framed by the chic interior decor and heaving tiers of tea-time treats, all of this several floors above the ground at one of the “highest” hotel lobbies in the city. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Lobster Air
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Premium Oyster Plate, Lobster Salad topped with Salted Egg Fish Skin, Lobster Spinach Pasta, Lobster Bisque
data.ABOUT:
Calling all lobster and travel lovers! Lobster Air provides diners with an enjoyable First and Business class dining experience. With a menu inspired by actual airline food served in those categories, the restaurant whips up classic delights such as Lobster Pasta, Premium Oyster Plate and more.

Follow the dedicated cabin crew staff to your seat and prepare for a feast in the skies. Start with a light plate of Tofu Lobster Salad or the Lobster Salad topped with Salted Egg Fish Skin. While it’s a less healthy option, the latter is worth every calorie, rewarding diners with a satisfying crunch in every bite. Baked with garlic butter sauce and served with a house salad, choose to either satisfy your seafood cravings with half a lobster or a whole lobster. Piled with a hearty portion of organic spinach pasta, the Lobster Spinach Pasta is also a healthy main option filled with juicy lobster, greens and a generous serving of noodles to fill you up. 

For passengers who are looking for a lighter selection, the restaurant’s short haul menu is made for you. Featuring steamed lobster meat, opt for the Lobster Salad topped with sunflower seeds and drizzled with Japanese roasted sesame dressing for an extra crunch. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Lolla
data.Good For: Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cinco Jotas Jamon Ibero de Bellota, Scrambled Eggs with Bottarga di Muggine, Beef Tongue Escalopes, Tuna Belly "Chutoro" Tartare, Sea Urchin Pudding, Doughnuts with Lemon Curd, Steamed Dark Chocolate Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Drawing from its underground supper club roots, Lolla fits right in on Ann Siang Hill with a petite but confident concept featuring uncompromising ingredients transformed into renowned small plates.
If you think modern design, communal dining, artisan ingredients and small plates could be the description of any number of popular nouveau restaurants in Singapore, you'd be right. However, Lolla has proven itself to be the cream of the crop, as evidenced by the standard wait list for a reservation to sample their fare. Here's some insider intel: book for lunch, where you can request a seat at the coveted bar (which is saved for those few well-timed walk-ins come dusk) and avoid the feeding frenzy of dinner time service. Why is the zinc-plated bar the place to be? From here, you can watch the compact kitchen create the wondrous small plates that have earned Lolla international acclaim.
Such plates include the Sea Urchin Pudding, a deceivingly miniature vessel of deadly-rich egg yolk custard, blackened by squid ink and topped with tangerine-coloured morsels of urchin plucked straight from the ocean. The dish is at once thick and light, the depths of umami refreshed by a spritz of the sea. The Beef Tongue Escalopes are similarly brilliant, tenderized to banish any minerally gristle and which presents a unique meaty flavour spiked by pickled sides. The Scrambled Eggs with Bottarga is a high-end play on the smoked salmon breakfast staple, the feathery eggs punctuated by shavings of fish roe. All dishes benefit from a glass of bubbly, which is intentionally the bar's specialty. It's a fitting choice since the extraordinary dining experience at Lolla isn't exactly a steal, making it ideal for special occasions.
In the basement, a large, democratic table-for-all accommodates the majority of diners, a design choice that loosens up the mood. The concrete and bare bulb ascetic is softened by vintage touches like antique crystal vases posted alongside family-sized cans of artisan ingredients atop the bar. The menus are simply stated and printed with Victorian comics on paper placemats. The décor, along with the exceptional culinary musings served, ensure that Lolla really lives up to the hype. (Jul 2014)

data.title: Lombardo's Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Singapore Fling Burger, Pork-A-Licious Burger, Grilled Chicken & Avocado Sandwich, Classic Beef Burger
data.PRESS RELEASE:
At Lombardo's - it's all about taste! That’s our motto. We carefully select the best quality ingredients and labour to make all our food fresh every day. 

The best burgers, sandwiches, salads, freshly made juices all served with a smile and a whole lot of love.

Follow our journey from Amsterdam to Singapore as we open our first outlet in Singapore at 15 Duxton Road. We are open daily for lunch and dinner and we serve beer and cocktails there too! (Sep 2019)

data.title: Long Beach @ Dempsey
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Original Black Pepper Crab, Scottish Razor Clam, Southern Australian Lobster, Grilled Chicken Satay.
data.ABOUT:
Singapore’s leading seafood restaurant and creator of the original and best black pepper crab since 1982, Long Beach Seafood invites you to enjoy a vast array of exclusive live seafood delicacies. 

Coated with piquant black pepper sauce and stir-fried, the Original Black Pepper Crab is a signature seafood dish that is not to be missed out on. Another all time bestseller, the Scottish Razor Clam is steamed in a light and aromatic sauce with minced garlic and vermicelli, topped off with luscious royal razor clams and a crunchy smattering of fried garlic. Other mouthwatering seafood dishes include the Air Flown Live Alaskan King Crab, Southern Australian Lobster and Dungeness Crab. 

For a different dining experience, smaller groups can opt to try out the sampling menu. Specially curated to serve and satisfy diners in small portions, the food selection consists of a variety of local favourites. Sweet and spicy, the Grilled Chicken Satay skewer features a savoury peanut sauce glazed with pineapple puree and paired with cucumber and onion slices. Cooked in a delectable chilli gravy with generous bits of fresh crab meat, the famous Chilli Crab is best enjoyed with sake or beer. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Long Beach IMM
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Live Geoduck Sashimi with Superior Stock Steamboat, Steamed Live Scottish Razor Clam, The Original Black Best Black Pepper Crab, Famous Chilli Crab
data.ABOUT:
A pioneer seafood restaurant in Singapore, Long Beach impresses as the creator of the original and best Black Pepper Crab of Singapore. Today, the restaurant’s menu has expanded to include exciting new seafood dishes cooked with the freshest Singapore produce.

Prized for its remarkably sweet, sea fresh flavour and crunchy texture, the Live Geoduck Sashimi with Superior Stock Steamboat is a pot of perfectly sliced sashimi best enjoyed in superior stock hot pot. Another great dish to get the party started, the Steamed Live Scottish Razor Clam that comes served with minced garlic and vermicelli is ideal for sharing!

The star of the show here at Long Beach is undoubtedly the different variations of crab on offer. Spice lovers should opt for the Famous Chilli Crab for a taste of the sweet and savoury. Served with your choice of fried or steamed buns, this fiery rendition of a local classic is a must-order. Other signature favourites include The Original Black Best Black Pepper Crab and Classic White Pepper Live Alaskan King Crab. (Apr 2021)

data.title: LongQing
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Marinated Beef and Omasum Tripe, Chilled Seaweed with Homemade Sauce, Crispy Fish Head, Fresh Prawns, Handmade Pork Balls, Handmade Beef Balls, Hand Pulled Noodles, Mushroom Platter, Signature Chilli Beef Tenderloin, Prime Beef, Pork Collar
data.ABOUT:
Hands down one of the coolest hotpot places we’ve seen, LongQing’s concrete walls feature street-style murals – done in monochromatic colours, naturally – that complement the edgy metal and wood furnishings. You can get pre-selected sets for two to go with unusual appetisers like Marinated Beef and Omasum Tripe or Chilled Seaweed with Homemade Sauce, but for finickier folk, a la carte gives you a range of options that can’t be beat.
Choose Spicy Ma La, Tomato, or their Signature Clear Broth to begin and then plop in savoury bites such as Crispy Fish Head, Fresh Prawns, handmade pork and beef balls, and a generous handful of vegetables ranging from Garland Chrysanthemum to classics like Chinese Cabbage and Spinach. If you’re like us, however, the stars of the show will be the meat offerings. Lamb Shoulder, Prime Beef, Signature Chilli Beef Tenderloin, chicken; the array can almost seem endless. Steamboat never struck us as particularly trendy but LongQing’s proving to be hotpot for the hip! (Jul 2016)

data.title: Loof
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.ABOUT:
Singapore’s quintessential local rooftop bar, Loof, opened its doors to happy revellers back in 2005. Named in a playful reference to the idiosyncrasies of local speech and culture, ‘loof’ is a play on the way Singaporeans pronounce ‘roof’. Awarded as Singapore's best rooftop bar, Loof serves up quality whimsy, fresh nostalgia and unbridled playfulness in an urban garden atop Odeon Towers in downtown CBD.

Enjoy carefully crafted Southeast Asian inspired cocktails that are familiar yet unique. Cocktails in the limelight include Firecracker, a gin-based concoction that playfully pairs the flavours of watermelon and chilli with just the right amount of spice to pack a punch. Another must-try is Rum, Forrest, Rum, a refreshing blend of dark rum, pandan-infused Amaro Montenegro and pineapple husk-infused syrup. The Set B is a buzzy spin on the Singaporean breakfast staple of traditional kopi and kaya toast with vodka, Mr. Black coffee liqueur, kaya and espresso.

In nostalgic tribute to Loof’s earlier years, signatures such as the Loof Bubble Tea and the cheeky Uncle Tee-Kee continue as mainstays on the menu. For guests seeking other speciality libations, Loof also offers a wide variety of Asian spirits, from Japanese whiskies and sake to local craft beers Sunday’s Brew and Lion Brewery.

The cuisine, aptly coined ‘Dude-Sin’ (Dude-Singaporean), is a modern Singaporean riff on typical bar grub done in a style that is anything but ‘atas’. Divided into four categories: chip chip, sticks and balls, and buns, the menu features bar snacks full of local flavour from every Singaporean’s favourite Chilli Crab Dip to our bold take on the notorious Ramly Burger.

After all this time, Loof continues to offer the best view of the Raffles Hotel and her surrounding area and remains one of the hippest and funkiest places to meet old friends and make new ones. There’s a palpable energy that permeates the bar, and sitting there, amidst the skyscrapers, urban gardens, and buzzing crowd of locals, expatriates and tourists, you can’t help but be swept up in that pulse of the city night. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Los Amigos Taqueria
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Con Carne Nachos, Alitas Picantes Mexicanas, Beef Quesadillas, Churros Con Chocolate
data.ABOUT:
Los Amigos, which means "the friends" in Spanish, is a friendly taqueria and bar that welcomes guests with Mexican small plates, desserts, and drinks. The cosy interior is great for a catchup session with friends, while the alfresco dining area is perfect for enjoying the breeze and watching the crowds go by.

Start with Chilli Con Carne Nachos that come with a generous serving of minced beef, mozzarella, jalapeño and homemade salsa, before moving on to heartier dishes like the Alitas Picantes Mexicanas, Mexican wings with jalapeño aioli, and the Beef or Chicken Quesadillas.

You can't call your trip to Los Amigos complete without having some classic Mexican cocktails to go along with your meal. The Raspberry Margarita and Gin Basil Smash are crowd favourites, but a range of draft beers and spirits are also available if you prefer.

Wrap up your meal on a sweet note with the Churros Con Chocolate, a platter of mini churros with a decadent chocolate dip. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Lubnan Authentic Lebanese Cuisine
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cheesy Lamb Shank, Wara’ Inab, Mezza Platter, Chicken Kofta
data.ABOUT:
Lebanese cuisine is a niche cuisine in Singapore, but the dishes at Lubnan are sure to convert your tastebuds. Decorated in authentic Lebanese style with tiled walls and Middle Eastern music, this spot serves up authentic and delicious dishes at affordable prices. Nestled in the historic Kampong Glam district, Lubnan has had no trouble making a name for itself amongst all the famed Malay eateries that surround it. 

Start with some light dishes to whet your appetite. The Wara’ Inab is an excellent option. Made with rice, parsley, onion, tomato, and wrapped in vine leaves, these bite-size rolls of heaven are the perfect way to start your meal. Diners in big groups may want to order the Mezza Platter to share. A large platter with wells filled with Hummus, Babaganoush, Arabic Salad, and various other starters. This is the perfect option to get a taste of Lebanese cuisine without ordering everything on the menu. For something a little heartier, opt for the Cheesy Lamb Shank. Made with a generous portion of lamb shank cooked in an authentic Lebanese sauce and topped with melted cheese, this dish is definitely big enough to share, but why would you want to? (Jan 2019)

data.title: Lucha Loco
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mexican street corn, ceviche, wagyu beef and crab tostadas, Mexican truffle quesadilla, Baja fish, lamb, chorizo and prawn tacos, Mexican jerk pork ribs and Pan fried barramundi. Finish off with their famous Super churros. A wide range of vegan and vegetarian dishes.
data.PRESS RELEASE: Set in a lush tropical garden at Duxton Hill, Lucha Loco is a festive and vibrant Mexican restaurant and garden bar that serves up a variety of contemporary Mexican dishes.  With a selection of the finest tequilas and innovative cocktails, Lucha Loco provides an authentic and festive Mexican experience for all.  A perfect setting for romantic dates, catch ups, parties, birthday celebrations and weddings. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Lumo
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions

data.title: M&S Café (Wheelock Place)
data.Cuisine: All-Day Breakfast, British, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: British Fish & Chips, Wood Fired Pizza, Bircher Muesli, Fish Finger Sandwich, Sweet Potato Falafel, Melting Middle Chocolate Pudding
data.PRESS RELEASE: M&S Café (Wheelock Place) Singapore is the world’s first table service café by Marks & Spencer. The 60-seater M&S Café offers a full menu of items such as all-time favourite British Fish & Chips, Wood Fired Pizza and lighter meals such as sandwiches and salads. Recently, over 20 new dishes were introduced such as traditional Bircher Muesli, Fish Finger Sandwich, Sweet Potato Falafel, Chicken Korma Curry and more. (Jul 2019)

data.title: MARUKYU
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Sushi, Bara Chirashi, Omakase Tsuduni, Omakase Fue, Omakase Mai, Gyu Niku Koumiyaki & Sashimi Set, Wagyu Bento
data.ABOUT:
Past the doors, a conservation shophouse in trendy Telok Ayer melts away into a bamboo-clad, softly-lit sushi bar redolent with the aromas of soy sauce, fresh seafood, and sake. Behind the bar, the diligent Chef Derrick Lau chats up some guests at the bar while delivering plate after plate of sushi made from the freshest catch of the day. There’s not much of a menu here, just a few tiers of set meals, filled up by whatever the chef decides is best to serve that day. Omakase is the word, and you leave your meal in the capable hands of the chef and his direct-from-Japan supply chain.
Depending on the season, feast on tender slices of monk fish liver, creamy cod milt, fatty tuna belly, and year-round favourites like sea bream, salmon, yellow tail, and horse mackerel. Chef Lau, a huge favourite among Japanese cuisine connoisseurs in Singapore, is well-known for his innovative and sophisticated omakase menus, so whenever you drop by, you’re in for a treat. If you’re not looking for a special-occasion omakase meal, there are bento-style set dinners here too, like pan fried beef, seasonal sashimi and tempura on rice, Wagyu steak, and a bountiful Bara Chirashi, a bowl of rice topped with chopped sashimi. Whatever your needs, budget, and desire for indulgence, there’s something for you at MARUKYU: it’ll be a meal to remember. (Nov 2016)

data.title: MO BAR
data.Good For: City Views, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Location: City Hall, Marina Bay, Promenade, Marina Central
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sarimanok, Chamoe, Thunder, Milkyway, Panacea, Gyu-Katsu Sando (Breaded Wagyu Beef and Bulldog Sauce), Tiger Prawns (Masala Mayo and Curry Leaves) and Lobster Roll.
data.PRESS RELEASE: Recognised as one of Asia's 50 Best Bars 2020 and inspired by the Pacific Ocean and rich culture of Asia's ports, MO BAR is a vibrant experience that celebrates the flavors and aromas of the region. Blending the finest ingredients with progressive techniques, bespoke cocktails and beverages range from refreshing to spirituous, with each artfully presented by Mandarin Oriental's talented team.The innovative cocktail menu can be paired with eclectic light bites, while the hotel's popular afternoon tea is also served daily, featuring artisan pastries and a myriad of accompanying delights. With breathtaking views of Marina Bay, by day or night, and a chic design, MO BAR is the hottest destination in Singapore. (Jun 2020)

data.title: MOONBOW
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Carpaccio, Prawn “Gambas”, Hokkaido Scallops Orzo, The Salmon Fish & Chips
data.ABOUT:
Serving a delectable menu made up of Modern European cuisine infused with a delightful Asian influence, MOONBOW dishes up an array of eclectic dishes presented on exquisite ceramic tableware. Pamper your senses in the heart of Dempsey Hill with a sumptuous feast today! 

Perfect for intimate meals, it’s love at first bite here at MOONBOW with soul booster soups, wholesome vegetables and a delicious spread of desserts for a sweet ending. Kickstart your meal with a plate of Wagyu Carpaccio. A match made in heaven, slices of seared wagyu beef are paired with purple mustard and truffle shoyu for a savoury dish that will surely whet your appetites. Seafood lovers can opt for the Prawn “Gambas”. Peppered with coconut crumbs and coconut emulsion, this serving of succulent ocean Tiger Prawns is a great start to a hearty meal. 

Those who prefer something lighter can order The Heirloom Tomatoes or Heart of Palm for a nutritious starter. Move on to the mains with the restaurant’s tantalising European plates such as the Hokkaido Scallops Orzo, The Salmon Fish & Chips, as well as the Angus Beef Short Rib. (Apr 2021)

data.title: MY Cafe & Bar
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Stuffed Chicken Breast, MY Special Pizza Base, Mutton Biryani, Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
MY Cafe & Bar is what modern bistronomy looks like, where casual multi-cuisine dining meets an eclectic bar.

Available round the clock, the Stuffed Chicken Breast is a crowd favourite. Garnished with ricotta cheese and sun dried tomatoes, the chicken breast is stuffed with hazelnut, crab meat, mashed potato and seasonal vegetables. Another hot favourite at the cafe is their thin crust pizza. Fresh from the oven, there are six different kinds of pizzas to choose from, including the cafe’s NJ Special Pizza Base. A tasty combination of mozzarella, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, asparagus and zucchini, this signature pizza is delicious and filling! Flavours across Asia can also be found here in dishes such as the Mutton Biryani and Chicken Tikka Gravy.
