The drinks menu also offers a wide variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Sporting a fun and casual ambience, MY Cafe & Bar promises to bring all diners a good time. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Madame Fan (The NCO Club)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wok-Fried Crispy Duck, White Pepper Crab, Lobster Cantonese with Wanton Noodle, Drunken Chicken Soup, Scallop Shumai, Jasmine Pork Ribs, Australian Rib-eye with Sarawak Black Pepper
data.ABOUT:
From the English-style lighting to the lush gold interior, everything about this restaurant radiates elegance.  Opened by acclaimed restaurateur Alan Yau, Madame Fan represents a shift from the in-your-face luxury of traditional Chinese dining to a more subtle opulence. This is reflected in the menu, which focuses on premium ingredients cooked to bring out their best flavours. 

The Wok-Fried Crispy Duck is a must-try. Made with tender duck meat fried to perfection, this dish is crisp on the outside, tender on the inside, and goes perfectly with a bowl of steamed rice. Another signature plate at this restaurant would be The White Pepper Crab, a less searing version of one of Singapore’s most iconic fare. This seafood delight preserves the airy egg white sauce but uses white pepper for a more delicate flavour. 

Diners who love their carbs can indulge in the Claypot Japanese Rice With Japanese Sweet Potato. The claypot cooking enhances the taste of the dish and its accompanying items, giving the rice a heartier taste, while the Japanese sweet potato provides some delicate sweetness, balancing out the flavours. The Lobster Cantonese with Wanton Noodle is another great option as the lobster meat is lightly sweet and juicy, and pairs perfectly with the tender noodles. (June 2019)

data.title: Madrinaa Italiano
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: Blk 44 Jalan Merah Saga#01-60Chip Bee Gardens Holland VillageSingapore (278116)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Linguine, Truffle & Mushroom Risotto, Gluten Free Pizza, Misto Di Mare Cacciatore, Tortelli Crab And Lobster, Fettucine Boscaiola
data.ABOUT:
Standing as a bastion of heartfelt Italian cuisine since 1995, Michelangelo's has recently launched a new a la carte menu that goes right back to their roots: traditional, home-cooked Italian cuisine at an exceptional price point. Service here is warm, friendly, and personal. Helmed by the affable Jacylyn, service is as much part of the nostalgic charm of the restaurant as the timeless dishes they have on offer. Their outdoor tables have a casual elegance that look (and feel) incredibly comfortable, and during the drier months of Singapore's skies, are an excellent place to have a long, wine-enriched dinner with friends.
On the new menu, the Appetizers section is headlined with Michelangelo's famed Calamari Fritti. The light crunchy morsels come with two dipping sauces, and it's no wonder they come highly recommended by regulars and staff alike. The menu now offers two pasta sections: Pasta Classico which offers a range of Singapore’s favourite pasta selections, and Pasta Speciali where all your Michelangelo's signatures return to delight you once more. There are, of course, non-pasta options like the Seafood Cartoccio, which is a sublime medley of seafood cooked in a white wine and tomato broth wrapped in a paper package.
It's a varied and delicious sounding menu, and since we’re sure that Michelangelo's will still be winning fans for many years to come, you’ve got all the time you need to try every single option that tickles your fancy. (Sep 2012)

data.title: Mag's Wine Kitchen
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Foie Gras Terrine, Hokkaido Scallops, Argentinian Beef Tenderloin, Brine and Seared Pork Ribeye, Asparagus Risotto with Seared Boston Lobster
data.ABOUT:
Long a favourite among CBD folk looking for a good lunch, Mag’s Wine Kitchen offers contemporary French bistro fare with sophisticated service and ambiance that manages to be homey, and not in the least bit stuffy. A massive wine room calls invitingly as you sit down to order, so you may as well crack open a bottle and make an event of the visit.
The superb plates certainly demand some vino as accompaniment: think starters of bouncy Hokkaido Scallops, or Australian beef carpaccio done up with lashings of black truffle and sesame dressing. For an extra classic touch, spread some croutes with a smearing of Foie Gras Terrine, perfect with a semi-dry white wine as you wait for your mains. The more classic fare on the plats principaux, from Argentinian Beef Tenderloin given the simple salt and jus treatment, to an elegant risotto of asparagus and seared Boston lobster, sweet, buttery, and indulgent. Dessert is a refined affair of peaches poached in fragrant amaretto, followed by a platter of French cheeses to elongate the meal alongside the good conversation and more wine. The French do it right, and this is an invitation to indulge and turn a simple meal into a luxurious event. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Magal BBQ (마포갈매기)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Galmaegi, Kkotsal Jumulleok, Beef Platter, Mapo Galmaegi, Mapo Kaisamgyupsal
data.ABOUT:
Nestled along the quaint streets of Telok Ayer, the unassuming Magal Korean BBQ has built up quite a reputation for its authentic Korean fare and irresistible marinated meats perfect for the barbecue. But this should not come at a surprise - this cosy establishment is but one of more than 400 outlets worldwide. 

Tuck into some traditional Korean favourites such as the Bibimbap, Wang Galbitang, a  delicious back rib beef stew, or the signature Galmaegi, where tender pork, surrounded by an egg crust, is cooked on a special grill. Here with company? The Teugsu Budae Jjigae, a hearty kimchi stew topped with generous portions of sausage, ramen, beef bulgogi, tofu, and many other toppings, is a satisfying crowd pleaser that’s perfect for sharing, especially on a rainy day. But of course, the spotlight’s on the barbecue and nothing beats the Signature Combo featuring boneless short ribs, marinated short ribs, pork belly, sliced brisket coated with mouthwatering spices and sauces that will have you coming back for more. Don’t forget to order some sides to complement your meal; our favourites include the Chicken Feet Roast and the Grilled Prawns with Salt. 

Work around the area? Magal also has some irresistible lunch specials and cold noodles sure sounds like an excellent idea when it’s 30 degrees outside! (Sep 2018)

data.title: Magosaburo
data.Good For: Fine Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Ribeye, Kobe Chateaubriand, Exclusive Karubi, Zabuton, Superior Cut Tongue
data.ABOUT:
Book your seats at Magosaburo if you like your beef of an excellent grade. For starters, this elegant Japanese restaurant brings in some of the best Ohmi and Kobe beef, featuring exclusive cuts like the zabuton, a prime yakiniku cut taken from just behind the neck. Tender and flavourful, it’s a must-have at authentic yakiniku restaurants. For melt-in-your-mouth beef, the Ohmi Wagyu Ribeye is streaked with a mesmerising web of snow, served tableside, cubed and grilled. 

Got a beef with wagyu? The menu here also includes other meats like Hungarian pork belly slices. Marinated in Korean sauces, the grilled meat is wrapped in a leafy lettuce, and savoured with a dash of spicy paste. 

Don’t worry about the smell of smoke getting in your hair; the exhaust system in Magosaburo is one of the most efficient ones we’ve experienced so far. You’ll leave smelling just as good as when you entered. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Maison Marie Bistrot
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 380 Upper Bukit Timah RoadThe Rail MallSingapore (678040)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oyster Flight, Roasted Tiger Prawns, Charolais Beef Ribeye, Brulee Lemon Tart
data.ABOUT:
Welcome to a one-of-a-kind fresh market and bistro in Upper Bukit Timah that specialises in bringing authentic flavours of Europe to discerning palates in Singapore. Boasting a dual dining and shopping concept, the fresh market and bistro represents two different experiences in a single space. 

Get to taste what you see when you pop over to the bistro after a leisurely stroll through the fresh market. Filled with various products and produce from around the world, the fresh market is the perfect place to conduct your grocery shopping trips. If you’re on the hunt for an unforgettable dining experience, Maison Marie Bistrot offers an exciting selection featuring the Oyster Flight selection. Mix and match plump and succulent oysters from a range of premium oysters sourced from different parts of France. 

Seafood lovers can also indulge in the Roasted Tiger Prawns. Roasted and grilled using a charcoal oven and topped with parsley and garlic oil, the juicy prawns come served up with fluffy slices of toast. Made of excellent quality beef and drizzled with a smoky in house Choron sauce, the Charolais Beef Ribeye is simply irresistible. Other signature favourites here include the Octopus Bolognese, Whole Mediterranean Seabream, Brulee Lemon Tart, and more. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Majestic Bay Seafood Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Local, Dim Sum, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 18 Marina Gardens Drive#01-10Below Flower Dome, Gardens By The BaySingapore (018953)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kopi Crab, Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, Seared Chilli Crab Meat Buns, Glutinous Rice Dumplings with Fresh Cream Stuffing, Crispy Shredded Duck Jiang-Nan Style, Baked Rice with Assorted Seafood
data.ABOUT:
From all the flavours of savoury crab you love, to some you've probably never tried before, the creative kitchen at Majestic Bay Seafood Restaurant is bound to please with the culinary flair that's come to be synonymous with the Majestic name.
Both the Chilli Crab and Black Pepper Crab deservedly get their fair share of fandom from both locals and tourists alike. But while Majestic Bay Seafood does a wonderful rendition of both, what you should really be there for is Chef Yong Bing Ngen's award-winning, signature creation: the Kopi Crab. This dish is a reflection of Chef Yong's culinary philosophy that Chinese cooking is a great canvas for bold, artistic flourishes. Tossed with a sauce made from fruit jams and juices, and three varieties of coffee beans, the crab's flavours blend harmoniously, leaving you savouring every last morsel! Flambéed tableside, it's one of those dishes that you never knew was missing from your foodie bucket list until you've tried it.
If you're fishing around Gardens by the Bay for a light bite, Majestic Bay Seafood also fits the bill. Its tantalising dim sum, only available for lunch, is worth a visit on its own. Pick from local favourites like Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, oozing with creamy goodness, or signatures like their Seared Chilli Crab Meat Buns.
Dining at Majestic Bay Seafood is as much a feast for the eyes as it is for our bellies. Indeed, if it weren't for the restaurant's impressive waterfront view of Marina Bay, and magnificent display of 3D textured artworks by Singapore-based artist Hong Zhu An, we'd be sorely tempted to pack a basket of that dim sum for a picnic among the lush greenery! (Aug 2014)

data.title: Majestic Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 5 Straits View#04-01Marina One The HeartSingapore (018935)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Xiao Long Bao in Bak Kut Teh-style, Majestic Trio Combination, Roasted Ireland Silver Hill Duck in Peking Style, Stewed "Mee Sua" Baby Abalone, Smoked Kampung Kitchen
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Formerly housed within the New Majestic Hotel, the award-winning Majestic Restaurant has found a new home at Marina One located within the prestigious Marina Bay financial district.

True to Chef Yong's style of contemporary Cantonese food rooted in traditional Chinese culinary techniques, the refreshed menu features new dishes such as the succulent Roasted Ireland Silver Duck in Peking Style served with handmade rose pancakes, scallion and cucumber, the wonderfully aromatic Black Truffle with Crabmeat and Egg White Fried Rice, and the tantalizing Smoked Kampong Chicken with Salt and Hickory served in a glass dome.

Chef Yong has also introduced a full selection of dim sum for lunch, with new creations such as the Chee Cheong Fun made with organic brown rice and served with Hakka-styled lei cha (thunder tea) sauce, pan-fried Radish Rolls with Chicken, Button Mushrooms and Cheese, and Xiao Long Bao Bak Kut Teh-style.

Popular Majestic Restaurant signature dishes such as the Majestic Trio Combination of Crispy Wasabi Prawn, Pan Seared Foie Gras, Peking Duck and Organic Greens, and Stewed "Mee Sua" Baby Abalone, Vegetable and Crab Roe Gravy remain on the menu. Set Menus, starting from $48++ per person for lunch and $68++ per person for dinner, are also available. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Major 99
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 4190 Ang Mo Kio Ave 6#02-02Broadway PlazaSingapore (569841)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wonton Mee, Nasi Lemak, Top Shell, Pork Belly
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located in the heartlands of Ang Mo Kio, Major 99 is easily accessible by the many. Unlike the usual restaurant joints, Major 99 offers a wide range of activities such as karaoke, old-school arcade machines, pool tables, dart machines and a beer pong table to keep diners constantly entertained.  

 

The outlet serves a variety of liquor and beers paired with local delights such as Wanton Mee and Nasi Lemak, as well as sumptuous bar bites to keep diners' appetites satisfied.

data.title: Man Fu Yuan
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 12-3pm, 6-10pmSat-Sun & PH: 11:30am-3pm, 6-10pm (1st Seating: 11:30am-1pm (Last Order: 12:45pm), 2nd Seating: 1:30-3pm (Last Order: 2:45pm))
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilled Fanny Bay oysters in Hua Diao wine, Braised beef short ribs and wild mushrooms in lotus leaf, Kung Fu Soup - double boiled sakura chicken, abalone, maca, morel mushrooms served in a tea pot, Poached marble goby fish with mala green peppercorns and salted vegetable broth, Double-boiled superior bird’s nest, rock sugar
data.ABOUT:
Lauded by Singapore Tatler as one of Singapore's best Chinese restaurants and recipient of the Michelin Plate, Man Fu Yuan is a stalwart in the Chinese fine dining scene in Singapore, serving culinary presentations that showcase an artful balance of spices and flavours, uplifted by modern interpretations and quality ingredients.
Look forward to a refined dining experience underpinned by traditional culinary techniques and elevate your experience with a handpicked selection of quality wines or premium tea pairings.
Set within an elegant venue which accommodates up to 172 guests, including a suite of private dining rooms, Man Fu Yuan is well-suited for all occasions, from private business lunches to joyous celebratory events.
For reservation of private dining rooms, get in touch with us at +65 6825 1008. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Manhattan
data.Hours: Tue-Sat: 5-10:15pmTue-Fri (Violet Hour): 5-7pmSunday Cocktail Brunch : 12-3pmClosed MondayLast Order: 9:30pm. In-line with government guidelines, consumption of alcohol after 10:30pm is prohibited.
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Rebellion Burger, Central Park Crudités, Crispy Golden Cauliflower, Big Apple Cheesecake
data.ABOUT: Inspired by the Golden Age of cocktails and fine drinking, Manhattan is reminiscent of a grand hotel bar, modern yet with a touch of old New York glamour and sophistication. Choose your tipple from artisanal spirits, and classic and forgotten cocktails, meticulously crafted from the world’s first in-hotel rickhouse and a remarkable collection of house-made ingredients, accompanied by gourmet bar bites. Manhattan was recently placed 14th in World’s 50 Best Bars and 8th in Asia’s 50 Best Bars. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Manpei 万平
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Garlic Ramen, Mixed Sashimi Rice Bowl, Stir Fry with Squid Ink, Japanese Omelette, Clam Soup
data.ABOUT:
This cosy spot has found a new home in Clarke Quay Central. Opened in Kampong Bahru by Hokkaido-born Urayama Satoru, this restaurant serves up a range of fresh fish grilled to perfection, as well as a variety of seafood dishes. Due to their late opening hours, this restaurant is a favourite of late-night stragglers and Japanese chefs alike.

The Mixed Sashimi Rice Bowl is a must-try here. Featuring a decadent slices of fresh tuna and salmon layered over a bed of rice and topped with greens, this dish is the perfect pick-me-up for a midday meal. The buttery velvet fresh fish slices contrast well with the crunch of the vegetables, and the soft rice soaks up the umami flavour of the fish. Diners chasing a spicy kick can opt for the Spicy Garlic Ramen - a dish consisting of springy noodles and egg bathed in a red hot broth - with three levels of spice to choose from, you can customise your dish to suit your specific needs.

The Stir Fry with Squid Ink is the perfect dish for seafood lovers. Made with saline squid ink, this dish is made with firm squid tentacles and flavoured with chilli. The dish is topped with crunchy greens that add to the bite of the meat. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Marcy's
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Marcy’s is a restaurant set amidst the backdrop of Duxton, a seafood bistro at heart that takes familiar ideas like tartare, raw seafood, pasta, and grilled fish, and presents them in new, satisfying ways.

Inspired by rarified worlds colliding to create a vibrant, modern institution, the bracing flavors of coastal Italy are awakened by a Latin American heartbeat to imbue familiar ingredients with a new kind of gusto. Our attention to detail in all things from the sea, flows through everything we do.

The intimate bar is open late and you can come in for just a glass of wine, or a classic nightcap and a small bite should you feel like it. The adventurous will feel at home with a selection of craft spirits, cocktails and atypical snacks.

Marcy’s strives to chart the tide for restaurant culture in Singapore, with exquisite food, disarmingly relaxed service and an eclectic and atmospheric setting that all set the stage for an experience like no other.

Marcy’s is anchored in being all real, all the time, attracting those who don't chase luxury, but who live it by elevating moments, indulging their senses and celebrating the everyday. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Margarita's Dempsey Hill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Taco Salad, Swiss Flat Enchiladas, Poblano Rellenos, Chorizo Sonorense Al Ajillo, Fajitas, Chimichanga, Tacos Al Pastor, Three Milk Cake, Churros
data.ABOUT:
In this fickle city, it’s no easy feat managing a successful long-running restaurant, let alone an eating spot that still dazzles diners with its consistently solid fare. Margarita’s Dempsey Hill is one such culinary gem, sporting a rich history that dates all the way back to 1988, with a longevity can be credited to its authentic and succulent Mexican bites that don’t cost a pretty penny. 
 
Explore a trove of Mexican grub with bright and fiery appetisers such as the Cheese Fondue that gets its kick from a dash of chiles and chorizos. Meanwhile, the Nachos La Especial is another evergreen favourite, made with a seasoned blend of black beans, chipotle cheese sauce, jalapenos, guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo. 
 
And we can’t talk about the mains without salivating. There’s the drool-worthy Carnitas de Puerco, which features a fork-tender piece of pork slowly roasted in the oven and served with a zesty dollop of salsa verde on warm corn tortillas. And be sure to save room for the tantalising desserts which include the popular Mexican Fried Ice Cream or warm Churros. 
 
Good Mexican cuisine made from fresh ingredients. That’s the concept behind Margarita's Dempsey Hill and we can’t ask for anything more. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Marriott Café
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 320 Orchard RoadLobby LevelSingapore Marriott Tang Plaza HotelSingapore (238865)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Marriott Burger, Hokkien Mee, Steak Frites, Fish & Chips; Char Hor Fun, Risotto of Porcini Mushroom, Char Kway Teow
data.ABOUT:
Attempting to maintain maximum culinary freshness is a tall order but it's a challenge that Marriott Cafe is willing to take on.

Get aboard on a gastronomic ride and experience a delightful mélange of expertly-curated International gourmet creations at Marriott Cafe. An iconic restaurant for a pampering work lunch or a celebratory family meal, Marriott Cafe will satiate your culinary desires and put smiles on faces with indulgent a la carte offerings.

There's simply a deluge of choices at Marriott Café, which means no matter who you are with, there's bound to be something for everyone. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Marusaya
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Japanese Wagyu Beef Dashi Shabu, Dashi Katsu Toji, Shimahokke, Tori Karaage Amazu Ankake, Dashimaki Tamago, Oden
data.ABOUT:
An authentic Japanese restaurant serving healthy dishes in the heart of Singapore with its origin in Japan since 1962 as the whole seller of Japanese broth ingredients.

Dashi Master Marusaya takes great pride is offering a large selection of healthy, Dashi-based dishes. For the non-epicureans among us, natural Dashi (as opposed to chemically-composed additives) is a key seasoning developed from Katsuboshi (dried bonito) and ingredient in Japanese cooking.

As a result, the stars of the menu are those dishes which make full use of the umami taste of the natural Dashi. For example, the Dashi Katsu Toji (Pork Cutlet with Dashi Sauce) are deep-fried pork cutlets from Hokkaido which go perfectly with the thick, flavourful egg Dashi gravy, whilst the Japanese Wagyu Beef Dashi Shabu features melt-in-your-mouth slices of beef cooked in a delicately-flavoured Dashi pot. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Matsukiya
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chawanmushi, Foie Gras Tontoro Don, Truffle Tori Omu Rice
data.ABOUT:
An exciting concept tucked away in Paragon, Matsukiya dishes out traditional kushiyaki that is grilled over bincho-tan.
An exclusive Japanese charcoal grill restaurant that promises a personalized and private dining experience, get ready to indulge in the luxurious selection of fresh Japanese ingredients, complete with a curated selection of spirits.
Start with small bites such as the traditional Chawanmushi. A unique take on the all-time favorite, the steamed egg is infused with bits of truffle. Another great starter is the Satsuma Imo. A filling dish, the Japanese sweet potato is extremely tasty.
Move on to the Donburi bowls. A staple dish in any Japanese restaurant menu, the rice bowls at Matsukiya are made with high-quality ingredients. Try the Foie Gras Tontoro Don, which features duck liver and pork cheek on rice. For truffle lovers, the Truffle Tori Omu Rice is a must-try! Wrapped in a rolled omelet, pieces of chicken are strewn atop the omelet, accompanied by truffle shavings. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Matsumoto
data.Cuisine: Bar, Japanese, Fusion, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oyster Kanban Yaki, Minced Beef Cutlet, Grilled Oyster, Seafood Porridge
data.ABOUT:
Nestled within Orchid Hotel, Matsumoto is a friendly Japanese restaurant serving up a wide variety of traditional Japanese delights.

Fresh from the ocean, Matsumoto delights diners with assorted platters of exotic seafood and mouthwatering hot pot options. Choose from either the Oyster Kanban Yaki or Grilled Oyster to satisfy your seafood cravings. Indulge in the best of both worlds with the mix Seafood and Oyster hotpot for a sweet taste of miso or soy sauce. Fried delights are also available with the different kinds of tempura on offer. 

For sharing, go for the classic fried potato. Meat lovers will definitely appreciate the Minced Beef Cutlet. Taking the shape of a patty, the minced beef is lightly fried with batter. Sink your teeth into one for a wonderful burst of flavour. 

For those with a lighter palate, order the warm Seafood Porridge for a taste of rich and nourishing miso soup. Rice bowls are also available at Matsumoto for a filling one-dish meal. End your meal with a refreshing fruit platter of exotic fruits. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Matsuya Dining
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Otoro Don, Sushi Platter, Salmon Aburi Maki, Bara Chirashi Don, Unagi Don, Negitoro Don
data.ABOUT:
Omakase has been a food trend locally for a while now, and while it takes some courage to leave your meal solely in the hands of the chef, at Matsuya, you can rest assured that you’re in good hands. This intimate restaurant is helmed by Chef Benson, a homegrown chef who works his magic at a station in front of diners.

The menu here focuses on fresh seafood, and plays up the best of Japanese cuisine. The Chirashi Don comes with a warm, authentic Miso Soup and a generous serving of fish of your choice. The Otoro Don here is tender, and pairs perfectly with the sushi rice. With tuna bought and chilled individually, diners can rest assured that they are getting the best that the ocean has to offer when they dine here.

The Katsu Don is a staple of every Japanese menu. Heaps of crispy pork cutlet and egg, served on a bed of sushi rice is as attractive as it is appetizing. The Gyu Don is equally generous with the tender beef, and pairs perfectly with crispness of the accompanying vegetables. Whether you choose to head over for a delectable lunch or an authentic Japanese dinner experience, this spot is sure to deliver.

data.title: Maya's Kitchen
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mutton Biryani, Garlic Naan, Lamb Pepper Fry, Samosa, Tandoori Chicken, Butter Chicken, Chicken 65, Paneer Chilli, Mutton Jogan Rosh
data.ABOUT:
The Jalan Sultan stretch may be known for its sprawling heritage district, quirky cafes, and Malay hawkers, but this little gem is set to establish itself as a prominent eatery in Singapore. Tucked away in the back alleys bordering Little India and Kampong Glam is Maya’s Kitchen, this spot serves up Indian comfort food made with fresh handpicked ingredients. The menu here includes a range of North and South Indian classics.

Even the pickiest of diners are sure to love the range of vegetarian and non-vegetarian starters available here. Tuck into one of their Samosa - a delicious fried treat of fried potato wrapped in crispy dough. For something a little richer, the Lamb Pepper Fry is an excellent option. Chunks of buttery lamb is seasoned with spicy pepper and cooked to perfection, this dish is an excellent way to whet the appetite for the dishes to come. 

The Mutton Biryani is an excellent dish of pilaf rice cooked with flavourful mutton. The combination of  fragrant rice and spicy meat is a good option for diners looking for a filling meal. For something a little less rich, opt for the Garlic Naan, a herby flatbread that is perfect on its own, or dipped in a curry. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Mazzo Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Calamari Fritti, Crab Meat Tagliolini, Grilled Seafood Platter, Traditional Cream Pasticciotto Tart, Grilled Iberico Pork
data.ABOUT:
Mazzo Restaurant & Bar is a laid-back Italian diner that specialises in small plates, pastas, seafood, and grilled meats. With indoor seating as well as a spacious al fresco dining area, it's the perfect spot for relaxing after a long day's work.

Whet your appetite with several sharing plates such as Spicy Calamari Fritti and Parma Ham Salad before digging into the hearty mains. If pasta is a must-have for you, try the Crab Meat Tagliolini with Basil Tomato Sauce or the Tagliatelle All'Aragosta. Big parties should go for the Grilled Seafood Platter with lobsters, prawns, and calamari, and the Grilled Iberico Pork with Mashed Potato.

The beverage menu is equally impressive, with an extensive list of wines, cocktails, beers, and more. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Meat You Here
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: NZ Ribeye, NZ Prime Ribs, Breaded Chicken with Cheese Sauce, Glazed BBQ Baby Back Ribs, Kurobuta Pork Belly Rice Bowl
data.ABOUT:
If a sudden craving for a good steak hits but you don't wish to splurge, look no further than Meat You Here, a homely diner tucked away in Balmoral Plaza.

Steak is the star of the show here. Think: Juicy slabs of fresh New Zealand beef char-grilled to perfection. Pick from a variety of cuts such as ribeye, tenderloin, and prime rib, and have it accompanied by either black pepper or mushroom sauce. Each dish also comes with generous servings of fries, coleslaw, and buttered corn that are guaranteed to leave you satisfied at the end of the meal.

The poultry and seafood dishes shouldn't be overlooked either, with a fan favourite being the Breaded Chicken with Cheese Sauce, where creamy nacho cheese is drizzled atop a crispy, golden-brown chicken cutlet.

For something unique, try their hearty rice bowls. We recommend the Kurobuta Pork Belly Bowl that comes with melt-in-your-mouth pieces of pork belly and an onsen egg over a bed of fluffy white rice. (Dec 2019)

data.title: MeatSmith (Little India)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bhaji Onion Rings, Madras Pork Cheeks, Butter Chicken Hot Pocket, Biryani Stuffed Suckling Pig, Okra Fries, Gunpowder Potatoes, Indian Lemonade
data.ABOUT: MeatSmith Little India is Singapore’s first restaurant serving Modern Indian Barbecue. With its colorful façade and street artwork, this outlet fits perfectly at its home, at Campbell Lane in the heart of Little India. Expect a masterful menu combining the technique of slow cooking and barbecue, with Indian spice, rubs, and sauces. By adding a tandoor oven and spit roaster alongside the southern pride smoker, guests can expect dishes like a Ikura Papadum, Coconut Pork Ribs and suckling pig biryani. (Feb 2020)

data.title: MeatSmith (Telok Ayer)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Location: Tanjong Pagar, Club Street, Telok Ayer
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Smoked Suckling Pig Platter, Meat Platter, Dirty Fried Rice, Brisket Spring Rolls, Mac & Pimento Cheese, Nashville Fried Chicken, Chongqing 1/2 Pork Spare Ribs, Southern Ice Tea, Valentino Twist
data.ABOUT:
Churning out American Southern style BBQ, MeatSmith (Telok Ayer) takes a bold approach by offering up only the most premium cuts of meat, Southern sides, and tasty tipples from all around the world.
Seriously, the menu here is exceptional from beginning to end. And the meats? One word: flawless. The Beef Brisket is tender, juicy and smoked to perfection, and when combined with a side of either the Mustard Potato Salad or gooey Mac & Cheese, makes for the perfect meal. If you're still yearning for more, check out the Nashville Fried Chicken, it's mouth-watering. The fried chicken here does have a spicy kick to it, so make sure to have a glass of Southern Iced Tea or one of their signature drinks like the Valentino Twist within arm's reach.
So head on down with your carnivorous clan to enjoy a true taste of the South, and discover for yourself why MeatSmith (Telok Ayer) has often been touted as being 'a cut above the rest'. (Nov 2017)

data.title: Meating Place
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Cauliflower, Kale & Pine Nut Salad, Dry-Aged Wagyu Burger and Boneless Wagyu Shortrib
data.ABOUT:
Duo Galleria is known for their lifestyle haunts and premier residences, so it’s no wonder that this casual diner chose to set up shop here. With a sleek wooden interior that is tastefully decorated and backlit with warm lighting, there’s not better ‘meating place’ for a weekend brunch catch up with friends, or a hearty post-work meal. 

If you’re here for brunch, be sure to try the Wagyu Short Ribs. The well-marbled premium cut of meat is cooked to tender perfection. You’ll want to use your hands for this one. Get some Crack Fries on the side for a filling meal - they’re as addictive as they sound! For something a little healthier, opt for the Kale & Pine Nut Salad. Made with silverfish, crisp kale, and earthy nuts, as well as pomegranate for a juicy bite, expect an explosion of flavour with every bite. 

The dinner menu doesn’t disappoint either -- it promises diners with an indulgent array of meat, vegetable, and seafood dishes. The Hokkaido Scallops are a must-try for seafood lovers. The scallops are moist and lightly sweet, pairing perfectly with the pickled daikon and edamame on the side. (March 2019)

data.title: MediumRare by Saveur
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 1.5kg Tomahawk Steak, Flat Iron Steak, Angus 150 Days Grain Fed Ribeye, Grilled Chicken bowl, Steak & Foie Gras bowl
data.ABOUT:
Welcome to Tampines’ choice steakhouse.

 

Fresh from the grills of Saveur, comes MediumRare, a steakhouse focused on the true way to cook a steak, no shortcuts, premium grades and the same affordable value that we are known for. But not detracting from what Saveur is known for, we are still focused on providing value, with carefully sourced meats from reputable suppliers, we offer cuts such as the increasingly popular Flat Iron Steak (250g) at $18++, to an Angus 150 Days Grain Fed Ribeye (250g) at $38++ only, even the Tomahawk is going for only $150++ as a sharing dish for 5 Pax.

 

Aside from such, we offer a distinctive taste, crafting something new just for the local palates to pair with everyone's love for meat. Other than the usual Mushroom, Black Pepper sauce and Cafe de Paris, we serve a special Mala steak sauce, that everyone can enjoy, drawing the taste of szechuan sauce with mala peppers, the taste that has taken the nation by storm now comes with you juicy, roasted steaks. We also offer a Black Bean sauce, typical of a familiar dish one would find in a dimsum restaurant. These tastes are paired well with meats, and we have ventured to bringing it to the table with cuts of Steak, properly cooked, and affordably served, 

 

For those who need your carbs, we also serve a small range of Rice Bowls, such as a Grilled Chicken bowl ($12++), and a Flat Iron Steak Bowl ($18++) and even a Steak & Foie Gras bowl ($23). (Jul 2019)

data.title: Meet & Meat - Street Food
data.Cuisine: French, Italian, Fusion, Steakhouse, All-Day Breakfast, Cafe, Burgers, BBQ
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Meet & Meat Beef Burger, Ramly Beef Burger, Beef Batter Onion Rings, Hot Wings
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Carnivores rejoice! There’s a new kid on the block: Meet & Meat – Street Food, the latest addition to the bustling food haven on East Coast Road. Meat lovers, you’ll feel right at home at this casual, no frills joint that dishes up affordable cuts of tender, juicy steaks. We’ve heard raving reviews on the Meet & Meat Beef Burger; boasting thick, moist 100 days grain-fed beef patties, dripping in melted cheese. 

  

Don’t forget to try their charcoal grilled skewers – with a plethora of flavours to choose from: Chinese traditional spicy, BBQ, teriyaki, or good old sea salt & black pepper. 

  

What better way to round it all off, than with a selection of ice-cold Paulaner beers on tap. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Melben Seafood Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 1 Pasir Ris Close#01-302/303Market Square @ Downtown East E!AvenueSingapore (519599)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Claypot Crab Bee Hoon, Chili Crab, Shimmering Sand Crab, Laksa Crab Bee Hoon
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Melben Seafood has officially opened a new outlet @ Downtown East Market Square, catering to crab-craving diners staying in the east of Singapore.  


Singaporeans rave over Melben Seafood's heavenly crab dishes, and Melben Seafood never fails to serve up the freshest crabs, which are delivered daily to the restaurant. Do head down for their signature dishes such as the Claypot Crab Bee Hoon, Chili Crab, Shimmering Sand Crab, Black Pepper Crabs, and numerous other styles of crab dishes. They have launched a new dish "The Laksa Crab Bee Hoon”, combining a local delight with juicy crabs, and it is only available at the Downtown East outlet! (May 2019)

data.title: Meld's Boba Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Big Man’s Breakfast, Hash Brown Burger, Moonlight Bakkwa Carbonara, Mala Mixed Mushroom Aglio Olio
data.ABOUT:
The first of its kind, Meld’s Boba Cafe is the first fusion cafe which boasts a brunch food menu accompanied by signature alcoholic bobas from SMOObar. 

The Big Man’s Breakfast is a popular menu option made of eggs, pork sausage, bacon, salad, harshbrowns, sauteed mushroom and mini croissants. Other brunch items such as the Hash Brown Burger, Cajun Chicken Chop and Meld’s Salad are served all day. The Mentaiko Chicken Mantou is a chef’s recommendation that features three pieces of mouthwatering mentaiko chicken burger, served with your choice of salad, straight cut or curly fries. Add on a bowl of piping hot Truffle Mushroom Soup to complete your meal. 

Featuring a local twist on classic favourites, the Moonlight Bakkwa Carbonara is a blend of pasta and spice that is topped with a generous amount of bakkwa, surely enough to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Spice lovers will definitely love this innovative menu, especially the Mala Mixed Mushroom Aglio Olio. A tantalising mix of black fungus, king oyster mushroom and fried mushroom carrying a spicy mala kick, this fiery dish is set to delight your taste buds! (Dec 2020)

data.title: Mellben Signature
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Claypot Crab Vermicelli Soup, Creamy Butter Crab, Pi Feng Tang Crab, Braised Pork Belly
data.ABOUT:
Dressed to impress, Mellben Signature features a wide array of seafood delights with an innovative twist garnished with unique ingredients that guarantee a delicious dining experience. 

Committed to selecting only the highest quality Sri Lankan crabs, the restaurant performs an additional round of selection when bringing in a fresh batch of crabs to ensure that only the biggest and freshest crabs end up in your dishes. Helmed by Chef Gabriel, Mellben Signature tantalising menu includes the Claypot Crab Vermicelli Soup, Creamy Butter Crab, Imperial Chicken Soup and more! The place to visit for a hearty feast, drop by today to have a taste of these fresh ocean delights. A crowd favourite, the Pi Feng Tang Crab is fried with chillies, garlic and scallions, making for a fragrant pot of steaming hot crabs. Blanketed with a layer of melted savoury cheese, the lobsters and oyster menu options available here at Mellben Signature are a must order for all seafood lovers. 

Other equally mouthwatering dishes include the Braised Pork Belly. A wonderful meat option doused in an exceptional sauce, dig into a plateful of tender meat for melt in your mouth layers of fat. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Melt Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Large Parties (16+)
data.Location: City Hall, Marina Bay, Promenade, Marina Central
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oysters & Premium Seafood, Royal Tandoori Selection, Herbal Drunken Prawns, Japanese Sushi & Sashimi, Outdoor Barbecue Grill Station, Roasted Wagyu Cuts, Melt Signature Cake, Sabayon in Liquid Nitrogen
data.PRESS RELEASE: Melt Café is a sophisticated all-day-dining experience, where cultures and cuisines mingle. The restaurant presents guests with contemporary and stylish interiors, where a delightful patisserie counter takes centre stage.Known for its extensive buffet presentations, the restaurant has a variety of stations to tempt diners. The main dining space is filled with light, which comes from floor to ceiling windows and provides a welcoming ambience. Here diners will find a roast and carving corner, as well as the ever popular live gourmet stations, together with European and Asian spreads. Guests can also dine alfresco during dinner, amidst lush greenery, while enjoying a delicious barbecue. Indoors, the award-winning pastry theatre provides for the perfect finale. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Meta Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oyster, Abalone, BBQ Pigeon with Carrot Puree, Cabbage Chawanmushi
data.ABOUT: Short for metamorphosis, Meta is representative of the ever-changing F&B industry, as well as its culinary team's evolutionary approach to the menu. At the restaurant, dishes and flavour combinations are reinterpreted to reflect Chef Sun Kim's experiences. Combining his Korean heritage, Japanese culinary techniques, and Western culinary training, Meta presents innovative and well-balanced dishes that utilise the best seasonal produce and ingredients from around the globe. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Metropolitan YMCA Singapore
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Indonesian, Malaysian, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Peranakan, Cafe, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Claypot Fish Head Curry, Fish & Chips, Claypot Chicken Rice, Indonesian Nasi Goreng, Sago Gula Melaka
data.ABOUT: Many would have heard of Metropolitan YMCA Singapore (MYMCA), an organisation which strives to inculcate a heart for the wider community in today's youth. What you wouldn't expect to find, however, is a restaurant nestled within MYMCA's building, where all net surpluses made are channelled to MYMCA's community outreach programmes. They support low-income families and underprivileged individuals affected by physical disabilities or chronic illnesses. What can be more gratifying than enjoying a sumptuous meal and giving back at the same time? (Mar 2021)

data.title: Mezame!
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Country-style Pork Pate, Japanese Wagyu Red Wine Curry Rice, Strawberry ShortCake
data.ABOUT:
Celebrating originality and dedication, Mezame! is a natural wine bar that carries wines made by passionate and sustainable wine producers. Designed to provide the most immersive experience, the bar is situated off the beaten path in Orchard Road and boasts a huge walk-in cellar that stores over 800 bottles of fine wines from all over the region. 

With an aim to bring pesticide-free wines, without chemical additives to the table, the bar only works with producers that have a minimal intervention to the making of wines, from organic grapes to bottling. For an unforgettable wine and dining experience, the 4awesome set menu is a specially curated chef’s selection of food and wine pairing. Served with four sets of 75ml wine and a generous tasting portion of food Mezame believes the best complement the wines, sit down for authentic wine and dine experience you’ll surely enjoy. Don’t forget to wrap up your meal on a sweet note with a slice of Strawberry ShortCake. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Mezza9
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Japanese, Thai, International, Seafood, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly, Local
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Cakes, Spicy & Sour Tiger Prawn Soup, Sushi Shiruba, Porterhouse, Flower Pot
data.PRESS RELEASE:
mezza9 derives its name from nine thrilling and authentic experiences - the grill and rotisserie, a sushi and sashimi counter, a Thai grill and kitchen, sustainable seafood, traditional Chinese, patisserie and a gourmet boutique. There is also the martini bar and the party room, both versatile venues suitable for drinks and private events. 

With authentic dishes prepared in exciting open kitchens, guests get to interact with the restaurant's chefs as they showcase their love for the most delicious, sustainable produce on the planet.
Thirsty? Hop on over to the martini bar for bold and exciting martinis, handcrafted gin and tonics, as well as a great, value-for-money selection of certified sustainable champagne and wines. (Dec 2017)

data.title: Mikoto Singapore
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Champon Ramen, Chicken Nannban, Sashimi, Mentaiko Pasta, Tempura
data.ABOUT:
Named after the Japanese word for “respect”, this casual izakaya pays homage to the cuisine of Southwest Japan, which is heavily influenced by fresh seafood and premium cuts of meat. The intimate setting, affordable prices, and friendly service has made this restaurant one of the most popular haunts in the city. 

The Chicken Nannban is a great option for diners looking to treat themselves. Made with breaded chicken fillet deep fried to crisp perfection and flavoured with a dollop of pink radish sauce, this dish is an exciting mix of flavours. The chicken skin is light, crisp and non-greasy, while the meat is tender and juicy. Paired with the earthy richness of the sauce, it’s sure to leave you wanting for more. 

Noodle enthusiasts are sure to love the unique Champon ramen. A traditional version of the Singaporean Hokkien Mee, this recipe is made with a broth of chicken and pork bones, stringy noodles, and topped with chunks of lard, seafood, and vegetables. The result is a flavourful meal that is best enjoyed on a cold day with some beer. 

Speaking of beer, barflies will be glad to know that there are various happy hour promotions at Mikoto, cementing its place as one of the CBD’s favourite watering holes. (May 2019)

data.title: Mikuni
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Nihon Namayasai Salad, Jou Sashimi, Miyazaki Wagyu Sirloin, Live Boston Lobster Uni Yaki
data.ABOUT:
Embark on a culinary tour of stunning creations fresh from Mikuni’s teppanyaki and sushi live stations at Fairmont Singapore. Helmed by various master chefs, each station highlghts different premium Japanese produce. Complemented with signature dishes and innovative modern kaiseki dishes that never disappoint, visit the restaurant to feast your senses on mouthwatering Japanese delights. 

Drop by during lunch to indulge in Mikuni’s teppanyaki lunch menu. Consisting of an appetiser, sashimi platters, A5 Wagyu, rice, and dessert, this menu is specially curated to bring diners an authentic teppanyaki experience. 

For those who prefer to customise their dining experience, mix and match the various menu options for a true taste of Japan. Highly recommended, the Dragon Roll is a mouthful of BBQ eel, shrimp tempura, tobiko, cucumber, avocado topped with tempura flakes and unagi sauce for an extra crunch. Other signatures include the Crunchy Spicy Tuna and Mikuni Lobster Maki. 

The finest selection of assorted seasonal tempura, the Tempura Moriawase is a tasty platter of fried Japanese favourites that will leave you coming back for seconds. Wrap up your meal with a refreshing scoop of Yuzu Sorbet for the perfect finish! (Mar 2021)

data.title: Mimi Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Snout About Stout, The Unsubtle Truffle Mein, Saucy Crab & Egg Affair, Oh My Cod, Garden of Mushroom
data.PRESS RELEASE: Set against Clarke Quay’s storied backdrop of oriental intrigue, mìmì 秘密 is a swanky and chic Modern Chinese restaurant by the award-winning lifestyle and F&B company, 1-Group. Nestled on the upper floor of The Riverhouse, mìmì offers a quiet recluse from the bustling Central Business District during lunch hours with its wholesome lunch sets and dim sum selection. Come day's end, the restaurant transforms into an enchantingly vibrant spot serving an impeccable array of Modern Chinese tapas, beers, wines & baijius. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Miraku
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 15 Course Lunch, Chef’s Omakase Special
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away in the cosy alley that is Nankin Row, this intimate 15-seater restaurant is your go-to for a night of delicious Japanese food.

Head over for a satisfying and affordable meal at $38 for 13-course Omakase during lunch. It is an absolute steal for a quality sushi and a decent omakase experience which includes 1 appetiser, 9 pieces of nigiri sushi (including toro), hand roll, soup and dessert. If you fancy for a little extra, you can also opt for a 15-course lunch that comes with 3 appetisers, 9 pieces of nigiri sushi (including toro, uni and premium items), wagyu sukiyaki with onsen egg, soup and dessert.

Dinner is when you are in for a gastronomic feast. Miraku’s omakase sets ranges from $98 for five pieces of nigiri sushi, 2 omakase dishes, appetisers, seasonal items, somen soup & dessert to a $138 omakase that includes appetiser, wagyu appetiser, seasonal items, five pieces of nigiri sushi, two omakase dishes, vinegar dish, somen soup & dessert. The most premium set, Chef’s Omakase is available at $168 which includes appetisers, seasonal premium appetiser, seasonal item, 2 omakase dishes, five pieces of nigiri sushi, uni (sea urchin) ikura rice bowl, somen soup & dessert.

Pair your dinner with a carafe of chilled sake, or opt for a good bottle of Shochu. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Misaki Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 12 Marina Boulevard#02-08Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 3Singapore (018982)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bara Chirashi Teishoku, Santoku Teishoku, Sashimi & Sushi Set
data.ABOUT:
Located at Marina Bay Financial Centre, this Japanese restaurant is well-loved by the office crowd and weekenders looking for sushi and sashimi. With “Misaki” representing the air, trees, and sea, these balancing of nature’s elements are evident in the extensive lunch and dinner menu.

With attention to detail, beautiful plating, and a curation of the best Japanese ingredients, Misaki Japanese Restaurant is great for an indulgent solo lunch at the counter, or an intimate catch-up with work mates. Go for their Chirashi Dons, which are beautifully plated with quality ingredients such as Botan Ebi, Uni, Caviar, Ikura, Otoro, Kani Tsume, and more.

For something comforting, the smooth Chawanmushi is given a luxe edge with the addition of uni, balancing the light tofu pudding with the saltiness of the sea. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Mischief
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mac & Cheese, Cracking Pork Belly, Pulled Pork Fettucine, Cajun Spiced Spring Chicken, Roast Pork Banh Mi, Open Face Tacos, Jerk Chicken Quesadilla
data.ABOUT:
Overlooking the outdoor concourse of the Esplanade is this American-themed bar and restaurant oozing with rock & roll and attitude. It’s one of the most popular eateries around the arts centre so you’re liable on any night to be seen chowing down on American street food with the city’s arty set and happening youngsters having a swish pre-game before hitting the clubs. Whether it’s pre-theatre dinner and drinks, or a romantic waterfront date with the strains of live music coming in from the Esplanade concourse, this is one of the city’s coolest spots. 

And the food is no afterthought either. Tuck into hearty American fare like Tex-Mex influenced pastas, including a Pulled Pork Fettuccine, and Southern-style dishes like the sticky BBQ Baby Back Ribs. For something more casual, grab a sandwich or taco. Think messy but delicious numbers like their Open Face Tacos, with your choice of chicken, pork, or beef, slathered with sriracha mayo, fresh greens, and jalapenos. Also good is the Roast Pork Banh Mi, the Vietnamese darling of American foodie circles, two crisp rice-flour baguettes stuffed with roast pork, pâte, and crunchy pickles. For a good ol’ American burger, nothing quite beats the Classic Wagyu Cheeseburger, all 150 grams of prime Wagyu patty, caramelized onions, bacon, sharp cheddar, and BBQ sauce. Grab a beer or cocktail to wash all that down, and soak in the funky vibes with the rest of the cool cats out on the town. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Miska Cafe (Sentosa)
data.Cuisine: Bar, Italian, All-Day Breakfast, Greek, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Döner Kebab & Rice, Pancakes, Mushroom Frittata, Shakshouka, Mediterranean, Halloumi Salad, Kalymali Pizza, Falafels, Chicken Kebab, Cypriot Halloumi Wrap, Hummus
data.ABOUT:
Epitomising Mediterranean tranquillity, Miska Café is the perfect escape for people to ease up on their hectic pace of life as the soothing colours, open concept, and patterned tiles create a relaxed ambience. Awash with the constant murmurs of lapping waters, this soothing quayside gem boasts lengthy pages of breakfast options to keep both adults and children satisfied. Plates like Mediterranean, a dish packed with delights like Halloumi cheese, freshly baked pita, and grilled sausage, Mushroom Frittata, and the classic Shakshouka, sit alongside sweeter options like Vanilla French Toast and Pancakes, and it’s a picky person that won’t find something to suit their fancy at Miska.
The rest of the immense offerings are both staggering and delicious. You’ll be tempted to fill up on appetising starters and a Greek salad, at first, but as your eyes travel on (and on), the lure of mouthwatering mains like Döner Kebab & Rice and a Kalymali Pizza topped with minced beef in spicy tomato sauce, coriander, and cheese, becomes more difficult to resist. Health buffs will also appreciate the lighter bites and preservative-free pita and wrap breads that showcase fresh products and homemade sauces to their best advantage. It can be a tad tough to find a spot that offers great food, family friendly atmosphere, and a chance to regroup from the chaos of everyday life but Miska Café has hit three for three in our books! (May 2016)

data.title: Mitsu Sushi Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Alaskan King Crab, Grilled Anago (Sea Eel), Aburi Maguro Spicy Roll, Asari Clam Soup, Nama Saké
data.ABOUT:
Located along the hip Duxton Road, the winsome Mitsu Sushi Bar charms diners with the best and freshest sushi in the city, thanks to its premium seafood that gets flown in from Japan five times a week. Under the deft hands of Fukuoka-native Chef Mitsuyasu Tatsuro, simple sushi ingredients are made to shine. The chef employs a “one fish, three ways” approach to his food, so diners can choose one fish from the daily menu and have it cooked three different ways. One notable standout is the Alaskan King Crab, cooked in styles that run the gamut from kaminabe, tempura, and sashimi to grilled & served with vinegar, simmered, or in chawanmushi. Other must-try menu items include the Soft-shell Crab Roll paired with a mildly spicy mayo. The Asari Clam Soup is another divine dish that doubles up as a refreshing palate cleanser. Then complement the fresh seafood offerings with any of the eatery’s numerous sake and shochu options, such as the Nama Sake, an unfiltered and unpasteurised sake that goes down smoothly with sushi.

There’s nothing quite like an omakase meal, a chef-curated meal where all you have to do is sit back and enjoy the journey. And if there’s any restaurant that ranks among the best, it’s Mitsu Sushi Bar. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Mitsuba Japanese Restaurant
data.Hours: Mon-Thu (Except PH & PH Eve): 11:30am-2:30pm, 6-10pmFri-Sun, PH & PH Eve: 11:30am-2:30pm, 5.30-7:55pm (1st Seating), 8-10:30pm (2nd Seating)No same day reservations after 11am.
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 6 Eu Tong Sen Street#03-88The CentralSingapore (059817)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sashimi, Temaki, Makimono, Jyo Chirashi, Dobin Mushi
data.ABOUT:
Dining with a view has to be one of our favorite things and you get that and much, much more when you dine at Mitsuba Japanese Restaurant. Sprinkled with keyaki booths for a more traditional experience, dining here is perfect for date night, birthday dinners, and family gatherings!
Settled right in the heart of Clarke Quay in Central, Mitsuba Japanese Restaurant is a vibrant eatery serving authentic Japanese cuisine. Signature dishes like Temaki, Maki Mono, and Ipin Mono make it quite hard to pick a favorite so do what we do and order them all! (Apr 2015)

data.title: Mitzo Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Truffle Crispy Roast Duck, Venison with Asparagus in Black Pepper Mint Sauce, Noodles with Prawn Dumplings & Signature Mitzo Barbeque Pork, Porridge with Lobster Claw, Fish & Pork, Deep-fried Prawn Coated with Wasabi Mayonnaise
data.ABOUT:
Mitzo breaks the mould of Chinese dining by combining a contemporary take on Cantonese cuisine with an artisanal cocktail programme. Set in the heart of Orchard Road, Mitzo offers diners a host of exciting Cantonese cuisines with customised cocktail pairings. Whether it's a lunch venue that you are looking for or a dinner get-together with friends and family, Mitzo has just the right offerings for you.

A sense of wonderment greets any diner who steps into Mitzo. The mesmerizing colours of dusk blue, lemon yellow, mint green, hint at the unique culinary journey diners will experience and remember with every single visit.

Mitzo's attention to your dining experience begins with an attentive host of associates who will walk you through your dining selections, take you through the list of exquisite  a la carte signatures - Black Truffle Crispy Roast Duck, Venison with Asparagus in Black Pepper Mint Sauce and the restaurant's fine selections of specialties such as piquant White Pepper Lobster, Prawn with Caviar Sesame Mayo, Crispy Roasted Pork Belly, which can be found on its set menus.

Mitzo's Dim-Sum Set Lunch comes highly recommended. Its 3-course set features over 10 delectable handcrafted dim sums, a double-boiled soup of the day and a dessert that is almost theatrical in its presentation. With an option for a 4-course set, diners will be spoilt for choice. The mouth-watering 4-course set allows diners a choice of dry-styled thin Noodles with Prawn Dumplings & Signature Mitzo Barbeque Pork or Porridge with Lobster Claw, Fish & Pork.

Mitzo stops at nothing to ensure an experience that surpasses any diner's expectations. Mitzo has a cocktail bar that is truly a sight to behold - a spellbinding aqua tank that is home to some beautiful bell-shaped jellyfish. What makes the bar even more special is the artisanal cocktails that are curated in-house by a team of mixologists who are also your perfect bartenders, affable and knowledgeable in their field. From Asian Inspirations - Empress Sour (a classic for all Whisky Sour fans) to Mitzo's creations - Total Recall (an aromatic cocktail set to awaken your senses), Mitzo Bar is a must-visit. The cocktails can be paired with your selections of the cuisines when dining.

A superb Supper Menu is also available for those with a penchant for deep-fried snacks after midnight. Evergreens like Deep-fried Prawn Coated with Wasabi Mayonnaise and the decadent Fried Rice with Live Lobster Meat, Vegetables and Mushrooms in XO sauce, are available at Mitzo.

Just a stone's throw away from Orchard and Somerset MRT stations, Mitzo, with its exquisite offerings of contemporary Cantonese cuisines and artisanal cocktails and promotions, is a restaurant that delights the palates and the wallets. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Miyu
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bara Chirashi Set, Otoro Chirashi Don set, Miyu Omakase Set
data.ABOUT:
Miyu is a Japanese omakase restaurant tucked away in a shophouse on Duxton Road. Helmed by executive chef Ng Kam Kwan, who’s trained in the kitchen of some of Singapore’s most highly-acclaimed restaurants, it’s a great place to get a taste of Japan.

During lunch, the menu is casual, offering a variety of sets that come with appetisers, soup, a main dish, and dessert. The Bara Chirashi set is a favourite among sashimi fans. For something more indulgent and tuna lovers, go for the Otoro Chirashi Don set which is the fattiest portion of the Japanese Bluefin Tuna and can literally melt in your mouth.

During dinner, full-course omakase sets are the stars of the show, with each set having no less than seven courses. Dishes change regularly according to the season and the chef's preference, but you can look forward to fresh air-flown sashimi, sushi, donburis, cooked dishes, dessert, and more. Dinner sets are also available upon request during lunch, so die-hard omakase fans can get their fix at any time of the day. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Miznon
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Falafel Burger, Folded Cheeseburger, Minute Steak, Baby Cauliflower Flower
data.ABOUT: Helmed by acclaimed Israeli "MasterChef", Chef Eyal Shani, Miznon aims to impart a sense of magic in every bite with a menu that features a fresh take on Israeli street food.Miznon's menu options offer both the sweet and savoury, in pitas, and out of pitas. Upon arrival, you'll get to sample their creamy tahini dip, as well as charred peppers to give a little heat to the start of your meal.Made for the health conscious, the Falafel Burger is a wonderful combination of tomato steak, accompanied by sour cream, chilli, onion and pickles. For meat lovers, the Abu Kebab is a tasty lamb option that is cooked well and served with grilled tomato, onion, tahini, salsa and chilli. Other interesting and yummy dishes include the Folded Cheeseburger, Minute Steak, and seared Chicken Liver.Vegetarians are also treated to a wide variety of options here with options such as Baby Cauliflower Flower, Bag of Green Beans and the Run Over Potato. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Mizuki
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 391 Orchard Road #05-32Ngee Ann City Podium BlockSingapore (238872)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Omakase Tempura Meal, Sushi Set Meal
data.ABOUT:
Tucked in Ngee Ann City along Orchard Road, Mizuki is a Japanese restaurant to enjoy cuisine of the highest order. Well-known for their Omakase Tempura Meal, the restaurant specialises in whipping up tasty tempura dishes. 

Perfect for intimate meals, the restaurant is segregated into private rooms with the option of dining at the sushi counter or the tempura counter. For the tempura experience, start with a simple plate of spinach and beancurd skin in dashi sauce before moving onto the scallop. Cooked medium rare, the wonderful texture of the scallop elevates the dish, giving it a fantastic flavour. Deep fried to perfection, the anago is a delicious mouthful of sweet and tangy flavour, enhanced by the acidity brought about by a drop of lemon juice. Wrap up your meal with a small bowl of fluffy Japanese short grain rice topped with diced tempura prawns. 

The sushi set features the usual fanfare of traditional Japanese favourites such as eight different pieces of sashimi sushi, as well as a variety of handrolls. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Mizume
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lunch Set, Dinner Set
data.ABOUT:
Located along Hong Kong Street, Mizume is an omakase restaurant in Singapore. Bringing with him over 30 years of experience in Japanese fine dining, chef and owner Lawrence Chia aims to wow diners with meticulously prepared dishes featuring seasonal ingredients.

Step into the cosy and elegant 25-seater restaurant for an intimate dining experience. Featuring a wood-lined exterior and a semi-dark interior, the restaurant is great for private events or small get-togethers. Showcasing the freshest exports from Toyosu fish market three times a week, the dishes are creatively handcrafted by the chefs and made for the discerning palates. Choose from four excellent choices of lunch and three dinner sets to begin your luxurious dining experience. 

Promising diners a creative omakase dining experience, diners can look forward to fresh and innovative combinations of traditional Japanese favourites. Open daily from Monday to Saturday, drop by during lunch or dinner time to enjoy Japanese fine dining at its best. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Mizuya
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fugu Mirin Boshi, Wagyu Tataki, Aburi Sushi, Special Chirashi Don, Shiromi Usuzukuri
data.ABOUT:
Nestled along Cavan Road, Mizuya is a gem waiting to be discovered by lovers of Japanese food. Omakase (chef’s choice) is the menu on offer here, though you’ll find affordable sets available during the busy lunch hour. 

By day, tuck into a selection of donburi, from a premium Wagyu Don set complete with a sous-vide egg, to affordably-priced Chirashi or Sashimi & Unagi Don sets. 

Come dinner time, the restaurant transforms into an intimate space where diners indulge in an extensive tasting menu. Tuck into three kinds of appetisers, and a refreshing salmon carpaccio. Dinner then progresses to an assortment of seasonal sashimi, served on a bed of ice and beautifully garnished with edible flowers. A bowl of piping hot clear soup is a good palate-cleanser, before the chef serves up the main courses — nigiri sushi, a mini don bowl, and miso soup, ending with some sweet Japanese fruit and hot tea for dessert. Sushi fans can opt for a full Nigiri Sushi Omakase, which comes with 15 pieces of nigiri sushi and a handroll. 

Head chef Kenny is also an expert in pairing whisky with Japanese food, so be sure to ask him for recommendations on a delicious dram for an accompanying nightcap. (Jul 2019)

data.title: MoboMoga
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 207 River Valley Road#01-58UE Square River WingSingapore (238275)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tsukune, Yakisoba, Karaage, Shizuoka Oden
data.ABOUT: MoboMoga is a quaint little sake bar, tucked away in a little corner in UE Square Shopping Mall. Stepping inside this place allows one to feel at home instantly with its cosy atmosphere and friendly bartenders. MoboMoga also boasts a wide selection of Sakes and food options to pair with, making this the perfect place for Sake lovers as well for people looking for a chill night out. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Moghul Mahal Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Rogan Josh, Garlic Naan, Paneer Tikka, Seekh Kabab
data.ABOUT:
Moghul Mahal is an institution for North Indian food lovers in Singapore. Established almost 30 years ago, when there were only a small handful of restaurants serving authentic North Indian food, Moghul Mahal has stood the test of time and needs no introduction to those in the know of the local dining scene.
It has steadily built up a pool of loyal patrons that have followed the restaurant and its exquisite range of fine North Indian dishes through its multiple incarnations in various locations over the past 3 decades. Using only the finest ingredients and freshly blended spices, the award winning chefs bring to life the wonderful universe of flavours that Indian food has to offer, delivering a feast for all the senses that will undoubtedly delight and satisfy you. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Mona Lounge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Songstress, Lady’s Elixir, Dangerous Romance, First Bouquet, Longevity Highball
data.ABOUT:
Sum Yi Tai has already made a name for itself with its sensuous name and unique ambience the straitlaced would cover from. Now, they’ve upped the ante with a bar in the back room of the second floor of the restaurant which is accessible only with a password that can be obtained on the website or from the servers on the first floor. From the gilded mahjong gold tiles on the tables to the cushy upholstery arranged with purposeful carelessness, everything about this bar screams ostentatious excess.

The draw here are the cocktails, each with their unique link to Mona, the elusive third wife the restaurant draws its name from. Ask, and the bartenders are sure to regale you with tales of Mona’s exploits, and how each concoction got its name. Sip on the light Lady’s Elixir, a mix of Remy Martin and VSOP mixed with monk fruit soda and sea salt drops for a lightly sweet flavour. Purported to have “close to zero” calories, this is the perfect drink for diners watching their waistlines. 

For something closer to home, try the Songstress. Served in a bottle of Pei Pa Koa, this drink is made with Bulleit Rye whiskey, angostura bitters, and a hearty dose of the sickly sweet traditional herbal medicine most Singaporeans have grown to love. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Mondo Mio Italian Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Four Cheese Pizza, Mondo Mio Pizza, Ossobuco, Pappardelle Casalinghe Mondo Mio, Pappardelle di Spinaci ai Gamberoni in Crema di Zafferano, Tiramisu
data.ABOUT:
Robertson Quay has long had a stellar reputation as a trendy dining and nightlife destination, probably partly due to its choice location along the Singapore River. As you walk along this iconic river, you can't help but sense an instant lightness in your step, a bounce in your walk, and a rumble in your belly. And if you think there's something reminiscent of the canals of Venice, why not answer that rumble with a trip to Mondo Mio?
Mondo Mio is an authentic Southern Italian restaurant which is as Italian as it gets. Freshly-made pizza and pasta make up the bulk of the menu and cheese is used generously. Still not enough cheese? The Four Cheese Pizza comes highly recommended. Fans of the thin thin-crust variety of the famous Italian pie will also enjoy the satisfying biscuit-like crunch with each bite.
If you're not a huge fan of either pizza or pasta, or just happen to be craving for a good chunk of meat, the premium veal shank is your answer. Braised on low fire with rosemary and thyme, the shank comes served on a bed of rich and flavourful saffron risotto made with simmered Italian Arborio rice. Just the sight of it is guaranteed to make you want to belt out a melody like a Gondola singer. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Monster Curry (100AM)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Flame Monster Curry, Chashu Curry Ramen, Combo Curry Ramen Set, Seafood Fantasy
data.ABOUT:
The only restaurant in Singapore that serves Japanese demi glace curry made with as many as 14 varying vegetables and spices, Monster Curry keeps diners coming back for more.

Big on size and huge on taste, the restaurant’s monstrous bowls of curry rice and noodles bring joy and spice to all! Perfect for sharing, opt for the 41cm plate and spread the love of Monster Curry’s smooth and fragrant curry with family and friends.

All dishes at Monster Curry are served at five different levels of spiciness. Daredevils can opt for the monster spicy or super spicy option while others can enjoy the hot sauce concoction at a normal spicy level. A popular favourite, the Flame Monster Curry consists of pork shabu shabu, tori karaage, shrimp tempura, onsens egg and cheese for a satisfying one dish meal. Other signature menu options include the Chashu Curry Ramen and Combo Curry Ramen Set.

For those who fancy pasta, a plethora of creamy and tangy pasta options are available on the menu. Opt for Seafood Fantasy and indulge in a taste of the flavours from the ocean in a single plate. (Feb 2021)

data.ABOUT:
The only restaurant in Singapore that serves Japanese demi glace curry made with as many as 14 varying vegetables and spices, Monster Curry keeps diners coming back for more. 

Big on size and huge on taste, the restaurant’s monstrous bowls of curry rice and noodles bring joy and spice to all! Perfect for sharing, opt for the 41cm plate and spread the love of Monster Curry’s smooth and fragrant curry with family and friends. 

All dishes at Monster Curry are served at five different levels of spiciness. Daredevils can opt for the monster spicy or super spicy option while others can enjoy the hot sauce concoction at a normal spicy level. A popular favourite, the Flame Monster Curry consists of pork shabu shabu, tori karaage, shrimp tempura, onsens egg and cheese for a satisfying one dish meal. Other signature menu options include the Chashu Curry Ramen and Combo Curry Ramen Set. 

For those who fancy pasta, a plethora of creamy and tangy pasta options are available on the menu. Opt for Seafood Fantasy and indulge in a taste of the flavours from the ocean in a single plate. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Monster Planet (Causeway Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.ABOUT:
Landing in Causeway Point, Monster Planet is Monster Curry Groups’ debut of a halal-certified brand. Known for their monster-sized curries dished up at pocket-friendly prices, the iconic Japanese restaurant chain is offering its fiery dishes alongside other exclusive menu options at Monster Planet. 

Made with 14 varying vegetables and spices, the addictive sauce is cooked over low fire for two days, resulting in an intensely flavourful sauce. Popular signatures drenched in this fiery sauce include the Monster Curry Combo, Signature Chicken Katsu Curry, Monster Combo Curry Ramen and more. For those looking for a taste of something different, the burger options at Monster Planet will surely satisfy your cravings. Seasoned with teriyaki sauce, the juicy patty in the Supreme Beef Burger is handmade using premium beef for a delicious one meal dish. The Lemongrass Chicken Burger is another mouthwatering option that comes highly recommended. 

End your meal on a sweet note with the restaurant’s Mixed Berries Honey Toast. Drizzled with strawberry syrup, the Shibuya style toast features a tasty mix of Ben & Jerry’s vanilla ice cream with strawberries and blueberries. (Feb 2021)
