data.title: Monte Risaia
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pescatora Rosa Shiso & Omaru Lobster Dashi Pasta, Omi Wagyu Tagliatelle
data.ABOUT:
Monte Risaia spotlights Japanese flavours executed with Italian flair. 

Dining omakase-style, with a three-course menu starting from $68 and a six-course menu from $128. The meal starts with an amuse bouche and assorted appetizers, before moving on to pasta and the main course. 

Pastas here are cooked to perfection. The Pescatora Rosa Shiso & Omaru Lobster Dashi Pasta is an umami-rich dish of plump juicy lobster sitting in a light and tangy tomato-based broth made from dashi stock. 

For mains, the Omi Wagyu Tagliatelle promises to win over your heart — and stomach — with its beautifully-marbled meat, seared to medium-rare doneness. The beef is buttery and meltingly tender, best paired with a glass of classic Italian red wine or some fine Japanese sake. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Monti
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: House-made Spaghetti Aglio Olio e Gamberi, House-made Ravioli, Mayura Wagyu Beef Tartare, House-exclusive Mayura Full Blood-Wagyu T-bone, Butternut Squash Tortelloni
data.ABOUT:
Known for its award-winning architectural marvel and elegant multi-concept space, Monti @ 1-Pavilion continues to be the bay’s jewel for culinary excellence, new-age cocktail creations and reliable breath-taking views of the entire Marina Bay. Located at the iconic spherical Fullerton Pavilion, Monti was designed with versatility in mind – from rich, jewel-toned furnishings to floor-to-ceiling windows that provide copious natural light by day and the city's twinkle lights by night, she is a wonderful collision of both elegance and old-school charm.

Co-curated by both culinary maestros, Monti menus bring the soul of authentic Tuscan-Italian cuisine to elevated heights, using only premium ingredients sourced with as much care as her décor – including olive oils created specifically for the restaurant. Just as Chef Felix still hand-crafts his pasta, Chef Emanuele displays a level of devotion to quality that produces knockout hero dishes. Straight-forward and easy to love, Monti’s menu consists of composed appetizers and entrees that echo Italy’s charm. Main-stays like “The Fiorentina Experience’’ and ‘’The Omakase Menu’’ showcases a crescendo of flavor, moving guests along on an unforgettable gastronomical journey.

As the night progresses, Monti offers the glamour of a city rooftop for after-work aperitifs, along with the charm of a sunset elopement dinner. Combining personalized service and chef-driven menus, Monti is one of the most-beloved fine-dining destinations for cosmopolites at the Marina Bay. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Monzen@Gardens
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Don, Salmon Roll, Assorted Sashimi
data.PRESS RELEASE: Monzen@Gardens is situated at myVillage @ Serangoon Garden. Opened by former Campus Superstar alumni Renfred Ng, Monzen@Gardens is the latest venture after The Milky Way Homemade Ice-Cream and Coffee at Tanglin Halt. To maximise seating capacity, the shop utilises a part of the outdoor area for seats, while a small bar counter seating is also available. The menu offers a variety of sides, as well as Donburi items to choose from. Beverages include Japanese tea, soft drinks, and alcoholic options. (Jul 2019)

data.title: MooTeow Chilli Beef Kway Teow
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sliced Beef, Mixed Beef, Mixed Beef with Tendon, Mixed Beef Soup
data.ABOUT:
MooTeow Chilli Beef Kway Teow is best known for its authentic and traditional Teochew Beef Noodles. Building on the heritage of Empress Place Beef Kway Teow, fans will recognise the distinctive Teochew style and flavour which features the eatery's signature chilli in every bowl. This addictive chilli paste is made from hand-chopped chillies, a mix of secret spices, and a dash of pineapple that adds a citrus kick.

Simplicity is key here, with the menu offering only four options. But boy do they hit all the right notes. Silky smooth kway teow is accompanied by your choice of sliced beef, mixed beef (beef tripe, beef brisket and beef meatballs), mixed beef with tendon, or mixed beef with soup. All orders also come with a bowl of sweet and savoury beef broth that will leave you wanting more. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Moosehead Kitchen and Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.Location: Chinatown, Raffles Place, Tanjong Pagar, Telok Ayer
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bacon-Wrapped Dates; Grilled Duck Hearts and Fennel on Sourdough; Fried Artichokes, Ricotta and Bottarga; Cauliflower, Garlic Miso and Leek Confit; Beetroot, Smoked Goat's Cheese and Ponzu; Lamb Rump, Green Tahini, Whipped Feta and Kale
data.ABOUT:
Moosehead Kitchen is the eclectic corner bar on Telok Ayer Street that you've no doubt heard about, owing to their strategic location (at the cross junction of Cross Street and Telok Ayer Street) and vibe that exudes a palpable kinetic buzz.
Best described as 'elevated street food' inspired by the 'investigative wanderings' of owner Daniel Ballis, Moosehead serves edgy, freestyle food that centers around Mediterranean flavours with influences from around the world. Unafraid to colour outside the lines of traditional small plates cuisine, the menu is constantly evolving; filled with diverse, smoky fare, prepared from an open kitchen that features an INKA charcoal grill.
The surrounding bar helps revive the "counter culture", acting as the best seats in the house amongst a refreshingly non-traditional approach to décor. Dusky wood tones and mismatched chairs channel a cool cabin in the woods, while inked up walls and an indie soundtrack provide an energetic rhythm to the place.
Standouts on the menu include sweet-savoury bacon wrapped chargrilled dates with roast garlic aioli and crunchy pine nuts, fried artichoke, house-made ricotta and bottarga shavings, and the cauliflower, garlic miso and leek confit. A favourite of other local chefs, which is perhaps the greatest endorsement of all, Moosehead is one to watch on the Singapore dining scene - that is, if you're not already hooked. (Mar 2016)

data.title: Morettino Italian Café & Bistro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Arancini, Bruschetta Platter, Italian Chopping Board, Grass Fed Beef Burger, Baked Pasta
data.ABOUT:
Located in Tanjong Pagar, 100 AM Mall, Morettino Cafe serves authentic Italian Food, prepared daily, combined with the delicious Italian Coffee, Italian Wines and beers come in a snug space with a relaxed European cafe feel.
Morettino Cafe opened its doors in September 2018 serving Italian Espresso and other coffee drinks, gourmet open-faced Paninis, authentic pastas & pizzas, burgers, healthy salads, and homemade desserts & cakes with vegetarian options. You will find a reasonably priced menu of a wide selection of tasty Italian foods, wines, and coffee. A traditional Sicilian cuisine is vibrant in the menu as well as other Italian classics.
Our main focus is to provide unique and authentic food, coffee, and wine experience in our cozy, chic, modern, and charming location in 100 AM Mall next to Amara Hotel. Our strongest belief is that less is more and simple is good.
Deliver delicious food and coffee takes dedication, love, and care and this is precisely our motto for our guests at Morettino Cafè.
Our coffee - you cannot go wrong - is Morettino, an Italian must, Caffe Morettino is an artisanal slow coffee produced in Sicily, in the middle of the Mediterranean, since 1920.
Our fresh homemade food such as Mediterranean Aglio Olio with Prawns, Mediterranean Salad,  Beef Burger,  Paninis (sandwiches), bread, lasagna, pastas, pizzas, arancinis, cakes are freshly made. The cafè is based on sharing a way of Italian life style in which guests are invited to be aware of what it means to eat fresh food and not massive unfresh productions.
We strongly believe in a diet based on a balance between meat, vegetables, cheeses, carbohydrates, and protein and in awareness to be part of an amazing Universe that provide us such good resources and we need to do our part as a conscious human being, paying respect and not being greedy in pretending what earth cannot produce in such big quantity without damaging the environment.
If you want to indulge in our tiramisu, you are more than welcome and we will not tell anyone your indulgence.
Morettino Café experience is about more than just food. A sincere effort to educate our staff on all aspects of food, coffee, and wine culture is the basis for our service philosophy. Our value-driven wine list features 100 bottles starting from $38 and under $100. Our wines, like our food, are never static and change with the seasons. Labels range from interesting newcomers to Old-World classics from small-production winemakers who put as much love and care into their wines as we put into our food.
When you visit Morettino Cafè, we hope you are ready to share an experience that does not want to be pretentious but wants and hopes to be lived in the same way we make food, with love and passion.
Our concept is to use love and balance in choosing and making our dishes, considering also a way to eat and use daily.Morettino uses a basic philosophy imported from the Sicilian culture. Our warm and charming atmosphere we hope will relax you, Chef’s specials are also added to the daily menu already established.
Morettino Cafè is the perfect destination anytime you are hungry or fancy a good cuppa or simply want to relish a glass of quality wine or beer.
We are open 7 days a week.We hope you will have a great time! (Jan 2021)

data.title: Morsels
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Jowl Char Siew Wonton Mee, House-Poached Octopus, Wild Sri Lankan Prawns Laksa, Jackfruit Banana Cake
data.ABOUT:
Located in the lush greenery of Dempsey Hill, this restaurant has all the makings of a chilled out hangout spot away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The interior of this restaurant is almost as green as its exterior, with hanging plants, repurposed wooden furniture, and wood panelling reminiscent of a weatherboard cottage.

This restaurant has won many accolades throughout the years and has gained an experience for their excellent food, and it’s not difficult to see why. Chef-Owner Petrina Loh draws on her childhood for inspiration for her dishes, and has created sharing platters of fusion cuisine that feature the perfect balance of flavours. 

Diners looking for a unique dish can try the Pork Jowl Char Siew Wonton Mee. Made with tender, locally sourced pork jowl, herbal soy sauce, pork and kimchi wontons, and a fiery jalapeño chilli sauce, this dish seamlessly incorporates the spice of Korean and Latin American cuisine into a dish that is uniquely Singaporean. 

Looking for a unique treat to end your meal? Look no further than the Jackfruit Banana Cake. Made with chunks of fragrant jackfruit and sweet banana, and topped with Mugi miso meringue and drizzled with chocolate sauce, this dish is deliciously sweet without being cloying, and the perfect dessert to end an excellent meal. 

Ultimately, while Chef Petrina's culinary pedigree is nothing to sniff at, with Le Cordon Bleu and a stint at HUSK in Nashville under her belt, it's really the intimate hospitality and innovative courses that will keep you coming back, time and time again, for more. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Morton's The Steakhouse
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly, Cajun
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Location: City Hall, Marina Bay, Promenade, Marina Central
data.Address: 5 Raffles Avenue4th FloorMandarin Oriental SingaporeSingapore (039797)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oysters Rockefeller, Tuna Tacos, Chilled Ocean Platter, Baked Five Onion Soup, Lobster Bisque, Cajun Ribeye Steak, Porterhouse Steak, Chicken Bianco, Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes, Morton's Legendary Hot Chocolate Cake
data.ABOUT:
Situated smack dab in the middle of the Commercial and Central Business District, Morton's The Steakhouse in Mandarin Oriental is the truest and bluest steakhouse Singapore has to offer. Not skimping on any detail, everything from the succulent steaks and fresh seafood to the vast wine collection and seamless service reiterate the classic and exceptional dining experience Morton's is widely known for.
As mentioned, no detail is overlooked and this is clearest when glancing at the menu. Serving the best available aged grain-fed beef, such as the must-try 48-ounce (1300g) Porterhouse and 20-ounce (550g) New York Sirloin, as well as fresh fish, Maine Lobster,  and lamb chops - the menu offers generous portions of it all.
Equally renowned for their extensive wine list, the bar at Morton's is one of our favourite post-work spots to grab a drink, indulge in bar bites like their Blue Cheese Steak Fries, and loosen up after a long day at work! (Apr 2016)

data.title: Mouth Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Suckling Pig, Peking Duck, Black Char Siew, Phoenix Soon Hock Fish, Chilli & Black Pepper Crab
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Established in 1989, we began in a teahouse that serves fresh handmade dim sum and Cantonese fare to Singapore’s Hong Kong expatriate community. 30 years on, the teahouse has transformed into a family-friendly restaurant that has remained resolute in its interpretations of Cantonese cooking. Now an all-inclusive Chinese restaurant, we offer affordably priced innovative dim sum in a family-friendly environment.

To sample Mouth Restaurant’s signature flavors, diners should go with the Roasted Suckling Pig, Peking Duck, Black Char Siew, Phoenix Soon Hock Fish, Chilli & Black Pepper Crab. Mouth’s Liu Sha Bao has also made waves among the local foodie community - its custard buns have been recognized by Epicure Food Magazine and Lifestyle Asia, as one of Singapore’s Best. In 2014, the restaurant was rated as one of the top 23 dim sum restaurants in Singapore. In 2018, it was voted one of the top Chinese Restaurants in Singapore. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Muchos
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Real Deal, Stuffed Jalapenos, Crispy Churros, Cheesy Little Thing
data.ABOUT:
Located at the heart of Singapore’s iconic nightlife district, Muchos brings the theme of modern Mexico to life with its vibrant coloured walls and fun ornaments. With an abundance of scrumptious and authentic Mexican cuisine, Muchos promises an unforgettable dining experience by the riverside.  

 

Extra crispy on the outside and cheesy on the inside, the fiery combination of Stuffed Jalapenos is the perfect crowd-pleasing appetiser. For those dining in groups, The Real Deal is an extravagant take on cheese dips. Featuring freshly prepared vegetables, golden tortilla chips and a heap of ground beef, this plate of nachos is just the dish to get the party started. Additional side dishes to complement your meal include the Crispy Churros and Mexican Hot Wings.  

 

Looking to add an extra crunch? Muchos has got you covered with their Grilled Corn. A beautiful shade of gold, the lightly grilled corn is topped with sauce and mozzarella cheese flakes. End your meal on a savoury note with Muchos’ Cheesy Little Thing. A popular sweet dish in Mexico, these sumptuous quesadillas are the perfect way to wrap up any meal. (Sep 2020)

data.title: MxG Classics
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Moonlight Kway Teow, Grilled Siam Squid, MXG Shrimp Paste, Kang Kong In-A-Bite
data.ABOUT:
There’s nothing better than your favourite pot of mala xiang guo and a good pint of beer to end off your night after a hard day’s work. Here at MxG Classics, enjoy a harmonious combination of both as you kick back and relax with family or friends. 

Offering a localised version of mala xiang guo, MxG Classics seeks to redefine the traditional fiery experience and bring about a unique explosion of flavours in every bite. Fans of the numb and fiery mala xiang guo will definitely not want to miss out on the MXG classic pot bases. Simply pick any five ingredients and choose your preferred cooking style to enjoy a bowl of fiery goodness! If you’re not a fan of mala, fret not, for there’s something for everyone at MxG Classics. 

Try the Moonlight Kway Teow. Stir fried with a mixture of classic local ingredients such as cockles, vegetables and fried fish cake, the flat rice noodles are seasoned with oyster sauce for maximum flavour. Add some bites and sides for a lovely spread. Signature sides include the Grilled Siam Squid, MXG Shrimp Paste and the Kang Kong In-A-Bite. Pair your meal with a pint of any of our crafted beers for a tasty meal. (Oct 2020)

data.title: My Little Spanish Place (Boat Quay)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Migas, Sepia, Handmade Sausage Platter, Secreto Iberico, Leche Merengada
data.PRESS RELEASE:
My Little Spanish Place, one of Singapore's first Spanish restaurants, has setup its second home-style space in town. Housed at the ground level of a conservation shophouse along the Boat Quay riverside, guests can now have a taste of Spanish 'meson' dining right in the heart of the CBD.
With its new location by the waters, the My Little Spanish Place chef duo, Chefs Maria Sevillano and Edward Esmero, naturally looked to the Balearic Islands - anarchipelago made up of 4 islands, the well-known clubbing destination Ibiza, Majorca, Minorca and Formentera. The brand new menu offers dishes inspired by new regions previously not explored. (Aug 2015)

data.title: My Little Spanish Place (Bukit Timah)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pulpo de la Casa, Chuletillas de Cordero, Cochinillo Asado, Churros
data.ABOUT:
Newly renovated and with a new chef sharing the helm, My Little Spanish Place is once again right at the forefront of the Spanish culinary wave that has left Singaporeans in a tizzy. Chef Edward Esmero joins Chef Maria Sevillano in the kitchen and promises to bring a completely new perspective to the cuisine that has so quickly settled as one of our island's favourites.
There is still a strong focus on authentic, home-cooked style dishes, and the new revamped menu combines old favourites with new ones. Simple, classic favourites like the Pulpo de la Casa (grilled fresh octopus seasoned with pimenton, sea salt, and olive oil) or the Chuletillas de Cordero ($32), pan-fried cutlets of milk-fed lamb with a garlic white wine reduction, are exactly reminiscent of the local fare in the countryside regions of Spain. The team is also introducing a brunch menu that's only available on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays (till 3pm) that include a Spanish version of the classic ham and eggs! Considering the general quality of Spanish ham, that sounds amazing to us!
 Chef Edward shares that My Little Spanish Place aims to be somewhere friends and family can bond over a good meal, so round up those friends and family members! Any excuse for a good meal works for us! (Aug 2013)

data.title: My Little Tapas Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Charcuterie Platter, Andalusian Flatbread, Gambas Picante, Tortilla Espanola, Tapas Steak, Mini Chocolate Tarts
data.ABOUT:
Tucked in along lively Ann Siang Road, My Little Tapas Bar is a cheeky newcomer in Singapore's love affair with Spanish tapas. With simple, classic fare done as the Spanish do - as an accompaniment to long, lovely evenings filled with wine and laughter - My Little Tapas bar is sure to steal your heart.
Taking a more authentic approach to tapas than usual, per its sister restaurant My Little Spanish Place, this tapas bar is all about the bona fide, Iberian originals - an all-Spanish wine list, five types of jamones carved-to-order, Spanish cheeses and only the most fundamental of Spanish snacks. The interior features rough-hewn woody tones and modern touches like bare bulbs. Spanish flare is evident in vintage posters, bullfighter-red napkins and rope accents that recall a traditional torero. The wine list is concise and convincing, each entry boasting its high Robert Parker and (Spanish equivalent) GUIA Penin scores, so you know that your choice will be a great one.
The cuisine is so classic and restrained that you can taste each ingredient that went into the dish. Andalusian flatbread features caramelized onions, piquillo peppers and a rioja reduction over grilled bread. The gambas are seasoned with smoky paprika and garlic, creating slurry so tasty that we recommend digging down into the dish long after the prawns are gone. For dessert, try the Chocolate Tart served with a traditional meringue sorbet with flavours of cinnamon. In all, My Little Tapas Bar's disarmingly chic combination of modern decor, warm vibe and delicious food has it poised to become your little tapas bar. (Mar 2014)

data.title: NAMI
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 22 Orange Grove RoadLevel 3Valley Wing, State RoomShangri-La HotelSingapore (258350)                                                Map
data.ABOUT:
Nestled within the illustrious Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore, NAMI Restaurant & Bar showcases perfectly balanced culinary creations that stay true to authentic Japanese cuisine, harmonised with international influences.

The restaurant currently operates from the State Room located at the Valley Wing, and guests are invited to immerse in a splendid, diversified dining experience with Japanese chef, Yutaro San, and omotenashi (Japanese hospitality) from the heart.

Under the leadership of Chef Yutaro Tsuchiya who has decades of experience and exposure to distinct influences from overseas working experiences and travels, the repertoire of gastronomic delights at NAMI showcases a mindful balance of the art of Japanese cuisine with international influences as techniques and flavours that Chef Yutaro has discovered from his exploration of different cultures are incorporated into the culinary creations. From slicing techniques to unique marinades, the culinary team’s craft of treating each ingredient differently with skill brings out the best of each produce. 

Hailing from Yokosuka, Yokohama, Chef Yutaro was raised near the sea, laying the foundation for his expertise in handling seafood and his deep-rooted appreciation for fresh seasonal produce, which forms the heart of the restaurant’s identity today. NAMI, which means wave in Japanese, transports the pulse of the sea from Japan to diners in Singapore with an unrelenting dedication to seasonality, flying in seasonal fresh catches from Japan frequently as the delicacies are available.

Guests can look forward to savouring quality produce at their peak in a la carte selections as well as curated set menus that are updated frequently to present only the best that are in season. (Dec 2020)

data.title: NOX - Dine in the Dark
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.ABOUT:
This social experiment-meets-unique dining experience has enthralled diners with its fascinating concept: led into a restaurant that’s completely shrouded in darkness, with only a blind guide to assist you; sight, one of the key elements of taste, is removed. What remains is for you to enjoy the mystery of what’s on your plate, and discover a new element of taste: surprise. All the while, your blind guide helps you navigate the table and your plate, in a reversal of roles that will leave you with something to ponder beyond a delicious meal.

The food here is no afterthought, either, and features a French palette courtesy of veteran Chef, Desmond Lee. The meals change each day, but take the form of an appetizer, a main, and a dessert. In the dark, a meal may open with ethically-sourced foie gras paired with honey-sweet dried figs and a rich gorgonzola cream. A main course may take the form of a lobster tail, poached in butter and paired with a gelée of fennel, pickled radish, and chili-infused coconut broth, or meltingly tender Kobe beef short ribs served with thyme jam, compressed tomato, and creamy mash. Even in the dark, there’s room for dessert, especially sophisticated numbers like Manjari chocolate cremeux with a crumbly “soil” of cashew and chocolate, garnished with pink salt caramel and peanut sorbet. Strip yourself of one of your primary senses, and see what becomes intensified at this super cool dining experience! (Apr 2017)

data.title: Nalan Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hara Bara Kebab, Paneer Tikka Masala, Mixed Vegetable Curry, Aloo Shimlamirch, Paneer Butter Masala, Dal Tadka, Rava Onion Masala Thosai, Paper Thosai, Assorted Bread Basket
data.ABOUT:
It’s all about food from the heart at Nalan Restaurant. Set up in 2009 by two old friends who were dissatisfied with the then-available options for Indian cuisine, Nalan Restaurant has blossomed into a gem that spins out authentic Indian vegetarian fare meticulously prepared with traditional cooking methods-- no doubt the reason for their impressive pool of loyal patrons who return for a heartwarming taste of home-cooked food.
Nalan’s dedication to their customers is clearly evident in their ability to cater to traditional Jain diets. Dishes without onion and garlic, such as Palak Paneer and Sbji Diwani-hundi, are commonplace and should you have any dietary restrictions or food allergies, Nalan’s skilled chefs are more than happy to whip something up for you without sacrificing taste or quality.
The menu also features an impressive range of options from all across India. We are major fans of the Paneer Butter Masala, featuring satisfying cottage cheese cubes drenched in a creamy sauce of tomato and butter. Tip: soak up every last drop of goodness with some naan. If you’re looking for some Western fare, Nalan’s got you covered too, with exciting options like the Asparagus and Baby Bella salad and the Rigatoni with Broccoli, Walnuts and Ricotta. What’s there not to like? (Aug 2016)

data.title: Nalati Restaurant & Events
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 9 Raffles PlaceLevel 1 & 2, (Walk in via Distrii Main Entrance)Republic Plaza 1Singapore (048619)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Soft- Shell Crab with Almond, Pan-Seared Lamb Rack, 2 ways Lobster with Linguine, Pan-seared with Butter Sauce, Nalati Tiramisu, Pistachio Ice Cream with Seasonal Fruits and Caramel Sauce
data.ABOUT:
A unique garden-themed restaurant located in the heart of Singapore, Nalati features a one-of-a-kind dining experience where casual dining meets experiential shopping and art.

Start your day with the restaurant’s hearty brunch set. A delicious mix of crispy bacon, sausages, eggs and truffle grilled mushrooms, this plate of wonderfully blended colours and flavours is sure to tantalise your tastebuds. Follow up with a soft and fluffy muffin stuffed with mixed berries and chocolate chips. Impossible to resist, these delectable baked goods are created in-house daily and make for the perfect tea-time treat. For those looking for affordable meals, Nalati has a list of scrumptious set menus that are wallet-friendly. Seafood lovers should opt for the Marinated Grilled Prawns and Teriyaki Baked Salmon paired with Aglio Olio Pasta for a satisfying meal.

Don’t leave without trying the Lotus Rice. Steamed in a lotus leaf wrap, the fragrant rice is a classic dim sum choice for many. Other recommended dishes include the Pandan Cereal Prawn, Pumpkin Soup with Scallop, Steamed Codfish and Soft-Shell Crab with Almond Flakes. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Nan Jing Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cucumber with Sesame Oil, Chilli Crab, Pork Trotters, Deep Fried Pumpkin Pancake
data.ABOUT:
Nan Jing Restaurant offers an array of flavourful menu dishes that focuses on Huaiyang and Cantonese cuisine, aiming to bring authentic Chinese cuisine to Singapore.

Appetisers are simple yet delicious. For example, the Cucumber with Sesame Oil is lightly seasoned and garnished with diced chilli padi, giving it a sweet and tangy flavour. The Preserved Egg is another crowd favourite. Cubes of salted eggs are served up on a platter decorated with carrots, beans and flowers. 

However, the star of the show at Nan Jing Restaurant is undeniably the Chilli Crab. Freshly cooked, the crab meat is juicy and succulent and tastes best when dipped in the thick and spicy Chilli Crab sauce. The Pork Trotter is another worthy contender. Fried with peanuts  and coriander, the Pork Trotters are a wonderful burst of flavours.

Order a warm bowl of Mushroom Soup to cleanse your palate. Filled with handmade meatballs and mushrooms, the soup is nutritious and refreshing. For those who are craving something more sinful, try the Deep Fried Pumpkin Pancake. Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, this dish presents the perfect balance of flavour. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Nanami Izakaya
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bara Chirashi Don, Saikoro Steak Teppanyaki, Surume Ika, Ama Ebi Karaage, Green Tea Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Nanami Modern Izakaya is a casual eatery that serves authentic Japanese fare and drinks. Conveniently located in Tanjong Pagar, it's the perfect place to grab lunch with colleagues or for some after-work drinks and nibbles.

During lunch, it whips up a variety of donburis for a quick and satisfying meal. The Bara Chirashi Don is a sashimi lover's paradise, with fresh chunks of salmon and tuna sashimi over a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. All donburis come with miso soup, salad, and dessert.

In the evening, the menu expands to include a wider selection of ala carte dishes such as sashimi, maki rolls, tempura, yakitori, grilled dishes, and more. You'll be spoilt for choice with the dishes available. Favourites include the Saikoro Steak Teppanyaki (grilled beef cubes with wafu oroshi sauce), the Surume Ika (grilled squid), and the Ama Ebi Karaage (deep fried sweet shrimp).

The drinks menu completes the izakaya experience, with a tempting range of premium Japanese cocktails, liqueurs, and sake. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Nanbantei Japanese Restaurant (Chinatown Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yakitori Bento, Pork Don Set, Unadon & Tempura Set, Sashimi & Yakitori Course
data.ABOUT:
Established over three decades ago, Nanbantei was Singapore's first and only Yakitori restaurant. 30 years on, and they're still standing strong, serving up stick after stick of their signature skewers.
Lightly seasoned with sea salt to let the flavours of the meat shine through, each skewer is grilled to perfection over high heat using a special type of charcoal, which imbues the meat with a distinctive smoky aroma. This meticulous grilling method results in skewers that are slightly charred on the edges, while retaining all its juicy goodness.
Whether you're looking to tuck into succulent meat on sticks, or seafood and vegetables fresh off the grill, Nanbantei's extensive menu has got you covered. So, for an authentic taste of Japan, Nanbantei is your best bet. (Jul 2017)

data.title: Nanbantei Japanese Restaurant (Far East Plaza)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yakitori Bento, Pork Don Set, Unadon & Tempura Set, Sashimi & Yakitori Course
data.ABOUT:
Established over three decades ago, Nanbantei was Singapore's first and only Yakitori restaurant. 30 years on, and they're still standing strong, serving up stick after stick of their signature skewers.
Lightly seasoned with sea salt to let the flavours of the meat shine through, each skewer is grilled to perfection over high heat using a special type of charcoal, which imbues the meat with a distinctive smoky aroma. This meticulous grilling method results in skewers that are slightly charred on the edges, while retaining all its juicy goodness.
Whether you're looking to tuck into succulent meat on sticks, or seafood and vegetables fresh off the grill, Nanbantei's extensive menu has got you covered. In fact, after over three decades in the business, Nanbantei has just opened a brand new outlet in Chinatown Point, giving you more options for when you're craving an authentic taste of Japan. (Jul 2017)

data.title: Nanjing Impressions
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Drunken Virgin Red Crayfish, Honey-glazed Lotus Roots, Poached Lion's Head Meatball, Salted Duck
data.ABOUT:
Diners looking for pure Nanjing cuisine, look no further. This swish spot in Plaza Singapura is this beloved Chinese restaurant chain’s first foray into Singapore, and serves up a variety of dishes made in classic Chinese style. 

The interior here will transport you back in time to the heyday of China’s first capital - think fine upholstery, traditional calligraphy on the walls, and delicious dishes cooked using time tested methods - there’s a reason why this is one of the must-visit restaurants of China. 

Dig into beloved dishes like Poached ‘Lion’s Head’ Meatball, large generous chunks of pork meatballs served with cabbage and vermicelli noodles in a rich broth. Spice fanatics will enjoy the Mala Red Crayfish, a dish flavoured with traditional Sichuan spice, with the crayfish cooked to perfection inside. The Nanjing Impressions Potstickers dumplings are this restaurant’s claim to fame, and for good reason. The dumplings are tender and chewy, and stuffed with a generous amount of pork filling.

The Honey-glazed Stuffed Lotus root is a simple dish bursting with subtle flavour. The lotus root is rich and cooked to tender perfection and the honey glaze adds a touch of sweetness that contrasts perfectly with the earthiness of the lotus. (June 2018)

data.title: Napoleon Food & Wine Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.Location: Raffles Place, Tanjong Pagar, Club Street, Telok Ayer
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Homemade Grand Marnier Foie Gras Terrine, Hand Cut Angus Beef Tartare, Seared Tuna Steak, Duo of Chocolate Ganache & Mi-Cuit Canelé
data.ABOUT:
With its inky wood interior, rustic stone walls, location on bustling Telok Ayer Street, and namesake emblazoned on the back vaulting, Napoleon Food & Wine Bar certainly lives up to the impression of the cool French wine bar you'd think it is. Then you catch flashes of the very unique.
The visit is streamlined with smart touches of tech - like the long row of enomatic machines that, like adult soda fountains, welcome guests to taste a selection of their 28 wines before committing to a half-glass, glass, or bottle.
The wines and food follow through with Napoleon's concept of an exceptional and easy wine experience. With a varied selection of hand-picked, reasonably-priced French labels categorized by taste, we were able to pick our top choices - and were happy to taste a few along the way - before settling on that perfect glass.
The small plates menu is intelligently created to pair well with all of their wines and are also meant for sharing, making the ordering process lively and involved. The menu offers a range of salads, platters and European and Asian-influenced mains, along with scrumptious desserts that most certainly call for adding a sweet wine to your iPad order!
Napoleon explores the rich culinary history and fabulous offerings of France. The Chef boasts an exquisite menu of traditional French brasserie dishes with a modern twist, focused on low temperature cooking. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Napolizz Pizza
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 200 Turf Club Road#01-15BThe Grand StandSingapore (287994) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Garlic Bread with Mozzarella Cheese, Combo Plate, Pizza Napolizz, Pizza Gorgonzola
data.ABOUT:
An authentic Italian restaurant at Turf City Grandstand, Napolizz Pizza is a family-friendly spot that serves freshly made pizzas. Enjoy these delicious pies alongside an extensive wine list and a variety of alcoholic beverages.

Signature pizzas here include the Pizza Napolizz, Pizza Gorgonzola and Pizza Pollo. Apart from just pizza, the restaurant offers multiple dishes such as appetisers, salads, pastas and main courses. Kickstart your meal with a classic slice of Garlic Bread with Mozzarella Cheese. Toasted with garlic, butter, and parsley before being topped with a generous spread of cheesy goodness, these delicious slices of fluffy bread are the perfect appetisers before your pizza feast.

For celebratory gatherings, order the Combo Plate to sample the huge variety of tasty appetisers that Napolizz Pizza has to offer. From chicken wings to king prawns and potato wedges, this platter has all your favourites on one plate! Those looking for healthier alternatives can opt for lighter meals such as the Rucola Salad or Parma e Melone. Drizzled with olive oil, the latter features thinly sliced Parma Ham and rockmelon. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Nasrin Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Middle Eastern, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Caribbean, Pizza, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hummus, Roasted Lamb Leg, Adana Kebab, Salmon Steak
data.ABOUT: Consistently dishing up delicious Turkish cuisine, Nasrin Restaurant is a great foodie find in the heart of Kampong Glam.If you're into classic Turkish staples, start with a serving of Hummus for a platter of tasty dip made with chickpeas blended with olive oil, fresh garlic, lemon juice, and tahini. Looking for a heartier option? Dig into the American Salata. Drenched in tasty American salad dressing, this light and sour potato salad is an extremely popular choice.The Roasted Lamb Leg is another mouthwatering favourite - this rendition consisting of slow roasted lamb leg that rewards with mouthfuls of tender, juicy meat, along with a side of grilled potatoes. For seafood lovers, the Salmon Steak or Balik Sis are both great options for an affordable one meal dish. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Nassim Hill (Killiney)
data.Cuisine: Bar, International, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steak and Eggs, Buttermilk Pancakes, Brioche French Toast, Personal Truffle Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Situated in the heart of town at Somerset, Nassim Hill (Killiney) is a long-term pop-up concept by the popular eatery, Nassim Hill Bakery Bistro Bar. Serving brunch favourites from every Tuesday to Sunday, swing by to enjoy brunch with drinks and tipples for a short escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. 

Brunch lovers can revel in this afternoon tea spot with classic menu offerings such as a plate of mouth-watering Steak and Eggs or the well-loved stack of fluffy Buttermilk Pancakes.  Drop by early to savour Your Favourite Breakfast. Have your pick of sunny side up or scrambled egg along with your choice of beer Beiser sausage, bacon or honey baked ham alongside a heaty breadbasket. Sinfully delicious, the Brioche French Toast is a guilty pleasure worth every calorie! Decked with toasted almonds, whipped cream, berries and drizzled in maple syrup, this sweet treat is the ultimate indulgence to reward yourself with. 

A wide range of fresh draught beer and wines are available, together with Hendrick’s cocktails specially concocted for the pop up to go perfectly with brunch. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Nassim Hill (Tanglin)
data.Cuisine: American, Seafood, All-Day Breakfast, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Skillet Eggs, Cheddar Cheese Bacon Waffles, Hot Reuben, Chilli Crab Pasta, Mushroom Risotto, Rosemary Lamb with Truffle Potato Mash, Brownie Parfait, Yuzu Breeze, Summer Sangria
data.ABOUT:
With its multipurpose function as a bakery, a bistro, and a bar, Nassim Hill Bakery Bistro Bar has comfortably earned a reputation as a triple threat, must-visit establishment. With its warm, friendly atmosphere and a menu that's easy to love, it's the perfect place for families and for those looking to unwind with friends at the bar after work.
Sink your teeth into an utterly decadent forkful of Rosemary Lamb with Truffle Potato Mash, and savour the balance of delicate rosemary fragrance and tender, grilled lamb chop. The truffle potato mash is an unforgettable component of the dish as well, and will linger (in all its truffle-scented glory) on your mind for days to come. You also can't miss out on the Chilli Crab Pasta, where large chunks of fresh crab meat are sautéed in the restaurant's irresistible homemade chilli crab sauce and served on top of a bed of spaghetti. If you're looking for a refreshing drink to wash all that down, then a Summer Sangria (which serves four) wouldn't be amiss - it's always summer in Singapore after all. The place also offers up a bevy of classic and other innovative cocktails, spirits, and other drinks to tickle your fancy if you feel so inclined. You're bound to have an enjoyable, relaxing time at Nassim Hill, and that's a promise.
 (Aug 2017)

data.title: National Kitchen by Violet Oon (National Gallery)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sambal Timun Nanas, Kiam Chye Ark Thng, Kuay Pie Tee, Buah Keluak Ayam, Beef Rendang, Fish Head Curry, Sayur Lodeh, Hakka Abacus Beads, Kueh Beng Kah, Eurasian Beef Brisket Semor
data.ABOUT:
Violet Oon's unabashed love for, and knowledge of, the Peranakan culinary delights and culture of Singapore has manifested into cookbooks, Violet Oon Singapore, and, more recently, National Kitchen at the National Gallery. Given that we've compared her to Julia Child previously, it's safe to say thatwe're fans.
Peranakans didn't shy away from colour and were known for their intricate or opulent decorations, and you'll definitely see hints of this philosophy in National Kitchen. Decadent dark panels and mirrored walls are lit up by elegant wall sconces whilst references to the Peranakan way of life are peppered throughout the space. Rattan ceiling fans, distinctive tiles, and typical Singaporean foliage like palm leaves and orchids are just a few of the touches that make National Kitchen special.
The food is an excellent introduction into some of the more famous Peranakan dishes like Sambal Timun Nanas (pineapple and cucumber with chillies, onions and lightly sweet rice vinegar), Kiam Chye Ark Thng (soup of duck with salted mustard greens and a hint of spice chillies), and Buah Keluak Ayam (a stew of tangy chicken and the traditional buah keluak nuts). National Kitchen has also opened its menu's borders a little, offering other cultural favourites like Eurasian Beef Brisket Semor and Hakka Abacus Beads.
Be warned though, while some of the dishes may be familiar and well-loved, the Peranakan options often prove to be divisive. Tuck in with an open mind though, and if you're looking for a sophisticated rendition of Peranakan food, you're in for a treat! (Dec 2015)

data.title: Native Kitchen
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 10 Artillery Avenue#02-02Village Hotel at SentosaSingapore (099951)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jumbo Satay Skewers, Big Kahuna Burger, Misoyaki Butterfish, Bebek Goreng, Kalbi Short Rib Loco Moco, Native Kitchen's Nasi Lemak, Pineapple Upside Down Cake, Hula Pie
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located within the cosy Sentosa Island, Native Kitchen takes diners on a culinary adventure with an island-inspired menu featuring the best of land and sea, prepared with a tropical twist. Celebrate the lifestyle of Asian and Polynesian islands with Native Kitchen's take on a number of culinary favourites, while embracing the culture of togetherness with communal dining options. Special attention is paid to the use of fresh ingredients and culinary techniques that bring out the best of natural flavours, ensuring that the Native Kitchen experience is always enjoyable, welcoming and memorable.

Signatures include Steamed Barramundi, Kalbi Short Rib Loco Moco, Bebek Goreng and the classic Big Kahuna Burger. For those who prefer Asian Island classics, our curated selection of Native Kitchen's Nasi Lemak, Singapura Laksa and Jumbo Satay Skewers are sure to delight the palate.

Top the tropical feast with refreshing Native's rejuvenators, smoothies and desserts such as the Ginger Zinger Juice Rejuvenator, Mango Lassi Smoothie, Pineapple Upside Down Cake and Hula Pie. Native Kitchen appeals to guests and diners from all around the world - travellers, families, locals, business executives and leisure-seekers - looking to soak in the easy tropical vibe and savour a truly delectable experience. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Nee Yakitori and Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gyoza Karaage, Quinoa Bowl, Tori Teriyaki Set, Tori Teriyaki Set
data.ABOUT:
Bringing subtle elements of Ginza’s starched collar cocktail culture to Singapore, Nee Yakitori and Bar proudly presents an authentic Japanese dining experience within the Katong neighbourhood. 

Offering a broad collection of Japanese alcohol and affordable bar bites, wine and dine with friends and colleagues at this yakitori restaurant and bar. It employs the famed charcoal Binchotan cooking technique, rewarding diners with tasty skewers that feature a delicious smoky flavour profile. Whet your appetite with the huge variety of tapas options available. Chef recommendations include the Gyoza Karaage and Chicken Skin Karaage. For a simple yet scrumptious one dish meal, meat lovers can opt for the Ribeye Soba. Served with a generous heap of carrots, purple cabbage and mixed salad, the tender piece of perfectly seared meat is drizzled with honey mustard sauce for extra flavour. 

Looking for a heartier meal that’s easy on the wallet? Nee Yakitori and Bar has got your back with the wide selection of set lunch options. The Tori Teriyaki Set is a popular crowd favourite that will have you coming back for more. (May 2021)

data.title: Neon Pigeon

data.title: New Fut Kai Vegetarian 新佛界素食
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Honey Roast Pork, Curry Nonya Fish, Chef-made Roast Duck, Pumpkin Butter Sauce Mushrooms, Crispy Lotus Root with Honey Red Dates, Sanyao Tofu, Pesto Wantons
data.ABOUT:
Spanning more than 10 years of delivering sought-after vegetarian delights, New Fut Kai Vegetarian serves up superb Charcoal Hotpots and Chef Signature dishes for families and corporate diners alike.

Vegans can now rejoice as we provide full-vegan options at request. Make friendships and good conversations over delicious vegetarian food.
Our Signature Dishes - Charcoal Hotpots (Mushroom, Fish Head Laska & Soy Miso)
A soupy mix of fresh and hearty ingredients slowly simmered over a traditional charcoal flame.
Be surprised by flavourful and healthful hot pot ingredients, chock-full of body-restoring vitamins and  beauty-enhancing minerals.
Fusion Wok Dishes - We combine traditional favourites and contemporary dining ideas to bring fresh new flavour combinations. (Apr 2021)

data.title: New Ubin CHIJMES
data.Cuisine: Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: U.S. Black Angus Rib Eye Steak, Crispy Pork Jowl, Boss Bee Hoon, Ubin Fried Mee Sua, Fried Hokkien Mee Special, Smoked Pork Curry, Kaya Toast with French Butter
data.ABOUT:
With the opening of their second outpost in CHIJMES, fans of New Ubin can now indulge in a truly Singaporean dining experience in the heart of the city, thanks to a menu chock-full of mouth-watering tze char dishes and innovative takes on local and Western staples.

Expect signature favourites like USDA Black Angus "Choice" Rib Eye with Heart Attack Fried Rice, Crispy Pork Jowl, and Grilled Lime Leaf Chicken, amidst other new creations, like Milk Fed Veal Chops and Ubin Fried Mee Sua, the latter of which is exclusive to the CHIJMES outlet.

With multiple accolades under their belt, including the coveted Michelin Bib Gourmand, as well as their illustrious history of serving up flavourful kampong-style seafood since 1986, it's no wonder that New Ubin continues to churn out stellar dishes with such ease, pleasing flocks of hungry diners while they're at it. (Jun 2018)

data.title: New Ubin Tampines

data.PRESS RELEASE: Originating from Pulau Ubin, New Ubin has retained its rustic roots and 'kampong' essence through the years, while constantly discovering innovative dishes to suit the local taste buds. New Ubin Tampines will be serving a confluence of hearty tze char with the freshest produce in a laid-back and relaxing environment. Expect signature dishes like USDA Black Angus "Choice" Rib Eye with Heart Attack Fried Rice, as well as the Hokkien Mee Special. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Next Door Spanish Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tortilla De Patatas, Gambas al Ajillo, Croquetas, Paella, Churros Con Chocolate
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Experience the true Spanish dining here at Next Door Spanish Cafe, located in the quaint neighbourhood of Siglap. Serving you with an authentic traditional taste of Spain with classic signature dishes like Tortilla De Patatas—the Spanish omelette consisting of a creamy mix of potatoes, eggs and caramelised onions.

From brunch to dinner, you will be well taken care of with hearty tapas and main dishes, not forgetting the iconic paellas. Take your pick of fish, beef, lamb, or pork from the restaurant’s comprehensive menu. Let’s not forget, of course, the well-loved paellas that is always perfect for sharing with your friends and family.

Sip on exquisite wines and cocktail concoctions while you wait for desserts. Save space for Churros Con Chocolate. Iconically rich, creamy with a hint of bitterness, the flavours are balanced together to create a sinfully sweet and savoury dessert. 


A place like home. Como En Casa! (Jan 2021)

data.title: Ni Pang Zi Grilled Fish

data.title: Niku Katsumata
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: A4 Wagyu Beef Set, Tataki Wagyu, A4 Wagyu Donburi with Caviar, A4 Wagyu Donburi with Ikura, A4 Wagyu Donburi with Foie Gras
data.ABOUT: Welcome to the wonderful world of Japanese beef: meat that’s succulent, sweet, well-marbled, and unbelievably tender. Niku Katsumata prides itself on serving some of the finest beef produced in Japan, plated in the simplest ways to highlight the natural flavours of the meat, and paired with various complementary dishes to create a full, beef-centric meal. At its barest level, the beef here is of such high quality that it’s served up as as sashimi. For cooked beef, one of the specialities here is Tataki Wagyu, a premium A4 Grade Wagyu that’s lightly seared before being placed atop a bowl of rice and given the ‘chasuke’ treatment: a light, savoury bonito stock is poured over the dish, which gently coaxes even more flavour from the beef. You have the option to top this up with premium, umami-rich ingredients like caviar, foie gras, or ikura. You can also have the beef in the form of a magnificent set meal, the A4 Wagyu Beef Set, which features Japanese Pork Prosciutto, a selection of home-made pickles, a premium selection of  A4 Wagyu Beef, and a Japanese A4 Beef Curry Rice. The beef here, beautifully marbled, tender, and served very rare, is prepared by chef Tsuyoshi Katsumata in the most unusual of ways: it’s cooked over a crystal plate, a method that apparently evenly distributes the heat and cooks the meat gently, ensuring it remains perfectly juicy. The incredible flavour of the beef at Niku Katsumata has to be tasted to be believed. A word of warning: you may never go back to your supermarket varieties after this! (Apr 2017)

data.title: Ninethirty by Awfully Chocolate
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Pork Chop, Lamb Chop, Mushroom Crepe, Grilled Cheese Sandwich
data.ABOUT:
Started in 1998 selling only the All Chocolate cake, Awfully Chocolate has grown from one indie store into a group of shops, cafes and restaurants bearing our love for dark chocolate, both in Singapore and overseas.
The flagship Awfully Chocolate store in Singapore, Ninethirty by Awfully Chocolate, offers a contemporary selection of well-loved comfort food and (of course) Awfully Chocolate desserts. Inspired by Awfully Chocolate's philosophy of fresh bakes made by hand and from scratch, Ninethirty by Awfully Chocolate's dining range also incorporates fresh ingredients and handmade elements with a twist. 
Always the best place in Singapore to get that perfect chocolate cake, come get the full experience of what the Awfully Chocolate life is when you dine with us at Ninethirty by Awfully Chocolate. (Mar 2017)

data.title: No Signboard Seafood (Esplanade Mall)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sambal Kang Kong, White Pepper Crab, Chili Crab, Fried Cereal Beancurd, Crispy Cereal Prawn, Drunken Shrimp, Cheese Lobster
data.ABOUT: Indulge your seafood cravings and pay a visit to No Signboard Seafood, the popular chain famous for its White Pepper Crab and other seafood dishes. Part of what makes this particular establishment extra interesting is the story of its humble beginnings, because who doesn’t love a good origin or success story? With a history dating back to the late 1970s, No Signboard Seafood began as a hawker centre seafood stall with literally no signboard and sales of three crabs a day. And look at it now – with outlets in several different locations, the establishment’s story makes for a narrative that’s about as satisfying as the food it serves.All this wouldn’t be possible without some real quality cooking, of course – Singaporeans are a discerning lot when it comes to their food, and a chain that has stood the test of time the way No Signboard Seafood should more or less be worth its salt. Sink your teeth into a delightfully fresh, sweet hunk of crab meat when you order a crab dish (again we’re plugging the White Pepper Crab), and you’ll understand why this is an eatery that has endured for so long. Don’t forget to try the irresistibly spicy Sambal Kang Kong, another popular must-try option. Other seafood items are definitely worth a taste too. Unpretentious and reliable, delicious and satisfying, No Signboard Seafood is definitely a place that hits all the right notes, and then some. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Noka by Tippling Club
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 109 North Bridge Road#07-38/39Funan MallSingapore (179097)(Lift Lobby A, near North Bridge Road entrance)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Edamame, Cod Popcorn, Una-Q, Tuna Taku
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Housed at the 7th floor of Funan’s rooftop, NOKA by Tippling Club is a modern-Japanese restaurant serving spirited small plates bursting with flavour and omakase with a sexy arsenal of Japanese whisky highballs and artisanal sake. Helmed by award-winning Chef Ryan Clift of Tippling Club, known for its ultra-progressive cuisine and cocktails.

Stamping the menu with Tippling Club’s brand of playful gastronomy, NOKA by Tippling Club turns Japanese cuisine on its head into an innovative ingredient-focused dining experience. 
One that still undertakes a profound love and appreciation for Japanese produce and provenance. (Jun 2021)

data.title: Noodle Thai Thai Kitchen @ Beach Road
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Jade Noodle Claypot with Flower Clams, Tom Yum Goong, Stir-Fried Basil Leaves with Chicken, Pad Thai, Thai Honey Mango Sticky Rice
data.ABOUT:
This casual eatery promises an authentic culinary Thai experience with its range of soups, curries, stir fries, noodles and more, prepared by chefs hailing from Bangkok and Northern Thailand. With some unique creations thrown into the mix as well, you'll get a combination that's hard to resist. Know of a dish that isn’t on the menu? Let the chefs know and they’ll try their best to accommodate your request. 

Thai food purists will love the fiery Tom Yum Goong, Stir Fried Basil Leaves with Chicken, and Pad Thai, amongst others. Those who are exceptionally well-versed in the cuisine will also be delighted to know that Khao Soi is on the menu. The coconut curry noodle dish, popular in Chiangmai, is a rare find here.

A must-try item at Noodle Thai Thai Kitchen is their Signature Jade Noodle Claypot with Flower Clams. The emerald-hued spinach noodles are stir-fried with spices, along with your choice of flower clams, basil minced chicken or pork, tuna cubes, or double-grilled chicken. When the spices get too hot to handle, cool down with a refreshing pint of Chang draft beer.

End your meal on a sweet note with iconic Thai desserts such as Honey Mango Sticky Rice and Jasmine Red Ruby. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Noosh Noodle Bar and Grill
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Black Pepper Sirloin Beef, Curly Fries with Bacon and Cheese, Butter Beer
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Noosh Noodle Bar and Grill, a restaurant located at The Esplanade brings together the best of both Asian and Western cuisine in a stunning ambience, perfect for families and special occasions.  

Noosh Noodle Bar and Grill showcases specially crafted contemporary fusion menu that goes beyond regular dining, challenging boundaries with food concoction and exciting senses, all while maintaining unique traditions.  

At Noosh Noodle Bar and Grill we bring sophistication and excitement to everyday comfort food, by introducing and immersing different ingredients, specialty cooking techniques and robust culinary skills. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Nozomi @ Forum The Shopping Mall
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 583 Orchard Road#01-41Forum The Shopping MallSingapore (238884)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Japanese Claypot Rice, Pork Kakuni, Bento Set, Nankotsu Karaage
data.ABOUT:
A Japanese restaurant serving classic and modern interpretations of traditional Kyoto kaiseki cuisine, Nozomi @ Forum The Shopping Mall aims to curate and execute a menu that provides quality meals to customers at affordable prices. 

Flown straight from Japan’s Toyosu Market twice a week, the restaurant’s seasonal sashimi is fresh from the ocean. Prepared in true “kaiseki ryori” fashion, the dishes are cooked using a myriad of different cooking methodologies. Available in Salmon and Ikura or Sakura Ebi, the Japanese Claypot Rice features fluffy white rice steamed in dashi stock with a hint of savoury sakura ebi and light soy seasoning blended together for a refined flavour. Pair with a side of Pork Kakuni, where braised pork belly is drizzled with the restaurant’s in-house concocted sauce. Other ala carte options include the Unagi Kabayaki, Oden, Nankotsu Karaage and Mentaiko Cheese Balls. 

Pocket-friendly bento sets are also available in a range of options. Served with salad and miso soup, Yoshi’s Signatures are also a must-try at this authentic Japanese restaurant. (Jan 2021)
