data.title: Pastaria Abate (Tanjong Pagar)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Calabrese Stewed Squid Pasta, Create Your Own Pasta
data.ABOUT:
It’s amazing how adding egg and salt to flour can conjure up homemade pasta that elevates a dish from good to great. Lucky for us, getting such delectable pasta requires nothing more than a car (or train) ride into town. Located along Craig Road in Tanjong Pagar, Pastaria Abate is a casual eatery that has seemingly cracked the culinary code, serving up amazingly delicious pasta in an inviting environment at prices that won’t break the bank.

Embark on your meal with several Italian appetisers such as the warm Garlic Bread made in-house, or the Antipasta Full Board showcasing cuts of prosciutto, salami and more. Then move on to the pasta because, my oh my, is it divine. Select your favourite pasta from egg-based fettucine to rigatoni and pair it with any of the 18 rich and flavourful sauces available. Stellar options include the Al Ragu, where the traditional chunky beef sauce is slowly cooked overnight. The Mixed Seafood sauce is another crowd-pleaser, with its generous heaping of prawns, mussels, and squid all lightly cooked in a seafood broth. And what better way to round off the meal than with a glass of Italian wine from the eatery’s wine cellar?

Set in a warm and cosy environment, the humble Pastaria Abate charms with delightful renditions of classic Italian pasta meals at wallet-friendly prices. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Patara Fine Thai Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Patara Premium, Nua Yang, Whole Seabass, Gang Kiew Wan Nua, Khana Moo Grob
data.ABOUT:
Simple Thai dishes done well. That has been the cornerstone of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine’s cooking for the last twenty years, and their longevity in this country of fickle diners is testament that it works.
Nestled in the cosy compound of Tanglin, Patara Fine Thai Cuisine combines premium ingredients and traditional cooking techniques to conjure Thai dishes that will warm the body and soul. There’s no better way to kick things off than with a Patara Premium, designed to be shared by two. This showcase sampler features top-sellers such as the resplendent Chor Muang, or handcrafted blue flower dumplings stuffed with caramelised chicken, sweet turnip, and peanut filling. If you’re a fan of beef, then opt for Nua Yang. Here, a tender 300 days grain-fed Australian beef tenderloin is cooked to perfection and paired with a tangy spicy tamarind sauce. Patara Fine Thai Cuisine also does not lack for any seafood options, ranging from fresh lobsters, prawns, to several kinds of fish, so you won’t go wrong with any pick. For us, the Whole Seabass cannot be beat thanks to its complementary broth concocted from lime, garlic, and chilli.
Bold, zesty Thai flavours are on full display here at Patara Fine Thai Cuisine, an eatery that stands out among the best Thai spots in the city. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Paulaner Bräuhaus
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cordon Bleu, Pork Knuckle, Beef Beer Goulash, Currywurst
data.ABOUT:
The grand dame of German hangouts here in Singapore, Paulaner Brauhaus is the only German microbrewery in Singapore, and has been delighting Singaporeans with its superb, full-bodied beers for years. The Brauhaus is also a stellar Bavarian restaurant, churning out plates of meaty German favourites to go with those beers, as well as heaps of friendly German “Geselligkeit,” or “sociability”. 

Channeling an authentic German tavern, the trappings here are gorgeous and rustic, and usher you into a truly German experience. The food does the rest. The great classics of the cuisine are all here, including a massive Roasted Whole Pork Knuckle on the bone, served with tart Sauerkraut and Bavarian bread dumplings. There’s also German meatloaf, called Leberkas, served grilled with a side of fresh cucumber salad, a sunny side up egg, and rich Bavarian mustard. Deep from the heart of Bavaria comes the Beef Beer Goulash, a rich beef stew given extra layers of flavour by some dark beer, served with mounds of Bavarian egg noodles to soak up all that delicious gravy. 

It’s not German food without an entire section of the menu dedicated to sausages, and here you can get your fix of Currywurst, Munich Weisswurst, and herby Sausage Snail. Pile on the meat with a serving of Schnitzel, a battered cutlet of pork or chicken, served with a variety of sauces that will forever change your mind about German food being bland and uninteresting. Needless to say, chug down some beers. They’re brewed on-site and are some of the tastiest on the island. (Feb 2018)

data.title: Pazzion Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Founded in 2019, PAZZION Café is a multi-concept store that boasts a holistic retail and dining experience in the heart of lifestyle hub Jewel Changi Airport.

Shoppers can browse the latest shoes and accessories at the retail section and look forward to a variety of artisan beverages and premium quality delights at the café thereafter.

Adorned with French-inspired interiors that exudes a relaxed and intimate vibe, PAZZION Café is the ideal cosy hangout for families and friends alike. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Peach Garden (Chinatown Point)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Crispy Peking Duck, Steamed Soon Hock Fish in “Hong Kong” Sauce, Deep Fried Duck Meat with Salt and Pepper, Stewed Vermicelli with Assorted Diced Seafood and Baby Cabbage in Black Bean Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Peach Garden is a top-rated Chinese restaurant that seeks to delight diners with exciting set menus and a wonderful selection of signature dishes served in thoughtfully plated portions.
Ideal for large gatherings or celebratory dinners, Peach Garden at Chinatown Point indulges diners with a huge selection of private dining rooms for more intimate functions. The Roasted Crispy Peking Duck has just the right balance of sweet and tender duck meat. The Steamed Soon Hock Fish in “Hong Kong” Sauce is also a great dish for sharing. Braised and steamed in a fragrant sauce unique to Peach Garden, the fish is garnished with ginger slices that add flavor to every mouth.
Follow up with the Deep Fried Duck Meat seasoned with salt and pepper. Finish off with a plate of Stewed Vermicelli with Assorted Diced Seafood and Baby Cabbage in Black Bean Sauce. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Peach Garden (Hotel Miramar)
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 401 Havelock RoadLevel 3 Hotel Miramar Singapore (169631)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Crispy Duck, Chilled Marinated Jellyfish, and Almond Flakes Fried Prawn, Traditional Braised Yoshikiri Shark’s Fin with Egg White, Fried Hor Fun with Pork Collar Meat in Egg Sauce, Sweet Temptation
data.ABOUT:
Relish the delicious Cantonese delicacies prepared by expert chefs at Peach Garden as you indulge in the spacious and elegant setting of the restaurant in Hotel Miramar.
Opt for the set menus specially designed for four. Perfect for family dinners, the six-course meal takes diners on a culinary journey to experience authentic Cantonese delights. Delight in a hearty starter of Roasted Crispy Duck served with Chilled Marinated Jellyfish and Almond Flakes Fried Prawn before moving on to a comforting bowl of Traditional Braised Yoshikiri Shark’s Fin with Egg White.
The restaurant saves the best for the last with its signature Fried Hor Fun with Pork Collar Meat in Egg Sauce. Coated in delicious egg sauce, the Hor Fun tastes as good as it looks and is accompanied by a generous amount of juicy pork collar meat. End with Sweet Temptation, a dessert that truly satisfies.
Coupled with Peach Garden’s distinctive brand of personable service, the restaurant’s unique dining concept continues to be a choice destination for many diners. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Peach Garden (OCBC Centre)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Rack of Suckling Pig, Steamed Fillet of Soon Hock with Beancurd in Special Sauce, Double Boiled Baby Superior Shark’s Fin with Essence of Chicken Soup, Chilled Jelly Royale with Mango, Sago and Pomelo in Young Coconut
data.ABOUT:
With an emphasis on premium ingredients, winning culinary skills and top-notch service, Peach Garden at OCBC Centre brings diners the best of Chinese cuisine with a refined touch.
Located in the heart of the Central Business District, the restaurant offers unparalleled views through the iconic building’s glass doors. Look out to spectacular views of the Singapore River, Esplanade and Singapore Flyer as you tuck into dishes prepared using only the freshest and most premium ingredients.
Start your meal with the signature Roasted Rack of Suckling Pig. Juicy and succulent, this dish is one of the main highlights here at Peach Garden. Move on to the Double Boiled Baby Superior Shark’s Fin with Essence of Chicken Soup. An aromatic blend of high-quality herbs, the soup delicately balances out the flavors of shark fin and chicken essence.
Finish with a Chilled Jelly Royale with Mango, Sago, and Pomelo in Young Coconut for a refreshing end. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Peach Garden (The Metropolis)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 9 North Buona Vista Drive#02-021 The Metropolis TowerSingapore (138588)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Homemade Beancurd with Local Spinach and Fresh Crab Meat, Stewed Ee-fu Noodle with Assorted Diced Seafood and Minced Meat Sauce, Pan-fried King Prawn with Garlic and Superior Soya Sauce, Sweet Temptation
data.ABOUT:
Peach Garden is a top-rated Chinese restaurant that seeks to delight diners with exciting set menus and a wonderful selection of signature dishes served in thoughtfully plated individual portions.
Boasting a dining concept that brings together award-winning cuisine and the relaxed vibe of the restaurant’s noodle house, Peach Garden at The Metropolis is an exquisite dining experience that is perfect for all special occasions.
Offering a variety of set menu options that cater to different groups of diners, Peach Garden at The Metropolis is the ideal place for dinner dates and celebratory gatherings. Indulge in Asian fares such as Braised Homemade Beancurd with Local Spinach and Fresh Crab Meat, as well as the well-loved Stewed Ee-fu Noodle with Assorted Diced Seafood and Minced Meat Sauce.
For seafood lovers, enjoy a plate of juicy Pan-fried King Prawn with Garlic and Superior Soya Sauce. End off the satisfying meal with a delectable dessert. Named the Sweet Temptation, this dessert tastes true to its name by being deliciously sweet and creamy. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Peach Garden (Thomson Plaza)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Peking Duck, Roasted Crispy Chicken, Smoked Duck with Fresh Mango accompanied with Deep Fried Scallop with Salted Egg Yolk, Deep-fried Chicken Cutlet with Almond Flakes and Plum Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Established in 2002, Peach Garden at Thomson Plaza is well regarded for refined traditional Cantonese cuisine deftly prepared by a team of experienced and dedicated master chefs.
The place to enjoy authentic Cantonese specialties, signature dishes on the restaurant’s a la carte menu include the Roasted Peking Duck, Roasted Crispy Chicken, Steamed Mian Xian and Baby Lobster with Egg White and Chinese Wine, and the quintessential Cantonese Steamed Sponge Cake.
Catered for two, the set menus at Peach Garden will leave you feeling more than satisfied. First up, try the Smoked Duck with Fresh Mango, followed by the Deep Fried Scallop with Salted Egg Yolk. A delicious mish-mash of seafood, meat and fruits, the salted egg yolk elevates the dish, giving every bite into a delightful kick of flavor.
Cleanse your palate with a Double-boiled Soup of the Day before diving into the Deep-fried Chicken Cutlet with Almond Flakes and Plum Sauce. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Peng Cheng Xiao Chu 彭城小厨
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum, Steamboat
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Pork Belly, Beef Tripe, Moo Shu Pork
data.ABOUT:
Peng Cheng Xiao Chu serves up a classic range of Chinese fare, emphasising on dishes from the ancient city of Peng Cheng, now known as Xuzhou. As you enter the eatery, you'll be greeted by lanterns, murals, and furnishings that pay homage to tradition.

The menu boasts an extensive array of small plates, claypot and ground pot dishes, hot plates, noodles, and more. Favourites include the Ground Pot Chicken — tender, braised chicken surrounded by flour cakes to help soak up all the savoury sauce — and the Claypot Braised Pork with its succulent slices of pork belly. 

For those who love variety, go for the Claypot Stewed Delicacies, an assortment of homemade meatballs, fishballs, fried pork skin, beancurd skin, squid eggs, and veggies. If you have a sweet tooth, you should try the Candied Sweet Potatoes, a dish of stir-fried sweet potatoes in a sticky glaze. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Peony Jade @ Keppel Club
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Char Siew Soh, Chili Crab Sauce Dumpling, Peking Duck, Hot Sweetened Teochew ‘Oor-ni’ with Ginko Nuts,
data.ABOUT:
This restaurant is set to shake up the Chinese dining scene in Singapore. Helmed by Chef Ricky Liew, who is known for his creative presentation and dishes, the menu here features a number of dishes that are easy on the eyes and palate. With no MSG and minimal oil used in his creations, the dishes here are perfect for the health conscious.

Try Chef Liew’s signature dish like “Bi Feng Tang” Style Crispy Cod. Crunchy pieces of fresh fish is served with caramelised onions and presented on a bed of greens, sprinkled liberally with chilli. Meat lovers will love the Honey Glazed Barbecue Pork - smoky, tender chunks of meat from Spain drenched in a rose-infused honey sauce that is rich, tangy, and sweet. The sauce goes perfectly with the meat and can be eaten on its own, though some diners may choose to mop up the decadent sauce with some steamed rice. 

Diners who can’t decide on what to eat can opt for a special omakase style meu. Simply inform the restaurant of a budget, and Chef Liew will create dishes that are not on the menu from fresh ingredients he finds at the market. (May 2018)

data.title: Peperoni Pizzeria (Biopolis)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Arancini, Chicken Truffle Pizza, Grilled Vegetable Pizza, Seafood Misto, Nero Di Seppia (Squid Ink Pasta), Lasagna, Caribbean, Vanilla Panna Cotta
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The warmth and comfort of wood-fired pizzas and traditional pasta over drinks with friends and families have become an everyday affair that started with Peperoni Pizzeria's first outlet in Greenwood, Singapore.

Charming, vivacious and full of life, Peperoni has since evolved into a much-loved multi-destination staple with its 'Appetite for Life' philosophy. This philosophy makes Peperoni more than just a restaurant, as it is a place with a mission - to bring people together, to bind relationships, and to savour life in all its delightful flavours. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Perch
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Otah-Otah Slider Bao, Steamed Baby Seabass with Lemongrass Broth, Cempedak Profiteroles, Vegan Chocolate Hazelnut Cake
data.ABOUT:
Located in the mini-metropolis that is Jewel Changi Airport, this bistro serves Asian-European fusion food with an emphasis on Southeast Asian flavours.

Start your meal with appetisers such as the Otah-Otah Slider Bao, garnished with sambal mayo and Kyuri cucumber, or the Blue Swimmer Crab Cake, served with Gochujang cocktail sauce, celeriac, and an apple and raisin remoulade. 

Continue to the entrees, such as the Braised Lamb Shank in Pomegranate Molasses, served with celeriac puree, confit cherry tomato and haricot vert (green bean). For more pronounced Asian flavours, don’t miss the Steamed Baby Seabass with Lemongrass Broth, served with cantaloupe and Japanese pearl rice.

Finish your meal with the Cempedak Profiteroles, consisting of a craquelin (a Scandinavian type of pretzel), served with creamy Cempedak ice cream and compote. For vegans, try the Vegan Chocolate Hazelnut Cake, served with sinful chocolate frosting and roasted hazelnut ice cream. 

All dishes are best enjoyed with a glass of wine from 1855 The Bottle Shop’s extensive collection. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Permata Singapore
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Indonesian, Malaysian, Local, Southeast Asian, Peranakan
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Rendang, Lemak Nangka Arang, Seasonal Shellfish, Lontong Ambin Permata
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Inspired by the trade in the 1920s, where diamonds and gemstones were sold in Kampong Glam, Permata which means jewel in Malay is the first Nusantara Buffet Restaurant at Gedung Kuning. Located at 73 Sultan Gate.

Offering over 60 Nusantara-inspired dishes for both lunch and dinner, Executive Chef Firdauz Nasir is on a mission to elevate Nusantara cuisine in Singapore while ensuring that key nostalgic dishes such as Ulam, Kerabu, Lemang remain on the menu. Pushing the boundaries in his cooking, Executive Chef Firdauz has added modern twists to the menu with dishes like Wagyu Beef Rendang, Ayam Binjai, Tempoyak Ikan Patin that pairs perfectly well with Nasi Bunga Telang, Permata’s Signature Blue Pea Rice. 

Wanting to offer a truly premium Malay and Indonesian dining experience for the food lovers in Singapore, Executive Chef Firdauz has curated a Seafood on Ice Station which has a selection of fresh seafood along with Live Noodles, Live Roti Jala, Live Carving Station and a Grill Station that includes Beef Sirloin Steak, Locally Farmed Chicken, Marinated Lamb Flap and the all-time favourite Satays!

Love spices? Choose from 6 different types of hand blended sambals that make the perfect condiments to your meal. Be sure to try Permata’s Buah Keluak Brownie, made with a native seed commonly used in Javanaese cooking and Intan Permata, a chiffon cake infused with natural pandan flavour, glazed with white chocolate and calamansi zest. 

Permata Singapore is located at 73 Sultan Gate, Gedung Kuning, Singapore 198497. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Pete's Place
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 10 Scotts RoadBasement LevelGrand Hyatt SingaporeSingapore (228211)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spaghetti Ciopinno, Bistecca alla Griglia, Frutti di Mare, Burrata e Caponata, Ravioli Astice, Quattro Formaggi Pizza, Tagliata di Manzo, Capricciosa Pizza, Bonnet Astigiana
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Journey through Italy at Pete's Place, one of Singapore's oldest and most nostalgic restaurants that serves authentic Italian fare in a rustic, charming brick abode since 1973.
 
Helmed by two Italian culinary maestros, find arguably, the most authentic pastas and wood-fired oven pizzas in town. (Dec 2017)

data.title: Piatto Bistro Bar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pollo Parmigiana, Avacado Bruschetta, Maiale Platter, Piatto's Choice, Churros with Gelato Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Named after the Italian word for platter, this restaurant serves up a range of hearty Italian-American dishes that are sure to satisfy the most diverse of palates. Located in the antique VIP Hotel on Balmoral Crescent, this restaurant’s vibrant atmosphere makes it inviting, and is the perfect place to hang out with friends and family on weekends. 

For a unique starter, opt for the Avocado Bruschetta - avocado halves filled with a tangy bruschetta-based filling. These tiny treats are delicious and light enough to whet your appetite without filling you up. The Maiale Platter is a crowd favourite, and for good reason. Popular with carnivores, this platter is made with a range of pork cuts served with sauerkraut and creamy mashed potatoes. The portion is big enough to share between two to three people, making it perfect for diners in groups. Don’t like sharing? The Mexican Chicken Steak is a good option. A fresh chicken steak grilled with traditional spices and served with grilled vegetables and mashed potatoes, this dish is both healthy and delicious. 

End on a sweet note with the Churros with Gelato Ice Cream - warm, soft churros topped with icy cold gelato, this dish melts in your mouth from the first bite, making it the perfect dessert. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Pietro Ristorante Italiano
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Funghi Portebello, Pollo con Salsa al Vino Bianco e Roshari, Pizza al Quattro Formaggi, Linguine al Cartoccio, Tiramisu al Pistacchio
data.ABOUT:
Who says that you need to travel to the city for top-notch, drool-worthy
Italian cuisine? Not us, that’s for sure, when we know there are
culinary neighborhood gems such as the one tucked away in Serangoon –
Pietro Ristorante Italiano. This comfy eating spot has always astounded
us with its solidly creative and delicious Italian fare, conjuring up
hearty portions meant to be shared among friends.

At this mid-sized restaurant, which seats 56 people inside and 32 at its
alfresco area, the crowd is raucous but never rowdy. Here, all your
favorite classics are on the menu, from pizzas that are fired in a
wood-burning oven, to creamy risotto and plates of pasta made with fresh
pasta.

Carb-eaters would undoubtedly appreciate the fragrant Risotto di Mare e
Zafferano, where risotto is cooked with a blend of prawns, clams, squid,
and scallops in a saffron-based sauce. Meanwhile, Pietro kicks it
old-school with tried-and-true recipes such as the Spaghetti alla
Carbonara, so good it’ll even put a smile on the face of an Italian
grandmother. And you can’t go wrong with the kid-friendly Cheese Pizza,
served on a crispy thin crust.

Well-seasoned with well-loved dishes make a play here at Pietro
Ristorante Italiano, ensuring that any meal here would be an excellent
one.(Jun 2020)

data.title: Pig N Whistle Bistro & Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, International, Seafood, All-Day Breakfast, British, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steak N Ale Pie, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, BLT, Pineapple Pie
data.ABOUT:
Pig N Whistle Bistro & Bar is nestled within the Hexacube Building in the east side of Singapore. An au natural restaurant, Pig N Whistle Bistro & Bar only dishes up food that is made in house, with beers and ciders following suit.

Known as the second home for residents in the area, this friendly bistro and bar serves up delectable British fare at wallet-friendly prices. Start with the Steak N Ale Pie. A hearty dish to warm the soul on a cold winter day, this steaming pie is generously stuffed with mouthfuls of juicy steak and served with a portion of fries to fill up your bellies and warm your hearts. Break apart the pie to have a taste of the slow roasted beef paired with caramelised onions, carrots, leeks and celery.

Another classic favourite not to be missed out on is the Beer Battered Fish & Chips. Fried to a beautiful golden brown, this fishy delight features a succulent pacific dory fillet battered in a special in-house ale. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Pince & Pints Restaurant and Bar (Duxton)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Whole Lobster, Lobster Roll, Truffle Roll, Ginger Bread, The Bee's Knees
data.ABOUT:
Enough talk about crabs, guys, it's time to focus on another delicious crustacean: lobsters. At Pince and Pints, these bad boys are imported directly from fisheries that practice sustainable fishing methods along the Atlantic Coast, so you can chow down on these fresh, premium sea creatures without harming the natural population of wild lobsters.
Lest you're only familiar with the taste of lobster in an Asian context, the concentrated selection of contemporary lobster dishes - each made with 1 whole lobster - might be confusing at first, but you'll soon be won over by the succulent meat and punchy flavours on the New England-style menu. Try their signature Lobster Roll, the classic or truffle version, tap on your Singaporean side by going for the Chilli Lobster, or remain a purist with a Live Whole Lobster either grilled or steamed. Whichever dish you decide on though, you'll be guaranteed a lip-smacking good time! (Mar 2016)

data.title: Pintxos Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, French, Spanish, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 3 Fullerton RoadThe Fullerton Waterboat HouseSingapore (049215) Map
data.PRESS RELEASE: Setting the tone for an immersive gastronomic experience, the Pintxos Bar welcomes diners to unwind over a flute of cuvee champagne curated specially for the restaurant, and to tease the tastebuds with the diverse range of light bites. Make it a pampering prelude before your main dining experience, or simply soak in the good vibes and enjoy a casual evening here. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Pizza Fabbrica
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prosciutto Crudo con Rucola, Funghi Scarmorza, Vegetariana, Spaghetti alla Carbonara, Saffron Panna Cotta
data.ABOUT:
With well-done, hearth-crisped pizzas, rare draught beers and even on tap wine, Pizza Fabbrica is a welcome addition to the Bugis dining beat. 

Upon entering the cool, minimalist space taken by Pizza Fabbrica on Bussorah Street, your eye is drawn straight through to the back by the glinted reflections of a gorgeous copper-clad oven, ebulliently glowing from its wood-fired embers within. It sits behind a glassed-in kitchen, bustling with chefs pressing dough and boiling pasta. The window is a theme at the restaurant, its storefront also featuring floor-to-ceiling versions that allows light and action to flow from inside to outside beautifully. The rest of the design is as if stepping into the mind of a graphic designer, complete with techy textures of chrome and wire, along with charming infographic posters displaying optimal wine and beer pairings. It’s a refreshingly minimal, but not understyled look that shows a new side to the tired hipster aesthetic, and a very unexpected one for a pizza restaurant. 

Let the posters guide you to your ideal beverage, picking from the small but efficient bar of beers and wines on tap. From the menu, the pizzas are the obvious choice, in which you can taste the handiwork of that impressive oven.  The Funghi Scarmorza features a woodsy mix of mushrooms with a drizzle of truffle oil and rich melted cheese that’s an immediate palate pleaser. The Prosciutto Crudo con Rucola is another winner with more than the usual volume of toppings of Parma ham and peppery rocket suspended in a milky mozzarella. The Vegetariana has the same cheese, which is cut nicely by balsamic grilled eggplant, capsicum and zucchini. All the pizzas are grounded by a tasty crust, chewy in the center and bubbled and scorched at the edges. A variety of pastas is also available for the non-pizza straggler of your dining party. Cap off the meal with a heavenly scented, creamy Saffron Panna Cotta and you won’t be disappointed! (Dec 2014)

data.title: PizzaExpress (Duo)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Dough Balls "PizzaExpress", Pomodoro Pesto, Cheesecake, Carbonara, Calabrese Pizza
data.ABOUT:
PizzaExpress has specialized in gourmet, hand-made Italian pizza for over 50 years. The company was founded in 1965 by Peter Boizot, a well-travelled Englishman, who upon discovering a lack of authentic Italian pizza in London, imported an oven and opened the first PizzaExpress in Wardour Street, Soho. 

Today, PizzaExpress has over 550 restaurants across 15 countries worldwide, serving signature favourites like Dough Balls, Calabrese and much more. Talented pizzaiolos – each trained for 12 weeks - stretch and toss a unique dough to create a thin, crisp pizza base, which is then topped with fresh, simple ingredients to create the perfect pizza. 

Diners can expect classic dishes core to the PizzaExpress brand, as well as the introduction of localized specials to keep the menu fresh and exciting for pizza lovers. (Feb 2019)

From Buffalo Wings, Truffle fries to Aglio Olio Pasta and Pizza with Parma Ham, its extensive and sumptuous menu is reflective of the efforts to cater to every palate, making it a very suitable dining venue for family, large groups or just catching up with friends and colleagues. data.title: Place to READ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Stuffed Squid with Feta Cheese, Lamb Shank, Beef Souvlaki, Vongole Pasta, Chilli Crab Sauce Pasta, Moussaka, Hummus Bi Tahini, Laksa Pasta with Prawns, Scallops and Mussels, 	Pan Seared Salmon with Special Mango Salsa
data.ABOUT:
Greek food isn’t exactly a common sight in Singapore, so based on that alone the grub at Place to READ stands out. That would mean little, however, if the food wasn’t authentic and delicious, but fret not - the restaurant’s commitment to good food is obvious from the very first bite. That, together with a relaxed ambience and attentive service staff, makes for a meal to remember.

If you’re looking to have a little taste of Greece, then dig into a large helping of Moussaka, an oven-baked casserole made of grilled eggplant, minced beef, decadently creamy cheese, and various spices. Hot, rich, and a real belly buster, it’d be a rare person who didn’t come away from it feeling satisfied. Do try the Grilled Stuffed Squid with Feta Cheese as well – every chewy mouthful is enhanced by the fragrance of sliced garlic. It’s not an overly complicated dish, but man if it isn’t good.

Place to READ doesn’t just serve Greek food – there’s a great selection of pastas and pizzas too, among other Western fare. You won’t regret the Chilli Crab Sauce Pasta, with an authentic take on the sauce that won’t disappoint fans of the Singaporean classic. Served with helpings of scallop and shrimp, you’re sure to get every cent of your money’s worth. Hearty, good value, and a good place to unwind – that just about sums up Place to READ! (Aug 2017)

data.title: Po Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 320 Havelock RoadRobertson QuayThe Warehouse HotelSingapore (169628)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Popiah, Kurobuta Char Siew, Charcoal-Grilled Iberico Satay, Barramundi Salad, Paper Spring Chicken, Spicy Tamarind Barramundi, Carabinero Prawns & Konbu Mee, Ice Cream Popiah
data.PRESS RELEASE: A refined Singaporean concept, Po is the flagship restaurant of The Warehouse Hotel, a meticulously restored godown on the banks of the Singapore River. Combining culture, heritage and cuisine, Po pays tribute to the flavours of yesteryear using premium ingredients and meticulous cooking techniques that would make even the toughest popos proud. All are welcome; for popiah parties, celebrations or corporate dinners  - popo does it all.  (Jul 2019)

data.title: Podi & Poriyal
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Medhu Vadai, Idli, Paruppu Payasam, Murungukkai Pachadi, Poondu Rasam
data.ABOUT:
Located on Serangoon road in Little India, this lovely gem serves up vegetarian Indian snacks and desserts. Its roots date back to the social enterprise Arpanam, which was started by the Nadathur family who was involved in the founding of technology giant Infosys. The menu boasts an array of light bites bursting with flavour at pocket-friendly prices. All proceeds from sales go directly into supporting local artists and cultural programs.  

Dig in to one of their Medhu Vadais, a crispy, deep-fried savoury donut. Made with urad dal and rice, as well as a special mix of spices, these little bites of heaven come with coconut chutney, giving them a spicy kick. For something a little moreish, opt for the Idli-Vadai combination. The Idli is made with ground rice batter that is steamed to fluffy perfection. There are even curries like Poondu Rasam and side dishes like Murungukkai Pachadi that can be ordered with your choice of rice - or millet for a healthier option. 

Prefer something a little more saccharine? Try the Paruppu Payasam with Jackfruit. Made with Moong Dal, milk, sugar, and fruit, this dish is delectably sweet and perfect for diners who want to indulge their sweet tooth. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Pollen
data.Good For: City Views, Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 18 Marina Gardens Drive#01-09Flower Dome Gardens by the BaySingapore (018953)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lettuce Gazpacho, Carne Crudo, Duck Neck & Foie Gras Sausage, Pandan Rice Pudding, Watermelon Ravioli
data.ABOUT:
Housed within the Flower Dome at Gardens by the Bay - the largest glass greenhouse in the world, Pollen is helmed by Michelin-starred Chef Michael Wilson, who creates modern interpretive cuisine inspired by nature’s bounty. Always evolving with the seasons, his cuisine seeks to inspire the imagination.

More than just delicious creations served on the plate, Chef Michael’s cuisine is artful yet approachable, created to inspire diners to be curious about the flavours, textures and origins of food.

Begin your epicurean journey to POLLEN with our personalised buggy service from Gardens by the Bay’s arrival plaza to the restaurant. Enjoy complimentary access to the Flower Dome and wander in the sub 20-degree Mediterranean garden filled with exotic flowers, herbs and foliage.

A unique POLLEN experience made with you in mind. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Porters Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 4 Marina Boulevard#01-31The Sail @ Marina BaySingapore (018986)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Portobello Mushroom With Truffle Chantilly Cream, Pan Seared Foie Gras, Porters Crab Meat Croquette, Papilotte Sea Bass, Char Grilled Kurobuta Pork Chop, Wagyu Cheese Burger, Grilled Prawn Aglio Olio
data.ABOUT:
This snazzy restaurant at the Sail offers a delightful feast for the senses. With a sleek, sweeping wood-panelled interior and minimalist decor, this place is versatile enough for business lunches by day and dinner dates at night. 

Diners get to customise their own three-course meal here, and can even choose to pair their selections with a wine from the extensive list available. The Portobello Mushroom With Truffle Chantilly Cream is an excellent soup to start with. Light, earthy, and simple, this dish whets the appetite and prepares the palate for the dishes to come. Another popular starter here is the Porters Crab Meat Croquette. Served with homemade chilli sauce, this dish is crunchy, meaty, and not greasy in the slightest. 

The Pan Seared Foie Gras is an excellent main, and a crowd favourite. The duck liver is seared to tender perfection and served with brioche and mixed berry compote, making for a dish that is sweet, buttery, and melts in your mouth. The Papillote Sea Bass is a generous serving of fish with potato fondant and lemon on the side, making for a dish that is tangy with a hint of earthiness tempered by the umami flavour of the fish. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Positano Risto
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Positano Mac and Cheese with Crab Meat, Arancini Balls, Super Supreme Calzone, Signature Boston Lobster Fettuccine, Signature Short Ribs, Positano Wagyu Beef Burger, Signature Chocolate Fudge Brownie
data.ABOUT:
Positano Risto offers a gastronomic adventure with authentic Italian flavours! Indulge in fan-favourites such as the juicy Short Ribs, Angus Ribeye, and their legendary Mac n Cheese. For starters, their Arancini Balls, crispy, golden Italian rice balls stuffed with just the right amount of mozzarella, as well as their mushroom and tomato bruschetta, will leave you craving more! Other wows include their Super Supreme Calzone, a thin-crusted Roma Style pizza, baked to absolute perfection, topped with Turkey Ham, Pepperoni Strips and Burrata.
Feeling super hungry? Dive into their enormous serving of their Signature Boston Lobster Fettuccine. Whole Boston Lobster paired with al dente Fettuccine, cooked in a hearty lobster bisque sauce, this dish is perfect for a truly special occasion! As for the Chilli Fanatics, have a twirl of their Squid ink Spaghetti and Seafood Aglio Olio Linguini with Sun-dried Tomatoes, spiced to your liking! Are you game?
This charming hidden gem, coupled with amazing service and a quirky dining ambience, will definitely leave you coming back for more! (Jul 2018)

data.title: Potato Head Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Naughty Fries, Pokemon, Baby Huey, Burning Man, This Lil Piggy, Cobblepot
data.PRESS RELEASE:
PTT Family, the hospitality and entertainment group renowned for the internationally acclaimed 'Potato Head Beach Club' in Bali and the 'Potato Head' restaurant in Jakarta, opened its first venture outside Indonesia in June 2014, located in the heart of Chinatown in Singapore.
Housed in one of the most iconic buildings on Keong Saik Road, this dynamic destination offers four venues within one building. Guests can combine the distinctively different restaurants and bars to create their perfect mix, or visit individually depending on the occasion, mood and time of day.
Designed as PTT Family's 'home' in Singapore, Potato Head Singapore has the intimate feel of a private house - the first floor is the kitchen - the dynamic burger restaurant Three Buns; the second its living room - a relaxed restaurant with table service; the third its private studio - a decadent drinking den; and the rooftop its garden - a tropical-paradise open-air bar. The different rooms of the house are a haven in the heart of the city, a retreat for Singapore's creative crowd from the arts, fashion, film, music and design worlds. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Praelum Wine Bistro
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Stockyard Wagyu Ribeye, Tiramisu Classic, Salmon En-Croute, Tarte Flambee, Braised Beef Cheeks, Pork Parcels, Crème Brûlée
data.ABOUT:
Looking for a place to improve your knowledge of your libations? Look no further. Named after the device used to extract juice from crushed grapes, Praelum is one of the few places that has been continuously lauded by Wine & Dine Magazine for their excellent wine list. There is also a selection of cheeses and other dishes for diners’ pairings. 

With a walk-in cellar home to over a thousand bottles of carefully procured wines and a bottle list that changes weekly, this is one place that truly knows its grapes. Wines are sold by the glass using the Enomatic and Coravin wine preservation systems, which minimises spoilage of the wine. The knowledgeable sommeliers are also able to advise diners and make recommendations for different palates. 

Diners can pair their choice of wine with farmhouse cheese platters and truffle honey. The tarte flambee is another good option, and comes with a range of premium toppings, including roma tomatoes and gruyere cheese. For something a little moreish, opt for the Stockyard Wagyu Ribeye. The fresh cut of beef is cooked to your liking and slathered in a rich beef demi glace sauce which gives the dish a strong flavour without overpowering the taste of the meat. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Prata Alley
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Big One, Tumeric Rush, Chicken Sambal Briyani, Milo Ice, Mango Lassi
data.ABOUT:
What do you get when you fry a bit of dough in ghee? None other than light and fluffy roti prata. This humble South Indian staple has long been a go-to dish for many people across all walks of life, who find themselves chowing down on this dish at all hours of the day. 

And as big fans of this simple dish, we know that some of the best prata can be found in Clementi at a little establishment called Prata Alley, located in the shopping mall 321 Clementi. Unlike your old-school neighbourhood joints, Prata Alley kicks this dish up a notch, serving up inventive fare. One such dish is the The Big One, which seamlessly blends a mozzarella cheese prata base with pizza toppings such as pesto chicken and shiitake mushrooms. 

You can expect other specialties too, such as the Turmeric Rush, which showcases a generous plate of nasi goreng cooked with a special blend of spices. Of course diners who prefer traditional dishes would enjoy Prata Alley’s rendition of Chicken Sambal Briyani, where you can bite into chunks of chicken that’s both tender and spicy at the same time.  

By putting a new spin onto the age-old prata dish, Prata Alley has created a bevy of delicious and innovative dishes for all to enjoy. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Pratunam Market Place and Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Meat Bread Roll Set, Lychee Curry Steak
data.ABOUT:
Pratunam market place and bar brings Bangkok’s lively Thai tradition of sipping fresh beer on busy street corners to Bencoolen street in Singapore.

Start with a selection of small but flavourful bites to whet your appetite for a wonderful evening inspired by Bangkok’s variety of street food. Affordable and delicious, the restaurant offers multiple lunch set menus that make for a hearty meal. Customise your lunch according to your preferences by choosing your starter, main and drink. 

A signature dish at Pratuman market place and bar is the Crab Meat Bread Roll Set. Featuring generous chunks of tender and juicy crab spread across a freshly toasted bread roll, the sandwich is filled with thick warm lemon butter. Served with an in-house chilli sauce, dip the juicy crab meat into the sweet and spicy chilli for a brillant burst of flavours. 

A unique twist on a local favourite, the Lychee Curry Steak is a hearty one dish meal that will surely fill you up! (Dec 2020)

data.title: Prego
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Italian, International, Seafood, Cafe, Pizza, Dessert Only, Mediterranean
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.ABOUT:
Featuring a vibrant, contemporary setting in Fairmont Singapore, this magnificent 235-seater Italian restaurant boasts handcrafted, authentic Italian food by Chef Mauro Sanna. 

Enjoy delicious Italian fare at Prego with their signature Charcuterie Board. Decorated with assorted cured meats, the combination of different cuts of meat is perfect for two to three diners. Those who love fish should definitely try the Ali di Razza in “Agliata”. Served with crispy salsa chips, this bowl of fish slices is beautifully garnished with carrots and spring onions. 

Seafood lovers would definitely favour the Capelli d’Angelo all’Astice. Abundant with generous chunks of Maine lobster entangled in angel hair pasta, this sweet mix of tomato and meaty lobster is deliciously sweet. Thinly stretched and laden with ham, sun dried tomatoes, wild mushrooms, parmesan and mozzarella, the restaurant's signature pizza, the Prego, is the perfect dish for sharing. 

Finish your meal on a tasty note with the Pancetta di Maiale. A plate of slow roasted pork belly drizzled with a savoury sauce, dig into this hearty dish for mouthfuls of juicy pork meat. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Preludio
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: La Cortina, Pata Negra, Burrata Parmigiana
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Preludio is a contemporary dining concept from Fernando Arévalo that moves with time in orchestrated chapters.
The word preludio, which may be translated as "introduction" or "prelude", alludes to the constant beginning of something new.
For its debut, Preludio will open with Monochrome, where the restaurant will be inspired in black and white. To remove colour from an object is to strip it down to its fundamental self - everything raw and everything pure. Opening with this rudimentary idea of black and white seemed only befitting for Preludio as it embarks on this unconventional journey. (May 2019)

data.title: Princess Terrace Authentic Penang Food
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly

data.title: Privé (Asian Civilisations Museum)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eggs Benedict, Plant Power Breakfast, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Pan-Roasted Chilli & Lime Salmon, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Spaghetti Aglio Olio With Roast Pork Belly, Impossible Meatballs In Tomato Sauce, 85% Dark Chocolate Cake, Sticky Date Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Casual yet chic, Privé exudes an allure of laidback charm reminiscent of its sister at Keppel Bay and not just because of the relaxing waterfront river view. The ACM branch delivers and upholds the Privé brand of approachable and delicious fare. Comforting favourites are the perfectly poached Eggs Benedict, tender Pulled Pork Knuckle Burger and their famous Sticky Date Pudding. Other than the familiar favourites, the menu offers some exciting new dishes. The health-conscious city-goer will be delighted to find that Privé ACM takes care of their needs with their range of “healthier choice” salads and sandwiches, while tourists can enjoy local favourites like Thai Vegetable Curry and Nasi Goreng. Vegans and vegetarians will also be delighted with the wide range of plant-based options from award-winning Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice and Tracy’s Favourite Salad to indulgent tiramisus. 
Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé CHIJMES
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eggs Benedict, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Spaghetti Aglio Olio with Roast Pork Belly, Impossible Meatball Spaghetti, Sticky Date Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Prive is the only standalone pavilion in CHIJMES and commands an impressive plot of prime courtyard real estate, and dons a look that's fresher and more chic than anything else around. The sprawling portico is outfitted in bamboo, teak and concrete, channeling the organic feel of the characteristic CHIJMES greenery. The simple lines and casual furnishings offer a roomy backyard feel, but elevated with design-centric touches, so it's more of what we would imagine Gwyneth Paltrow's back lawn to be like rather than our next-door neigbour's. Vintage green brick and terracotta tiles are reflected from the rattan-clad mirrors, all cast with a romantic glow come nighttime. The set-up, along with the varied menu, allow Prive to be a great spot for both brunch with the family, or an after work hangout with friends.

The menu has brought along the most-loved dishes from Keppel Bay including Eggs Benedict, crispy Fish & Chips we can't seem to get out of our heads, satisfying Impossible Meat burgers, and divine Sticky Date Pudding. Being added to the mix are stone-baked pizzas, hearty brunch as well as local favourites like the Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice and Traditional Chicken Curry. If you prefer snacking, then the selection of bar food, including Breaded Crab Cakes and Crispy Chicken Wings are ideally suited to enjoy with the extensive range of cocktails, affordable beers and wines. Drop by for happy hour from 5pm to 8pm daily and relax in the garden with an ice-cold drink in hand. Think of it as your own backyard, just better. 
Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé Clarke Quay
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Forest Mushroom Soup, Ultimate Fish & Chips, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Impossible Meatball Spaghetti, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Traditional Chicken Curry, Breaded Crab Cake, Sticky Date Pudding
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Privé Clarke Quay is an exciting one-stop food and entertainment venue located in the heart of bustling Clarke Quay. Bringing together The Privé Group’s refined, casual dining and quality service, Privé promises to entertain your senses. During the day and early evening, it is an ideal venue for grabbing a quick bite or enjoying a satisfying meal, while at night, it seamlessly transforms into a vibrant venue for specially crafted drink presentations and live music. Step into the back and enter Prive Social, a cosy space for stand-up comedy, live band performances and Ladies Night! 
From weekend brunch to daily hearty mains and decadent desserts, Privé Clarke Quay satisfies at any time of the day or night. Diners can look forward to perennial favorites including Forest Mushroom Soup, Meter Long Stone-Baked Pizzas, Fish & Chips, Classic Wagyu Beef Burger, Impossible Meat Spaghetti and Sticky Date Pudding. Tourists will also be delighted with the unique Asian offerings such as Chicken Satay, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice & Traditional Chicken Curry. For those stricken with the late-night munchies, such as Mini Sliders or Breaded Crab Cakes, are perfect for staving off those hunger pangs. 
Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé Grill @ The University Club
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 11 Kent Ridge DriveStorey 4Shaw Foundation Alumni HouseSingapore (119244)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Tartare, Escargots, Ribeye Steak, Lamb Shank, Tarte Tatin
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Privé Grill @ The University Club offers affordable French classics served in a cosy and casual setting away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The distinctive location in the National University of Singapore affords the unique opportunity to re-live some university nostalgia and dine like an academic would.
During lunch, it is an ideal spot to grab a delectable weekly set lunch from only $28, while at night, affordable set dinners (with a la carte options) from $42, featuring Salmon Tartare, Escargots, Ribeye Steak, Lamb Shank, Tarte Tatin & more will tantalise the taste buds.
Privé Grill @ The University Club, which is also open to the public, offers the choice of an intimate indoor dining area, breezy alfresco terrace and informal lounge seating. Those looking for something more private can also book the Private Dining Room (PDR) for intimate soirees or jubilant celebrations. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Privé Keppel Bay
data.Hours: Mon-Fri & Eve of PH: 9am-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Sat-Sun & PH: 8am-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 2 Keppel Bay VistaMarina At Keppel BaySingapore (098382)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Plant Power Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Ultimate Fish & Chips, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Vegetable Curry, Sticky Date Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Privé Keppel Bay is a casual and children-friendly venue which the whole family can spend hours enjoying. Strategically located right by the water’s edge, diners can choose to relax indoors in air-conditioned comfort or savour the cool sea breeze amidst lush greenery in the expansive al fresco area.
Privé Keppel Bay makes every effort to ensure the freshest food is prepared with exacting standards, making your visit to Keppel Bay completely worthwhile. Privé Keppel Bay’s simple and down-to-earth menu can satisfy a variety of appetites. Hungry diners might just appreciate hearty choices, like the all-day breakfast, stone-baked pizzas, pastas and even local delights, while the peckish can enjoy a simple pastry, freshly-baked cakes or one of the menu’s many beverage items (thick milkshakes, TWG teas, and gourmet coffees). With unbeatable views of the award-winning Marina and Sentosa, Privé Keppel Bay will definitely brighten your day with its cheerful décor and friendly servers.
Privé Keppel Bay is also very kid-friendly with a separate kid’s menu, indoor library and TV area, as well as an impressive outdoor playground that the kids can spend hours at. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé Paragon
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eggs Benedict, Plant Power Breakfast, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Lamb Shank Biryani, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Spaghetti Aglio Olio With Roast Pork Belly, Nihon Nachos, 85% Dark Chocolate Cake, Sticky Date Pudding
data.ABOUT:
During the day, the chic yet friendly environment makes it perfect for entertaining, social lunches, business meetings or just taking in the sights and sounds of Orchard Road. Start your morning off with a cup of good coffee paired with a light breakfast, or linger over a hearty lunch comprising brunch favourites, local delights and hearty mains. For something a little healthier, Privé Paragon also has lots of plant-based options from filling salads to award-winning Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice. 

Come evening, Privé’s alfresco deck transforms into casual place to gather for drinks and bar bites while the cosy indoors is ideal for those looking for a more intimate dining experience. Start your evening off with happy hour cocktails from 5 to 9pm and wines complemented with small bites at the vibey alfresco terrace, or come by at 7pm for live acoustic jazz daily. Craving something a little more substantial and cosy? Then the inviting indoor area can cater to anyone looking for either a romantic date night or a night out on the town with close friends or colleagues.

Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé Robertson Quay
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Plant-Based Truffled Mushroom Burger, Singapore Seafood Laksa, Eggs Royale, Oreo Mudpie
data.ABOUT:
Conveniently located in the centre of the bustling Robertson Quay neighbourhood, Prive at Robertson Quay exudes casual charm and treats diners to beautiful waterfront views as they wine and dine by the Singapore River. 

Prive’s all-day menu encompasses delicious brunch favourites, Asian delights, Western fare and more! As extensive as they are indulgent, the plethora of mouthwatering menu options include cakes and desserts as well as plant-based options specially crafted for vegetarians. The Plant-Based Truffled Mushroom Burger is one such option. Garnished with creamy field mushrooms, vegan Swiss cheese sauce and vegan truffle mayonnaise, this burger is packed full of flavours and greens, perfect for a quick bite. Other scrumptious delights include the Singapore Seafood Laksa, Eggs Royale and the Oreo Mudpie. As evening dawns, head out to the alfresco terrace to grab some happy hour wines, beers, spirits, and tasty bar snacks as you enjoy the evening breeze. 

An ideal space for social gatherings and family meals, Prive at Robertson Quay has something for everyone. Don’t forget to bring your furry friend along as they have treats and toys to keep them occupied too. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Privé Somerset
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Truffled Field Mushroom Madness Pizza, Spaghetti Aglio Olio With Roast Pork Belly, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Nasi Goreng, Ultimate Fish & Chips,  Breaded Crab Cakes, Sticky Date Pudding
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Conveniently located near Somerset MRT station in the busy al fresco promenade of 313@Somerset, Prive offers the same high-quality yet affordable food and drinks. Its affable and friendly service has positioned itself as one of the must-visit dining venues in the bustling Orchard Road area.
Prive Somerset is a relaxed all-day dining and drinks venue where you can grab a quick bite, linger over a full meal or unwind with cold beers in a comfortable garden-esque al fresco setting. Offering juicy burgers, stone-baked pizzas, Asian fare, brunch favourites and other comforting dishes which are guaranteed to satisfy, Prive beckons you to take a break from the hectic pace of life and just chill.

The daily Happy Hour from 5-9pm is even more reason to linger on for a refreshing cocktail and gourmet bar bites. Casual, friendly and familiar, feel free to drop by in your slippers and kick your heels up with family and friends. 
Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé Tiong Bahru
data.Hours: Mon-Sun: 8am - 10:30pm (Last order for food and drinks at 10pm)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: PB&J with Flourless Banana & Oat Pancakes, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Impossible™ Meatball Spaghetti, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Sticky Date Pudding, Carrot Cake
data.ABOUT:
Joining the enclave of hip cafes at Tiong Bahru is Privé, the cafe chain that's garnered a solid following for its hearty mains, decadent desserts, and laid-back atmosphere.
This outlet marks Privé's first foray into a residential neighbourhood, and it couldn't have chosen a better spot than one teeming with old-school charm and nostalgia, creating the perfect vibes for a good book and a cuppa.
It opens early at 8am to fuel residents and tourists exploring the area with a variety of both light and hearty breakfast options. As the crowd starts to trickle in during lunchtime, the menu expands to offer an extensive range of local delicacies, salads, burgers, pastas, and mains. In the evening, the alfresco dining area makes a great spot for nibbling on tapas and imbibing a drink or two from the bar.
What makes Privé stand out from the crowd is its innovative selection of vegan and vegetarian options. Even meat-lovers can't say no to Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Impossible™ Meatball Spaghetti, award-winning Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice or the Harrisa Spiced-Roasted Eggplant.
End your meal on a decadent note with Privé's signature 85% Dark Chocolate Cake and Sticky Date Pudding. 
Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Privé Wheelock
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Plant Power Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Impossible Meatballs Spaghetti, Pulled Pork Knuckle Burger, Chilli & Lime Salmon, Sticky Date Pudding, Gummy Bear Margarita, Pineapple & Ginger Mojito
data.ABOUT:
Whether you’re looking for a place to rest your feet after a day of shopping, enjoying a fun night out, or having some late-night drinks with friends, Prive’s breezy alfresco terrace is your perfect refuge. Nestled prominently at the junction between the bustling Orchard Road and Scotts Road, this all-day dining establishment earns a place in our hearts with their amazing location, mouthwatering dishes, and refreshing drinks.
Begin your day with an Eggs Benedict or Plant Power Breakfast, or tuck into mains such Tracy’s Favourite Salad or a hearty Pulled Poek Knuckle Burger. Craving for local flavours? Satisfy them with Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice or Traditional Chicken Curry.
For the perfect partner-in-crime, look no further than their drinks menu where a good selection of classic and specialty cocktails, beers, spirits, and many more await you. Be sure to take advantage of the daily happy hour promotion on selected house pours between 5 to 8pm, and get your fix of sassy cocktails, like the Gummy Bear Margarita, which is a heady mix of tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, watermelon syrup, and irresistibly adorable gummy bears. Who can say no to that? 
Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Professor Brawn Bistro (Enabling Village)
data.Cuisine: Modern European, All-Day Breakfast, British, Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 20 Lengkok Bahru#01-17Enabling Village, Academy BlockSingapore (159053)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mushroom Soup, House Drumlets, Pan Grilled Striploin Steak, Waffles with Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
A cafe with a difference, Professor Brawn Cafe was set up with a mission to provide affordable good food by an inclusive workforce comprising people of different abilities, ages and socio-economic backgrounds. Serving great food with a great cause, Professor Brawn Bistro is the perfect place to indulge in sweet treats and healthy staples. 
Classified under urban farming research, starters at the bistro are healthy options that include Mushroom Soup, Garden Salad with Mushroom, Caesar Salad and more. For those looking to indulge in fried food, try out their sides. The House Drumlets are a classic favorite, with mouthwatering pieces of fiery drumlets doused in the bistro’s signature sauce. Strewn with tasty shavings of truffle, the Truffle Fries are absolutely delightful, with a hint of truffle in every bite.
Move on to the mains and be wowed by seafood, meat or pasta options that will leave you spoilt for choice. Classified under the study of anthropology, desserts include Waffles with Ice Cream or baked treats such as Assorted Muffins and Brownies. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Pronto
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mini Fish & Chips, Truffle Cream Sauce Pasta, Garlic Chicken, Hokkaido Cream Cheese Cake
data.ABOUT:
Serving the best of Japanese-Italian fusion, Pronto is located right in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District. A cafe by day and bar by night, Pronto changes its menu and service style according to the time of the day. Have a taste of something different when you stop by at different times of the day.

Indulge yourself in Italian cuisine with the wide range of appetisers, mains and sharing platters on the menu. Start with a tantalising portion of Mini Fish & Chips before diving right into the hearty Grass Fed Striploin Steak to satisfy your meat cravings. Pasta lovers can go for the Truffle Cream Sauce Pasta. Topped with fresh cherry tomatoes for a subtle sweetness, this dish is made for truffle fans. Sharing options here include the variety of pizza flavours available. The Garlic Chicken is a hot favourite here at Pronto. Served piping hot, these slices of cheesy chicken are here to delight! 

End your meal on a sweet note with the Hokkaido Cream Cheese Cake or Mascarpone Cheese Cake. (May 2021)

data.title: Publico Ristorante
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 1 Nanson RoadInterContinental Singapore Robertson QuaySingapore (238909)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prosciutto Pizza, Tartufata Pizza, Publico Lobster Spaghetti, Risotto Al Nero, Linguine Vongole, Bistecca Ribeye, Iberico Pork Secreto
data.ABOUT: Publico Ristorante brings a little slice of Italy to Singapore, with an emphasis on authentic and evocative Italian flavours. With interiors designed by New York firm AvroKO, the award-winning restaurant & bar boasts a multi-sensory culinary experience where you can enjoy contemporary Italian fare highlighting provenance and seasonality. Situated along the Singapore River, this lively Italian restaurant is a social hotspot that offers a haven of tropical paradise away from the bustle of city life. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Pura Brasa
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Piquillo Peppers with Burrata Cheese and Homemade Pesto Sauce. Avocado Salad with Ciptrio Dressing, Tagliatelle Pasta with Homemade Marinara sauce and Meatballs, Charcoal Grilled Mushrooms Paella
data.ABOUT:
A well-known Spanish restaurant chain, Pura Brasa opened its seventh restaurant in Tanjong Pagar Centre. Offering a unique dining experience based on their formula of quality products, expect a wide variety of dishes.

Pura Brasa’s menu exudes originality with their unique spin on Spanish tapas, burgers, fish and meat, as well as grilled greats. From 12pm till 3pm daily, the set lunch menu is a satisfying three-course meal not to be missed. Start with an Avocado Salad with Ciptrio Dressing before working your way through the Tagliatelle Pasta with Homemade Marinara sauce and Meatballs. Last but not least, end your meal on a sweet note with the Dessert of the Day.

Born from the idea of high quality food at affordable prices, Pura Brasa aims to deliver an unforgettable dining experience to all customers. (Jul 2020)

data.title: Q-WA Bar and Yakitori
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Katsu Cheese, Buta Bara, Gyu Yaki Shio, Garlic Yaki Meishi, Hatsu (Chicken Hearts), Shiitake Maki
data.ABOUT:
This Japanese izakaya-themed gastro-bar is a great spot for meat on sticks and cups of sake. Located in a leafy green area of Katong, Q-WA Bar and Yakitori offers a large selection of delicious Japanese grilled meats. Tuck into classic charcoal-grilled dishes like Pork Belly Shio, Tsukune and Gyu Yaki Shio. The Enoki Maki and Shiitake Maki are popular favourites — who doesn’t like the winning combination of bacon and cheese? 

If you need your carbs to keep you full, Q-WA Bar and Yakitori also offers rice and noodles on their menu. The Garlic Yaki Meishi is not the kind of rice you want to share with a date, but we love it for its fragrant, garlick-y aroma! Zaru Udon is a cold noodle dish that is a refreshing change from all the heavy meats you’ll be indulging in. 

For drinks, check out the bar that is well stocked with premium sake, as well as beers and Japanese single malt whiskies. Keep the mood light and fun with drinks like Shochu, Highballs and Umeshu! (Jul 2018)

data.title: Q-WA Izakaya
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Katsu Cheese, Buta Bara, Gyu Yaki Shio, Garlic Yaki Meishi, Hatsu (Chicken Hearts), Shiitake Maki
data.ABOUT:
Adorned with warm Japanese fittings, bright lanterns and carp streamers, Q-Wa Izakaya is a great place along Beach Road for after work drinks and casual, delicious food. The charcoal-grilled meats here are the perfect accompaniment for the sake and beer you’ll be drinking. 

For starters, order the Sawagani, Japanese freshwater baby crabs. Tori Kaarage is a classic that never goes wrong with beer, and the fried chicken here at Q-Wa Izakaya have a crunch skin and juicy meat. Tuck into classic charcoal-grilled dishes like Pork Belly Shio, Tsukune and Gyu Yaki Shio. The Enoki Maki and Shiitake Maki are popular favourites — who doesn’t like the winning combination of bacon and cheese? 

If you need your carbs to keep you full, Q-WA Izakaya  also offers rice and noodles on their menu. The Garlic Yaki Meishi is not the kind of rice you want to share with a date, but we love it for its fragrant, garlick-y aroma! Or try the Yaki Udon if you’re craving some pan-fried noodles. 

The bar is well stocked with premium sake, as well as beers and Japanese single malt whiskies. KKick back with with drinks like Shochu, Highballs and Umeshu! (Jul 2018)

data.title: Qi Lai Feng 齐来丰
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Collagen Q Fish Ribs, Tomato Fish Pot, Mala Fish Pot, Baby Lobster
data.ABOUT:
Hotpot has become one of the mainstays of Singaporean cuisine, but there are some things that our palates have yet to experience. Qi Lai Feng aims to enhance the hotpot dining experience with the unique “muscle fish”. A type of fish that is grown under strict conditions with a specific diet, its taste is similar to pork belly — firm, chewy, and delectable. Available exclusively at Qi Lai Feng, they’ve centred their menu and dishes around it with dry pots, soup pots, and side dishes.

The Mala Fish Pot is a great option for diners looking for a kick. Made with fish, Sichuan peppercorns, and chilli, this fiery dish has the searing flavours Singaporeans have come to love, made richer by the addition of silky fish. Top it with noodles and meat to soak up the broth for the perfect meal. For something a little milder, try the Tomato Fish Pot. Sweeter and tangier than Mala, the tomato in this soup gives the dish a rich and subtle flavour that goes well with rice. Try the Collagen Q Fish Ribs soup. Clear and packed with nutrients, this mainstay of hotpot is also available here, made with fish instead. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Quaich Bar (South Beach)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks
data.PRESS RELEASE:
At Quaich Bar, we believe that the love for fine whisky always begins with an exquisite dream.
Stocking more than 500 varieties of fine whisky, the bar is a warm embrace from the bustle of city life.
Quaich Bar is one of the most exquisite whisky bars in Singapore. Since its opening in 2007, it has played host to countless social gatherings among friends and catered to the every need of business leaders looking to entertain colleagues or clients with a taste for the finer things in life. In the true spirit of this tradition, it is therefore apt that Quaich (pronounced ‘quake’) is named after the Gaelic cup, a symbol of welcome and friendship.
We started in 2005 as a humble retail kiosk in Tanglin Mall called “The Whisky Store”. At that time, the market lacked a dedicated whisky bar so we pursued our passion, opening Singapore’s first whisky bar a year later at Waterfront Plaza.
The venture soon reaped rewards in terms of notable accolades for our contribution to whisky culture in Singapore, being awarded the ‘Great Whisky Bar of the World’ title by the international whisky publication ‘Whisky Magazine’ in 2006. In 2007 the bar was renamed Quaich Bar, as it remains today.
In 2010, Quaich Bar was voted ‘Top 10 Best Unique Bars’ by regional gastronomic publication, ‘Epicure’. It has since become a stop-over for master distillers from around the world who regularly conduct introductions or workshops to showcase their signature brands.
After nine years of spreading the word of good whisky at the original outlet nestled at the corner of Waterfront Plaza next to Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, a second outlet was opened at South Beach Avenue, next to JW Marriott Hotel, in 2016. (Jan 2019)

data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks
