data.title: Quentin's Bar & Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Curry Debal, Buah Keluak Curry, Putugal & Kueh Salat
data.ABOUT:
Quentin’s Bar and Restaurant explores a contemporary dining concept that is traditionally communal and takes pride in preparing distinctive and piquant dishes with recipes passed down from generations. Savour great Eurasian favourites such as the Chicken Curry Debal while indulging in unique twists to classic desserts.
Eurasian cuisine is a glorious and exotic mix of Asian and European flavours ranging from fiery hot chilli-mustard-vinegar flavoured curry to a mild cinnamon-garlic-onion flavoured stew.Located in the heart of Lion City’s most visited destinations and set in a thoughtfully restored colonial building, guests can expect a gastronomic Eurasian dining experience with a modern twist amidst Sentosa’s tranquil environment and opulent ambience. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Quentin's Eurasian Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Indian, Malaysian, Fusion, Local
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Debal Galinhia (Chicken Devil Curry), Prawn Bostador, Ros Befe, Porka Semur, Turmeric Cabbage, Fretu Bendi, Patchri, Chap Chye, Sugee Cake
data.ABOUT:
For most diners, Eurasian fare is uncharted territory. The fusion between Portuguese recipes and Malaysian and Indian spices is as unique as it is exciting, and this laid-back diner off Ceylon Road is happy to be your tour guide through the diverse landscape of these most savoury dishes.
The Debal Galinhia or Chicken Devil Curry is a chicken dish named after the devil himself for its potent blend of spices, and for those that can handle some heat, it's a must try. The hearty Ros Befe presents a traditional pot roast with a boldly spiced gravy that's good to the last, fork-tender bite. The Turmeric Cabbage is a filling dish in vibrant marigold colours. Another pleasingly bright dish is the Patchri, a beautiful composition of deep purple eggplant with sweet and sour sauce. The Fretu Bendi, or fried okra, is contrastingly crisp and toothsome. (Feb 2015)

data.title: QĪN Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Siphon Mushroom Tea, Hainan, No Rice Please, Canton Crisp, The Five Kings
data.ABOUT:
Experience a home away from home at QĪN restaurant and bar, where a plethora of classic dishes are reimagined with a modern yet intimate touch. A place where culture meets and kinship ignites, taste QĪN's contemporary and innovative take on well-loved delights that tug at the heartstrings of one’s home when you drop by The Clan Hotel.

Featuring an open kitchen concept that offers diners a visual spectacle while they await their masterpieces, the restaurant boasts Chinese design elements coupled with granite and wood finishing that creates an elegant dining experience. Bask in nostalgia at QĪN with their extensive menu that celebrates the diversity of Singapore. 

Start with a warm cup of Siphon Mushroom Tea to whet your appetite before diving into the various main dishes. A scrumptious favourite, the Hainan, No Rice Please is a plateful of free-range organic chicken served up with chicken chips, barley grain ball, garlic chilli aioli and shoyu jus. Meat lovers can opt for the Canton Crisp. Braised in pickled cream and paired with a hearty portion of crispy noodles, this tender beef brisket is just the dish to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Wash down your meal with a glass of signature cocktail that pairs exquisitely with the food and savour the taste of home. (Mar 2021)

data.title: RAPPU Handroll Bar
data.Hours: Tue-Thu: 5-10:30pmFri: 11:45am-3pm, 5-10:30pmSat-Sun: 11:45am-3:30pm, 5-10:30pmClosed MondayRESERVATIONS ONLY ACCEPTED FOR LUNCH
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: High Roller, Hand Rolls, Chicken Cartilage Karaage, Ginzu
data.ABOUT:
Different from your run-of-the-mill Japanese joint, RAPPU Handroll Bar is nestled along Duxton Road and is dedicated to delivering an unrivalled Japanese dining experience.
Known to have Singapore’s largest sushi handroll bar, the restaurant's signature handrolls come in sets of six. With six delicious options to choose from, diners will be spoilt for choice!
Top it off with the decadent High Roller (a must-try) and Scallop & Uni. The High Roller comes dusted with gold flakes and topped with wagyu and generous dollops of uni and caviar for the ultimate indulgence.
Round off your RAPPU rolls with a complimentary shot of miso soup with asari clam and let the good times roll here at RAPPU Handroll Bar. (Dec 2020)

data.title: RENNThai
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Phad Woon Sen, Khao Phad Pataya, Tom Yum Talay, Phad Prik Khing Tua Khiy Kem
data.ABOUT:
Offering the best of royal Thai cuisine, RennThai is located just a stone's throw away from the historic bank of Singapore River. Apart from a delectable Thai menu, the restaurant also offers a comprehensive wine selection.  

 

A well-loved Thai classic to kickstart your meal would be the Phad Woon Sen. Fried with generous chunks of chicken with an assortment of vegetables thrown into the mix, this plate of fragrant fried glass noodles is an authentic blend of Thai flavours. Seafood lovers should opt for the Khao Phad Pataya. Topped with scallops and prawns, this flavourful dish will leave you coming back for more.  

 

Complete the Thai dining experience with Tom Yum Talay. Both spicy and sour, the soup is brimming with a medley of prawns, squid and other fresh seafood. Add some greens into your meal with RennThai’s Phad Prik Khing Tua Khiy Kem. Fried with chilli, chicken and salted egg yolk, this savoury dish is a wonderful way to enjoy the traditional stir-fried french beans. (Sep 2020)

data.title: RUBATO Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Linguine al Cartocci, Burratina con Prosciutto e Rucola, Squid Ink Pasta
data.ABOUT:
RUBATO Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar takes its welcoming ambiance and understated decor a step further by keeping their kitchen open from 11am till 10:30pm. Located on Greenwood Avenue just off Bukit Timah Road, RUBATO keeps its décor simple and fresh, just like its menu. Ingredients are handpicked, pasta are homemade and cooked a la minute, and pizza are cooked to perfection in a wood-fired oven. In fact, the Chef Specialities vary each day depending on what owner, Marcus Edwin Wu, finds on his nightly journey to Jurong Port, where he selects the freshest seafood to serve. 

With the food taking centre stage, RUBATO Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar is a place where serious foodies can focus on great food whenever the mood strikes them. (Jan 2014)

data.title: RVLT
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 4-10:30pmFri: 4-10:30pm (1st Seating: 4pm, 2nd Seating: 8pm)Sat: 1-10:30pm (1st Seating: 4pm, 2nd Seating: 8pm)Closed Sunday
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The WINE RVLT is a wine bar founded by 2 veterans sommeliers of the F&B industry - Alvin Gho and Ian Lim - seeking to create a real revolution in the food and wine experience in Singapore.  
RVLT is an oasis in the middle of the concrete jungle that is Singapore, a home away from home for Singaporeans to unwind and just have fun. The founders get bored quite easily so they sought to create a wine and food program that radiates good energy in a spontaneous manner.For wines, Al Gho and Ian Lim likes to present whatever they like to drink! Some may say their taste is weird, or that their wines are too funky. However there are others like them from around the world who give them hope that they’re are not alone. From grower Champagnes to an amphora-aged Zibbibo, you will never know what to expect, because neither do they!Food is a key part of the new RVLT, with a focus on sustainable produce with a mind for "Lightness and Freshness". Great tasting dishes that nourish without making people feel jelak. (May 2019)

data.title: Racines
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 9 Wallich StreetSofitel Singapore City CentreSingapore (078885)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Bisque, Poulet, Wagyu Cheek, Sweet & Sour Kurobuta Pork, Angus Beef Cubes, Fruits de Mer Special, Abalone, Yuzu Tart, Mango Sticky Rice
data.ABOUT:
Racines, which means “roots” in French, is a restaurant that grows out of two very different but spiritually intertwined cuisines. The elaborate sauces and flavours of French cuisine meet the à la minute robustness of Chinese cooking, with each cuisine getting half of the menu, allowing diners to create a fascinating fusion meal unlike any other. Helmed by famed Executive Chef Jean-Charles Dubois, this restaurant spreads out over four live cooking stations that turn locally-sourced and organically-grown produce into elegant plates, a truly unique hotel buffet experience. There is also an à la carte menu that sprawls the full gamut of these two rich cuisines. In this fashion, you may see a classic pot-roasted French hen, a corn-fed beauty cooked in a pot with French potatoes and vegetables served up with a plate of stir-fried Frog Legs in a fiery Szechuan sauce. Or a beautifully slow-braised Wagyu Cheek served alongside crunchy Sweet & Sour Kurobuta Pork, or scallion-kissed wok-fried Angus Beef Cubes.
Both cuisines unite in their love for seafood. On the French side, there’s a massive platter of premium Fruits de Mer (fruits of the sea), including Alaskan king crab, freshly shucked oysters, and scallop carpaccio on an iced platter. On the Chinese side, the ubiquitous Abalone, except here served sashimi-style with a sea urchin sauce and a sprinkling of lemony breadcrumbs. Dessert is a grab-bag of options: delicate French gateaux flavoured with strawberries, dark chocolate, or praline rub shoulders with Asian flavours like red bean, yuzu, and mango sticky rice. The quality of cooking is truly unmatched, and who knows, you may discover some delicious food pairings for yourself at this culinary wonderland. Come experience one of the island’s most exciting fusion experiences today! (Nov 2017)

data.title: Raffles Courtyard
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 328 North Bridge RoadRaffles ArcadeSingapore (188719)(Accessible via North Bridge Road entrance)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Laksa Spring Rolls, Salted Egg Squid, Singapore Chilli Crab Cake, Watermelon & Beetroot Salad, Original Singapore Sling
data.ABOUT:
Exuding a welcoming vibe and surrounded by lush greenery, Raffles Courtyard is the city's social space in a lushly landscaped alfresco venue at the Raffles Arcade.

This friendly bar and lounge offers guests a garden respite against a colonial architectural backdrop, complete with refreshing shared summer drinks and a selection of Southeast Asian small plates, including authentic Singaporean delights. Perfect for the all-year-round summery weather in Singapore, this bar is where the city comes to socialize, meet, and spend time at. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Rakuichi Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sashimi, Sumiyaki Moriawase, Soft Shell Crab Karaage, Breaded Oysters, Enoki Mushrooms & Bacon
data.ABOUT: Set within a relaxing space along Dempsey Road, Rakuichi specialises in dishing out authentic and tasty Japanese fare at pocket-friendly prices. Sashimi is a must to start the meal, and the fresh slices of raw fish presented elegantly on a platter are definite crowd-pleasers. Grilled meats are a highlight at Rakuichi — your eyes feast first on the generous cubes of meat on skewers, presented on a small charcoal-grill and cooked before you. It’s enough to work up an appetite (not that you’ll need to) for the smoke-kissed, lightly charred meats bursting with flavour. There’s also comfort food to indulge in, such as soft-shell crab karaage, plump breaded oysters that are crispy and creamy at the same time, as well as enoki mushrooms wrapped in thick strips of fatty bacon. Put this on your go-to list if you’re a Japanese food lover. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Rang Mahal
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Avocado Kebab, Dhuwandaar Lamb Chop, Kashmiri Dum Ghosht Biryani, Chicken Tikka Masala, Maharashtrin Thecha Bhindi, Konkan Prawn Curry with Appam, Lychee Kulfi
data.PRESS RELEASE: Centrally located in the heart of Singapore's city centre, Rang Mahal is a fine-dining destination that serves up the best of Indian cuisine with modern flair. Taking pride in quality, excellence and focused on cooking from the heart, a meal at the acclaimed restaurant entails more than the assembly of freshest ingredients and culinary finesse; Rang Mahal represents fine dining that is unpretentious and exemplary, bringing people together through familiar yet refreshing flavours that delight the palate and nourish the body and soul.Since its establishment in 1971, Rang Mahal has been recognised as one of Singapore's leading Indian fine-dining restaurants with accolades such as the Singapore Brand Prestige Award – Heritage Brands Award, Wine Spectator's Award of Excellence from 2016 to 2018 and the Michelin Plate in 2018 and 2019. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Rattana Thai Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lemon Chili Squid, Pandan Chicken Leaf, Tom Yam Prawn Soup, Green Curry Chicken, Hotplate Basil Beef, Sweet & Sour Fish Sliced, Sambal Prawn
data.ABOUT:
As soon as you enter Rattana Thai Restaurant, you notice the unique Thai relics, the pristine wood dolls, and the regally framed pictures. This cosy Thai restaurant, nestled in Tanjong Pagar, exudes authenticity- something the locals appreciate and something we adore!
So have a seat, take a look at the menu, and wait for the delicious dishes to come out! First up on our list is the Lemon Chili Squid. It’s perfectly steamed squid in a flavourful concoction of Thai chili and a secret sauce. We can’t divulge too much, but just know you have to keep a glass of water nearby, this ones spicy! Next up, is the Tom Yam Prawn Soup. It’ll preface the main course and get your taste buds ready for what’s up next. Now for the piece de résistance and one of our favourites, the Hotplate Basil Beef. It’s perfectly tender Basil Beef dished on to this hotplate, keeping it steaming and ready to devour! (Jun 2015)

data.title: Raw Kitchen Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Herbal Tuna Tartare, Black Ink Rice, Limber
data.ABOUT: Enjoy good food, drinks and conversations with your loved ones at Raw Kitchen Bar (RKB). Located along Kallang Riverside, this intimate bar and restaurant features a secluded garden, perfect for intimate dinners.Representing a return to the basics, RKB is a celebration of the realness and rawness of being present, inviting you to sample their delicious menu of backyard comfort cuisine, inspired by punchy flavours from the Southern Hemisphere.Be sure to try out their signature Herbal Tuna Tartare. Served with a generous side of fresh perilla leaves, enjoy the tartare in this leafy goodness! The Black Ink Rice is a great option for those looking for a more filling meal. Flavoured with squid ink sofrito and topped with juicy charred tiger prawns, the in-house sambal chilli enhances the medley of flavours, turning it into an incredibly savoury and satisfying dish not to be missed out on. End your meal with the well-loved Limber. A crowd pleaser, this classic childhood Puerto Rican popsicle is served in seasonal flavours and makes for a refreshingly sweet end to a sumptuous meal. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Red Crab
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 180 Albert Street#01-09Village Hotel Albert CourtSingapore (189971)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seafood Package, Popcorn Chicken, Cheese Fries
data.ABOUT:
Red Crab Singapore, as its name suggests, serves up fresh crab and other ocean gems. Be sure to grab your buddies and order the assorted seafood package that comes with a crab, cockles, prawns, cheese hotdog, and corn. You can even choose the sauce you'd like the seafood to be cooked in: Chilli, black pepper, or salted egg, which is by far our favourite.

For those who love crab but are too lazy to peel it, Red Crab even has a Crabmeat Steamed Egg, with fluffy egg chock full of tender crabmeat.

There’s also a variety of finger food available, such as popcorn chicken, cheese fries, and even "maggi mee", the perfect accompaniments to a hearty seafood feast. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Red Eye Smokehouse
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Angus Short Ribs, Iberico Duroc Short Ribs, Smoked Chicken Flatbread
data.ABOUT:
Here’s your new go-to for delicious smoked meats at an affordable price. Imported from an exclusive butcher in California, the grass-fed produce have been transformed into perfectly marbled steaks with an even ratio of fat to meat. Chicken, pork ribs, and pork belly are also available for diners looking for something other than beef.

The Angus Short Ribs are one of their popular items, and it’s no surprise why — the ribs are tender and flavourful. Made from meat selected specifically for smoking, the thick ribs have been cooked for six hours that result in a tender, melt-in-your-mouth bite. The Iberico Duroc Short Ribs are another great option for diners who prefer a beefier alternative. Seasoned with dry rub and smoked for four hours, these ribs are sweet, spicy, and juicy. For something a little lighter, go for the Smoked Chicken Flatbread, topped with veggies and a helping of delightfully tender chicken. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Red House Seafood (Clarke Quay)
data.Cuisine: Seafood, Local, Dim Sum, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Pao Fan, Creamy Custard Sauce Lobster, White Pepper Crab, Fried Seafood Hor Fun, Chilli Crab, Takesumi Chilli Crab Buns, Crispy Cereal Prawns
data.ABOUT:
A decades-old operation originally from the East Coast, Red House Seafood upholds the tradition of classic seafood dishes with a focus on freshness.
Established in 1976 in a literal red house in East Coast, the restaurant has had its roots in the community for some time now, and its growth to various outlets across the island is a testament to its tasty fare. The original red house was a bastion for just-caught fish and crustaceans, delivered fresh from local fishing boats. The crimson-coloured facade was a symbol of prosperous and communal dining, further adorned with traditional red lanterns.
Now, the Clarke Quay outlet has very few red-coloured accoutrements, as the decor takes on a more understated look. For a casual step up from the outdoor seafood restaurants, this incarnation of Red House fits the bill perfectly, favouring simple functionality over flair. The one red item that's not going anywhere though, is their famed Chilli Crab, and with good reason. While there's much debate over which recipe reigns supreme in Singapore, Red House is consistently named among the top contenders. Here, the spicy gravy tastes especially homemade and doesn't mask the freshness of the crab.
With a bilingual menu written in both English and Chinese, Red House Seafood offers patrons a wealth of seafood options split into categories, all kept at more reasonable price points than you may expect. Prepared using a mix of Chinese and local Singaporean cooking methods, menu items include savoury dishes, like Fried Hor Fun, Lobster Pao Fan, and Creamy Custard Sauce Lobster that are all absolute must-tries. (Dec 2016)

data.title: Red Noodle & Bottle Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prawn & Pork Rib Ramen, Chasu Ramen, Prawn Laksa, Assorted Ngo Hiang Platter
data.ABOUT: Serving the tech wizards and film gurus of Fusionopolis is this charming dive bar and restaurant that trots out a menu of hearty Asian-Fusion bar bites and dinners along with frosty beers and cocktails. Here you’ll find all kinds of interesting pairings, but comfort food is at the heart of it. You can order their signature Fusion Bak Kut Teh, featuring pork ribs in a rich tonkotsu-style soup laced with punchy spices, and served up with a ramen soy-sauce egg alongside the requisite braised peanuts and dark soy sauce. Ribs come in a completely different form when you order the BBQ Pork Ribs, a much more American affair glazed in sticky sweet and sour sauce, over a bed of crisp fries. Then there’s the Japanese Chashu Rice Set, think ramen turned into a rice dish, with sweet glazed chashu served with freshly steamed rice. For a little zi-char comfort, order the Frog Leg Hor Fun, smoky wok-fried rice noodles tossed up with tender frog legs, spring onions, and lots of fiery ginger in a rich soy-based sauce. All this comes paired with frosty craft beers, the incredible marriage of a dive bar, kopitiam, and Izakaya, perfect for all your post-work hangout needs. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Red Sparrow
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pho Bo Tai, Cha Gio, Banh Xeo, Ca Kho To
data.PRESS RELEASE: Red Sparrow is a restaurant that offers a delightful dining experience with their menu featuring authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Located along Dempsey Road and just a few minutes away from Queenstown MRT Station, Red Sparrow is an ideal choice for a comforting solo meal or simple get together with friends and family in a casual and comfortable setting. (Jul 2019)

data.title: RedDot BrewHouse @ Dempsey Hill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: RedDot Guava Salad, Crispy Pork Belly, Wagyu Rump, Rib-Eye Steak, BBQ Squid Tubes
data.ABOUT:
Located in the refurbished Tanglin Barracks, this quaint spot boasts is modelled after the beer gardens of Bavaria, and boasts old world charm. Wonderfully intimate, it is the perfect place for a romantic dinner or a catch up with close friends. This restaurant is also one of the few places that are dog-friendly, which means furry friends are more than welcome to enjoy the dining experience. There are even kid-friendly activities like cooking classes and face painting for the enjoyment of the little ones - truly a dining experience for the whole family!

The Finger Foods here are perfect with a glass of beer, which is available on tap. The Crispy Pork Belly is reminiscent of Germany - home-cured and deep fried to crisp perfection without being too greasy. For something a little smokier opt for dishes from their charcoal grill - there’s the classic Satay available in chicken, beef, and pork, but there are also exquisite offerings like the Wagyu Rump and Rib-Eye Steak. 

For something a little lighter, opt for the RedDot Guava Salad, a unique mix of sweet and tangy guava, turnip, cucumber, and a variety of other greens topped with a lemon dressing. (Oct 2018)

data.title: RenLounge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 30 Beach Road#01-01JW Marriott Hotel Singapore South BeachSingapore (189763)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Namban Tsuke, Ika Shiokara, Assorted Tempura, Buta Shogayaki Don
data.ABOUT:
Discover an authentic omakase dining experience with family and friends at RenLounge with chef Samuel. With a wealth of experience under his belt, chef Samuel delights diners with a visual performance behind the sushi counter with his expert preparation of traditional and innovative sushi offerings available on the menu.

From donburi bowls to healthy salads and tempting bar bites, RenLounge attracts diners with its huge variety of classic Japanese favourites in addition to a sumptuous omakase menu tailored to bring out the best of Japanese cuisine. 

The Namban Tsuke features a mouthwatering portion of marinated fried fish for seafood lovers to kickstart their meal. Other equally tantalising seafood options include the Wasabi Tako and Ika Shiokara. If you’re dropping by with family or friends, try out the Assorted Tempura where an assortment of lightly battered seafood and vegetables await to delight you. Served with miso soup on the side, select the Buta Shogayaki Don for a simple and fuss free meal. Set atop a bed of fluffy short grained rice, the fatty pork belly is stir fried and ginger sauce and packs a punch of flavour with every bite. (May 2021)

data.title: Renga-Ya
data.Hours: Tue-Sat: 12-2:30pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6-11pm (Last Order: 10:30pm)Sun: 12-2:30pm (Last Order: 2pm), 5:30-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm)Closed Monday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Renga-Ya Zen Set, Wagyu Sirloin Steak, Wagyu Tenderloin Steak, Rainbow Raw Oysters, Wagyu Tar Tar, Abalone Cappelini.
data.ABOUT: When the yearning for Japanese barbecue hits us, we zip off to one place and one place only. That eatery is none other than Renga-Ya, a top-notch Japanese BBQ and grill. Nestled in the quaint and historic grounds of CHIJMES, Renga-Ya is a one-of-its-kind culinary gem that combines great food, warm hospitality, and a lovely atmosphere to boot. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Republic
data.Cuisine: Bar, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 7 Raffles AvenueLevel 3The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia SingaporeSingapore (039799)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: British Prawn Cocktail, Tomato-Vanilla Chutney, Artisanal Chocolates, Handcrafted Pastries, Boneless Texas Buffalo Wings, Squid Ink Brioche, Cocktails
data.ABOUT:
The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore presents an exciting new bar concept.

Republic presents flavours, ingredients, and sensations inspired by the influential hallmarks of the 1960s - one of the most pivotal eras of the Twentieth Century. The bar celebrates four cultural epicenters of importance and meaningful change; represented by way of alluring cocktails. Enjoy the stories while you imbibe on liquid history.
 

Open from 12 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily, Republic offers delicious cocktails, afternoon tea, lunch, and bar bites. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Restaurant JAG
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.PRESS RELEASE: In under a year, Restaurant JAG, Singapore’s latest French fine-dining restaurant has been awarded its first Michelin Star. Keeping their eyes on the prize, restaurant owners, Anant Tyagi a veteran restauranteur and French Michelin-Starred Chef Jeremy Gillon guaranteed a dining experience reaching the pinnacle of perfection. Staying true to its distinct concept, a tailored menu which highlights some of the most rare herbs from the Alps of Savoie, the duo have led the team to deliver only perfection. Each diner is served the finest meal using the freshest seasonal ingredients in the intimate warmth of the 27-seater restaurant. At the end of each meal, the diner is presented with a hand-written menu by the Chef and a special gift, making a visit to Restaurant JAG truly memorable.The beverage program contributes immensely to the overall dining experience. The Lounge Bar on the second floor opens up to a beautiful space, well-stocked with small-batch craft gin, vodka, rum, whisky and sake labels. Using the French herbs as its inspiration as well, the impressive menu features signature cocktails, updated with the change in season. Classics are not overlooked with our talented mixologists pouring out some of Singapore’s finest tipples. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Restaurant Labyrinth
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bak Chor Mee, Otah, Claypot "Ang Moh" Kampong Chicken Rice, The OG Labyrinth Chili Crab
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The idea for Restaurant Labyrinth came about when Chef LG Han realised that whilst Singapore is a bastion of great street food, the quality of dishes vary widely from hawker centre to hawker centre. Thus, Restaurant Labyrinth was conceptualized to provide a consistent level of top-notch, elevated Singaporean street food under one roof, complete with an edgy ambience.
Starting with a menu featuring some of Chef LG’s most-loved local dishes, diners will now be able to indulge in his signature “Ang Moh” Chicken Rice, the recipe of which was left to him by his beloved late grandmother, as well as Laksa featuring Local Green Lipped Mussels stuffed with homemade Fish Paste, Crab Meat Her Geow and Grilled Argentinian Red Prawns in a luscious broth. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Ricciotti (Riverwalk)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Linguine al Granchio, Ravioli del Plin, Tortelloni di Bufala, Trofie alla Genovese, Risotto alla Milanese
data.ABOUT:
This well-loved Italian restaurant is popular with an in-the-know lunch crowd hungry for its Italian deli grub and pastries, though in true Italian fashion, a luxurious sit-down affair that stretches out over a few hours would be the best way to enjoy this homey restaurant’s ample offerings.
The menu features lots of Italian classics, with a good number of ingredients made from scratch in the kitchen to really get at that home-cooked flavour. There’s a wide range of hand-made pastas tossed in vibrant sauces, including house favourites plump ravioli and tortelloni, stuffed with creamy cheeses and rich meat sauces. The risotto here is made from organically grown rice that gives a superb texture and creaminess, perfect in the meaty, Milanese-style risotto that’s made with a beef marrow reduction, saffron, and for a top-up, mounds of luxurious foie gras.
Grilled dishes round off the meal, and the seafood here is particularly good, featuring a range of oceany treats like grilled seabass. Delicious and hearty Italian plates from start to finish, find yourself some dining partners and have a nice, long meal at this fine trattoria. (Jul 2017)

data.title: Riders Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Australian Wagyu Burger (made with short rib and beef chuck), Squid Ink Risotto with Seafood, Roasted Squash with Kale Tabbouleh (vegetarian), Seafood Cioppino, Tropical Eton Mess
data.ABOUT:
Hidden somewhere behind the lush greenery in the heart of Bukit Timah is Riders Cafe, a charming and rustic restaurant that is one of Singapore’s most unique venue and popular dining spot. They have been one of Singapore’s most popular brunch spots since their establishment in 2007. Riders Café specializes in contemporary comfort food in a casual and relaxing space that exudes a lovely old-world charm in a black and white house. Guests are treated to a lovely view of riders on horses while dining at the cafe's verandah - a charming view where you might just forget you are in Singapore.

In the evening, the calming view of the setting sun along with the gorgeous pink hued sky is perfectly framed from the verandah of Riders Cafe. Just minutes away from the bustling city, this idyllic getaway is perfect for a romantic dinner or an intimate family gathering. Contrary to the buzzing brunch service they are so well known for, their dinner service is turned down to a chill and relaxing ambience, with a carefully curated selection of wines and full main courses. The Dinner Menu is a sampling of modern European cuisine with classic signatures such as the Steak Frites - 250gm Australian Angus Striploin (150 day grain fed), Berkshire Bone-In Grilled Pork Chop and Roasted Snapper. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Ristorante Da Valentino Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 200 Turf Club Road#01-19The Grand StandSingapore (287994)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Zuppa Ai Frutti Di Mare, Valentino's Granchio, Antipasto Fantasia, Tentacolo di Piovra alla Griglia, Tonnato, Burrata e Datterini, Insalata con Carne alla Griglia, Assaggi di Paste Speciali, Spaghetto ad frutti di Mare con Bottarga, Spaghetti e Scampi, Risotto ai Funghi Porcini, Linguini alla Pescatora, Costata di Wagyu Tomahawk Gr 250 or Gr 500 with Bone, Pollo alla Diavola, Branzino Pope
data.ABOUT: An Italian family, led by Chef Valentino, serves up the hearty fare of their home country, with ingredients specially imported from Italy and lovingly prepared in a way even Italian mothers would approve of. Ristorante Da Valentino prides itself on its seasonally-influenced menu, working with the best produce of each season, bringing the harvest highlights to the table. Open a meal with some antipasti, like a Mediterranean-style grilled octopus leg, spritzed with the barest trace of lemon juice to highlight its oceany flavours. There’s also an appetizer of thinly-sliced pork loin blanketed in a zingy sauce of capers, mayonnaise, and tuna, the perfect prelude to hearty, seafood-studded pasta mains like black fettuccine dressed in fruity olive oil with chunks of crabmeat. If you still have room for a course after that, order some dry aged tenderloin served up with earthy porcini mushrooms and mashed potato, or some pork chops given a sweet moscato marinade for an extra tender, deeply-flavoured dish. Hearty from start to finish, with a rustic sensibility that’s so quintessentially Italian, you know you’re in the good hands of a family steeped in tradition at Ristorante Chef Valentino. (May 2017)

data.title: Ristorante Palermo
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Burratina Verdure, Paccheri Braised Beef Ragu, Quattro Formaggi Pizza, Tiramisu, Torta Della Nonna
data.ABOUT:
Ristorante Palermo is an elegant Italian trattoria on Keppel Island, an ideal escape from the grind of the city. Whether you choose to dine indoors or on the alfresco terrace, you'll be treated to sweeping views of the marina and beyond.

The fare served here is undoubtedly authentic Italian, with a wide range of antipasti, pastas, pizzas, and sweet treats. Whet your appetite with the indulgent Burratina Verdure, a platter of creamy burratina cheese and vine tomatoes topped with crushed pistachios and truffle caviar.

For mains, the Paccheri Braised Beef Ragu is comfort in a bowl, while the Quattro Formaggi pizza, with four types of Italian cheese, will definitely satisfy all the cheese fanatics out there. Whatever you choose, the range of cocktails and Italian wines available are perfect pairings to your meal.

Save some space for dessert too. You wouldn't want to miss the Tiramisu or the Torta Della Nonna, a traditional Tuscan custard pie. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Ristorante Takada
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: French White Asparagus & Hokkaido Scallop, Tagliolini Pepperoncino Hokkaido Sea Urchin, Risotto Foie-Gras with Rapsberry bubble, Kagoshima Wagyu Tenderloin Steak with Red Wine Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Standing out from the elegant row of shops along Alexandra Road is Ristorante Takada, which sets itself apart from other dining establishments in more ways than one. At its helm is Chef Masahiro Takada, who has established himself as a trailblazer and a creator of superb Japanese-Italian fare. With a strong emphasis on the freshness of ingredients used, Chef Takada ensures the extraordinary standard and quality of his food. The restaurant uses fresh seafood, such as Hokkaido scallops and sea urchin, which are imported directly from the famed Tsukiji market in Tokyo.
The squid ink taglioni topped with sea urchin is sublime, with the combination of ingredients releasing a delightful blend of flavours on the taste buds. We also highly recommend the Wagyu tenderloin steak which is cooked to perfection, bringing out the full magnificent texture of the beef. These are all found on the July 2016 dinner menu, and are just a few examples of Chef Takada’s varied and exquisitely unique creations.
Let your dining experience be elevated further by the simple, chic decor that speaks of subtle elegance. The soothing jazz music and minimalist aesthetic create a great ambience that complements the meal perfectly. Japanese-Italian cuisine might not be quite as well-known as Japanese-French fare, but we definitely recommend giving Ristorante Takada a go! (Jul 2016)

data.title: Riverwalk Tandoor
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Chicken, Paneer Shashlik Kebab, Riverwalk Dhal, Keema Matter Tart, Gulab Jamun
data.ABOUT:
For a sumptuous feast of North Indian classics, head to Riverwalk Tandoor. Serving up hearty delights such as Tandoori Chicken and Butter Naan, a meal here is always satisfying and filling. 

From the a la carte menu, the Paneer Shashlik Kebab is a delicious grilled skewer of tender meat with snowy-white cubes of toasted cheese. For something more unique, the Keema Matter Tart is a savoury tartlet of diced meat and potatoes garnished with coriander and chilli. 

For mains, the Tandoori Chicken features flavourful, smoke-kissed meat with a crisp, juicy skin. Pair this with the aromatic Biryani Rice, or the signature Riverwalk Dhal, a vegetarian dish of lentils slow-cooked in coconut milk with a dash of lemon juice. Also good is the Butter Chicken, or the Fish with Cashew Nut Gravy and a side of buttery, toasted naan to sop up all the curry. 

End the meal on a sweet note with a classic dessert, Gulab Jamun. The golden-brown dough balls are soaked in a saccharine sugar syrup, garnished with pistachios for that bit of crunch. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Riviera
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.PRESS RELEASE: Sitting elegantly within One Fullerton with stunning vistas of the Marina Bay waterfront, Riviera is one of Singapore’s best-known destinations for Mediterranean fine dining with a view. Each meticulously crafted dish is a gourmand’s journey of the Mediterranean, celebrating the finest of culinary influences from the coasts to the mountains of this diverse region. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Rocku Yakiniku
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Chuck Tender, Wagyu Beef, Baby Octopus, Green Mussels, Salmon, Shiitake Mushrooms
data.ABOUT:
This casual and edgy restaurant isn’t just your typical Yakiniku joint. A haven for meat-lovers, Rocku serves up tantalising cuts of meat flown in from Australia, Japan, and the USA. You can expect premium cuts such as Wagyu beef brisket, Australian sirloin, short ribs, and many other delightful options. The decor is equally intriguing. With unpolished brick walls and bold graffiti carelessly plastered all over them, the space oozes fun and cheekiness.
What makes Rocku special however, is the multi-sensory dining experience diners will get to enjoy. Offering live music of the Korean, Japanese, and Mandarin pop-rock variety every Thursday to Saturday, Rocku is definitely your go-to place for an upbeat night out with friends. Don’t forget to complement your sizzling meats with some Asahi beer, whisky, or Japanese sake in hand. Whether it’s an Asahi Beer Tower, a classy glass of Nikka Black Special, or some Gekkeikan Josen, one thing’s for sure: there’s bound to be something to say cheers to here at Rocku. (Oct 2016)

data.title: Roots Mediterranean
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Skinny Pizza with Truffle Beef Carpaccio, Octopus Gallego, Tomahawk Steak, Tortelli Crab Lobster, Nutella!, Rootless Dessert Platter
data.ABOUT: Back to the Mediterranean ROOTS! A new restaurant concept with a great selection of Spanish, Greek and Italian dishes. Located in Bukit Timah area, ROOTS offers a cozy and laid-back ambience with a nice alfresco area where to have a drink with a tapas or a full dinner with friends or family. (Aug 219)

data.title: Rosso Vino
data.Cuisine: Bar, Italian, Seafood, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Penne with Crab Meat Sauce in Bisque of Prawns, Calzone Rosso Vino, Stuffed Ravioli with Porcini Mushroom in a Creamy Sauce and Parmesan, Tiramisu, Panna Cotta,
data.ABOUT:
Located along the banks of the Singapore River, Rosso Vino is a friendly, convivial Southern Italian restaurant and wine bar. With a view of the glittering Central Business District skyline, together with its stellar food and service, it is no wonder that Rosso Vino is popular with families, businessmen, and couples alike.  

The food menu is a cornucopia of delicious Italian dishes. The Chicken Parmigiana is another crowd-pleaser. Pan seared breaded chicken breast is topped with generous helpings of cloud-soft mozzarella cheese and tangy tomato sauce. The Calzone Rossovino is a folded pizza stuffed with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, pork ham, and mushrooms. A bite into it is enough to send you to food heaven. Desserts are equally tempting. A host of Italian classics such as Panna Cotta, Crème Caramel, and Torta Lava Con Gelato Alla Vaniglia are available. The star of the show, however, is undoubtedly the Tiramisu Dello Chef - the fullness of the mascarpone cheese, intensity of the espresso coffee, and sweetness of the ladyfinger biscuits combine to create one of the best versions of this Italian favourite. With an extensive menu filled with a plethora of Italian delights, there’s something for everyone at Rosso Vino. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Route 6
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 1 Rochor Canal Road#06-12Sim Lim SquareSingapore (188504)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Tiger Prawns, Thai Spicy Salad with Salted Egg Yolk, Thai Braised Pork Noodle, Thai Chicken Coconut Soup
data.ABOUT:
Offering authentic Thai cuisine and irresistable drink packages, Route 6 is nestled within Sim Lim Square. Boasting a team of experienced chefs from Thailand, this Thai restaurant and bar attracts many diners with an array of classic Thai favourites.

With a special menu dedicated to plating up seafood delights, Route 6 is a must-visit for all seafood lovers! Featuring juicy Grilled Tiger Prawns, Gong Gong, and freshly shucked oysters, these tantalising dishes perfectly complement sinful Thai classics such as the Thai Green Papaya Salad and Spicy Minced Pork Salad.

A delicate balance of savoury and sweet, the Thai Spicy Salad with Salted Egg Yolk wows with each fiery strip of vegetable coated with a yummy layer of fried salted egg. Exquisitely wrapped in fragrant banana leaves, the Pandan Chicken is a hot favourite not to be missed out on. Other affordable one-dish meal options on the menu include Tom Yum Bouncy Pork Noodle, Thai Braised Pork Noodle and Boat Noodle variations. For those who simply can’t dine without soup, order the Thai Chicken Coconut Soup is a comforting accompaniment to rice plates. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Route 65 Bar + Kitchen
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 3 Temasek Boulevard#01-434Suntec City North WingSingapore (038983)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Carnivore Platter, Hokkien Mee, Crying Tiger, Har Cheong Gai, Wan Tou Sliders
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Presenting to you a new Asian-fusion concept, Route 65 Bar + Kitchen! Nestled in the heart of Suntec City, we welcome you to our premium dining lounge coupled with a top-notch menu, hand-crafted signature cocktails and kickass live performances.

Enjoy conversations over an exquisite blend of local cuisines, cool concoctions and a convivial atmosphere here, catered for light to night event. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Royal Palm @ Orchid Country Club
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 1 Orchid Club Road01-21/22Orchid Country ClubSingapore (769162)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pasta Aglio Olio, Beef Rendang, Fish Head Curry, Chilli Crab, Black Pepper Crab, Chicken Shawarma
data.ABOUT:
Nothing completes a day out at the balmy Orchid Country Club quite like a sumptuous buffet, and the Royal Palm offers one of the most extensive buffets in town, drawing from the flavours of Singapore, the region, the Mediterranean, and the Middle East. Think big, robust flavours of local favourites such as Soup Tulang, Beef Rendang, Fish Head Curry, Chilli Crab and Black Pepper Crab.
No buffet is complete without à la minute stations, and the live BBQ station on Fridays to Sundays is an absolute must to try. Think Roasted Lamb, Chicken Wings, Satays and so much more! All this happens in a luxurious, opulent dining hall that’s perfectly Instagram-worthy, perfect for family outings and greedy date nights. Treat yourself, you deserve it. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Royal Taj
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cocktail Samosa, Pani Poori Shots, Royal Taj Butter Chicken, Gulab Jamun
data.ABOUT:
Serving inventive Indian cuisine for couples, families, travellers, and guests residing at Village Hotel Sentosa, Royal Taj is open all week for a la carte lunch and dinner buffets.

Partake in a royal feast of timeless Indian classics and authentic flavours reconceived with a modern take, alongside local and international cuisine to suit all kinds of palates. 

Begin your meal with the Cocktail Samosa. A vegetarian-friendly option, the pastry shells are filled with a potato filling and served with a sweet tamarind sauce. A popular street food dish from India, Pani Poori Shots are crispy fried dough balls that are stuffed with potatoes, sprouts, and spicy tangy water, making this dish a great start to any meal. Tuck into a bowl of Royal Taj Butter Chicken, with tasty spiced chicken in a smoky cream tomato sauce mixed with dried fenugreek and cream sauce. For something lighter, go for the Zafrani Chicken Curry which features chicken simmered in fragrant zafrani gravy. 

End your meal with a classic Indian sweet. Known as Gulab Jamun, this dessert is a delicious concoction of milk solids, rose syrup and cardamom powder. (Jul 2020)

data.title: Royal Thai
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Satay, Crispy Springrolls, Baby Kai Lan with Roast Pork, Red Curry Chicken
data.ABOUT:
The perfect dining space where you come hungry and leave happy, Royal Thai is located in Champions Golf Academy and is home to some of the most prolific chefs with a legacy of serving customers with all the delicacies of the Thai culinary tradition. 

The mouthwatering dishes here at Royal Thai are bound to leave you smacking your lips in anticipation. Made for sharing, the Chicken Satay is a plate of skewered meats that are juicy and succulent. The Crispy Springrolls are must-tries. Bite into one for a satisfying crunch and enjoy the harmonious mix of mushrooms, vegetables and pork. Shatteringly crisp on the outside, dip the spring rolls into the signature house sauce for an extra burst of flavour. 

Other delicious dishes include the Baby Kai Lan with Roast Pork, Red Curry Chicken, and Fried Rice with Pork. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Royale
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Atlantic Cumin Crust Salmon, Australian Striploin Steak, Signature Laksa & Fried Hor Fun
data.ABOUT: Royale, situated within the Mercure Hotel in Bugis, truly delivers on its name. You enter to an opulent, almost regal dining room done up with baroque style finishes and furnishings that include plush upholstered seats, leather touches, and gold studs. It’s possibly one of the most intimate and cushy hotel dining experiences in the city, with its cosy booth seats and banquet-style semi-circular tables for larger groups. Bathed in bright sunlight in the day and romantically candle-hued in the night, this is a space that makes you feel like royalty. Royale’s menu features an all-day menu of modern European classics like Grilled Atlantic Cumin Crust Salmon, soft and tender salmon served with Italian fork spud and cucumber spaghetti, all bathed in a pool of creamy St. Jacques butter. For more Asian flavours, there is a stellar rendition of Char Kway Teow, full of smoky flavours, and a fiery Nasi Goreng Istimewa, power packed with otah-otah, chicken wing, prawn cracker, fried egg and spicy pickles. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Rui Xiang Restaurant 瑞祥美食
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum, Zi Char
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.Address: 131 Bencoolen Street#01-01Hotel G Singapore  Singapore (189639)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Xiao Long Bao, Ma La Pot, Prawn with Golden Sauce, Signature Fish Head
data.ABOUT:
With a promise to cook up your new cravings, every visit to Rui Xiang Restaurant is a surprising one that guarantees deliciousness in every bite. Also available for special events and catering, the restaurant places an emphasis on high quality seasonal and local produce sourced directly from local farmers’ markets. 

Boasting an expert staff with over 30 years of experience in the culinary world, Rui Xiang Restaurant ensures that diners will have nothing short of a fantastic dining experience. A local Chinese food restaurant with a twist, the restaurant offers traditional local delights such as Chilli Crab and Signature Fish Head Fried Dumpling, as well as springy noodles that differ in taste from other Chinese restaurants. 

Order the signature Ma La Pot to share with family and friends. Filled with chewy glass noodles and a variety of different meat and vegetable ingredients, this popular spicy dish is the perfect way to savour together with loved ones. Pair with a mouthwatering side of Xiao Long Bao for a classical dining experience. A signature dish here at Rui Xiang Restaurant, don’t leave without trying the Prawn with Golden Sauce. Peppered with garlic and soaked in a shiny, golden sauce, this tasty dish is sure to leave you coming back for more. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Runway80
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, All-Day Breakfast, Cafe, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Fillet, Pulled Pork Sliders, Wagyu Beef Burger, Eggs Benedict, English Breakfast, Jalapeno Bites
data.ABOUT:
Lively cafe by day and chill bar at night, this tranquil Tai Seng spot does it all. Aviation paraphernalia line the walls of this cosy spot, a symbol of the passion of the owners. From clocks from various time zones, to an LED track that mimics a runway, this spot has it all. The love for all things flight doesn’t just stop at the decor either. The menu traces the origin of several iconic Asian and European dishes. All the mains are marked with their country of origin, and named after a code of their city.

The Bangers & Mash here is a hot favourite. Served with your choice of meat sausage - Kurobuta pork, lamb, or beef, this dish comes with earthy truffle mashed potatoes and is topped with black pepper or mushroom gravy, making for a extremely rich and satisfying dish. The Salmon FIllet is another popular, lighter option. Pan-seared Norwegian salmon is served with rich cream sauce and a generous portion of vegetables, making this the perfect option for a hearty, healthy lunch. 

Barflies looking for a place to chill after work in east will appreciate Runway80 for their wide selection of spirits, wines, and beers. There are even generous milkshakes and Dutch Colony coffee for diners who prefer non-alcoholic beverages. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Ruth's Chris Steak House
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 6 Raffles Boulevard4th FloorPARKROYAL Collection Marina Bay HotelSingapore (039594)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sizzlin' Blue Crab Cakes, Barbecued Shrimp, Cowboy Ribeye, New York Strip
data.ABOUT:
Merlot-coloured walls, plush gold and burgundy floors, a sense of timeless elegance, these are just a few gushing phrases that spring to mind upon stepping into Ruth’s Chris Steak House. It makes sense that the décor isn’t overblown because, as the familiar quip goes, all the better to focus on the amazing, New Orleans-inspired food, my dears!

You might expect to come face-to-face with pages of meats once you crack open the menu, given its name, but, refreshingly enough, it starts off with plenty of seafood appetisers. Barbecued Shrimp, Sizzlin’ Jumbo Scallops, their signature Blue Crab Cakes; all good reminders that there’s more to this steak house than just beef. Go a little further, however, and you’ll strike gold: custom-aged Midwestern beef that come in all sorts of cuts, from Ribeye and Porterhouse to Petite Filet for those with a smaller appetite. Pair your juicy, perfectly grilled steaks – which come on a piping hot plate – with a Bleu Cheese Crust, get it Oscar Style with crab cakes, asparagus, and béarnaise sauce, or throw your diet plan out and add on other succulent mains such as Fresh Lobster or an Ahi-Tuna Stack. After all, when at Ruth’s Chris Steak House, following that wise rule of ‘go big or go home’ is what we call a solid plan. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Ryu Taro Yakitori Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yaki Onigiri, Hamachi Kama, Gyu Enoki Maki, Hatsu
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away on the second floor of a shophouse along Neil Street lies Ryu Taro Yakitori Restaurant. A secret dining space featuring dark, swanky interiors decked out in carpeted floors and posh sofas, this modern Izakaya bar specialises in yakitori and Japanese cuisine alongside a wide variety of Japanese sakes.

We recommend going with the mentaiko-flavoured Yaki Onigiri or Chikin Chahan to pair with the yakitori, starter and charcoal grill options. Hot appetiser options include Kani Karaage or Kawabi. Curated for seafood lovers, these fried seafood favourites are a great way to kickstart a hearty meal. The seafood feast continues with the restaurant’s yakimono offerings. Tuck into the Hamachi Kama to enjoy tender bites of lightly salted Grilled Yellowtail Collar. For the salmon fans, the Sake Kama Shioyaki and Sake Kabuto Yaki are not to be missed out on! 

Mix and match your favourite yakitori sticks with your pick of beer, chicken or lamb. Chef recommendations include the well loved Gyu Enoki Maki, Hatsu and Uzura Tamago. (May 2021)

data.title: SBCD Korean Tofu House (Millenia Walk)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: L.A. Galbi, Spicy Grilled Chicken, Spicy Baby Octopus, Abalone Spoontofu, Assorted Spoontofu
data.ABOUT:
A mainstay of Singapore’s Korean food scene, this Korean Tofu House has once again opened its doors to patrons at a location closer to the Promenade. Clear floor-to-ceiling windows allow patrons to dine “al-fresco” while they beat the heat indoors. This new stalwart on Millenia Walk seats over 150 people comfortably, which means shorter wait times and a livelier dining experience. 

Helmed by celebrated Korean Chef Nam Kyoung Soo, diners will once again get to indulge in the beloved Soontofu soup with their choice of broth. The silken tofu used in the soup is made by hand at the restaurant daily, using organic soybeans imported directly from Paju, South Korea. Beloved classics like Spicy Baby Octopus and L.A. Galbi are also made with fresh ingredients and can be served with the rice dishes on the menu or as dishes on their own, depending on the diner’s preference.

The rice dishes here are served in hot stone bowls as per Korean tradition, and the rice crust at the bottom is mixed with corn tea and served as a porridge at the end of the meal - if you’re looking for authentic Korean food that is healthy, hearty, and accessible, look no further.

data.title: SBCD Korean Tofu House (Tanjong Pagar Centre)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Soontofu Soup, Spicy Baby Octopus, L.A. Galbi, Kimchi, Nurungji Bap
data.ABOUT:
Helmed by celebrated Korean Chef Nam Kyoung Soo, the highlight of the menu here is the Soontofu Soup, which is made with silken tofu and the diner's choice of broth - from mild to crazy hot for the daredevils out there.

The silken tofu used in the soup is made by hand at the restaurant daily, using organic soybeans imported  directly from Paju, South Korea. The broth is made with a 10-ingredient secret recipe soup paste and is allowed to set for a couple of days after boiling. This brings out the best of the ingredients without any need for artificial flavouring, and results in a soup that is light but tasty and low in cholesterol for health-conscious patrons.


Tiger prawns and flower crab are only some of the ingredients that can be added to the soup. If that's not your thing, authentic Korean side dishes like Spicy Baby Octopus and L.A. Galbi are also available. The rice dishes here are served in hot stone bowls as per Korean tradition, and the rice crust at the bottom is mixed with corn tea and served as a porridge at the end of the meal. If you're looking for authentic Korean food that is healthy, hearty, and accessible, look no further. (Apr 2018)

data.title: SEA Chuan KungFu Fish
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Steamboat, Modern Asian, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Mala, MSpicy Sichuan Chicken, Garlic Baby Lobster, Chinese Prata
data.ABOUT:
Founded by Adam, this seafood restaurant in Marina Square pays particular attention to the use of quality ingredients. Specially grown to suit the restaurant’s needs, the vegetables used in his dishes are urban farmed and exceptionally fresh.

Their signature dishes include Red Snapper, Qing Tang, Special Cod, or Barramundi doused in Red Hot Chilli Flavour, a flavoursome soy sauce or the restaurant’s Signature Mala dressing. For those who are looking for a fiery good time, bolder flavours include the Fresh Chilli and Pepper Flavour, and handmade Kung Fu Tomato Flavour. Complete your meal with side dishes from stir-fry menu options that include classic Sichuan delights such as MSpicy Sichuan Chicken, Thirteen Incense and Garlic Baby Lobster, pick any for a mouthwatering addition to a yummy meal. Alternatively, choose to add on ingredients such as Potatoes, Enoki Mushroom or Kung Fu Vermicelli for a filling meal.

Meat lovers will love the grilled BBQ menu here at Sea Chuan Kungfu Fish. Choose from a variety of beef, lamb, lamb ribs, and scallops for a steaming good time. (Feb 2021)

data.title: SG Taps
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Miso Nikomi Hanba-gu, Sake Kasu Miso Chicken, Teppan Neapolitan, Stuffed Chicken Ham, Piri Kara Chicken Wing
data.ABOUT:
Our sunny island isn’t exactly a hotspot for beer connoisseurs but we have much to thank for the recent, much-appreciated influx of bars that specialise in craft beers. The newbie to the scene, SG Taps, has the same fervent mission of bringing the very best craft beers from around the world to Singapore, complete with a trendy address right in the heart of town, and we just can’t say no to that.

Conveniently located at the historic Duxton Hill, SG Taps supplies the perfect spot for a cheeky midday pick-me-up or a casual after-work pint; and with 10 taps and a burgeoning collection of both familiar and eclectic beers, there’s no better place to be. Pair the lovely Crossroads Craft Lager or the Rye & Pint Trippin Wheat with some casual Japanese-inspired plates such as the Pakchi Gyoza, the Amami-style Chicken Rice for a well-rounded meal, or go local with their delicious Laksa Pizza, topped with generous portions of shrimp and clans - with so many options, there’s gotta be something for everyone. (Sep 2018)

data.title: SHAO
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: SHAO Signature Roast Platter, Crispy Roast Suckling Pig, SHAO Signature BBQ Crab, BBQ Oyster, Fried Seafood Rice
data.ABOUT:
It goes without saying that you can’t cook without fire. So it’s no wonder why SHAO 烧 pays tribute to this oh-so important element with a menu that’s centred around roast and barbecue.

Created by Chef Jack Ding who got his culinary feet wet operating a takeaway business during his university years, SHAO is a casual eatery on Frankel Avenue where you’re invited to relax and partake in a hearty meal with close friends. Several roast meats take the menu here, one notable dish being the tender and juicy SHAO Signature Roast Platter, comprising a mix of the restaurant’s roast duck and roast pork. The restaurant also spins up an amazing Crispy Roast Suckling Pig that’s crispy yet succulent in all the right places.

But that’s not all! Seafood makes an appearance on the menu too, and it is fantastic. We love the SHAO Signature BBQ Crab, which is paired with a divine Japanese-style pepper, salt and unagi sauce, while fans of oysters should definitely give the BBQ Oyster a try.  Surpassing all expectations, SHAO delivers an impressive mix of artistry, service, and quality in one great culinary experience. (Feb 2018)

data.title: SKAI Bar
data.Hours: Wed-Thu: 4-11pmFri: 12-11pmSat-Sun: 3-11pmClosed Monday & Tuesday Last food order: 9:45pmLast drinks order: 10pm
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Food: Charcuterie Platter, Foie Gras Terrine, Freshly Shucked Fine De Claire No2 Geay Special Oysters, Crab Spaghetti, Westholme Wagyu Flat Iron
Wine: Penfolds Grange, Penfolds BIN 311, Penfolds St Henri, Penfolds Max’s Chardonnay, Riesling Penfolds Koonunga Hill
data.ABOUT: In partnership with Penfolds, Australia’s leading winemaker, SKAI Bar offers a remarkable selection of benchmark wines complemented with thoughtfully curated premium bar bites. Or unwind with bespoke cocktails to the city’s best sunset views. (Jun 2021)

data.title: SKAI Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Fusion, International, Seafood, Steakhouse, Vegetarian Friendly, Modern Asian, BBQ, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seared Foie Gras, Crab Cake, Tenderloin Oscar, Tomahawk, Baked Cheesecake
data.ABOUT:
A refined and contemporary grill restaurant, SKAI Restaurant is located on the 70th floor of Singapore’s acclaimed Swissotel The Stamford. Indulge in the iconic views of the city’s beautiful skyline as you wine and dine with the restaurant’s extensive cocktail and brunch menu.  

Fresh from the Acipenser Schrenki variety of sturgeon, the Kaviari Kristal Caviar features a deep golden colour with a firm texture and rich nutty flavours — the perfect appetiser to a wonderful meal. Meat lovers can dive straight into the Miyazaki Wagyu. A 200-gram New York Strip from pure-bred Japanese wagyu, tuck into this plateful of meaty goodness to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Specially curated for two, the Stanbroke features a Black Angus cut, a wonderful cut of steak for an intimate dining session. Other chef recommendations include Crab Cake, Heirloom Beetroot and the Tenderloin Oscar. 

Pair with the restaurant’s exquisite bottles of red or white to complete your meal. Lastly, do not leave without ordering the Baked Cheesecake. A concoction of sweet strawberries, sour cream and vanilla, this mini cake is not to be missed out on! (Mar 2021)

data.title: SKIRT (W Singapore - Sentosa Cove)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 21 Ocean WayW Singapore – Sentosa CoveSingapore (098374)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Seared Scallops, Housemade Hummus, Charred Sweetcorn Ravioli, Australian Wagyu, Cheese Platter
data.ABOUT:
SKIRT is a trailblazing grill house, where prime cuts of meat and fresh, sustainably sourced seafood are beautifully prepared on the centerpiece parilla grill, placing us amongst the most favourite Grill Restaurants in the city.

The food concept of SKIRT simply offers the very modern and “now” approach that the essence of good cooking and thereby great eating is to source from the finest produce, treat it with simplicity to show it for the best that it can be – this remains as the cornerstone of the food philosophy of SKIRT. (May 2018)

data.title: SLATE.
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sideways Omelette, G&G Sandwich, Sweet Pork Sausage Burger, Double Fried Spring Chicken
data.PRESS RELEASE:
We are a dual concept, Asian Contemporary eatery - Brunch cafe by day, Restobar by night. 

The day time is upbeat and energetic, as we serve up creative takes on classic Brunch dishes, best enjoyed with an aromatic cup of joe. Be sure to check out our counter of house-baked breads & pastries and a shelf of house-made pantry items such as condiments and jams for a little treat and to take home. 

Come nightfall, release your inhibitions as the restaurant elevates the dining experience with uniquely inspired small & large sharing plates, meant to be paired with the thoughtfully curated selection of wines and cocktails, backed by an expansive and handsome collection of Gins & Whiskys. (Jan 2021)

data.title: SMÖÖbar (Holland Village)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mentaiko Seafood Pizza, Beef Lasagne, Popcorn Chicken Pizza, Hawaiian Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Located along Lorong Mambong @ Holland Village, SMÖÖbar specialises in mentaiko dishes such as Mentaiko Fries, Mentaiko Chicken Mantou, and Mentaiko Seafood Pizza. For the full mentaiko experience, order the large Mentaiko Platter which consists of Smoobar’s mentaiko dishes. Drizzled in mentaiko sauce, the Mentaiko Fries are thick and crisp with the right balance of sweet and salty notes. The Mentaiko Seafood Pizza looks as good as it tastes, with chunks of prawns, squids, cheddar and mozzarella placed atop a mentaiko crust base. 

Additionally, the bar’s signature Beef Lasagne is also the star of the show. With layers of rich meat sandwiching a creamy cheese sauce, the Beef Lasagne is served piping hot. Made for sharing, SMÖÖbar’s Popcorn Chicken Pizza is a specialty pizza topped with crispy popcorn chicken and melted mozzarella atop a tomato based crust. The classic Hawaiinan Pizza is also a favourite among diners. 

The bar also serves cheap beer towers and a wide range of alcohol with more than 10 liquor choices such as soju, Guinness and many more. (Mar 2020)

data.title: SMÖÖbar (Prinsep)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mentaiko Fries, Bakwa Carbonara, Mentaiko Chicken Mantou, Mentaiko Seafood Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Located along the busy stretch of restaurants and bars along Prinsep street, SMÖÖbar offers a fun and affordable night out with friends and family. 

SMÖÖbar at Prinsep specialises in mentaiko dishes such as Mentaiko Fries, Mentaiko Chicken Mantou, and Mentaiko Seafood Pizza. For the full mentaiko experience, order the large Mentaiko Platter which consists of Smoobar’s mentaiko dishes. Drizzled in mentaiko sauce, the Mentaiko Fries are thick and crisp with the right balance of sweet and salty notes. The Mentaiko Seafood Pizza looks as good as it tastes, with chunks of prawns, squids, cheddar and mozzarella placed atop a mentaiko crust base.

Featuring a taste of home, the Bakwa Carbonara is a unique take on Singapore’s love for the famous Chinese salty-sweet pork jerky. Paired with spaghetti and cream sauce, this dish makes for a delicious meal any time of day.

The bar also serves cheap beer towers and a wide range of alcohol with more than 10 liquor choices such as soju, Guinness and many more. (Mar 2020)

data.title: SPRMRKT At Cluny Court
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Brussel Sprouts, Tofu Fries, Buttermilk Pancakes, Aburi Salmon, Blackened Fish & Chips, Vegan Lasagne, Vegan Classic Chocolate Cake, Lychee Chiffon Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
SPRMRKT is a cultural-culinary brand focused on the simplicity of every day with dining, retail and art at the heart of its locations. Produce-driven cooking, responsible sourcing, conscious dining plus curatorial care guide their approach to enrich lives and experiences. Exemplary to this is the new vegetable-forward menu, created by Head Chef Marc Wee. 
Often regarded as an accompaniment or even a garnish, the humble produce takes center stage where vegetables of all kinds fill an array of sharing and individual plates. The Butternut features soy-glazed roasted butternut squash, black barley and farro dressed with wild stingless bee honey, finished with toasted sesame seeds. The Nasu is laden with umami as baked Japanese eggplant is coated with shio kombu balanced with honey yogurt, while the Peckham Pear is a refreshing salad of compressed pear, endive, radicchio, local arugula, deep-fried chickpeas drizzled over with a piquant lemon dressing.
Chef Marc’s style of produce-driven cooking is also seen in a concise selection of seafood and meat dishes, such as the Hamachi – a western take on a Japanese favorite where the cheek and collar are grilled to a perfected char complemented with capers, burnt butter and anchovies; the Fisherman’s Catch of wild-caught or sustainably farmed fish as well as the Butcher’s Cut of meats available in the market. (Jun 2020)

data.title: SPRMRKT At Dempsey Hill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Avocado on Toast, Buttermilk Pancakes, Honey Infused Yoghurt Bowl, Golden Carbonara
data.ABOUT:
A culinary-cultural concept that merges food, retail and art into a single space, SPRMRKT at Dempsey Hill offers an unparalleled multi-faceted experience. Boasting a modern European menu heavily influenced by South Asian produce, the multi-functional space offers all-day breakfast and lunch menus, attracting hordes of diners every week.

Live and eat well with SPRMRKT at Dempsey Hill’s wide range of all-day dining options. Redefining the local supermarket experience, SPRMRKT also aims to give back to communities around the region.

Avocado on Toast at SPRMRKT at Dempsey Hill comes in the form of freshly deseeded avocado, pickled shallots, poached egg and cherry tomatoes piled atop toasted sourdough. A savoury breakfast staple, the Buttermilk Pancakes is topped with bacon, sunny-side up eggs, kurobuta pork sausage and sweetened with sliced banana, caramel sauce, fresh berries before being garnished with a drizzle of maple syrup. 

For those who prefer an iced cold treat that is as delicious as it is healthy, opt for the Honey Infused Yoghurt Bowl. Made of housemade granola, selected fresh fruits and honey-yoghurt, the yoghurt bowl is a refreshing dish to kick start your mornings. (Jul 2020)

data.title: STAGE
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab Pizza, Samb Chicken Pizza, Carbonara, Black Pepper Beef, Crispy Pork Belly
data.ABOUT:
Good food and good music, the twin pleasures of life, are epitomised at STAGE, an unassuming hideout along Prinsep Street. The cosy space takes on industrial chic vibes reminiscent of an underground bar, setting the perfect atmosphere for live music performed by talented local bands. If you think you’ve got the vocal cords, then head down to Stage on Wednesdays when open mic sessions allow guests to belt out their favourite ballads before a crowd.
While you’re serenaded by your favourite local acts, tuck into STAGE’s gourmet food. Their famed hand-crafted pizzas, for instance, are made from the freshest ingredients and served hot from the oven daily. Savour some local flavours with the Chilli Crab Pizza, where generous portions of succulent crab meat and a decadent chilli crab sauce are topped with a gooey poached egg and coriander leaves. Pasta is also always a good idea here - the Carbonara is creamy without being too overwhelming, while the Black Pepper Beef, a spaghetti tossed with tender beef cubes, bell peppers, and a tangy black pepper sauce is a definite must try. Looking for some small bites instead? Tantalising options such as the Crispy Pork Belly are always reliable choices here. Let’s toast to a great night out because it’s going to be tough to beat! (Aug 2017)

data.title: SaVour Eat
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Italian, Fusion, Seafood, Local, Caribbean, Cajun, Cafe, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cordon Bleu, Spicy Aglio with Tiger Prawn, Smoked Duck Pesto Pasta, Spring Prawns
data.ABOUT:
Revel in the music, good food and drinks together with family and friends at Savour Eat as you enjoy the restaurant’s chef signature dishes in a relaxing ambience. 

Pop by Savour Eat for a wide variety of freshly prepared healthy meal options that can be seamlessly incorporated into your busy lifestyle. Order the in-house special for a tangy and tasty pasta dish featuring meatballs made with hidden specials. Speckled with grated cheese, this dish is a wonderful medley of flavours. 

Ready your bibs for the restaurant’s Cordon Bleu. Guaranteed to fill you up, this chicken dish is layered with ham and cheese perfectly layered inside with a light batter outside, providing a satisfying crunch in every bite. For the seafood lovers, the Spicy Aglio with Tiger Prawn is a must have. Expertly cooked with olive oil and tossed to perfection, the chewy pasta is served up with a generous serving of juicy tiger prawns. 

Treat yourself to a glass of wine or chill with Savour Eat’s in-house beer bag for a delightful end to a satisfying meal. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Sabio By The Sea
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Selection of Pintxos, El Pulpo, El Cerdo, Ceviche de Gambas,
Carpaccio de Pulpo, Gambas al Pil Pil, Pan Con Sardinas and Churros
data.ABOUT:
Quayside Isle is home to many restaurants with a striking view, but none doling out zesty Spanish tapas like Sabio By The Sea. Inspired by the original Sabio on Duxton Hill, this Spanish tapas concept took to the sea to spoil us with a warm breeze and salty ocean air, yet keeping true to the delicious tapas we've all come to love. Adorned with antlered chandeliers, vividly curated paintings redolent of Joan Miró, and carefully etched tiles, Sabio By The Sea is an enchanting venue full of captivating Spanish culture and robust Spanish dishes.
The menu, itself, is bold and intense. Conjuring up visions of matadors, evoking Iberian inspired flavours, and leaving a vibrant legacy - the plates here come to life as soon as they hit the table. The Paella Negra, a medley of seafood and squid ink, is the perfect example of what we mean. The savoury flavours come together to bring a dish you'll be craving for days to come.
But it's not just about the savoury options, the dessert menu brings together so many of our favourite things, making for one tough decision when it comes time to make our pick. The Churros, glittered with sugar and cinnamon, are crisp heavenly delights! (Jul 2015)

data.title: Saint Pierre
data.Hours: Tue: 6-8pm (Last Seating: 8pm)Wed-Sat: 11:30am-1:30pm (Last Seating: 1:30pm), 6-8pm (Last Seating: 8pm)Closed Sunday & Monday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Scallop, Marron, Wagyu, Pigeon
data.ABOUT: Savour the quiet refinement of Saint Pierre where subtlety is the name of the game, be it in its food, service or setting. With a warm palette of colours for the carpets and upholstery, the restaurant’s interior exudes an elegance that makes an impression from the very beginning. Coupled with a spectacular view, the impression will keep growing once you take in the selection of exquisite modern French dishes with Asian influences. The set menus offer myriad options for every course. The dishes tell the story of Chef-Owner Emmanuel Stroobant’s intriguing gastronomic journey as a European who has lived in Asia for half his life. They are fine examples of employing classic French techniques to prepare the freshest quality ingredients with an Asian touch. Sit back, take in the great views of the Marina Bay area, and dig in. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Salaam Bombay
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Tikka Set, Gulab Jamun, Tandoori Roti, Onion Rice
data.ABOUT: A salutation to Bombay and the spirit it represents, Salaam Bombay’s lovingly crafted menu features quintessential Bombay street food. Inspired by and reminiscent of the bustling Khau Galli in Churchgate, the restaurant offers an authentic Indian fine dining experience with a Bombay twist at Fusionopolis.Choose from Vegetarian, Chicken, Mutton, Chicken Tikka and Biryani sets for a filling and tasty meal. For those with a lighter appetite, go for bread options which include a wide variety of Tandoori Roti and Naan, served in a variety of savoury combinations.Offering a host of delightful promotions all year round, try the affordable lunch set options, which come with a complimentary drink of your choice. Dine with friends to get the most out of this lunchtime promotion with the enticing offer of one free set with every five sets purchased. Promotions are subject to changes every month.Happy endings at Salaam Bombay include traditional North and South Indian favourites such as Gulab Jamun and Kheer. Opt for a delicious plate of fried balls soaked in saffron flavoured sugar syrup or a bowl of basmati rice pudding for a true taste of Bombay. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Salted & Hung
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Abalone, Truffle, Aged Turbot, Japanese Wagyu, El Toro Orchard
data.PRESS RELEASE:
