Contemporary Australian restaurant, Salted & Hung presents an all-new Tasting Menu that revolves around the creative use of forgotten parts, from skins to bones, protein to innards, with not a single by-product put to waste. True to Chef Drew’s personal cooking philosophy of Minimal Wastage, the menu encapsulates the essence of Sustainable Cooking where every part of a single produce is pushed to its maximum potential.Diners are transported to a utopia of Sustainable Cuisine, starting from the table setting with a cutlery holder made from recycled abalone shells; to a pictorial guide detailing how each by-product are used, and lastly, the fine flavours from Chef Drew’s enthralling take on sustainable cooking.
Drew grew up on his family farm near Brisbane, Australia where it first ignited his passion for cooking. He spent most of his childhood working the farm and attributes his cooking style and philosophy to his time at the farm. Coupled with hard work, passion, and dedication to his craft, Drew’s personal cooking philosophy of Minimal Wastage forms the cornerstone of Salted & Hung.
The 7 & 10 course menu showcases Chef Drew’s clever manoeuvre of ingredients and his vision for a Sustainable kitchen.
The signature dish on the menu is the Aged Turbot served on a wooden board with three elements, namely the ‘Turbot’, ‘Turbot Tea Broth’ and ‘Turbot Liver Vin Jaune’ sauce. The 5-days aged Turbot is stuffed with Mushroom Duxelles that has been slow-cooked for 8 hours. The skin and turbot trimmings will be fermented into a garam that is later used to season the fish. The dish is then finished off with a sauce made from the Turbot liver and Vin Jaune. Lastly, the turbot bones are hung and dried for 14 days in preparation for its role in making a dashi broth, along with local herbs and flowers lending an aromatic flavour to the dashi tea. These three elements will come together when presented tableside by our server.
Next, the Kagoshima A4 Wagyu presents a sirloin steak grilled over Japanese Bincho-tan paired with carrots. The carrots presented on the dish are prepared in a process that spans over 24 hours. First, the carrots are confit in excess beef fat from the Wagyu, then slow-cooked, dried and rehydrated with beef sauce. The rest of the carrot trimmings goes into making a smoked carrot ketchup. Lastly, the sauces finishing touches consists of a charcoal powder derived from onion and leek trimmings, and pear and shiitake mushroom reduction made from vegetable trimmings.
The final pièce de resistance El Toro Orchard is Chef Drew’s tribute to his family farm in Stanthorpe, Queensland. The farm is founded in 1945 and tended by generations of the Nocente family. The orchard mainly bears Granny Smith apples, Gala apples and Red Delicious apples. The dessert presents an Apple Tartin that resembles an apple dropped on the Orchard ground. The Apple Tartin is caramelised and compressed with cider, and filled with apple jam. The dessert is paired with chocolate twigs and mascarpone ice-cream.
The Tasting Menu is available for dinner from Tuesdays to Sundays. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Salvo by Pasta Fresca
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Fries Parmigiano, Marinara, Amatriciana, Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
Made for those constantly on the go, Salvo by Pasta Fresca serves quality Italian food in a fast casual setting.

Choose to chill out at one of its two alfresco areas with bar bites and alcoholic beverages. Wherever you choose to dine, sit back and enjoy a plate of homemade fresh pasta in a welcoming and friendly setting. Crafted with love from Italy, the menu features a variety of antipasto, bar bites, pasta, pizza, and desserts alongside a huge selection of fine wines. 

Start by exciting your taste buds with a gigantic platter of Truffle Fries Parmigiano. Truffle fans are in for a treat with this plateful of truffle goodness. Tossed with truffle oil and topped with a smattering of shredded cheese, the deep fried shoestring potato fries are crispy and make for mouthfuls of truffle delight. 

Customise your delectable bowl of pasta with your choice of stuffed, long or short pasta and one of the many sumptuous sauces on offer. An irresistible choice for seafood lovers, the Marinara is a splendid mix of prawns, squids and mussels fresh from the ocean. (Oct 2020)

data.title: San Laksa Steamboat
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bamboo Clams, Fresh Scallops, Seafood Steamboat
data.ABOUT:
Located on the first floor of a standalone building near VivoCity mall, this hidden gem of a restaurant serves up a hearty steamboat with a delectable laksa broth. The star of this restaurant is the laksa soup -- a rich and spicy concoction that comes with an extra bowl of laksa leaves for you to add as you wish. While it’s tempting to slurp up the gravy on its own, San Laksa Steamboat offers a wide variety of fresh seafood, vegetables, and meat for you to amp up your hot pot experience. 

Start with local vegetables such as kang kong, Chinese lettuce, and a mixed platter of mushrooms to infuse sweetness into the soup. Love cheese? The cheese tofu is a popular item here, where a square of fermented beancurd hides a lovely, cheesy middle. And no laksa soup can be complete without an order of tau pok — the spongy beancurd skin is the perfect way to sop up all the richness of the laksa broth. 

For meats, try the fresh prawns or wafer-thin slices of pork collar. Diners who prefer more seafood in their hot pot can opt for the fresh toman fillet. Round up a scrumptious dinner experience with an order of handmade minced meatballs, laced with tiny bits of water chestnut for that added crunch. (Jun 2019)

data.title: San Yuan Ge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Tofu with Salad Sauce, Steamed Fish in Chef’s Special Broth, Grilled Fish in Spicy Sauce with Dried Chili,  Baked Coffee Pork Ribs with Sliced Almonds
data.ABOUT:
For a sumptuous seafood feast, head over to San Yuan Ge. Located in Jurong, this family-friendly Chinese restaurant turns out fresh seafood cooked expertly over an open grill. Start the meal on a high note with signature dishes such as the Crispy Tofu with Salad Sauce, where soft tofu is lightly-crumbed and fried to a delicious golden-brown. 

Fish is a must-order at San Yuan Ge, where you pick from a selection of red snapper, red grouper, and dragon grouper. Savour your choice catch steamed Teochew-style, or in Chef’s special broth. For grilled fish, pick from sea bass or barramundi fillet. Popular sauce choices include a Chef Special Spicy Sauce tossed with dried chilli, soya bean, and peanut, as well as a Signature Assam Sauce to go with ladyfingers, pineapple, and onion. Besides seafood, San Yuan Ge also caters to meat lovers with speciality dishes such as Baked Coffee Pork Ribs with Sliced Almonds. The fork-tender ribs are perfumed with the aromatic scent of coffee, while the nutty slivers add some crunch to each bite. Wash it all down with cups of hot Chinese tea, or a mug of icy cold beer. (May 2019)

data.title: SandBank
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Buffet, Modern European, Italian, Australian, Fusion, International, Seafood, British, Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Charcoal Grilled Chicken Leg, Fish & Chips, Charcoal Grilled US Black Angus Ribeye, Charcoal Grilled Sausage Platter, Verdura Pizza, BBQ Pulled Pork Burger
data.ABOUT:
Soak up the sea-side views and beach atmosphere at East Coast park from this casual family gastropub. While the interiors are handsome and look like a classic, no-frills sports bar, the outside is pure Singapore with sun, surf, and a 15 metres long plunge pool for kids that lends the joint a fun, beach resort feel. Perfect for families, or anyone on the beach looking to tuck into its selection of generous Western plates and cocktails.
Think meaty sharing plates straight off the kitchen’s nifty charcoal grill, like a crisp-skinned charcoal-grilled chicken leg, or pleasantly charred US Black Angus Ribeye with roasted whole garlic, caramelized onions, and sweet pommery mustard. If in doubt, opt for a platter, like the Grilled Sausage Platter featuring chorizo, Italian sausages, and beef sausages with gherkins and zingy mustard. The signature SandBank Fish & Chips, made with battered seabass and served with fries and homemade Asian-inspired tartare sauce, makes the perfect beach-side lunch. If it’s a group situation, grab a few pizzas and spoil yourselves with flavours like the BBQ Pulled Pork, which sees chewy dough topped with a tangy and savoury shreds of pork, onions, and pineapples, and the elegant Verdura, a vegetarian number strewn with artichokes, mushroom, pimento, and spinach. On top of all this, look out for its sumptuous international breakfast and brunch buffet on weekends!
The name SandBank has it right: swim ashore for a breather, chow down on some great bites, and then head back out to enjoy the rest of your day out at the coast. (May 2017)

data.title: Sanobar Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: BBQ Butterfish, Chicken Moussaka, Lamb Kofta, Shish Kebab, Grilled Halloumi Cheese, 1001 Mezza, Baklava
data.ABOUT:
An authentic taste of Lebanon. That's what Sanobar Restaurant promises diners who find themselves supping at their bustling restaurant on Bussorah Street, and boy, do they deliver. From familiar staples like falafel, hummus and baklava, to heartier mains like moussaka and lamb kofta, Sanobar Restaurant uses quality ingredients and traditional cooking methods to deliver one memorable meal.
What's more, given that most dishes are grilled, baked, or sautéed in olive oil, you don't have to worry about overindulging.
Their cosy home in one of Singapore's oldest, and most vibrant, cultural neighbourhoods, makes complete sense given their desire to impress with traditional flavours with a touch of modern flair. The al fresco area is perfect for people-spotting, and paves the way for a picturesque meal given the backdrop of one of Singapore's most ornate religious structures, the Sultan Mosque.
Excellent use of traditional flavours and beautiful presentations in an even more spectacular surrounding, Sanobar Restaurant is the perfect place to take a bite out of both delicious nosh and history. (Oct 2017)

data.title: Santa Fe Tex-Mex Grill
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mexican Bean Salad, Chicken Chimichangas, Fish with Mango Salsa Taco, Wagyu-Angus Fajitas, Apple Crumble
data.ABOUT:
What’s the mark of a good tortilla? One that’s lightly crisp around the edges. At Santa Fe Tex Mex, you’ll find excellent tortillas that are turned into tacos, chimichangas (deep-fried burritos), and quesadillas. 

Start the meal with a basket of Tostada Chips with a side of salsa and guacamole to share, and a hearty Mexican Bean Salad. The latter is a generous portion of mixed greens, with plenty of corn kernels, black beans, avocado, and sour cream. For mains, choose from a selection of Tex-Mex specialties. A popular favourite is the Chicken Chimichangas, where diced chicken, cheese, and black beans are stuffed into a flour tortilla that is then deep-fried to a perfect golden-brown. The deep-fried burrito is chock-full of tender meat and stringy cheese, and is pure indulgence with every bite. Also good are the Tacos, which diners get to customise. Pick from hard or soft shell tortillas, then choose your favourite filling — Chimichurri Chicken, Fish with Mango Salsa, Avocado Prawn, Pulled Pork, or Vegetables. The Fish with Mango Salsa is a healthy yet delicious treat, where fork-tender cubes of fish are tossed with a tangy and refreshing mango salsa.  

Craving for a meaty feast? The signature sizzling-hot fajitas will more than satisfy! Choose from the regular Chicken or Beef, or the super-indulgent Wagyu-Angus and Iberico Pork options. Be sure to also save some space for desserts. The Apple Crumble with Vanilla Ice Cream is a classic treat that will win your heart with its buttery crust and sticky-sweet filling. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Sarnies Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pulled Pork Tagliatelle, Aussie Burger, Chicken Parmigiana
data.ABOUT:
Step into Sarnies and one of the first things you’ll notice is the cool, relaxed vibe characteristic of cafés in Melbourne. Opened by Aussie Ben Lee a while back, this trendy establishment has made a name for itself as the place to go for delicious, quality café nosh. Visitors are especially fond of its sandwiches on weekdays, which is no surprise considering the name ‘Sarnies’ is a slang term for sandwich! Little jokes aside though, Sarnies has proven to have as much substance as it has style, and that’s saying quite a bit; the café has received nominations by City Nomads for Best Coffee Roasters and Best Value Restaurant in Singapore, and has been featured in the Singapore Lonely Planet Guide. That’s gotta mean something!
Looking past the accolades straight to the food and drink, coffee addicts will fall in love with the quality brews served here. With coffee beans that are meticulously roasted by a team of talented baristas, and with all coffees made with a double ristretto for more intense flavour, Sarnies firmly establishes itself as the place to go for your caffeine fix. And as for the food, you definitely wouldn’t go wrong with the brunch options, but the dinner menu offers a plethora of mouthwatering delights. So make a reservation at Sarnies – with such a yummy spread available at this café, you’d be hard-pressed to get a seat without one! (Mar 2020)

data.title: Saturday House
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cheesy Baked Mushroom Toast, Grilled Pork Collar, Bacon Cheese Mushrooms, Marmite Mid-Joint Wings
data.ABOUT:
A cosy establishment along Upper Paya Lebar Road, Saturday House brings the concept of weekend getaways to life. A bistro, bar and cafe in one, it boasts a delectable selection of western and local fusions. 

Perfect for brunch, the Cheesy Baked Mushroom Toast is served with mushrooms and topped off with a melted blend of parmesan and mozzarella cheese. For non-cheese lovers, a great alternative would be the Grilled Pork Collar. Sinfully tasty, the pork collar is lightly char-grilled, yielding a tender bite that packs a punch of flavour. The Bacon Cheese Mushrooms is another noteworthy dish. Lightly battered, the crispy exterior of the fried mushroom gives a satisfying crunch to reveal generous amounts of stuffing of bacon bits and cheese hidden inside. Indeed, the classic combination of bacon and cheese never fails to disappoint! 

Don’t leave without trying the Marmite Mid-Joint Wings. Created with finesse, this dish is a huge hit among diners with the subtle taste of marmite flawlessly complementing the wings. Without a doubt, Saturday House is the place to be if you are on the hunt for good food and good times. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Saveur (Purvis)
data.Hours: Tue-Sun: 12-3pm (Food Last Order: 2:30pm), 5-10pm (Food Last Order: 9:30pm)Closed Monday
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: French wines, Duck confit, Saveur Pasta, Foie Gras, Panna Cotta
data.ABOUT: In case you don't remember a time before Saveur, French cuisine was almost synonymous with fine dining back in the day, so you can bet we sat up and took notice once this wallet-friendly restaurant burst onto the scene. Don't be too quick to dismiss the quality of the food before you tuck in though, the multitude of classical techniques used to create their particular brand of contemporary French fare are a testament to the professional training of the chefs.Begin with a starter of Saveur's Pasta before moving on to main plates like Beef Bourguignon, Chicken Roulade, and the signature Duck Confit. Rounding off the relatively compact menu are sweet treats like the Pistachio Panna Cotta which sound too good to pass up. It's difficult to believe this eatery had their first debut in a humble coffeeshop! Saveur's one-two punch of French flavours, tweaked to suit the local palate, and reasonable prices will leave you salivating for more. It's no wonder, then, that lines can sometimes extend out the doors. (Feb 2016)

data.title: Sawadee Thai Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 9 Tan Quee Lan Street#01-01Tan Quee Lan SuitesSingapore (188098)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Thai Mango Salad, Thai Coconut Chicken Soup, Thai Style Otah on Clayplate, Mango Sticky Rice, Spicy Steamed Sea Bass, Thai Stuffed Chicken Wings, Fried Fish Maw with Beansprouts, Sawadee Olive Fried Rice, Panaeng Red Curry Roast Duck
data.ABOUT:
From the elegant decor, done up in swathes of gold with touches of wood and bamboo, to the jazzed-up Thai music in the background, and the spicy aroma wafting out from the kitchen, everything here evokes the charming Land of Smiles. Sawadee Thai Cuisine has been serving up traditionally-prepared Thai food since 2000, turning fresh ingredients cooked á la minute into comforting, flavourful Thai plates.
All the familiar favourites are here. Whether your Thai fix is a plateful of crispy chicken wings stuffed with minced meat, or a fresh seabass lightly steamed and dressed in a piquant sauce, or a fiery Thai mango salad, this place will hit all your sweet spots. Save room for the mother of all sweet spots though. Living up to the famous Thai sweet tooth is a luxurious durian sticky rice dessert that’s made with super-fragrant Mao Shan Wang durians. Not to be missed! Relive all your favourite Bangkok memories here, where the food is hearty and the vibe is friendly and upbeat. (Sep 2016)

data.title: Sbagliato Kitchen & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Burrata & Parma Ham, Special Italian Antipasto, Lasagna, Spaghetti Vongole, Tonnarelli Ink Squid with Seafood, Polpette Al Sugo, Calamari Friti, Arancini
data.ABOUT:
Fun dining and fine drinking is the name of the game at this new Italian spot. With a menu bursting with authentic, affordable classics and plenty of tipples to go with your meal, this is the perfect spot for dinner and drinks with friends.

While all the pastas here are done well, the Penne Alla Carbonara deserves special mention for seamlessly blending pecorino cheese and egg yolk into a creamy mixture that is flavourful without being too rich. The pizzas are large enough for sharing, and the Margherita is one of our favourites. Made with fresh mozzarella and basil, the dish is deliciously simple and goes perfectly with a glass of Premium Red from the drinks menu.

Seafood lovers will appreciate the Zuppa Di Cozze, fresh black mussels in a white wine sauce. The sauce is light and luscious, and goes well with the succulent meat from the mussels. Mop up the remaining sauce with the oven toasted bread that the dish is served with. For a sweet end to the meal, dig into the Tiramisu. Soft savoiardi and creamy Italian mascarpone are the centerpieces of this treat.

Whether you’re new to Italian cuisine or a seasoned expert, you’ll feel welcome in this friendly restaurant.

data.title: Se7enth
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 6 Shenton Way#07-01Oakwood Premier AMTD SingaporeOUE Downtown 1Singapore (068809) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oakwood SE7ENTH Beef Burger, Alaskan King Crab Seafood Platter with Truffle Risotto, Oakwood Premier Nasi Lemak, Curry Cod Fish and Chips, Angus Ribeye Black pepper Hor Fun, Crispy Chicken Wings with Truffle Maple Drizzle
data.ABOUT:
The phrase ‘seventh heaven’ is often used to describe a state of pure euphoria and joy. We don’t want to exaggerate but that’s what a meal at Se7enth Restaurant feels like. Under the masterful hands of acting Executive Chef, Gary Lim, SE7ENTH promises diners a relaxing evening with dishes centred around classic, contemporary Western and Asian fare.
Situated within Oakwood Premier AMTD Singapore, SE7ENTH is a 74-seater restaurant perfect for social gatherings and business meetings. Tucked away on level 7 and hidden from the hustle and bustle of the central business district, SE7ENTH is a tranquil oasis offering modern international cuisine.
For diners who relish cuisines inspired by the West, the Alaskan King Crab Seafood Platter with Truffle Risotto, a show-stopping galore of snow crab legs, mussels and prawns baked in garlic and herbs and served with a lush bowl of truffle risotto, will delight palates. The Salmon En Papillote with Wild Mushroom Velouté, baked salmon on a tender bed of zucchini and eggplants nestled in a paper pouch, is a delicious way to start a meal.
Asian cuisine lovers can reminisce a trip to Japan with Wagyu Katsu sandwich featuring tender breaded Wagyu striploin steak medium done, sandwiched between grilled brioche. Alternatively, savor one of Chef Gary’s specialties, the Oakwood Premier Nasi Lemak, an elevated Asian delight of sambal king river prawns, mussels, crispy turmeric chicken, fried egg and fragrant coconut milk-infused rice. Making a bold and fiery entrance is rendition of a locals’ favorite, the Mala Xiang Guo, a spiced treasure trove of king river prawns, scallops, black mussels, squid, quail eggs and noodles. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Sea Scent
data.Cuisine: Malaysian, Italian, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Cajun, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 10 Bukit Chermin RoadSwimming Pool AnnexeKeppel ClubSingapore (109918)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Unami Chilli Chai Poh Fries, Seafood Bisque, Seafood White Bee Hoon, Crunchy Fried Chicken Burger
data.ABOUT:
A relaxing sanctuary for those looking for a laid-back and palatable dining experience, Sea Scent at Keppel club is located right at the border of Singapore’s Southern shoreline. Delight in a satisfying meal anytime of the day with the restaurant’s plethora of delectable menu options. 

The perfect dining venue for a romantic date by the sea or casual weekend family gatherings, Sea Scent’s menu is a carefully curated mix of Western and Asian cuisine suited for all. Tuck into a fragrant plate of Seafood White Bee Hoon and enjoy the tangy noodles elevated by the  infusion of the flavour from the fresh ocean catch.

For the little ones, indulge them in a hearty serving of Crunchy Fried Chicken Burger. Sandwiched between two fluffy brioche buns, the fried chicken is accompanied by coleslaw, lettuce, tomato and a sunny side up. Signature dishes include the Chilli Crab Linguine, Unami chilli Chai Poh Fries, Seafood Bisque and other innovative fusion creations. 

Visit Sea Scent today to feel the soft breeze from the sea and unwind while savouring dishes finely crafted by expert in-house chefs. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Sea Tripod @ Garden
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Australian Jade Tiger Abalone, Razor Clams, Sea Bass, American Beef Short Plate, Fresh Lala, Shark Bone Porridge, Fresh Scallops, Fresh Sea Urchin
data.ABOUT:
There’s really no doubt about what’s on offer here from the minute you step through the doors and into a charming fisherman’s fantasy: nets strewn from the ceiling, storm lamps, and all manner of nautical detail, and most arresting of all, the rich aroma of gently-cooking fresh seafood that permeates the air. Here, they believe that steaming is the best way to cook seafood while retaining the most of its nutrients and flavours, and have developed a novel method that combines the theatre of table-side cooking with the advantages of steaming.

You choose from an extensive menu of fresh seafood, ranging from super premium sea-critters like Australian Jade Tiger Abalone, the house signature, oysters, and sea urchin, to less sinful options like prawns, bamboo clams, and sea bass. On top of seafood, red meat and vegetables turn this into a full food-pyramid situation, though it’s the seafood that truly makes the meal, especially as the taste of the ocean gradually flavours a tureen of porridge sitting underneath the steamer. Perfect for groups looking for a super festive dinner, dinner here is filled with rich oceany aromas and umami flavours in your mouth, making this one of the most exciting seafood experiences in town. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Seasonal Tastes
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 12 Marina ViewLevel 32Asia Square Tower 2The Westin SingaporeSingapore (018961)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bruschetta with Roasted Tomato, Steamed Arctic Char with Wolfberry, Ginger and Choy Sum, Grilled Spring Chicken, Hainanese Chicken Rice
data.ABOUT: Situated on Level 32, Seasonal Tastes is The Westin Singapore’s signature all-day dining venue offers a live interactive kitchen concept to provide a truly personalized dining experience. Boasting a selection of contemporary international and local cuisines, Seasonal Tastes promises a truly gastronomic experience complete with panoramic views of Singapore’s Marina Bay and the South China Sea through its floor-to-ceiling windows. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Sen Of Japan
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 2 Bayfront Avenue#01-86The Shoppes at Marina Bay SandsSingapore (018972)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Filet Mignon Tataki, Black Cod Soy, Prawn & Vegetable Tempura Combination, Sashimi Special Platter
data.ABOUT:
Sen of Japan is a modern Japanese restaurant and bar with a carefully curated menu using a dazzling medley of premium quality ingredients.
The meaning of ‘Sen’ in Japanese is fresh, we believe that the quality of each dish lies in the source of ingredients – ‘to be fresh’.
Sen of Japan aims to bring together key elements of traditional Japanese cuisine combined with modern flavours and techniques for a sophisticated flavour in every bite.
The intimate settings and delectable dishes are accompanied by a spectacular view of the Singapore skyline for a memorable dining experience that is a feast for both the eyes and taste buds – perfect for both business and leisure meals. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Sens Sushi & Grill
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Unagi and Sashimi Set, Tempura Udon Set, Ebi Katsu Ni Set
data.PRESS RELEASE: SENS – defining flavour in Japanese — will whisk you away to Japan with its wide repertoire of contemporary Japanese cuisine including sashimi, sushi and teppanyaki. This unique dining concept in Singapore showcases cuisine from the different regions of Japan and redefines quality dining for all palates. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Seoul Kitchen
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Belly, Pork Collar, Korean Sweet Soy Chicken, Kimchi Soup
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Seoul Kitchen is a charming and casual neighborhood restaurant that specialises Korean cuisine.  Located along Sembawang Road, the eatery offers a specialty menu, traditional BBQ Buffet and crispy Korean fried chicken buffet. 

For the BBQ buffet, the free-flow meat variety comes with pork belly, pork collar, chicken, spicy pork and beef.  As for the Korean fried chicken buffet, it also comes with a choice of stir-fried Korean glass noodle or rice balls, Kimchi Stew or Army Stew. There is a free-flow side dish buffet bar with 6 different kinds of side dishes and vegetables. 

Seoul Kitchen takes pride in serving authentic Korean food with the lowest price they can offer! So if you're craving comfort food in a homely and laid back setting, instead of traveling all the way to South Korea, look no further than Seoul Kitchen. (May 2019)

data.title: Sessions
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab with Man Tou, Frozen Yoghurt Tower
data.ABOUT:
Looking for a taste of home among the international crowd at Resorts World Sentosa? Look no further than Sessions, a casual dining establishment serving up classic Singaporean dishes like Chilli Crab and Cereal Crayfish. With Sweet Sessions, Crab Sessions, and Cooking Sessions, this 3-in-1 restaurant is sure to have you spoiled for choice.

The Chilli Crab with Man Tou is a must-try. Based on the hawker classic, Sessions’ rendition is made with fresh crab and features a thick gravy flavoured with red chilli and plenty of tomato sauce for a well-rounded taste. Go in with your hands and mop up excess gravy with the delightfully fluffy Man Tou buns. Another usual hawker suspect is the Cereal Crayfish. An exquisite take on Cereal Prawn, this dish features the larger and juicier crayfish rolled in butter cereal and deep fried to golden perfection. 

There is also a range of delicious vegetable dishes on offer for diners who wish to enjoy a ‘zi-char’ style meal. The Stir-Fried Belachan Kang Kong gets our vote as it is cooked to tender perfection. The belachan gives the dish some heat and salty flavour, and it goes well with a bowl of steamed rice. (March 2019)

data.title: Señor Taco (Clarke Quay)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Guacamole & Chips, Fish Ceviche, Beef Tongue Quesadillas, Pork Burritos, Chicken Fajita Tacos, Corona-ritas, Sangría
data.ABOUT:
Say hola to Singapore’s most authentic Mexican eatery, Señor Taco! Nestled in the heart of Clarke Quay, this Mexican-style cantina serves up zesty street eats all while a live Latin band gets you pumped up for a food fiesta like no other.
Doling out dishes like Chicken Fajita Tacos (with tortillas made from their very own tortilla factory right here in Singapore), Beef Tongue Quesadillas, Pork Burritos, and tons more from the kitchen, it’s safe to assume these amigos know a few things about authentic Mexican food! Serving these mains alongside a variety of fresh and spicy salsas that’ll have your tastebuds going loco, get ready for a five-alarm flavour explosion that only one of their signature Corona-ritas can put out! (May 2016)

data.title: Shabestan
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Muhamara, Kash-e-Bademjan, Kufte Parsi, Shah Pasand Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Shabestan means a place of rest for weary travellers, and this oasis of deliciousness couldn't be any more aptly named. Nestled in a corner of Robertson Quay along a well-trodden path, Shabestan offers classic Persian cuisine but with a decisive nod to local palettes: less grease yet still perfumed with exotic, but never overwhelming, spices. Dine al-fresco and people-watch, or head indoors to enjoy the friendly ambience of this culinary gem.
That Shabestan's Executive Chef Hamid Hosseini obsession with fine ingredients is apparent - there is nothing artificial in the flavours that combine to make each dish. Traditional grilled meats are marinated in fresh herbs; while seasonal vegetables meld with spices so perfectly that your taste buds will thank you for the experience.
A little birdie tells us that Middle Eastern royalty have dined here on more than one occasion. We believe it - the food is wholesome perfection. Juxtaposed against the nightly belly dancing show, dining here embodies a delightful blend of naughty and nice. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Shahi Maharani
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 252 North Bridge Road#03-21BRaffles City Shopping CentreSingapore (179103)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Chicken, Lamb Chops Shah Jehani, Tawa Jheenga, Sabzi Sizzler, Kulfi, Gulab Jamun, Kesari Phirini
data.ABOUT:
Since opening in 1997, Shahi Maharani has won countless awards and accolades for its fine cuisine, and judging from our own dining experience, each one is richly deserved. Shahi Maharani aims to provide a dining experience reminiscent of North Indian Royalty. Everything from its décor, to its food and service, will ensure that your trip to the restaurant is undoubtedly fit for a king.
Upon entering its ornate doors, you will be enveloped by a deep burgundy and rich gold interior, with traditional glass lamps and classical Indian music. The traditional North Indian food is truly outstanding and will please even the seasoned gourmand. To those less initiated, the warm and helpful servers will be more than happy to recommend dishes, and even wine pairings to go with your meal. Topped off with its convenient location in Raffles City, a trip to Shahi Maharani is certainly not to be missed. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Shang Palace
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 22 Orange Grove RoadLobby Level, Tower WingShangri-La HotelSingapore (258350)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Smoked Fish Fillet with Five Spice, Deep-Fried Crab Claw Coated with Shrimp Paste, Roasted Peking Duck, Deep-Fried Spare Ribs with Salt & Pepper, Braised Crispy Egg Noodles with Eight Treasures, Shang Palace Salty Mung Bean Pastry
data.ABOUT: Located in Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore, Shang Palace has held a reputation as one of the foremost Chinese restaurants in Singapore for 50 years. The flagship of 36 Shang Palace restaurants worldwide, it is helmed by veteran Chef Mok Kit Keung, who brought Shang Palace Kowloon to its second Michelin star in 2011.Being an expert on Cantonese cuisine, Chef Mok brings to the table a delectable harmony of old and new; including 'lost' dishes, his award-winning signatures, and a selection of innovative creations inspired by his travels. The restaurant's cooking has no added MSG and features more than 60 sauces made in-house. Combining stunning décor and the pinnacle of Asian service and hospitality, with impeccable Cantonese dining, Shang Palace remains the gastronomic icon in Shangri-La's international group of hotels. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Shang Social
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 78 Airport Boulevard#01-219 to 222Jewel Changi AirportSingapore (819666)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Signature Honey Pork Belly, Sichuan Kung Pao Prawn, Deep-Fried Boneless Chicken filled with Fried Glutinous Rice, Braised Black Marbled Pork and Eight Treasures Tofu Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Located in the spectacular JEWEL @ Changi Airport, Shang Social marks the esteemed Shangri-La Group’s first standalone restaurant venture. Diners can expect a luxe dining environment, top-notch service, and an exciting menu. The food here is inspired by three main cuisines, namely Cantonese, Huaiying, and Sichuan. Fittingly, there are three dining enclaves here, dedicated to formal and communal dining, as well as drinks. 

The Signature Honey Pork Belly is one of their most popular items, and for good reason. The meat is deliciously juicy, and is enhanced by the sweet smokiness of the marinade and grill. The skin of the pork belly is delightfully crisp, but the meat inside is melt-in-your-mouth tender. There is also a wide variety of seafood items. The Sichuan Kung Pao Prawn is made with a generous portion of spice for that mouth-numbing spice that Singaporeans have come to love. For something to share in a group of 4 and above, try the Deep-Fried Boneless Chicken filled with Fried Glutinous Rice, and Braised Black Marbled Pork. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Shanghai Tang Exclusive Musical Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 407 Havelock Road#01-01Furama Riverfront HotelAnnex BuildingSingapore (169634)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Signature Stewed Seafood with Egg White, 
Signature Pork Ribs with Homemade Sauce, 
Japanese Wasabi Prawns, 
Stir-Fried Prawns with Pumpkin Sauce
data.ABOUT: Located in Annex, Furama Riverfront Hotel, the 13,000-square-foot Shanghai Tang Exclusive Musical Restaurant serves a wide range of delectable Chinese dishes. Choose from a wide selection of authentic and delicious Chinese dishes, ranging from Cantonese to Hai Nan. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Shashlik Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 545 Orchard Road#06-19Far East Shopping CentreSingapore (238883)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Blinis & Caviar, Borscht, French Onion Soup, Eggs Millionaire, Beef Shashlik, Oxtail Stew, Beef Stroganoff, Chicken à la Kiev, Baked Alaska
data.ABOUT:
Hearts across the island broke as news of Shashlik's closure spread, but then the classic Hainanese-run Western restaurant announced it would re-open under a younger generation of owners, while retaining the old world charm and staff that had kept customers happy for decades.
The endearingly twee vibe here harkens back to a day of refinement, when going out for a meal was a special occasion, and where personal, friendly service was a big part of the meal. But at Shashlik, it's also the comforting flavours that have kept customers returning over the years, starting with the pillowy dinner rolls and butter that greet you at the table, and following through to entrees like French Onion Soup, a meaty beef broth enriched with caramelized onions and a crusty cheese croute, or endearingly 60s appetizers like Egg Millionaire - chopped boiled egg, bacon bits, and parmesan gratin served in little egg cups. There's even Blinis & Caviar, served with sour cream, if you're feeling especially indulgent before your main.
We'd hold back on the appetizers though, because the shashlik, or meat grilled on skewers served straight up at the table, is very hearty. There's the classic Shashlik of Beef, juicy tenderloin rich with the flavours of a 24-hour marinade, as well as pork, chicken, and lamb. If you like your meat cooked more conventionally, there's also grilled steaks. But one of our favourite ways of eating meat here is in one of Shashlik's classic old-world stews: hearty, rustic Oxtail Stew and creamy Beef Stroganoff, perfect with some crusty bread or rice, and a heart full of nostalgia. For dessert: Baked Alaska, no question.
The food here may seem a little too quaint for the 21st century, but really that's part of the charm, and a rapidly disappearing one at that. So book a table while you can! (Apr 2017)

data.title: Shelby Cafe & Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Fusion, Seafood, British, Vegetarian Friendly, Caribbean, Cafe, Pizza
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Whiskey, Wines, Cocktails
data.ABOUT:
A bespoke hidden jewel located within the heart of China Square, Shelby Cafe & Bar sports a unique frontage that invites diners into a warm ambience decked in plush custom banquettes and artsy features. Combining the vibes of post war London and the 1920s era, Shelby Cafe features curated craft food and beverage cocktails, premium line wines and the finest service for an indulgent dining experience.

Offering a classic range of dishes from a selected Eastern culture, the bar and cafe’s distinguishable menu includes a number of carefully curated menu items from one particular cuisine. Encompassing special dishes from multiple nations and differing cultures throughout the entire Asian continent, Shelby Cafe and Bar delicious offerings bring you on a gastronomic journey throughout Asia for a diverse dining experience. Elevate your meal with a complementary pairing of whiskey or wine from the bar’s huge selection of fine wines from all over the region. 

Featuring pan-asian cuisine for a tasty experience alongside insights and vibes of post war London, come down to Shelby Cafe and Bar today for a great feast. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Shen Ji Tong Guo Chuan Chuan Xiang 沈记铜锅串串香
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum, Steamboat
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Fish Skin, Shen Ji Pan Fried Dumpling, Prawn Egg Fried Rice
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away in Broadway Plaza, Shen Ji Tong Guo Chuan Chuan Xiang is a hidden gem in Ang Mo Kio that serves authentic soups with unique flavours such as butter mala, as well as signature hotpots and skewers.

The ideal place for gatherings and family dinners, Shen Ji Tong Guo Chuan Chuan Xiang often rolls out promotions and packages that give more bang for your buck. You won’t be able to resist their skewers that are sold for merely $0.20 each!

Start your meal with the restaurant’s cold cucumber dish, a delicious traditional Chinese delicacy while waiting for your soup to boil. From pork belly to homemade prawn paste and cockles, the restaurant provides the freshest ingredients by ensuring that they are prepared daily.

Dim Sum lovers will definitely be wowed by a wide variety of options such as pan-fried dumplings, spicy wanton and the restaurant's signature fried fish skin. Be it a reunion dinner or birthday lunch, the array of side dishes paired with the restaurant’s flavourful soup and tasty skewers makes it the perfect place for any meal. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Shima Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sushi Moriawase, Beef Tenderloin, Ise Ebi, Salmon Belly, Oyster, Garlic Rice, Tochigi, Foie Gras, Lamb Tenderloin
data.ABOUT:
The grand-daddy of teppanyaki restaurants in Singapore, Shima has been firing up Japanese food à la minute at the stately Goodwood Hotel since 1980. The table-side acrobatics of its Japan-trained chefs has become a part of the meal as the delicious flash-cooked dishes made from fresh ingredients. The menu has since expanded to include sushi and sashimi dishes to go along with the hot plates, satisfying that Japanese cuisine craving of yours under one roof.
The classic Teppanyaki menu features a range of premium meats cooked before your eyes to perfection. Fatty tenderloin of Wagyu, chicken thigh, buttery foie gras, live lobster, and tender salmon belly sizzle on the pan, releasing their delicious aromas as a teaser to the meal. Mounds of garlicky fried rice and fresh vegetables follow, mopping up the meaty juices for a taste of perfection. If you want to beef up your meal, order some hand rolls that are studded with everything from chopped tuna belly to braised unagi, or get a platter of sashimi to ramp up all those umami flavours swirling about in your mouth. If you hate choosing, meals here come in elegant Kaiseki-style sets, where you let the chefs prepare the meal at a luxurious pace that will leave you bursting at the seams. Everyone loves a good, smoky teppanyaki dinner, and here you get to pair that with sushi for a complete Japanese night out! (Jan 2017)

data.title: Shimbashi Soba
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Soba Duck Tsukemen Seiro, Chawanmushi, Sukiyaki Udon, Soba Tempura Seiro
data.ABOUT:
Soba lovers of Singapore, rejoice! This spot was made just for you. With over 40 varieties of noodles handmade fresh daily, this is the perfect place to indulge your cravings, outside of Japan of course. Sample everything - from the refreshingly cold soba in sauce to hearty warm soba - and pick your favourite, if you can. From classics like Tempua Seiro Soba and Ten Chirashi Soba, to an exclusive vegetarian menu, there’s something here for everyone. The noodles are made with only pesticide-free buckwheat grown under the clear blue skies of Tasmania, and according to the “Santate” principle - freshly milled, made, and cooked -  so diners can rest assured that their meals are of the highest quality.

The Soba Duck Tsukemen Seiro is a must-try, and for good reason. Served with a generous helping of noodles, a soft boiled egg, and flavourful duck broth topped with mushrooms and tofu, this is the perfect meal to enjoy with a glass of sake. The little things are just as well-executed as the mains. The Chawanmushi is an instagram-friendly dish of egg topped with a traditional fishcake and Ikura. The Sukiyaki Udon is another excellent option. Hearty and served with thin, perfectly-cooked slices of meat, this is a great choice for diners looking for a filling lunch. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Shin Kushiya
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Sat-Sun, Eve of PH & PH: 11:30am-4pm (Last Order: 3:30pm), 5-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kushiyaki, Trio of Sashimi Favourites, Flamed Salmon Sashimi Maki, Yakitori Kushiyaki Set, Buta Kushiyaki Set, Unagi Don Set, Chicken Shogayaki Don Set, Asari Butteryaki, Ikura Chawanmushi
data.ABOUT:
Simple and authentic, Shin Kushiya serves up affordable, quality Japanese cuisine in an elegant and contemporary setting. As one of the first Japanese restaurants to introduce the Kushiyaki dining concept in Singapore, their signature Kushiyaki skewers are prepared with culinary craftsmanship of the highest calibre, producing mouth-watering skewers that are both flavourful and appetising. It's also worth a mention that Shin Kushiya uses imported Bincho Charcoal from Japan that's known for the clean-charcoal smokiness it imparts to food during grilling.
The minute you step into this quaint Japanese eatery, the minimalistic interior is a dead giveaway that it's no-frills and all-flavours here. Go for the signature Kushiyaki - with over 50 different types to choose from, there's no denying that these tantalising sticks made from fresh and quality seafood, meat, and vegetables are sure winners. Shin Kushiya doesn't stop at skewers either; enjoy all-time crowd-pleasers such as Sashimi, Sushi, Maki Donburi, and many more. (Mar 2017)

data.title: Shin Minori Japanese Restaurant @ Katong Square
data.Hours: Mon-Sat & Eve of PH: 12pm-2:30pm (Last Order 2:15pm), 6:15-10:15pm (Last Order: 9:45pm)Sun & PH: 12:15-2:45pm (Last Order 2:30pm), 6:15-10:15pm (Last Order: 9:45pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Maguro Sashimi, Kani Tempura, Zaru Soba, Spider Temaki, Ebi Tempura Maki, Harvest Maki Roll
data.ABOUT:
Shin Minori is all about value in Japanese dining. Offering all sorts of cravings from sushi to tempura, this is your one stop shop for Japanese feasting without the splurge.
Best known for its a la carte buffet option, Shin Minori is ideal for group gatherings or family dinners, where a variety of palates need to be pleased. Meaning "new harvest" in Japanese, the restaurant features a motif of golden grains blended with traditional Japanese design for a casual yet distinguished atmosphere. The menu indeed showcases the new and noteworthy, with novel selections crafted by the kitchen team to enhance the buffet experience with original tastes.
The buffet menu is an impressive deal, offering tempting slices of raw seafood and rice filled sushi. A pretty parade of hand rolls, or temaki, is also on offer with the Spider Temaki filled crispy soft shell crab often gaining multiple orders. The maki rolls are a rainbow of creative combinations including the Harvest Maki Roll with tempura shrimp and avocado, almond and coconut flakes, and a sweet and tangy mango eel sauce. Supplement your picks with grilled yakimono, airy tempura and more for a complete Japanese smorgasbord that doesn't break the bank. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Shine Bar & Grill
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beauty Collagen Crab Tang Hoon, Seafood Pao Fan, Extreme Spicy Belacan crab, Cereal Oats Sotong
data.ABOUT:
Steamboats and barbecues are food best eaten communally with a big group of friends. Shine Bar & Grill at Raeburn Park reigns as one of the preferred choices to get both BBQ and steamboat fix. Everyone can catch up and banter with each other while waiting for the food to cook.

Order the BBQ combo platter which consists of humongous red leg prawns, flower crab, crayfish, mala marinated chicken and pork, spicy lala with vermicelli, scallop with shell, cheesy corn, bacon wrapped with cheese and more. Upgrade to our fish head broth which is well prepared and seasoned with the right sweetness and flavour, and using only the best for the heart of the dish – red snapper fish. (Jan 2021)

data.title: ShinnSato Japanese Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sashimi Platter, Gindara Cod Fish, Tempura and Soba, Unagi Don, Salmon Don
data.ABOUT:
For a spot of comforting Japanese food in the Kampong Bahru area, head over to Shinnsato. Here, you’ll find favourites such as sashimi, tempura, and hearty donburi. 

For starters, order the Sashimi Platter that comes with a selection of salmon, horse mackerel, maguro (tuna), and swordfish. The slices of fish are fresh and generously cut, perfect with a dab of wasabi and soy sauce. 

For mains, the Gindara Cod Fish is not to be missed. The thick slab of fatty fish is tender and juicy, paired with crisp root vegetables. Fancy something heartier? Tuck into the Tempura and Soba set, which comes with two pieces of deep-fried prawns and vegetables, a Californian roll, and a refreshing plate of cold soba. 

Shinnsato also offers value-for-money lunch sets, with your choice of donburi or soba, along with a side of tempura or sashimi, and a bowl of miso soup. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Shinzo Japanese Cuisine
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chirashi Lunch Set, Take Lunch Omakase, Tokusen Dinner Omakase, Hokkaido Uni, Hotate Foie Gras, Kanpachi Carpaccio and Hokkaido King Crab with Uni Sauce
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Shinzo Japanese Cuisine started in 2013 fueled by a passion to bring affordable high-quality omakase to Singapore. The word Shinzo means heart in Japanese. Having spent more than 39 years honing his skills as a sushi shokunin (sushi artisan), Chef Patrick Tan knows that the best sushi is made from the heart.
Chef Tan takes great pride in making sure he maintains an intimate setting in his sushi bar. He wants every seat in the house to be the best so that guests have full view of their personal chefs in working on their creations. Chef Tan believes that this is one of the highlights of the Shinzo experience. He is a perfectionist who is known for shaping the culture at many renowned fine dining Japanese restaurants in Singapore, including the Sushi Jin by Les Amis Group, Nogawa and Sushi Chiharu.
At Shinzo, one can expect nothing less than the freshest ingredients flown in directly from Japan. Just as the ingredients varies with the seasons in Japan, so does Shinzo’s menu. Chef Tan constantly pushes the envelope of culinary creativity, such as fusing non-Japanese ingredients like foie gras and century egg with traditional Japanese cuisine. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Shiok Garden
data.Cuisine: American, Buffet, Chinese, Seafood, Steamboat, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: BBQ Sambal Stingray, Fish Soup Noodle, Classic Dessert Chendol, Thai Ice Milk Tea
data.ABOUT:
A hotpot and BBQ buffet restaurant that serves up an interesting selection of fresh seafood, ingredients, cooked food and beverages, tuck into a hearty feast of Asian favourites with family and friends here at Shiok Garden. Decorated with elements traditionally found in the early kampung days of Singapore, feed your nostalgia as you savour the best of hotpot and BBQ delights in the restaurant’s cosy interior.
You can’t go wrong with Shiok Garden’s BBQ Sambal Stingray. An all time favourite, this fiery dish is sure to spice up your meal with the in house special sambal that is prepared fresh daily. Taste the fragrance of the localicious sauce with each bite of the soft, succulent stingray that melts in your mouth!
Topped with the freshest evaporated milk and sweetened with just the right amount of sugar, the Thai Ice Milk Tea is the perfect remedy for a hot day. Alternatively, the Avocado Milkshake is a deliciously healthy drink to quench your thirst. Made for rainy days, Shiok Garden also serves up steaming hot bowls of Fish Soup Noodle peppered with crispy flakes for an extra crunch. Wrap up your meal with the Classic Dessert Chendol for a sweet ending to a wonderful meal. (May 2021)

data.title: Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Japanese, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 333 Orchard RoadLevel 35Mandarin Orchard Hotel SingaporeSingapore (238867)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Abalone in Premium Soya Sauce, Mapo Tofu, Chen's Original Spicy Soup Noodle, Roasted Crispy Duck, Barbecued with Honey Glaze, Stir-Fried Wagyu Beef with Green Peppers, Pan Roasted Rack of Lamb, Cold Almond Pudding
data.ABOUT:
Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro at Mandarin Orchard Singapore is the Singapore
debut of Japan’s best loved chain of Szechwan restaurants, Shisen Hanten. It is the
product of a proud culinary legacy that began with the founding of Japan’s first
Szechwan restaurant in 1958 by Chen Kenmin, regarded as the “Father of
Szechwan cuisine in Japan.”
Carrying on the family tradition is his eldest son, Chen Kenichi, nicknamed the
“Szechwan Sage” and acclaimed as one of Japan’s most celebrated iron chefs. It
was Chen Kenichi that expanded the family business, branching out across Japan
and imbuing his personal touch to the Shisen Hanten brand by incorporating fresh
new ideas into the menu offerings.
Now taking centre stage is third-generation Chen Kentaro, Executive Chef of
Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro, and himself a rising star in Japan’s culinary scene.
From the time the restaurant was launched in 2014, Chef Kentaro continues to
demonstrate his mastery of Szechwan cuisine with a menu that celebrates the
signature flavours of Shisen Hanten, alongside traditional Cantonese fare.
Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro was awarded two stars in the MICHELIN Guide
Singapore 2016, 2017 and 2018, making it the highest Michelin-rated Chinese
restaurant in Singapore for three consecutive years. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Shish Mahal Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Aloo Papri Chaat, Fish in Banana Leaf, Tandoori Prawns, Paneer Butter Masala
data.ABOUT:
Shish Mahal is a humble restaurant and bar tucked in Village hotel at Albert Court. Offering some of the best Indian and Nepalese Cuisine, the restaurant’s delicious food options are crafted with traditional organic herbs and spices. Great for families and large groups, this friendly restaurant’s extensive menu showcases the rich Indian and Nepalese culture.

An ultimate place for authentic Indian cuisine, Shish Mahal’s extensive menu features a wide range of vegetarian food that will surely satiate your cravings for healthy, tasty and affordable Indian food. With many years of experience in whipping up special and exotic dishes, the team of chefs at the restaurant are highly skilled and adaptable. Be it a quick and wholesome meal or a tailored menu suitable for fine dining, Shish Mahal is able to provide what your stomach desires. 

Awarded a Michelin Award Winner Best Restaurant 2017 in Singapore, the restaurant’s signature dishes include Indian street food such as Aloo Papri Chaat, Fish in Banana Leaf, and Tandoori Prawns. Come down to Village hotel to taste the best of Indian and Nepalese cuisine for yourself! (Nov 2020)

data.title: Sho Yakitori & Sushi
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tori Momo, Tsukune, Unagi Hitsumabushi, Unagi Maki, Chirashi Bakumori Don
data.ABOUT:
Hidden in Millenia Walk is this gem of a Japanese restaurant that specialises in grilled meat skewers and unagi (eel). Here, the eels are flown in live from Japan weekly — look out for the tanks of live slippery eels — and the chicken used for yakitori is locally-sourced. 

The Tori Momo is a must-try from the yakitori menu. Grilled chicken thigh is tender and juicy, wrapped in a crispy golden skin that adds a delightful crunch to the flavourful meat. Also good is the Tsukune, where the minced chicken meatballs can be enjoyed as is, or with a topping of cheese and mentaiko sauce. Opt for the latter if you’re a fan of umami-rich creamy sauces. 

Unagi dishes are also not to be missed at this joint. The Unagi Hitsumabushi is a great way to enjoy the freshly grilled eel. There are three ways to enjoy this grilled eel speciality — as a bento box of smoky, charred eel atop a bed of rice, with the condiments of wasabi and seaweed, and mixed with a light dashi broth. The meat is soft with a good bite. Wash it all down with an icy glass of Ume Shu, a refreshing mix of shochu, yuzu, and sparkling soda. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Shoukouwa Sushi Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
The Emmanuel Stroobant Group's first venture into Japanese cuisine comes in the form of this intimate 14-seater sushi joint. Perhaps, 'joint' isn't the right word; after all, a restaurant which boasts an austere elegance and a pricey omakase menu deserves more formality. It's a venture with the founder of three Michelin star Sushi Shikon - folks who've been to this Mercer Hotel establishment in Hong Kong will likely remember its jaw-dropping price tag - so excellent Japanese food is to be expected.
Like most Japanese places which take pride in authenticity, ingredients are flown in from Tsukiji Market daily and used to great effect in the Master Chef's impressive array of omakase dishes. Let's just say that wobbling out of Shoukouwa is a possibility once you've finished two appetisers, three assorted sashimi, four cooked dishes, 13 pieces of nigiri sushi, miso soup, Japanese omelette, and dessert. The cooked dishes are great but the stars of the show are, without a doubt, the premium seafood. Slices bear none of that heavy, fishy aroma, but remain slightly salty and very sweet - as all fresh catch should be. If you're looking to be hypnotised by a vast array of dishes made in front of your eyes and impeccably fresh seafood, look no further than this incredibly intimate and meditative sushi restaurant. (May 2016)

data.title: Shu Yan SiChuan Cuisine 蜀宴
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 207 River Valley Road#01-51/54UE Square (Along Mohamed Sultan Road)Singapore (238275)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Marinated Pig’s Trotter, Mala Crab, Chicken Pudding, Gong Bao Cod Fish, La Zi Chicken
data.ABOUT:
This is one of the first overseas incarnations of the famed restaurant in Chengdu. Established in 2004, the flagship restaurant has been delighting diners with Sichuan classics for over a decade. The dishes here combine a variety of cuisines - from Huaiying to Cantonese, with dishes ranging from spicy Pepper Chicken to soothing soups.

The popular Mala Hotpot has its roots in Sichuan cuisine, so it’s no surprise that dishes on the menu come with an extra kick. Spice fanatics will love the Mala Crab for its searing heat levels and generous portions of crab meat. Diners who prefer something less fiery can opt for the delicious Chicken Pudding - a delectable dish of meat and herbs that is perfect on a cold day. The Marinated Pig’s Trotter is another Sichuan dish that features tender pork meat soaked in a flavourful blend of herbs and spices and cooked to perfection.

The premium ingredients and fancy interior may seem too plush for some, but don’t be fooled - this restaurant is as wallet-friendly as it gets, so patrons can indulge without fear of breaking the bank. If you’re ever in River Valley and craving a taste of Chengdu, this is the place to go! (Apr 2018)

data.title: Shukuu Izakaya
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.Location: Raffles Place, Tanjong Pagar, Telok Ayer
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yasai Miso, Chuka Kurage, Reba Shoyuzuke, Aburi Salmon Mentai Sushi, Maguro Yukke, Torikawa Oroshi Ponzu, Kani Gratin, Kurobuta Pork Ribs, Yaki Gyu Tan, Rosti Mentaiko, Omi Wagyu, Kutobuta Tontoro, Hot Soba, Gyu Don
data.ABOUT:
You might be forgiven for thinking that you’ve been transported to an intimate restaurant in one of Tokyo’s back alleys. Nestled cosily in the trendy yet historic corner of Stanley Street is Shukuu Izakaya, a trendy hotspot featuring a bevy of eclectic small plates that will tickle taste buds. The intimate space features iconic red lanterns and a traditional Japanese mural to create a chic vibe that makes the experience so authentic. Whether you’re looking for an eatery with friends or just a quiet, solitary dinner after work, the superb yet reasonably-priced fare gives you the perfect reason to let your hair down.

Staying true to their conviction of serving only high quality food, ingredients are sourced from leading Japanese suppliers and air-flown in fresh from Japan. The dishes here remains true to its Japanese roots while tinkling with Western influences. The Kani Gratin, or crab gratin with mentaiko, and the Rosti Mentai, where swiss-style potato shreds are drizzled with a decadent mentaiko sauce, serve as fine testaments. Shukuu Izakaya’s specialty, Kushiyaki, or charcoal-grilled skewered meat, is a must-try as well. The Omi Wagyu as well as the Kurobuta Tontoro are your best bets. For the more adventurous, the Yaki Gyu Tan, where premium beef tongue is grilled to tender perfection is sure to please as well. 

The dishes here taste best when paired with sake, so choose your partner in crime from their extensive range of sakes or ask for a recommendation, and voilà, the meal’s perfect! (Feb 2017)

data.title: Shunjuu Izakaya
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yakitori, Tori Kawa Ninni, Ninniku Cha-han, Tori Zousui, Gyu Tan, Tebasaki, Sashimi Sarada, Ribuai Tataki
data.ABOUT:
Since the early Edo period, izakayas (or ‘sit-down sake shops’) have been an indispensable fixture in the Japanese way of life and a few years ago, they found their place in Singapore’s flourishing culinary landscape. Shunjuu Izakaya, situated along the beautiful Robertson Quay, adds a refreshing spritz of excitement to the modern Izakaya with their specialty in Sumiyaki, charcoal-grilled dishes which may very well be the Japanese answer to tapas.

We love the al-fresco dining space but if you’re looking for some air-conditioned comfort, the wood-filled interior and cosy booths provides a much-welcomed respite. When it comes to food, expect well-executed Japanese favourites with an emphasis on dishes that pair well with sake or shochu. As with tapas, the dishes are served as small plates made for sharing, so don’t go easy on the ordering! All 70 of their sumiyaki signatures such as the Tori Kawa Ninniku (garlic rolled with chicken skin), Tebasaki (chicken wings), Gyu Tan (ox tongue) are not to be missed of course. Cold dishes such as the Tako Wasabi (seasoned baby octopus) , the Sashimi Sarada (sashimi salad), and Tori Kawa Masago Ae (chicken skin mixed with cod roe) are also as delicious as hot plates such as the Buta Kimuchi Itame (stir-fry pork and kimchee) and the Ribuai Tataki (ribeye carparccio).

For some carbs, opt for some Soba or the delicious Ninniku Cha-han (garlic fried rice). Wash it all down with sake or shochu - a wide selection awaits, along with a detailed table which specifies the serving temperature, the prefecture of origin, and the sake meter, allowing you to make the most informed choice. We suggest you try a few. It can’t hurt, can it? (Aug 2018)

data.title: Shutters
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.ABOUT: Time to treat yourself and end that spa day with some luxury comfort food. Shutters is located within Sentosa’s beautiful Amara Sanctuary Resort, and a full day of pampering yourself has never been easier. Even if you’re just dropping by for a meal, there’s never been a better way to escape the city; tranquil and surrounded by lush greenery, Shutters is done up in lovely earth tones, a high ceiling, and lots of access to sunlight. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Si Chuan Dou Hua (Beach Road)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Seafood Treasures with Sliced Abalone, Sliced Beef and Tripe in Chilli Sauce, Marinated Mushrooms in Onion Oil, Minced Meat Dumpling, Braised Sea Cucumber in Sichuan Bean Paste, Boiled Sliced Fish in Sichuan Pepper Sauce, Sichuan Dan Dan Noodles
data.ABOUT:
Having first opened its doors in 1996, Si Chuan Dou Hua is no stranger to anyone serious about Chinese food. A wide array of authentic Sichuan and Cantonese fare is offered here, with a menu that stretches more than 30 pages long. Yet, quality is not compromised, and every dish boasts nuanced flavours that will tinkle with your taste buds.
Contrary to popular belief, Sichuan cuisine isn't defined by a fiery spiciness that requires a glass of water nearby at all times. We are major fans of their Sichuan Dan Dan Noodles, but that's just the tip of the iceberg. Expect dishes like the Marinated Black Chinese Fungus with Preserved Chilli, the Braised Sea Cucumber in Sichuan Bean Paste, and the delicate Boiled Sliced Fish in Sichuan Pepper Sauce to blow you away with their smorgasbord of robust flavours.
Their Cantonese classics are similarly executed with finesse. The highlight is undoubtedly the dim sum here where diners are treated with an eclectic mix of old favourites and innovative creations, but double-boiled soups like the Chicken Soup with "Lingzhi" and dishes such as the Braised Seafood Treasures with Sliced Abalone warrant a return trip. (Jan 2017)

data.title: Si Chuan Dou Hua (Kitchener Road)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sichuan Dan Dan Noodles, Double-boiled Bird's Nest in Thick Soup with "Kampung" Chicken, Braised Fish Maw and Goose Web, Signature Bean Curd Medley, Boiled Sliced Fish in Sichuan Pepper Sauce, Braised Pork Belly in Whole Pumpkin
data.PRESS RELEASE: Si Chuan Dou Hua Restaurant at PARKROYAL on Kitchener Road, a hidden gem that sparkles in the Little India enclave and well-loved for its authentic Cantonese and Sichuan specialties, embraces a brand new look with classic oriental elements that blend seamlessly with a touch of modern sophistication.Discover a memorable selection of new Cantonese-style creations that are hallmarks of culinary tradition, skills, creativity, and experience to execute, alongside comforting Sichuan favorites expertly prepared by Executive Cantonese Chef Leung Wing Chung (执行广东主厨梁永祥师傅) and his accomplished team. The warm and knowledgeable service, and a familiar presence of a Tea Master who skillfully pours tea through a long-spout pot, complete the outstanding dining experience. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Si Chuan Dou Hua (UOB Plaza)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chong Qing Diced Chicken with Dried Chili, Boiled Sliced Fish with Sichuan Pepper Sauce, Cantonese Stir-Fried Diced Beef with Sliced Garlic
data.ABOUT:
"Are the dishes 'Sichuan spicy' or 'normal spicy'?" we asked. The restaurant's management staff replied, "Sichuan spicy!" Normally we would discount that reply as pure marketing trickery, but after trying the dishes for ourselves, we were instant believers.
Welcome to Si Chuan Dou Hua, bringing you authentic Sichuan and Cantonese cuisine from its perch on the top floor of UOB Plaza 1. Complete with chefs imported in from Sichuan and Hong Kong in addition to martial arts-and-dance-trained traditional tea pourers from Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan province, this place is as real as it gets, folks!
Although there are three outlets in Singapore, each boasting a different menu that caters to a specific clientele, the UOB location is best known for its 30% Sichuan and 70% Cantonese split menu. This makes it ideal for hosting clients since it's probably best to avoid the faux pas of entertaining guests while drenched in a fearsome chili-induced sweat.
In addition to abalone-themed set meals and Sichuan-style high tea, the restaurant also features an expansive list of high end teas imported from various regions in China. (Oct 2012)

data.title: Si Wei Mao Cai
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Si Wei Stewed Beef in Hot Szechuan Pepper Sauce, Pickled Vegetables with Beef, Si Wei Chilli Frog, Si Wei Chilli Crab, Hai Zi Lan, Mao Tai
data.ABOUT:
It’s a no-brainer that our love for spicy foods knows no bounds. Whether it is a tucking into a bubbling pot of fish head curry, or scouring for the best sambal for our nasi lemak, we flock to spicy foods like moths to a flame. That’s why we’re head over heels for Si Wei Mao Cai, a humble Sichuan restaurant located in Chinatown that reigns supreme with its fiendishly spicy foods. 

Ready to set your tongue ablaze? Then we highly recommend diving into a pot of Si Wei Stewed Beef in Hot Szechuan Pepper Sauce. Adventurous eaters should not miss the restaurant’s rendition of Si Wei Chilli Frog where tender frog legs are stir-fried in a blend of fresh and dried chillies. Then wash down the spiciness with the mild vinegary Pickled Vegetables with Beef, or any number of Chinese wines and liquors available here. If you ask us, we personally can’t say no to a cold glass of Hai Zi Lan or a Mao Tai. 

Aside from its delectable dishes, Si Wei Mao Cai also prides itself on its top-notch service. And honestly, we’re bowled over not only by the incredibly polite and efficient wait staff, but the kitchen who tries to accommodate any requests for Sichuan dishes not on the menu. (Sep 2017)

data.title: Si Wei Xiao Hot Pot
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sichuan Spicy Soup (Butter Oil), Matsutake Soup, Pork Knuckle Soup, Dan Dan Noodle, Wanton Mushroom Soup, Si Chuan Brown Sugar Ice Jelly
data.ABOUT:
Traditional steamboat is all about swishing your meat or vegetables in hot broth. At Si Wei Xiao Hot Pot, expect a slight twist on tradition, as you dip skewered meats into a variety of soup bases. This sister restaurant to the popular Si Wei Mao Cai just next door on Mosque Street offers matsutake mushroom or pork bone soup for those who prefer clear broths, to traditional spicy Sichuan soups for those who can take the heat.

Come with an appetite and order an array of skewers to share, because the chuan chuan (food on sticks) menu here is extensive! Start the meal with sticks of pork belly, marinated chicken and beef tongue, then move on to ordering some vegetable skewers like kang kong, ladyfingers and beancurd skin. Dip these into your soup base of choice for a satisfying experience! (May 2019)

data.title: Siam Kitchen (Khatib)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Authentic Beef Soup, Butterfly BBQ Chicken, Egg Noodles with Crabmeat and Prawn, Fish Head in Tom Yum Curry, Salted Fish Fried Rice with Shrimps

data.title: Siam Kitchen (Lot 1)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Authentic Beef Soup, Butterfly BBQ Chicken, Egg Noodles with Crabmeat and Prawn, Fish Head in Tom Yum Curry, Salted Fish Fried Rice with Shrimps
data.ABOUT:
Rustic, old-world surroundings replete with soft lighting and wooden finishes, beautifully plated classic Thai food and friendly service, it’s hard to believe you’re in the middle of a bustling Singapore mall. Siam Kitchen gives you the Thai fix you’ve been longing for in air-conditioned comfort, offering platefuls of traditional Thai favourites, ranging from tasty Bangkok street food to refined fare originating from the royal court.
Tuck into a Thailand-wide feast with fare from the country’s coastal cuisine - think a beautiful deep-fried garoupa dressed in a savoury-sweet mango sauce - to the rich curries and soups of the Northern regions, including fragrant red curry and a comforting beef soup. Grilled meats and skewers evoke sweaty Bangkok nights and a classic mango sticky rice rounds up the meal and sends you off with a satisfied smile. Let Siam Kitchen take care of your sweet and spicy food cravings, and come tuck into the robust offerings of our friends in the north! (Oct 2016)

data.title: Siam Kitchen (Safra Toa Payoh)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 293 Lor 6 Toa Payoh#01-04SAFRA Toa PayohSingapore (319387)                                                Map
