Rustic, old-world surroundings replete with soft lighting and wooden finishes, beautifully plated classic Thai food and friendly service, it’s hard to believe you’re in the middle of a bustling Singapore mall. Siam Kitchen gives you the Thai fix you’ve been longing for in air-conditioned comfort, offering platefuls of traditional Thai favourites, ranging from tasty Bangkok street food to refined fare originating from the royal court.

Tuck into a Thailand-wide feast with fare from the country’s coastal cuisine - think a beautiful deep-fried garoupa dressed in a savoury-sweet mango sauce - to the rich curries and soups of the Northern regions, including fragrant red curry and a comforting beef soup. Grilled meats and skewers evoke sweaty Bangkok nights and a classic mango sticky rice rounds up the meal and sends you off with a satisfied smile. Let Siam Kitchen take care of your sweet and spicy food cravings, and come tuck into the robust offerings of our friends in the north! (Dec 2020)

data.title: Silk Road Restaurant (Amara Singapore)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shanghai Xiao Long Bao, Sliced Pork with Cucumber on Rack, Jelly Noodle with Spicy Sour Bean Sauce, Double-Boiled Chicken Soup with Ginseng, Deep-Fried Prawn with Wasabi and Crispy Potato, Sichuan Smoked Duck with Camphor and Tea Leaves, Fried Shaved Noodle with Sliced Beef, Traditional Beijing Roasted Duck
data.ABOUT:
Helmed by a team of culinary specialists from China who have dug deep into their respective repertoires of provincial cuisines to present an array of innovative and unique dishes, Silk Road Restaurant at Amara Hotel is a celebration of regional Chinese cuisine that is a joy to experience. The menu at Silk Road Restaurant is an enthralling medley of inventive and traditional creations, with each dish a perfect showcase of artistic flair and deft culinary skills.
The must-have at Silk Road Restaurant is the Shanghai Xiao Long Bao. Each dainty parcel of pork is marinated with sauces and spices for over four hours to achieve maximum flavour, fragrance, and taste before being wrapped in a delicate dough skin together with a juicy burst of flavourful broth. The Fried Shaved Noodle with Sliced Beef features silky and chewy noodles paired with a succulent slices of beef which have been seasoned with fragrant herbs and spices before being expertly fried till all the flavours have been sealed in. Of course, the Traditional Beijing Roasted Duck is another popular dish on the menu. Roasted for an optimum amount of time so that the premium duck meat can retain moisture and succulence under its layers of shining, cracking, skin, diners are free to enjoy this in the usual way (rolled in a crepe), or with sugar granules that bring out its crunchiness and crispiness even more. A meal at Silk Road Restaurant is almost akin to a journey of discovery down the Silk Road - definitely not to be missed! (Apr 2017)

data.title: Silver Shell Cafe
data.Cuisine: Bar, Buffet, International, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 101 Siloso RoadDine On 3 at Level 3Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & SpaSingapore (098970)                                                Map
data.ABOUT:
A World of Flavours from Sunrise to Sunset

Dive into a world of flavours from sunrise to sunset at Silver Shell Café where vibrant, market-fresh fare come into play for an engaging and delicious dining experience within the tropical playground at Singapore’s only beachfront resort.   ​

Relish all-you-can-eat indulgences or enticing a la carte selections that go perfectly well with curated wines, cocktails and the fresh sea breeze, all served to the table with care by the passionate team. Western classics, Asian favourites, vegetarian options and more await, along with a dedicated kid’s menu that adds a splash of fun to the family-friendly all-day dining destination.   ​

Elevated on the third level of the resort offering air-conditioned indoor seating as well as an al fresco seating terrace, grab a table by the window to take in the sea views and immerse in a relaxed and casual atmosphere where service is attentive yet unobtrusive. Dine at ease with convenient contactless ordering and safe measures in place. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Sinfonia Ristorante
data.Hours: Mon-Tue: 12-3pm (For dinner reservation, please call us or email at least 1 day in advance)Wed-Sat: 12-3pm, 6-11pmSun: 12-3pm
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 11 Empress Place#01-01Victoria Theatre and Concert HallSingapore (179558)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Chicken Liver Brulee, Local Herbs, Roasted Focaccia; Crab Salad, Avocado, Roasted Shallot; Pumpkin Casoncelli, Taleggio Sauce, Veal Jus, Roasted Pistachio; Homemade Egg Tagliolini, Mediterranean Clams, Sardinian Bottarga; Wagyu Sirloin, Rosemary, Crystal Salt; Roasted Mediterranean Octopus, Paprika, Seasonal Vegetables; 3 Style Roasted Cabbage, Sour cream, Seasonal Herbs
data.PRESS RELEASE: Nestled in the iconic Victoria Theatre & Concert Hall, Sinfonia Ristorante strives to deliver a fine dining experience that is accessible for all gourmands. Sinfonia Ristorante seeks to be the home where eating is always a pleasure, with quality seasonal ingredients as the basis of good cuisine. Indulge in a multi-sensorial dining experience within the majestic space, adorned with elegant decor, impressive high ceilings and Corinthian columns. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Singabrew
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Texas Grilled Chicken, Mentaiko Fries, Calamari, Eastern Board
data.ABOUT:
A brand dedicated to supporting local craftsmanship and brands, Singabrew proudly presents a hall of Singapore’s best brews. Ranging from beer to wine and spirits, head on down to Keong Saik Road today to grab a glass of cold handcrafted beer. 

Apart from alcoholic beverages, the beer lounge serves a variety of bites and main dishes to fill you up for a night of drinking and good fun. Meat lovers will surely fall in love at first bite with the Texas Grilled Chicken and Pan Seared Smoked Duck Breast. For those here to mingle after work, the Eastern Board is a sumptuous accompaniment. Made of fiery Mala konjac, crackers, silverfish, beancurd and pacific saury, this unique platter tastes even better than it looks. 

Simply here for a drink? Singabrew’s got your back with delicious beer bite options to pair with a glass of ice cold beer. Spot classic favourites such as Mentaiko Fries, Calamari and Mini Sliders on the beer  lounge’s comprehensive menu. Boasting a ton of irresistible promotions each week, make your way down the hippest drinking alley in town for a night you won’t forget! (Apr 2021)

data.title: Sinpopo
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Nasi Lemak for Two, Har Jeong Burger, Baked Salmon, Gula Melaka Cake, Durian Pengat
data.ABOUT:
All dressed up in vintage furnishings, Sinpopo isn’t trying to be an elevated version of your local coffee shop. Although the flavours are inspired by the classic food stalls nearby, the fusion of heritage tastes with modern dining sets this spot apart.
Smartly decorated to feel like a throwback living room, you didn’t have to live through the 70s to recognize the look. Tapered leg tables, wide couches and a boxy TV set now used as a stand all contribute to a unique and trendy feel, making this a great choice for a casual dinner or lengthy weekend lunch.
The menu comes in the form of an old-school attendance roster, and you can choose from heavy-hitters that you might find familiar like Ma Ling Luncheon Crisps and spicy Sambal Fishballs. The signature dishes include the Har Jeong Burger with crispy prawn paste-crusted chicken sandwiched between soft buns. The Nasi Lemak for Two is a hearty platter of all your favourite fixings, plus a big helping of home made sambal that’s offered in free flow. The Gula Melaka Cake is the superstar dish that has diners flocking. A layered creation with smooth caramelized palm sugar, it’s coffee’s match made in heaven. (Apr 2015)

data.title: Siri House
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pappardelle, Pork Tenderloin, Duck, Beef Steak, Tropical Tau Huay
data.PRESS RELEASE:
SIRI HOUSE draws inspiration from the modern Asian family table, introducing diverse flavours and influences to a delicious menu of shared plates. Quality produce is delivered with a signature SIRI HOUSE twist while service forgoes formality for genuine warmth and hospitality. A sophisticated bar programme of Aperitivo and Craft Cocktails comprises house-made distillates, spirits and garnishes.

SIRI HOUSE elevates the home dining and drinking experience as part of lifestyle, social and dining space. Conceptualised by Thai Luxury Property Developer, Sansiri, the house prides itself in fostering community, bringing together people, art, design, food, and retail - all essential elements for a sought-after place of gathering. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Sixteen Ounces Craft Beer Bistro
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tacos, Cheeseburger, Butter Chicken Burger, Mango Habanero Wings, Chilli Beef Fries
data.ABOUT: Sixteen Ounces was born out of a thirst for a proper craft beer bar and bistro in the Western part of Singapore. It is located at the chill end of The Rail Mall, right beside the historical steel rail bridges of The Green Corridor. Serving up 8 regularly rotated craft beers on tap, paired with local fusion delights from the kitchen, it also has an expanding variety of over 40 bottled and canned craft beers and ciders from different parts of the world. (May 2019)

data.title: Sky Lounge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butternut Squash Soup, Braised Oxtail, Hainanese Chicken Rice, Singapore Laksa, Double Decker Club Sandwich, Local Satay
data.ABOUT:
When you’re feeling worn down from the grind of everyday life, take a breather and soak skyhigh with great food and a peaceful ambience at Sky Lounge. This laidback and tranquil eating joint, located on the 22nd floor of the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel, touts some of the best city views around with stunning 270-degree views of the city skyline and Marina Bay waterfront area.

Simplicity and timelessness is the driving motto at this immaculately polished establishment. This is immediately apparent from the second you step through its doors as you set your eyes on the restaurant’s elegant and tailored decor. Then tuck into a worldly feast, with an international menu that will unmistakably satisfy curious diners. We love kicking the meal off with a zesty Scallop Salad made better with the addition of oranges, strawberries, cherry tomatoes on a bed of lettuce and baby spinach. Meat-lovers can partake in some quality meats, with well-crafted mains such as the Five Spice Lamb Rack where lamb marinated in Chinese spices is cleverly paired with a smoky barbecue sauce. Equally admirable is the Asian fare, with standouts such as the delectable and creamy Thai Red Curry Chicken. And be sure to save room for a sweet treat. We recommend the citrusy Cheese Cake drizzled with a sour cherry coulis. 

By elevating gourmet food to a new level, Sky Lounge shines with its amazing fare and breathtaking city views. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Sky View Pavilion
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sky View’s 3 Types Barbecued Meat Platter, Sauteed Prawn with Chilli Sauce in Singapore Style, Chef’s Signature Fried Rice, Sauteed Beef Cube with Black Pepper & Capsicum, Stewed Bean Curd with Spicy Sauce in Sichuan Style
data.ABOUT: Indulge in the award-winning taste of exquisite Chinese cuisine and an extensive spread of Cantonese cuisine at Sky View Pavilion. Our team of experienced and dedicated chefs utilise traditional cooking techniques to bring out the natural flavours of the finest ingredients with no added MSG, setting your palate alight and impressing even the most discerning gastronomes. Coupled with its posh, contemporary interior to create a refined ambience, Sky View Pavilion is your ideal venue for celebratory banquets and business dinners. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Slake
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cornflake Har Cheong Kaarage, Crispy Chili Crab Omelette, Spiced Pork Ribs, Chye Poh Steamed Barramundi, Slake Shiok RiceMore

data.title: Slappy Cakes (Resorts World Sentosa)
data.Cuisine: American, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Hours: Mon, Wed-Fri : 10am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5:30-9:30pm (Last Order: 9pm)Sat Sun, PH & PH Eve: 8:30am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 5-9:30pm (Last Order: 9pm)Closed Tuesday
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: DIY Pancakes, Slappy Okonomiyaki, Carbonara, Angus Beef Steak, Classic Breakfast
data.ABOUT:
Breakfast food for lunch and dinner has caught on as a trend here, and we couldn’t be more glad. Slappy Cakes by the Tung Lok Group is all about making your pancakes, and eating them too. The set-up is simple: a table with a built-in, non-stick griddle, and jars of golden syrup at the side to go with the pancakes. Purists will go for classic batter flavours like buttermilk, while adventurous souls will enjoy the wide variety of batter flavours such as peanut butter, chocolate and even zucchini. Fill your pancakes with sweet strawberries or chocolate chips, or go the savoury path with pork sausages and roasted mushrooms. 

You don’t need to know how to cook to make your pancakes, either. Simply squeeze the batter out onto the griddle, dress it up how you like it, and flip the pancakes with the spatula provided. Not a pancake fan? Slappy Cakes also serves up hearty all-day breakfast items. Popular favourites include The Classic Breakfast of scrambled eggs with crispy bacon, toasted brioche and breakfast potatoes, and the Country Fried Steak — a crispy and juicy serving of battered chicken. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Smoke & Mirrors
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 1 St. Andrew’s Road#06-01National Gallery SingaporeSingapore (178957)                                                Map
data.ABOUT: Perched on the rooftop of the National Gallery Singapore, Smoke & Mirrors is known for its spectacular panoramic views of Singapore’s skyline and a progressive cocktail programme. The destination rooftop bar sets out to elevate guests’ cocktail experience by bringing the three senses of taste, sight and touch into every sip of each tipple. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Smokey's BBQ Joo Chiat
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Venison Chilli Nachos, Buffalo Wings, Baby Back Ribs, St. Louis Ribs, Pulled Pork Sandwich, Texas Bacon Cheeseburger
data.ABOUT:
Unbeknownst to most Singaporeans, barbecue is a craft that requires passion, dedication, and practice. And at Smokey's BBQ, the down to earth, open air, go-to place for American-style ribs, that's exactly what you get. This isn't your simple poolside open brick pit with charcoal. In fact, Smokey's use a custom built smoker, imported wood from the States, and a homemade dry rub, all for that ultimate barbecue experience. Endorsed by our very own in-house token Texan, Smokey's BBQ is THE place to go for delicious ribs, beer, and an old-fashioned good time.
The homemade sauces complement the dishes perfectly, and when coupled with the rich smoky flavour of the meat, it's impossible to resist picking the bones clean. For the perfect barbecue experience though, you'll need to wash all that meat down with some ice cold beer! There's beer on tap, imported craft beers by the bottle, and even a selection of wines from the walk-in wine cellar. Suffice to say, you won't be leaving hungry or thirsty.
As one of the owners so eloquently said, the secret to Smokey's is simply that they love the food they serve, and serve the food they love. (June 2013)

data.title: So France
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oeufs Meurette, Duck Confit, Salade Landaise, Pork Chop, French Seabass Filet, Cassoulet
data.ABOUT:
So France is an immersive all-in-one space comprising a bistro, terrasse and epicurean grocer carrying over 500 gourmet products imported directly from France. The revamped concept brings bistros of today from the streets of Paris to Singapore, presenting the true French bistro experience unlike the caricatured recreations outside of the country.

Launched in March 2018, So France takes guests on a journey through the vibrant culinary landscape of France. Working closely with artisanal producers predominantly from Southwest France, as well as other regions of France, the restaurant presents an authentic selection of classic French bistro fare in a warm and inviting atmosphere. An extensive wine list completes the dining experience with accessible glasses and bottles of wines from beloved appellations including Bordeaux, Southwestern wines or Burgundy. (Feb 2020)

data.title: So Pho (Causeway Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup, Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice, Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat, Vietnamese Drip Coffee
data.ABOUT:
Try halal-certified Vietnamese food in Singapore at So Pho, with their menu of healthy and delicious dishes. Using only the freshest ingredients to capture the authenticity of Vietnam food, So Pho promises the best pho, Banh Mi, Spring Rolls, bento sets, and more. 

Housed in a casual and contemporary setting, indulge in piping hot bowls of tasty pho. Topped with beef balls, beef and a dash of lime, So Pho’s Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup is a healthy bowl of vermicelli that is appetising and nourishing. Order a side of Imperial Spring Rolls to go with the bowl of noodles for a satisfying meal. Another great addition to your meal would be the Vietnamese Drip Coffee. Warm and robust, the specialty coffee is the ideal beverage for a quick pick-me-up. A plate of delights, the Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice is another dish that packs an explosion of Vietnamese flavours. Served with a generous amount of crisps and vegetables, the chicken is grilled and flavoured with a blend of chopped spices. 

An innovative offering not to be missed, savour the Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat.  Similar to a crepe, this Vietnamese delight is made with a crispy layer of dough paired with savoury meat. (Sep 2020)

data.title: So Pho (Paragon)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup, Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice, Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat, Vietnamese Drip Coffee
data.ABOUT:
Try halal-certified Vietnamese food in Singapore at So Pho, with their menu of healthy and delicious dishes. Using only the freshest ingredients to capture the authenticity of Vietnam food, So Pho promises the best pho, Banh Mi, Spring Rolls, bento sets, and more. 

Housed in a casual and contemporary setting, indulge in piping hot bowls of tasty pho. Topped with beef balls, beef and a dash of lime, So Pho’s Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup is a healthy bowl of vermicelli that is appetising and nourishing. Order a side of Imperial Spring Rolls to go with the bowl of noodles for a satisfying meal. Another great addition to your meal would be the Vietnamese Drip Coffee. Warm and robust, the specialty coffee is the ideal beverage for a quick pick-me-up. A plate of delights, the Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice is another dish that packs an explosion of Vietnamese flavours. Served with a generous amount of crisps and vegetables, the chicken is grilled and flavoured with a blend of chopped spices. 

An innovative offering not to be missed, savour the Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat.  Similar to a crepe, this Vietnamese delight is made with a crispy layer of dough paired with savoury meat. (Sep 2020)

data.ABOUT: The new multi-concept restaurant by Les Amis Group, featuring the best of the group’s favourite offerings, all under one roof. A place where diners can look forward to mix and matching their cuisines. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Sofi Cafe + Pizza by Pasta Brava
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sous Vide Chicken Roulade with Strawberry Balsamic Reduction, Charcoal Fluffy Waffles with Carbonara Sauce & Crispy Bacon, Rosemary Chocolate Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Sofi Cafe + Pizza by Pasta Brava is an all-day cafe serving pizza, coffee, healthy dessert, and drinks at
an affordable price.
The menu is crafted by Sofi, the owner, who got her recipes from her overseas trips, picking up local recipes and  ingredients as she visits each country.
Sofi Cafe + Pizza is located just next to Pasta Brava, the restaurant’s main branch which serves traditional dishes from various regions of Italy for 27 years. To put it simply, Sofi Café + Pizza provides diners with a warm and hospitable environment where they can enjoy their day over a good meal and coffee. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Middle Eastern, Vegetarian Friendly, Halal Certified
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hummus, Sofra Kebap, Pide, Sofra Musakka, Izgara Kofte, Hunkar Begendi,  Turkish Coffee, Turkish Hot Apple Tea, Baklava
data.ABOUT:
Tucked away in the unassuming Shaw Towers, this household name has been operating for 16 years and for good reason. Quality and authentic Turkish food at amazing prices isn’t easy to find but Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant manages to tick off these boxes effortlessly.
Sofra, which means “let’s dine” in Turkish, stays true to the humility, warmth and joy of sharing a meal. The fuss-free decor, riddled with interesting trinkets and folksy furniture puts all the attention on the good food while the extensive menu doesn’t dilute the quality of each Turkish classic.
Try their pide, a Turkish pizza filled with gooey cheese and your choice of meat, or the indispensable Sofra Kebap, where your freshly baked bread is heaped with generous servings of meat, walnut, tomato and cheese. The Turkish answer to meatballs, Izgara Kofte, is also a timeless crowd favourite. Wash down the food with a cup of Turkish Hot Apple Tea or Turkish Coffee to complete the Turkish experience.
If you’re around the area, do check out their set lunches, an absolute steal with prices ranging from $7.90 to $14.90 nett. Wait no longer! (Jul 2016)

data.title: Soi 44
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 44 Thai Platter, Green Curry, Basil Minced with Rice, Mango Sticky Rice
data.ABOUT:
Craving for authentic Thai food? Look no further than Soi 44. Located along the bustling Prinsep Street, this restaurant offers a huge variety of authentic Thai cuisine such as Thai Mango Salad and Lemon Chicken at affordable prices. 

For a great starter, go for the 44 Thai Platter. Named after the restaurant, this platter features an abundance of Thai signature favourites such as Fish Cake, Deep Fried Seafood Tofu, Spring Roll and Fried Lemongrass Wings. Other best selling finger food options include the Moo Ping, Prawn Cake and cold Thai Topshell. Highly recommended, the Thai Mango Salad is a mix of strips of mango soaked in a flavourful in house Thai chilli sauce. Offering four different meat options, the Green Curry and Red Curry are also spicy concoctions that are deliciously fiery. 

For those looking for a signature Thai one dish meal that is great value for money, the Phad Thai is a great option that will afford you more bang for your buck. A classic staple in Thai cuisine, Soi 44 also whips up fragrant plates of Basil Minced with Rice with your preferred meat option. Wrap up your meal with a plate of Mango Sticky Rice for an authentic Thai dining experience. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Solo Ristorante
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 12-2:30pm, 6-10:30pmFri: 12-2:30pm, 6-6:30pm (First Seating), 8-8:30pm (Second Seating)Sat: 6-6:30pm (First Seating), 8-8:30pm (Second Seating)Closed Sunday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Carpaccio, Chef's Daily Pasta, Ravioli, Daily Catch of Fresh Fish or Seafood, Butcher's Choice of Cut
data.ABOUT: The menu at Solo Ristorante rotates regularly, allowing you to experience their vibrant dishes which are crafted from seasonally abundant ingredients at the peak of their freshness.The degustation menu is modified daily and is prepared with the chef's daily sauces, fresh catches and butcher's cuts to keep a product-driven cuisine approach. No matter the time of the year, Solo's food can be customized to accomodate any dietary request - just ask the team. (Feb 2019)

data.title: Southbridge
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Sliders, Umami Oysters
data.ABOUT: Southbridge is the city’s ultimate destination for chic and buzzy bar dining, with arguably one of the best 360° views of the city, which spans from the historic Parliament House across the Singapore River, to the iconic Marina Bay Sands and Boat Quay skyline. The elegant yet unpretentious atmosphere is coupled with convivial service and a gin-focused bar list. Indulge in crafted Gin & Tonics, wines and bubbly to pair with the freshest oysters and morish bar bites. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Spice Brasserie
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Japanese, Indian, Local, Southeast Asian, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Broken Rice Claypot Porridge, Charcoal Smoked Black Char Siew, BBQ Carrot Cake, Teppanyaki Ice cream, Durian Pengat with Sticky Rice, Chilli Crabs with Mantou
data.ABOUT: Inspired by the colourful heritage of the neighbourhood, our all-day-dining restaurant boasts an ambience and decor with a distinct sense of place. Guest can find a tantalising selection of Asian street food while enjoying creative and modern interpretations of local favourites. Be spoilt for choice with the extensive a la carte and buffet offerings, that includes an array of appetizers and sweet treats to complement your meal. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Spices Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Laksa, Ayam Buah Keluak, Oyster Omelette, Dim Sum, Kway Chap, Apong Bok Kuah, Oysters, Alaskan king crab, Lobster, Salted Egg Crab
data.ABOUT:
Striking black and white décor, hints of red, grandly tufted booths and an amber dome; the eye-catching décor is reflected in the walls of cleverly framed mirrors. Not that you'd be staring at your surroundings when there are counters laden with mouth-watering concoctions right before your eyes!

Savour local specialties during lunch with popular favourites such as Oyster Omelette, Fruit Rojak, as well as Peranakan classics like the Ayam Buah Keluak, Kueh Pie Tee and Nonya Laksa. Desserts are equally stocked with Nonya confections, so fill up your belly with Apong Bok Kuah, Kueh Charah, and Durian Pengat to your heart's content! When evening falls, it's another decadent flow to look forward to, this time with jewels from the sea. Boasting three different crab creations, crustacean lovers will find it hard to tear themselves away from these but we urge you to try. It'd be a shame to miss out on the new Alaskan king crab claws (served chilled or stir fried in Thai curry), Cheese or Mentaiko Baked Lobster, a bevy of fresh sashimi, and the other grilled meats sizzling on the hot grill.

Over the weekend, luxuriate in Spices Cafe's tea-time treats, specially put together to reflect a myriad of Singaporean flavours. It's not all Dim Sum, Laksa and Satay, however! End the meal on a sweet note with their Blueberry Cheesecake and Chocolate Fountain. Morning, noon, or night, Spices Cafe has an endless rotation of exciting fare to whet your appetite. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Spicy House
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sichuan Dumplings, Mala Butter soup base, Indonesian Crab, Wagyu Beef, Australian Lobster, Mala Noodles
data.ABOUT:
Buckle up and prepare for a rich, hearty, and – above all – spicy gastronomic adventure that has plenty of ‘kick’ and definitely won’t disappoint. Spicy House Restaurant certainly pulls no punches in serving quality, fiercely authentic, Chengdu-style hotpot. The chain has its origins in Shanghai and the outlet in Riverside Point is its first overseas branch; unique to the Singapore outlet is the mouthwatering addition of Japanese wagyu beef and Australian lobster (plus some others) to the menu.

The restaurant’s signature soup base is the Mala Butter, which has a distinctively rich flavour courtesy of the butter stirred into the soup. You’d be hard-pressed to forget the taste of this particular base, which possesses a complexity that not many other places can produce. If you’re looking for something different, however, you can choose from a list of soup bases such as Tomato, Pig’s Trotters, and Chestnut Healthy Chicken, among others. Some ready-to-eat side dishes include flavourful Sichuan Dumplings as well as Mala Noodles, for those who feel like having something apart from hotpot. It quickly becomes apparent that there’s something in this restaurant for everyone,  especially for those who like their food extra spicy, so make your way down to Spicy House Restaurant – you definitely won’t regret it! (Jan 2017)

data.title: Spicy Rock
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Premium Beef Steak Don, Spicy Rock Chicken Square Hotpot, Spicy Miso Tori-Kotsu Ramen
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Welcome to the outrageously-glamorous and fun-loving dining concept, Spicy Rock! 

Serving up varietal spicy cuisines in Singapore, Spicy Rock offers the freshest Japanese ingredients and Japanese products with a fusion twist to "Spicy Up" your life! (Jun 2019)

data.title: Spizza (Bukit Timah)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Portobello Mushrooms, Parma e Melone, Aglio Olio e Pepperoncini, Kiara Pizza, Wilma Pizza, Vongole (clams) in White Wine or Tomato Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Spizza is the go-to pizza parlour for loads of local foodies, known for its consistently outstanding wood-fired pies and reasonably priced Italian mains.
Spizza might not look like your nonna's authentic pizzeria, relying on strict recipes in a white table clothed dining room. Instead, with a contemporary interior and endlessly personalized pizzas and pastas, this place is all about pleasing every type of diner that ambles in. The Balmoral Plaza outlet features a spacious outdoor terrace with garden lined views and plenty of clean-lined, modern seating.
Despite its current look, you might be surprised to learn that several key components in their tasty dishes are sourced the good old-fashioned way. Ingredients hailing from the motherland include tomatoes, mushrooms, artichokes, and the insanely tasty ham from Parma. These goodies are used liberally in house made compositions, all named after Italian ladyloves, and wood fired by the custom built oven. The resulting crust is cracker thin with just enough char to hold up against the flavourful toppings and cheese.
The Isabella is a longtime crush, with mozzarella, Parma ham, juicy tomatoes, rocket leaves and shards of peppery parmesan. If you prefer some curves over the skinny version, you can opt for your pizza gondola-style with a fluffy, boat shaped crust and toppings turned into innings filling it up. Every month, there's a specialty Star Pizza and Star Pasta created with gourmet, seasonal ingredients that are always a good bet. Or else you can create your own pizza and pasta with heaps of delicious tidbits to work with. For dessert, the Zara sweet pizza is a heartbreaker, with luscious Nutella, banana and crisp almond flakes topping that incredible crispy crust! (Feb 2015)

data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Portobello Mushrooms, Parma e Melone, Aglio Olio e Pepperoncini, Kiara Pizza, Wilma Pizza, Vongole (clams) in White Wine or Tomato Sauce

data.title: Spring Court
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Stewed Boston Lobster in Fresh Fungus in Superior Stock, Crisp Fried Fillet of Cod Fish with BBQ Sauce, Braised Fish in Claypot, Homemade Tofu with Scallop in Minced Pork Gravy, Stir-fried Chinese Cabbage with XO Sauce
data.ABOUT:
As the oldest family-run restaurant still in business, it’s clear that Spring Court Restaurant has more than proven its mettle, and then some. Opened in 1929, the establishment has seen more than one venue (think the well-known Great World Amusement Park), and today one can find it located in a beautifully preserved heritage shophouse along Upper Cross Street. A restaurant that has remained open for this long surely has something good going for it, and you certainly won’t regret a visit!

Lose yourself in the variety of sets offered on the menu. There’s a particular set for one person that we’re pretty fond of, with its plethora of seafood eats. Luxuriate in a serving of Stewed Boston Lobster in Fresh Fungus in Superior Stock, a tasty dish made with delightfully fresh helpings of lobster you’ll be remembering for days to come. The Crisp Fried Fillet of Cod Fish with BBQ Sauce is another dish that’s easy to love – perfectly crispy on the outside with firm, fresh cod on the inside, you’d be hard-pressed to stop yourself from guzzling it all down in a rush! There are other sets available that are pretty damn good too, and anyone who gets a taste of the restaurant’s comfort food offerings will immediately understand why it has remained open for business through the decades. (Sep 2017)

data.title: Spruce (Hillview 2)
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spruce Hot Wings, Pugliese, Creme Brulee, Bomb Alaska
data.ABOUT:
Spruce’s extensive menu of modern European dishes revolves around the concept of serving wholesome and unpretentious cuisine at affordable prices. 

Start your night with one of Spruce’s signature bar bites, the Spruce Hot Wings. Tender and juicy, the wings come with the hot sauce served as a dip, allowing diners to customise the spice level according to their preferences. Coated with a unique batter that retains the crisp and crunch of the buffalo wings, this dish is a must-try. A familiar starter combination of burrata cheese and prosciutto, the Pugliese is a tasty pizza version of the traditional Italian appetiser,  topped with extra tomato sauce and cherry tomatoes as well as a cheesy layer of mozzarella. 

Dessert lovers rejoice! Spruce’s wide variety of cakes, pastries and desserts will spoil you. The Creme Brulee is glazed to perfection, with the sweet taste of caramelised apple in every bite. The Double Chocolate Crunch Cake Ala Mode, Baked Ginger Date Pudding or the Bomb Alaska are other mouthwatering treats that come highly recommended. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Spruce (Tanglin, Phoenix Park)
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Devil’s Wings, European Cheese Wonderland, Messi Burger, Spruce Sundae
data.ABOUT:
Savour, relish and indulge in Spruce’s extensive menu of modern European dishes. Inspired by the concept of serving wholesome and delectable modern Italian-American cuisine at affordable prices, the restaurant has a huge array of Western dishes to choose from. 

Bite into the deep fried fish bites with spicy lime sauce first before moving onto the mains. This delightful starter is a crowd favourite, with spicy and tangy flavours perfectly complementing each other. For those looking for a challenge, the Devil’s Wings are the ultimate test of your spice tolerance. Be warned, for these succulent wings are fried and tossed in an extremely spicy blend of chilli sauces.

Spruce has a variety of sharing platters great for groups. The European Cheese Wonderland consists of an assortment of European cheeses, presented with nuts and crisps. Ideal for after work socials or catch up sessions among friends, this wonderfully plated cheese platter is great for sharing. Homemade with love, the Messi Burger features a delicious beef patty, iceberg lettuce, sunny side egg and bacon sandwiched between two fluffy buns and drizzled in a cheese sauce. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Squisito
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gnocchi Ripieni, Ravioli All Aragosta, Squisito’s Speciale Di Carne, Panforte, Arancini Di Funghi
data.ABOUT:
Conveniently located, Squisito is a must-try for every lover of Italian cuisine. Minutes away from Bugis MRT station, it is an innovative meeting of traditional Italian cooking techniques with modern flavours and the freshest ingredients.

For starters, try the tart and creamy Gnocchi Ripieni, where fried gnocchi has been stuffed with spicy beef filling and served with marinara sauce. Also good is the Arancini Di Funghi, where Sicilian rice balls are stuffed with mushroom and turkey ham. 

For the entrees, chew on Squisito’s perfectly cooked pasta, made fresh daily and cooked al dente. Order the Ravioli All’ Aragosta, a lobster meat ravioli served in a flavourful and aromatic prawn bisque and seasoned with fresh tarragon herbs. Pizza lovers, don’t miss out on Squisito’s Speciale Di Carne. With a tart tomato base, the pizza is topped with melted mozzarella cheese, turkey ham and bacon, as well as beef sausage, chicken and salami.

Finish your meal on a sweet note with Panforte. A traditional Italian dessert containing nuts and fruits, it is chewy and indulgent. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Ssak3 Korean BBQ
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Planner Porkbelly, SSAK3 Assorted Set, Army Stew, Ramen Noodles
data.ABOUT:
Look no further than SSak3 for your next Korean barbeque fix! Conveniently located in the heart of Singapore, SSak3 serves affordable grilled meat, army stew and more along with a variety of soju and beer, at the best deals.

Helmed by a Korean chef with over 30 years of experience, the restaurant dishes out authentic Korean food. The restaurant has no lack of reasonably priced meat. The Planner Porkbelly is a massive plate of beautifully curled slices of meat, alongside a generous scoop of fried bean sprouts and fresh kimchi. To enjoy a scrumptious Korean barbeque, one cannot miss out on ordering the Grilled Cheese. A perfect combination of cheese, meat and kimchi, these two dishes complement each other for a deliciously unforgettable meal. 

If you’re still feeling peckish after savouring the huge pork platter, the SSAK3 Assorted Set is worth a try. Featuring pork belly, honeycomb pork belly, beef short ribs and short plate, this tasty plate of meaty goodness will surely fill you up. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Ssikkek Korean Grill BBQ (Tanjong Pagar)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ribeye, Beef Short Ribs, Pork Belly, Beef Bulgogi, Chicken Chop
data.ABOUT:
With a buffet priced at just S$22++, Ssikkek Korean Grill draws in crowds with its pocket-friendly prices. The buffet spread here is sumptuous; think an array of top-quality meat such as ribeye, short ribs, pork belly, and pork collar. 

The ribeye and short ribs are popular cuts, sliced thinly so you can enjoy as much as you want. Pick from either marinated meats, or unseasoned ones if you prefer. Grill the meat on the hotplate individually, or turn dinner into a feast by putting all the meats and vegetables on the same plate and grilling them at once. The service staff are friendly, and always on hand (despite the crowds) to change the aluminium foil cover. 

To balance out the rich meal, add some kimchi to the mix - the sharp, sour fermented egetables are perfect for cutting through the fattiness of the meat. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Stags' Room
data.Good For: Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.ABOUT:
Bon vivants will be irresistibly drawn to this cosy lounge in the NCO Club, where you’ll find a private reserve of vintage New World wines from US and Australian wineries Stags’ Leap, Penfolds and Beaulieu Vineyard. Love a rich mouthfeel for your Chardonnay? Stag Leap’s wide variety of grapes harvested from their location at the base of the hill reflects the strength of their terroir, from creamy Chardonnays to powerful Petit Syrahs. Fans of dry reds will make a beeline for the extensive selection from Penfolds. You’ll also recognise the Australian winery’s iconic Penfolds Grange on the menu here. For wines steeped in history, the Beaulieu Vineyard is one of the few wineries to survive the Prohibition era, and wield a huge influence over the winemaking in the Napa Valley region today, 
For nibbles, there’s creamy Brillat Savarin with cranberries and truffle honey, as well as deeply savoury iberico bellota. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Steakgrill
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Steak, Truffle Pork Chop, Vegan Aglio, Fried Haddock Fish, Seafood Pomodoro, Bacon Carbonara
data.ABOUT:
If you ever find yourself in the north of Singapore with a craving for steak, then be sure to drop by Steakgrill. Located along Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10, Steakgrill is a casual neighboorhood joint that serves affordable quality Western food.

Be sure to indulge in Steakgrill’s Grilled Steak, served with fries. The steak is tender, juicy and flavourful, while the fries are also done exceptionally well, crispy and with not a detectable drop of oil. If beef is not your thing, then try the Truffle Pork Chop instead. Alternatively, if you prefer seafood, the Fried Haddock Fish is definitely for you. Alongside such mains, Steakgrill also offers an array of pasta dishes, full of crowd favourites including Seafood Pomodoro and Bacon Carbonara. For vegans, don’t fret, there’s something for you as well — the Vegan Aglio. 

Boasting a cosy and relaxed atmosphere, Steakgrill also prides itself on its excellent service, from its smiley staff to the cheery chef. Affordable, comfortable and with excellent food, Steakgrill is definitely an excellent choice for family meals and catch-ups. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Straits Cafe
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Indian, Local, Halal Certified, Mediterranean
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 9 Bras Basah RoadLobby LevelRendezvous HotelSingapore (189559)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Durian Pengat Shooters, Nasi Mandhi With Lamb Ribs, Rendang Ayam Bakar, Nasi Kunyit, Beef Ribs Rendang
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located within the iconic Rendezvous Hotel Singapore, Straits Café presents a scrumptious Halal-certified buffet spread of regional fare featuring the favourites of the Straits. Drawing flavours from Penang, Melaka, Ipoh, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore and more, Straits Café aims to be the destination for Straits delights.

Guests can expect to savour Straits favourites including KL Prawn Noodles, Klang Chic Kut Teh, Ipoh Chicken Rice made using quality ingredients. Also not to be missed is the Seafood Sambal Live Station, available from Fridays to Sundays, where chefs cook up a wide selection of fresh seafood and greens a la minute. (May 2018)

data.title: Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant (Esplanade Mall)
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Peranakan, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ayam Buah Keluak, Udang Sambal, Beef Rendang, Chendol
data.ABOUT:
A name synonymous with Peranakan food, Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant is Singapore’s oldest nyonya restaurant, serving food made with three generations of love since 1953.

Building on the legacy, the restaurant uses secret recipes handed down generations to bring an authentic Peranakan cuisine made from the freshest ingredients and select choice of spices. For a complete Peranakan experience, the Ala Carte Nonya Buffet is an ideal choice. Start with an appetiser of your choice before moving on to the mains such as Ayam Buah Keluak, Udang Sambal, Beef Rendang and more. There’s something for everyone here as the buffet serves all kinds of meat and vegetables. Pair your meal with a traditional Chin Chow or Lime Cordial to cleanse your palate. 

Last but not least, choose from four different desserts to end your meal on a delicious note. For those looking for something refreshing, the Lemongrass Jelly is a great option that will surely perk you up. The Chendol is also a classic favourite that makes for a wonderful dessert in Singapore’s humid weather. (Aug 2020)

data.title: StraitsKitchen
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Indian, Malaysian, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Halal Certified
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 10 Scotts RoadGrand Hyatt SingaporeLobby LevelSingapore (228211)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Rendang, Wok-Fried Crab, Tandoori Murgh, Assorted Nonya Kuehs, Durian Ice-Cream
data.ABOUT: Discover Singapore's reputation as a food haven through StraitsKitchen, a one-stop venue with a Halal-certified kitchen showcasing the best of Chinese, Indian, Malay and Peranakan cuisines. Hailing from around Asia, StraitsKitchen's team of chefs prepares authentic hawker fare for you a la minute and at the highest culinary standards.With the latest advisory by the Singapore Government, StraitsKitchen has now returned to serving all food items via a staff-served food line from 13th April 2021. Beverages will be ordered via the restaurant menu's QR code and will be delivered to the table. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Streats (Bukit Panjang Plaza)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Claypot Tom Yum Seafood, Hong Kong Shrimp Noodles, HK Beef Crispy Egg Noodles, HK Fried XO Seafood Noodles
data.ABOUT:
Paying homage to popular Hong Kong and Macau street food, Streats is a halal-certified restaurant chain offering a wide variety of dim sum, noodles, rice and pasta. With a focus on Hong Kong specialities, the restaurant’s casual and inviting layout provides a great dining experience for family and friends.

Start with the restaurant’s signature Claypot Tom Yum Seafood. A popular favourite, this comforting bowl of spicy soup features a mix of juicy prawns, squid, mussels and more — perfect for seafood lovers. For those in search of a lighter meal, the Hong Kong Shrimp Noodle is a great option. Served either dry or in a piping hot bowl of flavoursome soup, the tangy noodles are accompanied by handmade shrimp dumplings and vegetables. 

Feeling overwhelmed by the sheer number of options? When in doubt, stick with the classics. Streats’ famous HK Beef Crispy Egg Noodles and HK Fried XO Seafood noodles are mouthwatering options you can never go wrong with. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Stuttgart Blackforest Boutique S-Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Knuckle, Speciality Sausage, Prawn Linguine, Chicken Spatzle with White Wine Sauce, Maultaschen
data.ABOUT:
The lesser-known Swabian cuisine is recognised for its rich and down-to-earth dishes native to Wurttemberg and parts of Austria. The menu here is dedicated to authentic Swabian classics such as Pork Knuckle, Speciality Sausages, and Spatzle. Whether you’re a newbie to German cuisine or a seasoned connoisseur, there’s sure to be something for you. With fine upholstery, lively music, and welcoming staff, Bavaria is just but a meal away. 

You can’t go wrong with the Pork Knuckle. Crisp on the outside, yet tender and juicy on the inside, this dish is amazingly tasty. Pair it with one of the beers imported straight from Stuttgart and you’ll get a truly authentic Swabian feast. There is also a wide selection of wines for diners who prefer alternatives. The Speciality Sausages are another hot favourite, and for good reason. Choose between beef, chicken, or pork sausages, which are dressed up with a side of mashed potatoes and gravy. The gravy is lightly spicy and adds flavour to the generous portion of sausages. The Chicken Spatzle with White Wine Sauce is a boozy dish that is perfect for ravenous diners looking for a decadent dish. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot (Khatib)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 2 Yishun Walk#01-01HomeTeamNS Clubhouse Singapore Singapore (767944)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shabu-Shabu Beef, Thai Signature Tom Yum, Khao Soi, Tom Yum Yen Ta Fo, Sweet Basil Chicken Soup, Mango Sticky Rice, Khanom Tako, Cassava Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot presents the multi-dimensional flavours of Thai cuisine through its halal-certified hot pot fare. Brought to you by the team behind Siam Kitchen and Bangkok Jam, the Eat-All-You-Can buffet menu features quality ingredients like thinly sliced Shabu-Shabu beef, fresh chicken, home-made fish glue, and access to the buffet bar with unlimited fresh vegetables, mushrooms, pot dishes and more!

Experience an ensemble of sweet, salty and spicy through authentic Thai soup base
well-loved all over the world, including the Thai Signature Tom Yum and a creamy curry
broth Khao Soi. Go beyond the famed classics with Tom Yum Yen Ta Fo, a tom yum base
with sweet yen ta fo sauce made from fermented beancurd, or the refreshing Sweet Basil
Chicken Soup.

Not forgetting the free-flow Thai drinks and desserts such as the Mango Sticky Rice,
Khanom Tako (Thai pudding with coconut topping) and Cassava Cake, these are
must-haves to round off the Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot experience.
Set in a vibrant Thai-inspired interior, Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot remains homely and
welcoming, perfect for a hearty makan session with family and kakis. (Aug 2020)

data.title: Suki-Ya (Bugis+)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shabuya Wagyu Beef, Pork, Tonyu Miso Soup, Sukiyaki Soup
data.ABOUT:
If you’re looking for a place offering sukiyaki and shabu shabu at crazy affordable prices, then Suki-Ya’s your best bet. Priding themselves on offering diners a heartwarming dining experience that won’t break the bank, you’re sorely mistaken if you think quality is compromised here.
Choose from five exciting types of soup bases to complement the quality meats, think an unlimited amount of thinly-sliced beef, chicken, or pork, which you’ll be tucking into in no time. Our personal favourites include the Tonyu Miso broth, a wildly popular Japanese winter dish that’s both nutritious and packed with flavour. The Kimchi broth, on the other hand, is perfect for those who want to spice up their meal. Simmered with authentic kimchi, spicy miso, and vegetables, this broth definitely packs a punch. Seeking a balanced meal? Suki-Ya’s got you covered too. Their expansive Healthy Bar features a wide variety of fresh vegetables to round up your meal with some greens. Now, get ready for a feast that will titillate your taste buds! (Oct 2016)

data.title: Suki-Ya KIN
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shabuya Wagyu Beef, Pork, Tonyu Miso Soup, Sukiyaki Soup
data.ABOUT: If you enjoy swishing meats at popular outfit Suki-Ya, you’ll love its more upscale sister Suki-Ya Kin. With a panoramic view of the Sentosa waterfront, this premium shabu shabu outlet showcases all-you-can-eat quality ingredients. Pick from a choice of five different broths first, with popular favourites such as classic shabu-shabu made from simmered kelp and kombu, or a richer Butaniku — a creamy pork-based soup. On the menu are excellent meat selections, from fatty strips of wagyu to generously-marbled slices of premium kurobuta. Craving for seafood? A must-try are the fresh tiger prawns and the sliced sashimi. Balance your meal with trips to the vegetable bar to load up on crisp, leafy greens. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Sumire Yakitori House
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bakudan Korekke, Aburi Salmon Menati Mayo Roll, Aburi Shime Saba, Sumire Mori
data.ABOUT:
Taking the pride of place in the cosy Japanese space that is Sumire Yakitori House at Bugis Junction is, of course, a grill. Large and shiny, it produces skewer after skewer of succulent meat grilled expertly right in front of you. Sumire hails from a long tradition of yakitori in Japan, and this is clear in its extensive menu, which showcases different parts of the humble chicken, from its shoulder to its thigh. Sumire’s meatballs are very popular for their savory balance of juicy flavours. They literally explode their goodness with each bite, making it necessary for you to reach out for a napkin or two to dab your mouth with after each bite. 
 
Non-yakitori items are also available at Sumire. The Japanese Daisen Chicken Hotpot is made from Daisen chicken, a breed of chicken that has been raised on the Daisen mountain in Tottori Prefecture (north of Kyoto) in Japan. The stock itself is chock-full of goodness, with chicken meat, minced chicken balls, prawn, fried tofu, enoki mushrooms, okra, zucchini, and fungus all contributing to its robust and hearty flavour.
 
Love runny eggs? The D-I-Y Tamago Toji Hotplate is the perfect dish for you. Tossed in the hotplate are grilled chicken meat, grilled chicken meatballs, and mixed mushrooms, all mixed in a savoury-sweet dashi. Unlike the usual Tamago Toji dishes, Sumire serves the raw pasteurized egg separately so you can decide how cooked you want your egg to be. Do not ignore the accompanying rice bowl topped with Egg Tempura. The yolk itself is comfortingly runny, and together with the chicken pieces hidden in the rice, it is an eggy party in the mouth. For a yakitori night out that is far from yucky, Sumire is the place for you. (Aug 2016)

data.title: Summer Hill
data.Hours: Tue-Sat: 12-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Sun: 11am-3pm (Last Order: 2:30pm), 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Closed Monday
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roast Chicken, Croque Monsieur, Sage & Mustard Roasted Kurobuta Pork Collar, Premium Roast Prime Rib Steak
data.ABOUT:
Anthony Yeoh and Christopher Soh, the folks behind the now-defunct and dearly missed French bistro Cocotte, come together again to bring you Summer Hill, offering French classics in their inimitable laid back fashion, except in scaled down, but very cozy Clementi digs. It’s an intimate space but even then the kitchen is an open-concept one, so you can see the chefs hard at work turning out your roast chooks and other delights in a manner not unlike watching your grandma potter away in the kitchen. You’ll want to make a booking because this tiny hole in the wall has only one indoor table with a small alfresco section, and even then these chefs have a cult following who’ll gamely brave muggy weather for some French perfection.

You’ll know once you walk in what the specialty is: that warm thyme and butter scent, and the familiar fragrance of perfectly crisp, browned skin can only mean exquisite French-style roast chicken. A hormone and antibiotic free bird is given a good roast after being slathered with creamy, herb-scented butter for extra crispiness and flavour. It comes accompanied with roasted sprouts and spuds, plus a gravy-boat of jus, liquid gold that elevates this to high gourmand territory. Besides chicken, think other French bistro classics like a formidable, Gruyère encrusted Croque Monsieur, other roasted meats like a beautiful Sage & Mustard Roasted Kurobuta Pork Collar, and the king of all grilled joints, the Premium Roast Prime Rib Steak, a family-sized cut of Angus beef. It’s not the biggest menu, but that just means they give a lot more love and attention to each plate, which, if you ask us, is perfect. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Summer Palace
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steamed Lobster with Gastrodia, Braised Superior Bird's Nest with Fish Maw and Dried Scallops, Steamed Live Prawns with Garlic Trio, East Star Garoupa Fillet with Soya Bean Paste, Shrimp Dumplings with Bird's Nest, Deep-Fried Yam with Garoupa, Beggar Chicken, Steamed Glutinous Rice with Crab, Chilled Double Boiled Pear, Double Boiled Egg White Milk Custard with Bird's Nest
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Awarded Michelin one-star, savour classic Cantonese dishes and an extensive selection of dim sum delicacies at Summer Palace, lauded time and again for both its exquisite cuisine and traditional oriental interior.
Inspired menus by the restaurants two Hong Kong chefs are complemented by a collection of fine Chinese art and antiques. Besides à la carte and set menu options, Chef's five-course lunch and six-course dinner menus are also available. For private business and social functions, two private dining rooms are available. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Summer Pavilion (The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore)
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Fried Shredded Yam & Pumpkin Dim Sum, Lobster Poached Rice, Braised Estuary Grouper with Dried Beancurd Skin, Braised King Scallop with Stuffed Eggplant, Prawn Paste & Spicy Sauce, Barbecued Pi Pa Duck, Chilled Yam Paste with Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Enclosed by greenery and featuring a glass pavilion, the aptly named Summer Pavilion evokes the essence of summer and has diners feeling like they're feasting in a lush garden.
References to the Chinese summer are beautifully represented in the floral motifs that appear in crockery and the musical arrangements featuring the Chinese flute, but most impressive of all, is the menu. Besides the usual Cantonese offerings such as soups, noodles, and a smorgasbord of seafood, meats and vegetables cooked in a variety of ways, keep an eye out for highlights such as the Double-boiled Sea Whelk Soup with Fish Maw & Chicken Served in Whole Coconut, and the Poached Rice with Lobster.
Finally, choose a specialty tea from the Tea Salon to pair with your meal, to round out that perfect experience with Summer Pavilion. (Jan 2017)

data.title: Sunday Folks
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 44 Jalan Merah Saga#01-52Chip Bee GardensSingapore (278116)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sea Salt Gula Melaka Ice Cream, Affogatos, Iced White with Ferrero Ice Cream, Watermelon Lime Pop, Lemon Lavender Cake, Rich Cognac Chocolate Ganache Cake.
data.ABOUT:
Enjoy a little Sunday every day with a dose of delicious desserts and coffee. Not just any desserts, but handcrafted desserts prepared with pride and love. From the selection of raw ingredients to the making of crafted sweets, every detail pays homage to the freshness and tastefulness of our products.

Kick things off by ordering a slice (or five, in our case) of one of their tempting cakes. Fans of lighter flavours might enjoy the Strawberry Charlotte or Lemon Lavender, whilst the other end of the spectrum sees richer combinations like Rich Cognac Chocolate or Oreo Cheesecake. Signature, however, is a plate of two thick waffles, crunchy on the outside and fluffy in the middle, stacked and loaded with a perfectly shaped spiral of freshly-churned ice cream. There are perfectly churned classics like Sea Salt Gula Melaka and Dark Chocolate Ferrero, but why not live a little and give less ubiquitous flavours like Earl Grey Lavender or their seasonal flavours a try. (May 2021)

data.title: Super Loco Customs House
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cauliflower Aguachile, Tuna Tostadas, Wagyu Steak and Octopus Tacos, Beef Quesadilla, Lamb Barbacoa, Angus Rib Eye Steak and Churros
data.ABOUT:
Super Loco Customs House is a festive and contemporary Mexican restaurant and bar located on the Marina Bay waterfront. Relax with a margarita and delicious food as you enjoy the stunning backdrop of Marina Bay.

Drop by during lunch to enjoy a quick salad, selection of tacos or a hearty burrito. Dinner at Super Loco Customs House is also equally delightful. Choose from and sink your teeth into signature tacos, quesadillas, salads,  as well as sharing mains. (March 2021)

data.title: Super Loco Robertson Quay
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mexican Street Corn, Ceviche, Tuna and Crab Tostadas, Baja Taco, Chorizo Taco, Chicken Quesadilla, Mexican Pork Ribs, and Achiote Roast Chicken and their famous Super Churros. A wide range of vegan and vegetarian dishes.
data.ABOUT:
The fun and festivities never end at Super Loco Robertson Quay. A Mexican-inspired restaurant and bar founded by The Loco Group, the riverside restaurant is family and pet friendly and serves up a variety of hearty and healthy sharing plates with fresh ingredients and punchy flavours.

Perfect for sharing, the restaurant’s dinner menu features plenty of healthy and gluten-free options.  Must-try dishes are: Mexican street corn, Ceviche, Spicy chicken wings, Chicken and Beef quesadilla and their wide selection of tacos.

For the health-conscious, at least half of the menu is vegetarian or vegan, or can be done so. Expect interesting and unique Cactus tacos, Roast Pumpkin & Corn Enchiladas and Huitlacoche Truffle Mushroom quesadillas.

Pop by the restaurant on the weekends to have a taste of their popular brunch menu which consists of classics with a Mexican twist or come by for Happy Hour every Monday to Friday from 12-7pm. (March 2021)

data.title: Supply & Demand (Esplanade)
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Location: Marina Bay, Promenade, Esplanade, Marina Central
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Salted Egg Fries, Mixed Bruschetta, Handmade Arancini,
Asian Inspired Salmon Poke, Carte-Blanche Grill Menu, Signature Pastas Of All’ Arrabbiata, Polpa di Granchio, Al Funghi, Al Vino Bianco, Seafood Pasta. Squid Ink Risotto With Seafood & Signature Hand Opened Thin Crust Pizzas
data.ABOUT:
Feeling very much like a modern trattoria, the trendy wood and black steel décor of Supply & Demand is instantly eye catching, in part because of the restaurant’s spot at the relatively artsy Esplanade. With huge glass windows, plenty of diners clamour to snag a spot that affords them a view of the outdoors bustle, but few succeed unless they’re very lucky or, you know, they book in advance.
In terms of dishes, we’re happy to report this isn’t one of those places where the décor far outstrips the food. The menu is robust and boasts a wide variety of things you’d expect from an Italian joint; cichetti like Handmade Arancini, Beef Tagliata, Mixed Bruschetta, generous portions of Polpa Di Granchio, Carbonara Classico, and other pasta bigwigs – there’s even a whole section dedicated to risotto – plus pizza ranging from Hawaiian and Quatro Formaggio to unusual options such as Manzo Scottato (seared beef) and Gamberetti Piccante (spicy shrimp). The usual Italian offerings are more than enough, so we’re pleasantly surprised to see Supply & Demand go the extra mile by introducing something different in the form of Southeast Asian-inspired flavours. Sambal Marinara, Asian Inspired Salmon Poke, Salted Egg Fries, it’s a collision of two cultures that form unique combinations sure to pique your interest.  For a super casual Italian meal that’s inviting and delicious, this makes it into our top ten. (Aug 2017)

Feeling very much like a modern trattoria, the trendy old school chic décor of Supply & Demand is instantly eye catching, in part because of the restaurant’s isolated spot in the corner of Orchard Gateway. With huge glass windows and leafy trees, plenty of diners clamour to snag a spot that affords them a view of the bustle down below in Somerset, but few succeed unless they’re very lucky or, you know, they book in advance.
In terms of dishes, we’re happy to report this isn’t one of those places where the décor far outstrips the food. The menu is robust and boasts a wide variety of things you’d expect from an Italian joint; cichetti like Handmade Arancini, Beef Tagliata, Mixed Bruschetta, generous portions of Polpa Di Granchio, Carbonara Classico, and other pasta bigwigs – there’s even a whole section dedicated to risotto – plus pizza ranging from Hawaiian and Quatro Formaggio to unusual options such as Manzo Scottato (seared beef) and Gamberetti Piccante (spicy shrimp). The usual Italian offerings are more than enough, so we’re pleasantly surprised to see Supply & Demand go the extra mile by introducing something different in the form of Southeast Asian-inspired flavours. Sambal Marinara, Asian Inspired Salmon Poke, Salted Egg Fries, it’s a collision of two cultures that form unique combinations sure to pique your interest.  For a super casual Italian meal that’s inviting and delicious, this makes it into our top ten. (Aug 2017)

data.title: Sushi Ayumu by Masa Ishibashi
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The name “Ayu-mu” (あゆ夢) means walking towards a new beginning.

3 years ago, we started our journey stemming from a fervent respect and desire to share the rich heritage of “edomae” sushi. The name symbolised a fresh start with immense possibilities and was the inspiration of our longtime and dear friend, highly acclaimed Chef Masakazu Ishibashi, affectionately known as “Chef Masa” by his followers in Japan and Asia.

Today, we are extremely privileged and humbled to announce a new chapter and the continuation of our dream with the official rebrand to Sushi Ayumu by Masa Ishibashi.

This will be Chef Masa’s second outpost outside of Tokyo, following his successful “Sushi Nanami by Masa Ishibashi” in Taipei.

Chef Masa comes from a family which ran a sushi restaurant in Tochigi prefecture and spent a lot of time behind the counter growing up. Many of his followers would have known him as the Executive Chef for Ginza Sushi Ichi Tokyo, Jakarta, Bangkok and Singapore. He led its Singapore branch to Michelin 1-star before starting Shoukouwa where he led them as the first “sushiya” in Singapore to earn Michelin 2-stars in their first 2 years of business. In Nov 2017, he returned to Tokyo with his wife Tomomi to establish Sushi Masa Ishibashi at Ginza, where he has become the latest culinary sensation at the heart of Tokyo’s high end dining scene.

Known for his precision and finesse, Chef Masa will impart his eye for details and dynamism with us through this rebrand. Together, we will start walking towards a new dream to reflect his vision and interpretation of the perfect sushi “omakase” indulgence, along with our renowned “omotenashi” in a calm and luxurious intimate setting. We welcome you to embark on a memorable and decadent dining journey with us at “Sushi Ayumu by Masa Ishibashi”. Looking forward to the pleasure of your next visit very soon.

Yoroshiku Onegaishimasu. (May 2021)

data.title: Sushi Jin
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 1 Farrer Park Station Road#01-11/12Owen LinkSingapore (217562)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tai Carpaccio, Mini Wagyu Don, Truffle Seafood Chawanmushi, Ootoro Aburi Sushi, Unagi Chahan, Yuzu Mochi
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Japanese cuisine is still at the pinnacle of our palatal pilgrimage in sushi-obsessed Singapore, but a high-quality dining experience may not come with a plausible price tag – until now. The new concept by award-winning Les Amis Group is a "must-go" among Japanese food aficionados looking for a tranquil culinary escapade with a friend or two.

At Sushi Jin, you get the supreme freshness of ingredients flown in 3 times a week from Tokyo's Tsukiji market, known to be the world's largest and busiest fish market. This means, you can now save on airfare to Japan's favourite destination among jet-lagged tourists with predawn hours to kill, on top of a price-savvy menu.

Its menu boasts a plethora of appetizers, sashimi, sushi, maki, agemono, grilled items, noodles, rice, soup, and dessert. Chef's specials include Ootoro Aburi sushi, Wagyu Asupara maki, Gindara No Yuba Tempura and Gintara Tsuke Yaki. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Sushi Jiro (Keppel Bay)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 2 Keppel Bay Vista#02-01Marina at Keppel BaySingapore (098382)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Omakase, Wagyu Don, Sushi Platter
data.ABOUT:
Nakano Jiro-San founded Sushi Jiro over 2 decades ago with the sole aim of providing as authentic a Japanese dining experience to guests as possible. Armed with culinary skills gleaned from his experiences in Japan, Jiro-San has consistently offered his philosophy of respecting traditional methods of Japanese cuisine preparation and execution. Today he remains a pillar and mentor in Sushi Jiro's culinary team.

Simplicity lies in the center of Chef Kenji Nakagawa’s culinary philosophy. A master in the art of Edomae Sushi, Chef Kenji offers his best in crafting his Omakase experiences that has gained him a loyal following. His creations are often simple in form but delights the palate sensationally, exposing the skill and mastery behind every creation. His expansive knowledge of Japanese produce, from origins to characteristics of each ingredient combined with his art produces a divine Japanese dining experience. (Dec 2018)
