data.title: Sushi Kou
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 11 Cavenagh Road#01-13/14Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City CentreSingapore (229616)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tamago Tofu with Tobiko, Unagi Nasu Tempura, Gai Inaniwa Udon, Sesame Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
Sushi Kou offers value-for-money omakase sets with three delightful multi-course menus. At Sushi Kou, the best oceanic catch and seasonal vegetables are flown in twice a week from the restaurant's suppliers in Tokyo, Kyoto, and Hokkaido. The chefs then plan omakase menus around the bounty of fresh ingredients. Hence, each omakase experience is uniquely different. 

Opt for the seven-course menu if you want a quick introduction to omakase-style dining, with appetizers, sashimi platters, grilled items, and sushi.

Tamago Tofu with Tobiko is a steamed egg dish topped with flying fish roe for that extra burst of flavor. A great way to start the meal, this appetizer is light yet flavourful. A signature at Sushi Kou is the Unagi Nasu Tempura, with lightly fried unagi that’s rolled in eggplant. 

End your meal with the Gai Inaniwa Udon, topped with scallops, shrimps, and pumpkins. Featuring thinly sliced noodles that are braised before they are set to cool, the noodles are smooth and extremely tasty. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Sushi Mieda
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seasonal Seafood Items, Edomae-style Nigiri Sushi, Omakase Menu, Jyunsai, Miyazaki Mango, Tosazu Jelly
data.ABOUT:
If there's one thing the Chope team strives to avoid when it comes to describing a restaurant, it's hollow superlatives. With that said, a meal at Sushi Mieda is nothing short of breathtaking. Though what's served will change depending on what's in season in Japan at the current moment, you can be rest assured that everything will be prepared with craft and precision, earning Sushi Mieda a place among the upper crust of the best sushi restaurants in Singapore.
For our meal, we were welcomed with a starter of sea urchin atop sesame tofu, covered in a bonito-broth jelly, and garnished with a touch of caviar and gold leaf. Describing the combination of flavours and textures as a symphony probably doesn't do it justice; the balance of saltiness from the bonito jelly and sweetness from the sea urchin and sesame tofu meant it was more a masterpiece than any 'mere' composition.
Course after course convinced us that we were dining in the presence of a master craftsman. Head Chef Keisuke Ohno treated us to a dazzling array of fish both expected and uncommon. For the less sushi-seasoned, opportunities to sample fishes like golden-eyed snapper and black-throat perch will open your mind to an ocean far beyond salmon, tuna, and flounder.
The setting for this culinary master class is equally authentic. Seats at the sushi counter of eight make for an intimate dining experience, its position at the centre of the floor just emphasizing the exclusivity, while sitting at the "outside" tables lining the interior of the tower provide for spectacular views of the surrounding area.
Quite frankly, any meal at Sushi Mieda lets you leave the trappings of Collyer Quay far behind. An effortlessly bona fide Japanese experience, don't be surprised if you stumble back out, sated and blissful, and find yourself disorientated by the realization that you aren't standing on a street in Ginza. (Jul 2014)

data.title: Swee Choon Tim Sum Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mee Suah Kueh, Liu Sha Bao (Salted Egg Custard Bun), Xiao Long Bao, Prawn and Banana Fritters, Pan-fried Carrot Cake, Drunken Chicken, Fried Golden Tofu
data.ABOUT:
Dim Sum is food close to every Singaporean soul. Whether it’s fancy dim sum for Sunday brunch, humble dim sum for that post-party refuel, or the classic dim sum breakfast, dim sum always hits the spot.
When you’re a dim sum establishment that has been around for more than 50 years (yes, that’s as old as Singapore) but only opens from 6pm to 6am, then you know you’ve got your niche market down pat. Night owls swear by their Mee Suah Kueh, Prawn and Banana Fritters, and the Salted Egg Yolk Custard Bun. First two items are fairly unique, items that draw in the diners from all over Singapore, and the last, simply a really good rendition of an increasingly common dim sum item that almost every Singaporean loves.
The space is humble, the food is simple, but Swee Choon Tim Sum is timeless in its appeal. So the next time you want a taste of authenticity, you know where to go. (Aug 2015)

data.title: Switch by Timbre X
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Har Cheong Gai Chicken Nibbles, “Char” Hokkien Mee Spaghetti, “Lor Kurrobuto Bak Capellini, Hae Bee Hiam Pizza, Roast Duck Pizza, Switch Truffle Fries.
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located in the arts and heritage district of Bras Basah, Switch by Timbre X is a bilingual Mandarin and English live music venue and restro-bar by Timbre Group. This indoor venue recently underwent a refresh and has become a colourful and interactive space for customers!

The venue sets the stage for up-and-coming Singaporean musicians proficient in Mandarin and English pop-rock and sees live performances nightly; from an intimate 3-piece duo to a full 7-piece band rocking out on stage on weekend nights. Once a month, the stage turns into a platform for Chinese songwriters/singers to promote their original music under 新创 Series.

Not just a place for bilingual live music, the food and drinks menu features an exciting array of east-meets-west creations! Must-try food items include Har Cheong Gai Chicken Nibbles, “Char” Hokkien Mee Spaghetti, “Lor Kurrobuto Bak Capellini, Hae Bee Hiam Pizza, Roast Duck Pizza and Switch Truffle Fries.  For the best seller drinks, go with Frozen Kirin, Strawberry Basil Mojito or the exclusive Hendrick x Gryphon sets!

If you curate your Instagram feed, remember to order our “IG-worthy’ cocktails, like Smitten or Camomile Pixie and strike a post with the numerous neon-lighted signs at this venue! (Jan 2020)

data.title: Symmetry
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Symmetry Big Breakfast, Symmetry Waffles, Pancake Stack, Honey 5-Spiced Glazed Duck, Wagyu Rib-Eye A La Plancha, Black Truffle Risotto
data.ABOUT:
Located on the fringe of the historic Kampong Glam district, Symmetry is an all-day dining restaurant and bar with the laid-back sensibility of Aussie culture. Having just revamped their restaurant to reflect a more timeless and chic space, they have changed up and refreshed the menus as well. 

Serving up quintessential Australian fare with a contemporary spin, Symmetry's food expresses of who they are and what they believe in. To bring true Aussie flavours to the table, expect vibrant and bold flavours meticulously prepared with the finest and freshest produce without losing the sense of familiarity and comfort. 

Crowd Brunch favourites such as the Symmetry Big Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, and Symmetry Waffles are still a mainstay on the menu. But be sure to try out the waffles' close cousin, the Pancake Stack, served up with fresh berries, lemon curd cream cheese, maple syrup, a dollop of home-made caramelised banana compote topped with honey ice cream. 

Dinner sees all types of meat for every belly. From Honey 5-Spiced Glazed Duck to Wagyu Rib-Eye A La Plancha, Red Snapper to Braised Lamb Shank, there is something for everyone to feast on. Vegetarians can look forward to an indulgent Black Truffle Risotto served up with enoki fritters, tarragon creme fraiche and pecorino. The starters take no back seat with contenders such as Roasted Quail, Tiger Prawn Soldiers, and Pork Jowl Confit. (Jul 2018)

data.title: Syun
data.Hours: Wed-Sun:Lunch: 12pm (1st Seating) ; 1:30pm (2nd Seating)Dinner: 6pm (1st Seating) ; 8pm (2nd Seating)Closed Monday & Tuesday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sea Urchin Rolled by Wagyu Beef, Wagyu Beef Sukiyaki, Kurobuta Pork, Wagyu Beef Shabu-Shabu
data.ABOUT:
Singapore’s Japanese dining scene is vibrant, and has had plenty of new restaurants popping up every so often, but few offer the fresh take on seasonal dining that Syun does. Located in the luxe Crockfords Tower of Resorts World Sentosa, this spot pays homage to Japanese fine dining with their refreshing interpretations of classics. A sleek interior boasts natural accents like wood and marble and makes the perfect spot for a business lunch to impress, or even a date night to impress.

For a dish that is as delicious as it is Instagram-worthy, try the Sea Urchin Rolled by Wagyu Beef. Served on little gold spoons, the delight is made with the beloved Japanese uni rolled up in a thin strip of raw beef. Elegant and simple, it is the perfect way to prime your palate for the flavours to come. The Wagyu Beef Sukiyaki is a premium plate that is a must-try for meat lovers. Made with thin strips of premium meat cooked at the table, the beef absorbs the flavours of the broth and is so tender, it falls off the fork. Kurobuta Pork and Wagyu Beef Shabu-Shabu are also available for diners to enjoy at their tables. (March 2019)

data.title: Szechuan Court
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Angus Beef Shanghainese Gyoza, Barbecued Chicken Gold Coin, Avocado King Prawns, Jasmine Tea Smoked Duck, Clay Pot Jade Perch, Chrysanthemum Flaky Pastries
data.ABOUT:
Celebrating the love for regional Chinese cuisine, Szechuan Court is famous for dishing up impressively executed classic Cantonese dishes that are both visually spectacular and a feast for the stomach. 

Tickle your tastebuds with a serving of Pan Seared Angus Beef Shanghainese Dumpling and bite into mouthfuls of exquisitely crafted balls of pork infused with mushrooms. Dip these dumplings into aged vinegar for an extra burst of flavour. The Smokey Bacon Prawn Roll features crispy enoki mushrooms and gives a satisfying crunch with every bite. Do it yourself with the restaurant’s signature Jasmine Tea Smoked Duck! Served with pancake, scallion, cucumber and hoisin sauce, wrap the mouthwatering pieces of smoked duck in thinly stretched slices of pancakes before drenching in the rich hoisin sauce for the ultimate indulgence. 

Order a bowl of Steamed Healthy Jasmine Rice to pair with the plethora of side dishes available on offer. (Mar 2021)

data.title: TAAN IZA-BAR
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Saikoro Steak, Grilled Oyster, Nasu Miso, Korean Fried Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Taking after the spirit of an izakaya in Japan and a joo-mak in Korea, TAAN IZA-BAR’s menu is specially crafted to incorporate interesting izakaya and joo-mak dishes which perfectly complement the bar’s comprehensive drinks menu. The place’s jazz music and scattered soft lighting gives the bar a relaxed and romantic aura.

Taste the best of both worlds with the bar’s fusion menu of Japanese and Korean delights. Drenched in home-made sauce, the mix of Wagyu beef cubes and Shimeji mushrooms make up the Saikoro Steak, one of the most popular options on the menu. For seafood lovers, the Grilled Oyster is a yummy option that is spiced up with the addition of minced garlic sauce. The Oden and Nasu Miso are healthy yet delicious options, perfect for the health conscious. The former is a twist on a local favourite. Known as Japanese yong tau foo, the Oden is a light and nutritious one-meal dish that can be enjoyed any time of the day. 

Despite being smaller than the Japanese menu, the Korean options are also plenty. The Korean Fried Chicken is a classic favourite among diners. Featuring double fried boneless chicken tenders drizzled with Yangnyeom flavouring, these tasty treats are a highlight on the menu. (Jan 2021)

data.title: TANI - Modern Indian Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Caesar Salad, Bombay Chaat Platter, Quesadillas, Taco
data.ABOUT:
A contemporary bistro and bar that brings to diners an inspiring and modern take on Indian cuisine amidst the lush greenery of Zhongshan Park, TANI serves great food at affordable prices.


Start your meal with a Classic Caesar Salad. Always a well-loved classic bowl of greens, the salad is a tasty mix of lettuce, hard-boiled egg topped with croutons and parmesan cheese. An exciting trio of Bhel Puri, Sev Puri and Dahi Puri, the Bombay Chaat Platter is also another great dish to kickstart your meal. Move on to the mains with a hearty serving of Quesadillas. Sandwiched with your favourite fillings of grilled chicken or seasonal vegetables and melted cheese, these soft tortillas are just the thing to satisfy your Mexican cuisine cravings. Similar to the Quesadillas, the soft shell Taco comes in your choice of vegetable, chicken or fish and is served street style with beans, guacamole, sour cream and cheese.
 

Pair your meal with a drink from our bar menu to enjoy TANI’s happy hour promotion - happening all day long! (Nov 2020)

data.title: TANOSHII
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Sukiyaki, Kurobuta Shabu Shabu, Steamed Abalone, Kushikatsu, Tonkatsu, Escargot
data.PRESS RELEASE:
TANOSHII would like to invite you to discover through the pleasures in our dishes prepared by experienced chefs using the freshest fine ingredients. Our philosophy has always been to use the freshest ingredients to create simply delicious foods that can bring abundant pleasure in the taste.

TANOSHII presents the art of Japanese fusion and contemporary dining, a harmony of style and substance, tradition and innovation in the culinary delight. We offer you a selection of Japanese fusion plates in a contemporary and convivial atmosphere. (May 2019)

data.title: TAP (One Raffles Link)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Flaming Pasta Primavera, Pepper Beef Quinoa Bowl, Buffalo Wings, Taps' Wild West Burger, Chilli Beef Nachos
data.PRESS RELEASE: Inspired by American tap rooms, TAP is one of the first concepts in Singapore to boast 20 craft beers on tap at any time and a selection of 80 different bottled varieties. Core breweries include Modern Times Brewery, Lost Coast Brewery and Strand Brewing Co, as well as other renowned international craft breweries. TAP also offers tasting flights, beer floats and a curated food menu for an ideal pairing with its beers. (Mar 2020)

data.title: TEN Sushi
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salmon Tartar, Hegi-Soba Salad, 3 Kinds of Blue Fin Tuna Sushi, Fisherman Inside-Out-Roll, Vegetarian Eel & Cucumber Inside-Out Roll, Teriyaki Eel Don
data.ABOUT:
Pared down to the basics, it’s all about clean flavours and classic Japanese fare done right. TEN means “heaven” or “celebration” in Japanese and in the case of TEN Sushi, this can’t be more true: the cosy enclave is little more than a year old but has made its own splash with Sushi Master Marusaya at its helm. So whether you are looking for a mouthwatering array of fresh fish air-flown from Japan, impeccable hand-rolls, or just a comfy bowl of Don, TEN Sushi has got you more than covered. 
The Salmon Tartar provides an enticing sneak peek into the exhilarating epicurean journey ahead. A generous portion of salmon cubes is masterfully drizzled with a tangy spicy sauce that does not mask the salmon’s delightful creaminess, while the runny goodness of a perfectly poached onsen egg elevates the entire appetizer. Jumping right into mains, the sushi steals the show with its sheer freshness. Don’t believe us? Try the delicate 3 Kinds of Blue Fin Tuna Sushi for yourself. The rolls don’t disappoint either - the Fisherman Inside-Out-Roll, for instance, features 10 types of fresh fish, totally changing the game for your usual hand roll. 
Another highlight: the wide selection of sake, whiskey, and beers imported from Japan, so be sure to ask your friendly staff to recommend the perfect accomplice to a great meal! (Apr 2018)

data.title: TEPPAN by Chef Yonemura
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mushroom Croquette with Beef Stew Sauce, Wagyu Hamburg Steak, Clam and Lobster Bouillabaisse, Crepe Suzette
data.ABOUT:
With a kitchen helmed by lauded Chef Masayasu Yonemura, diners can rest assured that they are in good hands. His eponymous Kyoto restaurant was awarded One Michelin Star, and he is one of the most revered Japanese chefs in the world. This cosy spot in The Forum is his first foray outside of Japan, and was born out of his fascination with the traditional Japanese Teppan grill, and a desire to showcase the best of Eastern and Western cuisine.

Start with the Mushroom Croquette with Beef Stew Sauce. The richness of the mushroom and the tenderness of the beef make for a hearty combination. Crisp on the outside and tender on the inside, these little bites are the perfect for whetting your appetite. There are a range of meaty mains here - the Wagyu Hamburg Steak is cooked on the teppan grill and has a signature smoky flavour that seeps into the meat and gives it a unique flavour. Seafood enthusiasts will love the Clam and Lobster Bouillabaisse. Made with Dashi stock instead of fish broth, this dish is a rich comfort food perfect for a cold day. (March 2019)

data.title: TONITO Latin American Kitchen
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 78 Airport Boulevard #02-248 Jewel Changi AirportSingapore (819666)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mexican Ceviche, Fish Tacos, Pork Quesadilla,  Argentinian Prawn Pasta, Arroz Chaufa, Carne Asada
data.PRESS RELEASE:
HOLA, Welcome to TONITO Latin American Kitchen, where every bite feels like a party!
 

The only Latin American restaurant in the east serving family-friendly Latin American inspired dishes, TONITO introduces Latin American street food and staples the likes of Mexican quesadillas, Argentinian pastas as well as Peruvian stews. From tapas for sharing to classic desserts and cocktails, TONITO welcomes diners of all ages for a fuss-free spread against the beautiful panorama of the Rain Vortex, in its vibrant and cozy eatery.
 

TONITO Latin American Kitchen is a part of Singapore-based hospitality group, 1855 F&B, which also houses brands like The Spot, WAKANUI Grill Dining Singapore, Perch and Kam’s Roast Malaysia. (Mar 2021)

data.title: TORIO Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 50 Tiong Bahru Road#01-01Link Hotel Singapore (168733)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Special Sashimi, Unagi Don, Kani Miso Don, Toro Kubi Shioyaki, Chirashi
data.ABOUT:
The Japanese dining scene in Singapore is extremely varied, and has prices and dishes spanning from the very affordable to the exorbitant. However, there are rarely restaurants that succeed at marrying several aspects of the spectrum together, and TORIO is one of them. Their menu combines premium ingredients to dish out delicious recipes at affordable prices. Named after the Japanese word for trio, this restaurant is dedicated to showcasing the camaraderie, contribution, and commitment of its founding partners through their dishes. 

The Special Sashimi is a must-try. The plate features premium ingredients like Tuna, Salmon, and Sea Urchin, as well as two kinds of white fish -- well worth the price paid, being generous on portions and taste. The meat is plump and fresh, and the slices are paper-thin, which easily absorb the flavours of the condiments they are dipped into. Prefer a hearty grab-and-go lunch? Try the Unagi Don, a rich bowl of fluffy steamed rice served with a sizeable portion of grilled Japanese eel. The fish is spongy and the sweet and salty flavour of the meat gives flavour to the fragrant, pearly rice. (Mar 2019)

data.title: TWO Bakers (Serangoon)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Har Gheong Gai, Pink Crab Meat Pasta, Big Island Soba Bowl
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Perched along Teck Chye Terrace and just a few minutes away from Serangoon MRT Station, Two Bakers is a charming café serving specialty coffees and bespoke French and American pastries. This café also dishes out an array of delicious and savoury mains like Har Gheong Gai, Pink Crab Meat Pasta, Big Island Soba Bowl and many others.
With a menu packed with everything from sweet treats to savoury indulgences, you can be surely be certain of one thing, Two Bakers is the quintessential spot for brunch, lunch, dinner, and dessert! (Jun 2019)

data.title: TXA Gastrobar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ham Croquettes, Spanish Omelette, Coca de Serrano (Spanish Flatbread with Ibérico Serrano Ham), Honey Glazed Pork Rib, Grilled Octopus, Tarta de Queso “La Vina” (Burnt Cheesecake), Buenuelos De Viento (Spanish Donuts)
data.PRESS RELEASE:
TXA Gastrobar relaunches at The Alkaff Mansion with a new menu, focusing on Spanish grills and flavours. Chill out in style on our al fresco terrace, watch our chefs work their magic at the grill pod, smell the aroma curling up from the grill and enjoy this vibrant symphony for the senses!

Indulge in TXA ‘Char’ Grills or flavourful specialty dishes such as Ham Croquettes, Spanish Omelette, Coca de Serrano (Spanish Flatbread), Tarta de Queso “La Vina” (Burnt Cheesecake) and more. What’s more, treat yourself to our Sangria Punch Bowl, fully customisable to your tastebuds and one of its kind in Singapore.

TXA Gastrobar is the perfect buzzy hangout spot for a delicious, casual Spanish dinner and evening drinks under the night sky. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Table At 7
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tahu Telor, Ayam Penyet, Udang Cumi Bakar, Nasi Kuning Platter, Wagyu Oxtail Rendang, Pisang Goreng, Sticky Date Pudding
data.ABOUT: Table at 7 serves Asian-Indonesian food at Bukit Timah. Helmed by executive chefs Karl Dobler and Eugenia Ong, their passion for diverse culinary experiences led them to Table At 7 - the perfect platform for them to share their culinary craft with the world.Serving food prepared with the most exceptional ingredients, your taste buds are in for a real treat. With fresh and exciting offerings, Table at 7's menu boasts a medley of dishes that pay tribute to both Asian and Indonesian cuisine. Carefully crafted and updated to include seasonal dishes to tantalise diners, the ever-changing set menus feature decadent dishes not to be missed out on. Start with a simple but delicious House-Smoked Ocean Trout Salad to whet your appetite before moving on to the filling mains, such as the Beef Rendang Burger or Black Angus Sirloin Steak. Served with a generous amount of fries or truffle mash potatoes, these delightful mains are sure to fill you up.End your meal on a sweet note with a Sticky Date Pudding. Paired with butterscotch and vanilla ice cream, this sweet treat is the perfect way to end an indulgent meal. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Tablescape Restaurant & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 10 Coleman StreetLevel 3Grand Park City HallSingapore (179809)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 62°C Egg with Asparagus, Parmigiano and Black Truffle, Black Angus Beef Tataki, Black Angus Beef Cheek, Carnaroli Risotto with Cauliflower, Smoked Duck and Foie Gras, Iberico Pork Chop, Pan Roasted Barramundi with Eggplant, Tomato and Burrata, Soufflé served Crème Anglaise
data.ABOUT:
Set to become City Hall’s newest dining destination, Tablescape is located on level three of the hotel, and guests can expect an upscale restaurant serving an innovative approach to Modern European classics complemented by a contemporary bar. Reflecting the hotel’s thoughtful approach to service a ritualistic table-side trolley service will complete your dining experience.
Tablescape will reinterpret classic European flavour profiles with a menu delivering a refined selection of dishes, from starters, main courses of premium meats and fish grilled to perfection on a Josper Charcoal Oven to inspired desserts; while the bar celebrates the best of European classic cocktails infused with Asian nuances in the form of bespoke cocktails by the glass, communal cocktail punchbowls and barrel aged cocktails brewed at the bar, complemented by an extensive selection of craft beers and premium wines. (Jan 2019)

data.title: Taikoo Lane Hotpot 太古里火锅
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Noodles, Spicy Marinated Beef, Pandan Ice Jelly with Coconut Milk
data.ABOUT:
Experience the best of both worlds at Taikoo Lane Hotpot. Aimed to showcase the best of Sichuanese and Cantonese cuisine with diners, it is guaranteed to evoke the taste of home, as well as cultivate new memories.

No matter your party size, Taikoo Lane Hotpot offers individual and larger sharing pots, alongside an extensive variety of soup bases. This includes the well-loved Sichuan Spicy Broth and local favourite Fish Soup Broth with Fresh Milk.

Seafood lovers must sample the Shrimp Skewer, which comes in two varieties. The first is raw to accentuate its natural sweetness, while the second is marinated with Cajun spices, packing a flavourful punch! Their Lobster Noodles are also delicious. Simply cook the lobster and noodles in the flavourful broth, then drizzle on Taikoo Lane Hotpot’s special condiments!

If you prefer red meat, must-tries include the Spicy Marinated Beef, seasoned with an intoxicating medley of spices that includes sugar, chilli powder and red pepper flakes. 

Beyond hotpot, Taikoo Lane Hotpot also serves a variety of cooked dishes such as their signature Braised Beef Short Ribs. End your meal on a sweet note and try the Pandan Ice Jelly with Coconut Milk. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Tajimaya Yakiniku (Great World)
data.Hours: Mon-Fri: 12-3pm, 6-10pmSat, Sun & PH: 11:30am-4pm, 6-10pm (Last Order for Kitchen: 2:15pm for Lunch, 9:15pm for Dinner)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.Address: 1 Kim Seng Promenade #B1-114/115 Great World CitySingapore (098585)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tajimaya Tasting Platter, Japanese Miyazaki Beef, Miyazaki Tenderloin, Chawanmushi
data.ABOUT:
Indulge in a signature Yakiniku experience with a premium selection of meats to pick from, and an exclusive Omakase experience at Great World.

Showcasing the best Japanese charcoal grill experience, the Tajimaya Tasting Platter is an impressive assortment of nine distinct chef selected premium Japanese meat cuts, served with seven different appetisers and sides to complete the meal. Alternatively, hop on a gastronomical ride with an affordable omakase style dining experience. Featuring seasonal ingredients and refined flavours not to be missed out on, sit in on an authentic Japanese dining experience with your choice of a la carte menu options, an omakase affair or with the crowd favourite Tajimaya Wagyu Beef Buffet. 

Made for intimate dining sessions, the Japanese Miyazaki Beef comes in a set for two and features a fine selection of premium cuts such as the Miyazaki RIbeye, Miyazaki Tenderloin and more. Served up with delectable side dishes, take your pick of Tempura or Chawanmushi to go with the hearty feast that awaits. (May 2021)

data.title: Tajimaya Yakiniku (VivoCity)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Miyazaki Beef, Garlic Fried Rice, US Wagyu Beef, Kurobuta Pork, Kimchi Soup, Ishiyaki Don, Udon, Tempura
data.ABOUT:
Yakiniku is one of the great pillars of Japanese cuisine: the practice of grilling succulent cuts of meat over a charcoal fire. The basic elements are almost religious in their simplicity: beautifully marbled and fresh meat, a smoky fire, and some subtle dipping sauces to go along. Oh, and bowlfuls of steaming hot rice on which to baste those hot, meaty drippings. 

Here at Tajimaya, the menu is basically page after page of different grades of top-grade meat, though really they are most famous for their offerings of divine Miyazaki Beef offered in a range of cuts from ribeye to chuck short rib. Choose from an à la carte menu or simply get the set, which comes with a generous lineup of sides from crunchy Tempura to a daily selection of Sashimi, as well as a comforting bowl of Garlic Fried Rice. Apart from Miyazaki beef, there is US Wagyu and US Angus, as well as fatty Kurobuta Pork for lovers of that other great barbecue meat. The pork is available in a range of cuts as well, including the unctuous jowl cut, or meltingly tender cheek that will reduce to a fatty sliver of joy in your mouth. 

To undercut all of that meaty goodness, other dishes here include Korean-inspired soups like Kimchi Soup and hot-stone Ishiyaki Dons filled with meat and vegetables crackling from the heat of the bowl. To fill up, slurp up some piping hot Udon. With meat this good, you’ll want very little else but rice, but these other options make this restaurant perfect for hitting every corner of that Japanese craving you’ve been nursing. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Takada Grill & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: US Black Angus Ribeye, Japan Ohmi A4 Wagyu Rump, AU Angus Tomahawk, SP Iberico Pork Neck, Gelato Affogato, Wasabi Shoyu Sauce
data.ABOUT:
Located on the upscale Wallich Street in Tanjong Pagar is this gorgeous eatery serving up Japanese classics with a delightful Western twist. With a kitchen helmed by the acclaimed Masahiro Takada, who honed his skills working in Michelin-starred eateries across Japan and Italy, diners can rest assured that they are in good hands here. From hearty and affordable lunch sets to deliciously juicy grilled steaks cooked in a special charcoal grill, the mind-boggling variety of dishes available here will have diners spoiled for choice. 

The Charcoal Grill menu features an array of meats including Shorthorn Striploin, Angus Tomahawk, and Angus Ribeye. There is also Pan-Seared Barramundi, Boston Lobster, and Roasted Chicken on offer for diners who prefer other meats. Want something a little moreish? The various lunch options are sure to fill you up without burning a hole in your wallet. The Dons here come with piping hot Miso Soup and Hokkaido Rice, and are available with Chicken Teriyaki, Beef Steak, and Au Wagyu. There is also Takada Pork Katsu Curry, which is served with fluffy steamed rice and made with juicy slices of pork. There is also Vegetarian Basil Pesto for diners who prefer a plant-based dish instead. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Takayama Japanese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Abalone + Uni, Saikyo Miso Black Cod, Grilled Kumamoto Wagyu Beef
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Takayama Japanese Restaurant invites you to an intimate epicurean encounter steeped in the tradition of fine Japanese cuisine. Indulge in a multi-course menu that celebrates seasonal ingredients at the peak of their flavours, as Executive Chef Taro Takayama and his team curate every dish to exquisite perfection right before your eyes.

At the heart of dining at Takayama Japanese Restaurant is the spirit of omotenashi, or wholehearted Japanese hospitality, graciously delivered in the elegant ambience of this exclusive kappo-style restaurant cocooned in the midst of Singapore's Central Business District.

The menu at Takayama pays homage to the food culture in Osaka, which came to be known during the Edo period as "the kitchen of the world" and where people, to this day, take great pride in their local cuisine.

Inspired by the four seasons of Japan, our menu and cooking styles are dictated by the freshest ingredients in season. Our signature dish, Abalone + Uni, is the ultimate celebration of this inspiration. Beverages, too, are curated with the seasons in mind to complement the cuisine at Takayama Japanese Restaurant. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Takeshi-San
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Incredible Hulk, Sushi Kaidan Sets, Mexican Roll, A5 Wagyu Inaniwa Udon with Truffle and Onsen Egg
data.ABOUT:
Takeshi-San is a sushi restaurant in Holland Village offering Japanese specialties that take on a classy and elegant approach.

It’s all about the rolls here at Takeshi-San! A smashing hit, the Incredible Hulk is a tasty mix of avocado, salmon roe with soft fluffy grains of Japanese rice perfect for sharing with family and friends. Another equally delicious menu option is the Mexican Roll. Made up of a unique combination of shrimp, cream cheese, crispy tempura bits, these mouthfuls of delights are finished off with a fiery spicy sauce.

For those with a bigger appetite, the restaurant’s Sushi Kaidan Sets will definitely satisfy all your sushi cravings. These sets are aesthetically presented with different pieces of sushi on a staircase-like wooden contraption. Truly indulgent, every piece of sushi is a passionate creation of pure enjoyment. For meat lovers, the A5 Wagyu Inaniwa Udon with Truffle and Onsen egg is a beautiful amalgamation of flavors that will have you putting your hands up for seconds. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Talay Thai
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chu Chi Lobster Curry, Tom Yum Lobster Bisque, Char Grilled Baby Back Ribs, Pineapple Fried Rice, Neau Yang Satay, Tamarind Grilled Prawn
data.ABOUT:
Thai food gets a swish update at Talay Thai in Clarke Quay. The space is all sexy dim lighting, cheeky neon-lit signs, and little Thai accents in the decor. Think gritty Bangkok streets and lux Singapore nightlife; you’d be forgiven for thinking it’s a newfangled cocktail bar!
The food is modern Thai and draws from different Thai regional cuisines, giving them fun and glamorous make-overs. Seafood takes pride of place here, with a mix of traditional and modern touches. If you like oysters, here they come topped with Asian-inspired granita or served with fiery Thai chili jam. Tender Norwegian salmon is served like you’ve never had it before: dressed in sweet and sour Nam Jin Sauce. That old hawker centre classic, grilled stingray, comes to the table with lashings of tamarind relish. Not to be outdone, French lobster bisque gets the hot and tangy tom yum treatment. It’s not just seafood. Pork and chicken dishes get similar Thai makeovers, and there’s plenty of classics like Phad Thai and various Thai curries to sate your Thai craving. Classic Thai food with swish touches, what’s not to love? (Sep 2016)

data.title: Tamago-EN (313)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer, Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko, The Ultimate TKG, Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake
data.ABOUT:
Delight in all things egg-related here at Tamago-EN. True to its name, the restaurant features a variety of dishes that feature your favourite Japanese egg as the star of the show. Using only the freshest eggs imported directly from Okinawa, delight in the orange yolk unique to Japanese eggs and revel in the fluffy texture of Tamago-EN’s delicious egg dishes. 

Order the 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer for an Instagrammable dish that’s a feast for the eyes and appetite! Each skewer comes with a different assortment of toppings, creating a bright, colourful and appetising dish. Soft and fresh on the inside, and springy on the outside, these tasty sticks of Tamago leaves a wonderfully sweet aftertaste. 

Topped with a runny egg and bonito flakes, the Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko is a must-try that tastes even better than it looks. The star of the menu, however, is The Ultimate TKG. Also known as Tamago Kake Gohan, whip the egg white into a fluffy cloud-like texture and add your favourite toppings for the ultimate indulgence. For dessert, be sure to order the Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake to end your meal on a sweet note. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Tamago-EN (Chinatown Point)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer, Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko, The Ultimate TKG, Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake

For dessert, be sure to order the Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake to end your meal on a sweet note. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Tamago-EN (Northpoint City)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer, Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko, The Ultimate TKG, Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake
data.ABOUT:
Delight in all things egg-related here at Tamago-EN. True to its name, the restaurant features a variety of dishes that feature your favourite Japanese egg as the star of the show. Using only the freshest eggs imported directly from Okinawa, delight in the orange yolk unique to Japanese eggs and revel in the fluffy texture of Tamago-EN’s delicious egg dishes. 

Order the 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer for an Instagrammable dish that’s a feast for the eyes and appetite! Each skewer comes with a different assortment of toppings, creating a bright, colourful and appetising dish. Soft and fresh on the inside, and springy on the outside, these tasty sticks of tamago leaves a wonderfully sweet aftertaste. 

Topped with runny egg and bonito flakes, the Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko is a must try that tastes even better than it looks. The star of the menu however, is The Ultimate TKG. Also known as Tamago Kake Gohan, whip the egg white into a fluffy cloud like texture and add your favourite toppings for the ultimate indulgence. For dessert, be sure to order the Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake to end your meal on a sweet note. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Tamashii
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.ABOUT:
There is a certain purity to top-notch quality ingredients grilled with care and perfection, a implicit respect afforded to such delightful offerings from nature. At Tamashii along North Canal Road, that’s precisely what you get. An elegant blend of tradition and panache, food is served on wooden oars in homage to Japanese fishermen who did the same once upon a time.
The freshest ingredients are flown in regularly from Japan, and Chef Patrick Tan continuously goes out of his way to prepare the amazing produce in tantalising, and occasionally fascinating ways! Previous seasonal stunners include grilled squid lips, ivory shell sashmi (called Shiro Baigai in Japanese), and Japanese clams served in a variety of ways.
You can’t go to a Japanese robataya without having some grilled fish though, and the seasonal Barracuda was grilled to perfection. The skin of the fish was crispy, the flesh moist and tender. It tasted of the grill and the sea, and felt like a portal to being seated on the beach, charcoal in the sand, and fish straight from the ocean.
We love the idea of walking into your favourite restaurant and eagerly asking “what’s in season right now?” Whether it’s the fruit of the land or the fruits of the ocean, there’s definitely only the freshest ‘fruit’ on offer at Tamashii, and we’re always eager to be introduced to something new, delicious, and satisfying whenever we visit. (Aug 2013)

data.title: Tandoor
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 11 Cavenagh RoadHoliday Inn Singapore Orchard City CentreBasement 1Singapore (229616)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mango Curry, Goan Fish Curry, Nimbu Murgh Ka Tikka, Bailey's Kulfi, Bollywood Bellini
data.ABOUT:
Tandoor re-opens on Thursday, 14 January 2021 and will operate from Wednesdays to Sundays.Established in 1985, Tandoor, Singapore’s most awarded Indian restaurant, takes diners on a journey with authentic North Indian dishes that pay homage to India's rich culinary heritage. Each dish in the gourmet menu is carefully handcrafted by a team of talented chefs using classic recipes and time honoured methods which date back in time across India’s rich history. Ever conscious of our diners’ palettes, some dishes use healthier preparation methods while retaining their original Indian heritage.

Contemporary yet laced with tradition, Tandoor’s interior is dotted with subtle Indian motifs. Back-lit wall panels featuring Jaali (or Jali) ─ a latticed screen characteristic of Indian architecture – line two sides of the restaurant, while twin alabaster pillars house the traditional Indian craft of inlay mirrors.

Full-length windows give diners an intimate view of the kitchen where two custom-made copper tandoors (or clay ovens) stand. From the dining hall, you will be able to see our chefs at work, from making Indian breads to preparing kebabs of tandoori meats and vegetables that are served fresh to your table, presents an inviting atmosphere where you can enjoy good food and great conversations with family, friends and clients alike. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Tandoori Culture (Boon Tat)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Vegetable Soup,  Punjabi Dal Tadka, Mutton Rogan Josh, Gulab Jamun
data.ABOUT:
To find authentic Indian food, look no further than Tandoori Culture. With a branch located at Boon Tat Road in Telok Ayer, this cosy establishment offers a casual and relaxed atmosphere with excellent Indian food. Popular with Singaporean gourmets, Tandoori Culture specialises in food cooked in a traditional tandoor oven, or an oven made of clay. This method of cooking slowly extracts the rich flavours from the component ingredients, resulting in fragrant and impactful dishes sure to make your tastebuds sing.

Start your meal with the Vegetable Soup, consisting of sweet corn, manchal and dal, and make your way to the entrees, which includes vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. For vegetarians, be sure to try the Punjabi Dal Tadka, consisting of yellow lentils cooked with butter and mixed with a medley of vegetables, including fried chopped onions, coriander and tomatoes. Beyond greens, try the Mutton Rogan Josh, consisting of bite-sized mutton cubes braised and blended with an eclectic mix of spices, and served in a creamy curry sauce.

Finish your meal with Gulab Jamun, consisting of fried balls comprised of milk and flour, and soaked in saffron-flavoured sugar. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Tandoori Culture (HillV2)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tandoori Lamb Chops, Chicken Tikka, Samosa, Paneer Tikka, Butter Chicken, Palak Paneer, Veg Chilli Milli
data.ABOUT:
To find authentic Indian food, look no further than Tandoori Culture. With a branch located at HillV2 near Hillview MRT station, this brightly-lit establishment offers a simple yet elegant interior, serving excellent Indian food in a casual atmosphere.  Popular with Singaporean gourmets, Tandoori Culture specialises in food cooked in a traditional tandoor oven, or an oven made of clay. This method of cooking slowly extracts the rich flavours from the component ingredients, resulting in fragrant and impactful dishes sure to make your tastebuds sing.

Start your meal with the Vegetable Soup, consisting of sweet corn, manchal and dal, and make your way to the entrees, which includes vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. For vegetarians, be sure to try the Punjabi Dal Tadka, consisting of yellow lentils cooked with butter and mixed with a medley of vegetables, including fried chopped onions, coriander and tomatoes.

Beyond greens, try the Mutton Rogan Josh, consisting of bite-sized mutton cubes braised and blended with an eclectic mix of spices, and served in a creamy curry sauce.

Finish your meal with Kheer, a Basmati rice pudding made with coconut milk, raisins, cardamom, and toasted almonds and pistachios. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Tang Chao @ One Bowl
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Oil Dumpling, Tom Yum Vermicelli Soup, Spice Salt Prawn, Deshelled Prawns with Salted Egg
data.ABOUT:
A place where people can come together and build connections, Tang Chao @ One Bowl prepares every dish with quality and love, bringing together different flavours to provide diners with sweetness, happiness, warmth, and satisfaction.

Work up an appetite by starting with the restaurant’s signature cold dishes. Glazed with a mix of fiery chilli and different spices, the Chilli Oil Dumpling is a mouthwatering dish not to be missed out on! For those who prefer a less spicy alternative, the Tofu with Pork Floss and Preserved Egg is a great choice that tastes as good as it looks. Pocket friendly one dish meal options are also available on the menu. The Tom Yum Vermicelli Soup is a popular option that affords diners with three different meat options. Choose either seafood, pork, or chicken to go with your broth for a warm and satisfying meal. The Curry Chicken dish is a traditional favourite that comes with a serving of buns or rice set to fill you up.

Seafood lovers are in for a treat with the restaurant’s prawn centric menu. Offering Spice Salt Prawn, Deshelled Prawns with Salted Egg and a Fried Prawn Platter, seafood lovers will surely be spoilt for choice. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Tang Lung Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 80 Mohamed Sultan Road#01-12The Pier at RobertsonSingapore (239013)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steamed Flower Crab in Shaoxing Wine and Chicken Oil, Steamed Glutinous Rice with Yellow Roe Crab, Braised Sea Cucumber with Mushroom in Chinese Herbs, Salted Egg Yolk Siew Mai
data.ABOUT:
Showcasing only the best of Chinese cuisine from different regions, Tang Lung Restaurant serves an expansive spread of over 60 dishes to choose from. From casual lunches to decadent dim sum high teas and hearty family dinners, Tang Lung Restaurant has got you covered. 

Come in groups to enjoy a wide selection of all that the restaurant has to offer. Highly recommended plates include the signature Steamed Flower Crab in Shaoxing Wine and Chicken Oil, Steamed Glutinous Rice with Yellow Roe Crab and Braised Tofu with Bonito Flakes. A traditional favourite not to be missed out on is the Braised Sea Cucumber with Mushroom in Chinese Herbs. This herbal pot of sea cucumber and mushrooms is a flavourful dish with high nutritional value. Best enjoyed with the Deep Fried Soon Hock in Superior Soya Sauce, these two dishes complement each other perfectly and are sure to leave you coming back for more. 

An array of dim sum delights are also available here. Delicately executed, the must-haves include the Pineapple Char Siew Tart and Salted Egg Yolk Siew Mai. Runny and salty, the rich salted egg yolk is wrapped in a mix of minced pork, flying fish roll and thinly rolled wonton skin. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Tangerine
data.Good For: Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Short Rib and Foie Gras, Hor Mok, Yuba with Organic Onsen Egg
data.ABOUT:
There aren’t many farm-to-table establishments in Singapore, so this unique spot in the lush ESPA of Resorts World Sentosa a must-visit. The spices used here are handpicked from their own garden, and the menu features wholesome Thai-inspired fare made with healthy ingredients like whole grains, fresh fruits, and premium free-range poultry. Helmed by famed Thai chef and restaurateur Ian Kittichai, diners can expect quality dishes plated exquisitely. Wood-panelled interiors and floor to ceiling windows welcome you as you overlook the elegant gardens -- the perfect place to enjoy a tranquil meal away from the hustle and bustle of the city. 

The Beef Short Rib and Foie Gras is a must-try. The combination of premium grass-fed beef with buttery foie gras makes for a unique and rich sensation. For something a little more adventurous, try the Hor Mok, a curry simmered with banana leaves. Served with a side of coconut milk, this pretty little orange mound is bursting with flavour from traditional Thai spices like galangal and red chilli. Topped with a generous serving of crisp greens, the curry is a great option for diners who like some spice in their dishes. (March 2019)

data.title: Tanjong Beach Club - Indoor & Alfresco
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Açai Bowl, Smashed Avo Toast, Smoked Salmon on Toasted Brioche, Burrata & Heirloom Tomatoes Salad, Crispy Skin Barramundi, Beef Ribs, Crunchy Brioche French Toast, Crab Linguine, Flourless Chocolate Cake, Pavlova, Apple Tart
data.ABOUT:
Lauded by Condé Nast Traveller as one of the World's Best Beach Clubs, Tanjong Beach Club is a serene sanctuary located on the finest sun-soaked stretch of sand in Sentosa. Designed to straddle the line between indoors and outdoors, the beach club takes its cue from the seaside homes of yesteryear, mid-century modernism and nostalgic maritime influences. 

On weekdays, it is a peaceful hideaway from Singapore's concrete jungle, offering a slice of tropical paradise mere minutes away from the heart of the city. 

Over the weekends, the club transforms into a celebration of vibrancy and living a life more carefree. Take your pick from the lively string of parties running all year round, adorn yourselves with specially curated accessories from The Beach Shop and prepare to dance the night away. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Tapas Club (Jewel Changi)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jamon Iberico, Tortilla de Patatas, Croquetas de Jamon, Huevos Estrellados, Pluma Iberica, Paella Mixta, Churros
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Say hola to the bright and festive flavours of Spanish cuisine with Tapas Club, a sleek and sophisticated eatery that promises food so authentic you’ll feel like you were whisked away to the Iberian Peninsula itself.

Embark on your evening our lunch with some cold cut platters, such as the Tabla De Embutidos. This platter features a variety of mixed Ibérico cold cuts, such as chorizo and salchichón. Paired with some bread and a dab of tomato puree, you will be hankering for more of these delicious morsels. For more yummy bites, the heavenly Croquetas De Setas, otherwise known as mushroom croquettes, can’t be beaten.

And what’s a Spanish eatery without some paella? Gorge yourself on one of the many paellas available. Our favorite has to be the Arroz Negro, highlighting fresh cuttlefish and clams in squid ink paella. Authentic and bold Spanish fare takes center stage at Tapas Club, so swing on by the next time you’re in the neighborhood. (Apr 2019)

data.title: Tapasta Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Creamy Fusilli, Roasted Chicken Thigh, Salmon, Cajun Mushrooms, Chicken Meatballs
data.ABOUT:
For a healthy yet hearty option in the bustling CBD, head to Tapasta Bar. This fresh concept serves pasta and grain bowls by day, and Spanish-style tapas (sharing plates) by night. There are no fixed combinations here; instead, diners put together their own bowl from an array of fresh ingredients. 

The Creamy Fusilli is a good base to build your bowl around. The curly pasta is cooked al dente and bathed in a rich, aromatic sauce laced with garlic and onion. For mains to go with the pasta, try the Salmon — the fish is grilled til’ fork-tender, with a crisp skin. Also good is the Roasted Chicken Thigh, with a lightly-peppered skin and succulent juicy meat. 

Dinner is a good time to head over with friends, you can sit back and share nibbles in a leisurely fashion. Be sure to try the Cajun Mushrooms, an addictive snack of plump button mushrooms encased in a golden-brown battered skin. The Chicken Meatballs, a must-have, is a well-seasoned dish that provides satisfaction with every bite. (Jun 2019)

data.title: Tarte By Cheryl Koh
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Strawberry Tart, Cherry Tart, Pistachio Tart, Fraisier, Dark Chocolate Cake, Bacon & Mustard Brioche, Whisky Truffles
data.PRESS RELEASE:
In 2015, Tarte by Cheryl Koh took Singapore by storm when they open their first retail shop at Shaw Centre. Helmed by Cheryl Koh, a Singaporean chef who was crowned 'Asia's Best Pastry Chef' by the Asia's 50 Best Restaurants Award, Tarte has since made a name for itself in Singapore and the rest of the region.

The various artisanal tarts and other confectioneries on offer are baked from scratch every morning with only the best available ingredients sourced from around the world. Many of these ingredients are highly sought-after and rarely served in Singapore. This is because when it comes to desserts, very few chefs in Singapore are willing to invest in seasonal fruit. Cheryl, however, is not one to compromise on quality. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Tasty Loong @ Link Hotel
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Stewed Rice Vermicelli with Seafood and Supreme Stock in Opeh Leaf, Braised Charcoaled Tofu with Minced Pork and Dried Shrimps, Poached Chinese Spinach with Sea Clam and Trio Eggs, Soya Bean Milk Pudding with Mango Puree
data.ABOUT:
Experience the taste of Nanyang right in the vicinity of Siglap. Owned and operated by multi-award-winning celebrity chef, chef Pung Lu Tin, the restaurant serves traditional Chinese dishes with a touch of modern creativity.

A scrumptious creation by chef Pung Lu Tin is the Stewed Rice Vermicelli with Seafood and Supreme Stock in Opeh Leaf. Nicely diced into bite-sized pieces and braised in supreme chicken stock, the ingredients are tossed with prawns and scallops, enhancing the flavour of the dish. The Braised Charcoaled Tofu with Minced Pork and Dried Shrimps also pack a punch of flavours. Cooked over a hot stove to bring out the flavours of the silken tofu, the dish is topped with fried minced pork and dried shrimps.

Another mouthwatering dish is the Poached Chinese Spinach with Sea Clam and Trio Eggs. End your meal on sweet and savoury notes with the Soya Bean Milk Pudding with Mango Puree.

Delicious, innovative and fresh, the food at Tasty Court by Chef Pung transforms every visit into an unforgettable dining experience. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Tasty Loong @ Orto Park
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Dried Seafood in Golden Chicken Broth, Jack Fruit Chilli Crab, Fried Kway Teow with Signature Seafood Chilli Sauce, Pomelo Sago with Mango Cream
data.ABOUT:
Owned and operated by multi-award-winning celebrity chef, chef Pung Lu Tin, the restaurant serves traditional Chinese dishes with a touch of modern creativity. Leveraging years of experience, Chef Pung Lu Tin brings his signature flair to this restaurant.

Meals here are great for large groups, with multiple set options such as the Friends Gathering Set, Family Gathering Set, Local Flavours Set and more! Try the Braised Dried Seafood in Golden Chicken Broth. Each mouthful more delicious than the last, the braised seafood and rich chicken broth perfectly complement each other, bringing out the flavours of the braised prawns and scallops. 

A speciality dish at the restaurant, order the Jack Fruit Chilli Crab for a unique yet fun combination of flavours. Dip the accompanying fried buns in the innovative sauce for a burst of flavours. The Fried Kway Teow with Signature Seafood Chilli Sauce is a delightfully sinful dish that has just the right amount of wok hey flavour without being too oily. 

Absolutely delicious, innovative and fresh, the food at Tasty Loong by Chef Pung transforms every visit into an unforgettable dining experience. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Tea Lounge
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Lobster Laksa with Rice Noodles, Regent's Signature Scones, Egg Mimosa Finger Sandwiches, Lamb Quiches
data.ABOUT:
Enjoy a quintessential Afternoon Tea in a contemporary colonial garden setting. Delight in freshly ground aromatic coffee or a perfect cup of precisely decanted Gryphon tea blends. For an unconventional refreshment, opt for a TipTree mocktail or cocktail.
With our signature pastries and sandwiches served on a three-tiered Afternoon Tea stand, look forward to relaxing over delectable gourmet offerings and a leisurely afternoon tête-à-tête.

Notice: During this period of phased openings, buffets will not be available at Tea Lounge. A three-tiered Afternoon Tea set and desserts will be served to your table on weekdays, with additional pass-around main courses on weekends. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Tea Room (Amara Singapore)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: English High Tea Set, Parma Ham and Cheese Sandwich, Raisin Scone, Coconut Macaron
data.ABOUT:
Escape the hubbub of the city and chill out at this elegant spot in the Amara Hotel. With mood lighting and chilled out tunes, this is the perfect place to unwind with a cup of tea and some finger food. Whether you’re a high-tea newbie or a seasoned visitor, the spread at the Tea Room is sure to impress. Guests can choose their favourite type of TWG tea to be brewed, and enjoy it with a variety of light bites that will tide you through dinner.

The Parma Ham and Cheese sandwich is definitely a must-try. For something a little lighter, the Classic and Raisin Scones are a great way to indulge your sweet tooth without going overboard. These airy treats come with a side of Devonshire cream jam, and butter. Feeling indulgent? Treat yourself and a friend to the English High Tea set, one that comes with a pot of premium brewed tea, and sweet and savoury treats on the side such as Mushroom Tarts and Coconut Macarons. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Tea Villa Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mac and Cheese Pizza,  Chilli Paneer Dry, Risotto with Pesto Sauce, Peach Fairies
data.ABOUT:
Warm and cherry, Tea Villa Cafe offers a wide range of premium teas, pizzas, pastas and a variety of Lebanese, Indian and Mexican food.

Delivering mouthwatering Western classics and traditional delights, don’t miss out on trying their Mac and Cheese Pizza. A tantalising carb on carb option, the harmonious combination of mac and cheese atop a tangy tomato base is a definite must-try. For those looking for a flaming good time, the Schezwan Noodles is an addictively fiery dish loved by regulars.

Other signature dishes include the Chilli Paneer Dry, Risotto with Pesto Sauce and more. An aesthetically pleasing dish that features an attractive selection of hummus dips served alongside a generous portion of pita bread and falafels, the Villa Special Hummus Platter is great for sharing among friends. Wash it all down with a refreshing cup of the cafe’s popular Peach Fairies.

Unlike your conventional cafe, Tea Villa Cafe provides diners with a unique range of Indian-Chinese dishes on top of your favourite cafe picks. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Tekong Seafood Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Oyster Omelette, Fried French Beans, Thai Style Tofu, Ginger and Spring Onion Lobster, Nyonya Steamed Fish
data.ABOUT:
Don’t be fooled! Despite what its name suggests, Tekong Seafood Restaurant is rooted firmly on the mainland. Based in Changi Village, this storied culinary establishment that was formerly based on Pulau Tekong has been wowing diners with its consistently fresh seafood and Chinese cuisine for over thirty-five years and counting.
Here, freshness is practically guaranteed as the restaurant tends to use live seafood that has been recently caught by local fishermen off the Singapore coast. And there’s something for everyone. For the health-conscious eaters, the Nyonya Steamed Fish is a great catch – bursting with flavour without the use of any oil. Meanwhile, the Ginger and Spring Onion Lobster is cleverly done, with the bright notes from ginger enhancing the tender lobster flesh. Vegetarians don’t have to despair, as the restaurant has plenty of stellar options to pick from, whether it is the soft Thai Style Tofu, or the crunchy Fried French Beans. And of course, one must not pass on the classic tze char go-to, the fluffy and fragrant Oyster Omelette.
On weekends, you’ll see this eating joint packed to its gills with families large and small. And thanks to its coastal views, dining at Tekong Seafood Restaurant feels like a respite from the usual city life. Now don’t wait, chope a reservation for your next meal there! (Jan 2018)

data.title: Telok Ayer Arts Club
data.Cuisine: Bar, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Smashed Fingerling Potatoes, Fried Carrot Chips, Baked Chocolate Pudding, Salted Jaggery, French Vanilla Ice Cream, Bloody Maria, Bir Pletok
data.PRESS RELEASE: Telok Ayer Arts Club is a multi-use venue that brings art, music, food and drink together in unexpected ways. Owned and operated by The Supermarket Company, the space is located in the heart of the busy Telok Ayer neighbourhood, at the crossroads of business, F&B, culture and more. Dubbed a creative factory for the community, Telok Ayer Arts Club will be a respite from the mundane – a jolt of creativity that is here to remind city dwellers to think about the driving forces behind our work, our city, and our lives. Artists are given a space to showcase their work and performances in a collaborative format, and in a non-gallery like setting. Each member of our homegrown team is continually inspired by our rotating schedule of artists and their work, ensuring that all are constantly creating and evolving the food, drink, and music offering. Telok Ayer Arts Club is here to challenge the notion that the arts isn’t for everyone, because we believe art is all around us, if we just looked a little closer. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Temasek Culinary Academy The Top Table
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.Address: Block 31 Tampines Avenue 1Level 3Temasek Culinary AcademyTemasek PolytechnicSingapore (529757)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Confit Duck Leg, 18 Hour Braised Beef Short Ribs, Pan-Seared Sea Bass, Warm Date Pudding, Coconut Parfait, Bread & Butter Pudding
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Temasek Culinary Academy The Top Table is a full-service restaurant is located at Level 3 of The Temasek Culinary Academy and boasts a Western and an Asian section within the same outlet. Seating 60 persons, this contemporary restaurant serves to train students in the
finer points of restaurant service and cuisine.
The restaurant also has a feature bar, see-through show kitchens where guests can see student chefs at work. (May 2018)

data.title: Tempura Oji
data.Hours: Mon-Tue: 5-11pmWed-Thu: 5-12am Fri: 5pm-1amSat & PH Eve: 6pm-2amClosed Sunday & PH
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Supamu Tempura, Sea Bass Tempura, Tempura Moriawase, Niku Udon, Shoyu Tonkotsu Ramen, The Blind Pig
data.ABOUT:
It’s easy to unassumingly walk past the beer vending machine that serves as the entrance to this bustling tempura bar. But keep your eyes peeled, and you’ll be rewarded with a night of good food, drinks, and plenty of fun. 

Owned by father-and-son duo Paul and Dragg Wong, Tempura Oji is a haven for midnight revellers looking for supper grub. And this is some fine supper nosh indeed. The pair invested in a top-grade flash-frying technology, which means the tempura that comes out from the kitchen here is wonderfully crumbed without being too greasy. 

Try the Supamu Tempura, which sees ‘Made in Japan’ Spam coated in a light batter and deep-fried. Enjoy this with the Pumpkin Tempura and a side of pureed radish and chopped ginger. Fancy a proper tempura meal? The Sea Bass Tempura is tender and sweet, and is a good complement to the Tempura Moriawase, a selection of deep-fried King Tiger Prawns and mixed vegetables such as onion and eggplant. 

Wash it down with some Japanese craft beers, or signature cocktails like The Blind Pig, featuring Japanese label Roku Gin stirred with homemade beetroot marmalade and pressed apples. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Tenkaichi Japanese BBQ Restaurant (Cineleisure)
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Japanese, Steamboat, Modern Asian, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kaiso Salad, Atsuyaki Tamago, Truffle Salami, Wagyu Saikoro Steak, Shishamo, Wagyu Beef Tataki, Wagyu Tokujo Rosu
data.ABOUT:
The pet project of owner-operator, this restaurant specialises in Wagyu Beef Yakiniku, and is one of the hidden gems of Singapore’s thriving Japanese restaurant scene. From his humble beginnings in Japan as a dishwasher to a manager of a yakiniku chain, he has come a long way, and the expertise he gained reflects in his menu of beloved Japanese classics. 

There is a range of barbecue meats on offer at this restaurant, although the main draw is the wagyu meat. The wagyu here is Kagoshima and Hokkaido wagyu, which is one of the most exquisite cuts of beef available in Japan. The Salmon Belly, Sea Bream, and Tuna are also popular sashimi options. 
The crisp Ebi-Fry is a Japanese staple, and perfect for sharing. The Soft-Shell Crab is another popular dish. A whole crab battered and deep-fried, this dish is good to share but can also be enjoyed by one hungry diner. (Jan 2019)
