data.DISHES WE LOVE: Maine Lobster & Hokkaido Scallop, The Pier's Prawn Laksa, Grilled Côte de Boeuf, Spaghetti Napolitana, 65% Mousse au de Chocolat, Graham Cracker Key Lime Tart, Silver Moon and Ricotta Chives and Mashed Egg Mayonaise Slider with Olive Bagel.
data.ABOUT:
The Landing Point stretches along an elegant indoor promenade paved with bespoke marble mosaics and gold hues. Its majestic 13-metre long bar lined with top shelf spirits from around the world take centrestage here. Sit back and enjoy your afternoon tea while taking in the panoramic sweep of Marina Bay’s waterfront, or toast bespoke cocktails as you catch the sunset by the bay.
In line with government regulations, please note that the sale and consumption of alcohol in all food and beverage establishments are prohibited after 10.30 p.m. daily.
The safety and well-being of our guests and team members are our top priority at The Fullerton Hotels and Resorts. We have set up rigorous cleanliness practices and safe distancing measures at our restaurants to ensure that you can experience an enhanced level of protection. (Jul 2020)

data.title: The Landmark
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Indian, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Halal Certified
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Masala, Fried Fish with Kerabu Mangga, Mutton Vindaloo, Harissa Soup, Soup Kambing, Minced Chicken with Thai Basil, Gulab Jamun, Malay Kuih
data.ABOUT: The Landmark is the in-house restaurant at Village Hotel Bugis, and it serves up a mean, halal buffet of local and international favourites, all bursting with rich, piquant flavours from Southeast Asia and the Mediterranean. Kick off your buffet spread with some hot Soup Kambing, a spicy broth of mutton bones, or a piquant Harissa Soup from the Middle East. Then move along to hearty regional mains like Beef Stew, savoury Malaysian Fried Fish with Kerabu Mangga (shredded mango), or Indian Mutton. That’s just the tip of the iceberg at this spread, which also includes Indian classics like Chicken Masala and Thai dishes like Minced Chicken with Thai Basil. For a more conventional continental buffet experience, there are live carving stations for beef and lamb, as well as a chilled seafood selection where you can grab fresh prawns and Spanish mussels. The dessert selection is as expansive as the mains, running the gamut from sugary sweet Gulab Jamun to rich Malay Kuih. This is a buffet with its eye and palate firmly set on the rich cuisine of our region, teasing out the best in our shared heritage and love of spice and bold flavours. (Mar 2017)

data.title: The Line
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 22 Orange Grove RoadLower LobbyTower WingShangri-La HotelSingapore (258350)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fresh Sashimi, Singapore Fruits Rojak & Sotong Bakar Salad, Shish Tawook, Seafood Pad Thai, Prawn Pakura, Butter Chicken, Laksa, Chinese Roasted BBQ Platter
data.ABOUT: Even if we are unable to travel around the world at this time, The Line has ensured that the flavours of the world travel directly to your tableside – no passport required! Chose to savour from over 88 delectable choices in their made-to-order menus served tableside - from fresh seafood on ice, sushi selections, authentic Thai salads, freshly-baked naans from the tandoor oven, homemade curries, through to dainty and delicious desserts.Designed by internationally acclaimed interior designer, Adam D Tihany, and spanning 1,350 square metres, The Line features indoor and al fresco dining options. The latter offers views of the hotel's lush gardens and free-form swimming pool. Dubbed the destination of choice for family gatherings and birthday celebrations for almost two decades, The Line continues to bring a sense of occasion and reignite the joy of dining with a new, intimate and gourmet experience. (Jul 2020)

data.title: The Lobby Lounge @ Shangri-La Hotel
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 22 Orange Grove RoadLobby LevelTower WingShangri-La Hotel SingaporeSingapore (258350)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 3-Tier Local Signature Afternoon Tea Set, Kong Bak Pau, Katong Laksa, Beef Rendang, Kueh Pie Tee, Pulut Hitam
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Dine as the locals do, albeit with a refined twist, with every visit to The Lobby Lounge. Redesigned and revitalised, the lounge now offers an enticing array of local heritage hawker dishes, made with finest quality ingredients, and prepared to perfection.

Eight signatures anchor the menu, each inspired by the flavours and culinary techniques of those who know this best in the nation: Hainanese Beef Noodles, Hainanese Chicken Rice, Fish Soup, Roti Prata, Katong Laksa, Chilli Crab with Mantou, Bak Kut Teh and Beef Rendang.
What's more, come mid-afternoon, The Lobby Lounge transits to afternoon tea, offering a Three-Tier Local Signature Set featuring succulent local delicacies. To enhance the experience, food is served on Peranakan crockery - think colourful motifs of nature that lend an authentic touch to the dining experience. Touch and taste aside, in between courses, pause for a moment to enjoy the elegant and relaxing atmosphere, complemented by impressive soaring columns that heighten the double volume space, floor-to-ceiling glass windows that let in natural light. (Mar 2021)

data.title: The Lobby Lounge at InterContinental Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Afternoon Tea, Heritage Cocktails, German Pork Knuckle Flatbread, Seafood Linguine, Tiramisu Cake with Coffee Ice Cream
data.ABOUT:
The charming centrepiece of the hotel, The Lobby Lounge encapsulates the allure of the classic with elements of modernity whilst embracing its heritage setting.
By day, the sun-kissed space makes for an ideal setting for a leisurely afternoon tea experience where each presentation is served on a classic three-tier stand.
Guests can also enjoy light breakfast options and an all-day dining a la carte menu of signature specialties and sharing platters from Ash & Elm.  Expect soulful nights amidst soft lights that complement the majestic backdrop for an evening wind-down over bespoke wines and cocktails. (Dec 2020)

data.title: The Lokal
data.Cuisine: Bar, Australian, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kaya Toast, Homemade Ricotta Cheese, Cauliflower 3 Ways, Lamb 3 Ways, Sticky Date Pudding, "Pimp Your Own Breakfast", Steak & Eggs
data.ABOUT:
In 2014, Aussie Chef Darren Farr started The Lokal, an Australian Restaurant-Bar, providing customers with homemade comfort food — including butter, sauces, pickles and meats all made on site. Our name is German for local, an influence that be explained by its proximity to Goethe-Institut Singapore and is also reflective of our diverse and worldly approach towards food that can be enjoyed by the people in Singapore. 
In the day, he serves up healthy and hearty brunches but slowly transits into a cozy and versatile space for intimate dinners & casual cocktails sessions with comfort food by German Head Chef Max Strauch. Aside from the normal menus, both Chef Darren & Max also prepare Daily Specials with fresh seasonal produces for Brunch & Dinner, like Victorian Truffles & White Asparagus.

Chef Darren Farr, more prominently known by his Instagram followers as ‘fuzzychef’, used to work at Tetsuya’s in Sydney, before working at various restaurants across London and Hong Kong.

Chef Max Strauch spent most of his childhood growing up in Jakarta (which explains how he can speak fluent Bahasa) before heading back to Germany to further his culinary journey, spending years in Cookies Cream, a popular vegetarian fine dining restaurant in Berlin. The well-travelled Chef Max also worked in Hamburg & Australia before settling into The Lokal in Singapore, showcasing his style of comfort food with great produce.
 
So the next time you swing by, pull out a seat at the kitchen counter and have a chat with the chefs to find out more about the food you’re eating at The Lokal! (Apr 2018)

data.title: The Lounge Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Agastache, Angelique, Croque Monsieur, Croque Salmon
data.ABOUT:
Owned by the renowned JAG restaurants group and helmed by veteran restaurateur Anant Tyagi alongside Michelin-star chef Jeremy Gillon, diners can expect an experience unlike any other at this cosy watering hole. Tucked away on Duxton Road on the second floor of a restored shophouse, The Lounge Bar serves up delicious drinks inspired by central European tipples. Decorated with plush armchairs and wood accents, the bar gives off prohibition-era vibes, and is the perfect place for a post-work drink.

The artisanal cocktails here are a must-try. The Angelique is notable for its light flavour accented by the addition of Chita Suntory Whisky. For something a little stronger, try the Aperol-infused Agastache flavoured with Peruvian Pisco. This is a strong drink with a robust flavour that will leave you sipping on the dregs.

Feeling peckish? The kitchen serves up some traditional French bites that pair perfectly with the drinks. Try the delectable Croque Monsieur. Made with gooey melted cheese and rich ham sandwiched between two slices of soft bread, this is the perfect option for diners looking for something substantial. The Croque Salmon offers a similar option made with salmon instead of ham. The flavour of the fish pairs well with the other ingredients for a unique taste. (March 2019)

data.title: The Malayan Council (Bussorah Street)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roti Kirai Beef Ribs, Smoked Duck Lemak Chili Padi, Lamb Shank Soup Tulang, TMC Burger, Classic Ondeh-Ondeh Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located in one of the oldest heritage areas, The Malayan Council is a restaurant where the west meets Malaya.
The restaurant offers a variety of Malay dishes bearing Western influences such as Lemak Chili Padi, Asam Pedas, Soup Tulang, and Masak Merah. Combining the restaurant's traditional recipes with high-end ingredients such as King Prawns, Scallops, Soft Shell Crabs and Angus Rib-eye, result in exquisite dishes. (Jan 2019)

data.title: The Market Grill
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Seafood, Steakhouse, Cajun, Burgers
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Watermelon Salad, Crispy Pig Ears, Chargrilled Whole Lobster, Lobster Roll, Signature Cheese Burger, Cod Fish Burger, David Blackmore Wagyu, BBQ Pork Short Ribs
data.ABOUT:
The Market Grill harkens back to the days of traditional diners where it is all about a fun-filled dining experience. Located in the historically rich district of Telok Ayer, the decor is inspired by traditional old-style butcheries and diners with the perfect complementary menu of hearty and robust dishes. Step through the glass doors for a haven of gourmet burgers, decadent lobster rolls and quality steak cuts. 

One of the first concepts to introduce lobster rolls to Singapore in 2013, expect market fresh produce chargrilled to perfection in the specially imported "Woodstone" Charbroiler. Savour the taste of the ocean in the heart of Singapore. (Mar 2019)

data.title: The Marmalade Pantry (Downtown)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 100 Peck Seah Street#01-01Oasia Hotel DowntownSingapore (079333)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Crabmeat Pasta, Seared Scallop & Prawn Pasta, The Marmalade Mac & Cheese, The Marmalade Club Sandwich, Truffle Beef Burger, Sticky Date & Toffee Pudding, Hazelnut Cupcake, Red Velvet Cupcake
data.ABOUT:
Everything about the Marmalade Pantry, from the rich sticky goodness of the name to its reputation as one of the city's favourite bistros, speaks of delicious, indulgent afternoons spent gossiping over impeccable treats and beverages. But beyond afternoon tea, this Downtown location is also perfect for a solid meal, serving up beautiful plates of modern comfort food with a distinct modern-European meets Asian sensibility in swish, modern digs.
 
For a start, nothing says indulgence quite like a luxury burger, and both the Truffle Beef Burger and Spicy Sriracha Burger has that in spades. Filled with juicy goodness and using 200g (USDA) meat, the Truffle Beef Burger is both tender and flavourful while the Spicy Sriracha Burger is filled with spiced chicken patty, sriracha mayo, blue cheese and parmesan fries.  For a lighter meal, the Caesar and Kale Salad and the Grilled Pear and Arugula Salad are the go-to dishes for something refreshing and healthy. (Oct 2019)

data.title: The Mask
data.Cuisine: Bar, Indian, Middle Eastern, Vegetarian Friendly, Mexican
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bangers & Mash, Fish & Chips, Duck Confit, Lamb Shank, Grilled Salmon Fillet, Beef Bolognese, Pesto Pasta
data.ABOUT: Belly-dancing, friendly Clarke Quay vibes, hearty no-fuss food, and frosty pints, The Mask hides very little about its intentions: here, they want you to have a fun time chilling with friends and family. Inside its dim, sexy interiors, tuck into British style pub-grub like a hearty braised Lamb Shank served on a pillowy mound of mash, a classic Bangers & Mash doused in homemade black pepper sauce, or a flaky Fish & Chips served with tangy tartar sauce and fat-cut chips. Beyond pub grub, there’s also slightly fancier fare like a crisp Duck Confit on pomme puree and garden salad, or a simple Grilled Salmon Fillet on a bed of sauteed greens, as well as pastas like a rich Pesto Pasta and a homey Parmesan-rich Beef Bolognese. They’re open for lunch, too, perfect for a quick bite in the CBD, though it’s at night that the place comes alive. With its nightly beer and wine promotions, constant party vibe, and chill river-side breeziness, you’ll want to stay here all night after that hearty dinner! (Apr 2017)

data.ABOUT:
“Happiness is other people.” 

The very essence of everything we do here. 
We are passionate about bringing Franco-Asian food and heartfelt service to The Masses.

After all, better food is always betterer with the betterest people.

Everyone wants to be happy right? For us, happiness is making others happy. It’s that simple. This comes from our 众 philosophy – Happiness is a circular cycle of ‘人’. (Aug 2020)

data.title: The Mediterranean Deli Turk
data.Cuisine: Middle Eastern, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 34B Lorong Mambong Holland Village Singapore (277691)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kul Basti, Falafel Plate, Deli Turk Pride, Spicy Chickpeas Stew
data.ABOUT:
A Turkish restaurant in Holland Village, The Mediterranean Deli Turk is a must-try for all diners on the hunt for deliciously healthy food when dining out.

Start with the Green Salad for a healthy combination of freshly chopped green vegetables lightly dressed with olive oil. For those looking for a more substantial start to your meal, choose the Fusilli Salad. A wonderful mix of cold pasta de fusilli and greens, this colourful bowl is as tasty as it is healthy.

Side dishes at The Mediterranean Deli Turk are also not to be missed out on. Chef’s recommendations include Kul Basti, Falafel Plate, and Butter Rice. An interesting combination of vegetables and chickpeas dipped in tomato sauce, the Spicy Chickpeas Stew is a pure vegetarian dish made for all.

Another sumptuous selection within the menu are the Turkish pizzas. With seven different flavours to choose from, mouthwatering favourites include the Cheese Pide and the Deli Turk Pride. (Sep 2020)

data.title: The Nomads
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Nomads ‘Plov’, Beef Tongue, Caviar & Kaya
data.ABOUT:
Inspired by the rich history of the Silk Road, a vast melting pot of great cultures which helped develop an array of cuisines, The Nomads seeks to expand Singapore’s culinary horizons with the exotic intrigue surrounding a Central Asian dining experience.

Promising a multi-sensory culinary journey, their eclectic dishes draw inspiration from China, India, Southern Europe, and Central and Southeast Asia. The custom-built grill is where the magic happens, dishing out specials like The Nomads ‘Plov’, a take on the Central Asian rice dish. Here, their ‘rice’ is replaced with a carnaroli risotto, while the meat is a mouth-watering combination of A4 Wagyu striplion and bone marrow. Every trimming of a great plov has been upgraded: Pickled heirloom carrots, tea quail eggs and branded raisins are found in each mouthful. You can try this dish in both their omakase-style Long Menu and Short Menu, aptly named The Nomad’s Journey and The Nomad’s Introductory respectively. (Nov 2019)

data.title: The Old Man SG
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Charcuterie & Cheese Board, Creamy Cheese Cake
data.ABOUT:
A passion project turned award-winning bar created by industry legends, The Old Man Singapore is an intimate speakeasy that serves top notch hospitality and innovative cocktails. Tucked away in the heart of Singapore’s buzzing Keong Saik Road, visit this cosy bar for a quick drink after work to relax and unwind. 

Wine and dine at The Old Man Singapore with a glass of bubbly and a sumptuous selection of food options specially crafted for you to nibble on. Crowd favourites here include the classic Cheese Platter, Creamy Cheesecake Slice and Chocolate Cheesecake Slice. Featuring an array of cured and cooked meat selections, the Charcuterie Platter is another plate of savoury goodness that perfectly complements your drinking experience at The Old Man Singapore. 

Ranking 38 on the World’s 50 Best Bars list, the bar’s harmonious combination of culinary techniques and unique ingredients are inspired by Hemingway’s novels, history and folklore, Drop by to sip on unique and delicious cocktails! (Apr 2021)

data.title: The Old Straits Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Hokkien Mee, Curry Fish Head, Signature Grilled Chicken, Burnt Cheesecake
data.ABOUT:
Drop by The Old Straits Cafe for a taste of delicious Chinese and Western cuisines. Prepared using only the freshest ingredients, the cafe guarantees you a pleasant dining experience any time of the day.

Located at 30 Selegie Road, the restaurant serves over 100 local delights and Zi-Char round the clock. From local Kopi C and Kaya Toast to local favourites such as Fried Hokkien Mee and Curry Fish Head, the cafe’s extensive menu is a great fusion of Chinese and Western delights. 

Start your day by enjoying a cup of latte with the cafe’s Burnt Cheesecake. Smooth and creamy, this slice of airy cheesecake is a luscious and rich sweet dessert that will satisfy your sweet tooth. For something more substantial, the Signature Grilled Chicken comes with different condiments and a generous heap of greens. Sharing platter options for family and friends are also aplenty here. Choose from chicken, pork and fish and chips when opting for the meat platter, or go for the flavoured Korean Fried Chicken. To make a night out of it, catch up with friends over a beer tower or two. (Sep 2020)

data.title: The Orchard Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 442 Orchard RoadOrchard Hotel Singapore LobbySingapore (238879)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Imperfect Vegetable Salad, Ocean of Seafood Platter, Assorted Japanese Appetiser Platter, Singapore Laksa
data.ABOUT:
Be spoilt for choice at Orchard Hotel Singapore’s iconic restaurant, The Orchard Cafe, with the wide array of fresh seafood, Asian, Japanese and hearty Western fare. Showcasing local dishes as well as international favourites, take a trip around the world with the restaurant’s enticing Signature class buffet.

Drop by during dinner to indulge in The Orchard Cafe’s a la carte plated buffet dinner. Served with balsamic dressing and drizzled with extra virgin olive oil, this bowl of seasonal winter salad leaves is fresh from the farm and makes for a delicious starter. Meat lovers can choose to add House Cured Salmon, Gourmet Ham or Sous Vide Chicken Breast to the Imperfect Vegetable Salad for extra flavour.

Dive into the Ocean of Seafood Platter to indulge in the assortment of chilled prawns, mussels, scallop, snow crab leg and more. For sushi lovers, the Assorted Japanese Appetiser Platter contains a host of classic favourites that will definitely satisfy all your cravings. Indian, Asian and Western delights are also readily available on the menu — there’s something for everyone here at The Orchard Cafe! (Mar 2021)

data.title: The Other Roof
data.Good For: Drinks
data.PRESS RELEASE: The Other Roof presents a worldwide new concept of tea-finished spirits and cocktails, all deriving from bespoke leaves and tea blends. Amongst the wide  variety of different leaves in the world, our team has been selecting only the finest profiles to create our signature bespoke tea spirits. (Oct 2018)

data.title: The Other Room
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 320 Orchard RoadSingapore Marriott Tang Plaza HotelSingapore (238865)                                                Map
data.ABOUT: We're a little reluctant to share this well-kept secret, but hidden behind an unassuming door at the Marriott Hotel is one of the sexiest cocktail bars in the Orchard belt.The Other Room, helmed by zany bartender and cocktail wizard Dario Knox, serves up some pretty mean prohibition-inspired craft cocktails. We especially love Dario's twists on classics like the smoke-infused Old Cuban, made with rum and citrus, or the bizarre Reverse Gin and Tonic, a mix of gin and tonic syrup that's carbonated at freezing temperatures at the table, ensuring a crisp, if a little science-fiction like, drink. On top of this, ask for any classic you can name, which Dario and his team will fix for you with pleasure.The main appeal for us, though, is Dario's pet project: he takes bottled spirits and finishes them in specially-treated casks to infuse them with new flavour dimensions. Your favourite whisky or rum can be turned into a completely different drink given some extra time in a sherry cask, or a gin you thought you knew and loved is given a new depth of flavour through infusions with all manner of fruit peel, herbs, and spices. It's a real mad scientist's lab here, and one that's guaranteed to change the way you enjoy your favourite spirits. If you ask Dario for recommendations, he can turn one of these finished spirits into a cocktail for you.If you like your drinks with a little bit of mystery, some magic, and lots of flair, seek out The Other Room, if you can find it! (Mar 2017)

data.title: The Populus Coffee & Food Co.
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ricotta & Herb Bread Pudding, Buckwheat Pancakes, Pork Belly Sandwich, Populus 'Chicken Rice' Donburi, Roast Chicken Grain Bowl, 'Ginger Beer' Pork Collar, Artisan 'Apple in Black' Iced Tea, Lemon & White Chocolate Waffle Sundae
data.ABOUT: Coffee and tea enthusiasts have found their latest stomping grounds at The Populus Coffee and Food Co. on Neil Road. A collaboration between the folks behind Department of Caffeine (D.O.C) and local specialty coffee roasters 2Degrees North Coffee Co., The Populus is a contemporary gastro-cafe with a menu that delivers a range of edibles from all around the world and a selection of exquisitely flavoured teas by Tea Bone Zen Mind.Their weekday menu is all work appropriate, with healthier alternatives like the Roast Chicken Grain Bowl and Buckwheat Pancakes. The weekend menu then, is all about indulgence with their Baked Pistachio ‘French Toast’ with Red Wine Pears and Lobster Seafood Linguine. Populus has got wickedly good eats and drinks down to a T (or tea)! (Jan 2016)

data.title: The Providore (Downtown)
data.Cuisine: Bar, Australian, Fusion, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crab Linguini Pasta, Roasted Chicken Leg, Nicoise Salad, The Providore Hot Chocolate, Affogato
data.ABOUT:
Knock yourself out on a spread of wholesome café nosh at The Providore, which hosts a café, deli, bakery, and grocery space within itself. The establishment's dedication to serving up good food is apparent from the start - one bite and you're sure to be hooked. Its creations are lovingly made with fresh seasonal ingredients, and it shows.
When at the café, be sure to try the Crab Linguini Pasta, an absolutely divine option made with sundried tomato, bird's eye chili, and fresh basil - cooked to al dente perfection, this is one pasta dish you won't be soon forgetting. The Pan Seared Barramundi is another must-have, with its accompanying Mexican rice, home-made corn tortillas and guacamole. If you're there for breakfast, however, then you can't go wrong with their signature Ricotta Pancakes, which comes with caramelised banana, candied walnuts, and sugar syrup. The Providore does a particularly fragrant latte too, if you're looking for a coffee on the side.
There's much to love about the place, with its versatility and commitment to quality - you won't regret a visit! (Oct 2017)

The Pan Seared Barramundi is another must-have, with its accompanying Mexican rice, home-made corn tortillas and guacamole. If you're there for breakfast, however, then you can't go wrong with their signature Ricotta Pancakes, which comes with caramelised banana, candied walnuts, and sugar syrup. The Providore does a particularly fragrant latte too, if you're looking for a coffee on the side.

There's much to love about the place, with its versatility and commitment to quality - you won't regret a visit! (Nov 2020)

data.title: The Providore (PLQ)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spanish Baked Eggs, Ricotta Pancakes, Pappardelle Pasta, Lobster Mac & Cheese, Pan Seared Barramundi
data.ABOUT:
Knock yourself out on a spread of wholesome café nosh at The Providore. The establishment's dedication to serving up good food is apparent from the start - one bite and you're sure to be hooked. Its creations are lovingly made with fresh seasonal ingredients, and it shows.

When at the café, be sure to try the Crab Linguini Pasta, an absolutely divine option made with sundried tomato, bird's eye chili, and fresh basil - cooked to al dente perfection, this is one pasta dish you won't be soon forgetting. The Pan Seared Barramundi is another must-have, with its accompanying Mexican rice, home-made corn tortillas and guacamole. The Providore does a particularly fragrant latte too, if you're looking for a coffee on the side.

There's much to love about the place, with its versatility and commitment to quality - you won't regret a visit! (Nov 2020)

data.title: The RANCH Steakhouse By ASTONS
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Cold Cuts Platter, Roasted Bone Marrow, The RANCH Burger, RANCH Strip Steak, Porterhouse T-Bone
data.ABOUT:
We know Astons for making steak affordable. Now, our favourite chain is taking it up a notch with their new outfit, The Ranch Steakhouse. The classic steakhouse sits along Clarke Quay with al fresco seating, so you get a great view to go with your meats.

The Ranch focuses on great beef here. Start with the Beef Tartare, hand-chopped tenderloin with plenty of delicious spices, and laced with a generous dash of XO cognac. Pan-fried Foie Gras is great if you’re looking to indulge — the fatty goose liver comes with an oozy soft-boiled egg, dried apricots and raspberries, and a warm, umami-packed bacon dressing.

Of course, meat is the star of the show at The Ranch. The New Zealand Grass-Fed Black Angus Sirloin is juicy and tender, and priced at great value. If you love the funky flavours that come with dry-ageing beef, try the USDA Prime 30 Days Dry-Aged Bone-In Ribeye. The cut is served bone-in, and the steak has a delicious buttery sear. You also get tableside service when you order this cut, so sit back and feel like a VIP.
To go with your meats, order from an extensive range of wines or get a pint of German beer from the bar. (Jul 2018)

data.title: The Ramen House
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Volcano Ramen, Cha Shu Ramen, Kushiyaki Set, Kaisen Don, Abalone Seafood Ramen
data.ABOUT:
Your answer to late-night cravings lies at The Ramen House, a Japanese eatery that opens till 6am. The folks here serve a wide array of ramen with their signature homemade broth, where chicken or pork meat and bones have simmered patiently for 30 hours to create a smooth, rich and milky texture. 

The Volcano Ramen is their best-seller, with succulent pieces of chicken cha shu accompanied by dollops of "red hot lava", a paste of red chillies and dried Indian chilli padi. Another indulgent option is the Abalone Seafood Ramen that comes with a plump abalone and tempura prawns and squid deep fried to perfection.

Even if you're not in the mood for ramen, other dishes from their extensive menu are sure to catch your fancy. There’s even a good selection of Sake, Shochu and Hokkaido Wines to wash all the food down at the end of your meal. From innovative sushi creations to hearty Kushiyaki Bento sets and Donburis, you’ll have to make several trips to try them all (but we aren’t complaining!). (Nov 2019)

data.title: The Ramen Stall
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Volcano Ramen, Chicken Cha Shu Ramen, Kushiyaki Set, Kaisen Don, Matcha Yoghurt Soft Serve
data.ABOUT:
Here’s a halal Japanese eatery that opens till 5am, serving a wide array of ramen infused with a local twist.  They’ve swapped the typical tonkotsu ramen broth with a chicken base, one that’s been patiently simmering for 30 hours, resulting in a rich and smooth texture. 

The Volcano Ramen is their best-seller, with succulent pieces of cha-shu accompanied by dollops of "red hot lava", a paste of red chillies and dried Indian chilli padi. Another indulgent option is the Abalone Seafood Ramen that comes with a plump abalone and tempura prawns and squid deep fried to perfection.


Even if you're not in the mood for ramen, other dishes from their extensive menu are sure to catch your fancy. From innovative sushi creations to hearty Kushiyaki Bento sets and Donburis, we couldn’t ask for a better excuse to be pigging out with a bunch of friends after hours. (Nov 2019)

data.title: The Rebel Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hungry Rebel Beef Burger, Portobello Mushroom Burger, Beer Battered Fish and Chips, Dessert Platter
data.ABOUT:
Serving up well-loved Western dishes, The Rebel Bar is a quaint and cosy eatery located along Stanley Street. Casual dining is the order of the day here with the restaurant’s extensive menu of small bites and hearty brunch meals.

Delight your taste buds with The Rebel Bar’s signature Hungry Rebel Beef Burger as you dig into a wonderful mix of homemade beef patty, chewy bacon and fried egg complemented by fresh romaine lettuce and tomatoes sandwiched between perfectly steamed buns. For the health conscious, you can opt for the Portobello Mushroom Burger. Made of lightly grilled portobello mushroom, the burger is garnished with caramelised onions and grilled capsicums to guarantee maximum satisfaction. The Beer Battered Fish and Chips is another long-standing favourite among customers. Served with fries, mixed greens and tartar sauce, the deep fried dory fish is covered in a rich coating of homemade beer batter. 

Ideal for gatherings with family or friends, The Rebel Bar offers enticing deals and platters that are great for sharing. End your meal on a sweet note with treats from the restaurant’s Dessert Platter. (Jul 2020)

data.title: The Rebel Company Cafe & Bar (Serangoon Gardens)
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Italian, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Burgers, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ultimate French Toast, Crispy ‘Pork’ Knuckle, Fried Steak, Rebel Feast
data.ABOUT:
Tucked along Kensington Park,  The Rebel Company Cafe & Bar (Serangoon Gardens) is known for whipping up delectable Western classics from bacon waffles to fish and chips and roasted chicken.

Choose from a variety of all-day breakfast favourites from the restaurant’s famous All Day Breakfast Menu. For something sweet and savoury, go for the Ultimate French Toast. Drizzled with coffee maple syrup and snow powder, the crispy toast is topped with blueberries and strawberries. The restaurant’s highly raved waffles are also a must-try. You can even customise your waffle with the cafe’s Build Your Own Waffle option. 

Don’t leave without tasting the Crispy ‘Pork’ Knuckle. A delightful twist on the classic local favourite, the pork knuckle is baked German style and served with mashed potato and mixed greens. Another dish worthy of mention is the Fried Steak. Featuring cubes of tender steak soaked in mixed herb crumbs, this fragrant dish is not to be missed! 

A great place for drinks and brunch, be sure to drop by The Rebel Company Cafe and Bar for an indulgent meal. (Oct 2020)

data.title: The Rose Veranda
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining
data.Address: 22 Orange Grove RoadMezzanine LevelTower WingShangri-La HotelSingapore (258350)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: FThe Rose Veranda Signature Sandwiches, Freshly Baked Scones
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The Rose Veranda has been an institution for high tea since its inception in 1991, and an epitome of elegance with a serene and soothing ambience to while away an afternoon in good company.The culinary indulgences within the high tea experience are delivered with a strong commitment to freshness and seasonality, enhanced by the culinary team's creativity.The restaurant serves a 3-course high tea set menu, designed to continue afternoon traditions of luxurious tête-à-têtes over dainty sandwiches, and delectable pastries. First, a delightful selection of sandwiches is served to your table. Your choice of main course follows, inspired by haute cuisine and presented with finesse, to make a welcomed savoury intervention before dessert arrives on a three-tiered stand filled with French pastries and signature scones with homemade jam and clotted cream.
For the traditionally inclined, select from two exclusive The Rose Veranda signature tea blends to complete your high tea experience, or choose your brew from a curated selection of more than 30 premium tea types from the best tea producing regions. Alongside the classic teas, there are champagnes and wines available for a sparkling afternoon. (Dec 2020)

data.title: The Sampan
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork and Chicken Choi Bao, Blue Swimmer Crab and Pomelo Salad, Sichuan Pepper Chicken Spare Ribs with Spring Onion Salad, Crispy Chili Beef with Green Mango Salad and Crispy Noodles
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Diners can look forward to a fresh spin on Singapore’s dining scene with The Sampan, a new three-storey restaurant and bar with a soulful vibe at the heart of Boat Quay. Helmed by former Ku De Ta Bali General Manager, Steve Collinson, The Sampan focuses on the fresh and bright flavours of Asia in its vibrant menu.

“The Sampan brings together the familiar flavours from all over Asia with a twist," said Steve Collinson. He added, “And it’s not just limited to our food menu but also our drinks menu as well. Cocktail aficionados can look forward to something unique from their regular tipple.”

Located at 63 Boat Quay, The Sampan offers a great space for private or corporate events. Open to all, The Sampan is opening up its space as a venue for meetings, corporate lunches or dinner parties, with its third-level catering for functions only. The Sampan is open on weekdays for lunch and dinner from 11.30am to midnight and Saturdays from 4.30pm to midnight. (Sep 2018)

data.title: The Seagrill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Seafood Platter, Grilled Meat Platter, Grilled Rack of Lamb, Grilled Chicken Skewer with Pineapple, Grilled Barramundi Fillet, Boston Lobster Thermidor, with our handcrafted by our Chef's Cake;  Seagrill's Burnt Cheese Cake and Dark Chocolate Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
There aren’t a lot of places in Singapore where you can dine with a view of the endless horizon and the sound of the waves, but The Seagrill is one of them. Plane enthusiasts can get an unparalleled view of planes taking off and landing at Changi Airport, music lovers can enjoy the live band performances on Friday nights, and food lovers can nosh on the various delicious dishes on offer.

Health-conscious diners can opt for the Detox Salad, made with greens and red quinoa, as well as a host of other colourful vegetables and nuts. This dish is a feast for the eyes and palate. For something a little moreish, opt for the Seafood Capellini, a delicious dish made with king prawns, Japanese sea scallops, clams, and a variety of other treasures of the sea. The pasta is coated in an earthy mix of garlic and olive oil, before being tossed in the seafood mix, making this dish an excellent main course. 

For a sweet end to the meal, try some local fusion desserts, like the Cempedak Creme Brulee. Made with the sweet and fragrant cempedak fruit, this dish combines the classic French dessert with a unique local flavour and makes for a memorable dessert. (Oct 2018)

data.title: The Social Kitchen @ Jurong Bird Park
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Fusion, International, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Cafe, Burgers, Vegetarian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 2 Jurong HillJurong Bird Park Singapore (628925)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: NoChicken Nuggets & Waffles, NoChicken Truffle Alfredo Pasta, NoChicken Assam Curry with Rice, NoBeef Burger with Crispy Onions
data.ABOUT:
A partnership with The Vegetarian Butcher, The Social Kitchen @ Jurong Bird Park provides employment to disadvantaged individuals and strongly values environmental sustainability. Leveraging founder Jaap Korteweg’s experiences as a ninth-generation butcher, The Vegetarian Butcher is well-known for its professional lineage, high-quality modes of production and sustainable practices. Nearly indistinguishable from real meat in terms of taste and texture, the premium cuts of meat are transformed into a variety of delicious dishes that can be enjoyed here at The Social Kitchen @ Jurong Bird Park. 

Start your meal with a vegetarian delight. The NoChicken Nuggets & Waffles is a tasty option that comes drizzled with a generous amount of maple syrup. Served with a golden baked hash brown, this hearty platter of ‘Chicken’ nuggets and waffles is all the fuel you need to kickstart your day with! Move on to the mains with a bowl of NoChicken Truffle Alfredo Pasta. Truly trufflicious, the pasta features bits of ‘Chicken’ infused with the unique taste of truffle and olive oil. For those looking to have a taste of local favourites, the NoChicken Assam Curry with Rice is a popular option among both young and old. (Dec 2020)

data.title: The Social Kitchen @ YMCA
data.Cuisine: Chinese, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Cafe, Burgers, Zi Char
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mingfa Fishball, Gim’s Heritage, Pin Si, Long Black
data.ABOUT:
The Social Kitchen @ YMCA is a social enterprise that partners community organisations such as YMCA to operate their kitchens and cafes to benefit the vulnerable community through the provisions of jobs. Converting under-utilised kitchens into cloud kitchens operated by well-known Singaporean F&B brands, they serve quality mid-tier to high-end dining options. Headed by Ang Kian Peng and Alvin Yapp, these two gentlemen are familiar names in the circle of the social services who have made a significant difference to the community with their years of commitment.
Find your favourite local delights here with Mingfa Fishball, Gim’s Heritage, Pin Si, Long Black and more, all conveniently located in one space. A medley of local-licious cuisine for you to choose from, The Social Kitchen provides an inviting space for gatherings with family and friends and a spread of varying local delicacies. 

Come down to The Social Kitchen’s first flagship kitchen at YMCA Orchard to show your support! With good food for a great cause, embrace this innovative dining concept and help the disadvantaged in society. (Oct 2020)

data.title: The Spot
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 5 Straits View#01-26/27Marina One The HeartSingapore (018935)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Atlantic Salmon, Scallop Carpaccio, Duck Breast, Grilled Red Snapper, Liquorice Ice Cream
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located in Marina One, The Spot is a multi-concept venue comprising an all-day café, restaurant, bar and cigar lounge. The various spaces are functionally interwoven so that diners can enjoy each activity on its own or in combination with the others, creating a seamless wine-and-dine experience.

Alongside The Spot are strategic partners, 1855 The Bottle Shop and South East Asia’s first and only The Macallan Boutique @ 1855, providing unique and complementary services for diners and guests. From breakfast to dinner and after, The Spot offers coffee and cocktails, superb contemporary food, extraordinary wines, and a sensational whisky collection for customers to enjoy in an elegant and welcoming ambience.

About Executive Chef Lee Boon Seng

As a boy of 17 in the kitchen of Equinox watching culinary virtuosity in action, executive chef Lee Boon Seng found his
calling. He stayed for eight years at this - his first job, rising from trainee to Chef de Partie before notching an impressive resume at places like Curate and the one-starred Osia at Resorts World Sentosa.

Chef Lee was honored with multiple accolades including Rising Chef of the Year at the World Gourmet Summit of 2013, and the Overall Champion during the semi-finals of Global Chefs Challenge organized by the Paris-based World Association of Chefs Societies (WACS). He also earned the opportunity of hosting and working with numerous Michelin-starred veterans such as Massimiliano Alajmo of the three-starred Le Calandre in Padua, Italy; Guy Martin of the three-starred Le Grand Véfour in Paris, France; and Esben Holmboe Bang of the three-starred Maaemo in Oslo, Norway.

The food at The Spot is highly individualistic – with the starting point an ingredient that excites Chef Lee with the drive to introduce its beauty to the world by elevating its flavors. He found this route through sauces, employing the European techniques of his training in tandem with the Southeast Asian fruits, herbs, and spices of his cultural heritage. (Jul 2019)

data.title: The Square @ Furama
data.Cuisine: Buffet, International, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Local
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Beef Burger, Beef Bolognaise Pasta, Cajun Ribeye Steak, Classic Fish & Chips, Pan Roasted Cod Fish, Fried Beef Kway Teow, Singapore Laksa, Fish Bee Hoon Soup, Satay, Royal Thai Seafood Tom Yum Broth
data.ABOUT:
Pamper yourself with a slew of international culinary gems at Furama RiverFront! Hankering after endless nosh? Their buffet spreads are there for you. Sup on ubiquitous seafood like Stone Crab Claw, Black Mussels, appetisers like the salmon sashimi, Live Noodle Station, Carving Station, and daily featured cuisine such as Thailand, Japanese, Local delights and Western. It’s too many to list so trust us when we say it’s a worldwide selection!

Looking for something a little more restrained? A la carte it is. No matter the time of day, the chefs work to bring out the best of East and West with a bevy of gourmet dishes. Go for a Collection of, Asian bites like Satay or Furikake Pop Corn Chicken, local favourites which include the ever popular Hainanese Chicken Rice and Singapore Laksa, or Western classics ranging from Impossible Patty Bagel to Angus Ribeye Steak.

The Square @ Furama is perfect for both adults and little ones – our little play area promises to keep the young ones entertained with activities, toys, and videos - so whatever the occasion, there’ll be food and fun for all! (Apr 2021)

data.title: The Stamford Brasserie
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fresh Fruit Danish, Pulled Kurobuta Pork, Beef Tartar, House Made Burger, BBQ Pork Ribs
data.ABOUT:
Set in a charming ambience, The Stamford Brasserie is a multi-concept restaurant and bar boasting affordable gourmet meals and unique craft beers. 

Start your day right with a slice of Golden Waffle. The perfect savoury treat to kickstart your day, indulge in a mix of berry compote, maple syrup and orange butter atop this classic favourite. A hearty platter of sausages, smoked ham, bacon potato and grilled tomato, the Traditional Two Egg Breakfast is a wholesome dish that both the young and old love. 

Want to have breakfast your way? Here at The Stamford Brasserie, Create Your Own Omelette features three different eggs and a variety of delicious fillings. Fuss-free grab and go options are also readily available on the menu. Choose from hand-crafted bakes and fruits, leafy salads, sandwiches and sweet treats to go with a steaming hot cup of Americano for your morning pick me up. 

There’s no such thing as too much alcohol! Pop open a bottle of bubbly to celebrate milestones with the restaurant’s multitude of promotions available. (Mar 2021)

data.title: The Summerhouse
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Charcoal Grilled Slipper Lobster, Smoked Butter Poached Red Snapper Fillet, Pickled & Slow Cooked Lamb Shoulder
data.ABOUT:
It's not everyday you can say you're escaping to the countryside in manic Singapore, but take a car or bus ride into the quiet stretches near Seletar Airport and you'll find empty fields, lush tropical greenery, and The Summerhouse, a new restaurant, bar, and cafe that's housed within a colonial-era Royal Airforce Bungalow. Amidst the hilly greenery of the surrounding landscape, there's a high chance that you'll forget you're in Singapore, though the food and drinks here, created by a team led by Chef Chris Millar, will remind you that you're in one of the world's great dining cities.
Crafted in partnership with farming communities in Singapore and farther afield, and topped off with produce from an on-site organic garden, this is a gourmet restaurant with a heart for nature. Leveraging on Singapore's constant sunshine to create the feeling of eternal summer, flowers and herbs from the garden are used to adorn the plate and each mouthful bursts with sun-ripened, sustainably-sourced flavours.
Kelong-farmed grouper is served with an elegant pesto of farm-fresh carrot, orange-kissed hollandaise, and a garnish of garden nasturtiums. Seasonal farmed sea urchins from France are turned into a gelato-like ice cream, flavoured with soy sauce and topped with briny ikura and toasted nori, while beautiful Australian Mayura beef is rendered smoky and tender with an Inka grill before being served up with pickled pumpkin, local mushrooms, and an earl-grey infused jus.
Come soak up the chill vibes and hard-to-find tranquility at The Summerhouse, a rare Singapore experience elevated by fine, sustainably-sourced food. (Apr 2018)

data.title: The Tavern Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Location: River Valley, Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Scottish Smoked Salmon Loin, Pan-fried Goose Liver, Chateaubriand, Beef Tenderloin 'Morel', Dingley Dell Pork Chop, Whole Dover Sole, Homemade Apple Pie A La Mode, Fresh Irish Oysters, Goose-Liver Terrine, Raclette Cheese with Air Dried Beef, Escargot ‘Madagasy’, Baked Portobello, Grilled Maine Lobster, Sliced Veal Zurich, Alaskan Crab-Mornay
data.ABOUT:
Wrapped around the corner of River Valley Road, this shophouse restaurant looks unassuming at a glance but a closer look yields the sort of quaint charm that draws diners in. Once inside, the Swiss chalet inspiration is clear – wood panels, vintage-looking lamps, and other decorative knick-knacks give the small space cosy warmth.
The philosophy here is obviously less about fancy touches and more about letting the food speak for itself. None of that half-baked tourist fare though, the menu offers a rich selection of prime Continental items. Fresh Irish Oysters, Goose-Liver Terrine, Raclette Cheese with Air Dried Beef; you’d never guess these sumptuous appetisers were on offer just by looking at The Tavern Restaurant’s humble exterior. The mains are equally decadent, with Wagyu beef listed alongside dishes like Dingley Dell Pork Chop, Angel Hair Pasta with Half a Lobster, Sliced Veal Zurich, and Alaskan Crab-Mornay. Surprised by the incredible spread? We were too, at first. It’s a good lesson in not judging a book by its cover and, really, we’re only sad lessons can’t be this delicious all the time! (May 2016)

data.title: The Three Peacocks
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tom Yum Soup, Potato Skins, Kimchi Pancakes, Pineapple Rice, Stir-Fried Glass Noodles, Mac & Cheese, Grilled Oyster, Boston Lobster, Beef Cheek
data.ABOUT:
Situated at Labrador Park, possibly one of the most beautiful downtown green spaces on the island, The Three Peacocks is a gorgeous open air barbecue restaurant spread out across a gorgeous lawn in the middle of the park, sheltered by chic architectural structures and lit at night by a scattering of lanterns. On offer is a menu that sprawls across Western, Korean, and Thai cuisines, the strong aromas of each intermingling in the air.
You get to choose your meat of choice, and have it dressed with a sauce of your choice, from buttery French sauces to punchy Korean glazes. But before that, warm up the stomach with some appetizers, like fragrant Tom Yum Soup, crunchy Potato Skins, or flaky Kimchi Pancakes. Then choose a plate of carbohydrates to support the oncoming barbecue onslaught. There’s Korean and Thai stir-fried noodles and fried rice, ranging from oil-slicked Glass Noodles to aromatic Pineapple Rice, as well as simple pastas like Pesto and Mac & Cheese. Then it’s time for the main event. There’s a premium grilled seafood menu that features Boston Lobster, Squid, Grilled Oyster, and Tiger Prawns, with sauce options like Lemon Garlic Butter, Creamy Salted Egg, Tom Yum, and Korean Garlic sauce. There’s also grilled meats, like tender Ribeye Steak, unctuous Beef Cheek, perfect done the French way with a vigorous searing and a lick of jus. Then there’s marinated Korean-style beef and pork for that hit of Korean barbecue, a mix of spicy and caramelized flavours, and the occasional hit of black pepper.
Options abound at this gorgeous barbecue restaurant, a true step up from low-fi East Coast Park barbecues. The premium meats and elegant sauces will give you a fantastic gourmet experience, while you enjoy the chill and laid-back open-air environment that’s the best way to enjoy Singapore’s weather. (Dec 2017)

data.title: The Tipsy Cow (Central)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 6 Eu Tong Sen Street#01-15The CentralSingapore (059817)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seafood Marinara, Carbonara, Lamb Rack, Whisky Sour
data.ABOUT:
Clarke Quay isn’t short on watering holes, but The Tipsy Cow stands out for good reason. Like its sister outlet in Katong, it provides fuss-free food and tipples at affordable prices. Whether you’re looking for a casual spot for post-work drinks, or a cool place for weekend brunch, you can’t go wrong with this spot. From sharing pizzas and delicious pastas to light bar bites, there’s something for everyone here. There is also an extensive wine list and a range of fun cocktails and hard liquors available for guests looking to let loose.

You can’t go wrong with the Seafood Marinara. Made with a generous portion of mixed seafood such as clams, squid, and prawns, this dish is a briny, tangy, and juicy treat. Prefer creamy pastas? The Carbonara here is done to perfection. Bacon, cream, and cheese make for a rich and indulgent dish that will leave you wanting more. Meat lovers can sink their teeth into the Lamb Rack. Fresh, juicy lamb is grilled to perfection and served with an earthy gravy that complements the natural flavour of the meat. (Nov 2019)

data.title: The Tipsy Cow (Katong)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Lamb Ribs, Chicken Fajita, Granchio Prawns, Lamb Burger, Vegetarian Pizza, The Raj, Linguine Marinara
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in a charming shophouse along the trendy Tanjong Katong precinct, The Tipsy Cow stands out with its white neon signboard, chill atmosphere, and stellar Italian fare that keep diners coming back for more. Featuring both an indoor and outdoor area, the intimate space is perfect for hanging out with the mates or a cosy dinner for two, so get ready to tuck into good food and knock back some affordable drinks, all while watching the season’s latest games.
Titillate your taste buds with the Grilled Lamb Ribs which features olive crusted grilled lamb ribs done medium rare and elevated with a red wine glaze, enjoy a fuss-free plate of pasta with the Linguine Marinara, or get comfy with a Soup Of The Day - there are no bad options here. For some bar grub, the Chicken Fajitas should be your go-to snack while the Granchio Prawns, featuring plump, succulent prawns drizzled with a decadent crab meat sauce and served with pizza bread, comes a close second. The pizzas here never disappoint as well, and our top picks include the classic Prosciutto or the adventurous The Raj, featuring majestic portions of mozzarella, lamb, chicken, capsicum, and porcini atop a tomato base. Vegetarian? Your options are equally appealing! Wash it all down with your favourite tipples, and the night will surely go down in the books as one to remember! (Sep 2017)

data.title: The Warehouse Hotel Bar
data.Good For: Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 320 Havelock RoadRobertson QuayThe Warehouse HotelSingapore (169628)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Singapore Sazerac, B.B. King, Forbidden Fruit, Disco Sling, Truffle & Duck Pie Tee, Kurobuta Char Siew, XO Crab Carrot Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Its craft cocktail programme reflects the three key eras of the property's past. Representing its incarnation as an 1895 warehouse, known in Asia as a godown, are rustic infusions that transport you to the heart of the old spice trade such as the Singapore Sazerec - raisin bourbon, pandan bitters, rye, cognac, absinthe.
Referencing Havelock Road's time as Chiu Long Lo in Hokkien - or 'Spirits Distillery Street' are heavier concoctions such as the Madame Butterfly - roselle tequila, watermelon shrub, rosé, kaffir lime salt, soda. Flirty concoctions like Barbarella - hibiscus gin, elderflower, rhubarb, earl grey tea - are inspired by the venue's transformation into an iconic disco in the 1980s. These are supported by a curated selection of Asian craft beers, spirits and fine wines. (Jan 2018)

data.title: The Whiskey Library Restaurant and Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 39 Syed Alwi RoadThe Vagabond Club Singapore, A Tribute Portfolio HotelSingapore (207630)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cannery Row, Spice Road, Wok-seared Organic Grass-fed Beef Tenderloin, Fried Lion’s Mane Mushrooms with Avocado Puree, BBQ Roast Duck
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The Whiskey Library is one of the greatest whiskey bars in the world, housing over 1000 bottles of rare and refined award-winning whiskeys from across the globe. Set within the glamorous Vagabond Club and designed by world-renowned French designer Jacques Garcia, The Whiskey Library oozes sophistication adorned with red velvet banquettes, a unique collection of art and handcrafted furniture. Anyone and everyone are welcome to experience the art of whiskeys or explore the well-loved selection of expertly crafted cocktails. And for those looking for more, The Whiskey Library offers a membership programme that gives access to the captivating Vagabond Club experience.

Lovers of creative libations will have to try The Whiskey Library's signature drink, Spice Road - a twist of an Old Fashioned that features scotch whiskey as a base, with hints of chocolate and spices like star anise, cinnamon, and cardamom for the ultimate sensorial experience. Another signature drink not to miss is the Cannery Row, a new take on a whiskey sour, featuring bourbon combined with vanilla and citrus flavours as well as a dash of red wine.

Guests can look forward to the famed modern Chinese cuisine from the adjoining Singapore Icon, Yellow Pot Little India. Chef Sebastian Goh has created an ingenious offering of Chinese fare with an innovative twist made for both intimate gatherings and larger groups. Favourites include the signature BBQ Roast Duck, Fried Prawns with Bonito Aioli and the highly addictive Crispy Sichuan Chicken — all paired perfectly with The Whiskey Library's expertly crafted drinks. 

Bespoke elements such as artisanal ice and an international selection of the finest of cigars together with the extensive collection of whiskeys, bourbons and craft cocktails bring a truly complete and unique experience to guests of The Whiskey Library. (Feb 2021)

data.title: The White Label
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prawn Pappardelle, Shorts Ribs Bourguignon, Eggs Benedict, Souffle Pancakes
data.ABOUT:
Located right behind the iconic Masjid Sultan amidst the hustle and bustle of the lively Kampong Gelam area, The White Label’s classy French decor boasts elegant chandeliers, gold cutleries and marbled tables for an upscale French dining experience. 

With an aim to serve popular French cuisine made halal, the restaurant whips up a variety of classical French dishes, ranging from Duck Confit to Salmon Beurre Blanc. Their signature Prawn Pappardelle is a dish that is not to be missed out on. Made from lobster bisque reduction, the dish features huge and juicy grilled tiger prawns that will surely delight your taste buds. 

For meat lovers, indulge in the Shorts Ribs Bourguignon to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Braised in a special sweet and spicy in house sauce, the fork tender beef short ribs melts in your mouth and leaves you coming back for more. Drop by during the weekend to have a taste of the classic Eggs Benedict and Souffle Pancakes series that make up the weekend brunch menu. 

Be it a romantic dinner for two or a celebratory meal for larger groups, The White Label is dedicated to serving authentic French dishes infused with local flavours for all. (Dec 2020)

data.title: The Wine & Gourmet Friends
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Local, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hei Zou (Pork & Seafood Roll), Foie Gras Lotus Leaf Rice, Roast Pork Belly (Antibiotic Free & No Added Hormones), Iberico “Bah Kut Teh” Risotto
data.ABOUT: This cozy hangout on the ground floor of a conservation shophouse promises delicious food and good wines put together by a team of industry veterans. From the kitchen comes Asian-style bites that are familiar yet innovative at the same time. Start dinner with the Pork and Seafood Roll Bite, a modern spin on Hei Zou. The deep-fried Pork and Seafood Roll here is rich with bounty from the sea and land, prepared with minced pork belly and diced sea prawns, mixed with crunchy turnips and cuttlefish paste. Eat this together with the refreshing homemade achar that is served on the side. Another dish to try is the Foie Gras Lotus Leaf Rice, a decadent dish of seared goose liver mixed with rice perfumed with garlic, sesame oil, and porcini mushrooms, wrapped in a fragrant lotus leaf. Pair these delectable bites with fruit-forward wines bursting with notes of ripe cherries, raspberries, and toasted oak.At TWGF, wines are imported directly from wineries around the world. With the economy of scale, elimination of multiple tiers of middlemen, and good relationships with wineries, they are able to continuously provide affordable, high-quality wines to all guests. (Dec 2018)

data.title: The Winery Tapas | Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prawn Ajillo, Pulpo A La Gallega, Squid Ink Paella, Presa Iberico
data.ABOUT:
At Winery, we believe food and wine unite people and form enduring friendships, setting the table for a life well-lived. Let us whisk you away on an epicurean adventure through our aisles of contemporary Asian And European tapas.
The Winery has got you covered no matter what you’re after. But it’s not just the food that’s catching people’s attention, as the wine list is masterfully curated by local award-winning sommelier, making sure that every sip and every bite go together perfectly to create a dining experience that’s not to be missed. (Feb 2021)

data.title: The Workbench Bistro
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: Blk 332 Ang Mo Kio Ave 1#01-1881Singapore (560332)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Salted Egg Wings, Pulled Pork Burger, Crab Meat Linguine, Signature Truffle Fries, Crab Cake Burger
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in the heart of Ang Mo Kio, Workbench Bistro aims to satisfy with its industrial decor and its crowd-pleasing menu. Small and cosy, this place is ideal for evening waffle dates, or for just sitting with a cold drink in one hand, watching one of the oldest neighborhoods in Singapore go by.
The hipster cafe trend has resulted in several must-have items on every self-respecting local cafe menu. A salted egg dish or two, a crab dish of some kind, truffle fries, craft beer. In this aspect, Workbench Bistro does not disappoint. It has not two, but four salted egg dishes on offer -- Salted Egg Chicken Pasta, Salted Egg Chicken Burger, Salted Egg Wings, and Salted Egg Wedges. The salted egg sauce is delightfully savory, and pairs well with the meats it comes with. There are two crab dishes, Crab Meat Linguine and Crab Cake Burger, that come chock full of fresh crab meat. If you come in a group, a must-order for sharing is the Signature Truffle Fries, which has that unmistakable aroma of truffle that is both appetizing and addictive. With the variety of craft beers available, and fluffy waffles for dessert, Workbench Bistro will undoubtedly make any cafe hopper very satisfied. (Sep 2016)

data.title: Thevar
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chettinad Chicken Roti, Crispy Pork, Rasam Oysters
data.PRESS RELEASE: Thevar is a modern grill restaurant and bar along the vibrant Keong Saik Road. It is spearheaded by Chef Mano Thevar and showcases creative combinations of traditional Indian flavours. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Thonglor Thai Cuisine & Seafood (West Coast)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 154 West Coast Road#02-25West Coast PlazaSingapore (127371)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Prawn with Garlic, Steam Seabass with Lime Sauce, Stir Fry Flower Clam with Sweet Basil Leaves & Chili Paste, Deep Fried Seabass with Special Chili Sauce
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Thonglor Thai Cuisine is a casual dining restaurant serving Authentic Thai dishes.

With a blend of affordable prices coupled with authentic, savoury local Thai cuisine, Thonglor is dedicated to bringing delicious Thai cuisine to delight your platter. 

Thonglor’s restaurant history comes all the way from the heartlands of Thailand. Driven by a passion for the Thai culture, our founders frequently made trips to Thailand to experience the uniqueness and beauty of the land of smiles. Bringing back the richness and authenticity of the Thai palette, Thonglor now serves authentic local Thai Food to Singaporeans at an affordable price. 

Look out for our promotional prices and Thai dishes of the week. Drop by and savour the richness of Thai cuisine for yourself!  (Sep 2019)

data.title: Three Buns Quayside
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Da Cheese Burger, Red Man Burger, Truffello, Seng Dog, Miso Dirty Fries
data.ABOUT:
By now, Potato Head has made a name for itself for its juicy, succulent burgers. Tuck into their decadent creations at their 80-seater standalone burger bar located in Quayside.
Helmed by executive chef Adam Penney, the burgers here are made from scratch using only premium European cheeses and two cuts of grass-fed Australian beef for the patties. The sauces are also made in-house, so you can expect to find quirky combinations on the menu here! Sink your teeth into exclusive creations like the Bun DMC, with a unique homemade watermelon rind relish stacked on barang goweng (fried shallots) on well-toasted buns with melted cheese. Or, go all out with the Red Man Burger, a nod to Singapore’s iconic dish beef rendang. Here, the beef cheeks are sous vide for 24 hours until meltingly tender, slathered with a sweet and spicy blend of gula melaka and over 10 spices that has been lovingly stewed for two hours. Housemade virgin coconut mayo is added to this concoction,sandwiched between two coconut buns.
There’s no denying the burgers at Three Buns Quayside are decadent — come hungry and relish every moment! (Oct 2018)

data.title: Thunderbird Bistro
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions

data.ABOUT:
Contemporary Asian Latin cuisine with a twist and pouring the best brews, situated near the historic wharf along the Singapore River. Known for serving the best commercial beers on tap since 2017, we are a cozy and friendly beer tavern located in Robertson Walk that resembles a Mediterranean town square with an aura of relaxation. 

We provide our guests with the best hospitality with a pint on one hand and delicious gastro bites in the other. We also feature many live sports daily such as EPL, rugby leagues, and more as well!

Email us for any event inquiries, be it birthdays parties or corporate functions inquiries
reservations@thunderbirdsb.com or drop us a message at +65 8816 8301 (Nov 2020)

data.title: Thus Coffee
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Thus Breakfast, Salmon & Kale Toast, Chicken Cutlet Jyolmeon, Wagyu Beef Grain Bowl
data.ABOUT:
If you’ve only ever been down Upper Thomson Road for the pratas, you’re missing out on the treasure trove of little indie bakeries, cafes, and restaurants tucked away in the small streets along the stretch. Thus Coffee is one of them, a specialty coffee joint in a charming residential area along Jalan Kuras, just a couple of minutes away from the Lower Peirce Reservoir Park. The space isn’t massive, but it’s very chic, done up with handsome wooden touches and a brushed concrete floor that announces its serious-coffee intentions. They’ve got an in-house roast and blend that they use for their coffees which promises a robust pick-me-up, but beyond a cuppa the food here is also to die for. Think subtle variations on the all-day breakfast menu, including treats like their in-house breakfast plate that features sous vide eggs on a fluffy muffin, paired with apple cider sausage, back bacon, mushrooms, and baked beans. Or the Salmon & Kale Toast, a fluffy brioche toastie topped with smoked salmon and avocado, creamy eggs, and a spinach and feta salad.

Lunch plates here take a heartier turn, with numbers like the Korean-inspired Chicken Cutlet Jyolmeon, chewy Gochujang-drenched noodles topped with a crispy chicken cutlet and sunny side up egg. The pasta here isn’t your garden variety stuff either, with punchy plates like the Linguine Puttanesca, bursting with ripe olives, piquant capers, chunky tomatoes, and briny anchovies. No self-respecting millennial outfit is complete with a grain bowl, and here the Wagyu Beef Grain Bowl takes pride of place, featuring tender beef atop a mélange of pearl barley and quinoa for some good artery-clearing health benefits and lots of toothsome flavour. Come for the mid-day coffee but stay for the mid-day snack and maybe dinner at this charming, Instagram-worthy haunt in one of Singapore’s most idyllic little neighbourhoods. (Feb 2018)

data.title: Thyme @Aliwal
data.Cuisine: Modern European, Italian, Fusion, British, Vegetarian Friendly, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.ABOUT:
This cosy little spot is the perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. From the beautiful art on the walls to the homely dishes on the menu, everything about this spot is comforting, making it the perfect place to unwind after a long day. 

The menu items here are healthy dishes meant to feed the stomach and soul. The Asian Prawn & Quinoa Salad is a light dish of spiced shrimp tossed with avocado, greens, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and sprinkled with quinoa pearls. The tender shrimp and crisp greens make for a great texture combination, and the cucumber and tomatoes give the dish a fresh flavour that is hard to pass up. Diners after something more than a salad will enjoy the Salmon & Kale Stir Fry. Made with a generous serving of salmon tossed in kale with chilli and garlic, this dish is simple, spicy, and delicious.

For something a little heartier, opt for the Chorizo & Kale Broth. A rich stew of spiced Italian sausage, sprigs of kale, and juicy tomatoes, this is the perfect pick-me-up on a cold day, and is best enjoyed warm. The ever-popular burger is a crowd favourite, and for good reason. Made with a juicy meat patty and thick cut fries, this dish will satisfy all your cravings. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Tien Court
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 403 Havelock RoadCopthorne King's Hotel SingaporeSingapore (169632)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Herbal Braised Spring Chicken with Chestnut, Braised Spare Rib in Black Vinegar Sauce, Chef's Specialty Spring Chicken (Whole), Spicy Mala Crispy Chicken, Wok Hey Spicy Prawn
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Tien Court specialises in contemporary Cantonese cuisine along with a delectable selection of stir-fried dishes and freshly crafted Dim Sum. As more people are adopting to healthy eating habits, Tien Court is introducing a Nourishing Menu 养身菜单to cater to these consumers. Tien Court will promote dishes that have significant health benefits and yet delectable to the palate. We are collaborating with Chinese Physician Zhang Lei 张磊医师where he will conduct a monthly soup recommendation that boosts the different aspect of our health.

For a quick business lunch, Tien Court is launching a 5 Course Executive Set Lunch Menu where associates can enjoy dishes like Dim Sum Combination Platter, Soup of the Day with Claypot Chicken with Cordyceps Flower, and Trio Egg with Spinach in Superior Stock. End the meal with Tien Court’s Signature Stewed Seafood Beehoon in Superior Stock. Our Executive Set Lunch Menu is priced at $38++ per person, available from Wednesday to Monday only.

If you have a hearty appetite, Tien Court is also launching our Eat-All-You-Can Ala Carte Lunch and Dinner buffet priced at $40.80++ per person for Lunch and $54++ per person for dinner. Our Eat-All-You-Can Ala Carte Buffet comes with a 6 course set menu with 24 other dishes where you can reorder to your heart’s content. Indulge in all time favourite dishes like Stir Fried Fish Fillet with Ginger and Scallion, Sweet and Sour Pork, Stir Fried Beef with Green Pepper and many more.

Tien Court restaurant is often described as one of Singapore’s best "undiscovered" Chinese restaurants. The classical Chinese setting provides a delicate counterpoint to the dishes that are elegantly plated yet boldly daring in flavour. Our extensive menu is reflective of our efforts to cater to every palate. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Tiffin Room (Raffles Hotel)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 1 Beach RoadGrand Lobby, Raffles SingaporeSingapore (189673)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Jhinga Kebab, Nalli Roganjosh, Makhana Paneer, Chocolate Gulab Jamun
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Part of the heritage of Raffles Hotel Singapore since 1892, the newly restored Tiffin Room returns and continues to celebrate the flavours of North India with an elevated dining experience featuring a resplendent interior, new delights and an extensive selection of vegetarian specialities.

Newly refreshed, Tiffin Room showcases a reinstatement of wooden floorboards reminiscent of its décor in the early 1900s. It presents an extended menu featuring authentic specialties from every main region of North India like Kashmir, Lucknow, Punjab and Rajasthan. The century-old restaurant also delivers classic Indian brews and paired beverages as well as an interactive dining experience with tableside service by chefs, perfected with freshly ground spices.For lunch, guests can enjoy an exquisite array of delicacies with a tantalising buffet accompanied with pass around delights or opt for the Thali Experience, a flavourful curation of signature Tiffin Room highlights served on a classic silver plate known as a thali.

Dinner at Tiffin Room is an a la carte affair and includes the heart-warming, customisable Mera Dabba (literally means "my box" in Hindi). Inspired by the home-cooked meals thoughtfully prepared by Indian families for their loved ones and packed into tiffin boxes, Mera Dabba offers a charmingly elevated North Indian meal experience presented in custom-made copper tiffin boxes and complemented with comforting curries, delicately-flavoured rice, tandoori breads, chutneys and pickles.

data.title: Tiger Street Lab
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wok-fried King Prawn White Bee Hoon, Handmade Beancurd Skin Prawn Roll, Indonesian Curry King Prawns, Trio-sampler of Sambal Quail Eggs, Salt Pepper Shrimps and Tiger Infused Crispy Baby Sotong
data.ABOUT:
Tiger Street Lab is Tiger Beer’s first-ever global concept store inviting people from Singapore and around the world to explore a more unexpected side of Singapore - a representation of Singapore shaped by our very own local talents. 

As a brand that is truly Singaporean but with an international footprint, available in more Han 50 markets across the globe, Tiger Beer understands, supports and celebrates all things that champion Singapore from taste to talent. 

Experience seasonal brews and a diverse menu of local street food favourites and international classics created in collaboration with Timbre X and the chefs from Da Shi Jia, 大食家. Discover unconventional artworks and merchandise designed by local talents, as well as an interactive digital customisation station where you can personalize your own Tiger Beer bottle label. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Timbre X S.E.A
data.Good For: City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: 1 Old Parliament Lane#01-04The Arts HouseSingapore (179429)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Poached Black Mussels in Coconut Tom Yum Broth, Rillette of Beef Rendang on Rosti, Thai Bas Duo Pork Capellini, Chili Crab Kueh Pie Tee
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Sitting by the Singapore River is the Timbre X S.E.A, housed in a beautifully restored historical building that used to play host to Singapore’s parliamentary meetings. Nestled in the heritage district and close to the landing site of our nation’s founder, Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles, Timbre X S.E.A hopes to bring the region’s music, food and drinks together.

For a perfect visit to this location; order Southeast Asian inspired dishes and drinks and take it all in. Must-try dishes include Poached Black Mussels in Coconut Tom Yum Broth, Rillette of Beef Rendang on Rosti, Thai Bas Duo Pork Capellini, and Chili Crab Kueh Pie Tee. Wash the food down with exclusive Thai Mojito, Chendol Cocktail, and a great selection of draught beers and wines.

To curate a one-of-the-kind Southeast Asia experience, Timbre X S.E.A will also see renowned  Southeast Asia F&B brands serving up their signatures on our menu for a limited time. And on the music front having regional acts on our stage when the borders reopen! Do follow our @TIMBREXSEA on Instagram to be updated on our latest collaboration. (Oct 2020)
