The nightly live music performances and wide varieties of beer available at Bottle Shop make Timbre+ a place to be where music feeds the soul and food feed the body. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Tittle Tattle
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mr Avocado, Tittle Tattle Disaster, Smoked Salmon Egg Affair, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Dinosaur Waffle, Fried Broccoli.
data.ABOUT:
You can literally feast all day on brunch and stunning waffles at Tittle Tattle. A 24-hour vintage cafe cum bar decked with touches of retro furnishing, Tittle Tattle exudes a 1980s vibe that is inviting and cosy. 

If all day breakfast is your thing, you can drop by anytime of the day to enjoy the cafe’s hearty Tittle Tattle Breakfast. A hearty breakfast platter that features a delicious mix of Italian sausages, bacon, scrambled egg and sauteed mushrooms, this is the breakfast of champions. For those hunting down more nutritious chow, Tittle Tattle offers Mr Avocado that features slices of toasted bread and smeared with avocado, crowned with a beautifully poached egg and a generous heap of greens on the side. 

If  you’re more inclined for something sweet, you can indulge in the Tittle Tattle Disaster -  A waffle topped with macarons, marshmallows, iced gem biscuits, full kinder bueno sticks and a huge scoop of ice cream, this dish will surely take you on a sugar high. 

Their extensive menu also features other cafe style brunch options. Other signature dishes here include the Smoked Salmon Egg Affair and Beer Battered Fish & Chips.

Grab a friend or two and head on down to Tittle Tattle for a casual brunch or study date today! Bonus points for accessible powerpoints that can also keep your devices juiced up throughout your stay. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Todamgol
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bu Dae Jji Gae, Herbal Ginseng Chicken Soup, Grilled Saba Fish, Seafood Pancake with Spring Onion, Rice Wine
data.ABOUT:
Todamgol prides itself on being a traditional Korean restaurant and rice wine house, serving up authentic soups, stews, meats, seafood, and more. As you step inside, old-school decor and climbing plants will whisk you away to a peaceful Korean village, making it the perfect hideout from the hustle and bustle of town.

The menu showcases a variety of dishes that we have come to know and love, such as the Bu Dae Jji Gae, a spicy sausage stew with ramyeon noodles, and the Herbal Ginseng Chicken Soup. Other favourites include the Grilled Saba Fish that's simple yet full of flavour, and the Seafood Pancake with Spring Onion. All the mains come in hearty sharing portions, so be sure to grab a few buddies before heading down!

No visit to Todamgol is complete without pairing the dishes with some smooth and subtly sweet rice draft wine. If you don't fancy alcohol, they offer a non-alcoholic rice drink that's sure to quench your thirst as well. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Tomo Izakaya (Clarke Quay)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: 3A River Valley Road#01-14Block A, Clarke Quay Singapore (179020)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Gobo Chips, Aspara Maki, Salmon Wasabi Mayo, Ochazuke
data.ABOUT:
Chic, minimalist, and cosy, Tomo Izakaya captures the essence of a traditional izakaya while injecting youthful fun in both the restaurant's decor and food. Relax and unwind over sake, wines and spirits as you tuck into delicious Japanese cuisine at Tomo Izakaya. Air-flown twice weekly from Tokyo’s famed Tsukiji Market, all the ingredients showcase the best of the seasons. 

The izakaya offers small plate dishes such as yakitori, sushi and karaage. Crunchy and addictive, the deep fried Gobo Chips are great bar snacks. Another delightful small plate is the Aspara Maki. Wrapped in pork belly, the grilled asparagus is full of flavour. A welcome twist on the usual grilled salmon with cheese, the Salmon Wasabi Mayo uses the punch of wasabi to give the grilled salmon an extra kick.

For something light and more refreshing, have a bowl of Ochazuke. With a choice of salmon, plum or spicy roe, the Japanese-style porridge is the perfect comfort dish on rainy days. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Tonic
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: 30 Beach RoadJW Marriott Singapore South BeachSingapore (189763)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mom, Ink Dry Gin, Wagyu Satay, Buffalo Wings, Burrata
data.ABOUT:
If you’re looking for a bar to have a private tete-a-tete, head to Tonic. Nestled in a quiet corner of the hotel’s main lobby, the soothing soundtrack and leather banquette seats are perfect to unwind and sit back with a glass of craft gin and tonic. 

The drinks menu puts the spotlight on artisanal, small-batch gins from around the world. For instance, The Mom cocktail is a sweet and refreshing drink to start. Here, a berry-infused English gin is mixed with East Imperial Old World tonic for an easy tipple. The Ink Dry Gin is sure to impress with its pretty purple hue, paired with yuzu-flavoured tonic water for that splash of bright, citrus flavour. 

For savoury bites to go with your cocktail, Tonic serves up staple bar bites such as Buffalo Wings with scrumptious dips and Truffle Fries. If you fancy a little indulgence, try the Wagyu Satay — tender cubes of delectably marbled beef are grilled to yield a smoky char, perfect with the accompanying dish of peanut sauce. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Tonkichi (Isetan Scotts)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 350 Orchard RoadLevel 4Shaw House Isetan ScottsSingapore (238868)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Premium Rosu Katsu Set, Cheese Kasane Katsu Set, Sashimi Mori, Tonkichi Special Roll
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Tonkichi serves real Japanese tonkatsu, prepared the authentic, traditional way. We have 2 kinds of tonkatsu meat—pork fillet and pork loin, all carefully selected and trimmed with the utmost care and skill. Pork fillet has the finest texture and is thought to be among the healthiest pork cuts as they are lower in fat and calories, and richer in vitamins. Good pork fillet, cooked by our expert chefs, can be cut even with just chopsticks.


Our pork loin has just enough fat in it to offer a rich aroma and a great texture, every bite offering you a great taste experience. Served with rice, miso soup with Japanese pickles, and completed with an appetiser, our tonkatsu makes the quintessential perfect Japanese set meal. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Tonny Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Steamboat, Zi Char
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, Steamed Pantin Fish, Double Boiled Black Chicken Soup, Pan-fried Slice Foie Gras, Double Boiled Bird’s Nest with Brown Sugar, Deep Fried Banana Yam Roll
data.ABOUT:
If you’re looking for culinary perfection, search no further. For us hungry diners, utter gastronomic perfection can be savoured at Tonny Restaurant, a Cantonese eatery run by chef Tonny Chan who hails from Hong Kong and honed his chops at establishments such as Sha Tin Kitchen and Dempsey’s Grand Hong Kong.  

Now stationed at his eponymous eating joint, Tonny serves up old-school Cantonese fare alongside innovative dishes that are just as delectable. Not only do these plates of wonder attract epicureans from across the country, but local celebrities have been seen tucking into the nosh here, as evidenced by photographs of famous faces posing for photographs with Tonny plastered across the walls. 

When dining at Tonny Restaurant, one mustn’t skip out on the epic Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon. Made from juicy scallops, egg whites, and tasty fish roe, this dish promises to be a knockout for the senses. Then there’s the Steamed Pantin Fish which showcases Tonny’s roots in Hong Kong and Singapore. Here, this butterflied fish is topped with copious amounts of ginger paste and chilli paste on either side, and enhanced with light touches of oil and soy sauce.  

If you want to round off a satisfying meal on a sweet note, we suggest going for options such as the Deep Fried Banana Yam Roll or healthful Double Boiled Bird’s Nest with Brown Sugar. Craving authentic Cantonese fare? Hit up Tonny Restaurant for the real deal. (Sep 2017)

data.title: Torasho Ramen & Charcoal Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Japanese, Fusion, Southeast Asian, BBQ
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Wagyu Dry Ramen, Spicy Uni Tsukemen, Lobster Dry Ramen, Truffle Tonkotsu
data.ABOUT:
Torasho Ramen & Charcoal Bar prides itself on serving one of the best Tsukemen broths in Singapore, with the perfect ratio of tonkotsu and seafood broths in a bowl. An open kitchen lets you have a peek at the magic that goes behind the scenes. Chef Sho helms the kitchen, that dishes out appetisers, ramen, robata (charcoal and wood grill), and fresh sashimi.

While they uphold Japanese traditions, expect some unexpected taste twists to your palate. Truffle lovers will enjoy the addition of this umami bomb of a flavour into the Truffle Wagyu Dry Ramen, the Truffle Tonkotsu, and even in snacks such as the Truffle Edamame. Whilst slurping on springy ramen noodles and piping hot soup, have a glass or two of their hand-crafted cocktails or their unique, transparent homemade cola. (Jan 2020)

data.title: ToriYard
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 1380 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 1Bishan Park 2Singapore (569930)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tori Chicken Skewer, Tsukune Ohba Tsutsumi Age, Ebi, Onsen Tamago Cocktail, Tebasaki Gyoza
data.ABOUT:
Nestled amongst the lush greenery of Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park II, is a dining experience that exudes an aura of a sun-drenched vacation spot somewhere far from the madding crowd. There lies Canopy Garden Dining, serving up an impressive all-day casual dining menu.

Whether you are looking to relax over brunch, have a quick bite to go with your furry four-legged friend, or gather with family and friends for some drinks, Canopy provides a picturesque view to unwind to, or make your Instagram followers green with envy.

Canopy serves up a pretty mean selection of hearty and healthy dishes for everyone from the early risers to the after-work park goers. Brunch items, served till 2pm, is full of bountiful choices like Classic Eggs Benedict and Scrambled Egg Croissant. For lunch and dinner, you can look forward to substantial mains like the Lamb Rack, Black Angus BBQ Burger, Seafood Pomodoro, and our crowd favourite Crabmeat. For sharing, check out the small plates featuring Calamari Fritters, Chicken Hot Wings, Australian Grain-fed Beef Cubes, and more! (Jul 2020)

data.title: Trapizza
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pizza Siciliana, Pizza di Mare, Siloso Prawn Salad, Trapizza Linguine, Crispy Fried Veal Milanese, Wagyu Beef Burger
data.ABOUT:
Trapizza is a casual Italian eatery located on Siloso Beach, just a five-minute walk away from Shangri-La’s Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa.
The dining establishment offers a revitalised dining experience with an enhanced menu featuring mouth-watering pastas, perfectly baked pizzas, alongside salads, desserts and creative reinterpretations of classic cocktails.
As with the interior, the menu has also been refreshed to showcase the best of Italian comfort food while preserving some of the restaurant’s best dishes.
Pizza lovers, rejoice! The thin-crust pizza at Trapizza is their claim to fame and popular with adults and children alike. The handmade pizzas are topped with fresh ingredients and sprinkled generously with cheese, creating that Instagram-worthy cheese pull.
Other classic favourites on the menu include the Trapizza Linguine and Siloso Prawn Salad. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Trattoria La Vita
data.Hours: Mon-Wed: 12-2:30pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:15pm)Thu-Sat: 12-2:30pm (Last Order: 2pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Closed Sunday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Vitello Tonnato, Pappardelle Porcini Duck Ragout, Seabass Acqua Pazza
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Trattoria La Vita prides itself on serving authentic, homely Italian cuisine in a friendly atmosphere where friends and family can gather over a good meal. Located along a row of shophouses between Clarke Quay and Boat Quay, it’s difficult to miss its signature orange logo.

The menu boasts a wide array of Italian favourites, from appetisers to pastas, meats, and desserts.

Whet your appetite with the Burrata Cheese or the Vitello Tonnato before digging into the mains.

Pasta fans will love the Pappardelle Duck Ragout and Ricotta Ravioli, while those looking for something heartier pick from a selection of grilled steaks.
For dessert, sink your teeth into a decadent Tiramisu or Crème Brulee. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Trattoria Nonna Lina
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Frittura di Calamari, Zuppetta Argentarina, Carapaccio di Manzo all'essenza di Tartufo, Spaghetti Carbonara di Mare, Pappardelle della Vigna, Cacciucco, Fiorentina, Grigliata Mista, Bonet Argentarino, Tiramisu.
data.ABOUT:
Named after Chef Simone’s beloved grandmother, Trattoria Nonna Lina is an utterly charming Italian bistro tucked away on Cantonment Road that spins up homestyle cooking that is sure to please everyone in the family. 

You won’t miss the brightly painted facade of this eatery as this conservation shophouse is painted in the bold colours of the Italian flag, ensuring this building stands out from the rest of the block. Inside, the decor draws inspiration from the sleepy seaside town of Porto Santo Stefano, where life is simple and the fishermen bring in the freshest Mediterranean catch every evening. Rustic and comforting, Trattoria Nonna Lina’s food showcases the best of traditional Tuscan cuisine. Start with the Bruschette di Nonna Lina, made with uber-fresh chopped tomatoes and a hint of basil sitting on slices of bread. 

Next, get a Pappardelle della Vigna, featuring Italian sausages and a creamy sauce made using blue cheese. It may be simple, but it packs quite a punch! For a taste of coastal Tuscany, try the Cacciucco, a thick stew of various seafood cooked in homemade tomato broth. Last but not least, the majestic Bistecca Fiorentina is perfect for hungry meat-lovers.

Come for the top-notch Tuscan-styled nosh, but stay for an evening of long conversations with friends with a bottle of wine or two. (Jul 2018)

data.PRESS RELEASE: TribeD³ Lounge offers an Asian fusion style menu and event services, with the aim to create a networking platform where associates and executives can have their company retreats and families can indulge in quality time. (May 2019)

data.title: True Blue Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ngoh Hiang, Jantong Pisang Salad, Ayam Buah Keluak, Beef Rendang, Kari Kepala Ikan
data.ABOUT:
True Blue Cuisine started in late 2003 in a pre-war shophouse in the Peranakan enclave of Katong.  The restaurant’s aim is to serve the best authentic Peranakan cuisine to Singapore and the world.  It was set up jointly with Baba Benjamin’s mother Bibik Daisy Seah, a well respected Peranakan chef.

True Blue Cuisine is the place for a good Peranakan feat - drawing locals and food lovers from all over the world.  Legendary dishes are their Ngoh Hiang (Minced Chicken and Prawn meat rolls wrapped in Beancurd skin), Jantong Pisang salad (Banana Blossoms with Cucumber), Ayam Buah Keluak (Chicken stewed with Indonesian black nuts), Beef Rendang (Beef simmered in a coconut sauce/dry curry) and Kari Kepala Ikan (Whole fish head curry).
True Blue Cuisine is situated beside the Peranakan museum at 49 Armenian Street, and it compliments the museum and brings to life an all-round experience of the rich Peranakan culture.
(Dec 2017)

data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.ABOUT: TSUBAKI BY SHUNSUI is a Kyoto Cuisine Restaurant.Chef Kenta Yamauchi introduces varieties of Omakase courses featuring Kyoto ingredients. (Mar 2021)

data.title: TungLok Heen
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 26 Sentosa Gateway#02-142/143, Hotel MichaelLobby Level, Resorts World SentosaSingapore (098138) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Char-Grilled Kurobuta Pork Jowl, Braised King Prawn, Roast Irish Duck, Oven-Baked Greenly Abalone with Salt and Japanese Kombu, Steamed Crab with Egg White and Chinese Wine
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Brace yourself, for TungLok Heen’s new menu has arrived on the shores of Sentosa today! 

Specially-curated by Celebrity Chef Susur Lee with the assistance of Senior Executive Chef Ken Ling, this menu features delicacies that aim to delight your taste-buds in every way. 

We have retained and upgraded all the crowd-pleasers such as Char-grilled Kurobuta Pork Jowl, Braised King Prawn with Superior Soya Sauce and Roast Irish Duck; and at the same time, included delectable dishes like Oven-baked Greenly Abalone with Salt and Japanese Kombu, Double-boiled Superior Fish Bone Soup with Fish Maw and Grilled Fish with Hot and Sour Consommé. Seafood aficionados out there will be happy to know that we have added in a variety of SEAFOOD such as Steamed Crab with Egg White and Chinese Wine, Live Australian Lobster with Singapore-style Chilli Sauce and Braised King Prawn with White Peppercorn. 

The Steamed Wild White Sultan with Crunchy Scale snagged the limelight with its delicate pearl white flesh that boasts an exceptional sweetness. Steaming the White Sultan Fish causes its scales to stand, providing a spectacle with its unique appearance. It is high in Omega-3 oil, which is known to prevent and manage heart disease. 

Now, don’t deprive your palate of these exquisite dishes! Make a plan to visit us today for an unforgettable dining experience. (Jul 2019)

data.title: TungLok Seafood (Orchard Central)
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 11:30am-1pm, 1:15-3pm, 6-8pm, 8:15-10pmClosed Friday, Saturday, Sunday & PH, PH Eve
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: TungLok Seafood Platter,  Fish Maw Broth with Four Treasures, Black Pepper Crab, Stewed ‘Ee-fu’ Noodles, Chilled Herbal Jelly with Honey
data.ABOUT:
A culinary powerhouse, TungLok has built its stellar reputation on creating Chinese meals that define perfection. With TungLok Seafood, the restaurant empire turns its focus to creating a seafood bonanza for diners as it welcomes hungry eaters from all corners of Singapore with its consistently delicious, locally-inspired seafood. 

Take a swim in the culinary ocean starting with the TungLok Seafood Platter. An ultimate crustacean dream, this impressive platter is practically overflowing with cuts of bluefin tuna, salmon, fresh oysters drizzled with chilli sauce, poached prawns, and braised baby abalone. The Fish Maw Broth with Four Treasures is a soup that’s sure to garner the approval of your health-conscious mother or grandmother, as it is packed with rich proteins and nutrients that will boost your immune system. Other perennial favourites include the super-shiok Black Pepper Crab. Sautéed with a homemade concoction of black pepper and fresh peppercorns, this highly-acclaimed crab dish is so finger-licking good you’ll be coming back for more. 

Set in Orchard Central, TungLok Seafood is the place to go after a full day of shopping or running errands in the shopping district. So don’t waste your time and energy trawling through an ocean of mediocre seafood restaurants. TungLok Seafood will be your perfect culinary catch – that’s our promise! (Jul 2017)

data.title: TungLok Signatures (Changi City Point)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: No.5 Changi Business Park Central 1#01-26/27Changi City PointSingapore (486038)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Flaming Fortune Chicken, Roast Irish Duck, Chilled Australian Lobster with Icy Salad served with Fresh Fruits, Pan-fried Norwegian Salmon with Mixed Salad
data.ABOUT:
Tunglok Signatures has long been synonymous with excellent traditional Chinese cuisine, the go-to place for family celebrations and birthdays. Regardless of which outlet you visit in Singapore, you can be assured that each exquisite morsel on your plate has been carefully planned by a team of chefs who really understand the nuances of Chinese cooking and are willing to take risks as they push the boundaries for a better dining experience. Indeed, Tunglok has a way of taking the most basic of Chinese dishes and ramping up its flavour and style quotient. 

Take the Tung Lok Flaming Fortune Chicken for instance. The wedding banquet staple, roast chicken, has been updated in spectacular style. It arrives at your table wreathed in flame, and if that's not enough spectacle, its taste doesn’t disappoint with its plump and juicy flesh. Another poultry dish, the Roast Irish Duck, is made using only the best Irish Duck from Silver Hill Farm. If you ever thought the Irish were only known for four-leaf clovers and leprechauns, you might want to add duck to your list. The flesh of the bird is so juicy and flavourful that you wonder what magic happens in the farm and in the Tunglok Signatures kitchen. (Aug 2016)

data.PRESS RELEASE: Whet your appetite for the finest epicurean delights as TungLok Signatures introduces its ala carte menu, flourished with tantalising traditional and modern dishes with our distinctive touch. Be swept away by a myriad of flavours from our premium ingredients at 4 convenient locations.With a detailed menu planned and carefully crafted by Executive Chef Li Man, our masterchefs’ skilful execution and innovative vision have produced a unique dining concept that has impressed many. Reminisce the taste and soul of Chinese tradition as these delicacies charm your palate with each tender morsel. (Aug 2016)

data.title: TungLok Teahouse (Square 2)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: TungLok Chilli Crab, Steamed Siew Mai, Stewed Pig’s Trotters with Black Vinegar, Crisp-fried Prawns with Soya Sauce, Smoked Duck Wrapped with Pancakes, Deep-fried Garlic Ribs, Steamed Minced Pork with Salted Egg Yolk
data.PRESS RELEASE:
TungLok Teahouse brings you experiential dining amidst the Peranakan-styled furniture and period décor including posters, lighting fixtures and tiles. Be treated to a traditional teahouse ambience with oldies from the 1960s to 1980s.

Offering a range of piping hot Dim Sum 'made on the spot, steamed to order' and Traditional Chinese favourites including Teochew dishes. These exquisite dishes are recreated with TungLok’s distinct creativity while retaining the authentic flavours and tastes of yesteryears. (Jul 2017)

data.title: TungLok XiHe Peking Duck (Orchard Central)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Peking London Duck, Wok-Fried Crab with Homemade Spicy Sauce, Mrs Zhang's Braised Lion's Head Meatball, Hot & Sour Soup with Fresh Shrimp, Braised 'Ee-fu' Noodle with Lobster in Superior Stock, 'Zhen-Jiang'-Style Pork Ribs, Pan-Fried King Prawns
data.ABOUT:
As complex as Peking London Duck may sound - London duck from Ireland's Silver Hill Farm served in traditional Peking style - there's nothing complicated about our feelings for this delicacy from TungLok XiHe. Specially bred and aged to produce dense and porous skin along with tender flesh, the duck is cured with a secret mix of spices and filled with a special marinade before hung to roast in a traditional oven.

The end result? Sheer perfection. We could spend forever tucking into endless wraps of juicy duck breast or creating our very own delectable bundles of joy using steaming slivers of duck thigh and a slew of incredible condiments. Our real favourite, however, is the skin and TungLok's version delivers both creativity and classic flavours. Crispy skin is highlighted with a unique blueberry sauce and Popping Rocks dip, bringing true meaning to the jingle: once you pop you just can't stop. If you can tear yourself away from the duck party in your mouth, the rest of the menu is nothing to sneeze at either. There's Wok-Fried Crab with Homemade Spicy Sauce, Mrs Zhang's Braised Lion's Head Meatball, Hot and Sour Soup with Fresh Shrimp, and more Chinese delicacies that score full marks. All their effort paid off in spades, we say! (Jul 2016)

data.title: Two Blur Guys
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prime Beef Burger, Duck Rillette, Pulled Pork, Portobello Mushroom
data.ABOUT:
With its unobtrusive signboard and simple décor, it’s easy to dismiss this hole-in-the-wall eatery but, if nothing else, the mouthwatering smells wafting from the entrance and al fresco tables packed with people should hint at the delicious nosh you’re missing out on!
Rather than pepper their menu with a variety of different offerings, Two Blur Guys beams their laser focus onto producing excellent gourmet burgers. So you can chow down on offerings like Duck Rillette, Prime Beef with Portobello, and Pulled Pork, safe in the knowledge that they’ve been finely tuned to perfection. As Two Blur Guys says – they’re “blur about everything. Except [their] burgers”. (Feb 2016)

data.title: Typhoon Cafe (Bugis+)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Classic Lu Rou Fan, Oyster Omelette, Canadian Pork Belly Stew with Preserved Vegetables, Typhoon Pavlova, San Bei Chicken, Tropical Passion Fruit Tea, Souffle Stackers
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Typhoon Cafe brings the “Taste of Taiwan” to the heart of Singapore. A concept that unifies Taiwan’s unparalleled flavours, obsession for artisan fruit teas and larger-than-life desserts set in cafe-style comfort.

Located along Singapore’s hottest shopping district, one no longer have to endure “夜市” crowds and compromise sleep to get a Taiwan food fix. Typhoon Cafe is located right in sunny Singapore’s Plaza Singapura. Name inspired by “台风” (which also means Typhoon) is an abbreviation of “台湾风味” which means Taste of Taiwan. Expect to complete an entire meal with iconic dishes from the famed food capital like Classic Lu Rou Fan, Oyster Omelette to decadently adorned Coffin Toast and flavoursome fruit teas. Going beyond the streets, Typhoon Cafe births its very own signature dishes like Australian Beef Short Rib with Wuxi Maltose Glaze and Canadian Pork Belly Stew with Preserved Vegetables; their flavors will not disappoint. Check out Typhoon Cafe’s Board Set series featuring 17 traditional Chinese meal of a “小菜”(small side), soup of the day with a main course.

Typhoon Cafe is designed to simulate ahole-in-the-wall cafe along Taiwan’s quaint Fujin Cafe Street, the casual unpretentious restaurant is perfect for any time of the day from quick lunches for student/professionals to afternoon high teas and even after-work casual dinners with family and friends! (Dec 2020)

data.title: Tóng Lè Private Dining
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bird’s Nest in Chicken Consomme, Fairy Duck of Confucian Mansion, Buddha Jumps over the Wall, Steamed Halibut with Kimchi
data.ABOUT:
The TungLok group never ceases to impress, and with Tong Le Private Dining, they have set the bar high for world-class fine Chinese dining. Here’s a peerless experience for any occasion. Sprawled across two expansive levels of the OUE Tower, the space somehow effortlessly manages to be both luxurious yet intimate and cosy at the same time. Should you need that extra privacy, Tong Le offers 11 private rooms, seating from two to 22 diners. What’s more, this revolving restaurant promises stunning 360° views of the Marina Bay skyline. 

Using only the best ingredients from round the world, the stellar dishes boast of intricate flavours, yet evokes the familiar taste of home. The interesting twist, though, is that these timeless Chinese dishes are reinvented by award-winning chefs to blend contemporary flavours into the traditional fare. The pre-fixed menus also change every fortnight to keep things fresh. Should you have any dining requirements though, Tong Le is able to tailor your menu upon prior request. For an elevated dining experience, Tong Le Private Dining is undoubtedly your top choice. (Nov 2016)

data.title: UNA at The Alkaff Mansion
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Paella De Marisco, Wagyu A La Parrilla, Arroz Con Leche De La Abuela
data.PRESS RELEASE: UNA, previously at One Rochester, will be reopening its doors in May 2019. Now housed at Level 2 of The Alkaff Mansion, the modern and romantic restaurant has returned with its past signature items (i.e suckling pig, selection of Paellas, Spanish grills, etc) and is now moving towards a renewed emphasis on Basque Cuisine.  Through a strategic partnership with Basque Culinary Institute,  UNA will partner producers and culinary associations from the Basque region to bring the best of Basque Cuisine and culture to Singapore. (May 2019)

data.title: UOUO
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Katsu Curry Rice, Cheese Curry Salmon, UOUO Fresh Fish Assorted
data.ABOUT:
UOUO is the latest venture from the people behind Yakiniku-Oh. Located at Sunshine Plaza, deal-hunters will be delighted to find this hole in the wall dining establishment. UOUO offers the freshest fish from Japan to customers at affordable prices. Consisting of a bar counter on one side and dining tables on the other, this cosy joint in the heart of town is extremely accessible, and yet, also allows for some privacy, making it the perfect place for a quick lunch with friends. 

For those who love hearty meals, try the Chicken Katsu Curry Rice. Sure to fill you up, the curry is thick and filling, while the chicken katsu is crispy and satisfying. Other standouts include the Cheese Curry Salmon. This combination consists of a hearty and delicious dish, with melted cheese drizzled over a thick slice of salmon.

UOUO also offers set lunches that allow diners to enjoy a main, a hot bowl of salmon miso soup, a refreshing salad, as well as green tea that’s refillable for all customers. (Jan 2020)

data.title: USHIO
data.Good For: Al Fresco, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tori Skin Crisp, Seafood Flatbread, Ox Tendon & Foie Gras Oden, Truffle Karubi Sumiyaki Donburi
data.ABOUT:
Journey to an unforgettable izakaya experience with a view at Ushio. Nestled within the iconic OUE Tower, the restaurant also features an alfresco dining area where diners can revel in the beautiful views of the amazing Marina Bay waterfront. 

Home to grilled bincho delicacies and creative sharing plates, Ushio is the ideal place for a quick catch up with friends or an intimate date over authentic Japanese delights.  Boasting originality with a contemporary touch, Ushio’s innovative offerings are as delicious as they are fresh. 

Start off with sharing platters such as the Tori Skin Crisps or Seafood Flatbread to whet your appetite. Served with creme fraiche and shio kombu, the crispy Tori Skin Crisps are lightly seasoned with yuzu pepper to spice things up. The Ox Tendon and Foie Gras Oden is an indulgent meat dish that is served with poached daikon radish, braised Japanese pumpkin and shirataki noodles.

For truffle lovers, the Truffle Karubi Sumiyaki Donburi is a must-order. Topped with charcoal-grilled soy glazed US Angus beef, homemade pickles and onsen egg over takikomi gohan, this mouthwatering bowl of tender beef is the perfect combination of meat and truffle. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Un-Yang-Kor-Dai
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pen Laos Signature Grilled Chicken, Khao Niew Dum, Stir-fried Lobster with Salted Egg Sauce, Phad Thai Tom Yum with Seafood
data.ABOUT:
“Un Yang Kor Dai” means anything goes, and pretty much summarises the story of this restaurant. Founded by four friends with varying expertise, this restaurant specialises in authentic Thai cuisine and is modelled after the communal dining restaurants of Thailand. The first overseas outpost of this popular Thai restaurant specialises in Thai classics, and also brings us a variety of new dishes that are equally as tempting.

The Issan Spicy Grilled Pork Neck Fried Rice is one of the popular menu items, and features buttery rice stir-fried in a mix of spices and topped with tender pork neck meat. The richness of the pork meat combined with the fragrant rice makes for a filling meal. Another unique menu item is  the Minced Pork Dip In Preserved Soy Bean And Coconut Milk Served With Rice Crackers. The tender pork and coconut together is a deliciously sweet combination, and is tempered by the briny flavour of preserved soybean. 

For something a little lighter, opt for the Steamed Whole Sea Bass In Spicy Lime Sauce. The tangy and spicy sauce combined with the tenderness of the steamed fish is irresistable. Enjoy this dish with a bowl of steamed rice, or dig into it on its own. (Oct 2018)

data.title: Una Una (Bugis+)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Unagi Kabayaki Set, Kaisen Hitsumabushi, Salmon Yon Shu Mori, Unagi & Salmon Ikura Ju, Unaju
data.PRESS RELEASE: Revel in delight as you watch our Unagi chefs cook up your favorite unagi cuisines over charcoal grill. Slathered with our in-house sweet & savory tare and grilled over hot charcoal resulting in a glistening crispy exterior and soft and tender interior boosting a fragrant smoky aroma. Savor Unagi in different styles, or pair them with your favorite sake at Una Una. (Aug 2019)

data.title: Una Una (Suntec)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 3 Temasek Boulevard#03-315Suntec City Mall, Eat at SevenSingapore (038983)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hitsumabushi, Seiro Mushi, Mamushi Donburi
data.ABOUT: Revel in delight as you watch our Unagi chefs cook up your favourite unagi cuisines over a charcoal grill. Slathered with our in-house sweet & savoury tare and grilled over hot charcoal resulting in a glistening crispy exterior and a soft and tender interior boasting a fragrant smoky aroma. Savour Unagi in different styles, or pair them with your favourite sake at Una Una. (Jun 2020)

data.title: Unagiya Ichinoji (Robertson Quay)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hitsumabushi, Seiro Mushi, Mamushi Donburi
data.ABOUT:
Having been in business for over a century, and having recently received a Bib Gourmand, you’d think the people at Miyagawa would know their stuff, and you’d be absolutely right. With 20 outlets in Japan, this is the first overseas outpost of the beloved unagi franchise. Famed for their expert grilling techniques and secret in-house sauces, this unagi restaurant is a must-visit for diners who love fine Japanese dining.

The Unagi here is served in three different styles, namely: Hitsumabushi - where the eel is placed over a bed of rice and served with three condiments, Seiro Mushi, which is served with Hokkaido rice, egg, and a sweet sauce, and Mamushi Donburi, which is served with Japanese yam, mentaiko, kinshi eggs and onsen egg. The latter two dishes are unique to the Singaporean incarnation of the restaurant, while the former is a signature dish available at all outlets. The unagi for all three dishes is marinated in a spice mixture made with ingredients directly imported from Tokyo before being steamed, then subsequently grilled - just as they do at all outlets across Japan.

Whether you’re an unagi connoisseur or just a fan of seafood, the wallet-friendly prices, intimate dining environment, and exquisite dishes here will surely entice you to visit more than once! (July 2018)

data.title: Uncle Leong Seafood (Anchorpoint)
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Shimmering Sand Crab, Claypot Crab Bee Hoon Soup, Salted Egg Prawns, Gold Coast Prawn, Guinness Pork Ribs
data.ABOUT:
Uncle Leong Seafood is a popular and laidback destination for all those seafood comforts you crave.

With a pleasant waterfront view and accommodating dining room, Uncle Leong is aimed at making diners feel at home. After all, a hearty meal of Chinese seafood delicacies is a family tradition for most of us, and the next best thing to home cooked, is the variety of delectable treats at Uncle Leong's. Here, shellfish are sourced as fresh as possible, and a variety of sizes are available for diners to choose from.

Along with the traditional Chilli Crab and Bee Hoon that's long been a signature of this seafood institution, Uncle Leong's features several other delightful concoctions that are worth a try. The Shimmering Sand Crab Delight offers a particularly savoury sauce and pleasing crunchy texture that's often missing in crab dishes. Speaking of crunch, the Gold Coast Prawn amps up the cereal recipe, with deliciously plump crustaceans in a spiced mix of golden, crispy topping. For the carnivores, the Guinness Pork Ribs is a favourite, with thick, mahogany sauce gaining tons of caramelised flavour from the distinctive beer, a perfect match for the meaty pork ribs. Made for sharing and family style enjoyment, Uncle Leong Seafood should be on every seafood fan's must-try list! (Dec 2018)

data.title: Uni Gallery by Oosterbay
data.Hours: Sun-Thurs: Lunch 11:30am-2:45pm (Last Order: 2:45pm)Dinner 6-10pm (Last Order: 10pm)Drinks Till 10:30pmFri-Sat: Lunch 11:30am-2:45pm (Last Order: 2:45pm)Dinner 6-10:30pm (Last Order: 10:30pm)Drinks Till 10:30pm
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Uni Oyster, Uni Sashimi, Hadate Shiro Uni, Higashizawa Shiro Uni, Bara Chirashi, Ikura Chirashi, Canadian Aka Uni, The Uni Bomb
data.ABOUT: We never thought this day would come; forget the oyster bar and welcome the age of the sea urchin! One of the most delicious seafood treasures in existence, sea urchin has firmly established itself as one of the foodie world's favourite indulgences, and here at Uni Gallery, the offerings are sublimely self-explanatory.You can opt to bliss out on these creamy orange globules of umami as you would oysters: fresh out of the shell with the barest lashings of seasoning. The restaurant offers premium grade uni sourced from all over the world, including varieties like Canadian Aka Uni, or more exquisite Japanese varieties like Higashizawa Shiro Uni and the Mercedes-Benz of urchins, Hadate Shiro Uni. All three varieties come together in a little treat called The Uni Bomb, which you chase with a shot of sake. For added indulgence, the Uni Oyster Shot combines uni with a freshly shucked oyster in a single, oceany mouthful.To make your uni go a little further, have it as one of a selection of sashimi atop a bowl of rice in the restaurant's hefty Bara Chirashi. But perhaps the most classic and delicious way to serve it up is in the hearty Ikura Uni Chirashi, which features mounds of salty salmon roe and uni atop rice, just mouthful after mouthful of pure, umami magic. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Ushidoki Wagyu Kaiseki
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Steamed Egg Custard with Minced Beef Thick Soup, Char-Grilled Ozaki Beef Sirloin served with Green Salad, “Rosanjin” Style Beef Sukiyaki with Soft Boiled Egg & Truffle
data.ABOUT: Stepping into this intimate dining space, you’re immediately enveloped by ambient lighting and neutral tones in different textures. Exposed brick walls, sakura woods, and simple fabric chairs give the space a warm vibe but doesn’t overwhelm – an excellent way to let the wagyu-centric dishes shine.Ushidoki’s kaiseki dinners are prepared by Chef Hirohashi Nobuaki, and you can choose different types of omakase sets. You’ll probably skip the 12-course menu if you’re not famished, but a wagyu beef lover would well be tempted to give it a shot. There’s wagyu salad, a luxuriously prepared wagyu sukiyaki, and 3-kind wagyu sashimi moriawase where chef picks include wagyu wrapped around uni (sea urchin) and oyster topped with wagyu. The meat is Ozaki wagyu beef – a big deal since there’s only one farm in Japan that sells wagyu under this name – and finding a restaurant serving the same Ozaki beef is incredibly rare.If you’re looking for quality dishes that revolve around premium beef and done in Japanese style, book early for Ushidoki – especially since they claim to serve the whole cow in one course. (Dec 2015)

data.title: Uya 四代目菊川 Japanese Unagi Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Hitsumabushi, Grilled Eel with Salt, Sashimi Moriawase, Crispy Bone, Liver Ponzu
data.ABOUT:
Uya 四代目菊川 may have opened its doors at Wheelock Place just recently, but it has served discerning diners for more than four generations back in Japan. What it does best is the exquisite, perfectly grilled traditional unagi and Uya 四代目菊川 aims to offer up its authentic rendition of the Japanese delicacy at affordable prices. The eels are carefully selected and this commitment to quality and freshness shows from the crispy, fluffy, and creamy unagi. In fact, the tare, or sauce, is made using Uya’s highly treasured secret recipe that has been passed down through the generations. The eel is delivered live from Japan and stored behind the kitchen before they are prepared and grilled daily. 

The main star here’s definitely the Hitsumabushi served with condiments, broth, soup, and pickles. The best way to savour the different flavours is simply to divide the unagi rice into four portions and enjoy it with some condiments, with the dashi broth and condiments provided, on its own, or any way you like! Different flavours come through with every quarter, making for a delightful culinary experience that’s truly exciting. No part of the eel goes to waste, so don’t forget to try the Kimoyaki (grilled liver) and the Hone Senbei (Bone Crackers) - they taste as delicious as they sound intimidating. Don’t pass up on this gem even if you don’t enjoy unagi. Dishes such as the Rare Wagyu Rice Bowl, the Sashimi Moriawase, and Oyster Tempura will also give you plenty reason to return! (Aug 2018)

data.title: V-DINING by V-ZUG
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Roasted Tomato Soup, Beef Cheek, Pork Belly, Tonkotsu
data.PRESS RELEASE: Nestled along Singapore’s famed Orchard Road shopping district, V-DINING, the first ever contemporary dining by V-ZUG, is the brand’s first restaurant designed to demonstrate the quality and competence of its appliances to the epicure. Spearheaded by Head Chef, John-Paul Fiechtner, and Sous Chef, Melvin Chou, expect gastronomic creations prepared using the finest ingredients and professional-grade kitchen appliances designed for homes by Swiss market leader, V-ZUG. The team of qualified chefs are passionate and innovative which means that the menu is constantly refreshed to delight even the most discerning palates. Open only for dinner, look forward to an array seasonal set menus. (Sep 2020)

data.title: VUE
data.Good For: City Views, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 50 Collyer QuayOUE Bayfront, Rooftop Level 19Singapore (049321)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: A5 Emperor "Kokuou" Black Wagyu, Crispy Scale-On Red Tilefish, Cheese Platter, Ceviche
data.ABOUT:
VUE is a rooftop bar and grill that specialises in binchotan-grilled meats and seafood, and is home to Singapore's first outdoor spritz bar. Situated on the penthouse level of OUE Bayfront, it boasts unparalleled views of Marina Bay and the iconic Singapore skyline.

With executive chef Sam Chin setting the pace on the culinary front, you can expect fusion dishes that showcase flavours of ingredients at the peak of their freshness.

Start your dining experience with a few pre-dinner cocktails and canapés at the bar. The Aperol Spritz is sure to please cocktail purists, but if you're in the mood for something unique, there's a range of house creations to choose from. The Speyside Buck, with Monkey Shoulder scotch, mint, cucumber, and ginger ale, provides a refreshing kick while the Kaiser Goblet, made with Riesling, peach liqueur, whisky and soda, lends fruity notes.

From the dinner menu, pick from the selection of premium charcuterie, cheese, seafood, grilled meat, and more. Be sure to try the restaurant's speciality: Binchotan-grilled A5 Emperor "Kokuou" Black Wagyu. Nothing pairs better with good food than fine wine, and VUE's wine cellar certainly doesn't disappoint, housing more than 1,000 bottles from around the world. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Vatos Cantina Holland Village
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Cheeseburger Spring Rolls, Chilli Lime Prawn Tacos, Peanut Butter Chocolate Milk Stout
data.ABOUT:
Vatos Cantina Holland Village might just become your new favourite joint. Located just minutes away from Holland Village MRT station, this bar and restaurant is the perfect mix of hip and family-friendly, providing a laid-back and relaxing atmosphere that is perfect for a meal with the family or after-work drinks with friends. 

This bar and restaurant serves up excellent KoMex (or Korean-Mexican) fusion cuisine. Must-tries include the Cheeseburger Spring Rolls that will make the mouth of every fusion fan water. Alternatively, seafood lovers would be thrilled by the deliciously crispy Fish Tacos, or the zesty Chilli Lime Prawn Tacos, consisting of flash-fried prawn, Asian slaw, pico de gallo, cilantro and flavourful lime-cilantro sour cream.

Wash down the food with some of Vatos Cantina’s excellent drinks, including their cocktails and craft beer. Gastronomic adventurers, be sure to try the Peanut Butter Chocolate Milk Stout. 

Vatos Cantina also has other amenities, including a large grassy lawn out front. Perfect for both kids and pets to play in, it also provides an extra space for al fresco dining for balmy nights. (Jan 2020)

data.title: Vatos Urban Tacos
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Vatos Cowboy Queso, Kimchi Carnitas Fries, Chimichurri Chicken Tacos, Chili Lime Shrimp Tacos, Baja Fish Tacos, The Sid Burger, Fat Bastard Burrito Bowl, Carne Asada Steak Quesadilla, Sexy Sanchez (Strawberry Margarita)
data.ABOUT:
Doling out zesty and delicious Korean-Mexican fusion fare isn’t an easy feat but the guys over at Vatos Urban Tacos make it seem effortless. With all three owners having roots in either California or Texas, and growing up on true-blue Mexican eats, it’s safe to say they know a thing or two about the flavour explosion the cuisine brings with it.

A quick glance at Vatos’ “Seoul-Mex” menu and you’ll know exactly what we mean. They dish out masterful fusion creations like the hefty Kimchi Galbi Grilled Cheese. Pieces of marinated Galbi short rib - bearing a moreish taste that comes from properly grilled meat - are sandwiched between slices of sourdough bread. Sounds simple? It's anything but. Each bite is a veritable bomb of umami, with Mexican cheese and savoury fried kimchi lending their own punchy kick.

The sandwich itself is pretty filling so if you prefer a slower pace, we recommend going for a range of their popular tacos. From Baja Fish to Chimichurri Chicken, these are the perfect portable snacks. Finally, no visit is complete without Kimchi Carnitas Fries plus a basket of Honey Tequila Chicken Wings to go with one of Vatos' signature margaritas, so be sure to order one (or two) of each before you head out! (Aug 2018)

data.title: Vespetta Italian Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE:
Seafood: Trofiette di Mare con Pesto - Trofiette Pasta with Prawns, Squid, Clams, Crab, Mussels in Basil Pesto

Pizza: Vespetta - San Marzano Tomatoes, Burrata Cheese, Parma Ham and Wild Rocket

Meat: Milanese - Milanese Style Breaded Pork Fillet with Roasted Potatoes and RocketMore
data.ABOUT: Italians add work and life to the Food and Wine. Here at Vespetta, we aim to bring you a truly Italian dining experience focused from the Southern roots with specialities from various regions through 3 key elements - high-quality ingredients, traditional recipes and passion. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Vibes Cafe (Westgate)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kong Bak Pau, Laksa, Grilled Chicken, Pan-Seared Salmon
data.ABOUT:
This retro restaurant is the perfect place to take the family on the weekend. Located conveniently in Westgate Mall, this spot serves up a range of traditional western meats and pasta dishes, along with popular local hawker fare, meaning the menu here is sure to have something for everyone. 

The local classics on offer are well-executed and will have diners spoiled for choice. The Laksa is an excellent option. Made with creamy coconut milk, spices, and bouncy white noodles, it’s easy to see why this is one of their most popular dishes. The Kong Bak Pau is another excellent option for meat lovers. Made with juicy braised pork sandwiched in a fluffy white bun, these buns are a staple of Singaporean cuisine. The sweetness of the buns brings out the smoky tenderness of the meat. 

The Grilled Chicken is an excellent option for meat lovers. The meat is grilled to tender perfection, crisp on the outside and deliciously tender inside. There is even an option to enjoy the chicken encased in a burger. Prefer some fish instead? The Pan-Seared Salmon is the perfect dish to commit to healthy eating without sacrificing taste. The fish is soft and seasoned with herbs and spices to give it a unique taste. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Vibes Cafe (Wheelock Place)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sandwich Croissant, Breakfast Set, Salad with Salmon, Grilled Seabass, Chicken a la King, Ondeh Ondeh Cake
data.ABOUT:
The name says it all. At STYLE by STYLE VIBES Cafe, everything here is designed to be a luscious feast for the senses, from its wooden-panelled walls to delicious cafe nosh. So it’s little wonder why this charming bistro is able to draw both the Instagram-crazy crowd on weekends looking to get their next great picture, as well as serious workaholics who want a strong cup of coffee and a quiet place to work at during weekdays. 
 
Like any good cafe, you’ll find fingerlicking sandwiches and hefty burgers on its local and Western fusion-inspired menu. Popular hits include the Chicken Burger, which practically comes whizzing out the kitchen doors. Another surefire hit among hungry diners is the Sandwich Croissant, where chunks of tuna is stuffed inside a warm and buttery croissant. And for a sweet treat, be sure to pick up a slice of Ondeh Ondeh Cake, a light and fluffy cake that draws inspiration from Peranakan flavours we all know and love. 
 
Featuring a rare combination of warm hospitality, lip-smacking nosh, and a jaw-droppingly gorgeous setting, STYLE by STYLE Vibes Cafe will be your next go-to for the day you want a peaceful cafe to work out of, or just while the day away. (May 2018)

data.title: Victorian Bistro
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mini Benedict, Baked Eggs, Salted Eggs Benedict, Chilli Crab Pasta
data.ABOUT:
Nestled in Tanjong Pagar, Victorian Bistro is a cozy bistro with great brunch options and good coffee.

Rise and shine for breakfast sets such as Toast with Scrambled Egg, Mini Benedict and Toast with Avocado. Healthy and filling, these dishes are also pocket-friendly. The all-day menu boasts pasta options such as Prawn Aglio Olio Pasta and the classic Carbonara. Our pick? The Chilli Crab Pasta, with mouthfuls of sweet and spicy crabmeat. Add-ons are also available at reasonable prices.

Brunch lovers will be happy to know that Victorian Bistro's all-day menu also includes Baked Eggs and the Salted Eggs Benedict. The latter comes served with grilled prawns, poached eggs and drenched in salted egg sauce. The Baked Eggs are customisable with a choice of sausage, salmon or bacon mixed with homemade baked beans and mozzarella. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Viio Gastropub Restaurant & Bar
data.Cuisine: American, Bar, Fusion, International, Local, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef Slider, Pork Belly Popcorn, Grilled Grain-Fed Beef Ribeye
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Featuring Head Chef Ronald Li and his signature dishes, Viio features a focused menu of unique flavours and experiences at our intimate establishment.

Located in the prominent 520 Balestier. Viio’s menu also spotlights a line-up of the freshest of craft beer on tap for all taste preferences. A truly driven restaurant to open in the area in years, Viio Gastropub is the upscale social spot for comfortable lunches, casual happy hour gatherings and culinary journeys. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Vineyard at HortPark
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Whole Fried Local Quail, Walnut Crusted Bull Frog, Prosciutto Pizza, Provençal Fish Pie, Lemon Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
At the downright lovely Vineyard at HortPark, spend the day dining among the lush greenery of HortPark and listening to birds as they serenade you while you graze over your meal. Be swept away the minute you step through the eatery’s doors, with its overhung foliage, beautifully aged-wood tables, and minimalist decor that will make you feel like being in the provincial countryside.
Sporting a winsome French-Italian menu, this dining destination prides itself on its farm-to-table concept, scouting for produce and ingredients such as quail, frog legs, and fish right from our very own doorstep. For instance, one showstopper is its Whole Fried Local Quail that comes accompanied with a rich plum and berries compote and a side of crispy kale. The Walnut Crusted Bull Frog is another stellar option, highlighting frog legs from a Jurong farm paired perfectly with a teriyaki-sesame dressing. Then end the meal on a tangy citrusy note  guaranteed to perk up the taste buds. For that, we love the Lemon Lava cake that goes down smooth with fresh vanilla chantilly cream.
Romantic and dreamy, the Vineyard at HortPark has all the makings of a garden wonderland, complete with beautifully crafted plates that highlight the fresh produce our little red dot has to offer. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Violet Oon Satay Bar & Grill
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buah Keluak Otak Otak, Assam Bak with Garlic Vinaigrette, Chicken Satay, Roti Jala with Durian Pengat, Kueh Pie Tee
data.ABOUT:
Best known for her creative spin on Peranakan dishes, Violet Oon has always celebrated Singapore’s unique flavours through her food. The Violet Oon Satay Bar & Grill, Oon’s newest restaurant, is no exception, featuring food that digs deep into Singapore’s history of cooking over a charcoal grill. 

Quality food, great ambience and a touch of history converge at this 1,9000-sq-ft restaurant located at the bustling Clarke Quay. Singapore’s satays and local BBQ form the centrepiece of this restaurant. Choose from an array of scrumptious satay options that include chicken, Angus beef, prawn and tripe. Then, sit back and watch the skilled chefs cook your food over a flame through the restaurant’s glassed-in open kitchen. 

If you’re hankering for a taste of a dish from Violet Oon’s existing restaurants, fret not. The new restaurant has incorporated many well-loved favourites such as Kueh Pie Tee, Beef Rendang, Babi Pong Tay, and Dry Laksa, into this new menu. 

And what better way to round off the meal than with a tipple? Quench your thirst with a selection of handcrafted cocktails that infuse local ingredients or have your pick of the many artisanal Singaporean craft beers on tap.   

As the adage goes, old is gold. That is certainly true at Violet Oon Satay & Grill where chefs adhere to traditional methods of cooking to coax out deep and earthy flavours from your food. (Feb 2017)

data.title: Violet Oon Singapore (ION Orchard)
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Peranakan
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Garam Assam Fish, Gado Gado Salad, Ngoh Hiang, Buah Keluak Ayam, Babi Pong Tay, Beef Rendang, Shepherd's Pie, Bubor Cha Cha Panna Cotta, Durian Chendol Panna Cotta, Sticky Toffee Date Pudding
data.ABOUT: It's not every day that you get to meet a bone fide celebrity chef. Dine at Violet Oon's Kitchen though, and you stand a very good chance of meeting the woman once described as "Singapore's Julia Child". Serving traditional Nyonya dishes, Violet Oon and her family personally invite you to experience the unique flavours of Peranakan cuisine in a beautiful black and white setting.Given that Ms. Oon is an expert on all things Nyonya, you can't go wrong by exploring the "Nyonya Favourites" on the menu. However, the western offerings, inspired by her experiences travelling abroad as Singapore's food ambassador, deserve some consideration. Her Shepherd's Pie is a cult favourite, while dishes like Chilli Crab Pizza, and Brioche French Toast with Gula Melaka Banana Sauce present an interesting Nyonya twist.Whether you decide to dine al fresco, or choose to be within the confines of the updated Peranakan decor, don't be surprised if Ms. Oon stops by and introduces herself, or even goes so far as to bring up a chair and chat with you for a bit! (Mar 2020)

data.title: Viva Loca @ Changi
data.Cuisine: Indian, Vegetarian Friendly, Caribbean, Pizza, Burgers, Cuban
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1#01-68/69Changi City PointSingapore (486038)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Freshly Shucked Oysters, Wurst Platter, Smoked Beef Burger, Shrimp Fried Rice
data.ABOUT:
Infused with local inspiration, Viva Loca serves up delectable Western, Mexican and Spanish cuisines prepared with local flair. Boasting both indoor and alfresco seating, drop by Viva Loca today to enjoy lip smacking tapas, oysters, ribs, pasta, pizza alongside the restaurant’s wide range of beer, liquor, wine, cocktails and mocktails.

Feast on half a dozen of Freshly Shucked Oysters. Drizzled in mignonette sauce, the plateful of fresh catch from the ocean is juicy and succulent. Pair this refreshing appetiser with a plate of Calamari Salad. Made of mesclun, golden calamari strips and topped off with a homemade Thai sweet cilantro dressing, this delectable mix of vegetables and squid is great for those on the lookout for a nutritious yet yummy meal.

For those looking to satisfy their carnivorous cravings, the Wurst Platter is the perfect combination of pork, veal and smoked cheese bratwurst, set to delight and satisfy. The Smoked Beef Burger is also a great option that is served with a generous portion of shoestring fries. Local delights menu options include the Shrimp Fried Rice, Crabmeat Fried Rice and Chicken Fried Rice. (Mar 2021)
