data.title: W39 Bistro & Bakery
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Housemade Crab Cakes, BBQ Beef Brisket Sandwich, Prawn & Bacon Linguine, BBQ Chicken Leg, Poached Chicken Breast
data.ABOUT:
Stepping into W39 instantly lifts your spirits. From the cheery interior decorations to the delicious smells wafting from the kitchen, weekend brunch just got better. Family-and-dog-friendly, this cafe welcomes your furry pals to laze around as you enjoy your meal. Located just off West Coast Road, W39 may be a hidden gem that takes a while to get to, but it is well worth the effort. With tapas, lunch and dinner specials, as well as a mouthwatering spread of fresh cakes baked daily, there’s something for everyone here.

Whet your appetite with their popular Housemade Crab Cakes. Made with juicy crab meat as well as capsicums and spring onions for an added kick, you’ll be wanting more after each bite. The addictive spicy mayo dipping sauce gives an extra flavour boost that brings out the mild sweetness of the crabmeat. One of the highlights of the menu is the BBQ Beef Brisket Sandwich -- a delicious dish made with a homemade charcoal bun encasing tender, pulled beef brisket flavoured with barbecue sauce. Smoky, decadent, and finger-licking good, this is a meal you’ll want to feature on your Instagram before you take a bite - it tastes just as good as it looks! (Mar 2019)

data.title: WAKANUI Grill Dining Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 5 Straits View#04-02Marina One The Heart West TowerSingapore (018935)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wakanui Spring Lamb Chop, Hot Smoked Salmon, WAKANUI Selection Board, Pavlova
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Having single-handedly changed the steak scene in Tokyo, WAKANUI Grill Dining has set their sights on replicating that success here in Singapore since their opening in 2017. From clinching one star in Wine & Dine's Top Restaurants 2018/2019 to hosting the most prestigious wine and whisky events – WAKANUI Grill Dining Singapore has upheld its rapport of quality cuts and refined dining experience in its stunning location at Marina One.

Developed in Tokyo by ANZCO Foods, a New Zealand-based meat company specializing in premium-quality New Zealand beef and lamb in Tokyo, WAKANUI takes its name from the location of ANZCO’s Five Star Beef Feedlot on the coast of Wakanui, South Canterbury. The ‘stars’ of WAKANUI and the essence of the restaurant are New Zealand Ocean Beef and WAKANUI Spring Lamb, which are grilled over Japan-sourced Binchotan charcoal in the centrally-placed, open kitchen. The beef displays the perfect balance of marbling and leanness, while retaining natural juiciness and an intense beef flavour. The lamb possesses peak flavour and texture. These optimal levels of quality are achieved by the precise and careful control that ANZCO Foods exercises over every step of the production process, from start to finish. The restaurant also showcases the best of New Zealand produce, including seasonal seafood and hand-picked wines. (Jul 2019)

data.title: WOK°15 Kitchen
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum, Zi Char
data.Hours: Tue-Sat: 11:30am-2:30pm (Last Order: 2:15pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Sun & PH: 11am-2:30pm (Last Order: 2:15pm), 6-10pm (Last Order: 9:30pm)Closed Monday
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab, Eight Treasures Duck, Double-boiled ‘Sakura Chicken’ Soup with Tian Shan Snow Lotus, Wok-fried Canadian Scallops with White Truffle Scented Egg White, Peking Duck, Pan-fried Grain-fed US Kurobuta Pork, Braised Spinach Beancurd with Trio of Mushrooms, Stir-fried US Asparagus, Braised Fish Maw with Crocodile Fin in Abalone Sauce, Fried Rice with Blue Swimmer Crab, Conpoy and Egg White, Green Apple and Chrysanthemum-flavoured Tea Jelly
data.ABOUT:
Specialising in authentic Chinese cuisine with a modern flair, WOK ̊15 Kitchen is one of the exceptional dining gems hidden at ONE°15 Marina Sentosa Cove. Indulge in sophisticated and distinctive cooking as you overlook a scenic view of the waterfront and immerse yourself in an outstanding dining experience. A cosy yet luxurious atmosphere, it is the perfect place for intimate gatherings with family and friends alike.

 

One of Singapore’s most popular dishes, Chilli Crab, is a star item on the menu. Bite into firm, fragrant crab meat, and don’t forget to ration your mantou – the sauce is so fragrant and piquant that you’ll probably want to soak up every last drop! We also highly recommend the Double-boiled ‘Sakura Chicken’ Soup with Tian Shan Snow Lotus; apart from its great nutritional value, the texture and complex flavours are sure to satisfy any palate. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Waa Cow! (Change Alley Mall)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Fries, Truffle Wagyu Beef, Spicy Mentaiko Chirashi, Kimchi Chirashi
data.ABOUT:
Looking for the ultimate donburi experience? Touted as Singapore’s first flame-torched donburi restaurant, Waa Cow! is located in Change Alley Mall and is committed to serving good food stemming from their emphasis on quality ingredients and meticulous craft. 

Be spoilt for choice as you browse the restaurant’s offerings of a vast selection of signature wagyu and premium seafood bowls. For fans of truffle, the Truffle Wagyu Beef is a sumptuous feast of salmon roe and egg topped with the signature wagyu beef torched with their in-house special beef sauce. Paired with a house-made truffle sauce and drizzled with ground black truffle and champignons, this ‘trufflicious’ bowl of beef comes with a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. Complete your meal with a side of Truffle Fries for the full truffle experience. Accompanied with a truffle dip, the crispy shoestring fries taste as good as they look. 

A great addition to the menu, the Spicy Mentaiko Chirashi features neatly diced pieces of premium sashimi-grade seasonal seafood. Opt for the sashimi set or chicken karaage set for a filling meal. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Waa Cow! (Marina One)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.ABOUT:
This humble eatery started out with just one outlet in the National University of Singapore, but quickly gained popularity for their delicious dishes made with the finest ingredients. This restaurant only serves premium cuts, such as the Australian Tajima Wagyu, which has a marbling score of 9, and beef from America’s Snake River Farms. 

You can’t go wrong with their Aburi Wagyu Beef - a bed of rice topped with 24 hour sous vide beef and a tender onsen egg drizzled with homemade beef bone sauce, this is the perfect option for a scrumptious lunch. There is even a Truffle Wagyu Beef option, which adds black truffle puree and white truffle oil to the decadent mix for an earthier flavour. Feeling fancy? Why not opt for the Ultimate Beef Sushi Experience? Available only during dinner, this exquisite option consists of six pieces of beef sushi with different flavour profiles. Whether you’re new to beef sushi or a seasoned connoisseur, you’re sure to find something you like in this dish. 

Seafood lovers are sure to enjoy the Mentaiko Salmon Don, a delicious plate made with sashimi-grade salmon fillet glazed with shoyu. There is also an option to add an onsen egg and tobiko to add to the flavourful dish. (Nov 2018)

data.title: Wagyu Express by Aburiya
data.Good For: Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Kimchi Mori, Wagyu Moriawase, Wagyu Sukiyaki, Garlic Chahan
data.ABOUT:
Providing a fuss-free yakiniku experience along the bustling stretch of shophouses in Tanjong Pagar, Wagyu Express by Aburiya offers a diverse selection of various cuts of beef and pork on the menu, along with a smattering of delightful side dishes. 


An assortment of kimchi with elements such as daikon, the Kimchi Mori is a delectable and mildly spicy dish to kickstart your meal with. Grilled over white charcoal for maximum flavour, the Wagyu Moriawase features a hearty mix of different cuts. The various cuts for the platter are the Jo Karubi, Tonbi, Jo Rosu, and Karubi. The restaurant also offers various choices of condiments such as ponzu, garlic butter, or the traditional dark soy sauce to complement the meats. A unique dish that is at the top of the must-try list here at Wagyu Express by Aburiya is the Wagyu Sukiyaki. Grilled to perfection, dip the exquisitely marbled slices of wagyu meat into egg sauce and enjoy the flavourful combination with each mouthful. 


Wrap up your meal with a fragrant bowl of Garlic Chahan. A simple bowl of fried rice with garlic and tender pieces of beef, this bowl is light on the palate and makes for the perfect end to a filling meal. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Wagyu More
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Japanese A5 Wagyu Beef, Australian Wagyu Beef
data.ABOUT:
An all-you-can-eat Japanese shabu-shabu restaurant in Bugis, Wagyu More was established in Hong Kong in 2014 and has since been serving a delicious assortment of the finest meats, vegetables, meatballs, sushi, drinks and desserts. Handpicked to ensure the best quality and taste, the restaurant is dedicated to serving up only premium food ingredients that are value for money. 

With as many as 10 varieties of soup base to choose from, diners can expect to be spoilt for choice. The soup bases offered are popular choices that add layers of flavour to the plethora of food options. To further tantalise Japanese Shabu-Shabu taste buds, Wagyu More serves premium buffet packages of Japanese A5 Wagyu Beef, Australian Wagyu Beef, Spanish Iberico Pork and Black Angus Beef for a tasty dining excursion. 

Apart from an all-you-can-eat menu, Wagyu More also features a soft drink bar for free flow non-alcoholic beverages. To elevate your dining experience, order from the All You Can Drink menu option for free top ups of Beer and Whisky. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Wah Lok Cantonese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Baked Barbecued Pork Buns, Steamed Glutinous Rice Dumplings, Baked Egg Tarts, Steamed Carrot Cake, Australian King Crab, Live Abalone, Coral Trout, Hokkaido Scallops, Chilled Foie Gras & Whole Abalone
data.ABOUT:
Since 1988, Wah Lok at the Carlton Hotel has set the standard for fine Cantonese dining. For a restaurant of such pedigree, it exudes a tremendous amount of contemporary elegance while keeping the food fastidiously traditional. As you might expect of a Cantonese restaurant, seafood reigns high on their list of priorities, but that doesn’t mean they neglect the rest. Famous for being packed during Sunday ‘yum cha’ hours, you can also prepare your appetite for exquisite lunchtime dim sum as well as aromatic Cantonese grilled meats.
The Dim Sum menu boasts all the favourites, executed with a perfectionist’s hand. Stack your table with flaky Baked Barbecued Pork Buns, delicate Steamed Glutinous Rice Dumplings, tender-centred Baked Egg Tarts, and pillowy Steamed Carrot Cake. Wah Lok does equally well in its banquet-style fare, turning out incomparable seafood with inimitable Cantonese flair. Whether it’s premium Australian King Crab, Live Abalone, Coral Trout, or Hokkaido Scallops, expect simple but effective culinary magic that will transform your chosen seafood into delicate mouthfuls of rich, oceany flavour. And if you’re looking to impress a boss or potential in-law, bring out the big guns: Chilled Foie Gras & Whole Abalone is one of the kitchen’s signatures, sure to seal any deal. Wah Lok’s reputation precedes it, and the restaurant more than lives up to its name. (Mar 2018)

data.title: Walking On Sunshine
data.Cuisine: American, Korean, Australian, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe, Pizza, Burgers
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Souffle pancake, Iberia prod jowl, Rucola Avo bulgogi pizza
data.ABOUT: Walking On Sunshine is a garden-themed Cafe, which serves delicious Korean fusion food, desserts, and trendy & unique drinks made with natural ingredients. Sip on coconut smoothie coffee, dalgona coffee, Ginseng Smoothie, while enjoying the view of plants and flowers that contribute to relaxation. we can totally see ourselves spending a leisurely afternoon here! (Sep 2020)

data.title: Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.Address: 320 Orchard RoadLevel 3Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza HotelSingapore (238865)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Peking Duck, Stir-Fried Beef Ribs in Chef’s Black Pepper Sauce, Braised Fried Bean Curd, Assorted Mushroom, Fungus, Bean Sprout, Baby Corn and Seasonal Green, Stir-Fried Garoupa Fillet with Celery in XO Sauce, 2-head Australian Abalone Braised with Superior Oyster Sauce, Double-Boiled Consommé with Scallop, Egg White and Black Truffle, Specialty Barbecued Duo Platter with Jelly Fish
data.ABOUT: Chinese restaurants can usually be classified as Asian kitsch or Asian splendour and there’s no doubt as to which category Wan Hao falls into. Elegantly outfitted in muted golds and reds, the place abounds in tasteful chinois touches like gold leaf calligraphic artwork and simple ceramics.Similarly, the menu boasts the sort of stately fare you can imagine eating during leisurely dim sum days, relaxed tea times, or at family gatherings. We might sound like we’ve watched one too many Wong Kar Wai films, but once you take a gander at their list of Hong Kong dim sum items and opulent mains, you’ll want to order one of everything as well. All the dim sum favourites are prepared with care – Steamed Crystal Dumpling with Scallop & Asparagus showcase slivers of jade through the translucent skin, silky Rice Noodle Rolls, satisfying Deep Fried Prawn Beancurd Rolls – and the main menu doesn’t fail to deliver either. Tender Drunken Prawns and Spanish Iberico Pork Char Siew, signatures like Peking Duck, Stir-Fried Beef Ribs in Chef’s Black Pepper Sauce, and Double-Boiled Consommé with Scallop, Egg White & Black Truffle. With a multitude of premium ingredients, award-winning Cantonese dishes, plenty of options for vegetarians, and an exceedingly stylish environment, we’re betting this Orchard Road restaurant will prove to be a delightful time! (Mar 2016)

data.title: Wan He Lou (Maude Road)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Lotus with Salted Egg, Ice Plant with Pickled Cherry Tomatoes, Pan Fried Kurobuta Pork, Yellow Gravy Crab Meat Tofu, Crisp Salt & Pepper Soft Shell Crab, Lobster Porridge
data.ABOUT:
We're suckers for unexpected bursts of inspiration and Wan He Lou's award-winning Lobster Porridge certainly qualifies. Catching a lobster during one of his typical leisurely diving trips off an isolated island, the lack of other ingredients forced Chef Lau Siaw Dee to throw together a quick meal using only rice, seawater, and the aforementioned crustacean. Surprise, surprise! The salty combination worked so well, it became an instant hit once Chef Lau brought it back home – after much refinement of course.
Today's iteration is a Teochew-style porridge, whose loose grains float in a yellow broth that's been richly flavoured with lobster roe, accompanied by a bevy of fresh lobsters sitting under a blanket of fresh spring onions. It's both comforting and decadent without being too much on the palate. There's also plenty more on the menu that can round out your meal, from poultry dishes like Seven Spice Pork Choplets to local staples like Braised Yee Fu Noodles and Sambal Fried Rice.
For mouth-watering Chinese food that's packed with plenty of local flavour and an exceptional bowl of lobster porridge, only one place comes to mind, and this is it. (May 2016)

data.title: Wan He Lou Kitchen (Beauty World)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Lotus with Salted Egg, Ice Plant with Pickled Cherry Tomatoes, Pan Fried Kurobuta Pork, Yellow Gravy Crab Meat Tofu, Crisp Salt & Pepper Soft Shell Crab, Lobster Porridge
data.ABOUT:
Offering local Chinese zi char, Wan He Lou Kitchen is best known for their award-winning Lobster Porridge. Stewed Teochew-style in a rich golden broth for hours, the porridge is sprinkled with a blanket of fresh spring onions that perfectly complements the lobster roe and enhances the taste of the fresh, juicy lobster.

Besides this signature dish, Wan He Lou Kitchen also features a wide variety of side dishes that make for a comforting and nourishing meal. Start with the Crisp Salt & Pepper Soft Shell Crab before diving into a steaming plate of Sweet and Sour Patin Fish. Drenched in the restaurant's signature house sauce, the fish is tender, each mouthful packing a flavour punch. Then cleanse your palate with a hearty concoction of Crocodile Soup with Cordyceps Flower before ending off your meal with the restaurant's delicious 'Dessert of the Week'. Wan He Lou is the place to be whenever you seek rich, comfort Chinese cuisine at affordable prices. (Jul 2020)

data.title: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 22 Orange Grove RoadLevel One, Garden WingShangri-La HotelSingapore (258350)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Burrata Pugliese, Carpaccio di Polipo, Mozzarella in Carrozza, Pizza Ai 4 Formaggi, Tagliatelle al Tartufo, Trancio di Dentice
data.PRESS RELEASE:
The freshest seafood, hand-me-down recipes and homemade pastas are what to expect at Waterfall Ristorante Italiano. Here, Southern Italian classics are served up with seasonal produce and sprinkles of la dolce vita. These are best paired with a bottle from the extensive wine collection that takes diners on a journey across Italy. Savour the house wine, Nero d'Avola, the most important red wine grape in Sicily, in the unique Boccalino. For coffee lovers, baristas are trained to brew the perfect Illy cuppa throughout the day. 

Situated in the Garden Wing, the restaurant reflects its ambience with greenery and fresh flowers. The colonial-era style interiors are designed like a home. The living room is at the front, with more intimate seating arrangements in the middle. In the rear are the communal tables. The gardens and free-form swimming pool of the hotel are visible from the inside, thanks to views that open out on 3 sides of the restaurant. For intimate dining, our Private Dining Room is available up to 8 persons. 

Waterfall Ristorante Italiano was also awarded the Ospitalità Italiana certification on 23 October 2020 by the government of Italy as a quality endorsement for signature Italian hospitality and authentic Italian cuisine that is built on history, tradition, and connection to its origin. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Wheeler's Yard
data.Cuisine: American, Japanese, Fusion, All-Day Breakfast, Cafe
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ultimate Beef Yard Burger, Truffle Fries, Eggs Benedict, 60 Degree Chicken Breast
data.ABOUT:
The Wheeler’s Yard is more than your average cafe - it’s also a bicycle atelier and workshop. Borne out of a greater vision to encourage Singapore’s growing cycling culture, Wheeler’s Yard provides the perfect pit stop for cyclists using the Whampoa park connector to rest and grab a bite whilst admiring the stunning array of handmade urban bicycles available for sale.

Not a cyclist? No worries, Wheeler’s Yard has also quickly become THE hot new coffee places for pedestrians too. Their iconic blue door, preserved from the 1980s, is one of its kind and has dominated Instagram feeds since the establishment opened its doors. The interior is just as “insta-worthy”, drawing you in with its sprawling space and unpolished floors, the perfect place to relax and grab a cuppa. Unsurprisingly, the space is also decorated tastefully with all things bicycles.

Don’t forget to complete the experience with some delicious grub. The Ultimate Beef Yard Burger and Grilled Chicken especially are consistent crowd favourites and shouldn’t be missed! (Jun 2016)

data.title: Wild Blooms
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Korean Spicy Chicken Burger, Flower Macarons, Charcoal Wings, Squid Ink Pasta
data.ABOUT:
This adorable garden-themed cafe is the perfect weekend haunt to refresh your senses after the stifling hustle of the city. Beautiful floral decor, delicious food, and a warm atmosphere make for a tranquil environment perfect for rejuvenation.

Keeping with the floral theme, the baked goods here come in soft shades, and the pastries are shaped like roses. The Rose Apple Pie is a delicate dish of swirled fluffy pastry atop a layer of apple filling. For a more savoury main, opt for the unique Charcoal Wings - a crisp deep-fried chicken wing dipped in a homemade squid ink sauce. The chicken is tender and crunchy on the outside while retaining the soft bounce inside. The squid ink sauce goes perfectly with the chicken, and gives it a unique taste.  

The Flower Tea Jelly Cakes may have dominated your Instagram feed recently, and for good reason. Not only are these dishes good to look at, they’re tasty, and made with fresh premium ingredients. The edible flowers are handcrafted and sealed in with a jelly made with brewed tea, which means that it’s perfectly fine to stick your fork in and devour - but why would you want to? (Oct 2018)

data.title: Wild Honey at Mandarin Gallery
data.Hours: Mon-Thu: 9am-9pmFri: 9am-10pmSat: 8am-10pmSun: 8am-9pmPH Eve: Close at 10pmPH: Open at 8am
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: The Greek, Brooklyn Double Pastrami burger, The Turkish, The Californian, The Amazon Bowl
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Featuring floor to ceiling windows, Wild Honey has dramatic and exciting views over the 'Times Square' of Singapore.

This beautiful restaurant is reminiscent of a Brooklyn loft and boasts a copper, steel & reclaimed wood bar with counter seating. 
The main dining room features a glorious reclaimed oak long table the centrepieces of the space flanked by Wild Honey’s trademarks of
 elegant sofas and chairs with plush fabrics all accented with artwork and objects to bring to life the feeling of home. 

All time favourite dishes such as The Norwegian, European, Canadian and Parisienne sit alongside new favourites such as The Greek, Brooklyn Double Pastrami burger, & the Turkish.

The menu continues to evolve and features and extensive range of vegetarian, gluten free, dairy free & vegan options such as The Californian that features eggplant bacon, The Amazon bowl & the spicy Korean salad that is grain and gluten free.

These beautiful breakouts are matched with excellence in beverage service with bespoke coffee blends by Common man Coffee Roasters and teas by TWG, hand crafted mocktails and cocktails including the favourite Mandarin Wilderness, the new star Turmeric Latte & free flow champagne and Prosecco service. 

Beautiful Breakfasts. All Day. Everyday. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Wildseed Cafe at The Alkaff Mansion
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.PRESS RELEASE: Cosied at the ground level of The Alkaff Mansion and surrounded by sprawling canopies, lies Wildseed Café, a pet-friendly floral café and patisserie. In a setting imbued with a natural landscape of verdant greenery and welcoming spaces, Wildseed serves as a conduit for pet owners and families to congregate. Offering a hearty selection of brunch items, freshly baked cakes and luscious pastries, the blooming café that rests in the hill of Telok Blangah makes for a true escape from the bustling city. (May 2019)

data.title: Wildseed Cafe at The Summerhouse
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Pet Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Big Pan Breakfast, Bagel Eggs Benny, Coconut Blue Pea Flower Shortcake, Waffle Factory
data.ABOUT: Inspired by a selection of thoughtfully curated dishes, Wildseed prides itself on using locally sourced ingredients from neighbouring farms and other carefully handpicked purveyors. Serving up a hearty lunch and brunch menu, choose from a curated selection of salads, burgers, pasta, cakes, pastries and more. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Wildseed Grill & Bar
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wildseed Crispy Suckling Pig, Harissa Butter BBQ Baby Back Ribs, Angus Onglet Steak, Grilled Abalone Mushroom Glazed with Soy Sauce and Sesame, Soft-Shell Chilli Crab Linguine
data.ABOUT:
Nestled at the ground level of The Summerhouse is delightful Wildseed, a café, patisserie and bar where summer lingers through the scent-filled days and into the night.

When night falls, indulge in a delectable grill selection at Wildseed Grill & Bar, set in the wild greenery and lush surrounds of our edible garden. From Monday to Saturday, sing along to live acoustic music as you sip up garden-inspired cocktails. (Apr 2018)

data.title: Window on the Park
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chinese Rojak, Kueh Pie Tee, Singapore Laksa, Cold Canadian Mussels, Black Paper Crab, Salted Egg Crab, Spaghetti in Chilli Crab Sauce, Cereal Prawn, Ice Cream, Bread & Butter Pudding
data.ABOUT:
One of Singapore’s most sought after local, Asian and seafood buffet is back at Window on the Park, Holiday Inn® Singapore Orchard City Centre.
Passionately prepared by our team of talented chefs, Window on the Park is the place where you can savour perennial favourites like Chinese Rojak and Kueh Pie Tee, Singapore Laksa.
The ala-carte buffet also features seafood on ice such as succulent poached prawns and cold Canadian mussels along with 10 different hot dishes like black paper crab, salted egg crab, spaghetti in chilli crab sauce, local dining has never been tastier!
Put a sweet ending to your dining experience with tempting delights of ice cream, piping hot bread and butter pudding, all accompanied by a wide selection of cakes and local Kuehs. (Oct 2020)

data.title: Wine & Chef
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Italian, Fusion, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Foie Gras, Veal, Oyster, Scallop Capellini, 'Black Pork' Noir de Bigorre, Sakura Chicken, Australian Wagyu Striploin MBS 3-4, Lobster Capellini, Conference Pear
data.ABOUT:
There aren’t many spots dedicated to Italian wines, but this cosy resto-bar on Keong Saik Road is one of them. Helmed by Chef Darence Wee of Les Amis fame brings 23 years of culinary experience to the kitchen, where he crafts Italian classics from premium Asian ingredients. A must-try here is the Scallop Capellini, a dish of cold capellini topped with cured kelp, caviar, and scallops and splashed with soy truffle dressing. Refreshing and earthy, this is the perfect plate to savour on a hot day. 

Prefer something a little sweeter? The Salted Egg Cheesecake brings together the best of east and west. This local take on the classic American dessert consists of a creamy mix of cheese and rich salted egg in a hand-pressed graham cracker crust. The Salted Egg gives the cake a depth of flavour that will have you savouring every bite.  

Food aside, the draw of this spot is their wine list. Featuring over 140 exclusive bottles from from Italian boutique wineries, there’s no place that knows their grapes better than this one. All wines here are handpicked to ensure high quality. Wineries that create tipplings with distinctive characteristics are selected to ensure the best dining experience for every guest. (Sep 2018)

data.title: Wine & Kitchen
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wasabi Mayo Prawns, ‘Kung Pao’ Style Seafood Risotto, Creamy Parma, Lava Chocolate Cake
data.ABOUT:
A modern wine bistro offering a wide range of fusion cuisine at breakfast, lunch, and dinner, Wine & Kitchen is more than just a place to wine and dine. This beautiful restaurant boasts a wonderful ambience that allows diners to let loose, relax and enjoy a wide selection of wine and beverages from all over the world. 

Start with a steaming hot platter of Wasabi Mayo Prawns. Served with a blend of wasabi and Japanese mayonnaise, this fiery twist to your favourite tiger prawns will surely tickle your tastebuds! Can’t get enough prawns? Order the Spicy Prawn Gambas, with succulent tiger prawns mixed in a fragrant medley of homemade garlic oil and stir-fried with chilli. 

Wine and dine your way by customising your dining experience with your pick of any warm or cold starters to pair with a wide variety of drinks available on the menu. Here at Wine & Kitchen, you can also build your own cheese and charcuterie platter to kickstart your meal. Other signature dishes include the Hokkien Seafood, ‘Kung Pao’ Style Seafood Risotto, Creamy Parma, and Lava Chocolate Cake. (Apr 2021)

data.title: Wine Universe Restaurant & Bar
data.Cuisine: Bar, Buffet, Modern European, French, Fusion, International, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wiener Schnitzel, Escalope Viennoise, Raclette, Rösti Valaisan
data.ABOUT:
In case the name wasn’t enough of a hint, the rows of wine bottles lining the walls should be a clue as to how seriously Wine Universe Restaurant & Bar takes its vino. Set up by Swiss vintner, Dominique Giroud, and Swiss owner, Claude Dizerens, the space is a restaurant, bar, and wine cellar rolled into one. The inside is furnished in a modern style with plenty of dark accents and simple lines – perhaps all the better to highlight the food and drink. However, if you’re in the mood for ambiance that’s a little more laidback, the sidewalk al fresco area might be more to your liking.

It’s not often that Switzerland comes to mind when you’re in the mood for wine but that’s exactly what Wine Universe hopes to change. Besides the usual suspects from France and Italy, their incredibly extensive wine selection – easily over 50 types of wine – also introduces several Swiss options that often go overlooked. Worried about getting a little tipsy with only drinks and no nosh? Try some of the contemporary dishes on offer. Taking inspiration from the Swiss culinary culture, the menu comprises of items like Wiener Schnitzel, Escalope Viennoise, Raclette, Matterhorn  Rösti, and more.

Not only does the lack of excessive crowds mean that the restaurant is a great venue to hang out at, the food and, most importantly, wine are also fantastic representations of the Swiss gastronomic landscape. (Dec 2015)

data.title: Winestone
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, French, Italian, Spanish, Middle Eastern, Greek, Portuguese, Pizza
data.Hours: Tue-Sun: 12pm-3pm, 3-5pm, 5-10pmSunday Ala Carte Buffet Brunch: 11:30am-3pmClosed Monday
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mixed Platter, Rigatoni Prawn, Ragout Tagliatelle, Winestone Pizza, Winestone Signature Burger, Beef Tenderloin, Braised Seafood Risotto, Chocolate Ganache Mud Pie
data.ABOUT:
Housing a Modern-European restaurant, bar and wine retail store under one roof, Winestone serves affordable wines and authentic Modern-European plates inspired by the gastronomic wonders all
over Europe. The name is derived from two elements: the expansive and carefully curated selection of quality wines, as well as, the signature hearty dishes served on stone boards. With a
concept revolving around the keywords: simple, attractive, authentic and affordable, one can expect quality wines starting at just $8 a glass and $38 a bottle, including take-home options that
can be bought directly from the retail store at the corner of the restaurant.
While you are there, be sure to dig into signatures like the Mixed Platter that serves some of the finest cold cuts, cheese, olives and bread at just $32. Other signatures includes the decadent
Rigatoni Prawn, which promises to leave the delightful tangy flavours of a rich sauce accompanied by al dente pasta and crunch fresh prawns. A vegetarian alternative of this dish is also
available upon request. The Pan-Seared Cod Fish is another new favourite, presenting a golden-brown gleaming cod surrounded by a bed of sautéed spinach soaked in a light fish velouté with
fresh clam juice and finished with a generous squeeze of lemon, erupting the senses with a myriad of flavours.
Opens daily, except Mondays, from 12pm until 3pm and 5pm until 10pm. Winestone is a sophisticated and chic space that is perfect for a romantic night out, or a gathering with a group of friends over a drink or two. (Nov 2020)

data.title: Wok Master (Changi City Point)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly
data.Address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1#01-28Changi City PointSingapore (486038)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Passionfruit Prawn, Coffee Spare Ribs, Black Pepper Crab, Sambal Kangkong, Claypot Curry Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Now you no longer have to sweat it out while enjoying hawker classics like Curry Fish Head and Black Pepper Crab. This restaurant focuses on flavour and finesse, with all their dishes undergoing a fiery treatment to preserve the wok hei taste we know and love.

The menu here isn’t just familiar fare, though. There are a number of unique creations on the menu that incorporate timeless techniques with fresh flavours to create never-before-seen dishes. The Crispy Passionfruit Prawn is one such dish. With the sweetness of the passionfruit and the crunch of deep-fried prawns, this dish has a unique flavour that only gets better with every bite. The Coffee Spare Ribs is another tantalizing dish that combines salty and sweet for a dish that is sure to perk you up during lunch.

Diners who prefer to stick to popular dishes will be pleased with the selection on offer here. The Black Pepper Crab offers the familiar earthy spice we are so fond of, while the Sambal Kangkong is crisp, spicy, and best enjoyed with a bowl of Jasmine rice. The Claypot Curry Chicken is a crowd favourite - and for good reason. The Wok Master’s curry gravy is aromatic and spicy, and coats every piece of tender chicken and potato. (Dec 2018)

data.title: Wok Master Express @ Mapletree Business City
data.Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, All-Day Breakfast, Local, Dim Sum, Cafe, Zi Char
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 20 Pasir Panjang Road #02-13Mapletree Business CitySingapore (117439)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prawn Dumplings, Crispy Pork Belly Rice, Salted Egg Pork Ribs, Curry Chicken with Rice
data.ABOUT:
A fuss-free alternative to the traditional Wok Master restaurant, this casual eatery at Mapletree Business City known as Wok Master Express is a local Chinese restaurant dishing up tasty and affordable fare. From all-time classics such as Sambal Kang Kong to hot favourites such as Salted Egg Pork Ribs, all dishes here at Wok Master Express go through a blazing fire in the wok to achieve that essential ‘Wok Hei” flavour that everyone loves.

Dig into a hearty breakfast of juicy Prawn Dumplings, crunchy Fried Spring Roll and more with the eatery’s wide variety of dim sum delights. Set options such as Laksa Set, Mee Siam and Ipoh Hor Fun are also available on the extensive menu. Meat lovers can look forward to the signature Crispy Pork Belly Rice. Perfectly sliced, the succulent pieces of tender pork belly are set atop a bed of soft, fluffy grains of short rice for a delicious dining experience. Alternatively, opt for the Curry Chicken with Rice for a fiery rendition of chunky potatoes, chicken wings and flavourful coconut milk. A mainstay in the Wok Master Express kitchen, the two claypot dishes are the star of the menu. Retaining the nostalgic flavour of the past, this tasty mix of chicken with spring onions rewards with a burst of flavours and is a great dish for sharing with family and friends. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Wok Palace
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Handmade Prawn Roll, Braised Australian Abalone, Creamy Salted Egg Crab, Cereal Prawn
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Wok Palace originates from the Wok Master and Coffee Hive family. From the humble roots of a traditional coffee and toast cafe, we have grown to a casual family oriented Zi-Char concept at Wok Master, and now to a refined fine dining concept at Wok Palace.

Wok Palace strives to provide a unique menu with exciting new dishes as well as our evergreen Zi-char favorites. In a more comfortable environment with VIP rooms, we hope to provide a new dining experience to our current and new customers. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Wonderland Savour (Wisma Atria)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Egg Confit, Dashi Risotto, Iberico Pork, Beef Ragu Spaghetti, Duck Fat Potato
data.ABOUT:
Located in Wisma Atria, this is a great place to unwind in between shopping trips. The menu consists of cafe fare jazzed up with upscale ingredients. Expect foie gras, aioli, and Iberico ham. From the bright lights to the plush upholstery of the interior, the restaurant simply screams sophistication. Boasting an Egg Confit to Dashi Risotto, diners can savour an array of exciting fusion dishes that will win them over to Wonderland. 

The Egg Confit is a great way to whet your appetite before your mains arrive. Made with eggs, crispy potato, truffle jus, and potato mousseline. The mixture of textures in this dish give it a unique mouthfeel that you’ll want to savour. The light eggs and hearty potatoes make for an unlikely but delicious combination. Continuing with the unique dish trend, try the Dashi Risotto. Made with Miso Chicken Dashi, seaweed furikake, arborio rice, and mushroom, the recipe here puts a Japanese spin on an Italian staple. Meat lovers can indulge in the Iberico Pork. Served with earthy garlic chips and creamy aioli, the buttery taste of the pork will leave you craving for more long after the last bite. (April 2019)

data.title: Woody Family Cafe
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buah Keluak Bakwan masak Garam Assam, Nasi Ulam, Devil’s Curry Chicken, Ondeh Ondeh Cake
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Nestled in the lush greenery of Sembawang and away from the bustling crowd, stood an eclectic themed café – Woody Family Café. Be transported to the laid-back, tranquil and “out-of-Singapore” ambience the minute you step into the café. 

Pamper yourself and your love ones with a comprehensive menu from comforting, traditional Peranakan delicacies to western Peranakan fusion creations! This café is renowned for handed-down delectable recipe from a true blue Peranakan lineage for generations.

The food is enjoyable of course, prepared from the heart much like a home-cooked family meal. Start off with the unpretentious no-frills Peranankan Buah Keluak Bakwan masak Garam Assam – uniquely prepared with buah keluak, meatballs, and assam and the signature Nasi Ulam, mixed herbs rice salad and served with special concocted sambal. For a true Peranakan experience, try the Devil’s Curry Chicken, comprising succulent chicken, sausages, and potatoes stewed in a traditional wholesome home-style curry; savour down with a slice of ondeh ondeh cake. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Wooftopia Pet Café
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 200 Turf Club RoadThe Grandstand#01-29/30 Singapore (287994)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wooftopia Chicken Burger, Bangers & Mash, Chicken Rice, Fruity Pancakes
data.ABOUT:
This pet cafe serves up wonderful and tasty meals for both pets and owners alike. 
Spaciously designed to make it a perfect venue for playdates, bring your feline or canine and dine together at Wooftopia. 

Order the Wooftopia Chicken Burger. Loaded with fresh tomatoes, romaine, caramelized onions, the cafe’s signature double patty grilled burger oozes a smokey barbeque sauce. Served with shoestring fries and a side salad, the Cheese Burger and Fish & Chips are also crowd favorites. Bangers & Mash is also a good choice. Presented on a bed of chunky mashed potatoes, sausages are drizzled with the cafe’s special black pepper sauce for an extra kick of flavor. 

The pet’s menu is also extensive, with sweet treats such as the Fruity Pancakes and even local favorites such as Chicken Rice and Nasi Lemak. A replica of Singapore’s beloved Hainanese chicken rice, boiled chicken is served with brown rice, cucumber and goji berry paste as chili. All pet dishes also come with a free dessert known as the Puppuccino! 

An ideal place for bonding sessions with your furry creatures, head down to Wooftopia for good food and company. (Mar 2020)

data.title: Wooloomooloo Steakhouse Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Tuna & Spanner Crab, Jumbo Prawn Cocktail, Australian Black Angus Tomahawk, Bread & Butter Pudding
data.ABOUT:
If you are in search for an experimental, avant garde take on steak, Wooloomooloo is not the place for you. Instead, Wooloomooloo is among the best classic refineries of steakdom in this hemisphere, with a name from Down Under, and years of experience from the namesake Hong Kong restaurant group. Including everything that has made steakhouses its own genre - premium cuts, elegant décor and classic trimmings - Wooloomooloo is set to "steak" its claim as one of the premier houses in Singapore.
From the 3rd floor of the Raffles City Shopping Center, Wooloomooloo boasts a picturesque view of Stamford Road, St. Andrew's Cathedral, and for Formula One enthusiasts, Turn 9 of the only night race in the world. There is much to be proud of, with an expansive lounge and dining area flanked by handsome leather seating and stacked wood touches that have become iconic. Aboriginal dot paintings pay homage to the Aussie title while an impressive meat case and open kitchen pay homage to the other source of the restaurant's greatness, its remarkable steaks.
With more offerings than it has O's, the range is well-varied and precisely prepared - think jumbo prawn cocktails, a mammoth Australian Black Angus Tomahawk, a highly sought after USDA prime rib eye, and a gorgeous bread and butter pudding if there ever was one. Take our word for it, when it comes to steak, go classic. Go Wooloomooloo. (Jun 2016)

data.title: Woorinara Korean Restaurant
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Bibimbap with Beef, Korean Fried Chicken, Bingsu, Injeolmi, Ginseng Tea
data.PRESS RELEASE: Our menu features all the big hitters of the Korean culinary tradition: fresh Bibimbap with beef, eggs and plenty of chili; Korean fried chicken twice fried to create that extra crispy skin, tossed in your sauce of choice, and finally, meat grilled at your table accompanied by plenty of banchan sides. Finish your meal with some Bingsu or Injeolmi – and don’t forget to leave before trying some ginseng tea, as we are the only restaurant in Singapore that sells it! Come on over and let us treat you to a Korean feast here on Lorong Kilat in Bukit Timah. (Jul 2019)

data.title: Xi Yan Shaw
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yunnan Ham Niang Dou Fu in Special Broth, Salivating Spicy Chicken
data.ABOUT: Founded by Jacky Yu, nicknamed ‘Hong Kong’s Jamie Oliver’, Xi Yan Shaw rides on his years of food experience as a food critic and cooking instructor. His impressive resume includes representing China at the food expo event, Bocuse D’or, alongside greats like Pierre Hermes and being selected by Phaidon to appear as one of the world’s top ten master chefs in a publication that also highlights Gordon Ramsay and Alain Duccase.Working off the fundamentals of Chinese cooking as created by Chef Yu, Xi Yan’s modern Chinese cuisine employs only the freshest ingredients which are then transformed into comforting fare. Enjoy familiar dishes given a creative twist – Salivating Spicy Chicken, Yunnan Ham Niang Dou Fu in Special Broth, and Steamed Cod Fish with Pickled Chili on Rice Noodles are but some of the mouth-watering items on offer and you’ll be spoilt for choice.The extensive food range – varied enough that you’d need to bring a large group or come back several more times – combined with a friendly and relaxed atmosphere makes Xi Yan Shaw a convenient place in the heart of Orchard Road where you can enjoy quality casual Chinese meals at affordable prices. (Mar 2016)

data.title: Xian De Lai
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Eat-All-You-Can Hotpot
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Xian De Lai Hotpot 鲜得来 in Singapore is an award-winning Asian restaurant which serves authentic Chinese hotpot and steamboat dishes. A Singaporean favourite ever since opening back in 2003, this Bugis eatery is one of the oldest hotpot restaurants in the city. 

Located on the popular Liang Seah Street, this spacious restaurant is perfect for intimate dinners for two, family meals, large groups and everything in between. You’ll find nine different soup bases to choose from and over 80 different ingredients to add extra flavour, this ensuring customers can create the hotpot they’ve always wanted. All the bases are brewed daily to guarantee both freshness and the best possible flavours. 

So what are you waiting for? If you’re in the mood for a hotpot steamboat head on down to Bugis and give Xian De Lai Hotpot 鲜得来 a try today. Just don’t forget to book your table in advance. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Xiao Long Kan Hotpot (Bedok)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Wrapped Lady's finger, A-Grade Lean Beef, Sheep Stomach, Meatballs
data.ABOUT:
If you ask us, we can’t think of a meal that’s more comforting than a bubbling cauldron of fiery-hot soup. And when that craving strikes, there’s one name that soars above its competition – Xiao Long Kan Hotpot 小龙坎老火锅. Hailing from Chengdu, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot is the brainchild of F&B veteran Lao Wu. Better known as Old Man Wu, this bright entrepreneur wanted to create an eating space centred around providing the best ingredients and flavours for diners. And what happens next is history, as this burgeoning empire succeeded beyond all expectations and has new restaurants popping up all over the continent.

Located in Bedok, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot is a place where you’ll be treated like a member of the imperial dynasty. From the warm and attentive service to the rich and opulent decor showcasing Chinese lanterns, wooden lattice panels, and gorgeous wall-sized paintings, get ready to be whisked away from the humdrum of everyday life and into a dining experience like no other. Load up on a variety of top-quality ingredients to go alongside your spicy hotpot. We love the tender Beef Slices or the Lady Finger Wrapped Pork. The freshly made Tofu is another go-to pick that complements the spice-laden soup perfectly.

An ever-growing chain, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot has made a splash among local hotpot aficionados for its deeply satisfying and lip-smacking fare. (Sep 2019)

data.title: Xiao Long Kan Hotpot (Bugis)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Wrapped Lady's finger, A-Grade Lean Beef, Sheep Stomach, Meatballs
data.ABOUT:
If you ask us, we can’t think of a meal that’s more comforting than a bubbling cauldron of fiery-hot soup. And when that craving strikes, there’s one name that soars above its competition – Xiao Long Kan Hotpot 小龙坎老火锅. Hailing from Chengdu, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot is the brainchild of F&B veteran Lao Wu. Better known as Old Man Wu, this bright entrepreneur wanted to create an eating space centred around providing the best ingredients and flavours for diners. And what happens next is history, as this burgeoning empire succeeded beyond all expectations and has new restaurants popping up all over the continent.

The freshly made Tofu is another go-to pick that complements the spice-laden soup perfectly. 

An ever-growing chain, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot has made a splash among local hotpot aficionados for its deeply satisfying and lip-smacking fare. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Xiao Ya Tou
data.Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Fusion, All-Day Breakfast, Local, Southeast Asian, Modern Asian
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Otak Otak Rolls, Braised Baby Spinach, XYT Lu Rou Fan, Twice-Cooked Angus Short Ribs, Truffle Roast Duck
data.ABOUT:
Xiao Ya Tou, or XYT, is hard to miss. Its distinctive red lanterns, plastic chairs, and loud decor just call out to you as you walk past, not unlike the pervy men in the past who used to line this very street leering at the ladies of the night who used to operate around the area.
XYT’s food, too, is loud, bold and in-your-face. Start your meal with the all-time classic, Braised Duck. At XYT, the meat of the duck is tender, yet provides enough of a bite to allow you to savour the juice of the sinews. To share, you will not regret ordering a Lu Rou Fan (braised meat on rice), which, at XYT, uses minced wagyu instead of the normal pork. The ubiquitous street food is thus upgraded to an almost unrecognisable form, but it is an evolution that we daresay is worth the calories. As the sun sets on Duxton Hill and lights from other eating establishments flicker on around you, sit back and reminisce about the days of old Duxton as you enjoy the retro charm with a cocktail or two from the XYT bar. (Feb 2017)

data.title: Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 317 Outram RoadLevel 4Holiday Inn Singapore AtriumSingapore (169075)                                                Map

data.ABOUT:
In line with the recent announcement on Covid-19 restrictions, Xin Cuisine will not be open for dine-in from 16 May to 13 June 2021. However, delivery and takeaways are still available through our eShop.
Please visit here to place your order.
Thank you! (May 2021)More

data.title: Xperience Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chicken Liver Mousse On Toast, Housemade Spicy Szechuan Style Beef Burger, Roasted Seabass, Duck Confit, Goreng Pisang
data.ABOUT: Xperience is where socialites come to wine and dine, meet and eat. A vibrant all-day café, restaurant and bar located in the heart of Singapore’s bustling CBD, Xperience is known for its tantalizing cuisine and attentive service. Our culinary designers use fresh and flavoursome produce to present a variety of International dishes, perfectly paired with our sommelier’s handpicked selection of fine wines. Satisfy your cravings for all-time favourites on the refreshing a la carte menu, or spice up your lunch meeting with a dynamic seasonal set menu which never fails to surprise and delight. With a magnificent 20-foot molteni oven that sits centre stage, diners can sit back and enjoy the show as tasty temptations are skilfully prepared before them. (Mar 2020)

data.title: YOSHI Restaurant
data.Good For: Fine Dining, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Beef & Foie Gras Don, Uni Bara Chirashi Don, Hassun, Shiizakana, Tsukuri
data.ABOUT:
Nestled on the bustling Orchard Road is none other than YOSHI, a Japanese establishment that celebrates the authentic flavours of Kyoto. At its helm is Chef Yoshiyuki, a former personal chef to Japanese ambassadors based in San Francisco and  Singapore, and has earned his stripes working at  the respected Kyoryori Hosoi in the Saitama prefecture.
 
At YOSHI, choose from from a personalised omakase menu or any one of the themed menus that revolve around a key ingredient. One popular themed menu is the Maguro Menu, which showcases fresh tuna flown from Tsukiji’s famous tuna supplier Yukitaka Yamaguchi, who is better known by his nickname “Tuna King”. Part of this eight course set features the Shokuji, where pieces of grilled tuna sit on a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. Not a fan of seafood? Then why not opt for the Wagyu Beef Menu instead? This eight-piece meal is centred around beautifully marbled prized beef guaranteed to melt in your mouth. Then pair your meal with a glass of sake such as a bottle of Kamokinshu known for its clean and refreshing aftertaste. 

Showcasing a steadfast commitment to seasonal and quality ingredients, YOSHI is the epitome of refined Japanese cuisine in a stunning environment. (Jul 2018)

data.title: YOUNGS Bar & Restaurant
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 3 Hyde Park GateThe Oval @ SAPSingapore (799531)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Fries, Crab Cake,YOUNGS Big Breakfast, YOUNGS Waffle Stacker, Crab & Eggs Benedict, YOUNGS Salad, Foie Gras, Chicken Roulade, Canard a l'Orange, Mussels Pot, Frutti di Mare Pizza
data.ABOUT:
Set in a preserved colonial bungalow, this unique spot offers an intimate dining experience far from the rush of the city. With an elegant interior, attentive service and delicious modern European fare, this restaurant and bar would not be out of place on the Champs Elysees.

The brunch menu here features an array of beloved staples from pancakes to eggs Benedict. Dig in to a stack of soft pancakes served with light chantilly cream and fresh fruit, or nosh on a soft poached egg served on a buttery croissant and and tangy Hollandaise sauce. 

The mains don’t disappoint either. Up for something unique? Give their Canard a l’Orange a try. Tender duck breast is done to perfection and served with a fresh, citrusy orange sauce. The Angus Beef Tenderloin is heaven on a plate for carnivores - fresh meat cooked to perfection and served with a rich port wine sauce and crisp greens. 

Diners who prefer a tipple with their meal will be delighted by the range of handcrafted cocktails on offer here, as well as the wallet-friendly happy hour deals. The Sangria Sour is a unique concoction of citrus, wine and whisky that is just as easy on the eyes as it is on the palate.

data.title: Yakiniku Ohji (Clementi)
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Arabiki Sausage, Angus Beef, US Tenderloin, US Kalbi, Marinated Pork Kalbi
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Roll up your sleeves, ladies and gentlemen, because it’s time to get down and dirty at this popular gem of a yakiniku restaurant. It’s pretty much a given that red meat-lovers will have the time of their lives at Yakiniku Ohji, which offers a luscious spread of Wagyu beef cuts that can be grilled to tender perfection over charcoal fires.

Admire the exquisite marbling that comes with beef of superb quality, and watch as it slowly cooks over your gridiron; the fact that the restaurant uses charcoal fires gives an exquisite charred facet to the taste of the meat. What truly sets Yakiniku Ohji apart from other similar restaurants, however, is the fact that it imports the entire cattle – this allows the restaurant to offer up a selection of rare cuts, each more flavoursome and succulent than the last. Don’t forget to reserve your favourites, though, because some parts are limited in quantity and liable to be snapped up early!

To get to the meat of the matter (pun shamelessly intended), it’s a rare person who won’t enjoy a visit to this restaurant – so what’re you waiting for? Make your way down to Yakiniku Ohji today! (Feb 2019)

data.title: Yakizen
data.Cuisine: Japanese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Modern Asian, BBQ
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pitan Tofu, Salmon Tataki, Yakizen Maki, Beef Tataki, Gyu Aburi Don and Yakitori
data.ABOUT:
Yakizen is located just a few streets away from the well-known Riverside Boat Quay. They offer a value-for-money lunch menu by day and a relaxed Izakaya by night. Yakizen is a modern Izakaya that immersed fine dining selection into an affordable family restaurant.

In the afternoon, the restaurant draws a crowd from the value-for-money lunch menu from $7.80+. They also serve bento sets with miso soup and free flow salad, and green tea.

As the sun goes down, they serve yakitori, which pairs very well with sake. Their yakitori is the must-try and value-for-money dish starting from $2.30+. If you are an oyster lover, you can try their super fresh oyster. For a beef lover, never leave the restaurant without ordering their Gyu Aburi Don. The beef is incredibly tender and melts in the mouth with Maze Gohan (a mix of sushi rice and Yakizen special sauce) at the bottom. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Yan Lai Ju (宴来居)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Mala Crayfish, Steamed Fish Head with Two Chopped Chilli, Garlic Pork Ribs, Hometown Cold and Sauced Dish
data.ABOUT:
A Chinese restaurant located in the West, Yan Lai Ju Chinese Restaurant is a stone’s throw away from Jurong East Mrt. Helmed by two experienced chefs from China and Malaysia, both chefs have more than 30 years of combined experience in the culinary world. While one hails from Northeastern China and specialises in Sichuan and Dongbei cuisines, another is skilled in whipping up local dishes and seafood options. 

Decked out in elegant Chinese decor, Yan Lai Ju Chinese Restaurant is a great place to meet with friends and dine out with family. The restaurant also features private KTV rooms that can accommodate up to 12 people — perfect for family gatherings or business dining. 

Whet your appetite with a bowl of Hometown Cold and Sauced Dish. Made for sharing, this dish is a tasty starter that will have you raising your hands for more. Other signature menu items here include Mala Crayfish, Steamed Fish Head with Two Chopped Chilli, Garlic Pork Ribs, and more. (Jan 2021)

data.title: Yan Ting (The St. Regis Singapore)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.Address: 29 Tanglin RoadLevel 1UThe St. Regis SingaporeSingapore (247911)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Fried Chicken with Morel in Superior Soy Sauce, Pan-Seared A9 Wagyu Beef Fillet with Mushroom Sauce, Braised Whole Abalone in Superior Oyster Sauce, Dimsum, Roast Pork, Double-boiled Sea Whelk Consommé with Garlic,
data.ABOUT:
Yan Ting is one of the city’s most ethereal Cantonese restaurants, tucked away in the regal St. Regis hotel. It’s a favourite amongst discerning diners looking for a quiet and discreet location for a luxurious and refined dimsum brunch, or more elaborate Cantonese feasts for special occasions. Expect the height of fine Chinese cuisine, shot through with the balance and richness of pure Cantonese cuisine. Nothing says special occasion quite like a Braised Whole Abalone in Superior Oyster Sauce, an entire lobe of the meaty treasure in an umami broth, paired with crunchy seasonal greens. A similar, less wallet-busting dish is the Braised Sea Supreme Cucumber with Corn Broth, a lovely blend of savoury and sweet flavours with the incomparable texture of high quality sea cucumber. 

Cantonese cuisine is nothing without a soup centrepiece, and here there’s a stunning Double-boiled Sea Whelk Consommé with Garlic, served in a teapot for some extra theatre with the deep oceaney flavours. Meat dishes here come with a similarly high-end flourish. Think Pan-Fried Chicken with Morel in Superior Soy Sauce, a humble poultry dish given a dramatic gourmet kick with the addition of rare, earthy morels. Moving further along this French direction, two great cuisines meet in the form of a Pan-Seared A9 Wagyu Beef Fillet with Mushroom Sauce. If it’s dimsum and traditional Cantonese roasts you’re after, lunch and brunch on the weekends is the best time to hit up this joint, with its popular buffet options. Either way, this is a meal that will stick around in your belly and mind with its commitment to fine ingredients, lovingly and innovatively prepared. (Jan 2018)

data.title: Yan at National Gallery Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.Address: 1 St. Andrew’s Road#05-02National Gallery SingaporeSingapore (178957)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Roast Suckling Pig 3 Ways, Yan Peking Duck, Mini Buddha Jumps Over The Wall, Dim Sum Selection
data.ABOUT:
Since opening in 2015, Yàn has more than lived up to its given meaning, ‘宴’, by being a veritable ‘feast’ of conviviality and exquisite Cantonese flavors, served with sincerity and heart. Helmed by Head Chef Ng Sen Tio, the restaurant showcases a spectrum of dining enjoyment featuring hearty Cantonese classics and favorites.
Located within the National Gallery Singapore, the restaurant’s elegant interiors alludes to its artistic surroundings, featuring modern décor complementing the overall dining experience. The 2,700 sq ft space seats up to 154 and is divided into the main dining hall with an adjacent flexible dining area and 3 private rooms, perfect for any group or event.
Serving authentic Cantonese cuisine, expect heartwarming dishes to elegant plates made to impress. Its chinoiserie chic interior design reflects this sense of largesse; be it a business power lunch, convivial dinner, wedding celebration or corporate event, the dining experience at Yàn, truly is a feast for the stomach, eyes, and soul. (Mar 2021)

data.title: Yantra
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seafood Rassa, Quinoa Chaat, Ganderi Kebabs, Grazing Goat, Ghee Roast Chicken, Maartaban Ka Meat
data.ABOUT:
Yantra has established itself as the premier fine-dining Indian restaurant in Singapore, having won numerous accolades such as Singapore Tatler Best Restaurants in 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012 and the Best Restaurant Concept Award (Asian) in 2011 by Epicurean Star Award. Now in celebration of its 8th anniversary, it seems fitting that Yantra has collaborated with world-renowned Chef Hemant Oberoi, who has cooked for the likes of world leaders and celebrities such as Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, Margaret Thatcher, Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie.
This is not your typical North India - the dishes are inspired by flavours from all over India, but with a contemporary twist. One stellar example, the Chicken Tikka Fondue, is the perfect marriage between chicken tikka marinated in spices and yogurt, and a tantalizing cheese fondue. From the Seafood Rassa to the Thepla Tacos, the dishes are also telling of Yantra’s unyielding conviction of using the freshest ingredients and spices hand-picked and flown in from India.
Yantra also turns fine dining up a notch with an interior that conveys an effortless sophistication and elegance, a clever reflection of its food. The extended bar which boasts of an imaginative range of specialty cocktails like the Tandoor Mojito and intriguing whiskies from Scotland’s finest whisky producing regions is also majorly impressive. Enough said, we’re sold on this unparalleled dining experience! (Jun 2016)

data.title: Yanxi Palace Steamboat Restaurant
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Buddha-Jumps-Over-The-Wall, Imperial Elixir Youth Soup, Seafood Platter, Rose Ice Jelly
data.ABOUT:
Located along Chin Swee Road, Yanxi Palace Steamboat is a humble Chinese restaurant that serves up a number of delicious soup bases double-boiled from scratch. With the likes of authentic Mala Soup, Tomato Soup, Pepper Pork Stomach, Chicken Soup and more, you’ll be spoilt for choice needing to make repeated trips back!

A huge hit among the ladies is the Imperial Elixir Youth Soup. Rich in collagen and nourishing for both your skin and health, this tasty and nutritious soup base is the perfect choice for a delicious meal. Another must-try soup is the restaurant’s signature Buddha-Jumps-Over-The-Wall. Brewed using the finest selection of ingredients and herbs such as ginseng and cordyceps, this tasty soup base comes highly recommended to nourish your health. If you’re looking for something to soothe your stomach, try the Yanxi Treasure Pearl Soup — boiled for 8 hours with different types of rice, try this take on comfort food instead. 

To supplement your soup bases, a variety of crowd-favourite steamboat options are available too. Choices include wagyu beef, prawn balls, flower crabs and black pork, to name a few. For seafood lovers, opt for the Seafood Platter that is filled with a variety of huge and juicy scallops and mussels, fresh from the ocean. To end off the meal, balance out the richness of the soup bases by indulging in the restaurant’s refreshing ice jellies. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Yardbird Southern Table & Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 10 Bayfront AvenueB1-07 & L1-82The Shoppes at Marina Bay SandsSingapore (018956)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Fried Green Tomato & Crispy Pork Belly, Deviled Eggs, Butter Lettuce & Grilled Mango Salad, Shrimp 'N' Grits, Lewellyn's Fine Fried Chicken, Chicken 'N' Watermelon 'N' Waffles, Skillet Cornbread, Dark Chocolate Bourbon
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Located along the Marina Bay waterfront, Yardbird Southern Table & Bar brings the best of American culture and cuisine to Singapore in a casual and inviting atmosphere overlooking the glistening Marina Bay waters.
Diners can enjoy classic American dishes, including the famous 100-year-old recipe Lewellyn's Fine Fried Chicken, Shrimp 'N' Grits, Buttermilk Biscuits, Butter Lettuce and Grilled Mango Salad, as well as new American home-favourites such as Jambalaya, Southern BBQ Shrimp, and Muffuletta Salad. Amongst the classic southern favourites, Yardbird Southern Table & Bar offers selections with an inventive spin on local cuisine inspired by Kunkel's travels to Singapore.
The restaurant also boasts one of Asia's most impressive selections of bourbon and many sought-after spirits from around the globe. Among the multitude of signature bourbon options, guests will discover rare favourites such as Pappy Van Winkle, Jefferson's Aged at Sea and rare expressions of Blanton's. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Yassin Kampung (Admiralty)
data.Cuisine: Seafood, Local, Halal Certified, Zi Char
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Chilli Crab, Crispy Oat Prawn, Butter Milk Salted Egg Yolk Chicken
data.ABOUT:
Opened by veteran Chinese Muslim chef Yassin Ng, this restaurant brings together everything Singaporeans love under one roof - seafood, spice, and the kampung spirit. Having worked in a medley of hawker kitchens - first as a waiter and then as a chef - gave Chef Ng the necessary expertise to craft halal versions of hawker classics. The menu at Yassin Kampung features a range of famous local dishes such as Chilli Crab and Fish Head Curry, and some with a contemporary twist - like the Buttermilk Salted Egg Yolk Chicken. There are sets available for groups of up to 10 people in a communal dining style - everyone gets a bowl of rice and a range of main dishes. 

The Chilli Crab here is a must-try. Served piping hot, this dish consists of tender crab meat in a rich, spicy gravy and served with deep fried buns. Use the buns to mop up your plate, or enjoy them on their own - the subtle sweetness of the buns cleanse the palate for the following dishes.The Grilled Tiger Prawn is another crowd favourite. Whole prawns are grilled in-shell with oil and spices to tender perfection. The flesh of the prawn is buttery and perfect with a serve of Jasmine rice. (Aug 2018)
