Whole prawns are grilled in-shell with oil and spices to tender perfection. The flesh of the prawn is buttery and perfect with a serve of Jasmine rice. (Aug 2018)

data.title: Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Yechun Steamed Pork Dumpling, Poached Sliced Beef in Sze Chuan Style, Claypot Chicken and Pig Stomach Stew, White Fungus Soup with Red Dates
data.ABOUT:
Located in Marina Square, level 2 Dining Edition, Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan is a Chinese restaurant that specialises in Huai Yang / Jiang Nan cuisine. Offering multiple deals a week, the restaurant serves a wide selection of appetizers, mains and dim sum dishes as well. 

 

Start your meal with the Yechun Steamed Pork Dumpling or dim sum of your choice from a wide selection of Dumplings and Buns (including the award-winning 3-diced bun which was created for the Qing Emperor). For something with a hint of spice, opt for the Poached Sliced Beef in Sze Chuan Style, where thinly sliced beef pieces are cooked in the restaurant’s famous sweet and spicy broth. For those looking for a healthier option, Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan offers a fragrant Tonic Herbal Claypot Chicken and Pig Stomach Soup, a herbal concoction that will surely comfort the senses and improve your immunity. The Wok-Fried Four Season Vegetables are also great for those looking for a tasty plate of greens.   Yangzhou Fried Rice is an award-winning main that please all nationalities.

 

Desserts at Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan are also healthy, with vegetarian options that cater to your non-meat eating friends. Order the Pan Fried Red Bean Pancake or the White Fungus Soup with Red Dates for a sweet end to a scrumptious meal. (Feb 2020)

data.title: Yellow Cab Pizza Co.
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: New York’s Finest, NY Classic, Manhattan Meatlovers, Dear Darla, Chicken Alfredo Pasta, Charlie Chan Chicken Pasta, Hot Wings, Twice Baked Potato Halves

data.title: Yellow Pot (Little India)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Braised Duck Spring Roll, Roast Duck, Roast Pork Rack, Wok-fried Tiger Prawns XO, Stir-fried Mee Sua
data.ABOUT:
The food here follows the clean eating philosophy adopted at The Garcha Group, which means you won’t find any additives or artificial flavourings in chef Sebastian Goh’s food. 

A cold starter of organic vine-ripened tomatoes, for instance, are served with their skins thoughtfully removed as the red skins are believed to contain inflammatory properties. The tomatoes are then soaked in a house-made plum and herbal juice, rendering them sweet and refreshing. 

Roast duck is a popular mainstay of Chinese restaurants, and the one at Yellow Pot is first marinated for two days in a fermented beancurd paste, then roasted over hickory wood so the meat is aromatic and tender with a glistening layer of crispy skin. Vegetables are not an afterthought here, too. Try the sweet and sour eggplant, where the aubergine is braised and coated with a delicious housemade sauce of hot bean paste, honey, vinegar, and Nanyang soya sauce brewed by a local company. (Sep 2020)

data.title: Yellow Pot (Tanjong Pagar)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wok-fried Chicken with Broccoli Cashew, Braised Ee-Fu Noodle with Wild Mushroom and Crab Meat, Fried Sesame “Wuxi” Pork Rib, Chinese Sweet Cake
data.ABOUT:
Located within Duxton Reserve Hotel, Yellow Pot is well known for delivering traditional Chinese flavours with a modernised twist that favours responsibly sourced ingredients. Promising an immersive gastronomic experience like no other, come down to witness the restaurant’s rich culinary philosophy, warm hospitality and traditional favourites in a breathtaking setting.
Clad in a striking palette of black, gold and yellow, the 50-seat restaurant lives up to its name with cheeky embellishments of a smattering of yellow pots of various sizes and configurations. An avid believer of eating clean, chef Sebastian Goh whips up dishes that are free of MSG, additives or artificial flavourings.
Start your meal by sharing Wok-fried Chicken with Broccoli Cashew. Extremely flavoursome and juicy, enjoy a mouthful of different textures with every bite of this yummy dish. To fill up your bellies, the Braised Ee-Fu Noodle with Wild Mushroom and Crab Meat is a stunning dish that delights with its generous serving of tangy noodles and chewy pieces of crab meat. End your meal on a sweet note with Yellow Pot’s Chinese Sweet Cake. (Feb 2021)

data.title: Yi Jia South Village Seafood Restaurant 一家南村海鲜
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Prawn Balls in Honeydew, Salted Egg Crab, Curry Fish Head
data.ABOUT:
Serving extraordinary seafood at great prices, Yi Jia South Village Seafood Restaurant is the perfect location for a celebratory meal with friends or family. Featuring a laid back experience in a friendly neighbourhood setting, the restaurant is well-known for dishing out Zi Char delights.

A dish that is not to be missed is the Prawn Balls in Honeydew. Unique to Yi Jia South Village Seafood restaurant, the fritters are served in a hollowed out melon and tastes like sweet and sour prawn balls. The live mussels are also an excellent choice. Juicy and big, the mussels are steamed to perfection before being topped off with soy sauce and garlic. Local favourites such as Salted Egg Crab, Fish Head Steamboat and Curry Fish Head are also delectable dishes that can be found at the restaurant.

Located along MacPherson Road, Yi Jia South Village Restaurant is open seven days a week for lunch, dinner and drinks, so be sure to drop by for a meal if you happen to be in the Tai Seng area! (Feb 2020)

data.title: Yin At The Riverhouse
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Crispy Sichuan Beef Slices, Angus Dry ‘pasta’, Honey Char Siew, Bandit Chicken Wings
data.ABOUT:
Yin At The Riverhouse joins the Clarke Quay nightlife enclave, bringing with it a selection of hand-crafted modern Asian cocktails and Chinese tapas. It sits in front of The Riverhouse, a 140-year-old heritage building which was formerly a secret society den. The Chinese-style architecture is a perfect complement to Yin At The Riverhouse's offerings, and acts as a great backdrop for the gram.

The drinks here are certainly one-of-a-kind — you'll find cocktails served in teapots and even one with boba. Crowd favourites include Rendezvous, a floral and fruity concoction with gin, Yuzu sake, and melon liqueur, as well as the refreshing Dragon Glass that combines yuzu juice and dragonfruit puree with spirits. Those who love longan red date tea must try the "High" Tea, a cocktail that recreates the drink but with a dash of rum.

After trying two or three drinks, you'll probably feel peckish. Yin At The Riverhouse has got you covered with a selection of Chinese and Greek dishes from Mimi's Modern Chinese Kitchen and Zorba respectively. Grab a few small plates for the table, like the Honey Char Siew, Bandit Chicken Wings, and Crispy Sichuan Beef Slices. If you're craving something heartier, the Angus Dry Pasta or Truffle Fried Rice might just do the trick. (Dec 2019)

data.title: Ying Izakaya
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Green Salad, Unagi Don, Kushiyaki, Tonkotsu Ramen
data.ABOUT:
A great place to hang out and chill with family or friends after a long day at work, Ying Izakaya offers a range of alcoholic beverages alongside a wide array of Japanese delights such as Unagi Don, ramen, and charcoal grilled platters that are perfect for sharing. 

Cooked on a traditional charcoal grill, the experienced chefs expertly serve up Kushiyaki to perfection. Diners also have the option to grill their own Kushiyaki on individual charcoal stoves. Pair with a cup or two of specially curated sake available on the menu for an authentic Japanese dining experience. 

For those looking for a quick lunch fix, the restaurant also offers Ramen and Donburi sets at promotional prices. Start off with a light Green Salad. Follow up with a hearty bowl of Unagi Don. Topped with lightly sliced slices of unagi, the rice bowl is tasty and filling. 

Swing by during dinner to have a taste of the well-loved Kushiyaki and other popular charcoal grilled menu items. Wrapped in slices of juicy pork belly, the Buta Enoki is a must order item not to be missed out on. Other popular options include the Tomorokoshi, Shitake and Ebi. (Dec 2020)

data.title: Yujin Izakaya
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Truffle Chawanmushi, Katsu Sando, Eringi, Tsukune, Gyu Kalbi, Nama Yasai
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Tucked along Zion Road is Yujin Izakaya, a lively hang out where one and all are received as friends. The industrial-chic space features a bar that opens to the five-footway and main street, beckoning with the glow of display fridges showcasing an enticing range of sake.

Immerse in this casual laid-back enclave where one can enjoy an eclectic mix of Japanese Izakaya food over a round of beer or sake. The menu spans inspired cold and hot appetisers, smokey grilled vegetable, meat and seafood dishes, beautifully singed skewered items and light desserts.

Highlights include a delightfully refreshing cold starter of Nama Yasai - a platter of shaved raw asparagus and cauliflower tossed in an umami-rich vinegar-based seaweed dressing. Or pad your stomach for a night of stiff sakes with hot appetisers of Truffle Chawanmushi and Katsu Sando - a fluffy toasted sandwich of luscious thick-cut beef katsu smeared with pommery mustard.

Continue the feast with succulent grilled Eringi and the flavours of Tontoro slow-cooked to tender perfection and finished over the grill. Meaty bites also come in the form of grilled Gyutan, Gyu Kalbi and skewers of Tebasaki, each expertly seasoned to draw out the rich, natural flavours of the ingredients. The hand-made Tsukune meatball lovingly moulded with a mix of house-minced chicken meat and with cartilage bits for a textural difference, is not to be missed either. Another signature dish from Chef Lee is the Inaniwa Udon, served with a prawn broth and topped with plump prawn tempura.

Complementing the menu of hearty, bold-flavoured grilled items is a beverage programme with a strong sake focus. Patrons can also enjoy a range of Chuhai, Highballs and unique Yujin concoctions such as a Shochu Mojito or Yuzu Sour. Happy hour promotions are also available from 5 to 7pm from Mondays to Saturdays. (Mar 2019)

data.title: Yum Cha Changi
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks
data.Address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 1#01-33UE Bizhub EASTSingapore (486017)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Vegetables and Cheese Dumplings, Pan Fried Rice Flour Rolls in Chilli Sauce, Malay Cake, Oyster Siew Mai, Xiao Long Bao, Peking Duck, H.K Roasted Meat, Steamed Sliced Fish with Fungus, Braised Beancurd with Mushroom and Vegetables served in Claypot, Yeung Chow Seafood Fried Rice
data.ABOUT:
A well-known and much-loved destination for Dim Sum, Yum Cha in Changi satisfies grandpa, tiny tykes and everyone in between with classic Cantonese cuisine.

There's a reason why Yum Cha always seems to be alive with hungry patrons, and that has a lot to do with their dim sum. Tried-and-true renditions of Xiao Long Bao, Prawn Dumplings, Fish Roe Siew Mai and more come piping hot from the kitchen, rolled in by traditional push cart to excited diners. The classics are certainly excellent, but Yum Cha also excels in trendier items like Malay Cake from Hong Kong, and Crispy Red Bean with Banana, which they challenge their kitchens to introduce to the menu every now and then. All are solid in taste with recipes very similar to those you grew up with, tossing you back into a haze of tasty nostalgia (or perhaps that's just a food coma).

The setting is apt for the retro dishes, with round marble tables and basic wooden chairs that recall traditional Chinese dining. (Jun 2018)

data.title: Yum Cha Chinatown
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Dim Sum
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Large Parties (16+)
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Vegetables and Cheese Dumplings, Pan Fried Rice Flour Rolls in Chilli Sauce, Lavender Bun with Coconut, Malay Cake, Oyster Siew Mai, Xiao Long Bao, Seafood Pancake, Seafood Hor Fun, Salted Egg Prawns, Peking Duck, Yum Cha Signature Chilli Crab
data.ABOUT:
A well-known and much-loved destination for Dim Sum, Yum Cha in Chinatown satisfies grandpa, tiny tykes and everyone in between with classic Cantonese cuisine.
There's a reason why Yum Cha always seems to be alive with hungry patrons, and that has a lot to do with their dim sum. Tried-and-true renditions of Xiao Long Bao, Prawn Dumplings, Fish Roe Siew Mai and more come piping hot from the kitchen, rolled in by traditional push cart to excited diners. The classics are certainly excellent, but Yum Cha also excels in trendier items like Malay Cake from Hong Kong, and Crispy Red Bean with Banana, which they challenge their kitchens to introduce to the menu every now and then. All are solid in taste with recipes very similar to those you grew up with, tossing you back into a haze of tasty nostalgia (or perhaps that's just a food coma).
The setting is apt for the retro dishes, with round marble tables and basic wooden chairs that recall traditional Chinese dining. Yum Cha has much more up their chefs' sleeves than just dim sum, however. Take part in the "Tapino" dining style, gathered around the hotpot. The rich broth and communal atmosphere truly give the place a feeling of home.
At the original Chinatown outlet, delight in the hi-tea a la carte buffet with over 60 items to choose from. At only $23.80++ for adults and $16.80++ for kids, it's a value that can't be beat and will have everyone saying "yum"(cha)! (Sep 2014)

data.title: Yummo Chow
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Soft Shell Crab Burger, Chili Crab Mee, Beef Burger, Deluxe Burger, YC Shibuya Toast
data.ABOUT: Hipster food doesn’t get any better than this: grain bowls topped with rich, flavourful, comforting ingredients, well-made “fast food” with gourmet touches, innovative snacks, and punchy coffee to wash it all down with. This Bugis cafe and bistro delivers on the promise of “yum” in its name. Try the Chicken Shogayaki Bowl, tender chunks of chicken thigh, a comforting garlic ginger sauce, shredded seaweed, and pickled ginger top a bowlful of chewy long grains, making for warm, chickeny mouthfuls. Then there’s the Smoked Salmon Bowl, think a massive sushi roll in a bowl: vinegared rice is topped with fatty smoked Norwegian salmon and creamy avocado, then garnished with tobiko, and a zingy sprinkling of lemon zest. For a carb bomb of a different sort, try the Beef Burger, fluffy brioche buns filled with a rich grilled patty, fat mushroom, all enrobed by some melty Emmental cheese. Pair all that with some Shitake Tempura, tender shiitake mushrooms battered till crispy and served with mayo and a squeeze of lemon. Wash it all down with a helping of the house Espresso, and some Tempura Ice Cream, a magical battered block of creamy heaven served with salted caramel sauce. Comfort food at its best! (Jun 2017)

data.title: ZIGGY'S Lounge Rooms & Cocktail Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Wagyu Steak and Fries, Indonesian Chicken, Bar Snacks
data.ABOUT:
Look no further than ZIGGY'S Lounge Rooms & Cocktail Bar for a night filled with fun and booze. A full-fledged cocktail bar, ZIGGY'S presents a refined food and beverage menu along with stylishly designed private rooms of luxury, comfort, and ease.
Boasting a bunch of costumes, fancy dress and props, the lounge and cocktail bar is the perfect place for after-work socials to let your hair down with friends and colleagues. Available throughout the evening, food options such as bar snacks, small plates, sharing dishes as well as classic comfort food are whipped up using high quality, fresh local ingredients for a great dining experience.
Not just another lounge bar, ZIGGY'S lounge rooms each contain a minibar fridge stocked with food and drinks, including treats by local chocolatier Demochoco. The drinks menu is also as impressive. With a huge sake selection of seasonal varieties, cult labels, boutique breweries and more, who’s up for a night of non-stop partying? (Feb 2021)

data.title: Zafferano Italian Restaurant & Lounge
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pan-Seared ‘Hokkaido’ Scallops, Red Prawns from ‘Mazara’, ‘Spaghetti’ Pasta, House-Made ‘Tagliolini’ Pasta, Pizza gourmet, Tenderloin Steak, Tomahawk Steak. Porterhouse Steak.
data.PRESS RELEASE:
Zafferano, or ‘saffron’ in Italian, is the first name in vibrant, all-round Italian hospitality.
Inspired by the prized value of saffron and its flower containing 3 stigmas, called
threads, Zafferano focuses on value, and the 3 ‘threads’ of Food, Service, and
Ambience. As the only Italian restaurant to feature a 43rd-storey perch and amazing
rooftop bar overlooking the spectacular Marina Water Front, Zafferano embodies the
Italian spirit of giving. Head Chef Andrea De Paolo presents a contemporary
interpretation of traditional Italian cuisine; and a celebration of prime produce. On the
dining floor, the front-of-house team orchestrates their own brand of elegant Italian
service – seamlessly threading together a paragon of warmth, Italian-style, for any
occasion, big or small, in the heart of the business district. (Nov 2019)

data.title: Zaffron Kitchen (East Coast)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Keema Dosai, Chef's Sampler, Fish Tikka, Tandoori Malay Chicken Tikka, Tandoori Gobi, Mutton Rogan Josh, Jaipuri Vegetables
data.ABOUT:
Taking orders and pleasing palates from an unusually hip, modern space in Katong, Zaffron Kitchen keeps more than its looks up-to-date with Indian flavours that encompass every dialect of the varied cuisine. From classic Hindustani tandoori to flaky Malay roti, Zaffron speaks the universal language of savoury Indian cuisine fluently.Zaffron Kitchen in Katong takes on the look preferred by many fresh-faced gastropubs and open dining concepts lately, but it's a novel makeunder for an Indian restaurant. A smattering of various seating arrangements from communal high tops to rustic wood bistro tables makes the space feel social. The dining area is grounded by floors made of modern concrete and vintage Perankan tiles, peppered with the common hue of deep saffron orange, and lit up by non-traditional fixtures. There's a children's area that encourages play, and the vibe in general is fluid and open.
The menu takes a similarly light and easygoing approach to Indian fare. A genre of cooking typically known for rich, hearty and spicy flavours, Indian cuisine is smartly organized into weekend only specialties of South Indian Dosai and Roti Prata, anytime snacks like crispy Bhel Puri and Samosa, and perennial North Indian classics of clay oven roasted Tandoori dishes and curries. The categories make the encyclopedic cuisine feel more accessible to those naan novices who are less familiar with Indian fare.
However those curry connoisseurs will be equally impressed with the complex, spot-on flavours of the offerings. The Fish Tikka here is especially scrumptious, made with salmon for a more unique texture that stands up to the marinade brilliantly. The Tandoori Malay Chicken Tikka, though it carries a similar name, has a distinctly different interplay between the medley of spices and the tender morsels of chicken. On the weekends, the Keema Dosai is a unique treat that must be tried. For the uninitiated, the familiar paper-thin, sourdough crepe is crisped fresh to order and filled with spiced minced ground meat. It's a killer, homestyle combination that you don't often see, which is a common theme at Zaffron Kitchen. Indian cuisine done so consistently well with modern approachability is certainly a rare sight - and taste - indeed. (Apr 2015)

data.title: Zaffron Kitchen (Great World)
data.Cuisine: Indian, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Cafe, Modern Asian
data.Hours: Mon-Thurs: 11:30am-10pm (Closed 3-5pm)Fri,Sun, Eve of PH & PH: 11.30am-10:30 pm
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 1 Kim Seng Promenade#01-153Great World CitySingapore (237994)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Butter Chicken, Tandoori Chicken, Tandori Mushroom, Kulfis
data.ABOUT:
Zaffron Kitchen is a cosmopolitan-style, multi award-winning Indian restaurant that serves authentic North Indian cuisine at affordable prices.
Tasty favorites such as Butter Chicken, Tandoori Chicken, and Naan are signature dishes that attract hordes of diners to the restaurant. From the choice of starters, the Papadum is highly recommended. This traditional dish is served with assorted homemade chutneys for you to dip the crispy wafer-thin crackers in. Pair it with a bowl of Pakora for extra crunch.
Freshly baked in the restaurant’s tandoor ovens, choose from a delightful spread of bread such as Naan and Roti. Stuffed with melted cheese, the Cheese Naan delights diners with mouthfuls of cheesy goodness. For meat lovers, the Chicken Tikka is a must-try! Marinated with spices and yogurt, skewers of succulent chicken are baked to juicy goodness. An equally extensive selection awaits vegetarians. From Paneer Tikka to Tandori Mushroom, vegetarians will be spoilt for choice.
No meal is complete until you have tried the restaurant’s creamy homemade Indian ice cream. Known as Kulfis, this rich dessert is the perfect way to end a great meal. (Apr 2020)

data.title: Zhu Kao Guan Hotpot & BBQ 煮烤官
data.Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Steamboat
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks
data.Address: 60 Paya Lebar Road#B1-29Paya Lebar SquareSingapore (409051) Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Pork Belly, BBQ Marinated Beef, Chicken Slice, Xiao Long Bao
data.ABOUT:
Enjoy the best of both worlds at Zhu Kao Guan Hotpot & BBQ 煮烤官. Eat all you can with the wide variety of value-for-money menu options inclusive of free-flow soft drinks and ice cream. Conveniently located in Paya Lebar Square, treat yourselves to a tasty yet affordable feast when you drop by the restaurant today!

With as many as seven different soup bases to choose from, mix and match any two before you begin filling your tables with the wide selection of fresh meats, vegetables, and traditional steamboat favorites available. Take your pick of protein with both the regular hotpot and regular BBQ option. The Pork Belly and Chicken Slice are must-try menu items not to be missed out on. Other signature meat dishes include the BBQ Marinated Beef, Taiwanese Sausage, and Pork Collar. 

Opt for the premium hot pot option to indulge in the multiple seafood offerings such as the Prawn Paste and Flower Crabs. Made with mouthwatering pork filling, add on a side of Xiao Long Bao to complete your hotpot and BBQ experience. Wash down your meal with a free glass of Barley Tea. (May 2021)

data.title: Zorba the Greek Taverna – Café & Restaurant
data.Cuisine: Modern European, Seafood, Greek, Vegetarian Friendly
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Greek Moussaka, Kolokithokeftedes, Sea Bass Fillet, Dips Platter
data.ABOUT:
With the best views of the iconic Singapore River along the Clarke Quay promenade, Zorba is more than just your average Greek eatery. With a seating capacity of up to 90 guests, it’s the perfect riverside destination for a romantic dinner for two or large dinner parties.

It’s all about an authentic Greek dining experience, prepared with quality ingredients and cooked with soul. The Dips Platter is a great way to start the meal. Expect a rainbow-coloured plate decorated with plenty of fresh, crunchy vegetables, and tantalising pools of nutty hummus, tzatziki, and labneh (yogurt cheese). 

For mains, try the Kolokithokeftedes — crispy, golden-brown zucchini patties with chopped herbs and tangy feta cubes — as well as the Greek Moussaka, a hearty layered dish of roasted eggplant and ground meat. Also good is the grilled Sea Bass Fillet, a dish of fork-tender fish paired with a fresh vegetable and tomato salad. (Oct 2019)

data.title: Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Deep Fried Liver Roll, Wok Fried ‘Kway Teow’ with Diced Kai Lan and Preserved Radish, Teochew Oyster Omelette ‘Gooey Style’, Teochew ‘Puning’ Fermented Bean Chicken
data.PRESS RELEASE:
A concept by JUMBO Group of Restaurants, Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine is housed within a two-storey heritage building located in the historic Far East Square precinct. Within this elegant oriental space, refined, authentic Teochew fare is presented: from signatures such as Deep Fried Liver Roll and Wok Fried ‘Kway Teow’ with Diced Kai Lan and Preserved Radish, to Teochew Oyster Omelette ‘Gooey Style’ and Teochew ‘Puning’ Fermented Bean Chicken. Meticulously and skilfully prepared, using only the freshest quality ingredients, each dish pays homage to the finer points of Teochew cuisine.

 

Be it a casual gathering or a momentous celebration in our beautifully refurbished dining hall; a discreet corporate luncheon or a cosy family meal in our six private rooms, Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine promises to deliver an experience that exudes understated refinement and classic elegance. (Apr 2019)

data.title: boCHINche
data.Cuisine: Bar, Modern European, Steakhouse, South American
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Asado, Empanadas de Carne, Croquetas, Sea Bass Ceviche, Tomates, Cangrejo, Ojo de Bife, Pulpo, Dulce de Leche
data.ABOUT:
boCHINche in the city’s foremost Argentine restaurants, bringing the robust hearty cuisine of Argentina to a country that isn’t terribly familiar with its flavours and traditions. Located along sexy Amoy Street, the little quartier of the city that’s leading Singapore’s culinary revolution, the restaurant provides a great mix of laid back lounge vibes and upmarket dining experiences. In other words: sexy cocktails and delicious food. The menu brings the traditional fare of an Argentine bistro to the table, but gives it a modern makeover. One thing that remains, though, is the pride of place given to the custom-made wooden charcoal grill that infuses everything it touches with its signature smoky kiss. 

So what is Argentine food? Think croquettes studded with smoky, spicy Chorizo, smoked peppers, and slices of duck ham served with preserved cherries and a cream of pecorino cheese. Classic Argentine empanadas come stuffed with braised cuttlefish, fragrant fennel, and chorizo, or savoury-sweet goat’s cheese with spinach, raisins, and pine nuts. Seafood mains are the next order of business, with plates like charcoal-grilled octopus served with crunchy fennel, new potatoes & samphire salad, and a homey tuna mayo. Argentine beef, the pride of the nation and, indeed, of this kitchen, comes in the form of the Caracu, a beef & marrow bone burger paired with braised ox cheeks, and a piquant salad of tomatoes, onions, and house pickles. For dessert, there’s none other than the fabled Dulce de Leche Creme Brulee & Banana Split Ice Cream, a combination of some of childhood’s favourite flavours: sweet toffee and creamy banana. Or maybe just wind down with one of the bar’s famous cocktails, like the boCHINche Sour, made from Amaretto-like Disaronno, apricot brandy, and lemon juice for a smooth and potent end to the meal. This is a gourmet experience close to the heart of Singapore’s new culinary wave, shot through with an Argentine love of good food, fine wines, and long, luxuriant dinners. (Nov 2017)

data.title: béni Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 333A Orchard Road #02-37 Mandarin Gallery Singapore (238897)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: King of Green Hiro Gyokuro, Foie Gras, Yonezawa Beef, Kobe A5 Wagyu, Charentais Melon, French Rhubarb Clafoutis
data.ABOUT:
béni, a French term which translates to "blessing", offers one of the most exclusive epicurean experiences available in Singapore, showcasing fine authentic French cuisine with a Japanese touch. Helmed by Executive Chef Kenji Yamanaka, who has built up a formidable gamut of experience with a portfolio that includes stints at three-star Michelin restaurants Georges Blanc in Vonnas, France, and L’Osier in Ginza, Tokyo, this charming eatery has earned several accolades including the prestigious 1-Michelin Star.

Chef Kenji's thoughtfully crafted discovery menus feature fresh produce, with meats and fish sourced and flown in from artisanal producers in Japan, and seasonal fresh vegetables from France. Highlights include Kenji's signature Amadai dish. The Amadai fish from Kyoto Prefecture is cooked in the traditional "Matsukasayaki" style where the scales are left on the fish and fried to a crisp resembling pine cones. This gives the fish a very unique combination of crispy and tender textures. While the cooking method remains the same, Chef Kenji comes up with new flavours to pair the Amadai with, based on the season, a reflection of his dedication to the craft. (Jun 2018)

data.title: db Bistro & Oyster Bar
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.Address: 2 Bayfront Avenue#B1-48The Shoppes at Marina Bay SandsSingapore (018972)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Seasonal Oysters, Signature Seafood Platter, Maine Lobster Roll, Steak Tartare, Coq Au Vin, Herb Roasted Organic Chicken, The Original db Burger
data.ABOUT:
A visit to db Bistro & Oyster Bar at The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands is a religious experience for devout burgerists. In-the-know foodies make the pilgrimage from all over the world for the Original db Burger - a gargantuan top sirloin creation famously filled with foie gras and braised short ribs in a Parmesan bun embrace. It is a marvel to see, with a taste that can only be described as heavenly. But burger nirvana is not only achieved with indulgent ingredients. Every element of the dish from the construction to the condiments will make you a believer in intelligent design. After all, db Bistro & Oyster Bar was established by a virtual deity in the culinary world, Chef Daniel Boulud. As such, his virtuosity is evident in each creation that leaves the kitchen.
And despite its larger-than-life reputation, db Bistro & Oyster Bar manages a down-to-earth, modern bistro feel. With an updated crimson and mahogany theme and faultless service, the Bistro personifies chic French dining. The Original db Burger certainly draws the most devotees, but the comfortable dining room also hosts business gatherings, Marina Bay shoppers and Singapore visitors.
The menu features exquisite bistro classics - Coq Au Vin, Tartare, Oysters, Duck Confit - all done so well that it will become your new standard for future imitations. It's no wonder db Bistro & Oyster Bar is on the universal foodie bucket list, and to answer your prayers, your seat is now just a click away. (Oct 2013)

data.title: fȳr
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Iberico Pork Secreto, Freshwater Prawns, Duck Foie Gras, Bone Marrow, Prime Ribeye, Scallops, Prawns & Chorizo Rice, Iberico Pork Tomahawk
data.ABOUT:
Pop art and graffiti line the walls of this intimate and funky Modern-European restaurant in the swish dining enclave of Telok Ayer. Occasional Asian elements punch up the flavours here, a selection of small plates and smoky grilled mains all blessed with the smoky perfume of an imported Josper charcoal grill. The mains are super meaty-heavy so lighten up with some green small plates to share. A refreshing and crunchy Endive & Shallot Créme-Blue Cheese Salad is a good way to start, filled with bittersweet endive, walnuts, and creamy studs of fruity blue cheese livened by an orange-balsamic vinaigrette. Or start the meat-fest early with creamy Bone Marrow, paired with refreshing white wine jelly, a piquant tomato salsa, and chips of deep fried garlic.

Once the mains come along, it’s a parade of beautiful grilled meats and seafood. Think chewy and sweet baby octopus given a rapid sear under the grill before being tossed with squid ink rice, a paprika-spiced rouille and sweet sun-dried tomato. Savour the rare treat of a Free-Range Yellow Chicken, roasted and deboned then served with olives, tahini, lentils, and a curry brown sauce for some exotic Middle-Eastern flair. Bone-In Beef Short Ribs accompanied by zingy beetroot and pickled potato will satisfy the meatiest cravings, but go slightly overboard with a Tomahawk, not of beef, but pork, a giant chop served with roasted pineapple that’s been infused with rum. A good, practically festive meal served in hip, Instagrammable surroundings, fȳr is one of the great gems of downtown dining. (Nov 2017)

data.title: handBELLO
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Spicy Chawanmushi, Ang Kar Prawn, Smoked Chestnut and Truffle Gyoza, Fried Brown Rice
data.ABOUT:
Amongst the Italian-inspired treats, handBELLO focused on fresh house-made pasta, an artisan craft that is at the heart of every Italian kitchen. At handBELLO dining, we allow creatively to flow in our starters and proteins, whereby focusing on quality ingredients made simply to pair perfectly with our pasta dishes. Moreover, we have a delectable wine selection curated just for our restaurant. 

handBELLO Italian-inspired restaurant, serving up quality forward-thinking cuisines to impress and to inspire. We are a modern semi-casual dining location. (Jun 2021)

data.title: iO Italian Osteria Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Assorted Homemade Bread, Baked Risotto, Grilled US Ribeye, Dark Chocolate Lava Cake
data.ABOUT:
The sleepy neighbourhood of Hillview has found a gem in iO Italian Osteria, the sister outfit to popular Italian restaurant Etna in Duxton. The warm, cosy space is lively and buzzing, constantly filled with the chatter of the many diners — it’s hard to just walk into iO expecting a seat — and staff bustling about with steaming plates of pasta. 

It’s hard to resist starting the meal with bread, because the ones here are baked fresh in-house and speckled with delicious tomatoes or mushrooms. The Roman schiacciata, for instance, is a golden-brown flat bread with crispy edges, which you either enjoy plain or stuffed with earthy truffle. A must-order is the porchetta, rolled pork belly roasted until the skin is crackling with savoury juices and the meat is super tender. Pastas are the star for main courses — the baked lasagne, grandma style, is absolute comfort food. But the home-made tagliolini is a dish you’ll come back for, with the springy strands of pasta tossed with generous amounts of garlic, olive oil and chilli, and fresh, chopped prawns. Our tip: Order to share, so you can dig into more dishes.  (Aug 2018)

data.title: il Cielo
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Calamaro Ripieno alla Viareggina, Carpaccio di Kinmedai, Spaghetti ai Ricci di Mare, Giapponese Orata Grigliata, Bistecca di Agnello, Il Nostro Tiramisu, La Sfera
data.ABOUT:
While our city does not lack for contemporary Italian restaurants, few come close to matching the exquisite dining experience one gets at il Cielo. Perched on the top floor of Hilton Singapore, the restaurant offers guests a bird's eye view of the teeming crowds on Orchard Road, a fitting tribute to its name that translates to 'the sky'. With its small 48-seater capacity and hyper-personalised service, this intimate restaurant is a perfect venue for a romantic evening or small dinner celebrations. 

Here, each dish is carefully conceived by Chef Yohhei Sasaki, who boasts years of experience working in top Italian restaurants across Japan and Italy. Under Chef Sasaki's leadership, the kitchen conjures artful dishes that marry locally sourced natural ingredients with seasonal gourmet produce that are simply divine.  

Partake in any of this award-winning restaurant's delectable offerings, such as the Pumpkin Charcoal Ravioli that comes with chickpeas cream, red onions, Modena balsamic, and black truffles. A must-have for any meat-lover, the Rack of Lamb is paired with a dab of sun-dried tomato tartar, and baby carrots for a slightly sweet finish. The Lobster Salad is also a refreshing option on a hot day, thanks to the addition of toscana roschetta, ice vegetables, bottarga, and mascarpone cream. Meanwhile, indecisive diners who want to sample a bit of everything should check out the degustation menus, available at both lunch and dinner service. (Jul 2017)

data.title: malts
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.DISHES WE LOVE: 12 year old Bunnahabhian, Three Course Lunch Set
data.ABOUT:
Celebrate life’s simple pleasures with beautifully prepared food and fine whiskey at malts. A premium whiskey bar nestled in cosy spots within the central business district, malts is the perfect place to let loose and enjoy life to the fullest with family and friends. Open on Mondays to Saturdays, head on down to malts to explore the aisles of carefully curated alcoholic beverages from all over the region.

Great for any occasion, the 12 year old Bunnahabhian is tinged with a light sherry sweetness overpowered by a smoky and smooth aftertaste. Best paired with Spanish tapas, opt for the bar’s take on tasty Spanish dishes to complete the experience. Apart from whiskeys and Spanish delights, malts also provides draft beers for beer lovers. 

Swing by for after work drinks with colleagues or intimate gatherings with friends, and celebrate the end of a hectic day with a round of drinks! malts’ cosy interior also makes for an ideal date spot should you find a kindred spirit. (Dec 2020)

data.title: sen-ryo Singapore
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Otoro Sashimi, sen-ryo Sushi, Japanese Wagyu Sushi Platter, DIY Uni Platter, Tamagoyaki Mentai, Grilled Chicken Thigh with Charcoal Style Sauce, Kaisen Nabe
data.ABOUT:
An authentic Japanese experience awaits you at Singapore’s very first sen-ryo outlet at ION Orchard. Established in Japan in 1999, the restaurant places a huge emphasis on dishing up exceptional Japanese cuisine made of only the highest quality ingredients imported from Toyosu Fish Market and around the world. Prepare to be impressed by the variety of premium but pocket-friendly creations that promise affordable luxury at its best.

Start your journey at the impressive sake bar and indulge in the various classic Japanese alcoholic beverages to relax and unwind. Highlights among the extensive sake selection available include the Ohime 2 Grain Hire Yamadanishiki and the Hyakujuro Junmai Daiginjo Black Face. Featuring a flora and subtly sweet rice wine with bittersweet undernotes, pair the former with a platter of cold starters to kickstart your meal. 

Topped with a dollop of minced fatty tuna, this inventive handcrafted creation known as the Maguro with Shio Koji Negitoro features a yummy slice of tuna lightly seasoned with fermented salt sitting atop perfectly rolled premium sushi rice. Available exclusively in Singapore, the Grilled US Beef Tenderloin and Foie Gras is made up of tender sliced meat expertly grilled to an aromatic char — perfect to satiate your carnivorous cravings. (May 2021)

data.title: table65
data.Good For: Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Ceviche Passionfruit, Veal Tartare, Apple
data.ABOUT:
This restaurant is famed for their popular Apple Dessert, which is one of the most “Instagram-famous” desserts on the menu, but has much more to offer than just sweet treats. Located at the late Joel Robuchon’s former spot in Hotel Michael, this spot has made a name for itself as an unpretentious fine dining establishment. Helmed by veteran Dutch chefs Richard van Oostenbrugge and Thomas Groot - whose restaurant 212 in Amsterdam was recently awarded a Michelin Star - table65 serves up modern European fare and is their first venture outside of the Netherlands. 

Dig into the Veal Tartare, a rich dish of light beef marrow and meat topped with a generous helping of briny Beluga caviar. The richness of the meat is tempered by the salty taste of the caviar, and makes for a standout combination of flavours. The Ceviche Passionfruit is a sweet and rich dish that combines a staple of Latin cuisine with the vibrant sweetness of passionfruit. The highly-raved Apple lives up to the hype. Made with an isomalt apple shell with a core of apple sorbet and chocolate seeds, this dish is delightfully light and sweet, and makes for a unique dessert. (March 2019)

data.title: the Cliff (Sofitel Sentosa)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 2 Bukit Manis RoadSofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & SpaSingapore (099891)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Grilled Octopus with Orange Potato an Samoriglio, Spaghetti 'alla Chitarra' with Smoky Lobster, Whole Seabass with Butternut, Taggiasche Olive and Cherry Tomato, Pappardelle with Pork Ragout, Guanciale and Rosemary, Beef Cheeky Tortelli with Grana Pandao Cream and Red Wine Sauce, Fior di Latte Cheese, Mascarpone and Truffle Cream Pizza, Smoked Scamorza Cheese and Balsamic Kurobata Pork Jowl Pizza with Caramelized Onions and Mushrooms.
data.ABOUT:
At the Cliff, every visit is a fresh experience for the palate, and the mood is fun, yet elegant. A
freshly-evolved elevated casual dining establishment, the Cliff presents authentic and
comforting flavours of Italy paired with the heartwarming hospitality. With its elegant yet chic
setting, the Cliff dishes out an extensive selection of homemade pastas, starters, handmade
desserts as well as gourmet pizzas, baked to perfection in a wood-smoked oven, all delicately
paired with the finest selection of premium world’s wines.
Through tasty plates paired with classic Italian hospitality, the Cliff embodies the essence of
heartwarming flavors and alluring service, a breathtaking experience and idyllic time by the sea. (Nov 2020)

data.title: the kitchen table (W Singapore – Sentosa Cove)
data.Good For: Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Kid Friendly
data.DISHES WE LOVE: W Super Salad, Singapore Chilli Crab, Oven Roasted Whole Seabass, Crisp Black Cod Burger, Chocolate Marquise
data.ABOUT:
the kitchen table brings to life a culmination of culinary finesse and the electrifying vibes of W Singapore – Sentosa Cove’s tropical locale. Step through our doors and satiate your appetite anytime of the day. 

Centered on sustainability and pursuing prime freshness through sourcing local produce, witness palatial displays of seafood, fiery grills and glowing embers in the signature pizza oven as the restaurant innovates at the forefront of the latest food trends, interweaving global influences with a uniquely local insider touch. As the day gives way to stunning sunset hues, wind down on the terrace as you immerse yourself in W Hotels’ iconic cocktail culture. (Dec 2020)

data.title: 藝yì by Jereme Leung
data.Hours: Open Daily (Mon-Sun; Including Public Holidays)Lunch: 11:30am-2pm (Last Seating: 1:30pm)Dinner: 6-9:30pm (Last Seating: 9:15pm)
data.Good For: Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner
data.Address: 328 North Bridge Road#03-02Raffles Hotel SingaporeSingapore (188719)                                                Map
data.DISHES WE LOVE: Sichuan Spicy Chicken & Luncheon Meat, Sichuan Spiced Crispy Fish Skin, Brined Duck Breast, Beef Tripe & Ox Tongue with Sichuan Chilli Dressing, Golden Roasted Duck with Rose & Fermented Bean Sauce & Rainbow Pancakes, Braised Beef Cheeks, Fried Rice with Char Siew, Pork Belly & Pickled Long Beans
data.PRESS RELEASE: One of the most influential chefs in modern Chinese culinary movement, Celebrity MasterChef Jereme Leung makes his return to Singapore with contemporary Chinese restaurant, 藝 yì by Jereme Leung at Raffles Hotel Singapore.Nestled on the third level of the restored Raffles Arcade, 藝 yì by Jereme Leung leverages on the art form of fine dining to awaken the appetite and the senses of guests. The restaurant delivers cuisine that takes guests on an exploration voyage to China's vastly diverse cultural regions.
